author: John Wooden
title: Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there.

author: David M. Burns
title: Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life.

author: Gore Vidal
title: A talent for drama is not a talent for writing, but is an ability to articulate human relationships.

author: Robert Frost
title: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: During my eighty-seven years, I have witnessed a whole succession of technological revolutions. But none of them has done away with the need for character in the individual or the ability to think.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of face within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: A retentive memory may be a good thing, but the ability to forget is the true token of greatness.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Ability without honor is useless.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is in your mind.

title: The barrier between success is not something which exists in the real world: it is composed purely and simply of doubts about ability.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: A famous person is often remembered for the ability to take from mankind rather than for his ability to give to mankind.

author: Branch Rickey
title: A game of great charm in the adoption of mathematical measurements to the timing of human movements, the exactitudes and adjustments of physical ability to hazardous chance. The speed of the legs, the dexterity of the body, the grace of the swing, the elusiveness of the slide - these are the features that make Americans everywhere forget the last syllable of a man's last name or the pigmentation of his skin.

author: Bob Woodward
title: A reporter's ability to keep the bond of confidentiality often enables him to learn the hidden or secret aspects of government.

author: Carl Jung
title: A special ability means a heavy expenditure of energy in a particular direction, with a consequent drain from some other side of life.

author: John Henry Newman
title: Ability hits the mark where presumption overshoots and diffidence falls short.

author: John Wooden
title: Ability is a poor man's wealth.,

author: Christopher Wren
title: Ability is a poor man's wealtli.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Ability is commonly found to consist mainly in a high degree of solemnity.

author: Napoleon
title: Ability is of little account without opportunity.

title: Ability is the art of getting credit for all the home runs somebody else hits.

title: Am I old-fashioned? I think I might be. I am a lucky woman, because I was born with a priceless gift... the ability to laugh at the misfortunes of others.,

author: James Baldwin
title: Americans, unhappily, have the most remarkable ability to alchemize all bitter truths into an innocuous but piquant confection and to transform their moral contradictions, or public discussion of such contradictions, into a proud decoration, such as are given for heroism on the battle field.

author: Salman Rushdie
title: An attack upon our ability to tell stories is not just censorship - it is a crime against our nature as human beings.

author: Bill Bryson
title: And then it occurred to me that a computer is a stupid machine with the ability to do incredibly smart things, while computer programmers are smart people with the ability to do incredibly stupid things. They are, in short, a perfect match.

author: Bob Uecker
title: Anybody with ability can play in the big leagues. But to be able to trick people year in and year out the way I did, I think that was a much greater feat.

title: As an instructor, you must be able to distinguish between poor performance caused by lack of ability or aptitude on the part of the student and poor performance caused by lack of effort. title: As doctors, we are not trained to communicate and understand the power of our words as they relate to a patient's ability and desire to survive.

author: L. Ron Hubbard

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

author: Karl Marx
title: Capital is money, capital is commodities. By virtue of it being value, it has acquired the occult ability to add value to itself. It brings forth living offspring, or, at the least, lays golden eggs.

author: Carl Stokes

title: Firms need to ensure that their ability to provide effective customer service keeps pace with their growth. If you're marketing your firm to new customers, you better be able to provide them service when they do business with you.

author: Karl Marx

title: I shouldn't have acted. I didn't exhibit any ability. I was one of the kids in the school play who was just mouthing words, and they weren't the actual words of the song. I was pretty lame!

title: In all activities of life, the secret of efficiency lies in an ability to combine two seemingly incompatible states: a state of maximum activity and a state of maximum relaxation.

title: The ability to be in the present moment is a major component of mental wellness.

title: The death of any man aged 56 is very sad for his widow and family. And no one would deny that Steve Jobs was a brilliant and highly innovative technician, with great business flair and marketing ability.

title: The easiest thing to do, whenever you fail, is to put yourself down by blaming your lack of ability for your misfortunes.

author: John A. Hannah

author: Roy L. Smith
title: The greatest difficulty with the world is not its ability to produce, but the unwillingness to share.

author: William James
title:
The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another.,
,

author: Bob Marley
title: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: The greatness of America lies not in being more enlightened than any other nation, but rather in her ability to repair her faults.

author: Ben Foster

title: The leader of genius must have the ability to make different opponents appear as if they belonged to one category.

author: Bill Parcells

title: The repeal of racist language in the Constitution of Alabama was and still is a necessary step in the state's ability to progress.

author: Marya Mannes
title: The sign of an intelligent people is their ability to control emotions by the application of reason.

author: Charles E. Popplestone
title: The successful man is prosperous, because he has developed ninety-five percent of his ability. The failure is poor, because only five percent of his natural talents have been utilized.

author: Arthur C. Brooks
title: The system that enables the most people to earn the most success is free enterprise, by matching up people's skills, interests, and abilities. In contrast, redistribution simply spreads money around. Even worse, it attenuates the ability to earn success by perverting economic incentives.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The test of a first-rate intelligence is the ability to hold two opposed ideas in the mind at the same time, and still retain the ability to function.

author: Benjamin E. Mays

author: William Hazlitt
title: The world judge of men by their ability in their profession, and we judge of ourselves by the same test: for it is on that on which our success in life depends.

author: Milan Kundera
title: The worth of a human being lies in the ability to extend oneself, to go outside oneself, to exist in and for other people.

author: Saul Bellow
title: There are evils that have the ability to survive identification and go on for ever... money, for instance, or war.

author: Mark Twain

author: Camille Paglia

He had no ability whatsoever to distinguish among historical sources, where he makes terrible blunders.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: There is far more opportunity than there is ability.

author: Bergen Evans

author: Alan Cranston

title: There's a famous slogan here in the Bavarian dialect, and we use it inside Bayern Munich. We say, 'Mia san mia.' Literally, it is, 'We are we,' but it means, 'We are who we are.' That's not being very arrogant, but we are very confident about our ability to win the game. It is about a winning mentality.

author: Brian Tracy
title: Those people who develop the ability to continuously acquire new and better forms of knowledge that they can apply to their work and to their lives will be the movers and shakers in our society for the indefinite future.

author: Billy Joel
title: Those who have expressed doubts and misgivings about their ability to live this kind of life shouldn't try, because being a musician is not something you chose to be, it is something you are.

author: Maxwell Maltz

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: To know how to hide one's ability is great skill.

title: To try to really land a spacecraft really on another world is really difficult, and if we lose that ability, it's going to be heartbreaking.

author: Bob Graham
title: Today 80 percent of all the oil that comes out of the Gulf is from 1,000 feet or more and today almost a third of it is more than 5,000 feet below the surface. title: Trending topics helped make Twitter a more relevant metric of what the world was talking about at any given moment. Google has worked for years in the space, most notably with Google Trends and Hot Searches, but Google+ offers the search giant the ability to see what is truly trending in real time.

author: A. Alvarez
title: Twentieth-century art may start with nothing, but it flourishes by virtue of its belief in itself, in the possibility of control over what seems essentially uncontrollable, in the coherence of the inchoate, and in its ability to create its own values.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: Unfortunately, there seems to be far more opportunity out there than ability. We should remember that good fortune often happens when opportunity meets with preparation.

title: Valor, glory, firmness, skill, generosity, steadiness in battle and ability to rule - these constitute the duty of a soldier. They flow from his own nature.

title: Waste is worse than loss. The time is coming when every person who lays claim to ability will keep the question of waste before him constantly. The scope of thrift is limitless.

title: We cherish our friends not for their ability to amuse us, but for our ability to amuse them.

title: We don't need more strength or more ability or greater opportunity. What we need is to use what we have.

author: Bill Nye
title: What makes the United States great, the reason people wanted to live in the United States, move here still, is because of our ability to innovate.

author: Thomas Arnold
title: What we must look for here is, firstly, religious and moral principles; secondly, gentlemanly conduct; thirdly, intellectual ability.

author: B. Kevin Turner

title: When I think of vision, I have in mind the ability to see above and beyond the majority.

author: Carol Loomis

author: Bill McCartney
title: When you're born again, your DNA changes. You have the ability to understand God's terms.

title: While one party may possess the levers of power, one party does not possess a monopoly on good ideas. Good lawmaking, after all, is about the ability to craft effective solutions.

title: Winners have the ability to step back from the canvas of their lives like an artist gaining perspective. They make their lives a work of art - an individual masterpiece.

title: Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability.

title: Woo means the ability to entice someone or something to get what you want. My first solo album was called: All the Woo of the Universe, which was titled by George Clinton.

title: You are wholly complete and your success in life will be in direct proportion to your ability to accept this truth about you.

author: Ben Carson
title: You have the ability to choose which way you want to go. You have to believe great things are going to happen in your life. Do everything you can - prepare, pray and achieve - to make it happen.

title: You have to have confidence in your ability, and then be tough enough to follow through.

author: Les Brown
title: Your ability to communicate is an important tool in your pursuit of your goals, whether it is with your family, your co-workers or your clients and customers.

title: Your ability to use the principle of autosuggestion will depend, very largely, upon your capacity to concentrate upon a given desire until that desire becomes a burning obsession.

author: Brian Tracy
title: Your decision to be, have and do something out of ordinary entails facing difficulties that are out of the ordinary as well. Sometimes your greatest asset is simply your ability to stay with it longer than anyone else.

title: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.

author: Franz Kafka

title: title

title: Chance can allow you to accomplish a goal every once in a while, but consistent achievement happens only if you love what you are doing.

title: It's very confusing when fame comes early on in your career. You get a little bit bent out of shape in terms of what's important. Fame is like the dessert that comes with your achievements - it's not an achievement in itself, but sometimes it can overpower the work.

title: The humorous man recognizes that absolute purity, absolute justice, absolute logic and perfection are beyond human achievement and that men have been able to live happily for thousands of years in a state of genial frailty.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: The starting point of all achievement is desire.,

author: Robert J. Mckain

author: Bo Bennett
title: Think of success as a game of chance in which you have control over the odds. As you begin to master concepts in personal achievement, you are increasing your odds of achieving success.

title: Thoroughness characterizes all successful men. Genius is the art of taking infinite pains. All great achievement has been characterized by extreme care, infinite painstaking, even to the minutest detail.

title: Those who improve with age embrace the power of personal growth and personal achievement and begin to replace youth with wisdom, innocence with understanding, and lack of purpose with self-actualization.

title: Unless one is taught what to do with success after getting it, achievement of it must inevitably leave him prey to boredom.

author: Benjamin Graham
title: Unusually rapid growth cannot keep up forever; when a company has already registered a brilliant expansion, its very increase in size makes a repetition of its achievement more difficult.

author: Woodrow Wilson

title: You must intensify and render continuous by repeatedly presenting with suggestive ideas and mental pictures of the feast of good things, and the flowing fountain, which awaits the successful achievement or attainment of the desires.

title: title

title: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.

title: Advertising is a valuable economic factor because it is the cheapest way of selling goods, particularly if the goods are worthless.

author: Bruce Barton
title: Advertising is the very essence of democracy.

title: Advertising seemed almost natural to me because it was a business where you had to inform, persuade and educate. title: Advertising signs that con you into thinking you are the one , That can do what's never been done, , That can win what's never been won , Meanwhile, life outside goes on all around you

title: Advertising was only meant to be a very small part of my life. I had intended that I would work extensively in journalism for about five or six years and then I'd become a writer.

title: All official institutions of language are repeating machines: school, sports, advertising, popular songs, news, all continually repeat the same structure, the same meaning, often the same words: the stereotype is a political fact, the major figure of ideology.

title: An advertising agency is 85 percent confusion and 15 percent commission.

title: Any Wall Street advertising that does not go into the boring details of methodology is most likely to be pushing past performance.

title: As a profession advertising is young; as a force it is as old as the world. The first four words ever uttered, Let there be light, constitute its charter. All nature is vibrant with its impulse.

title: Doing business without advertising is like winking at a girl in the dark. You know what you are doing, but nobody else does.

title: Governing today means giving acceptable signs of credibility. It is like advertising and it is the same effect that is achieved - commitment to a scenario.

title: Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half.

title: Here is what the practical impact of Citizens United means. What Citizens United means is that corporations call hundreds of millions of dollars into television ads, radio ads, and other forms of advertising to defeat those candidates who stand up and take them on.

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
title: I can not think of any circumstances in which advertising would not be an evil.

author: David Ogilvy
title:
I do not regard advertising as entertainment or an art form, but as a medium of information.,
,

author: Bruce Fairchild Barton
title: I had never thought of advertising as a life work, though I had on the side, written some very successful copy.

author: Augusten Burroughs
title: I was in advertising for years. That was cushy, you know? It's pretty cushy in a lot of ways, but I hated it.

author: Augusten Burroughs
title: I'm always prepared for the worst. I was prepared to have the book come out, sell seven copies, and have to keep working in advertising, so it was just great that it was received so well and by such a huge audience.

author: Marshall Mcluhan
title: Ideally, advertising aims at the goal of a programmed harmony among all human impulses and aspirations and endeavors. Using handicraft methods, it stretches out toward the ultimate electronic goal of a collective consciousness.

author: Will Rogers
title:
If advertisers spent the same amount of money on improving their products as they do on advertising then they wouldn't have to advertise them.,
,
,

author: Bruce Barton
title: If advertising encourages people to, live beyond their means, so does matrimony.

author: William Bernbach
title: If your advertising goes unnoticed, everything else is academic!

author: William Bernbach
title: In advertising, not to be different is virtual suicide.

author: Pauline Kael
title: In the arts, the critic is the only independent source of information. The rest is advertising.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: It is pretty obvious that the debasement of the human mind caused by a constant flow of fraudulent advertising is no trivial thing. There is more than one way to conquer a country.

author: Alexander Hamilton
title: It is the advertiser who provides the paper for the subscriber. It is not to be disputed, that the publisher of a newspaper in this country, without a very exhaustive advertising support, would receive less reward for his labor than the humblest mechanic.

author: Mark Twain
title: Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: Mass demand has been created almost entirely through the development of advertising.

author: Brit Hume
title: Nobody's profitable at this moment, because recession is on; advertising dollars are down, and expenses are way up. So that kind of belies the situation that you would expect, because the ratings are way up everywhere.

author: John Enoch Powell
title: Remove advertising, disable a person or firm from proclaiming its wares and their merits, and the whole of society and of the economy is transformed. The enemies of advertising are the enemies of freedom.

author: Stuart Chase
title: Sanely applied advertising could remake the world.

author: Bob Filner
title: Studies indicate that these children are more susceptible to advertising and even less likely to understand the purpose of this advertising.

author: Bill Gates
title: The future of advertising is the Internet.,

author: David Ogilvy
title:
The more informative your advertising, the more persuasive it will be.,
,

author: David Ogilvy
title: The most important word in the vocabulary of advertising is TEST. If you pretest your product with consumers, and pretest your advertising, you will do well in the marketplace.

author: Nadine Gordimer
title: The primacy of the word, basis of the human psyche, that has in our age been used for mind-bending persuasion and brain-washing pulp, disgraced by Gobbles and debased by advertising copy, remains a force for freedom that flies out between all bars.

author: Louis Kronenberger
title: The trouble with us in America isn't that the poetry of life has turned to prose, but that it has turned to advertising copy.

author: Billy Crudup
title: The truth is I don't think actors should have to do anything but come in and act. I feel the film companies should pay for proper advertising to see that the movie will sell instead of putting it on our backs.

author: Bill Cosby
title: The very first law in advertising is to avoid the concrete promise and cultivate the delightfully vague.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: There is another class of colored people who make a business of keeping the troubles, the wrongs, and the hardships of the Negro race before the public. Having learned that they are able to make a living out of their troubles, they have grown into the settled habit of advertising their wrongs-partly because they want sympathy and partly because it pays. Some of these people do not want the Negro to lose his grievances, because they do not want to lose their jobs.

author: Bill Kurtis
title: Think of it: television producers joining with newspapers to tell stories. It's journalism of the future. Advertising will follow the crowd - the 'crowd' being viewers and readers, of course, which could bring revenue back into journalism.

author: Barbara Tuchman
title: To ensure that no one gained an advantage over anyone else, commercial law [in the 14th century] prohibited innovation in tools or techniques, underselling below a fixed price, working late by artificial light, employing extra apprentices or wife and underage children, and advertising of wares or praising them to the detriment of others.

author: Zelda Fitzgerald
title: We grew up founding our dreams on the infinite promise of American advertising. I still believe that one can learn to play the piano by mail and that mud will give you a perfect complexion.

author: Brad Stone
title: We see Google experimenting in so many places outside of its core search and advertising business, whether that's bringing broadband Internet to the world or funding an entirely separate company to pursue solutions to disease and mortality. Amazon's one of the few other companies that thinks as big as Google does.

author: David Ogilvy
title: What you say in advertising is more important than how you say it.

author: Ann Macbeth
title: You have always had individual directors who begin in the advertising or commercial world, but they are probably exceptions rather than the traditional pattern.

author: William Allen White
title: Advertising is the genie which is transforming America into a place of comfort, luxury and ease for millions.

author: Charles Revson
title: In our factory, we make lipstick. In our advertising, we sell hope.

author: author
title: title

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Old people love to give good advice to console themselves for no longer being able to set a bad example.

author: Joseph Addison
title: A woman seldom asks advice before she has bought her wedding clothes.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.

author: Horace
title: A good scare is worth more than good advice.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: Advice is seldom welcome; and those who want it the most always like it the least.

author: Thomas L. Masson
title: Be yourself is about the worst advice you can give to some people.

author: David Seabury
title: Don't follow any advice, no matter how good, until you feel as deeply in your spirit as you think in your mind that the counsel is wise.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: I have lived some thirty-odd years on this planet, and I have yet to hear the first syllable of valuable or even earnest advice from my seniors.

author: Thomas L. Masson
title: 'Be yourself' is about the worst advice you can give some people.

author: Betty Wright
title: 'Pain' is more indicative of what I like to do. I'm lyric-conscious. I like to tell stories, give advice. Instead of writing a 'Dear Abby' column, I do it on records.

author: Pat Caddell
title: A politicians willingness to listen to good advice rises in inverse proportion to how badly he thinks he is doing.

author: Bill Cosby
title: A word to the wise isn't necessary, it is the stupid ones who need all the advice.

author: Gene Brown
title: Accept good advice gracefully—as long as it doesn't interfere with what you intended to do in the first place.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Advice in old age is foolish; for what can be more absurd than to increase our provisions for the road the nearer we approach to our journey's end.

author: Josh Billings
title: Advice is like castor oil, easy to give, but dreadful to take.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
title: Advice is like snow; the softer it falls the longer it dwells upon, and the deeper it sinks into the mind.

author: Carolyn Wells
title: Advice is one of those things it is far more blessed to give than to receive.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Advice is sometimes transmitted more successfully through a joke than grave teaching.

author: Erica Jong
title: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.

author: Babe Ruth
title: After all, there's only one answer to be made to the young fellow who is asking constantly for advice as to how to hit. The answer is: Pick out a good one and sock it!

author: Barbara Cartland
title: After forty a woman has to choose between losing her figure or her face. My advice is to keep your face, and stay sitting down.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: All of us, at certain moments of our lives, need to take advice and to receive help from other people.

author: Franklin P. Jones
title: Anybody who thinks talk is cheap should get some legal advice.

author: Bob Seger
title: Be original. That's my best advice. You're going to find that there's something that you do well, and try to do it with as much originality as you can, and don't skimp on the words. Work on the words.

author: John Gay
title: Can Love be controll'd by advice?

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Dying is a very dull, dreary affair. And my advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Dying is a very dull, dreary affair. My advice to you is to have nothing whatever to do with it.

author: Plautus
title: Every man, however wise, needs the advice of some sagacious friend in the affairs of life.

author: Arthur Schwartz
title: For the most part this is a place to find down-to-earth advice on everyday cooking, eating, food shopping, cooking equipment, and nice things to put on your table.

author: Robert Lynd
title: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.

author: John Gray
title: Generally speaking, when a woman offers unsolicited advice or tries to help a man, she has no idea of how critical and unloving he may sound to him.

author: Vauvenargues
title: Give help rather than advice.

author: Agatha Christie
title: Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.,

author: Erica Jong
title: Growing up female in America. What a liability! You grew up with your ears full of cosmetic ads, love songs, advice columns, whoreoscopes, Hollywood gossip, and moral dilemmas on the level of TV soap operas. What litanies the advertisers of the good life chanted at you! What curious catechisms!

author: Francis Bacon
title: He that gives good advice, builds with one hand; he that gives good counsel and example, builds with both; but he that gives good admonition and bad example, builds with one hand and pulls down with the other.

author: Erica Jong
title: He who can take advice is sometimes superior to him who can give it.

author: Anne Frank
title: How true Daddy's words were when he said: all children must look after their own upbringing. Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

author: Gene Fowler
title: I am glad that I paid so little attention to good advice; had I abided by it I might have been saved from some of my most valuable mistakes.

author: A. N. Wilson
title: I am shy to admit that I have followed the advice given all those years ago by a wise archbishop to a bewildered young man: that moments of unbelief 'don't matter,' that if you return to a practice of the faith, faith will return.

author: Henry Ford
title: I believe God is managing affairs and that He doesn't need any advice from me. With God in charge, I believe everything will work out for the best in the end. So what is there to worry about.

author: Harry S. Truman
title: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.

author: Groucho Marx
title: I have no advice to give to young actors. To young, struggling actresses, my advice is to keep struggling. If you struggle long enough, you will never get in trouble and if you never get in trouble, you will never be much of an actress.

author: Gloria Steinem
title:
I have yet to hear a man ask for advice on how to combine marriage and a career.,
,

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title:
I owe my success to having listened respectfully to the very best advice, and then going away and doing the exact opposite.,
G.

author: Mary Wortley Montagu
title: I sometimes give myself admirable advice, but I am incapable of taking it.

author: Betty Wright
title: I'm lyric conscious. I like to tell stories, give advice. Instead of writing a 'Dear Abby' column, I do it on records.

author: Beverley Mitchell
title: If I had to give one piece of advice to incoming college freshmen, I'd say always be true to yourself.

author: Lillian Hellman
title: If I had to give young writers advice, I would say don't listen to writers talking about writing or themselves.

author: Ann Landers
title: If I were asked to give what I consider the single most useful bit of advice for all humanity it would be this: Expect trouble as an inevitable part of life and when it comes, hold you head high, look it squarely in the eye and say, ''I will be bigger than you. You cannot defeat me.''

author: Winston Churchill
title: If the Almighty were to rebuild the world and asked me for advice, I would have English Channels round every country. And the atmosphere would be such that anything which attempted to fly would be set on fire.

author: Robert Montgomery
title: If you achieve success, you will get applause, and if you get applause, you will hear it. My advice to you concerning applause is this; enjoy it but never quite believe it.

author: Solon
title: In giving advice, seek to help, not please, your friend.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: In matters of religion and matrimony I never give any advice; because I will not have anybody's torments in this world or the next laid to my charge.

author: Bill Cosby
title: In spite of the seven thousand books of expert advice, the right way to discipline a child is still a mystery to most fathers and... mothers. Only your grandmother and Ghengis Khan know how to do it.

author: Igor Stravinsky
title: In the course of your work, you will from time to time encounter the situation where the facts and the theory do not coincide. In such circumstances, young gentlemen, it is my earnest advice to respect the facts.

author: Winston Churchill
title: In those days he was wiser than he is now - he used frequently to take my advice.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: It is a mistake to suppose that men succeed through success; they much oftener succeed through failures. Precept, study, advice, and example could never have taught them so well as failure has done.

author: Abigail Van Buren
title: It is a sad commentary of our times when our young must seek advice and counsel from 'Dear Abby' instead of going to Mom and Dad.

author: Aeschylus
title: It is an easy thing for one whose foot is on the outside of calamity to give advice and to rebuke the sufferer.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: It is bad advice that cannot be changed.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: It is easy to give advice from a port of safety.

author: Aeschylus
title: It is easy when we are in prosperity to give advice to the afflicted.

author: Anne Tyler
title: It is very difficult to live among people you love and hold back from offering them advice.

author: J. C. Macaulay
title: It takes a great man to give sound advice tactfully, but a greater to accept it graciously.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: It's a little embarrassing that after 45 years of research & study, the best advice I can give people is to be a little kinder to each other.

author: Anne Sullivan
title: It's queer how ready people always are with advice in any real or imaginary emergency, and no matter how many times experience has shown them to be wrong, they continue to set forth their opinions, as if they had received them from the Almighty!

author: Babe Ruth
title: Keed, I'll give you a little bit of advice. Don't believe anything they write about you, good or bad. Two, get the dough while the getting is good, but don't break your heart trying to get it. And don't pick up too many checks!

author: Ann Landers
title: Know when to tune out, if you listen to too much advice you may wind up making other peoples mistakes.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: Many receive advice, few profit by it.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: Many receive advice, only the wise profit from it.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Men give away nothing so liberally as their advice.

author: Barry Zito
title: Meyer and I have a bit in common because we're both left-handed. I think it's great that he seeks out that advice because he's not too cool or too uncomfortable to ask for it.

author: Ivern Ball
title: Most of us ask for advice when we know the answer but we want a different one.

author: Josh Billings
title: Most people when they come to you for advice, come to have their own opinions strengthened, not corrected.

author: Adam Savage
title: My advice is keep your lips away from the spinning things.

author: Carl Rowan
title: My advice to any diplomat who wants to have a good press is to have two or three kids and a dog.

author: Ben Elton
title: My advice to anyone adapting a novel is that once they've read it and learnt to understand it, then they must throw it away and never look at it again!

author: Brandi Carlile
title: My advice to new artists is to embrace a broader concept of timelessness than vintage or retro.

author: Timothy Leary
title: My advice to people today is as follows: If you take the game of life seriously, if you take your nervous system seriously, if you take your sense organs seriously, if you take the energy process seriously, you must turn on, tune in, and drop out.

author: Mae West
title: My advice to those who think they have to take off their clothes to be a star is, once you're boned, what's left to create the illusion? Let em wonder. I never believed in giving them too much of me.

author: Robert Montgomery
title: My advice to you concerning applause is this: enjoy it but never quite believe it.

author: Socrates
title: My advice to you is get married: if you find a good wife you’ll be happy; if not, you’ll become a philosopher.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: My advice to you is not to inquire why or whither, but just enjoy your ice cream while it's on your plate - that's my philosophy.

author: Bonnie Tyler
title: My mum was a wonderful mother. She died, aged 80, of Alzheimer's disease, which was dreadful to watch. I remember she said to me: 'Believe in yourself because no one else is going to do it for you.' I'm sure a lot of my success is due to her words of advice.

author: Lope de Vega
title: Never give anyone the advice to buy or sell shares, because the most benevolent price of advice can turn out badly.

author: Alan Alda
title: Never Have Your Dog Stuffed is really advice to myself, a reminder to myself not to avoid change or uncertainty, but to go with it, to surf into change.

author: Sydney Harris
title: Never take the advice of someone who has not had your kind of trouble.

author: Aesop
title: Never trust the advice of a man in difficulties.

author: John Steinbeck
title: No one wants advice, only corroboration.

author: Brad Meltzer
title: On the day my daughter was born, I started writing a book for her. The plan was that, over the course of her life, I'd fill it with advice on how to be a strong woman. But along the way, I got caught up in the stories of Amelia Earhart, Sally Ride, and so many others. So how do you pick the best heroes for your kids?

author: Anne Frank
title: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

author: Brendan Francis
title: People who ask our advice almost never take it. Yet we should never refuse to give it, upon request, for it often helps us to see our own way more clearly.

author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
title: Please give me some good advice in your next letter. I promise not to follow it.

author: Bob Newhart
title: Probably the best advice I ever got in my life was from the head of the accounting department, Mr. Hutchinson, I believe at the Glidden Company in Chicago, and he told me, 'You really aren't cut out for accounting.'

author: Alan Thicke
title: So there was a constant flow and a thin line there between reality and television and yes, much of what I was experiencing in my real life was also what was going on in the television show to the extent that I had to take writers' advice and from the counselors around.

author: Gordon R. Dickson
title: Some people like my advice so much that they frame it upon the wall instead of using it.

author: Atom Egoyan
title: That is where the irony of the film comes off, in terms of the language it employs - where he tries desperately to be a 'TV Dad,' to give advice and it's so pat it becomes ridiculous.

author: Ben Harper
title: The advice I have for new artists is this - write great songs and play them live as often as possible. Get residencies all over town and crush it.

author: Pierre Charron
title: The advice of friends must be received with a judicious reserve; we must not give ourselves up to it and follow it blindly, whether right or wrong.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: The advice of the elders to young men is very apt to be as unreal as a list of the hundred best books.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The advice that is wanted is commonly not welcome and that which is not wanted, evidently an effrontery.

author: Matthew McConaughey
title:
The best advice comes from people who don't give advice.,
,

author: Bob Newhart
title: The best advice I was probably given and the best advice I could give someone who is trying to get into the comedy field is to take advantage of every opportunity you have to work to hone your skills.

author: Barry Sternlicht
title: The best advice is often the compliments received, and they are often about an associate who did something exceptional. I tell my teams that it's the random acts of kindness, the unexpected, that people remember most.

author: Anne Sophie Swetchine
title: The best advice on the art of being happy is about as easy to follow as advice to be well when one is sick.

author: Carolyn Murphy
title: The best anti-aging advice I've ever received? Drink a lot of water and have a plant-based diet. I also do mindful meditation with my daughter every day. It takes ten minutes. I think reducing stress plays a big part in anti-aging.

author: Bruno Bettelheim
title: The fear of failure is so great, it is no wonder that the desire to do right by one's children has led to a whole library of books offering advice on how to raise them.

author: Arthur Helps
title: The greatest luxury of riches is that they enable you to escape so much good advice.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: The history of the last century shows, as we shall see later, that the advice given to governments by bankers, like the advice they gave to industrialists, was consistently good for bankers, but was often disastrous for governments, businessmen, and the people generally.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: The one thing people are the most liberal with, is their advice.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.

author: Boo Weekley
title: The tour life is real tough on a marriage. To the young guy who is just getting his PGA Tour card and is in a serious relationship, my advice is to wait three years before getting married.

author: Hannah Whitall Smith
title: The true secret of giving advice is, after you have honestly given it, to be perfectly indifferent whether it is taken or not, and never persist in trying to set people right.

author: Francis Bacon
title:
The worst men often give the best advice.,
,

author: Philip James Bailey
title: The worst men often give the best advice.

author: Bo Bennett
title: There is a misleading, unwritten rule that states if a quote giving advice comes from someone famous, very old, or Greek, then it must be good advice.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: There is hardly a man on earth who will take advice unless he is certain that it is positively bad.

author: Lillian Hellman
title: They're fancy talkers about themselves, writers. If I had to give young writers advice, I would say don't listen to writers talking about writing or themselves.

author: Anna Howard Shaw
title: Think of submitting our measure to the advice of politicians! I would as soon submit the subject of the equality of a goose to a fox.

author: John C. Collins
title: To ask for advice is in nine cases out of ten to ask for flattery.

author: John Gray
title: To offer a man unsolicited advice is to presume that he doesn't know what to do or that he can't do it on his own.

author: John Churton Collins
title: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.

author: Warren Buffett
title: Wall Street is the only place that people ride to in a Rolls Royce to get advice from those who take the subway.,

author: Jack Herbert
title: We all admire the wisdom of people who come to us for advice.

author: Boris Johnson
title: We are experiencing such large support for the Olympic relay that our advice is to stay in your neighbourhood, stay in your borough and wait for it to come near you.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: We ask advice but we mean approbation.

author: William R. Alger
title: We give advice by the bucket, but take it by the grain.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.

author: Henry Wheeler Shaw
title: We hate those who will not take our advice, and despise them who do.

author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine
title: We've no use for intellectuals in this outfit. What we need is chimpanzees. Let me give you a word of advice: never say a word to us about being intelligent. We will think for you, my friend. Don't forget it.

author: Barney Frank
title: Well, I don't give it out very often, but I reject the notion that you have to be a practitioner to give good advice.

author: Aeschylus
title: What exists outside is a man's concern; let no woman give advice; and do no mischief within doors.

author: Horace
title: Whatever advice you give, be short.

author: Josh Billings
title: When a man comes to me for advice, I find out the kind of advice he wants, and I give it to him.

author: Helen Rowland
title: When a man spends his time giving his wife criticism and advice instead of compliments, he forgets that it was not his good judgment, but his charming manners, that won her heart.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: When a man wants your advice he generally wants your praise.

author: Ben Stein
title: When I seemed to be irritable or sad, my father would quote the learned Dr. Knight, and then say, 'Just go to sleep.' Like all smart aleck kids, I thought the advice was silly. But as I've grown older, I've realized just how smart Knight was.

author: Al Franken
title: When you encounter seemingly good advice that contradicts other seemingly good advice, ignore them both.

author: Abu Bakr
title: When you seek advice, do not withhold any facts from the person whose advice you seek.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Wise men don't need advice. Fools won't take it.

author: Barbara Corcoran
title: You may not like the idea of putting money into a home when you're moving out. But it's demanded by the market. You need to show it off. You don't have to rip out the kitchen and bathroom. But maybe replace the tiles or the countertops. Get professional advice.

author: John Ruskin
title: You should read books like you take medicine, by advice, and not by advertisement.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: An ordinary man away from home giving advice.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Old men are fond of giving good advice to console themselves for their inability to give bad examples.

author: author
title: title

author: Joseph Addison
title: Certain is it that there is no kind of affection so purely angelic as of a father to a daughter. In love to our wives there is desire; to our sons, ambition; but to our daughters there is something which there are no words to express.

author: Sir Walter Scott
title: Ambition breaks the ties of blood, and forgets the obligations of gratitude.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Ambition and love are the wings to great deeds.

author: Timothy Leary
title: Women who seek to be equal with men lack ambition.

author: Charlie McCarthy
title: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.

author: Michel Eyquem de Montaigne
title: Ambition is not a vice of little people.

author: Walter H. Cottingham
title: A man without ambition is like a bird without wings.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: A slave has but one master. An ambition man, has as many as there are people who helped him get his fortune.

author: Arthur Koestler
title: A writer's ambition should be to trade a hundred contemporary readers for ten readers in ten years' time and for one reader in a hundred years' time.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: All sins have their origin in a sense of inferiority otherwise called ambition.

author: Sir James Matthew Barrie
title: Ambition - it is the last infirmity of noble minds.

author: Edmund Burke
title: Ambition can creep as well as soar.,

author: Bruce Forsyth
title: Ambition can take the place of everything - even sex.,

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Ambition has its disappointments to sour us, but never the good fortune to satisfy us. Its appetite grows keener by indulgence and all we can gratify it with at present serves but the more to inflame its insatiable desires.

author: Susan Sontag
title: Ambition if it feeds at all, does so on the ambition of others.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: Ambition is a Dead Sea fruit, and the greatest peril to the soul is that one is likely to get precisely what he is seeking.

author: Thomas Otway
title: Ambition is a lust that is never quenched, but grows more inflamed and madder by enjoyment.

author: Charlie McCarthy
title: Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy.

author: Robert Southey
title: Ambition is an idol, on whose wings great minds are carried only to extreme; to be sublimely great or to be nothing.

author: Sir John Denham
title: Ambition is like love, impatient both of delays and rivals.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Ambition is not a vice of little people.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: Ambition is not what a man would do, but what a man does, for ambition without action is fantasy.

author: Robert Browning
title: Ambition is not what man does... but what man would do.

author: Joseph Joubert
title: Ambition is pitiless. Any merit that it cannot use it finds despicable.

author: Machiavelli
title: Ambition is so powerful a passion in the human breast, that however high we reach we are never satisfied.

author: Thomas Dunn English
title: Ambition is the germ from which all growth of nobleness proceeds.

author: John Cowper Powys
title: Ambition is the grand enemy of all peace.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Ambition is the last refuge of failure.

author: Bill Bradley
title:
Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.,
,
,

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Ambition makes the same mistake concerning power that avarice makes concerning wealth. She begins by accumulating power as a means to happiness, and she finishes by continuing to accumulate it as an end.

author: Yoshida Kenko
title: Ambition never comes to an end.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: Ambition often puts Men upon doing the meanest offices; so climbing is performed in the same position with creeping.

author: Ben Jonson
title: Ambition, like a torrent, ne'er looks back; , And is a swelling, and the last affection , A high mind can put off; being both a rebel , Unto the soul and reason, and enforceth , All laws, all conscience, treads upon religion, , and offereth violence to nature's self.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Ambition: An overmastering desire to be vilified by enemies while living and made ridiculous by friends when dead.

author: Bruce Lee
title: As long as I can remember I feel I have had this great creative and spiritual force within me that is greater than faith, greater than ambition, greater than confidence, greater than determination, greater than vision. It is all these combined. My brain becomes magnetized with this dominating force which I hold in my hand.

author: Salvador Dali
title: At the age of six I wanted to be a cook. At seven I wanted to be Napoleon. And my ambition has been growing steadily ever since.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Avarice is generally the last passion of those lives of which the first part has been squandered in pleasure, and the second devoted to ambition. He that sinks under the fatigue of getting wealth, lulls his age with the milder business of saving it.

author: Helen Keller
title: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experiences of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired and success achieved.

author: Henry S. Haskins
title: Discontent follows ambition like a shadow.

author: Bob Riley
title: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Every man has, some time in his life, an ambition to be a wag.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition. Whether it be true or not, I can say for one that I have no other so great as that of being truly esteemed of my fellow men, by rendering myself worthy of their esteem.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Every man of ambition has to fight his century with its own weapons. What this century worships is wealth. The God of this century is wealth. To succeed one must have wealth. At all costs one must have wealth.

author: Herbert Kaufman
title: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage ''coaches'' ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.

author: Francesco Petrarca
title: Five enemies of peace inhabit with us - avarice, ambition, envy, anger, and pride; if these were to be banished, we should infallibly enjoy perpetual peace.

author: Barack Obama
title: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a certain poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. Because it's only when you hitch your wagon to something larger than yourself that you realize your true potential.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Gratitude looks to the past and love to the present; fear, avarice, lust, and ambition look ahead.

author: Napoleon
title: Great ambition is the passion of a great character. Those endowed with it may perform very good or very bad acts. All depends on the principals which direct them.

author: Adam Smith
title: Great ambition, the desire of real superiority, of leading and directing, seems to be altogether peculiar to man, and speech is the great instrument of ambition.

author: Bhagat Singh
title: I emphasize that I am full of ambition and hope and of full charm of life. But I can renounce all at the time of need, and that is the real sacrifice. These things can never be hinderance in the way of man, provided he be a man. You will have the practical proof in the near future.

author: James R. Cook
title: I had ambition not only to go farther than any man had ever been before, but as far as it was possible for a man to go.

author: John D. Rockefeller
title: I had no ambition to make a fortune. Mere money-making has never been my goal, I had an ambition to build.

author: Lord George Byron
title: I have a notion that gamblers are as happy as most people, being always excited; women, wine, fame, the table, even ambition, sate now and then, but every turn of the card and cast of the dice keeps the gambler alive - besides one can game ten times longer than one can do any thing else.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: I have no ambition to govern men. It is a painful and thankless office

author: Anthony Trollope
title: I have no ambition to surprise my reader. Castles with unknown passages are not compatible with my homely muse.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: I've got a great ambition to die of exhaustion rather than boredom.,

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: If boyhood and youth are but vanity, must it not be our ambition to become men?

author: Nadine Gordimer
title: If people would forget about utopia! When rationalism destroyed heaven and decided to set it up here on earth, that most terrible of all goals entered human ambition. It was clear there'd be no end to what people would be made to suffer for it.

author: Carl von Clausewitz
title: If the leader is filled with high ambition and if he pursues his aims with audacity and strength of will, he will reach them in spite of all obstacles.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: If you can once engage people's pride, love, pity, ambition (or whatever is their prevailing passion) on your side, you need not fear what their reason can do against you.

author: Beau Willimon
title: If you really think that ambition, power, lust, desire are not as applicable in the media as in politics or on Wall Street or anywhere else, you're deluding yourself.

author: Dr. Joyce Brothers
title: If your energy is as boundless as your ambition, total commitment may be a way of life you should seriously consider.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
title: In ambition, as in love, the successful can afford to be indulgent toward their rivals. The prize our own, it is graceful to recognize the merit that vainly aspired to it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: In literature the ambition of the novice is to acquire the literary language: the struggle of the adept is to get rid of it.

author: Aslan Maskhadov
title: Independence is not a whim or an ambition. It is the necessary condition of our survival as an ethnic group.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: It is a grand thing to rise in the world. The ambition to do so is the very salt of the earth. It is the parent of all enterprise, and the cause of all improvement.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: It is my ambition to say in ten sentences; what others say in a whole book.

author: Seneca
title: It is the constant fault and inseparable evil quality of ambition, that it never looks behind it.

author: Sallust
title: It is the nature of ambition to make men liars and cheats, to hide the truth in their breasts, and show, like jugglers, another thing in their mouths, to cut all friendships and enmities to the measure of their own interest, and to make a good countenance without the help of good will.

author: Marquis de Sade
title: Lust is to the other passions what the nervous fluid is to life; it supports them all, lends strength to them all ambition, cruelty, avarice, revenge, are all founded on lust.

author: Marquis de Sade
title: Lycurgus, Numa, Moses, Jesus Christ, Mohammed, all these great rogues, all these great thought-tyrants, knew how to associate the divinities they fabricated with their own boundless ambition.

author: Calvin Trillin
title: Marriage is part of a sort of 50's revival package that's back in vogue along with neckties and naked ambition.

author: Bette Davis
title: May each of my grandsons know, at an early age, what his life's ambition is -- and may he be successful in his pursuit of that goal.

author: Bob Marley
title: Me only have one ambition, y'know. I only have one thing I really like to see happen. I like to see mankind live together - black, white, Chinese, everyone - that's all.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: Moderation has been called a virtue to limit the ambition of great men, and to console undistinguished people for their want of fortune and their lack of merit.

author: Peter Carey
title: My greatest pleasure is to invent. My continual mad ambition is to make something true and beautiful that never existed in the world before.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Nothing arouses ambition so much in the heart as the trumpet-clang of another's fame.

author: Bernard Le Bovier de Fontenelle
title: Nothing can be more destructive to ambition, and the passion for conquest, than the true system of astronomy. What a poor thing is even the whole globe in comparison of the infinite extent of nature!

author: Horace Walpole
title: Oh that I were seated as high as my ambition, I'd place my naked foot on the necks of monarchs.

author: Sir John Lubbock
title: Our ambition should be to rule ourselves, the true kingdom for each one of us; and true progress is to know more, and be more, and to do more.

author: Margaret Mead
title: People in America, of course, live in all sorts of fashions, because they are foreigners, or unlucky, or depraved, or without ambition; people live like that, but Americans live in white detached houses with green shutters. Rigidly, blindly, the dream takes precedence.

author: Carmen Kass
title: Places like New York are just too intense, too much about money, too much about ambition; it's all too superficial for me.

author: Carly Fiorina
title: Russia - having sat across the table from Vladimir Putin, it's pretty clear when you meet him that he has an almost limitless ambition for power. And he's been very good at acquiring it - political power, economic power, military power, territorial power.

author: John Ruskin
title: Some slaves are scoured to their work by whips, others by their restlessness and ambition.

author: Beau Willimon
title: Tales of power and ambition and intrigue and betrayal and desire - when you're telling those in a big way, you automatically want to go to Shakespeare.

author: Seneca
title: That which is given with pride and ostentation is rather an ambition than a bounty.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The aphorism in which I am the first master among Germans, are the forms of ''eternity''; my ambition is to say in ten sentences what everyone else says in a book - what everyone else does not say in a book.

author: Katharine Hepburn
title: The average Hollywood film star's ambition is to be admired by an American, courted by an Italian, married to an Englishman and have a French boyfriend.

author: James Fenimore Cooper
title: The common faults of American language are an ambition of effect, a want of simplicity, and a turgid abuse of terms.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The desire to create continually is vulgar and betrays jealousy, envy, ambition. If one is something one really does not need to make anything - and one nonetheless does very much. There exists above the ''productive'' man a yet higher species.

author: Anna Garlin Spencer
title: The failure of women to produce genius of the first rank in most of the supreme forms of human effort has been used to block the way of all women of talent and ambition for intellectual achievement.

author: John Keats
title: The imagination of a boy is healthy, and the mature imagination of a man is healthy; but there is a space of life between, in which the soul is in a ferment, the character undecided, the way of life uncertain, the ambition thick-sighted: thence proceeds mawkishness.

author: William Hazlitt
title:
The incentive to ambition is the love of power.,
,

author: Barney Frank
title: The left and the right live in parallel universes. The right listens to talk radio, the left's on the Internet and they just reinforce one another. They have no sense of reality. I have now one ambition: to retire before it becomes essential to tweet.

author: Alva Myrdal
title: The longing for peace is rooted in the hearts of all men. But the striving, which at present has become so insistent, cannot lay claim to such an ambition as leading the way to eternal peace, or solving all disputes among nations.

author: William Hazlitt
title: The love of fame is almost another name for the love of excellence; or it is the ambition to attain the highest excellence, sanctioned by the highest authority, that of time.

author: Bill Dedman
title: The main threads running through the lives of W. A. Clark and his daughter Huguette include the costs of ambition, the burdens of inherited wealth, the fragility of reputation, the folly of judging someone's life from the outside, and the tension between engaging with the world, with all its risks, and keeping a safe distance from danger.

author: Herbert N. Casson
title: The men who succeed are the efficient few. They are the few who have the ambition and will power to develop themselves.

author: Gerald Early
title: The Miss America contest is the most perfectly rendered theater in our culture, for it so perfectly captures what we yearn for: a low-class ritual, a polished restatement of vulgarity, that wants to open the door to high-class respectability by way of plain middle-class anxiety and ambition.

author: Derek Jarman
title: The preserve of ambition and folly in pursuit of illusion, or delusion.

author: Alexander Pope
title: The same ambition can destroy or save, and make a patriot as it makes a knave.,

author: Alfred P. Sloan
title: There has to be this pioneer, the individual who has the courage, the ambition to overcome the obstacles that always develop when one tries to do something worthwhile, especially when it is new and different.

author: Edgar Quinet
title: Though ambition in itself is a vice, it often is also the parent of virtue.

author: John Steinbeck
title: Time is the only critic without ambition.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: To be happy at home is the ultimate result of all ambition, the end to which every enterprise and labor tends, and of which every desire prompts the prosecution.

author: Henry Drummond
title: To become Christ-like is the only thing in the whole world worth caring for, the thing before which every ambition of man is folly and all lower achievement vain.

author: William M. Thackeray
title: To endure is greater than to dare; to tire out hostile fortune; to be daunted by no difficulty; to keep heart when all have lost it; to go through intrigue spotless; to forego even ambition when the end is gained - who can say this is not greatness?

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: To make converts is the natural ambition of everyone.

author: Billie Burke
title: To survive there, you need the ambition of a Latin-American revolutionary, the ego of a grand opera tenor, and the physical stamina of a cow pony.

author: William James
title: We have grown literally afraid to be poor. We despise anyone who elects to be poor in order to simplify and save his inner life. If he does not join the general scramble and pant with the money-making street, we deem him spiritless and lacking in ambition.

author: Bjorn Ulvaeus
title: We will never appear on stage again. There is simply no motivation to re-group. Money is not a factor and we would like people to remember us as we were. Young, exuburent, full of energy and ambition.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: What seems to be generosity is often no more than disguised ambition, which overlooks a small interest in order to secure a great one.

author: Anna Held
title: Whatever success I may have attained is due to the fact that since I was old enough to work at all, my ambition has never deserted me.

author: Thomas Merton
title: When ambition ends, happiness begins.,

author: Billy Idol
title: When I started out, everyone seemed to be adopting these names... Johnny Rotten, Sid Vicious. I wasn't really Rotten or Vicious or Nasty, so I wanted something a bit more funny - yet something that seemed real rock 'n' roll... something that acknowledged my ambition.

author: David Hume
title: Where ambition can cover its enterprises, even to the person himself, under the appearance of principle, it is the most incurable and inflexible of passions.

author: Sir Henry Taylor
title: Where there are large powers with little ambition... nature may be said to have fallen short of her purposes.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Ambition should be made of sterner stuff.

author: author
title: title

author: Aristotle
title: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals; separated from law and justice he is the worst.

author: George Orwell
title: All animals are created equal, but some are more equal than others.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: If everything is perfect, language is useless. This is true for animals. If animals don't speak, it's because everything's perfect for them. If one day they start to speak, it will be because the world has lost a certain sort of perfection.

author: Ouida
title: In a few generations more, there will probably be no room at all allowed for animals on the earth: no need of them, no toleration of them. An immense agony will have then ceased, but with it there will also have passed away the last smile of the world's youth.

author: Joseph Addison
title: There is not, in my opinion, anything more mysterious in nature than this instinct in animals, which thus rise above reason, and yet fall infinitely short of it.

author: George Orwell
title: All animals are created equal, but some are more equal than others.

author: Byron Howard
title: 'Zootopia' features such a large and diverse range of characters - one of our biggest casts ever for a Disney Animation film. We needed talented actors who could help bring these animals to life.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man is ethical only when life, as such, is sacred to him, that of plants and animals as that of his fellow men, and when he devotes himself helpfully to all life that is in need of help.

author: George Orwell
title: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.

author: Samuel Butler
title: All animals except man know that the ultimate of life is to enjoy it.

author: Samuel Butler
title: All animals, except man, know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.

author: Bjarke Ingels
title: All comic books take place in built environments, and I was very good at drawing people and animals, and stuff like that, but I hadn't spent much energy drawing buildings. So I thought, maybe I could, and then I became an architect.

author: Maurice Maeterlinck
title: All our knowledge merely helps us to die a more painful death than animals that know nothing.

author: Bruce Jackson
title: All too often, academic departments defend their territory with the passion of cornered animals, though with far less justification.

author: Shirley Lord
title: Animals are considered as property only. To destroy or to abuse them, from malice to the proprietor, or with an intention injurious to his interest in them, is criminal. But the animals themselves are without protection. The law regards them not substantively. They have no RIGHTS!

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
title: Animals are in possession of themselves; their soul is in possession of their body. But they have no right to their life, because they do not will it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Animals are my friends... and I don't eat my friends.

author: Alfred A. Montapert
title: Animals are reliable, many full of love, true in their affections, predictable in their actions, grateful and loyal. Difficult standards for people to live up to.

author: Edward Hoagland
title: Animals are stylized characters in a kind of old saga - stylized because even the most acute of them have little leeway as they play out their parts.

author: George Eliot
title: Animals are such agreeable friends, they ask no questions, they pass no criticisms.

author: Malcolm de Chazal
title: Animals awaken, first facially, then bodily. Men's bodies wake before their faces do. The animal sleeps within its body, man sleeps with his body in his mind.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Animals do not admire each other. A horse does not admire its companion.

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: Animals have never betrayed me. They are an easy prey, as I have been throughout my career. So we feel the same. I love them.

author: Voltaire
title: Animals have these advantages over man: They have no theologians to instruct them, their funerals cost them nothing, and no one starts lawsuits over their wills.

author: Aaron Carter
title: Animals keep you company when you're really lonely. It helps because when you have a friend around who always likes you no matter what - it's harder to feel bad or down.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: Animals often strike us as passionate machines.

author: Bernadette Peters
title: Animals speak with pure affection. It's important to me to get something going in NY so we can get to be a no-kill city, and give the animals homes and more attention and love.

author: Joseph Addison
title: Animals, in their generation, are wiser than the sons of men; but their wisdom is confined to a few particulars, and lies in a very narrow compass.

author: Bruce Greenwood
title: Animals... don't have a sense of time. You just have to do things over and over with animals until they happen to do it right because they don't really know what you want.

author: W. C. Fields
title: Anyone who hates children and animals can't be all bad.,

author: Bonnie Bassler
title: As a kid, I loved doing puzzles, solving riddles, and reading mystery books. I also loved animals and always had pets.

author: Carine Roitfeld
title: Becoming a grandmother brought me back to the things I forgot to love. Nature. Playing. Seeing animals. A new way of looking. A rejuvenation. A cycle of life - things come back to you. The details.

author: Bill Nye
title: Burning carbon-based substances like oil, gas, and especially coal, produces billions of tons of extra carbon dioxide each year. Methane gas from cows and pigs and other animals on our large farms ends up in the atmosphere as well, trapping more of the sun's energy as heat.

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: China once again disgusts the world, portraying the image of a cruel, perverted people devoid of any feelings towards animals.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: Chinese civilisation is so systematic that wild animals have been abolished on principle.

author: David Seabury
title: Courage and conviction are powerful weapons against an enemy who depends only on fists or guns. Animals know when you are afraid; a coward knows when you are not.

author: Pierre de Beaumarchais
title: Drinking, when we are not thirsty and making love all year round, madam; that is all there is to distinguish us from other animals.

author: Juvenal
title: Even savage animals can agree among themselves.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Football is a gentleman's sport played by animals, while rugby is a animalsport played by gentlemen

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Fork: An instrument used chiefly for the purpose of putting dead animals into the mouth.

author: Arthur Young
title: God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man.

author: Ann Veneman
title: Great Britain had a much different situation than we do and did here in the United States, in that they had literally thousands of infected animals with human health risks. Their infectivity in this disease happened before very much was known about it.

author: Elizabeth Janeway
title: Growing up human is uniquely a matter of social relations rather than biology. What we learn from connections within the family takes the place of instincts that program the behavior of animals; which raises the question, how good are these connections?

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Human beings are the only animals of which I am thoroughly and cravenly afraid.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Humans are amphibians - half spirit and half animal. As spirits they belong to the eternal world, but as animals they inhabit time.

author: A. Whitney Brown
title: I am not a vegetarian because I love animals; I am a vegetarian because I hate plants.

author: Graham Swift
title: I am struck by the way people behave on the Tube. They look at each other beadily and inquisitively, and something goes on in their thoughts which must be equivalent to the way dogs and other animals, when they meet, sniff each other's arses and nuzzle each other's fur.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: I do not want to make my stomach a graveyard of dead animals.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: I fear animals regard man as a creature of their own kind which has in a highly dangerous fashion lost its healthy animal reason - as the mad animal, as the laughing animal, as the weeping animal, as the unhappy animal.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: I have no doubt that it is a part of the destiny of the human race, in its gradual improvement, to leave off eating animals, as surely as the savage tribes have left off eating each other when they came in contact with the more civilized.

author: Romain Rolland
title: I know at last what distinguishes man from animals; financial worries.

author: George Washington
title: I know of no pursuit in which more real and important services can be rendered to any country than by improving its agriculture, its breed of useful animals, and other branches of a husbandman's cares.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
title: I've always had that attitude about my career: it's something that I do, but it's not my whole life. I have a real life, a personal life: I've got a lot of chickens, I've got a horse, I've got a kitty-cat, I've got a lot of goats, I've got animals all over the place.

author: Anne Tyler
title: I've always thought a hotel ought to offer optional small animals. I mean a cat to sleep on your bed at night, or a dog of some kind to act pleased when you come in. You ever notice how a hotel room feels so lifeless?

author: Barry Marshall
title: If humans evolved in a tiny area of Africa, they only saw plants and animals within a 100-kilometre radius for a million years. When they began to migrate, there would have been different animals and plants - and potentially a lot of allergy issues.

author: Alfred Russel Wallace
title: In all works on Natural History, we constantly find details of the marvellous adaptation of animals to their food, their habits, and the localities in which they are found.

author: Bob Woodward
title: In Haig's presence, Kissinger referred pointedly to military men as dumb, stupid animals to be used as pawns for foreign policy.

author: Alfred Russel Wallace
title: It has been generally the custom of writers on natural history to take the habits and instincts of animals as the fixed point, and to consider their structure and organization as specially adapted to be in accordance with them.

author: Henrik Ibsen
title: It is inexcusable for scientists to torture animals; let them make their experiments on journalists and politicians.

author: Mario Vargas Llosa
title: It isn't true that convicts live like animals: animals have more room to move around.

author: Asa Gray
title: It was always understood that plants and animals, though completely contrasted in their higher representatives, approached each other very closely in their lower and simpler forms. But they were believed not to blend.

author: Byron Howard
title: It's tough sometimes for groups of people and animals to let go of that fear that can so easily bubble back up to the surface.

author: Bea Arthur
title: Keep fighting for animals by making compassionate, cruelty-free choices every day and encouraging those around you to do the same.

author: Jose Marti
title: Let those who desire a secure homeland conquer it. Let those who do not conquer it live under the whip and in exile, watched over like wild animals, cast from one country to another, concealing the death of their souls with a beggar's smile from the scorn of free men.

author: John Gay
title: Lions, wolves, and vultures don't live together in herds, droves or flocks. Of all animals of prey, man is the only sociable one. Every one of us preys upon his neighbor, and yet we herd together.

author: Benjamin Hoff
title: Lots of people talk to animals... Not very many listen, though... That's the problem.

author: Bea Arthur
title: Making lasting gifts for animals in our estate plans is perhaps the single most important thing we can do to ensure animals have the strongest possible voice for their protection.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
