title: Man can acquire accomplishments or he can become an animal, whichever he wants. God makes the animals, man makes himself.

author: Captain Beefheart
title: Man has done a lot to make himself dangerous and animals get the worst of all of it. But then, man too is an animal.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Man is an exception, whatever else he is. If he is not the image of God, then he is a disease of the dust. If it is not true that a divine being fell, then we can only say that one of the animals went entirely off its head.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: Man is distinguished, not only by his reason; but also by this singular passion from other animals... which is a lust of the mind, that by a perseverance of delight in the continual and indefatigable generation of knowledge, exceeds the short vehemence of any carnal pleasure.

author: René Daumal
title: Man is head, chest and stomach. Each of these animals operates, more often than not, individually. I eat, I feel, I even, although rarely, think. This jungle crawls and teems, is hungry, roars, gets angry, devours itself, and its cacophonic concert does not even stop when you are asleep.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Man's inhumanity to man is only surpassed by his cruelty to animals.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Man's unique reward, however, is that while animals survive by adjusting themselves to their background, man survives by adjusting his background to himself.

author: Adam Smith
title: Mankind are animals that makes bargains, no other animal does this.

author: Confucius
title: Mankind differs from the animals only by a little and most people throw that away.

author: Milan Kundera
title: Mankind's true moral test, its fundamental test (which lies deeply buried from view), consists of its attitude towards those who are at its mercy: animals. And in this respect mankind has suffered a fundamental debacle, a debacle so fundamental that all others stem from it.

author: Asa Gray
title: Many years ago it was taught that plants and animals were composed of different materials: plants, of a chemical substance of three elements,- carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen; animals of one of four elements, nitrogen being added to the other three.

author: Bryan Callen
title: My point of view is that men are basically animals, and I'm okay with that.

author: Mary Wortley Montagu
title: Nature has not placed us in an inferior rank to men, no more than the females of other animals, where we see no distinction of capacity, though I am persuaded if there was a commonwealth of rational horses... it would be an established maxim amongst them that a mare could not be taught to pace.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: Nature makes only dumb animals. We owe the fools to society.

author: Thomas Love Peacock
title: Nothing can be more obvious than all animals were created solely and exclusively for the use of man.

author: Russell Hoban
title: Nothing to be done really about animals. Anything you do looks foolish. The answer isn't in us. It's almost as if we're put here on earth to show how silly they aren't.

author: Joseph Rudyard Kipling
title: Often and often afterwards, the beloved Aunt would ask me why I had never told anyone how I was being treated. Children tell little more than animals, for what comes to them they accept as eternally established.

author: Byron Howard
title: One of the magical things about these anthropomorphic animal movies is that we can take things that are so common in our own world that we deal with, like the DMV, or moving to a new city, or our family, and show you a mirror image of those things, reflected in a whole new way. That's why animals are great.

author: Bee Wilson
title: One of the rudest things you can do, food-wise, is to stare at someone in the act of eating. It draws attention to the unseemly fact that eating is a bodily function - like animals, we are trapped by our hungers, but we do our best to disguise them with such civilized props as menus and forks.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Only the most acute and active animals are capable of boredom. A theme for a great poet would be God's boredom on the seventh day of creation.

author: Malcolm de Chazal
title: Our expression and our words never coincide, which is why the animals don't understand us.''

author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
title: People's hearts are like wild animals. They attach their selves to those that love and train them.

author: Bea Arthur
title: PETA has a proven track record of success. Each victory PETA wins for the animals is a stepping stone upon which we build a more compassionate world for all beings - and we will never give up our fight until all animals are treated with respect and kindness.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Rare virtues are like rare plants or animals, things that have not been able to hold their own in the world. A virtue to be serviceable must, like gold, be alloyed with some commoner but more durable metal.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Sadder than destitution, sadder than a beggar is the man who eats alone in public. Nothing more contradicts the laws of man or beast, for animals always do each other the honor of sharing or disputing each other's food.

author: Leonard Cohen
title: Seven to eleven is a huge chunk of life, full of dulling and forgetting. It is fabled that we slowly lose the gift of speech with animals, that birds no longer visit our windowsills to converse. As our eyes grow accustomed to sight they armor themselves against wonder.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Sexual freedom, sexual liberation. A modern delusion. We are hierarchical animals. Sweep one hierarchy away, and another will take its place, perhaps less palatable than the first.

author: Alice Walker
title: The animals of the world exist for their own reasons. They were not made for humans any more than black people were made for white, or women created for men.

author: James Thurber
title: The animals that depend on instinct have an inherent knowledge of the laws of economics and of how to apply them; Man, with his powers of reason, has reduced economics to the level of a farce which is at once funnier and more tragic than Tobacco Road.

author: Asa Gray
title: The best opinion now is, that there are multitudinous forms which are not sufficiently differentiated to be distinctively either plant or animal, while, as respects ordinary plants and animals, the difficulty of laying down a definition has become far greater than ever before.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: The best thing about animals is they don't talk much.

author: W. H. Auden
title: The countenances of children, like those of animals, are masks, not faces, for they have not yet developed a significant profile of their own.

author: Sir William Osler
title: The desire to take medicine is perhaps the greatest feature which distinguishes man from animals.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title:
The greatness of a nation can be judged by the way its animals are treated.,
,
,

author: Adam Smith
title: The propensity to truck, barter and exchange one thing for another is common to all men, and to be found in no other race of animals.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The theoretical understanding of the world, which is the aim of philosophy, is not a matter of great practical importance to animals, or to savages, or even to most civilized men.

author: Carl Sagan
title: The uniqueness of humans has been claimed on many grounds, but most often because of our tool-making, culture, language, reason and morality. We have them, the other animals don't, and - so the argument goes - that's that.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: There is nothing worse than an idle hour, with no occupation offering. People who have many such hours are simply animals waiting docilely for death. We all come to that state soon or late. It is the curse of senility.

author: Benito Mussolini
title: This is the epitaph I want on my tomb: Here lies one of the most intelligent animals who ever appeared on the face of the Earth.

author: Edwin Way Teale
title: Those who wish to pet and baby wild animals, ''love'' them. But those who respect their natures and wish to let them live normal lives, love them more.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Though our conduct seems so very different from that of the higher animals, the primary instincts are much alike in them and in us.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: To err is human also in so far as animals seldom or never err, or at least only the cleverest of them do so.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: War is often described as a law of nature-this is not true: Among the lower animals, war is unknown.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: We are all victims of the violence that animals suffer... their liberation is also our liberation.

author: John Steinbeck
title: We are lonesome animals. We spend all our life trying to be less lonesome. One of our ancient methods is to tell a story begging the listener to say - and to feel - ''Yes, that's the way it is, or at least that's the way I feel it. You're not as alone as you thought.''

author: Stephen Covey
title: We are not animals. We are not a product of what has happened to us in our past. We have the power of choice.,

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: We have abolished the death penalty for humans, so why should it continue for animals?

author: Arnold Toynbee
title: We have been God-like in our planned breeding of our domesticated plants and animals, but we have been rabbit-like in our unplanned breeding of ourselves.

author: Bruce Cameron
title: We have enforced a Darwinian process on wolves, turning them into the shy and elusive animals they've become. They didn't have that fear of us 30,000 years ago. We didn't have gunpowder; we had rocks. Wolves would have seen us as lunch, and we were weak and slow and tasty.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: We're animals. We're born like every other mammal and we live our whole lives around disguised animal thoughts.

author: William Golding
title: What are we? Humans? Or animals? Or savages?

author: James A. Froude
title: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.

author: Bryan Fuller
title: With land-roaming animals, I've just read so much about the sophistication of their emotional lives and their intelligence and the way they process information that betrays a greater intelligence.

author: Bernadette Peters
title: Working on behalf of companion animals is so important. We start to realize how healing they are.

author: author
title: title

author: Charles Swindoll
title: Attitude is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than what people do or say. It is more important than appearance, giftedness, or skill.

author: Ben Johnston
title: Commerce is one of the daughters of Fortune, inconsistent and deceitful as her mother. she chooses her residence where she is least expected, and shifts her home when in appearance she seems firmly settled.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Every fact is related on one side to sensation, and, on the other, to morals. The game of thought is, on the appearance of one of these two sides, to find the other; given the upper, to find the under side.

author: Henry Fielding
title: Fashion is the science of appearance, and it inspires one with the desire to seem rather than to be.

author: Plato
title: First appearance deceives many.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: It is only in appearance that time is a river. It is a vast landscape and it is the eye of the beholder that moves.

author: Iris Murdoch
title: A good man often appears gauche simply because he does not take advantage of the myriad mean little chances of making himself look stylish. Preferring truth to form, he is not constantly at work upon the façade of his appearance.

author: Thomas Paine
title: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong, gives it a superficial appearance of being right, and raises at first a formidable outcry in defense of custom. But the tumult soon subsides. Time makes more converts than reason.

author: Aristotle
title: A tyrant must put on the appearance of uncommon devotion to religion. Subjects are less apprehensive of illegal treatment from a ruler whom they consider god-fearing and pious. On the other hand, they do less easily move against him, believing that he has the gods on his side.

author: Alec Guinness
title: An actor is totally vulnerable. His total personality is exposed to critical judgment - his intellect, his bearing, his diction, his whole appearance. In short, his ego.

author: Ann Bancroft
title: And then there's also this element of - some people would describe it as spirits or a presence that appears when things are very difficult, physically and emotionally. You know, when you're really putting out. So the third man aura is sort of an appearance. It's the yeti.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: Appearance rules the world.

author: Andy Goldsworthy
title: As with all my work, whether it's a leaf on a rock or ice on a rock, I'm trying to get beneath the surface appearance of things. Working the surface of a stone is an attempt to understand the internal energy of the stone.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: At their first appearance innovators have always been derided as fools and mad men.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Beauty is a primeval phenomenon, which itself never makes its appearance, but the reflection of which is visible in a thousand different utterances of the creative mind, and is as various as nature herself.

author: Jean de la Fontaine
title: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.

author: Andrew Vachss
title: Building a mechanical device for its appearance is like putting lace on a bowling ball.

author: Michel Foucault
title: Chance does not speak essentially through words nor can it be seen in their convolution. It is the eruption of language, its sudden appearance. It's not a night twinkle with stars, an illuminated sleep, nor a drowsy vigil. It is the very edge of consciousness.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Don't judge men's wealth or godliness by their Sunday appearance.

author: John Cage
title: Food, one assumes, provides nourishment; but Americans eat it fully aware that small amounts of poison have been added to improve its appearance and delay its putrefaction.

author: Bridget Riley
title: For me nature is not a landscape, but the dynamism of visual forces - an event rather than an appearance.

author: William Hazlitt
title: Gallantry to women - the sure road to their favor - is nothing but the appearance of extreme devotion to all their wants and wishes, a delight in their satisfaction, and a confidence in yourself as being able to contribute toward it.

author: Berthold Auerbach
title: Good and stupid, is a common saying. I have found that only the judicious are really good. Only clever men know what is good for others; and at the first appearance of disadvantage to himself, the stupid man deserts.

author: Augustus Baldwin Longstreet
title: He was a horse of goodly countenance, rather expressive of vigilance than fire; though an unnatural appearance of fierceness was thrown into it by the loss of his ears, which had been cropped pretty close to his head.

author: Kate Millet
title: However muted its present appearance may be, sexual dominion obtains nevertheless as perhaps the most pervasive ideology of our culture and provides its most fundamental concept of power.

author: Anne Tyler
title: I do write long, long character notes - family background, history, details of appearance - much more than will ever appear in the novel. I think this is what lifts a book from that early calculated, artificial stage.

author: Jean Rostand
title: I think I am one of those who can manage not to take on a completely different appearance under their own glance.

author: Bill Goldberg
title: I'm going to make an appearance in professional wrestling, but it won't be for the WWE. If I put wrestling boots and wrestling trunks on one last time - and I'm going to - it's going to be done by me and me only.

author: Brene Brown
title: If I feel good about my parenting, I have no interest in judging other people's choices. If I feel good about my body, I don't go around making fun of other people's weight or appearance. We're hard on each other because we're using each other as a launching pad out of our own perceived deficiency.

author: Andre Weil
title: Intuition makes much of it; I mean by this the faculty of seeing a connection between things that in appearance are completely different; it does not fail to lead us astray quite often.

author: Hannah Arendt
title: It is in the very nature of things human that every act that has once made its appearance and has been recorded in the history of mankind stays with mankind as a potentiality long after its actuality has become a thing of the past.

author: Aristotle
title: It is not once nor twice but times without number that the same ideas make their appearance in the world.

author: Andrew Cohen
title: It is true that women tend to be more identified with their bodies because in this crazy world, both men and women measure women's value as human beings in relationship to their physical appearance.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: Kindness and friendliness become aspects of personalized service or of public relations of big firms, rationalized to further the sale of something. With anonymous insincerity, the Successful Person thus makes an instrument of his own appearance and personality.

author: Robert South
title: Most of the appearance of mirth in the world is not mirth, it is art. The wounded spirit is not seen, but walks under a disguise.

author: Ovid
title: Neglect of appearance becomes men.

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: No one is so miserable as the poor person who maintains the appearance of wealth.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Our new Constitution is now established, and has an appearance that promises permanency; but in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.

author: Alice Walker
title: People do not wish to appear foolish; to avoid the appearance of foolishness, they are willing to remain actually fools.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: So different are the colors of life, as we look forward to the future, or backward to the past; and so different the opinions and sentiments which this contrariety of appearance naturally produces, that the conversation of the old and young ends generally with contempt or pity on either side.

author: Brendan Dooling
title: Society puts so much emphasis on outer appearance, but being confident in yourself and not letting others' opinions affect you is pretty amazing.

author: Aristotle
title: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

author: Charles Lamb
title: The beggar is the only person in the universe not obliged to study appearance.

author: Michael Korda
title: The biggest fool in the world is he who merely does his work supremely well, without attending to appearance.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The biggest problem with every art is by the use of appearance to create a loftier reality.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The discovery of truth is prevented more effectively, not by the false appearance things present and which mislead into error, not directly by weakness of the reasoning powers, but by preconceived opinion, by prejudice.

author: Bobbi Brown
title: The easiest ways to improve your appearance is with a really good moisturizer that will plump up your skin, a bit of concealer and a creamy blush on your cheek and lip. It's quick and easy and you'll look so much better.

author: Adele
title: The focus on my appearance has really surprised me. I've always been a size 14 to 16, I don't care about clothes, I'd rather spend my money on cigarettes and booze.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The highest problem of any art is to cause by appearance the illusion of a higher reality.

author: Fran Lebowitz
title: The most common error made in matters of appearance is the belief that one should disdain the superficial and let the true beauty of one's soul shine through. If there are places on your body where this is a possibility, you are not attractive - you are leaking.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: The non permanent appearance of happiness and distress, and their disappearance in due course, are like the appearance and disappearance of summer and winter seasons.

author: Ludwig Feuerbach
title: The present age prefers the sign to the thing signified, the copy to the original, fancy to reality, the appearance to the essence for in these days illusion only is sacred, truth profane.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The President has paid dear for his White House. It has commonly cost him all his peace, and the best of his manly attributes. To preserve for a short time so conspicuous an appearance before the world, he is content to eat dust before the real masters who stand erect behind the throne.

author: Jessamyn West
title: The tragedy of our time is that we are so eye centered, so appearance besotted.

author: Albert Einstein
title: There is no logical way to the discovery of these elemental laws. There is only the way of intuition, which is helped by a feeling for the order lying behind the appearance.

author: Plato
title: Things are not always what they seem; the first appearance deceives many; the intelligence of a few perceives what has been carefully hidden.

author: Thomas J. Watson
title: THINK. Think about your appearance, associations, actions, ambitions, accomplishment.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Truth - An ingenious compound of desirability and appearance.

author: Henry Fielding
title: We endeavor to avoid censure by concealing our Vices under an Appearance of their opposite Virtues

author: Aesop
title: We should look to the mind, and not to the outward appearance.

author: Campbell Brown
title: When Wolf Blitzer wears a not-so-great tie, how much e-mail do you think he gets? My point is, for women, unfortunately, appearance is part of the job.

author: David Hume
title: Where ambition can cover its enterprises, even to the person himself, under the appearance of principle, it is the most incurable and inflexible of passions.

author: Campbell Brown
title: Women get scrutinized based on appearance far more than men. And look, I speak from experience here. When I wear a bad outfit on the air, I get viewer e-mail complaining about it. A lot of e-mail. Seriously.

author: author
title: title

author: George Santayana
title: Advertising is the modern substitute for argument; its function is to make the worse appear the better.

author: William E. Gladstone
title: Men are apt to mistake the strength of their feeling for the strength of their argument. The heated mind resents the chill touch and relentless scrutiny of logic.

author: Jean de la Fontaine
title: The argument of the strongest is always the best.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
title: Anyone who conducts an argument by appealing to authority is not using his intelligence; he is just using his memory.

author: Janet Frame
title: ''For your own good'' is a persuasive argument that will eventually make a man agree to his own destruction.

author: Angela Carter
title: A day without an argument is like an egg without salt.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: A strong argument for the religion of Christ is this - that offences against Charity are about the only ones which men on their death-beds can be made - not to understand - but to feel - as crime.

author: Rebecca West
title: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: Argument, as usually managed, is the worst sort of conversation, as in books it is generally the worst sort of reading.

author: Carl Jung
title: As the animus is partial to argument, he can best be seen at work in disputes where both parties know they are right. Men can argue in a very womanish way, too, when they are anima - possessed and have thus been transformed into the animus of their own anima.

author: Louis D. Brandeis
title: Behind every argument is someone's ignorance.

author: Charles Simmons
title: Bigotry and intolerance, silenced by argument, endeavors to silence by persecution, in old days by fire and sword, in modern days by the tongue.

author: Alistair Cooke
title: Curiosity ... endows the people who have it with a generosity in argument and a serenity in their own mode of life which springs from their cheerful willingness to let life take the form it will.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Don't take the wrong side of an argument just because your opponent has taken the right side.

author: George Sand
title: Faith is an excitement and an enthusiasm: it is a condition of intellectual magnificence to which we must cling as to a treasure, and not squander on our way through life in the small coin of empty words, or in exact and priggish argument.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Feminist anti-porn discourse virtually always ignores the gigantic gay male porn industry, since any mention of the latter would bring crashing to the ground the absurd argument that pornography is by definition the subordination of women.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: He who establishes his argument by noise and command shows that his reason is weak.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: He who wants to persuade should put his trust not in the right argument, but in the right word. The power of sound has always been greater than the power of sense.

author: Bob Rae
title: History has only ended for those caught inside the Marxist hothouse. For the rest of us the argument is just getting interesting.

author: Margaret Thatcher
title: I always cheer up immensely if an attack is particularly wounding because I think, well, if they attack one personally, it means they have not a single political argument left.

author: Dave Barry
title: I can win an argument on any topic, against any opponent. People know this, and steer clear of me at parties. Often, as a sign of their great respect, they don't even invite me.

author: Anthony Holden
title: I don't accept at all the quite popular argument that the press is responsible for the monarchy's recent troubles. The monarchy's responsible for the monarchy's recent troubles. To blame the press is the old thing of blaming the messenger for the message.

author: Victor Serge
title: I followed his argument with the blank uneasiness which one might feel in the presence of a logical lunatic.

author: Iain Banks
title: I just think people overvalue argument because they like to hear themselves talk.

author: Alain de Botton
title: I passionately believe that's it's not just what you say that counts, it's also how you say it - that the success of your argument critically depends on your manner of presenting it.

author: John Bright
title: If this phrase of the ''balance of power'' is to be always an argument for war, the pretext for war will never be wanting, and peace can never be secure.

author: Matthew Prior
title: In argument similes are like songs in love; they describe much, but prove nothing.

author: Walter Savage Landor
title: In argument, truth always prevails finally; in politics, falsehood always.

author: William G. McAdoo
title: It is impossible to defeat an ignorant man in argument.

author: Francis Beaumont
title: It is more noble by silence to avoid an injury than by argument to overcome it.

author: Al Sharpton
title: It is true that Mr. Lincoln signed the Emancipation Proclamation, after which there was a commitment to give 40 acres and a mule. That's where the argument, to this day, of reparations starts. We never got the 40 acres. We went all the way to Herbert Hoover, and we never got the 40 acres. We didn't get the mule. So we decided we'd ride this donkey as far as it would take us.

author: William Shakespeare
title: It would be argument for a week, laugter for a month, and a good jest for ever.

author: Daniel Webster
title: Keep cool; anger is not an argument.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Liberals are sometimes defined as people who can't take their own side in an argument.

author: Bobby Cox
title: Most umpires are good about letting the argument go, but you can only go on for so long, or go so far. If you don't leave it alone after a minute or two, you're in trouble. They want to keep the game moving, so they've got to throw you out. I had trouble leaving it alone, I guess.

author: Adam Clarke
title: Multitudes of words are neither an argument of clear ideas in the writer, nor a proper means of conveying clear notions to the reader.

author: Thomas Hardy
title: My argument is that war makes rattling good history; but peace is poor reading.

author: Bill Engvall
title: My wife and I had an argument last week that was so stupid, that it bears repeating. My wife collects twist ties...welcome to my world.

author: Omar Khayyam
title: Myself when young did eagerly frequent doctor and saint, and heard great argument about it and about: but evermore came out by the same door as in I went.

author: William Pitt
title: Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants; it is the creed of slaves.

author: Rufus Choate
title: Neither irony or sarcasm is argument.

author: Richard Whately
title: Never argue at the dinner table, for the one who is not hungry always gets the best of the argument.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: Never contend with one that is foolish, proud, positive, testy, or with a superior, or a clown, in matter of argument.

author: Jascha Heifetz
title: No matter what side of the argument you are on, you always find people on your side that you wish were on the other.

author: Marilyn Ferguson
title: No one can persuade another to change. Each of us guards a gate of change that can only be opened from the inside. We cannot open the gate of another, either by argument or emotional appeal.

author: George M. Adams
title: Note how good you feel after you have encouraged someone else. No other argument is necessary to suggest that never miss the opportunity to give encouragement.

author: Frederick Carl Frieseke
title: Now you can begin to see quite transparently that nothing purchased life is one of argument, If other people don't agree with you you're in big trouble. How far would you get in your work if nobody agreed that what you were doing had value?

author: Bob Beauprez
title: Obama and the Democrats' preposterous argument is that we are just one more big tax increase away from solving our economic problems. The inescapable conclusion, however, is that the primary driver of the short-term deficit is not tax cuts but the lack of any meaningful economic growth over the last half decade.

author: Thomas Hardy
title: Of course poets have morals and manners of their own, and custom is no argument with them.

author: Barack Obama
title: Part of the reason that our politics seems so tough right now and facts and science and argument does not seem to be winning the day all the time is because we're hardwired not to always think clearly when we're scared. And the country's scared.

author: Will Rogers
title: People's minds are changed through observation and not through argument.,

author: Daniel Webster
title: Philosophic argument, especially that drawn from the vastness of the universe, in comparison with the apparent insignificance of this globe, has sometimes shaken my reason for the faith that is in me; but my heart has always assured and reassured me that

author: Daniel Webster
title: Philosophical argument has sometimes shaken my reason for the faith that was in me; but my heart has always assured me that the Gospel of Jesus Christ must be reality.

author: Hosea Ballou
title: Preaching is to much avail, but practice is far more effective. A godly life is the strongest argument you can offer the skeptic.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Prejudice not being funded on reason cannot be removed by argument.

author: Aristophanes
title: Shrines! Shrines! Surely you don't believe in the gods. What's your argument? Where's your proof?

author: Che Guevara
title: Silence is argument carried out by other means.

author: Jane Austen
title: Single women have a dreadful propensity for being poor. Which is one very strong argument in favor of matrimony.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Sir, I have found you an argument; but I am not obliged to find you an understanding.

author: Joseph Joubert
title: The aim of argument, or of discussion, should not be victory, but progress.

author: Andrea Dworkin
title: The argument between wives and whores is an old one; each one thinking that whatever she is, at least she is not the other.

author: Bruno Maag
title: The argument that a serif font is too fussy doesn't cut it anymore. You want a font where the letter forms are not ambiguous.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: The argument that gay marriage doesn't affect straight marriages is a ridiculous red herring: Gay marriage affects society and law in dramatic ways. Religious groups will come under direct assault as federal and state governments move to strip them of their non-profit statuses if they refuse to perform gay marriages.

author: Noam Chomsky
title: The argument that resistance to the war should remain strictly nonviolent seems to me overwhelming.,

author: Carroll Quigley
title: The argument that the two parties should represent opposed ideals and policies, one, perhaps, of the Right and the other of the Left, is a foolish idea acceptable only to doctrinaire and academic thinkers.

author: Winston Churchill
title: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.

author: William James
title: The best argument I know for an immortal life is the existence of a man who deserves one.

author: Lord Quintin Hogg Hailsham
title: The best way I know of to win an argument is to start by being in the right.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title:
The common argument that crime is caused by poverty is a kind of slander on the poor.,
,

author: André Maurois
title: The difficult part in an argument is not to defend one's opinion, but rather to know it.

author: André Maurois
title: The difficult part in an argument is not to defend one's opinion, but rather to know it.

author: Constantin Brancusi
title: The function of art is to make that understood which in the form of argument would be incomprehensible.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The irrationality of a thing is no argument against its existence, rather a condition of it.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: The Left masks its distaste for the Bible's condemnation of homosexuality in a straw man argument that Bible believers are violent bigots. They are not. Citing the Bible doesn't make you a bigot against human beings - it makes you a bigot against sin, which is a good thing.

author: Barry Eisler
title: The most important guideline when it comes to argument is the golden rule. If someone were addressing your point, what tone, what overall approach would you find persuasive and want her to use? Whatever that is, do it yourself.

author: Sidney J. Harris
title: The most important thing in an argument, next to being right, is to leave an escape hatch for your opponent, so that he can gracefully swing over to your side without too much apparent loss of face.

author: Bill Dedman
title: The Obama administration is fighting to block access to names of visitors to the White House, taking up the Bush administration argument that a president doesn't have to reveal who comes calling to influence policy decisions.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: The sounder your argument, the more satisfaction you get out of it.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: The soundest argument will produce no more conviction in an empty head than the most superficial declamation, as a feather and a guinea fall with equel velocity in a vacuum.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The thing I hate about an argument is that it always interrupts a discussion.

author: Frederick the Great
title: The truth is always the strongest argument. Sophocles Truth is a thing immortal and perpetual, and it gives to us a beauty that fades not away in time.

author: Carl Sagan
title: The uniqueness of humans has been claimed on many grounds, but most often because of our tool-making, culture, language, reason and morality. We have them, the other animals don't, and - so the argument goes - that's that.

author: Douglas Jerrold
title: There are some people as obtuse in recognizing an argument as they are in appreciating wit. You couldn't drive it into their heads with a hammer.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: There is no good arguing with the inevitable. The only argument available with an east wind is to put on your overcoat.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: There is no good in arguing with the inevitable. The only argument available with an east wind is to put on your overcoat.

author: Cat Stevens
title: There's been this argument about Coldplay stealing this melody from Joe Satriani, but, if you listen to it, it's mine! It's the 'Foreigner Suite,' it is!

author: Bruno Schulz
title: Theses officers were good friends, so it must have been a terrible argument, because the one who played chess with my father was so angry that he walked over to the dentist's house and got the dentist out of bed and shot him.

author: Barbara Deming
title: This is the heart of my argument: We can put more pressure on the antagonist for whom we show human concern.

author: John Tillotson
title: To be able to bear provocation is an argument of great reason, and to forgive it of a great mind.''

author: Al Franken
title: To make the argument that the media has a left- or right-wing, or a liberal or a conservative bias, is like asking if the problem with Al-Qaeda is do they use too much oil in their hummus.

author: Sophocles
title: Truth is always the strongest argument.

author: John Galsworthy
title: We are all familiar with the argument: `make war dreadful enough, and there will be no war'. And none of us believes it.

author: Barry Schwartz
