title: title

author: Philip Adams
title: It seems to me that people have vast potential. Most people can do extraordinary things if they have the confidence or take the risks. Yet most people don't. They sit in front of the telly and treat life as if it goes on forever.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Action is a great restorer and builder of confidence. Inaction is not only the result, but the cause, of fear. Perhaps the action you take will be successful; perhaps different action or adjustments will have to follow. But any action is better than no action at all.

author: George Washington
title: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence. True friendship is a plant of slow growth, and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.

author: Ann Landers
title: Class is an aura of confidence that is being sure without being cocky. Class has nothing to do with money. Class never runs scared. It is self-discipline and self-knowledge. It's the sure footedness that comes with having proved you can meet life.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Confidence in another person's virtue is no light evidence of your own.

author: Tom Landry
title: I don't believe in team motivation. I believe in getting a team prepared so it knows it will have the necessary confidence when it steps on a field and be prepared to play a good game.

author: Leib Lazarow
title: Who has confidence in himself will gain the confidene of others.

author: Michael J. Gelb
title: ... by stretching yourself beyond your perceived level of confidence you accelerate your development of competence.

author: Bela Karolyi
title: A good 80 percent of the vault is still physical and another percentage of it, 20, 25 percent is mental. Mental is always the mental strength, the confidence building up to that contest or repetition, practice, practice, and practice.

author: Henrik Ibsen
title: A marriage based on full confidence, based on complete and unqualified frankness on both sides; they are not keeping anything back; there's no deception underneath it all. If I might so put it, it's an agreement for the mutual forgiveness of sin.

author: Charles Dickens
title: Accidents will occur in the best-regulated families; and in families not regulated by that pervading influence which sanctifies while it enhances... in short, by the influence of Woman, in the lofty character of Wife, they may be expected with confidence, and must be borne with philosophy.

author: Mark Twain
title: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then Success is sure.

author: Ann Macbeth
title: Any new producer starting up is to get investors' confidence. Investors are still very very wary of anything to do with the arts world.

author: Truman Capote
title: Anyone who ever gave you confidence, you owe them a lot.

author: Malcolm X
title: Armed with the knowledge of our past, we can with confidence charter a course for our future. Culture is an indispensable weapon in the freedom struggle. We must take hold of it and forge the future with the past.

author: William Hazlitt
title: As is our confidence, so is our capacity.

author: Bruce Lee
title: As long as I can remember I feel I have had this great creative and spiritual force within me that is greater than faith, greater than ambition, greater than confidence, greater than determination, greater than vision. It is all these combined. My brain becomes magnetized with this dominating force which I hold in my hand.

author: Bill Hybels
title: As you walk with God, your faith will grow, your confidence will increase and your prayers will have real power.

author: Arsene Wenger
title: At a young age winning is not the most important thing... the important thing is to develop creative and skilled players with good confidence.

author: Baltasar Gracián
title: Attempt easy tasks as if they were difficult, and difficult as if they were easy; in the one case that confidence may not fall asleep, in the other that it may not be dismayed.

author: Ben Bernanke
title: Banks will have to win the confidence of their customers through fair dealing, making good loans, and remaining financially healthy.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.

author: Joe Paterno
title: Besides pride, loyalty, discipline, heart, and mind, confidence is the key to all the locks.

author: Johnny Unitas
title: Conceit is bragging about yourself. Confidence means you believe you can get the job done.

author: Arnold Palmer
title: Concentration comes out of a combination of confidence and hunger.

author: Arnold Palmer
title: Concentration, Confidence, Competitive urge, Capacity for enjoyment.

author: Roger Staubach
title: Confidence doesn't come out of nowhere. It's a result of something... hours and days and weeks and years of constant work and dedication.

author: William Pitt
title: Confidence is a plant of slow growth in an aged heart.

author: Joe Montana
title: Confidence is a very fragile thing.

author: Michael O'Brien
title: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks in great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: Confidence is the bond of friendship.

author: Mary O'Hare Dumas
title: Confidence is the hinge on the door to success.

author: Jack Nicklaus
title: Confidence is the most important single factor in this game, and no matter how great your natural talent, there is only one way to obtain and sustain it: work.

author: Roger Staubach
title: Confidence is the result of hours and days and weeks and years of constant work and dedication.

author: Og Mandino
title: Count your blessings. Once you realize how valuable you are and how much you have going for you, the smiles will return, the sun will break out, the music will play, and you will finally be able to move forward the life that God intended for you with grace, strength, courage, and confidence.

author: Aristotle
title: Courage is a mean with regard to fear and confidence.

author: Pierre Corneille
title: Danger breeds best on too much confidence.

author: Beth Simone Noveck
title: Democratic elections alone do not remedy the crisis of confidence in government. Moreover, there is no viable justification for a democratic system in which public participation is limited to voting.

author: Lord Stirling William Alexander
title: Despair and confidence both banish fear.

author: Bobby Davro
title: Despite my confidence and self-belief, I've always wrestled with feelings of insecurity. To be honest, I think most people in show business are insecure.

author: Robert C. Edwards
title: Don't place too much confidence in the man who boasts of being as honest as the day is long. Wait until you meet him at night.

author: Brooke Shields
title: Eight shows a week is daunting, and it can be terrifying. But it just instills such a sense of confidence and growth.

author: Janet Malcolm
title: Every journalist who is not too stupid or too full of himself to notice what is going on knows that what he does is morally indefensible. He is a kind of confidence man, preying on people's vanity, ignorance, or loneliness, gaining their trust and betraying them without remorse.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Every man who attacks my belief, diminishes in some degree my confidence in it, and therefore makes me uneasy; and I am angry with him who makes me uneasy.

author: Alice Walker
title: Every small positive change we make in ourselves repays us in confidence in the future.

author: Mark Twain
title: Everything you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.

author: Stan Smith
title: Experience tells you what to do; confidence allows you to do it.

author: Martin Luther
title: Faith is a living, daring confidence in God's grace, so sure and certain that a man could stake his life on it a thousand times.

author: Oswald Chambers
title: Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.

author: Robert Collier
title: Faith is the confidence, the assurance, the enforcing truth, the knowing...

author: William Hazlitt
title: Gallantry to women - the sure road to their favor - is nothing but the appearance of extreme devotion to all their wants and wishes, a delight in their satisfaction, and a confidence in yourself as being able to contribute toward it.

author: Kofi Annan
title: Gather the five virtues (Dignity, Confidence, Courage, Compassion, and Faith). Then you are a man.

author: Bill Goldberg
title: Go empower yourself. You need confidence because the one thing that bullying does is it belittles you, and it takes away your confidence, and nobody deserves that.

author: Kofi Annan
title: Have confidence in the young people, give them a chance, and they will surprise you.

author: David Storey
title: Have confidence that if you have done a little thing well, you can do a bigger thing well too.

author: John Paul II
title: Have no fear of moving into the unknown. Simply step out fearlessly knowing that I am with you, therefore no harm can befall you; all is very, very well. Do this in complete faith and confidence.

author: Thomas A. Bennett
title: Having once decided to achieve a certain task, achieve it at all costs of tedium and distaste. The gain in self confidence of having accomplished a tiresome labor is immense.

author: Bram Stoker
title: He seemed so confident that I, remembering my own confidence two nights before and with the baneful result, felt awe and vague terror. It must have been my weakness that made me hesitate to tell it to my friend, but I felt it all the more, like unshed tears.

author: B. C. Forbes
title: He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.

author: Mary Kay Ash
title: Honesty is the cornerstone of all success, without which confidence and ability to perform shall cease to exist.

author: Erik H. Erikson
title: Hope is both the earliest and the most indispensable virtue inherent in the state of being alive. If life is to be sustained hope must remain, even where confidence is wounded, trust impaired.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: How much greater confidence has an advocate, retained with a large fee, in the justice of his cause! How much better does his bold manner make his case appear to the judges, deceived as they are by appearances! How ludicrous is reason, blown with a breath in every direction!

author: Bernard Beckett
title: Human spirit is the ability to face the uncertainty of the future with curiosity and optimism. It is the belief that problems can be solved, differences resolved. It is a type of confidence. And it is fragile. It can be blackened by fear and superstition.

author: Ann Veneman
title: I also believe that it's the right thing to do, to maintain strong consumer confidence in our food systems. And I believe that the consumer should have strong confidence in our food systems.

author: Johnny Unitas
title: I always thought I could play pro ball. I had confidence in my ability, You have to. If you don't who will?

author: Arsenio Hall
title: I am consumed with the fear of failing. Reaching deep down and finding confidence has made all my dreams come true.

author: Bryan Greenberg
title: I become a better actor after I step on a stage in front of, like, 500 people when it's just me, a microphone and my guitar. You don't get as nervous walking into a room in front of 3 or 4 people and to do a scene or to walk on a set. You gain confidence.

author: Barbara Jordan
title: I have confidence that we can form this kind of national community.

author: Mark Twain
title: I have not a particle of confidence in a man who has no redeeming vices.

author: Atom Egoyan
title: I mean, if you are directing actors to do one thing and then directing them to do something else entirely because the one thing you wanted them to do may not work, then you are just shattering their confidence in the project.

author: Angela Merkel
title: I see nothing that points to a recession in Germany. But I see considerable long-term tasks ahead of us that have to do with markets regaining confidence in Europe and that have a lot to do with reducing debt.

author: Doug McLeod
title: I still say a church steeple with a lightening rod on top shows a lack of confidence.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: I suggest that going to Mars means permanence on the planet - a mission by which we are building up a confidence level to become a two-planet species.

author: Adnan Pachachi
title: I think people are rapidly losing confidence in the political class, and I don't blame them.

author: Alex Morrison
title: I think they do have to get it right in Sierra Leone. There has to be something in there now to establish confidence, to stabilize the situation, and then to move to some sort of political negotiations.

author: Anna Freud
title: I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence but it comes from within. It is there all the time.

author: Bruce Willis
title: I've always had confidence. Before I was famous, that confidence got me into trouble. After I got famous, it just got me into more trouble.

author: Eddie Murphy
title: I've always had confidence. It came because I have lots of initiative. I wanted to make something of myself.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: If a man has been his mother's undisputed darling he retains throughout life the triumphant feeling, the confidence in success, which not seldom brings actual success along with it.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: If once you forfeit the confidence of your fellow-citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem.

author: Fjodor M. Dostojewski
title: If you like a man's laugh before you know anything of him, you may say with confidence that he is a good man.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: If you once forfeit the confidence of your fellow citizens, you can never regain their respect and esteem.

author: Bud Grant
title: If you're a coach, you've got to have a lot of confidence in what you're doing. Your egos are so large that you know it all anyway if you're a coach.

author: Babe Paley
title: In all things preserve integrity; and the consciousness of thine own uprightness will alleviate the toil of business, soften the hardness of ill-success and disappointments, and give thee an humble confidence before God, when the ingratitude of man, or the iniquity of the times may rob thee of other rewards.

author: St. John of the Cross
title: In tribulation immediately draw near to God with confidence, and you will receive strength, enlightenment, and instruction.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage. If you want to conquer fear, do not sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.

author: Arthur Eddington
title: It is also a good rule not to put overmuch confidence in the observational results that are put forward until they are confirmed by theory.

author: John Malkovich
title: It's not a field, I think, for people who need to have success every day: if you can't live with a nightly sort of disaster, you should get out. I wouldn't describe myself as lacking in confidence, but I would just say that the ghosts you chase you never catch.

author: John Wesley
title: Justifying faith implies, not only a divine evidence or conviction that ''God was in Christ, reconciling the world unto Himself,'' but a sure trust and confidence that Christ died for my sins, that He loved me and gave Himself for me.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.

author: Bill Simmons
title: Leaders thrive when they feel creatively empowered, when they trust the people around them, when their confidence is swelling. Leaders make mistakes when they lose that same confidence, when they're fretting about their power base, when they're reacting instead of acting.

author: Tom Landry
title: Leadership is a matter of having people look at you and gain confidence, seeing how you react. If you're in control, they're in control.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Life for both sexes is arduous, difficult, a perpetual struggle. More than anything... it calls for confidence in oneself...And how can we generate this imponderable quality most quickly? By thinking that other people are inferior to oneself.

author: Ben Bernanke
title: Long term, I have a lot of confidence in the United States. We have an excellent record in terms of innovation. We have great universities that are involved in technological change and progress. We have an entrepreneurial culture, much more than almost any other country.

author: Ann Landers
title: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.

author: Alfred Jodl
title: My most profound confidence is however based upon the fact that at the head of Germany there stands a man by his entire development, his desires, and striving can only have been destined by fate to lead our people into a brighter future.

author: Barbara Corcoran
title: My mother is an amazing woman. Not only did she manage the entire household, she noticed a gift in each of her kids and instilled confidence in all of us that that gift would take us wherever we wanted to go.

author: Julius Charles Hare
title: Never put much confidence in such as put no confidence in others. A man prone to suspect evil is mostly looking in his neighbour for what he sees in himself. As to the pure all things are pure, even so to the impure all things are impure.

author: J. C. Hare
title: Never put much confidence in such, as put no confidence in others. A man prone to suspect evil is mostly looking in his neighbor for what he sees in himself. As to the pure all things are pure, even so to the impure all things are impure.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Never, my dear Sir, do you take it into your head that I do not love you; you may settle yourself in full confidence both of my love and my esteem; I love you as a kind man, I value you as a worthy man, and hope in time to reverence you as a man of exemplary piety.

author: Franklin P. Adams
title: Ninety-two percent of the stuff told you in confidence you couldn't get anyone else to listen to.

author: Ansel Adams
title: No man has the right to dictate what other men should perceive, create or produce, but all should be encouraged to reveal themselves, their perceptions and emotions, and to build confidence in the creative spirit.

author: Bruce Schneier
title: No one can duplicate the confidence that RSA offers after 20 years of cryptanalytic review.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: On the death of a friend, we should consider that the fates through confidence have devolved on us the task of a double living, that we have henceforth to fulfill the promise of our friend's life also, in our own, to the world.

author: Helen Keller
title: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.

author: Baruch Spinoza

author: Ovid

title: People die of fright and live of confidence.

author: Ben Carson

author: Bill Buford
title: Since 1890, the Tour d'Argent's basic recipe hasn't changed. author: George Herbert
title: Skill and confidence are an unconquered army.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: Sports nurtures dreams of achieving self confidence and masculine striving for the skinny kid watching a boxer dance around the ring with sublime ease.

author: Ben Jonson

author: Lady Blessington

title: The Achilles Heel of the Americas was the lack of cultural confidence typical of new settlers.

author: John F. Kennedy

author: Henry Ford

title: The notion of a universality of human experience is a confidence trick and the notion of a universality of female experience is a clever confidence trick.

author: Mark Twain

title: We could have waited for a donor to appear, but we believe in the spirit of self-development and confidence. We are not so poor that we are unable to carry out this project.

title: Who is a professional? A professional is someone who has a combination of competence, confidence and belief. A water diviner is a professional. A traditional midwife is a professional. author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Who is sure of their own motives can in confidence advance or retreat.

title: title

author: Edmund Burke
title: He that wrestles with us strengthens our nerves, and sharpens our skill. Our antagonist is our helper. This amicable conflict with difficulty helps us to an intimate acquaintance with our object, and compels us to consider it in all its relations. It will not suffer us to be superficial.

title: A few of these interviews have gone slightly awry, because every now and again there has been the odd conflict of interest between interviews because of the Iron Maiden record, and I am a bit long-winded.

author: Robert Townsend
title: A good manager doesn't try to eliminate conflict; he tries to keep it from wasting the energies of his people. If you're the boss and your people fight you openly when they think that you are wrong - that's healthy.

author: Camille Paglia

title: America is a country that seems forever to be toddler or teenager, at those two stages of human development characterized by conflict between autonomy and security.

They raised their gaze in the face of conflict, believed in what America could be, and pushed forward.

author: Eldridge Cleaver
title: Americans think of themselves collectively as a huge rescue squad on twenty-four-hour call to any spot on the globe where dispute and conflict may erupt.

author: Bridget Riley
title: An artist's early work is inevitably made up of a mixture of tendencies and interests, some of which are compatible and some of which are in conflict.

author: Barbara Hepworth
title: At no point do I wish to be in conflict with any man or masculine thought. It doesn't enter my consciousness. Art is anonymous. It's not competitive with men. It's a complementary contribution.

title: But I believe that there are marriages where you can have your pool table and she can have her scrapbooking room or garden or whatever it is. But when everyone has what they want, it's not funny. There's no conflict.

title: Civilisation has ever accompanied emigration and conquest - the conflict of opinion, of religion, or of race.

title: Climate change, in some regions, has aggravated conflict over scarce land, and could well trigger large-scale migration in the decades ahead. author: Warren Mitchell
title: Comedy comes from conflict, from hatred.

author: Ernest Renan
title: Communism is in conflict with human nature.

author: Wayne Dyer
title:
Conflict cannot survive without your participation.,
,
,
,

author: Gordon B. Hinckley
title: Conflict grows out of ignorance and suspicion.,

title: Defence must be more adaptable, able to respond quickly to the changes in the security environment and the character of conflict.

author: Brent Scowcroft
title: Europeans are familiar with terrorism and violence. We have not experienced a true conflict on our soil in a hundred years, and especially not one that involved 3,000 dead.

author: John Jay Chapman
title: Everybody in America is soft, and hates conflict. The cure for this, both in politics and social life, is the same - hardihood. Give them raw truth.

author: Allen Tate
title: Experience means conflict, our natures being what they are, and conflict means drama.

author: Brent Scowcroft
title: First of all, I think the Saudis are deeply concerned about the collapse of negotiations between the Israelis and the Palestinians and the resumption of conflict.

title: From this vision of the role of the United Nations in the next century flow three key priorities for the future: eradicating poverty, preventing conflict and promoting democracy.

title: Heat and animosity, contest and conflict, may sharpen the wits, although they rarely do; they never strengthen the understanding, clear the perspicacity, guide the judgment, or improve the heart.

title: History shows that where ethics and economics come in conflict, victory is always with economics. Vested interests have never been known to have willingly divested themselves unless there was sufficient force to compel them.

title: I'm not sure why I'm so drawn to heroes who do bad things and to villains who think they're the good guys, but I do find that moral ambiguity and conflict makes for great characters.

title: If facts conflict with a theory, either the theory must be changed or the facts.

title: If work and leisure are soon to be subordinated to this one utopian principle - absolute busyness - then utopia and melancholy will come to coincide: an age without conflict will dawn, perpetually busy - and without consciousness.

author: Albert Low
title: Instead of suppressing conflicts, specific channels could be created to make this conflict explicit, and specific methods could be set up by which the conflict is resolved.

title: Laws are felt only when the individual comes into conflict with them.

author: William Mckinley
title: Let us ever remember that our interest is in concord, not in conflict; and that our real eminence rests in the victories of peace, not those of war.

author: Ariel Sharon
title: Like all Israelis, I yearn for peace. I see the utmost importance in taking all possible steps that will lead to a solution of the conflict with the Palestinians.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Mankind must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression, and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.

title: MSNBC policy requires journalists to report any potential conflict of interest and to seek approval from the president of NBC News before making any political contribution.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few.

author: Arthur Hays Sulzberger
title: News is so often a report of conflict, an account of problems, a thing of the day and even of the minute, that sometimes I think we make the background darker and the shadows deeper than they actually are.

author: Robert Lynd
title: No doubt there are other important things in life besides conflict, but there are not many things so inevitably interesting.

author: Andrew Bernstein
title: Nothing is given to man on earth - struggle is built into the nature of life, and conflict is possible - the hero is the man who lets no obstacle prevent him from pursuing the values he has chosen.

title: Once to every person and nation come the moment to decide. In the conflict of truth with falsehood, for the good or evil side.

author: Benjamin Watson
title: One of the biggest things we have to be able to do is to handle conflict and handle it correctly. We're able to look at our biases, look at our frustration, look at our sin in this area, our pride and our selfishness. It allows us to move forward.

title: One of the dreams of Zionism was to be a bridge. Instead, we are creating exclusion between the East and the West instead of creating bridges; we are contributing to the conflict between East and West by our stupid desire to have more.

author: Ronald Reagan
title: Peace is not the absence of conflict, but the ability to cope with conflict by peaceful means.

author: Gene Fowler
title: Perhaps no mightier conflict of mind occurs ever again in a lifetime than that first decision to unseat one's own tooth.

author: Kofi Annan
title: Poverty devastates families, communities and nations. It causes instability and political unrest and fuels conflict.

author: Bill Hybels
title: Prayer busters (causes of unanswered prayer) are prayerlessness, unconfessed sin, unresolved relational conflict, selfishness, uncaring attitudes, and inadequate faith.

author: Benjamin Netanyahu
title: President Abbas, you've dedicated your life to advancing the Palestinian cause. Must this conflict continue for generations, or will we enable our children and our grandchildren to speak in years ahead of how we found a way to end it? That's what we should aim for, and that's what I believe we can achieve.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: President Obama's biggest advocates believe that Americans are ready to embrace his vision for the United States: a less muscular America on the world stage, an America with a more controlling executive branch and less conflict in the legislative branch, an America in which the government takes care of us, be we Pajama Boys or Julias.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Republicans are for both the man and the dollar, but in case of conflict the man before the dollar.

author: Carlisle Floyd
title: Socially I never was an outsider. I have never thought of the conflict element before frankly, but perhaps it was wanting to belong, and at the same time wanting to retain one's own personality.

author: Anne Sophie Swetchine
title: Strength alone knows conflict, weakness is born vanquished.

author: Bayard Rustin
title: Surely, I must at all times attempt to obey the law of the state. But when the will of God and the will of the state conflict, I am compelled to follow the will of God.

author: Barbara Tuchman
title: That conflict between the reach for the divine and the lure of earthly things was to be the central problem of the Middle Ages.

author: Alain de Botton
title: The Arab-Israeli conflict is also in many ways a conflict about status: it's a war between two peoples who feel deeply humiliated by the other, who want the other to respect them. Battles over status can be even more intractable than those over land or water or oil.

author: Bruno Dumont
title: The battle between two men over a girl is the same as the fight for two men over a piece of land. It is all about desire. There is no difference between a love triangle and the conflict between Israel and Palestine.

author: Anna Lindh
title: The conflict in the Middle East needs to be solved for the same reasons. It is necessary to reach a two-states solution, built on international law, for sustainable peace and development, and it can only be achieved through joint efforts by the international community.

author: Arthur Henderson
title: The Disarmament Conference has become the focal point of a great struggle between anarchy and world order... between those who think in terms of inevitable armed conflict and those who seek to build a universal and durable peace.

author: Ignazio Silone
title: The final conflict will be between the Communists and the ex-Communists.

author: Thomas Paine
title: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.,

author: Martin Luther King
title: The hottest place in Hell is reserved for those who remain neutral in times of great moral conflict.

author: Clark Moustakas
title: The most dramatic conflicts are perhaps, those that take place not between men but between a man and himself - where the arena of conflict is a solitary mind.

author: Ariel Sharon
title: The ongoing conflict between us has caused heavy suffering to both peoples. The future can and must be different. Both our peoples are destined to live together side by side, on this small piece of land. This reality we cannot change.

author: Frederic Raphael
title: The party of God and the party of Literature have more in common than either will admit; their texts may conflict, but their bigotries coincide. Both insist on being the sole custodians of the true word and its only interpreters.

author: Ben Foster
title: The roles I'm interested in or have been interested in, you know, it's going to get down to conflict. Drama is conflict - conflict of interests.

author: Alfred Jarry
title: The theater, bringing impersonal masks to life, is only for those who are virile enough to create new life: either as a conflict of passions subtler than those we already know, or as a complete new character.

author: Bjorn Ulvaeus
title: The UN declaration on human rights must always be first in line before religion or other cultural habits, in case of any conflict between them.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: The very idea that there is some kind of conflict between science and religion is completely mistaken. Science is a method for investigating experience... Religion is the fundamental, necessary internalization of our system of more permanent values.

author: Aberjhani
title: The way out of the maze of whiteness and blackness that led inevitably, repeatedly, to violent conflict was through the simple recognition of and respect for blacks and whites as not two races but one: the human race.

author: Ramsey Clark
title: There is no conflict between liberty and safety. We will have both or neither.

author: Ari Fleischer
title: To avoid a military conflict, Saddam Hussein has no other choice than to leave the country.

author: Bobby Ghosh
title: To conflict journalists, a tiny, tight-knit tribe, tragedy is practically an occupational requirement: our work requires us to seek it out, measure it, contextualize it, and chronicle it.

author: Thomas Merton
title: To the truly humble man the ordinary ways and customs and habits of men are not a matter of conflict.

author: Bill Mollison
title: Type 1 Error: When we settle into wilderness, we are in conflict with so many life forms that we have to destroy them to exist. Keep out of the bush. It is already in good order.

author: Salman Rushdie
title: Vertigo is the conflict between the fear of falling and the desire to fall.

author: Anthony Eden
title: We are not at war with Egypt. We are in an armed conflict.

author: Jean Rostand
title: We are not naïve enough to ask for pure men; we ask merely for men whose impurity does not conflict with the obligations of their job.

author: Bruce Jackson
title: We entered the 20th century trying to deal with three ideas purporting to define or describe or explain three spheres of action, development and conflict: Darwin on the natural world, Freud on the internal world, Marx on the economic world.

author: Carl Honore
title: We know that no algorithm can solve global poverty; no pill can cure a chronic illness; no box of chocolates can mend a broken relationship; no educational DVD can transform a child into a baby Einstein; no drone strike can end a terrorist conflict. Sadly, there is no such thing as 'One Tip to a Flat Stomach.'

author: Simone Weil
title: What a country calls its vital economic interests are not the things which enable its citizens to live, but the things which enable it to make war. Petrol is more likely than wheat to be a cause of international conflict.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: What are we having this liberty for? We are having this liberty in order to reform our social system, which is full of inequality, discrimination and other things, which conflict with our fundamental rights.

author: Bruce Babbitt
title: What we've proven is that you can protect the environment, use it wisely and grow the economy and that there is no conflict between the two.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
title: When somebody says, 'Oh, Buffy, you're such a warrior for peace', I stop them and say, 'No, I'm not really a warrior for peace. What I promote is alternative conflict resolution'.

author: Tom Hopkins
title: Why don't you want to do what you know you should do? The reason you don't is that you're in conflict with yourself.

author: Benjamin Netanyahu
title: You know, I think, I think the Palestinians are trying to get away without negotiating. They're trying to get a state to continue the conflict with Israel rather than to end it. They're trying to basically detour around peace negotiations by going to the U.N. and have the automatic majority in the U.N. General Assembly give them, give them a state.

author: author
title: title

author: Alexander Cockburn
title: A ''just war'' is hospitable to every self-deception on the part of those waging it, none more than the certainty of virtue, under whose shelter every abomination can be committed with a clear conscience.

author: Steven Wright
title:
A clear conscience is usually the sign of a bad memory.,
,

author: Sydney Smith
title: A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.

author: Alphonse De Lamartine
title: A conscience without God is like a court without a judge.

author: Francis Bacon
title: A good conscience is a continual feast.

author: Joseph Addison
title: A good conscience is to the soul what health is to the body; it preserves constant ease and serenity within us; and more than countervails all the calamities and afflictions which can befall us from without.

author: Albert Camus
title: A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.

author: Doug Larson
title: A lot of people mistake a short memory for a clear conscience.

author: Khaled Hosseini
title: A man who has no conscience, no goodness, does not suffer.

author: Jane Austen
title: A man who has nothing to do with his own time has no conscience in his intrusion on that of others.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: A man's conscience and his judgment is the same thing; and as the judgment, so also the conscience, may be erroneous.

author: Frank A. Clark
title: A man's conscience, like a warning line on the highway, tells him what he shouldn't do - but it does not keep him from doing it.

author: William Faulkner
title: A man's moral conscience is the curse he had to accept from the gods in order to gain from them the right to dream.

author: Walter Savage Landor
title: A man's vanity tells him what is honor, a man's conscience what is justice.

author: William Shakespeare
title: A peace above all earhtly dignities: A still and quiet conscience.

author: Charles Lamb
title: A poor relation is the most irrelevant thing in nature, a piece of impertinent correspondence, an odious approximation, a haunting conscience, a preposterous shadow, lengthening in the noon-tide of our prosperity. He is known by his knock.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title:
A Sunday school is a prison in which children do penance for the evil conscience of their parents.,
,

author: Ben Jonson
title: Ambition, like a torrent, ne'er looks back; , And is a swelling, and the last affection , A high mind can put off; being both a rebel , Unto the soul and reason, and enforceth , All laws, all conscience, treads upon religion, , and offereth violence to nature's self.

author: Angela Carter
title: Anxiety is the beginning of conscience, which is the parent of the soul but is not compatible with innocence.

author: Bernard Cornwell
title: Anyone who claims to have an entirely clear conscience is almost certainly a bore.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: As long as our government is administered for the good of the people, and is regulated by their will; as long as it secures to us the rights of persons and of property, liberty of conscience and of the press, it will be worth defending.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: Avoid lawsuits beyond all things; they pervert your conscience, impair your health, and dissipate your property.

author: Ada Leverson
title: Before he left, Aunt William pressed a sovereign into his hand guiltily, as if it were conscience money. He, on his side, took it as though it were a doctor's fee, and both ignored the transaction.

author: Albert Camus
title: By definition, a government has no conscience. Sometimes it has a policy, but nothing more.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Confusing monogamy with morality has done more to destroy the conscience of the human race than any other error.

author: Henry Fielding
title: Conscience - the only incorruptible thing about us.

author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
title: Conscience has no more to do with gallantry than it has with politics.

author: Jeremy Taylor
title: Conscience in most men, is but the anticipation of the opinions of others.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: Conscience is a man's compass.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Conscience is a mother-in-law whose visit never ends.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Conscience is but a word that cowards use.

author: Joseph Cook
title: Conscience is our magnetic compass; reason our chart.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Conscience is the inner voice that warns us that someone might be looking.,

author: Sigmund Freud
title: Conscience is the internal perception of the rejection of a particular wish operating within us.

author: George Bancroft
title: Conscience is the mirror of our souls, which represents the errors of our lives in their full shape.

author: James Freeman Clarke
title: Conscience is the root of all true courage; if a man would be brave let him obey his conscience.

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: Conscience is the sentinel of virtue.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Conscience is the voice of the soul; the passions of the body.

author: Doug Horton
title: Conscience is the window of our spirit, evil is the curtain.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Conscience is thoroughly well-bred and soon leaves off talking to those who do not wish to hear it.

author: Irving Layton
title: Conscience: self-esteem with a halo.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: Conviction is the conscience of the mind.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
title: Courage without conscience is a wild beast.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Deep down, the US, with its space, its technological refinement, its bluff good conscience, even in those spaces which it opens up for simulation, is the only remaining primitive society.

author: Bono
title: Distance does not decide who is your brother and who is not. The church is going to have to become the conscience of the free market if it's to have any meaning in this world - and stop being its apologist.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: Do your duty, and don't swerve from it. Do that which your conscience tells you to be right, and leave the consequences to God.

author: Ben Miles
title: English history turned on Henry VIII and his desires, his whims almost. And it was down to Cromwell to make those desires happen. He was the guy that fixed it. He was also the guy that eased Henry's conscience. Because Henry VIII had an enormous, tender conscience and great theological knowledge.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: Every human being has a work to carry on within, duties to perform abroad, influence to exert, which are peculiarly his, and which no conscience but his own can teach.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: Fame and power are the objects of all men. Even their partial fruition is gained by very few; and that, too, at the expense of social pleasure, health, conscience, life.

author: Harriet Martineau
title: Fidelity to conscience is inconsistent with retiring modesty. If it be so, let the modesty succumb. It can be only a false modesty which can be thus endangered.

author: Ingmar Bergman
title: Film as dream, film as music. No art passes our conscience in the way film does, and goes directly to our feelings, deep down into the dark rooms of our souls.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Forgetfulness. A gift of God bestowed upon debtors in compensation for their destitution of conscience.

author: Michel Foucault
title: Freedom of conscience entails more dangers than authority and despotism.

author: John Milton
title: Give me the liberty to know, to utter, and to argue freely according to conscience, above all liberties.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our conscience, but shouts in our pains: it is His megaphone to rouse a deaf world.

author: Mark Twain
title: Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience; this is the ideal life.

author: Robert South
title: Guilt upon the conscience, like rust upon iron, both defiles and consumes it, gnawing and creeping into it, as that does which at last eats out the very heart and substance of the metal.

author: Jeremy Taylor
title: He that speaketh against his own reason speaks against his own conscience, and therefore it is certain that no man serves God with a good conscience who serves him against his reason.

author: D'Avenant
title: Honor is the moral conscience of the great.

author: Lillian Hellman
title: I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.

author: Martin Luther
title: I cannot and will not recant anything, for to go against conscience is neither right nor safe. Here I stand, I can do no other, so help me God. Amen.

author: Anita Hill
title: I did what my conscience told me to do, and you can't fail if you do that.

author: Thomas Paine
title: I love those who can smile in trouble, who can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but they whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves their conduct, will pursue their principles unto death.

author: Anne Frank
title: I soothe my conscience now with the thought that it is better for hard words to be on paper than that Mummy should carry them in her heart.

author: Martin Luther King
title: I submit that an individual who breaks the law that conscience tells him is unjust and willingly accepts the penalty by staying in jail to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality expressing the very highest respect for law.

author: Dean William R. Inge
title: I think middle-age is the best time, if we can escape the fatty degeneration of the conscience which often sets in at about fifty.

author: William B. Yeats
title: I think you can leave the arts, superior or inferior, to the conscience of mankind.

author: Jonathan Miller
title: I wasn't driven into medicine by a social conscience but by rampant curiosity.

author: Bernard Cornwell
title: I'm fortunate that the books sell, but even more fortunate to live in Chatham, to be very happily married and to have, on the whole, a fairly clear conscience.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
title: If a superior give any order to one who is under him which is against that man's conscience, although he do not obey it yet he shall not be dismissed.

author: Antonin Scalia
title: If we're picking people to draw out of their own conscience and experience a 'new' Constitution, we should not look principally for good lawyers. We should look to people who agree with us. When we are in that mode, you realize we have rendered the Constitution useless.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: In Hinduism, conscience, reason and independent thinking have no scope for development.

author: Thomas De Quincey
title: In many walks of life, a conscience is a more expensive encumbrance than a wife or a carriage.

author: Robert Hall
title: In matters of conscience, first thoughts are best. In matters of prudence, last thoughts are best.

author: William Congreve
title: In my conscience I believe the baggage loves me, for she never speaks well of me herself, nor suffers any body else to rail at me.

author: Bono
title: In my view, the only thing worse than a rock star is a rock star with a conscience.

author: Cal Thomas
title: In violent streets and broken homes, the cry of anguished souls is not for more laws but for more conscience and character.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: It behooves every man who values liberty of conscience for himself, to resist invasions of it in the case of others: or their case may, by change of circumstances, become his own.

author: Mark Twain
title: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: It is far more important to me to preserve an unblemished conscience than to compass any object however great.

author: Joseph A. Schumpeter
title: It is not true that democracy will always safeguard freedom of conscience better than autocracy. Witness the most famous of all trials. Pilate was, from the standpoint of the Jews, certainly the representative of autocracy. Yet he tried to protect freedom. And he yielded to a democracy.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Judaism's campaign to make divinity invisible has never fully succeeded. Images are always eluding moral control, creating the brilliant western art tradition. Idolatry is fascism of the eye. The western eye will be served, with or without the consent of conscience.

author: Martin Luther
title: Justice is a temporary thing that must at last come to an end; but the conscience is eternal and will never die.

author: Aleksandr Solzjenitsyn
title: Justice is conscience, not a personal conscience but the conscience of the whole of humanity. Those who clearly recognize the voice of their own conscience usually recognize also the voice of justice.

author: Nelson Algren
title: Literature is made upon any occasion that a challenge is put to the legal apparatus by conscience in touch with humanity.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love is too young to know what conscience is.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Men never do evil so fully and cheerfully as when we do it out of conscience.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: Modesty is the conscience of the body.

author: Billy Graham
title: Most of us follow our conscience as we follow a wheelbarrow. We push it in front of us in the direction we want to go.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: Most people sell their souls, and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.

author: Anne Hutchinson
title: Must not I then entertain the saints because I must keep my conscience.

author: William Shakespeare
title: My conscience hath a thousand several tongues, and every tongue brings in a several tale, and every tale condemns me for a villain.

author: Blanche Lincoln
title: My heart has been heavy and I have deliberated within my own conscience, knowing that my decision should not come out of my initial emotion of anger toward the President for such reckless behavior, but should be based on the facts.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Never do anything against conscience even if the state demands it.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: Nobody has any conscience about adding to the improbabilities of a marvelous tale.

author: Bjornstjerne Bjornson
title: Nothing has ever moulded our conscience so strongly as our knowledge of what is good and what is evil.

author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton
title: Nothing strengthens the judgement and quickens the conscience like individual responsibility.

author: Alighieri Dante
title: O conscience, upright and stainless, how bitter a sting to thee is a little fault!

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Of all tyrannies, a tyranny sincerely exercised for the good of its victims may be the most oppressive. It would be better to live under robber barons than under omnipotent moral busybodies. The robber baron's cruelty may sometimes sleep, his cupidity may at some point be satiated; but those who torment us for our own good will torment us without end for they do so with the approval of their own conscience.

author: Martin Luther King
title: One who breaks an unjust law that conscience tells him is unjust, and who willingly accepts the penalty of imprisonment in order to arouse the conscience of the community over its injustice, is in reality expressing the highest respect for law.

author: Barbara Jordan
title: Our concept of governing is derived from our view of people. It is a concept deeply rooted in a set of beliefs firmly etched in the national conscience, of all of us.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: Our conscience is not the vessel of eternal verities. It grows with our social life, and a new social condition means a radical change in conscience.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.

author: B. W. Powe
title: Passion was animal flesh, raw desire gnawing and ripping at its early limitations. These passions were to be feared only if undirected by the conscience of the higher self. Mind was the key to the process of enlightenment. Hence reason was the first principle, light itself.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: Peace is normally a great good, and normally it coincides with righteousness, but it is righteousness and not peace which should bind the conscience of a nation as it should bind the conscience of an individual; and neither a nation nor an individual can surrender conscience to another's keeping.

author: Will Rogers
title: People are getting smarter nowadays; they are letting lawyers, instead of their conscience, be their guide.

author: Henry James
title: People talk about the conscience, but it seems to me one must just bring it up to a certain point and leave it there. You can let your conscience alone if you're nice to the second housemaid.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Philanthropist. A rich (and usually bald) old gentleman who has trained himself to grin while his conscience is picking his pocket.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Philanthropist: A rich (and usually bald) old gentleman who has trained himself to grin while his conscience is picking his pocket.

author: William R. Alger
title: Public opinion is a second conscience.

author: Josh Billings
title: Reason often makes mistakes, but conscience never does.

author: George Santayana
title: Religions are the great fairy tales of conscience.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Science and art are only too often a superior kind of dope, possessing this advantage over booze and morphia: that they can be indulged in with a good conscience and with the conviction that, in the process of indulging, one is leading the ''higher life.''

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Shame arises from the fear of men, conscience from the fear of God.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: The changes in our life must come from the impossibility to live otherwise than according to the demands of our conscience not from our mental resolution to try a new form of life.

author: Lady Blessington
title: The chief prerequisite for a escort is to have a flexible conscience and an inflexible politeness.

author: Lady Blessington
title: The chief requisites for a courtier are a flexible conscience and an inflexible politeness.

author: Joyce Meyer
title: The conscience can be a strong guide in life if we allow it.,

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: The conscience is the most flexible material in the world. Today you cannot stretch it over a mole hill; while tomorrow it can hide a mountain.

author: Napoleon
title: The conscience is the sacred haven of the liberty of man.

author: Jean Paul
title: The conscience of children is formed by the influences that surround them; their notions of good and evil are the result of the moral atmosphere they breathe.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: The conscience of the world is so guilty that it always assumes that people who investigate heresies must be heretics; just as if a doctor who studies leprosy must be a leper. Indeed, it is only recently that science has been allowed to study anything without reproach.

author: Seneca
title: The first and greatest punishment of the sinner is the conscience of sin.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
title: The hungry world cannot be fed until and unless the growth of its resources and the growth of its population come into balance. Each man and woman-and each nation - must make decisions of conscience and policy in the face of this great problem.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The infliction of cruelty with a good conscience is a delight to moralists. That is why they invented Hell.

author: B. C. Forbes
title: The man who has won millions at the cost of his conscience is a failure.

author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
title: The New England conscience doesn't keep you from doing what you shouldn't - it just keeps you from enjoying it.

author: Sir Max Beerbohm
title: The Non-Conformist Conscience makes cowards of us all.

author: Harper Lee
title: The one thing that doesn't abide by majority rule is a person's conscience.

author: Izaak Walton
title: The person that loses their conscience has nothing left worth keeping.

author: Herbert Hoover
title: The President is not only the leader of a party, he is the President of the whole people. He must interpret the conscience of America.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The real satisfaction which praise can afford, is when what is repeated aloud agrees with the whispers of conscience, by showing us that we have not endeavored to deserve well in vain.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
title: The separation of church and state is a source of strength, but the conscience of our nation does not call for separation between men of state and faith in the Supreme Being.

author: Mme de Stael
title: The voice of conscience is so delicate that it is easy to stifle it; but it is also so clear that it is impossible to mistake it.

author: Stokely Carmichael
title: There is a higher law than the law of government. That's the law of conscience.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: There is no self-delusion more fatal than that which makes the conscience dreamy with the anodyne of lofty sentiments, while the life is groveling and sensual.

author: Sophocles
title: There is no witness so terrible and no accuser so powerful as conscience which dwells within us.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: There is nothing more dangerous than the conscience of a bigot.

author: Euripides
title: There is one thing alone that stands the brunt of life throughout its length: a quite conscience.

author: Ogden Nash
title: There is only one way to achieve happiness on this terrestrial ball, and that is to have either a clear conscience or none at all.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: They talk of a man betraying his country, his friends, his sweetheart. There must be a moral bond first. All a man can betray is his conscience.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: Through pride we are ever deceiving ourselves. But deep down below the surface of the average conscience a still, small voice says to us,  something is out of tune.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: To be conscience that you are ignorant is a great step to knowledge.

author: Barbara Deming
title: To resort to power one need not be violent, and to speak to conscience one need not be meek. The most effective action both resorts to power and engages conscience.

author: Charles William Stubbs
title: To sit alone with my conscience will be judgment enough for me.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Undeserved praise causes more pangs of conscience later than undeserved blame, but probably only for this reason, that our power of judgment are more completely exposed by being over praised than by being unjustly underestimated.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Vengeance taken will often tear the heart and torment the conscience.

author: Adam Smith
title: Virtue is more to be feared than vice, because its excesses are not subject to the regulation of conscience.

author: Bayard Rustin
title: War is wrong. Conscription for war is inconsistent with freedom of conscience, which is not merely the right to believe but to act on the degree of truth that one receives, to follow a vocation which is God-inspired and God-directed.

author: Butch Trucks
title: We all knew that asking another guitar player to step into Duane Allman's shoes would not really be fair to anybody who had a conscience.

author: Benjamin Todd Jealous
title: We do not owe allegiance to any candidate because they share our party or our color, but because they share our principles and our conscience.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: We grow with years more fragile in body, but morally stutter, and can throw off the chill of a bad conscience almost at once.

author: Aleksander Kwasniewski
title: We know enough to stand here in truth - facing pain, cry and suffering of those who were murdered here. Face to face with the victims' families who are here today. Before the judgment of our own conscience.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: We lie to ourselves in order that we may still have the excuse of ignorance, the alibi of stupidity and incomprehension, possessing which we can continue with a good conscience to commit and tolerate the most monstrous crimes.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: We only labor to stuff the memory, and leave the conscience and the understanding unfurnished and void.

author: James Joyce
title: Welcome, O life! I go to encounter for the millionth time the reality of experience and to forge in the smithy of my soul the uncreated conscience of my race.

author: Adam Smith
title: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?

author: Bob Barr
title: What has to do with your ability to fall asleep is not caffeine. It's having a clean conscience. I have a clean conscience so I can drink all the caffeine I want.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
