For the first time, the weird and the stupid and the coarse are becoming our cultural norm, even our cultural ideal.

author: Max Lerner
title: We cannot live by power, and a culture that seeks to live by it becomes brutal and sterile. But we can die without it.

title: What is acceptable in our culture, I think, is really detrimental. I think we ought to have a little more ownership over the kind of material and the content that we put in front of people, especially young people.

title: When a culture feels that its end has come, it sends for a priest.

title: When I started graduate school I was interested in the culture of the Civil Rights Movement.

author: Confucius
title: When nature exceeds culture, we have the rustic. When culture exceeds nature then we the pedant.

author: Albert Camus
title: Without culture, and the relative freedom it implies, society, even when perfect, is but a jungle. This is why any authentic creation is a gift to the future.

title: Without memory, there is no culture. Without memory, there would be no civilization, no society, no future.

author: Camille Paglia

title: You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them.,

author: Billy Corgan

title: title

title: A timid person is frightened before a danger, a coward during the time, and a courageous person afterwards.

author: Pierre Corneille
title: A Victory without danger is a triumph without glory.

title: A coward turns away, but a brave man's choice is danger.

author: Andrew William Mellon
title: A nation is not in danger of financial disaster merely because it owes itself money.

title: A person in danger should not try to escape at one stroke. He should first calmly hold his own, then be satisfied with small gains, which will come by creative adaptations.

title: A true knight is fuller of bravery in the midst, than in the beginning of danger.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: As soon as there is life there is danger.,

title: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.

title: Bullfighting is the only art in which the artist is in danger of death and in which the degree of brilliance in the performance is left to the fighter's honor.

title: But if you're going to go out on a military unit, you've got to allow yourself to be under the control of the commander because you really could put the troops in danger.

author: John Stuart Mill
title: But society has now fairly got the better of individuality; and the danger which threatens human nature is not the excess, but the deficiency, of personal Impulses and preferences.

author: Barbara Jordan
title: But this is the great danger America faces. That we will cease to be one nation and become instead a collection of interest groups: city against suburb, region against region, individual against individual. Each seeking to satisfy private wants.

author: Peter Ustinov
title: By increasing the size of the keyhole, today's playwrights are in danger of doing away with the door.

author: Louisa May Alcott
title: Conceit spoils the finest genius. There is not much danger that real talent or goodness will be overlooked long; even if it is, the consciousness of possessing and using it well should satisfy one, and the great charm of all power is modesty.

author: William T. Sherman
title: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.

author: Jean Paul
title: Courage consists not in blindly overlooking danger, but in seeing it, and conquering it.

author: Plautus
title: Courage in danger is half the battle.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
title: Cowards falter, but danger is often overcome by those who nobly dare.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Danger - if you meet it promptly and without flinching - you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything. Never!

author: Pierre Corneille
title: Danger breeds best on too much confidence.

author: Benjamin Cardozo
title: Danger invites rescue.... The wrongdoer may not have foreseen the coming of a deliverer. He is accountable as if he had.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: Danger is the very basis of superstition. It produces a searching after help supernaturally when human means are no longer supposed to be available.

author: George Chapman
title: Danger, the spur of all great minds.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: Delay always breeds danger; and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.

author: Caitlin Flanagan
title: Divorce in a young-adult novel means what being orphaned meant in a fairy tale: vulnerability, danger, unwanted independence.

author: Barbara Sher
title: Doing is a quantum leap from imagining. Thinking about swimming isn't much like actually getting in the water. Actually getting in the water can take your breath away. The defense force inside of us wants us to be cautious, to stay away from anything as intense as a new kind of action. Its job is to protect us, and it categorically avoids anything resembling danger. But it's often wrong. Anything worth doing is worth doing too soon.

author: Tryon Edwards
title: Doubt, indulged and cherished, is in danger of becoming denial; but if honest, and bent on thorough investigation, it may soon lead to full establishment of the truth.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: During the first period of a man's life, the danger is not to take the risk.

author: Claude Lévi-Strauss
title: Enthusiastic partisans of the idea of progress are in danger of failing to recognize... the immense riches accumulated by the human race. By underrating the achievements of the past, they devalue all those which still remain to be accomplished.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Everywhere one seeks to produce meaning, to make the world signify, to render it visible. We are not, however, in danger of lacking meaning; quite the contrary, we are gorged with meaning and it is killing us.

author: Thomas J. Watson
title: Follow the path of the unsafe, independent thinker. Expose your ideas to the danger of controversy. Speak your mind and fear less the label of ''crackpot'' than the stigma of conformity.

author: Carl Jung
title: For a woman, the typical danger emanating from the unconscious comes from above, from the spiritual sphere personified by the animus, whereas for a man it comes from the chthonic realm of the world and woman, i.e., the anima projected on to the world.

author: Carl Sagan
title: For the first time, we have the power to decide the fate of our planet and ourselves. This is a time of great danger, but our species is young, and curious, and brave. It shows much promise.

author: Francis Bacon
title: For there is no question but a just fear of an imminent danger, though there be no blow given, is a lawful cause of war.

author: Barry Eichengreen
title: For those unfortunate enough to experience it, long-term unemployment - now, as in the 1930s - is a tragedy. And, for society as a whole, there is the danger that the productive capacity of a significant portion of the labour force will be impaired.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: He is most free from danger, who, even when safe, is on his guard.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: He that displays too often his wife and his wallet is in danger of having both of them borrowed.

author: Arthur Henderson
title: He would see civilization in danger of perishing under the oppression of a gigantic paradox: he would see multitudes of people starving in the midst of plenty, and nations preparing for war although pledged to peace.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: How many of our daydreams would darken into nightmares, were there a danger of their coming true!

author: Alexander Mackenzie
title: I am sure that in Canada the people appreciate this principle, and the general intelligence which prevails over that country is such that I am sure there is no danger of a reactionary policy ever finding a response in the hearts of any considerable number of our people.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: I cannot help fearing that men may reach a point where they look on every new theory as a danger, every innovation as a toilsome trouble, every social advance as a first step toward revolution, and that they may absolutely refuse to move at all.

author: William Congreve
title: I find we are growing serious, and then we are in great danger of being dull.

author: Benazir Bhutto
title: I put my life in danger and came here because I feel this country is in danger. People are worried. We will bring the country out of this crisis.

author: James Baldwin
title: I think white gay people feel cheated because they were born, in principle, in a society in which they were supposed to be safe. The anomaly of their sexuality puts them in danger, unexpectedly.

author: William T. Sherman
title: I would define true courage to be a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: I've never forgotten for long at a time that living is struggle. I know that every good and excellent thing in the world stands moment by moment on the razor-edge of danger and must be fought for - whether it's a field, or a home, or a country.

author: Thomas Henry Huxley
title: If a little knowledge is dangerous, where is the man who has so much as to be out of danger?

author: Carter G. Woodson
title: If a race has no history, if it has no worthwhile tradition, it becomes a negligible factor in the thought of the world, and it stands in danger of being exterminated.

author: Benjamin N. Cardozo
title: If the nature of a thing is such that it is reasonably certain to place life and limb in peril when negligently made, it is then a thing of danger. Its nature gives warning of the consequences to be expected. If to the element of danger there is added knowledge that the thing will be used by persons other than the purchaser, and used without new tests, then, irrespective of contract, the manufacturer of this thing of danger is under a duty to make it carefully.

author: Voltaire
title: If there were only one religion in England there would be danger of despotism, if there were two, they would cut each other's throats, but there are thirty, and they live in peace and happiness.

author: Abdurrahman Wahid
title: If we cling to the institution of Islam, then we tend to defend it against whatever we see as a danger to it, so because of this we see now that many people are defending states, defending territories, defending everything institutional in the belief that they defend Islam.

author: Tacitus
title: If we must fall, we should boldly meet the danger.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
title: If we survive danger it steels our courage more than anything else.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: In comradeship is danger countered best.

author: Wendell L. Willkie
title: In no direction that we turn do we find ease or comfort. If we are honest and if we have the will to win we find only danger, hard work and iron resolution.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: In the long history of the world, only a few generations have been granted the role of defending freedom in its hour of maximum danger. I do not shrink from this responsibility - I welcome it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: In this world there is always danger for those who are afraid of it.

author: Hitopadesa
title: In time of danger it is proper to be alarmed until danger be near at hand; but when we perceive that danger is near, we should oppose it as if we were not afraid.

author: Bainbridge Colby
title: It is a high patriotic duty that we support and sustain the men who have been placed in position of difficulty, burden, responsibility, and even danger as the result of our suffrages.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: It is better to do thine own duty, however lacking in merit, than to do that of another, even though efficiently. It is better to die doing one's own duty, for to do the duty of another is fraught with danger.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: It is better to meet danger than to wait for it. He that is on a lee shore, and foresees a hurricane, stands out to sea and encounters a storm to avoid a shipwreck.

author: Aesop
title: It is easy to be brave when far away from danger.

author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison
title: Kindness and intelligence don't always deliver us from the pitfalls and traps: there are always failures of love, of will, of imagination. There is no way to take the danger out of human relationships.

author: Francis Quarles
title: Let the fear of a danger be a spur to prevent it; he that fears not, gives advantage to the danger.

author: Tennessee Williams
title: Luxury is the wolf at the door and its fangs are the vanities and conceits germinated by success. When an artist learns this, he knows where the danger is.

author: Bob Hawke
title: My point was that the war was intrinsically wrong, and as a result of our participation we haven't improved Australia's security but created a greater danger at home and abroad.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Mystery magnifies danger, as a fog the sun, the hand that warned Belshazzar derived its horrifying effect from the want of a body.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Napoleon affords us an example of the danger of elevating one's self to the absolute, and sacrificing everything to the carrying out of an idea.

author: Heraclitus
title: No one that encounters prosperity does not also encounter danger.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: Not only does democracy make every man forget his ancestors, but also clouds their view of their descendants and isolates them from their contemporaries. Each man is for ever thrown back on himself alone, and there is danger that he may be shut up in the solitude of his own heart.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: One is not exposed to danger who, even when in safety is always on their guard.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: One ought never to turn one's back on a threatened danger and try to run away from it. If you do that, you will double the danger. But if you meet it promptly and without flinching, you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything. Never!

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Our cause is never more in danger than when a human, no longer desiring, but still intending to do our Enemy's will, looks round upon a universe from which every trace of Him seems to have vanished, and asks why he has been forsaken, and still obeys.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Out of this nettle, danger, we pluck this flower, safety.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: People that are orthodox when they are young are in danger of being middle-aged all their lives.

author: Bill Bryson
title: Personally, I've never been attracted to danger. It's not my sort of thing. I am more attracted to pubs and cafes. The known, safe and comfortable world.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Philosophy is a bully that talks loud when the danger is at a distant; but, the moment she is pressed hard by an enemy, she is nowhere to be found and leaves the brunt of the battle to be fought by her steady, humble comrade, religion.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Physical courage, which engages all danger, will make a person brave in one way; and moral courage, which defies all opinion, will make a person brave in another.

author: Bill McKibben
title: Pity the poor senator or representative trying to stay alive in the political jungle. At every turn, there's a danger: a constituent who actually wants something done. Or worse, a campaign donor who might be offended by that something.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Rape is an outrage that cannot be tolerated in a civilized society. Yet feminism, which has waged a crusade for rape to be taken more seriously, has put young women in danger by hiding the truth about sex from them.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Reading, solitude, idleness, a soft and sedentary life, intercourse with women and young people, these are perilous paths for a young man, and these lead him constantly into danger.

author: Helen Keller
title: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Security will produce danger.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Send danger from the east unto the west, so honor cross it from the north to south.

author: John Dryden
title: She feared no danger, for she knew no sin.

author: H. L. Wayland
title: Show us a man who never makes a mistake and we will show you a man who never makes anything. The capacity for occasional blundering is inseparable from the capacity to bring things to pass. The only men who are past the danger of making mistakes are the men who sleep at Greenwood.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Small debts are like small gun shot; they are rattling around us on all sides and one can scarcely escape being wounded. Large debts are like canons, they produce a loud noise, but are of little danger.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: Surely all art is the result of one's having been in danger, of having gone through an experience all the way to the end, where no one can go any further.

author: Horace
title: Take away the danger and remove the restraint, and wayward nature runs free.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: Thank Heaven! the crisis - the danger, is past, and the lingering illness, is over at last, and the fever called ''Living'' is conquered at last.

author: John Stuart Mill
title:
That so few now dare to be eccentric, marks the chief danger of the time.,
,

author: John Stuart Mill
title: The amount of eccentricity in a society has generally been proportional to the amount of genius, mental vigor, and moral courage it contained. That so few now dare to be eccentric marks the chief danger of the time.

author: Carol Gilligan
title: The blind willingness to sacrifice people to truth, however, has always been the danger of an ethics abstracted from life.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: The brave man inattentive to his duty, is worth little more to his country than the coward who deserts in the hour of danger.

author: Thucydides
title: The bravest are surely those who have the clearest vision of what is before them, glory and danger alike, and yet notwithstanding go out to meet it.

author: Alfred Adler
title: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.

author: Carl Jung
title: The cinema, like the detective story, enables us to experience without danger to ourselves all the excitements, passions, and fantasies which have to be repressed in a humanistic age.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The cinema, like the detective story, makes it possible to experience without danger all the excitement, passion and desirousness which must be repressed in a humanitarian ordering of life.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: The clear and present danger of climate change means we cannot burn our way to prosperity. We already rely too heavily on fossil fuels. We need to find a new, sustainable path to the future we want. We need a clean industrial revolution.

author: John Tillotson
title: The crafty person is always in danger; and when they think they walk in the dark, all their pretenses are transparent.

author: Lord Acton
title: The danger is not that a particular class is unfit to govern. Every class is unfit to govern.

author: Bee Wilson
title: The danger of growing up surrounded by endless sweet and salty industrial concoctions is not that we are innately incapable of resisting them but that the more frequently we eat them, especially in childhood, the more they train us to expect all food to taste this way.

author: Seth Godin
title:
The danger of the Web is that you can go from idea to public announcement in under ten minutes.,
,

author: Philip Roth
title: The danger with hatred is, once you start in on it, you get a hundred times more than you bargained for. Once you start, you can't stop.

author: Earl Warren
title: The fantastic advances in the field of electronic communication constitute a greater danger to the privacy of the individual.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The great danger of conversion in all ages has been that when the religion of the high mind is offered to the lower mind, the lower mind, feeling its fascination without understanding it, and being incapable of rising to it, drags it down to its level by degrading it.

author: Plato
title: The humble are in danger when those in power disagree.

author: George Santayana
title: The little word is has its tragedies: it marries and identifies different things with the greatest innocence; and yet no two are ever identical, and if therein lies the charm of wedding them and calling them one, therein too lies the danger.

author: Bill Dedman
title: The main threads running through the lives of W. A. Clark and his daughter Huguette include the costs of ambition, the burdens of inherited wealth, the fragility of reputation, the folly of judging someone's life from the outside, and the tension between engaging with the world, with all its risks, and keeping a safe distance from danger.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The man loves danger and sport. That is why he loves woman, the most dangerous of all sports.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The man who promises everything is sure to fulfil nothing, and everyone who promises too much is in danger of using evil means in order to carry out his promises, and is already on the road to perdition.

author: F. L. Lucan
title: The mere apprehension of a coming evil has put many into a situation of the utmost danger.

author: Martin Luther King
title: The more there are riots, the more repressive actin will take place, and the more we face the danger of a right-wing takeover and eventually a fascist society.

author: Erich Fromm
title: The ordinary man with extraordinary power is the chief danger for mankind - not the fiend or the sadist.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The path is smooth that leadeth on to danger.

author: Jawaharlal Nehru
title: The person who runs away exposes himself to that very danger more than a person who sits quietly.

author: Sidney J. Harris
title: The real danger is not that computers will begin to think like men, but that men will begin to think like computers.

author: Barry Mann
title: The real danger of writing a great song when you're on something is that it might get you thinking that the only way to repeat that is by only writing when you're high.

author: Arthur Helps
title: The sense of danger is never, perhaps, so fully apprehended as when the danger has been overcome.

author: Jean Paul
title: The timid are afraid before the danger, the cowardly while in danger, and the courageous after danger.

author: Karl Marx

author: Edmund Burke
title: The true danger is when liberty is nibbled away, for expedience, and by parts.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.

author: Oscar Wilde

author: Aristotle
title: The wise man does not expose himself needlessly to danger, since there are few things for which he cares sufficiently; but he is willing, in great crises, to give even his life - knowing that under certain conditions it is not worthwhile to live.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but for deliverance from fear.

author: Plato
title: There are few people so stubborn in their atheism who when danger is pressing in will not acknowledge the divine power.

title: There can be no intelligent control of the lead danger in industry unless it is based on the principle of keeping the air clear from dust and fumes.

author: Thomas Wilson
title: There is a danger in being persuaded before one understands.

author: Agnetha Faltskog
title: There is a danger of changing too much in the search for perfection.

author: Mother Teresa
title: There is always the danger that we may just do the work for the sake of the work. This is where the respect and the love and the devotion come in -that we do it to God, to Christ, and that's why we try to do it as beautifully as possible.

author: John Adams
title: There is danger from all men. The only maxim of a free government ought to be to trust no man living with power to endanger the public liberty.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: There is far more danger of harm than there is hope of good in any radical changes.

author: Bernard Crick
title: There is no great danger to politics in the desire for certainty at any price.

author: Wilson Mizner
title: There's nothing so comfortable as a small bankroll. A big one is always in danger.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: These times of ours are serious and full of calamity, but all times are essentially alike. As soon as there is life there is danger.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: They that are on their guard and appear ready to receive their adversaries, are in much less danger of being attacked than the supine, secure and negligent.

author: Angelina Grimké
title: Thou art blind to the danger of marrying a woman who feels and acts out the principle of equal rights.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: Thus each extreme to equal danger tends, Plenty, as well as Want, can separate friends.

author: Daniel Defoe
title: Thus fear of danger is ten thousand times more terrifying than danger itself.

author: Pierre Corneille
title: To conquer without danger is to conquer without glory.

author: Plutarch
title: To do an evil act is base. To do a good one without incurring danger, is common enough. But it is part of a good man to do great and noble deeds though he risks everything in doing them.

author: Og Mandino
title: To do anything truly worth doing, I must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger, but jump in with gusto and scramble through as well as I can.

author: A. P. Gouthey
title: To get profit without risk, experience without danger, and reward without work, is as impossible as it is to live without being born.

author: Victor Hugo
title: To rescue from oblivion even a fragment of a language which men have used and which is in danger of being lost - that is to say, one of the elements, whether good or bad, which have shaped and complicated civilization - is to extend the scope of social observation and to serve civilization.

author: Lord Shaftesbury
title: True courage is cool and calm. The bravest of men have the least of a brutal, bullying insolence, and in the very time of danger are found the most serene and free.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Trump is more performance artist than zealot. But he's finding enemies everywhere, whether they are judges of Mexican ancestry, parents of those killed in war, the current president, or children of immigrants. Whether or not he has a sense of decency, he is in grave danger of losing it.

author: Harold Robbins Haldeman
title: We are getting into semantics again. If we use words, there is a very grave danger they will be misinterpreted.

author: Hubert H. Humphrey
title: We are in danger of making our cities places where business goes on but where life, in its real sense, is lost.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We can never be certain of our courage until we have faced danger.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: We do not quite forgive a giver. The hand that feeds us is in some danger of being bitten.

author: Burning Spear
title: We don't need no more danger, we don't need no more difficulties, we don't need no more misunderstanding, and we don't need no more violence. We need the people to see each other and know of each other, feel each other, touch each other, share with each other, and change hearts with each other.

author: Henry Miller
title: We have two American flags always: one for the rich and one for the poor. When the rich fly it means that things are under control; when the poor fly it means danger, revolution, anarchy.

author: Kwame Nkrumah
title: We prefer self-government with danger to servitude in tranquility.

author: Pierre Corneille
title: We triumph without glory when we conquer without danger.

author: Ronald Reagan
title: We're in greater danger today than we were the day after Pearl Harbor. Our military is absolutely incapable of defending this country.

author: Bart Starr
title: We, all of us, could do a much better job of evoking what someone has called the universal principle of human altruism: the urge in us all to help others who are in danger.

author: Adrian Lyne
title: What I think is interesting is that the more you do, you have to invent a book of rules of what you can do and what you can't do. And the very real danger is that if your book of rules becomes a book of cliches.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: When peace has been broken anywhere, the peace of all countries everywhere is in danger.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: When written in Chinese, the word "crisis" is composed of two characters - one represents danger and one represents opportunity.

author: Earl Nightingale
title: Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; whenever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable. They go together.

author: Jean Paul
title: Woman and men of retiring timidity are cowardly only in dangers which affect themselves, but the first to rescue when others are in danger.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: Written in Chinese, the word crisis, is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represent opportunity.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: Yet, in holding scientific research and discovery in respect, as we should, we must also be alert to the equal and opposite danger that public policy could itself become the captive of a scientific-technological elite.

author: Camille Paglia
title: You have to accept the fact that part of the sizzle of sex comes from the danger of sex. You can be overpowered.

author: Akhenaton
title: As a rock on the seashore he standeth firm, and the dashing of the waves disturbeth him not. He raiseth his head like a tower on a hill, and the arrows of fortune drop at his feet. In the instant of danger, the courage of his heart here, and scorn to fly.

title: title

author: Joseph Fort Newton
title: A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man in debt is so far a slave.,

author: Alexander Hamilton
title: A national debt, if it is not excessive, will be to us a national blessing.

author: Robert W. Service
title: A promise made is a debt unpaid.

author: Anthony Weiner
title: At a time when the GOP is playing games with the debt limit, a member of the Supreme Court is refusing to recuse himself from matters he has a financial interest in, and middle class incomes are stagnant, many want to change the subject. I don't. This was a prank, and a silly one. I'm focused on my work.

author: Angela Merkel
title: At this time - we're in a dramatic crisis - euro bonds are precisely the wrong answer. They lead us into a debt union, not a stability union. Each country has to take its own steps to reduce its debt.

author: Herbert Clark Hoover
title: Blessed are the young for they shall inherit the national debt.

author: Euripides
title: But learn that to die is a debt we must all pay.

title: Capitalism is an art form, an Apollonian fabrication to rival nature. It is hypocritical for feminists and intellectuals to enjoy the pleasures and conveniences of capitalism while sneering at it. Everyone born into capitalism has incurred a debt to it. Give Caesar his due.

title: Debt is the prolific mother of folly and of crime.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: Debt is the worst poverty.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Debt, n. An ingenious substitute for the chain and whip of the slavedriver.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Do not accustom yourself to consider debt only as an inconvenience. You will find it a calamity.

author: Bobby Hull
title: Every professional athlete owes a debt of gratitude to the fans and management, and pays an installment every time he plays. He should never miss a payment.

author: Bill Shuster
title: Government spending is being restrained, the economy is making progress and moving forward, and the pro-growth, tax cutting policies put in place have allowed businesses to grow, which has brought in additional tax revenue to help pay off the debt.

author: Jose Manuel Barroso
title: Growth based on debt is unsustainable, artificial.

author: Barack Obama
title: I found this national debt, doubled, wrapped in a big bow waiting for me as I stepped into the Oval Office.

author: Angela Merkel
title: I see nothing that points to a recession in Germany. But I see considerable long-term tasks ahead of us that have to do with markets regaining confidence in Europe and that have a lot to do with reducing debt.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: If a good person does you wrong, act as though you had not noticed it. They will make note of this and not remain in your debt long.

author: Ethel Watts Mumford
title: In the midst of life we are in debt.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Just praise is only a debt, but flattery is a present.

title: Like almost everyone who uses e-mail, I receive a ton of spam every day. Much of it offers to help me get out of debt or get rich quick. It would be funny if it weren't so irritating.

author: Josh Billings
title: Never run into debt, not if you can find anything else to run into.

author: Barbara Ehrenreich
title: No one should be incarcerated for debt or squeezed for money they have no chance of getting their hands on.

author: Donald Trump
title: Nobody can solve debt problems like me.

title: Nothing is so well calculated to produce a death-like torpor in the country as an extended system of taxation and a great national debt.

author: Bobby Scott
title: Obviously, there has to be a profound change in direction. Otherwise, interest on the national debt will start eating up virtually every penny that we have.

author: Garrison Keillor
title: One day Donald Trump will discover that he is owned by Lutheran Brotherhood and must re negotiate his debt load with a committee of silent Norwegians who don't understand why anyone would pay more than $120.00 for a suit.

author: Freya Stark
title: Pain and fear and hunger are effects of causes which can be foreseen and known: but sorrow is a debt which someone else makes for us.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Rather go to bed with out dinner than to rise in debt.

author: Barbara Corcoran
title: Refinancing doesn't reduce your debt, it just restructures it, so be clear about what you want to achieve with a refi.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Science does not know its debt to imagination.

author: Bill Gross
title: Slow growth and inflation have a tendency to accompany large deficits and increasing debt as a percentage of GDP.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Solvency is maintained by means of a national debt, on the principle, ''If you will not lend me the money, how can I pay you?

author: George D. Prentice
title: Some people use one half their ingenuity to get into debt, and the other half to avoid paying it.

author: Barry Eichengreen
title: Southern Europe has not done enough to enhance its competitiveness, while northern Europe has not done enough to boost demand. Debt burdens remain crushing, and Europe's economy remains unable to grow.

author: Bernie Sanders
title: The cost of college education today is so high that many young people are giving up their dream of going to college, while many others are graduating deeply in debt.

author: Bob Corker
title: The debt ceiling at some point has to be raised. I don't think there's anybody that questions the fact that if we ended up getting in a situation where the U.S. government was sending out IOUs like the state of California did at one point, that ends up creating quite a brand problem for our country.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: There are but two ways of paying debt: Increase of industry in raising income, increase of thrift in laying out.

author: Mark Caine
title: There is nothing that puts a man more in your debt than that he owes you nothing.

author: Fawn M. Brodie
title: There is, of course, a gold mine or a buried treasure on every mortgaged homestead. Whether the farmer ever digs for it or not, it is there, haunting his daydreams when the burden of debt is most unbearable.

author: Earl Wilson
title: This would be a much better world if more married couples were as deeply in love as they are in debt.

author: Ezra Pound
title: Wars are made to make debt.

author: Billy Baldwin
title: We can recognize and give credit where credit is due, to the debt of taste we owe Europe, but we have taste, too.

author: Mark Twain
title: We owe a deep debt of gratitude to Adam, the first great benefactor of the human race: he brought death into the world.

author: Adam Smith
title: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?

author: Carly Fiorina
title: When our most important issue is the debt that we're piling on our children and grandchildren, I think it's pretty helpful to have someone in the U.S. Senate who has actually managed billions of dollars and knows how to cut billions of dollars.

author: Mark Twain
title: Whoever has lived long enough to find out what life is, knows how deep a debt of gratitude we owe to Adam, the first great benefactor of our race. He brought death into the world.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.

author: Will Rogers
title: Worrying is like paying on a debt that may never come due.,

author: Barry Sternlicht
title: You go public because you want access to capital in the form of debt and equity.

author: author
title: title

author: Marcel Proust
title: All our final decisions are made in a state of mind that is not going to last.

author: Kenneth Hildebrand
title: Freedom is the opportunity to make decisions...

author: Stephen Covey
title: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: It is only in our decisions that we are important.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: More than anything else, I believe it's our decisions, not the conditions of our lives, that determine our destiny.

author: Mark Zuckerberg
title: I really want to clear my life so that I have to make as few decisions as possible about anything except how to best serve this community.

author: Antony Jay
title: 'Referring the matter to a committee' can be a device for diluting authority, diffusing responsibility and delaying decisions.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: A belief in God helps provide a foundation to arbitrate our decisions. Without this foundation, we are condemned to live essentially formless lives.

author: Carly Fiorina
title: A leader's most important decisions are about people. Who do you put in which jobs? How long do you leave them in a job?

author: Bobby Vinton
title: All around as a person, on right decisions, on holding your money, on doing your trade, a good education is a must. I don't think I would've done as good without an education.

author: Bruce Jackson
title: All governments in all wars have used all the means at their disposal to put their own motives, decisions and actions, and the actions of their military forces, in the best possible light.

author: Carol Leifer
title: All my other relationships with men, there was so much maneuvering and strategic decisions and stuff.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: An executive is a man who can make quick decisions and is sometimes right.

author: Bernard Cornwell
title: And yes, there's a simplicity to writing books because you're not a member of a team, so you make all the decisions yourself instead of deferring to a committee.

author: Atom Egoyan
title: As a producer, I think one of the most important decisions you make is not necessarily the material you are working on but the production apparatus that you choose to develop the project with, and that determines what funding you go to, it determines many factors.

author: T. Boone Pickens
title: Be willing to make decisions. That's the most important quality in a good leader. Don't fall victim to what I call the Ready- Aim-Aim-Aim Syndrome. You must be willing to fire.

author: Brent Scowcroft
title: But figuring out Saddam Hussein was one our greatest mysteries. He marched to his own drummer and frequently as this unfolded he made decisions which were sometimes inexplicable to us and sometimes didn't look very smart.

author: Barney Frank
title: But when others suggested that the poor should not simply be the objects of these programs but also the subjects - that they should be actively involved in shaping the programs, making decisions about how to spend the money etc. - some of the previous supporters reconsidered.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: By the power elite, we refer to those political, economic, and military circles which as an intricate set of overlapping cliques share decisions having at least national consequences. In so far as national events are decided, the power elite are those who decide them.

author: Barney Frank
title: Capitalism works better from every perspective when the economic decision makers are forced to share power with those who will be affected by those decisions.

author: Blake Farenthold
title: Census data influences decisions made from Main Street to Wall Street, in Congress and with the Federal Reserve. Not to mention, the American people who look to, and trust, the data the government releases on our nation's unemployment, state of our economy, and health insurance coverage.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Create a vision and never let the environment, other people's beliefs, or the limits of what has been done in the past shape your decisions. Ignore conventional wisdom.

title: In a democracy dissent is an act of faith. Like medicine, the test of its value is not in its taste, but its effects.

title: In a democracy everybody has a right to be represented, including the jerks.

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: In a democracy one must have the right to express oneself and that's what I do, even if it displeases.

author: Aristotle
title: In a democracy the poor will have more power than the rich, because there are more of them, and the will of the majority is supreme.

author: Benjamin Todd Jealous
title: In a democracy there are only two types of power: there's organized people and organized money, and organized money only wins when people aren't organized.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: In a well-functioning democracy, people frequently encounter topics and points of view that they did not specifically select but from which they learn. Those encounters can change minds and, even, the course of lives.

author: Carter G. Woodson
title: In our so-called democracy we are accustomed to give the majority what they want rather than educate them to understand what is best for them.

author: Orson Welles
title: In Switzerland they had brotherly love, five hundred years of democracy and peace, and what did they produce? The cuckoo clock!

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Information is the currency of democracy.

author: Winston Churchill
title: It has been said that Democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.

author: Brad Henry
title: It is a paradox that far too few Americans participate in the wonderful ritual of democracy that we call Election Day.

author: Thomas Mann
title: It is a strange fact that freedom and equality, the two basic ideas of democracy, are to some extent contradictory. Logically considered, freedom and equality are mutually exclusive, just as society and the individual are mutually exclusive.

author: Hubert H. Humphrey
title: It is not enough to merely defend democracy. To defend it may be to lose it; to extend it is to strengthen it. Democracy is not property; it is an idea.

author: Joseph A. Schumpeter
title: It is not true that democracy will always safeguard freedom of conscience better than autocracy. Witness the most famous of all trials. Pilate was, from the standpoint of the Jews, certainly the representative of autocracy. Yet he tried to protect freedom. And he yielded to a democracy.

author: Tom Stoppard
title: It's not the voting that's democracy, it's the counting.

author: Benazir Bhutto
title: It's true that General Musharraf opposes my return, seeing me as a symbol of democracy in the country. He is comfortable with dictatorship. I hope better sense prevails.

author: Andrew Vachss
title: Journalism is what maintains democracy. It's the force for progressive social change.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
title: Man's capacity for justice makes democracy possible, but man's inclination to injustice makes democracy necessary.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Many forms of Government have been tried, and will be tried in this world of sin and woe. No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed, it has been said that democracy is the worst form of Government except all those others that have been tried from time to time.

author: Brad Holland
title: Many of the contradictions in Postmodern art come from the fact that we're trying to be artists in a democratic society. This is because in a democracy, the ideal is compromise. In art, it isn't.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Most bands don't work out. A small unit democracy is very, very difficult.

author: Abbie Hoffman
title: My critique of democracy begins and ends with this point. Kids must be educated to disrespect authority or else democracy is a farce.

author: Benigno Aquino III
title: My father offered his life so our democracy could live. My mother devoted her life to nurturing that democracy. I will dedicate my life to making our democracy reach its fullest potential: that of ensuring equality for all. My family has sacrificed much, and I am willing to do this again if necessary.

author: Camille Paglia
title: My thinking tends to be libertarian. That is, I oppose intrusions of the state into the private realm - as in abortion, sodomy, prostitution, pornography, drug use, or suicide, all of which I would strongly defend as matters of free choice in a representative democracy.

author: Beth Simone Noveck
title: Network technology has irrevocably changed campaigning and elections. It has the potential to transform governance and the workings of our democracy for the better.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: No amount of charters, direct primaries, or short ballots will make a democracy out of an illiterate people.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: Not only does democracy make every man forget his ancestors, but also clouds their view of their descendants and isolates them from their contemporaries. Each man is for ever thrown back on himself alone, and there is danger that he may be shut up in the solitude of his own heart.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Nothing can be more abhorrent to democracy than to imprison a person or keep him in prison because he is unpopular. This is really the test of civilization.

author: Ang Lee
title: On a Chinese film you just give orders, no one questions you. Here, you have to convince people, you have to tell them why you want to do it a certain way, and they argue with you. Democracy.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: Our democracy is the centerpiece of who we are as a nation. And it is the fondest hope of all Americans that we can help bring democracy to every corner of the world.

author: Bill Clinton
title: Our democracy must be not only the envy of the world but the engine of our own renewal. There is nothing wrong with America that cannot be cured by what is right with America.

author: Al Gore
title: Our democracy, our constitutional framework is really a kind of software for harnessing the creativity and political imagination for all of our people. The American democratic system was an early political version of Napster.

author: Gore Vidal
title: Our form of democracy is bribery, on the highest scale.

author: Benazir Bhutto
title: Pakistan's future viability, stability and security lie in empowering its people and building political institutions. My goal is to prove that the fundamental battle for the hearts and minds of a generation can be accomplished only under democracy.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: Political democracy cannot last unless there lies at the base of it social democracy. What does social democracy mean? It means a way of life which recognizes liberty, equality and fraternity as the principles of life.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: Public confidence in the integrity of the Government is indispensable to faith in democracy; and when we lose faith in the system, we have lost faith in everything we fight and spend for.

author: Brad Henry
title: Reading builds the educated and informed electorate so vital to our democracy.

author: John Adams
title: Remember, democracy never lasts long. It soon wastes, exhausts, and murders itself. There never was a democracy yet that did not commit suicide.

author: Brent Scowcroft
title: Saddam's ouster will not necessarily lead to the same result, since Iraq lacks democratic traditions. Democracy doesn't just consist of holding elections.

author: Bayard Rustin
title: Since Israel is a democratic state surrounded by essentially undemocratic states which have sworn her destruction, those interested in democracy everywhere must support Israel's existence.

author: Caleb Cushing
title: Sir, I am a republican; and I desire to see this House observe the principles of that democracy which is ever on the lips of its members, and which, I hope, is in their hearts, as I know and feel it is in mine, and mean it shall be in my conduct.

author: Carol Moseley Braun
title: So I think that if we want to have a Congress, if we want to have government that looks like America, if we want to have government that is truly a representative Democracy, then we need to clearly address how we get our campaign laws out of the way of Democracy.

author: Roger Sherman Baldwin
title: So long as we have enough people in this country willing to fight for their rights, we'll be called a democracy.

author: Augusto Pinochet
title: Sometimes democracy must be bathed in blood.

author: Bill Lipinski
title: Speak up! We live in a democracy. We all need to make sure our voices are heard and our opinions are known.

author: Aaron Brown
title: Television is the most perfect democracy. You sit there with your remote control and vote.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: The American people need to know the truth. The American people need to see the truth. In a democracy, letting the people know the truth is the essence of what it means to be free.

author: Barbara Mikulski
title: The American system of democracy is founded on the concept that every citizen has the right to vote, to know that their vote is counted, and that the vote is counted accurately.

author: Winston Churchill
title: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.

author: Algernon Sydney
title: The best Governments of the World have bin composed of Monarchy, Aristocracy, and Democracy.

author: B. W. Powe
title: The corporatist-economic model of society appears to be governing us. Economists, often in the pay of transnationals, are deciding, for us, what democracy is, and will be.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The cure for the evils of democracy is more democracy.

author: Aung San Suu Kyi
title: The democracy process provides for political and social change without violence.

author: Beji Caid Essebsi
title: The democratic process is always vulnerable and threatened by terrorists, by parties that do not believe in democracy.

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
title: The East knew and to the present day knows only that One is Free; the Greek and the Roman world, that some are free; the German World knows that All are free. The first political form therefore which we observe in History, is Despotism, the second Democracy and Aristocracy, the third, Monarchy.

author: Arlen Specter
title: The essence of a democracy is a free electorate.

author: Anna Garlin Spencer
title: The essence of democracy is its assurance that every human being should so respect himself and should be so respected in his own personality that he should have opportunity equal to that of every other human being to show what he was meant to become.

author: Barack Obama
title: The essential truth of democracy is that each nation determines its own destiny.

author: James Baldwin
title: The establishment of democracy on the American continent was scarcely as radical a break with the past as was the necessity, which Americans faced, of broadening this concept to include black men.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: The fact that free men persist in the search for the truth is the essential difference between Communism and Democracy.,

author: Benjamin Whichcote
title: The government of man should be the monarchy of reason: it is too often the democracy of passions or the anarchy of humors.

author: Antonio Villaraigosa
title: The great thing about our system of democracy is when they call you for jury duty, you have to come... It's an honor and a privilege. I was called and I've got to be here.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: The greatest blessing of our democracy is freedom. But in the last analysis, our only freedom is the freedom to discipline ourselves.

author: Bernie Sanders
title: The history of American democracy, to say the least, has been checkered. Our nation was founded at a time when people of African descent were held in bondage. After slavery was abolished, they were forced to endure legal discrimination for another 100 years.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: The ignorance of one voter in a democracy impairs the security of all.

author: Barbara Lee
title: The last two elections were stolen. They were stolen and so we will not rest until we reclaim our democracy and this is what today is all about.

author: Amy Goodman
title: The media is absolutely essential to the functioning of a democracy. It's not our job to cozy up to power. We're supposed to be the check and balance on government.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The more I see of democracy the more I dislike it. It just brings everything down to the mere vulgar level of wages and prices, electric light and water closets, and nothing else.

author: C. L. R. James
title: The Paris Commune was first and foremost a democracy. The government was a body elected by universal suffrage.

author: Bill Richardson
title: The President, in talking about freedom and democracy, is sparking a wave of very positive democratic sentiment that might help us override both Islamic fundamentalism that has formed in that region, and also some of the hatred for our policies of invading Iraq.

author: Benjamin Graham
title: The Reservoir plan is and engineering mechanism applied to the field of economics, and in its essence it has nothing to do with democracy or any other political philosophy.

author: Grover Cleveland
title: The ship of Democracy, which has weathered all storms, may sink through the mutiny of those aboard.

author: Mikhail Gorbachev
title: The soviet people want full-blooded and unconditional democracy.

author: Aung San Suu Kyi
title: The struggle for democracy and human rights in Burma is a struggle for life and dignity. It is a struggle that encompasses our political, social and economic aspirations.

author: Byron Dorgan
title: The U.S. Constitution is the basic framework for the greatest democracy on Earth. Some of my colleagues find it easy to amend it. I don't.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: The world is weary of statesmen whom democracy has degraded into politicians.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: The world must be made safe for democracy.

author: Aneurin Bevan
title: The worst thing I can say about democracy is that it has tolerated the Right Honorable Gentleman for four and a half years.

author: Hillary Clinton
title: The worst thing that can happen in a democracy - as well as in an individual's life - is to become cynical about the future and lose hope.,

author: Ralph Nader
title: There can be no daily democracy without daily citizenship.

author: Bidzina Ivanishvili
title: There is a real and evident problem of democracy in Georgia, and this was the core reason of my entrance into politics. We have no rule of law. It's absolutely absent.

author: Carlisle Floyd
title: There is something inherent in our democracy that tends to want to level. America is a little uncomfortable in the presence of someone who is distinctly superior in whatever way.

author: Bobby Ghosh
title: There's much talk about how there can't be democracy in a region that has problems of illiteracy and poverty. But I bring a different idea to the table when I say, 'Guys, I come from India. I'm more optimistic coming from where I'm coming.'

author: Plato
title: These, then, will be some of the features of democracy... it will be, in all likelihood, an agreeable, lawless, parti-colored commonwealth, dealing with all alike on a footing of equality, whether they be really equal or not.

author: Boris Johnson
title: This is an absolute turning point in the story of our country because I think if we go on with being enmeshed in the E.U., it will continue to erode our democracy. That is something that worries me.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: To acquire immunity to eloquence is of the utmost importance to the citizens of a democracy.

author: Beth Simone Noveck
title: To me, technology was a means to an end to achieve the social justice goals, stronger democracy and more effective government that is the aim of what I do.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: To win the cause we all believe in, the spread of true democracy all over the world, we need to win by example, not just with speeches but by example; not just with military might but by gaining the respect of the world.

author: Barack Obama
title: Tonight we proved once more that the true strength of our nation comes not from the might of our arms or the scale of our wealth, but from the enduring power of our ideals: democracy, liberty, opportunity and unyielding hope.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Tradition means giving votes to the most obscure of all classes - our ancestors. It is the democracy of the dead. Tradition refuses to submit to the small and arrogant oligarchy of those who merely happen to be walking around.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: Two cheers for Democracy: one because it admits variety and two because it permits criticism.

author: Bradley A. Smith
title: Ultimately, the court is heading to a doctrine of 'separation of campaign and state.' This doctrine, like separation of church and state or separation of military and civilian authority, is not explicit in the Constitution but flows naturally from its structure and commitment to freedom and democracy.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: Unless democracy is to commit suicide by consenting to its own destruction, it will have to find some formidable answer to those who come to it saying: ''I demand from you in the name of your principles the rights which I shall deny to you later in the name of my principles.''

author: Blanche Lincoln
title: Voters must have faith in the electoral process for our democracy to succeed.

author: Arlen Specter
title: Voting is fundamental in our democracy. It has yielded enormous returns.

author: Abu Bakar Bashir
title: We have shown that Islam can rule the world perfectly for 14 centuries, and during this time of Muslim power we did not borrow ideas like democracy from others, so why do we need to learn democracy from them now?

author: Aaron McGruder
title: We have, essentially, a worthless democracy.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: We need to give the Iraqis a chance to build their own future. It should be in their hands. It must be in their hands. That is what democracy is all about. We can teach it, we can explain it, but they must want it enough to make it work for them.

author: Bob Menendez
title: We should seek international support for our mutual objectives abroad, in promoting freedom, democracy, respect for human rights, and also the elimination of weapons of mass destruction.

author: Ahmet Necdet Sezner
title: We shouldn't waste any more time in making sure that democracy is properly rooted in our political life and the supremacy of the law becomes an integral part of our state's structure.

author: A. Philip Randolph
title: We want the full works of citizenship with no reservations. We will accept nothing less... This condition of freedom, equality, and democracy is not the gift of gods. It is the task of men, yes, men, brave men, honest men, determined men.

author: Adam Schiff
title: We will not let terrorists change our way of life; we will not live in fear; and we will not undermine the civil liberties that characterize our Democracy.

author: Bhumibol Adulyadej
title: Western people ask me whether it is a paradox that I am King but support democracy. I have to tell them that in Thailand, the King is the guarantor of democracy.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: What is the most important for democracy is not that great fortunes should not exist, but that great fortunes should not remain in the same hands. In that way there are rich men, but they do not form a class.

author: Angela Davis
title: When Bush says democracy, I often wonder what he's referring to.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: When the Soviet Union fell, optimistic scholars believed the world had shifted inexorably in the direction of free markets and liberal democracy. Instead, the West gradually embraced bigger government and weaker social bonds, creating a fragmented society in which the only thing we all belong to, as President Barack Obama puts it, is the state.

author: Campbell Brown
title: While the protection of speech is at the bedrock of our democracy, it's critical as a nation that we exercise our right every day - and that includes embracing and engaging with those we may not agree with.

author: James Connolly
title: Without the power of the Industrial Union behind it, Democracy can only enter the State as the victim enters the gullet of the Serpent.

author: Malcolm X
title: You and I have never seen democracy; all we've seen is hypocrisy.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: You can never have a revolution in order to establish a democracy. You must have a democracy in order to have a revolution.

author: George W. Bush
title: You can't put democracy and freedom back into a box.,

author: Barbara Boxer
title: You know, I wish the world well. I want Iraq to have democracy and the Haitians to have democracy. I want the people of Afghanistan to thrive. Lord knows, we spend enough money there to help them. What about people at home? Isn't that our first responsibility?

author: Abbie Hoffman
title: You measure a democracy by the freedom it gives its dissidents, not the freedom it gives its assimilated conformists.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A democracy which makes or even effectively prepares for modern, scientific war must necessarily cease to be democratic. No country can be really well prepared for modern war unless it is governed by a tyrant, at the head of a highly trained and perfectly obedient bureaucracy.

author: Novalis
title: Christianity is the root of all democracy, the highest fact in the rights of men.

author: author
title: title

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Adapt yourself to the things among which your lot has been cast and love sincerely the fellow creatures with whom destiny has ordained that you shall live.

author: André Maurois
title: If you create an act, you create a habit. If you create a habit, you create a character. If you create a character, you create a destiny.

author: André Maurois
title: If you create an act, you create a habit. If you create a habit, you create a character. If you create a character, you create a destiny.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: More than anything else, I believe it's our decisions, not the conditions of our lives, that determine our destiny.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: A consistent man believes in destiny, a capricious man in chance.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: A consistent soul believes in destiny, a capricious one in chance.

author: Omar Khayyam
title: 'Tis all a Checker-board of Nights and days where Destiny with Men for Pieces plays: Hither and thither moves, and mates and slays, and one by one back in the Closet lays.

author: Michel Faber
title: A single day spent doing things which fail to nourish the soul is a day stolen, mutilated, and discarded in the gutter of destiny.

author: A. L. Linall Jr
title: Actions are the seed of fate deeds grow into destiny.

author: R. D. Laing
title: Alienation as our present destiny is achieved only by outrageous violence perpetrated by human beings on human beings.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: America lives in the heart of every man everywhere who wishes to find a region where he will be free to work out his destiny as he chooses.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: Anatomy is destiny.

author: Albert Einstein
title: And the high destiny of the individual is to serve rather than to rule, or to impose himself in any other way.

author: André Malraux
title: And when man faces destiny, destiny ends and man comes into his own.

author: Denis Waitley
title: As long as we are persistence in our pursuit of our deepest destiny, we will continue to grow. We cannot choose the day or time when we will fully bloom. It happens in its own time.

author: Henry Kissinger
title: Blessed are the people whose leaders can look destiny in the eye without flinching but also without attempting to play God.

author: Heraclitus
title: Character is our destiny.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Concerning God, freewill and destiny: Of all that earth has been or yet may be, all that vain men imagine or believe, or hope can paint or suffering may achieve, we descanted.

author: Jack Welch
title: Control your own destiny or someone else will.,

author: Albert Camus
title: Culture: the cry of men in face of their destiny.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: Destiny has two ways of crushing us - by refusing our wishes and by fulfilling them.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: Destiny is an absolutely definite and inexorable ruler. Physical ability and moral determination count for nothing. It is impossible to perform the simplest act when the gods say ''no.'' I have no idea how they bring pressure to bear on such occasions; I only know that it is irresistible.

author: William Jennings Bryan
title: Destiny is no matter of chance. It is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.

author: William Jennings Bryan
title: Destiny is not a matter of chance, it is a matter of choice; it is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.

author: Aeschylus
title: Destiny waits alike for the free man as well as for him enslaved by another's might.

author: James Baldwin
title: Employment is my right my destiny.

author: Bob Marley
title:
Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.,
,

author: Henry Miller
title: Every man has his own destiny: the only imperative is to follow it, to accept it, no matter where it leads him.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Fame comes only when deserved, and then is as inevitable as destiny, for it is destiny.

author: Lawrence Durrell
title: For us artists there waits the joyous compromise through art with all that wounded or defeated us in daily life; in this way, not to evade destiny, as the ordinary people try to do, but to fulfil it in its true potential, the imagination.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: Helping people in need is a good and essential part of my life, a kind of destiny.

author: Buckminster Fuller
title: Humans have always unknowingly affected all Universe by every act and thought they articulate or even consider.... Realistic, comprehensively responsible, omni-system-considerate, unselfish thinking on the part of humans does absolutely affect human destiny.

author: Alija Izetbegovic
title: I believe that the people, instead of pretty lies, should be told the truth, no matter how ugly it may be. What can we do, destiny hasn't been kind to us; but, with the help of God, we will prevail.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: I believe that you control your destiny, that you can be what you want to be. You can also stop and say, No, I won't do it, I won't behave his way anymore. I'm lonely and I need people around me, maybe I have to change my methods of behaving and then you do it

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: I don't know what your destiny will be, but one thing I know: the only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.

author: Richard Nixon
title: I don't think that a leader can control to any great extent his destiny. Very seldom can he step in and change the situation if the forces of history are running in another direction.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: I have no doubt that it is a part of the destiny of the human race, in its gradual improvement, to leave off eating animals, as surely as the savage tribes have left off eating each other when they came in contact with the more civilized.

author: Jeanette Winterson
title: I knew it like destiny, and at the same time, I knew it as choice.

author: Ang Lee
title: I took the name Green Destiny from - well there is such a sword called Green Destiny. It is green because you keep twisting it, it's an ancient skill, you keep twisting it and knocking it and twisting it until it is very elastic and light.

author: Carl Schurz
title: Ideals are like stars; you will not succeed in touching them with your hands. But like the seafaring man on the desert of waters, you choose them as your guides, and following them you will reach your destiny.

author: Albert Camus
title: If Christianity is pessimistic as to man, it is optimistic as to human destiny. Well, I can say that, pessimistic as to human destiny, I am optimistic as to man.

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: If life be a war, it seemed my destiny to conduct it single-handed.

author: Wyndham Lewis
title: If you do not regard feminism with an uplifting sense of the gloriousness of woman's industrial destiny, or in the way, in short, that it is prescribed, by the rules of the political publicist, that you should, that will be interpreted by your opponents as an attack on woman.

author: W. Clement Stone
title: If you employed study, thinking, and planning time daily, you could develop and use the power that can change the course of your destiny.

author: Albert Camus
title: In default of inexhaustible happiness, eternal suffering would at least give us a destiny. But we do not even have that consolation, and our worst agonies come to an end one day.

author: Barry Unsworth
title: In my generation, history was taught in terms of grand figures, men on whom the destiny of the nation hinged, quintessential heroes.

author: Benjamin Graham
title: Instead of passing blithely over into that Promised Land, flowing almost literally with milk and honey, it may be our destiny to wander a full 40 years or more in the wilderness of doubt and divided sentiments.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: Is the destiny of the human species to sit back and play with our mouse and computer and imagine, fantasize?

author: Winston Churchill
title: It is a mistake to look too far ahead. Only one link in the chain of destiny can be handled at a time.

author: Tony Robbins
title: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.,

author: Anthony Robbins
title: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.

author: William Shakespeare
title: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves; we are underlings.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
title: It is old age, rather than death, that is to be contrasted with life. Old age is life's parody, whereas death transforms life into a destiny: in a way it preserves it by giving it the absolute dimension. Death does away with time.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: It is the awareness of unfulfilled desires which gives a nation the feeling that it has a mission and a destiny.

author: Jean Nidetch
title: It's choice - not chance - that determines your destiny.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: It's not what's happening to you now or what has happened in your past that determines who you become. Rather, it's your decisions about what to focus on, what things mean to you, and what you're going to do about them that will determine your ultimate destiny.

author: Barbara Jordan
title: Let there be no illusions about the difficulty of forming this kind of a national community. It's tough, difficult, not easy. But a spirit of harmony will survive in America only if each of us remembers that we share a common destiny.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: Let us resolve to be masters, not the victims, of our history, controlling our own destiny without giving way to blind suspicions and emotions.

author: Kin Hubbard
title: Lots of folks confuse bad management with destiny.

author: Thomas Merton
title: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.

author: Quentin Crisp
title: Love is the extra effort we make in our dealings with those whom we do not like and once you understand that, you understand all. This idea that love overtakes you is nonsense. This is but a polite manifestation of sex. To love another you have to undertake some fragment of their destiny.

author: Alfred A. Montapert
title: Man's ultimate destiny is to become one with the Divine Power which governs and sustains the creation and its creatures.

author: Juvenal
title: Many commit the same crime with a different destiny; one bears a cross as the price of his villainy, another wears a crown.

author: Kofi Annan
title: More than ever before in human history, we share a common destiny. We can master it only if we face it together. And that, my friends, is why we have the United Nations.

author: Barry Humphries
title: Most of my contemporaries at school entered the World of Business, the logical destiny of bores.

author: David Seabury
title: Nature is at work.. Character and destiny are her handiwork. She gives us love and hate, jealousy and reverence. All that is ours is the power to choose which impulse we shall follow.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Neither dead nor alive, the hostage is suspended by an incalculable outcome. It is not his destiny that awaits for him, nor his own death, but anonymous chance, which can only seem to him something absolutely arbitrary. He is in a state of radical emergency, of virtual extermination.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: No cause has he to say his doom is harsh, who's made the master of his destiny.

author: Henry Miller
title: No man is great enough or wise enough for any of us to surrender our destiny to. The only way in which anyone can lead us is to restore to us the belief in our own guidance.

author: Agnes de Mille
title: No trumpets sound when the important decisions of our life are made. Destiny is made known silently.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: Not without a shudder may the human hand reach into the mysterious urn of destiny.

author: Wendell Phillips
title: On a single winged word hath hung the destiny of nations.

author: Daniel Webster
title: One country, one constitution, one destiny.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Only by joy and sorrow does a person know anything about themselves and their destiny. They learn what to do and what to avoid.

author: John Louis O'Sullivan
title: Other nations have tried to check... the fulfillment of our manifest destiny to overspread the continent allotted by Providence for the free development of our yearly multiplying millions.

author: Alan Cohen
title: Our history is not our destiny.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: Our problems are man-made, therefore they may be solved by man. No problem of human destiny is beyond human beings.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: Our true destiny is not to be ministered unto but to minister to ourselves and to our fellow men.

author: James Baldwin
title: People who believe that they are strong-willed and the masters of their destiny can only continue to believe this by becoming specialists in self-deception.

author: Al Goldstein
title: So, if anatomy is destiny then testosterone is doom.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Sow a thought and you reap an action; sow an act and you reap a habit; sow a habit and you reap a character; sow a character and you reap a destiny.

author: Bill Frist
title: Space offers extraordinary potential for commerce and adventure, for new innovations and new tests of will. As Americans, we can't help but reach for the stars. It's our nature. It's our destiny.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Strange things blow in through my window on the wings of the night wind and I don't worry about my destiny.

author: Beth Henley
title: That's what I like about [smoking]... taking a drag off of death, Mmm! Gives me a sense of controlling my own destiny. What power! What exhilaration! Want a drag?

author: Albert Ellis
title: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.

author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon
title: The chief condition on which, life, health and vigor depend on, is action. It is by action that an organism develops its faculties, increases its energy, and attains the fulfillment of its destiny.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The destiny of any nation at any given time depends on the opinion of its young people, those under twenty-five.

author: Eric Berne
title: The destiny of every human being is decided by what goes on inside his skull when confronted by what goes on outside his skull.

author: Herodotus
title: The destiny of man is in his own soul

author: Barack Obama
title: The essential truth of democracy is that each nation determines its own destiny.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: The first duty of society is to give each of its members the possibility of fulfilling his destiny. When it becomes incapable of performing this duty it must be transformed.

author: Bobby Seale
title: The first point was we wanted power to determine our own destiny in our own black community. And what we had done is, we wanted to write a program that was straightforward to the people. We didn't want to give a long dissertation.

author: Napoleon
title: The future destiny of the child is always the work of the mother.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The high destiny of the individual is to serve rather than to rule...

author: James Allen
