title: title

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: A politician divides mankind into two classes; tools and enemies.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: Let your enemies be disarmed by the gentleness of your manner, but at the same time let them feel, the steadiness of your resentment.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Am I not destroying my enemies when I make friends of them?

author: Ann Oakley
title: Men are the enemies of women. Promising sublime intimacy, unequalled passion, amazing security and grace, they nevertheless exploit and injure in a myriad subtle ways. Without men the world would be a better place: softer, kinder, more loving; calmer, quieter, more humane.

author: Antisthenes
title: Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because they are generally the same people.

author: Laurence Sterne
title: 'Tis no extravagant arithmetic to say, that for every ten jokes, thou hast got an hundred enemies; and till thou hast gone on, and raised a swarm of wasps about thine ears, and art half stung to death by them, thou wilt never be convinced it is so.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: A friend is one who has the same enemies as you have.

author: Lord Henry P. Brougham
title: A lawyer is a gentlemen that rescues your estate from your enemies and then keeps it to himself.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A man can't be too careful in the choice of his enemies.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act.

author: William Wrigley Jr
title: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms agains himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.

author: Max Lerner
title: A President is best judged by the enemies he makes when he has really hit his stride.

author: Baltasar Gracián
title: A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.

author: Jeanette Winterson
title: After every ''victory'' you have more enemies.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Ambition. An overmastering desire to be vilified by enemies while living and made ridiculous by friends when dead.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Ambition: An overmastering desire to be vilified by enemies while living and made ridiculous by friends when dead.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Anger and intolerance are the enemies of correct understanding.,

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: Beware of no man more than of yourself; we carry our worst enemies within us.

author: Audre Lorde
title: Black women sharing close ties with each other, politically or emotionally, are not the enemies of Black men.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: Bored with your present enemies? Make new ones! Tell two of your women friends that they look alike.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: Comforts and syphilis are the greatest enemies of mankind.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Concerned about re-election, interest-group reactions, the media, or fundraising, many legislators have found it in their interest to refuse to cooperate with members of the opposing party - or to treat them as enemies in some kind of war, in which the whole point is to defeat and humiliate them. But the American people have been the real losers.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Convictions are more dangerous enemies of truth than lies.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Do good to your friends to keep them, to your enemies to win them.

author: Bob Riley
title: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.

author: Katharine Hepburn
title: Enemies are so stimulating.,

author: Aesop
title: Enemies promises were made to be broken.

author: Henry Kissinger
title: Even a paranoid can have enemies.

author: Brin-Jonathan Butler
title: Exploring Castro's pawns in Cuba and exposing anything negative also makes you a pawn to all his enemies 90 miles away. Both sides don't have much of a track record for nuance of opinion.

author: John Steinbeck
title: Father and son are natural enemies and each is happier and more secure in keeping it that way.

author: Francesco Petrarca
title: Five enemies of peace inhabit with us - avarice, ambition, envy, anger, and pride; if these were to be banished, we should infallibly enjoy perpetual peace.

author: Laurence Sterne
title: For every ten jokes you acquire a hundred enemies.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.

author: Arthur Bloch
title: Friends come and go but enemies accumulate.

author: Thomas Jones
title: Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate.

author: John Frederick Boyes
title: Friends should be very delicate and careful in administering pity as medicine, when enemies use the same article as poison.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Generalized intelligence and mental alertness are the most powerful enemies of dictatorship and at the same time the basic conditions of effective democracy.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Give us grace and strength to forbear and to persevere. Give us courage and gaiety and the quiet mind, spare to us our friends, soften to us our enemies.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Had I but served my God with half the zeal I served my King, He would not in mine age have left me naked to mine enemies.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Hatred of enemies is easier and more intense than love of friends. But from men who are more anxious to injure opponents than to benefit the world at large no great good is to be expected.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.

author: Sydney Smith
title: His enemies might have said before that he talked rather too much; but now he has occasional flashes of silence, that make his conversation perfectly delightful.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: Historically, defense spending cuts have preceded increased international turmoil as America's global enemies sense a failure of will.

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: I can be on guard against my enemies, but God deliver me from my friends!

author: Oscar Wilde
title: I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects.

author: Aristotle
title: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies; for the hardest victory is the victory over self.

author: Mario Puzo
title: I don't feel I have to wipe everybody out, Tom. Just my enemies.

author: Buffalo Bill
title: I had many enemies among the Sioux; I would be running considerable risk in meeting them.

author: Gerald R. Ford
title: I have had a lot of adversaries in my political life, but no enemies that I can remember.

author: Arthur Miller
title: I have made more friends for American culture than the State Department. Certainly I have made fewer enemies, but that isn't very difficult.

author: Cormac McCarthy
title: I have no enemies. I dont permit such a thing.

author: Aristotle Onassis
title: I have no friends and no enemies - only competitors.

author: Warren Gamaliel Harding
title: I have no trouble with my enemies. I can take care of my enemies all right. But my damn friends. They're the ones that keep me walking the floor nights!

author: Walt Whitman
title: I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends.

author: André Gide
title: I owe much to my friends; but, all things considered, it strikes me that I owe even more to my enemies. The real person springs life under a sting even better than under a caress.

author: Arthur Hertzberg
title: I regard Christian and Jewish fundamentalism, and all other forms of fundamentalism, as the enemies of God - and I hope you'll quote me on that.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: If those who are the enemies of innocent amusements had the direction of the world, they would take away the spring, and youth, the former from the year, the latter from human life.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: If we could read the secret history of our enemies, we would find in each person's life sorrow and suffering enough to disarm all hostility.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: If we cut up beasts simply because they cannot prevent us and because we are backing our own side in the struggle for existence, it is only logical to cut up imbeciles, criminals, enemies, or capitalists for the same reasons.

author: Cate Blanchett
title: If you age with somebody, you go through so many roles - you're lovers, friends, enemies, colleagues, strangers; you're brother and sister. That's what intimacy is, if you're with your soulmate.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: If you have no enemies you are apt to be in the same predicament in regard to friends.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.

author: Voltaire
title: In my life, I have prayed but one prayer: oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it.

author: Martin Luther King
title: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.

author: Brigham Young
title: Is there war in our religion? No; neither war nor bloodshed. Yet our enemies cry out bloodshed, and oh, what dreadful men these Mormons are, and those Danites! how they slay and kill! Such is all nonsense and folly in the extreme. The wicked slay the wicked, and they will lay it on the Saints.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: It is a pitiful fortune that is not without enemies.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: It is always safe to learn, even from our enemies; seldom safe to venture to instruct, even our friends.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: It is difficult to say who do you the most harm: enemies with the worst intentions or friends with the best.

author: Frank Dane
title: It is not necessary to have enemies if you go out of your way to make friends hate you.

author: Leon Trotsky
title: Learning carries within itself certain dangers because out of necessity one has to learn from one's enemies.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: Little, vicious minds abound with anger and revenge, and are incapable of feeling the pleasure of forgiving their enemies.

author: Bob Wells
title: Look around. There are no enemies here. There's just good, old-fashioned rivalry.

author: Robert Greene
title: Lord, protect me from my friends; I can take care of my enemies.

author: R A Dickson
title: Love your enemies just in case your friends turn out to be a bunch of bastards.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Lovers may be - and indeed generally are - enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.

author: Baltasar Gracián
title: Many have had their greatness made for them by their enemies.

author: Voltaire
title: May God defend me from my friends; I can defend myself from my enemies.

author: George S. Patton
title: May God have mercy uppon my enemies, because i won't.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Men are by nature merely indifferent to one another; but women are by nature enemies.

author: Aristophanes
title: Men of sense often learn from their enemies. It is from their foes, not their friends, that cities learn the lesson of building high walls and ships of war.

author: Betty Williams
title: Men, once enemies, are now jointly governing in Northern Ireland. And although there have been several hitches, by and large it's working well.

author: Somers White
title: Money can't buy you friends; but you do get a better class of enemies.

author: Voltaire
title: My prayer to God is a very short one: ''O Lord, make my enemies look ridiculous!'' God has granted it.

author: Betty Parsons
title: My reputation was built on hostility. I had no friends and some very virulent enemies in the old-guard art scene when I began. They threw their heavy artillery against me. They were convinced I was perverting the public taste.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: Never disregard what your enemies say. They may be severe, they may be prejudiced, they may be determined to see only in one direction, but still in that direction see clearly. They do not speak all the truth, but they generally speak the truth from one point of view; so far as that goes, attend to them.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Never explain - your friends don't need it and your enemies won't believe you anyway.

author: Carl Hayden
title: Never give your enemies any more reason than they already have to go on hating you.

author: Mario Puzo
title: Never hate your enemies. It affects your judgment.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.,

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: No man ever got very high by pulling other people down. The intelligent merchant does not knock his competitors. The sensible worker does not work those who work with him. Don't knock your friends. Don't knock your enemies. Don't knock yourself.

author: Hitopadesa
title: One should not lift the rod against our enemies upon the private information of another.

author: Assata Shakur
title: Only a fool lets somebody else tell him who his enemy is....never let your enemies choose your enemies for you.

author: Stephen King
title: Only enemies speak the truth; friends and lovers lie endlessly, caught in the web of duty.

author: Carolyn McCarthy
title: Our pre-9/11 gun laws allow our enemies in the War on Terror to arm themselves right here in our own country.

author: Antisthenes
title: Pay attention to your enemies for they are the first to discover your mistakes.

author: Edmund Burke
title: People crushed by laws, have no hope but to evade power. If the laws are their enemies, they will be enemies to the law; and those who have must to hope and nothing to lose will always be dangerous.

author: Angela Carter
title: Pornographers are the enemies of women only because our contemporary ideology of pornography does not encompass the possibility of change, as if we were the slaves of history and not its makers. Pornography is a satire on human pretensions.

author: Bono
title: Poverty breeds despair. We know this. Despair breeds violence. We know this. In turbulent times, isn't it cheaper, and smarter, to make friends out of potential enemies than to defend yourself against them later?

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: Progress is a nice word, but change is its motivator and change has enemies.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title:
Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator. And change has its enemies.,
,

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Promises may fit the friends, but non-performance will turn them into enemies.

author: Frances Cornford
title: Propaganda is that branch of the art of lying which consists in nearly deceiving your friends without quite deceiving your enemies.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: Putin himself is a character out of fiction, an uber-macho former Soviet thug running a massive, expansionist kleptocracy. The man stages photographs riding horses barechested and hunting tigers. His enemies find themselves on the wrong end of radioactive poisoning.

author: John Enoch Powell
title: Remove advertising, disable a person or firm from proclaiming its wares and their merits, and the whole of society and of the economy is transformed. The enemies of advertising are the enemies of freedom.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Subtract from the great man all that he owes to opportunity, all that he owes to chance, and all that he gained by the wisdom of his friends and the folly of his enemies, and the giant will often be seen to be a pygmy.

author: Christopher Morley
title: The enemies of the future are always the very nicest people.

author: Sir William Temple
title: The first glass is for myself, the second for my friends, the third for good humor, and the forth for my enemies.

author: Jean Rostand
title: The ideal, without doubt, varies, but its enemies, alas, are always the same.

author: Harold Nicolson
title: The Irish do not want anyone to wish them well; they want everyone to wish their enemies ill.

author: Bill Murray
title: The more relaxed you are, the better you are at everything: the better you are with your loved ones, the better you are with your enemies, the better you are at your job, the better you are with yourself.

author: Bob Woodward
title: The number of illegal activities were so large that one was bound to come out and lead to the uncovering of the others. Nixon was too willing to use the power of government to settle scores and get even with enemies.

author: Camille Paglia
title: The only thing that will be remembered about my enemies after they're dead is the nasty things I've said about them.

author: Carl Lewis
title: The people are fed up with their elected officials playing the blame game and treating their political counterparts as enemies.

author: Don Piatt
title: The person who has no enemies has no followers.

author: Thucydides
title: The sufferings that fate inflicts on us should be borne with patience, what enemies inflict with manly courage.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: The supreme excellence is not to win a hundred victories in a hundred battles. The supreme excellence is to subdue the armies of your enemies without even having to fight them.

author: Carl Levin
title: The terrorist attacks of September 11th and the courageous actions of our armed forces in Afghanistan and Iraq remind us that friends of tyranny and enemies of freedom still exist.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The two enemies of human happiness are pain and boredom.

author: Samuel P. Huntington
title: There can be no true friends without true enemies. Unless we hate what we are not, we cannot love what we are.

author: Homer
title: There is nothing nobler or more admirable than when two people who see eye to eye keep house as man and wife, confounding their enemies and delighting their friends.

author: Plato
title: To the rulers of the state then, if to any, it belongs of right to use falsehood, to deceive either enemies or their own citizens, for the good of the state: and no one else may meddle with this privilege.

author: Emily Brontë
title: Treachery and violence are spears pointed at both ends; they wound those who resort to them worse than their enemies.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Trump is more performance artist than zealot. But he's finding enemies everywhere, whether they are judges of Mexican ancestry, parents of those killed in war, the current president, or children of immigrants. Whether or not he has a sense of decency, he is in grave danger of losing it.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: Truth of a modest sort I can promise you, and also sincerity. That complete, praiseworthy sincerity which, while it delivers one into the hands of one's enemies, is as likely as not to embroil one with one's friends.

author: Andrew Vachss
title: Victimizers of children are the enemies of any so-called society.

author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti
title: Was it a friend or foe that spread these lies? Nay, who but infants question in such wise,  'twas one of my most intimate enemies.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: We are not enemies, but friends. We must not be enemies. Though passion may have strained, it must not break our bonds of affection. The mystic chords of memory, stretching from every battle-field, and patriot grave, to every living heart and hearthstone, all over this broad land, will yet swell the chorus of the Union, when again touched, as surely they will be, by the better angels of our nature.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: We can come to look upon the deaths of our enemies with as much regret as we feel for those of our friends, namely, when we miss their existence as witnesses to our success.

author: George Orwell
title: We do not merely destroy our enemies; we change them.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: We make our friends; we make our enemies; but God makes our next door neighbor.

author: Ben Carson
title: We need to understand that we are not each others' enemies in this country. And it is only the political class that derives its power by creating friction. It is only the media that derives its importance by creating friction... that uses every little thing to create this chasm between people. This is not who we are.

author: Aesop
title: We often give our enemies the means for our own destruction.

author: Cormac McCarthy
title: What joins men together ... is not the sharing of bread but the sharing of enemies.

author: Ben Jonson
title: When a virtuous man is raised, it brings gladness to his friends, grief to his enemies, and glory to his posterity.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When Christ says, ‘Forgive your enemies,’ it is not for the sake of the enemy, but for one’s own sake that he says so, and because love is more beautiful than hate.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: When we turn to one another for counsel we reduce the number of our enemies.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: When you are ill make haste to forgive your enemies, for you may recover.

author: Umberto Eco
title: When your true enemies are too strong, you have to choose weaker enemies.

author: Mary Caroline Richards
title: Who are enemies? Those who oppose each others will.

author: Aristophanes
title: Wise men learn many things from their enemies.

author: Winston Churchill
title: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.,

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: You may depend upon it that he is a good man whose intimate friends are all good, and whose enemies are decidedly bad.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Our enemies approach nearer to truth in their judgments of us than we do ourselves.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Our enemies come nearer the truth in the opinions they form of us than we do in our opinion of ourselves.

author: author
title: title

author: Joseph Addison
title: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship. To raise this to the highest pitch of enjoyment, is a secret which but few discover.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Believe me! The secret of reaping the greatest fruitfulness and the greatest enjoyment from life is to live dangerously!

author: Joseph Addison
title: True happiness arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one's self, and in the next, from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.

author: Carl Friedrich Gauss
title: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.

author: Joseph Addison
title: True happiness is of a retired nature, and an enemy to pomp and noise; it arises, in the first place, from the enjoyment of one's self, and in the next from the friendship and conversation of a few select companions.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: A continual feast of commendation is only to be obtained by merit or by wealth: many are therefore obliged to content themselves with single morsels, and recompense the infrequency of their enjoyment by excess and riot, whenever fortune sets the banquet before them.

author: Chuck Noll
title: A life of frustration is inevitable for any coach whose main enjoyment is winning.

author: Butch Trucks
title: A lot of these guys come up and say, 'Man, you were my influence, the way you thrashed the drums.' They don't seem to understand I was thrashing in order to hear what I was playing. It was anger, not enjoyment - and painful.

author: Walter Bagehot
title: A slight daily unconscious luxury is hardly ever wanting to the dwellers in civilization; like the gentle air of a genial climate, it is a perpetual minute enjoyment.

author: François Fénelon
title: All earthly delights are sweeter in expectation than in enjoyment; but all spiritual pleasures more in fruition than in expectation.

author: Edmund Burke
title: All government - indeed, every human benefit and enjoyment, every virtue and every prudent act - is founded on compromise and barter.

author: Edmund Burke
title: All government, indeed every human benefit and enjoyment, every virtue, and every prudent act, is founded on compromise and barter.

author: Thomas Otway
title: Ambition is a lust that is never quenched, but grows more inflamed and madder by enjoyment.

author: Marshall Mcluhan
title: Appetite is essentially insatiable, and where it operates as a criterion of both action and enjoyment (that is, everywhere in the Western world since the sixteenth century) it will infallibly discover congenial agencies (mechanical and political) of expression.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: Art is the imposing of a pattern on experience, and our aesthetic enjoyment is recognition of the pattern.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Books, not which afford us a cowering enjoyment, but in which each thought is of unusual daring; such as an idle man cannot read, and a timid one would not be entertained by, which even make us dangerous to existing institution - such call I good books.

author: Bruce Nauman
title: But part of the enjoyment I take in it is finding the most efficient way to do it, which doesn't mean the corrections aren't made. I like to have a feeling of the whole task before I start, even if it changes.

author: Arnold Palmer
title: Concentration, Confidence, Competitive urge, Capacity for enjoyment.

author: Paul Goodman
title: Enjoyment is not a goal, it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.

author: Douglas William Jerrold
title: Even the worse of jobs has their pleasures, if I were a grave digger or a hangmen, there are some people I could work for with a great deal of enjoyment.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Every other enjoyment malice may destroy; every other panegyric envy may withhold; but no human power can deprive the boaster of his own encomiums.

author: Ken Keyes Jr
title: Everything is a gift of the universe - even joy, anger, jealously, frustration, or separateness. Everything is perfect either for our growth or our enjoyment.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: For unflagging interest and enjoyment, a household of children, if things go reasonably well, certainly all other forms of success and achievement lose their importance by comparison.

author: Bethany Hamilton
title: God created the heavens and the earth, the oceans and the waves for our enjoyment. Surfing is just my way of worshipping Him.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: I have always said and felt that true enjoyment can not be described.

author: Novalis
title: Learning is pleasurable but doing is the height of enjoyment.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Life is a progress from want to want, not from enjoyment to enjoyment.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Listen to the cry of a woman in labor at the hour of giving birth - look at the dying man's struggle at his last extremity, and then tell me whether something that begins and ends thus could be intended for enjoyment.

author: Bernard of Clairvaux
title: Love seeks no cause beyond itself and no fruit; it is its own fruit, its own enjoyment. I love because I love; I love in order that I may love.

author: Bahman Ghobadi
title: Lying and corruption are in the Iranian society in all sense of the world, and if you do research about married women, you see that a lot of them tell you they get a lot of enjoyment from breaking the rules of corruption, because just for the fact that they break the rules, it makes them oppose the system.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Man needs, for his happiness, not only the enjoyment of this or that, but hope and enterprise and change.

author: Denis Diderot
title: No man has received from nature the right to give orders to others. Freedom is a gift from heaven, and every individual of the same species has the right to enjoy it as soon as he is in enjoyment of his reason.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Not enjoyment and not sorrow, is our destined end or way; but to act that each tomorrow find us farther than today.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Not enjoyment, and not sorrow is our destined way, but to act that each tomorrow may find us further than today.

author: Hugh Blair
title: Only mediocrity of enjoyment is allowed to man.

author: Will Rogers
title: Pain is such an uncomfortable feeling that even a tiny amount of it is enough to ruin every enjoyment.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Subordination tends greatly to human happiness. Were we all upon an equality, we should have no other enjoyment than mere animal pleasure.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Success in its highest and noblest form calls for peace of mind and enjoyment and happiness which come only to the man who has found the work that he likes best.

author: Zoroaster
title: Suffer no anxiety, for he who is a sufferer of anxiety becomes regardless of enjoyment of the world and the spirit, and contraction happens to his body and soul.

author: Norman O. Brown
title: The dynamics of capitalism is postponement of enjoyment to the constantly postponed future.

author: Chauncey Depew
title: The enjoyment of life would be instantly gone if you removed the possibility of doing something.

author: Walter Benjamin
title: The greater the decrease in the social significance of an art form, the sharper the distinction between criticism and enjoyment by the public. The conventional is uncritically enjoyed, and the truly new is criticized with aversion.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: The habit of reading is the only enjoyment in which there is no alloy; it lasts when all other pleasures fade.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: The joy of life consists in the exercise of one's energies, continual growth, constant change, the enjoyment of every new experience. To stop means simply to die. The eternal mistake of mankind is to set up an attainable ideal.

author: Allen Klein
title: The lesson adults can learn here is that the world is filled with things for our enjoyment.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The secret of reaping the greatest fruitfulness and the greatest enjoyment from life is to liver dangerously.

author: B. D. Wong
title: The success of the storytellers - we're only as good as what we can withhold from the audience. Aspects of surprise and letting things play out for the audience - it's so much a part of their enjoyment. It's one of the great things about working in the movies and being a great storyteller.

author: Bobby Hull
title: Then to have Brett come along and follow in the footsteps, it's so gratifying. I get as much enjoyment out of watching Brett play as I did of entertaining people myself.

author: Nathaniel Branden
title: To preserve an unclouded capacity for the enjoyment of life is an unusual moral and psychological achievement. Contrary to popular belief, it is not the prerogative of mindlessness, but the exact opposite: It is the reward of self-esteem.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: To procrastinate seems inherent in man, for if you do to-day that you may enjoy to-morrow it is but deferring the enjoyment; so that to be idle or industrious, vicious or virtuous, is but with a view of procrastinating the one or the other.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Trouble is the next best thing to enjoyment. There is no fate in the world so horrible as to have no share in either its joys or sorrows.

author: Karl Wilhelm Von Humboldt
title: True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united.

author: Buffy Sainte-Marie
title: We allow each other so little enjoyment or even tolerance for our individualities, our uniquenesses, and yet to me, that's what it's all about.

author: Bobby Hull
title: What makes it all worthwhile is we just play for the sheer enjoyment of entertaining people and... make our families and the team we played on and the people watching, proud of what we did.

author: Thomas Traherne
title: Your enjoyment of the world is never right, till every morning you awake in Heaven: see yourself in your Father's palace; and look upon the skies, the earth, and the air as celestial joys: having such a reverend esteem of all, as if you were among the angels.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
title: Youth is too tumultuous for felicity; old age too insecure for happiness. The period most favorable to enjoyment, in a vigorous, fortunate, and generous life, is that between forty and sixty.

author: author
title: title

author: David Seabury
title: Enthusiasm is the best protection in any situation. Wholeheartedness is contagious. Give yourself, if you wish to get others.

author: Anatole France
title: I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.

author: Augustus Hare
title: A mother should give her children a superabundance of enthusiasm; that after they have lost all they are sure to lose on mixing with the world, enough may still remain to prompt fated support them through great actions.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Almost all of us long for peace and freedom; but very few of us have much enthusiasm for the thoughts, feelings, and actions that make for peace and freedom.

author: Birch Bayh
title: And I thought my loss my loss was not, certainly, the end of the world, but to lessen the enthusiasm of those young people who were signed up, I thought that was tragic.

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
title: Apathy can be overcome by enthusiasm, and enthusiasm can only be aroused by two things: first, an ideal, with takes the imagination by storm, and second, a definite intelligible plan for carrying that ideal into practice.

author: Alistair Cooke
title: As always, the British especially shudder at the latest American vulgarity, and then they embrace it with enthusiasm two years later.

author: Henry Miller
title: Back of every creation, supporting it like an arch, is faith. Enthusiasm is nothing: it comes and goes. But if one believes, then miracles occur.

author: John Wesley
title: Catch on fire with enthusiasm and people will come for miles to watch you burn.

author: Ralph Archbold
title: Charisma is the transference of enthusiasm.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: Common sense is compelled to make its way without the enthusiasm of anyone.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Courage is going from failure to failure without losing enthusiasm.

author: Earl Nightingale
title: Creativity is a natural extension of our enthusiasm.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Cushion the painful effects of hard blows by keeping the enthusiasm going strong, even if doing so requires struggle.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Earnestness is enthusiasm tempered by reason.

author: Conrad Hilton
title: Enthusiasm is a vital element toward the individual success of every man or woman.

author: Pele
title: Enthusiasm is everything. It must be taut and vibrating like a guitar string.

author: Bo Bennett
title: Enthusiasm is excitement with inspiration, motivation, and a pinch of creativity.

author: Bo Bennett
title: Enthusiasm is not the same as just being excited. One gets excited about going on a roller coaster. One becomes enthusiastic about creating and building a roller coaster.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: Enthusiasm is the energy and force that builds literal momentum of the human soul and mind.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: Enthusiasm is the genius of sincerity and truth accomplishes no victories without it.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
title: Enthusiasm is the inspiration of everything great. Without it no man is to be feared, and with it none despised.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Enthusiasm is the leaping lightning, not to be measured by the horse-power of the understanding.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Enthusiasm is the mother of effort, and without it nothing great was ever achieved.

author: Henry Ford
title: Enthusiasm is the yeast that makes your hopes shine to the stars. Enthusiasm is the sparkle in your eyes, the swing in your gait. The grip of your hand, the irresistible surge of will and energy to execute your ideas.

author: Arthur James Balfour
title: Enthusiasm moves the world.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Enthusiasm releases the drive to carry you over obstacles and adds significance to all you do.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Every great and commanding movement in the annals of the world is due to the triumph of enthusiasm. Nothing great was ever achieved without it.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: Every production of genius must be the production of enthusiasm.

author: George Sand
title: Faith is an excitement and an enthusiasm: it is a condition of intellectual magnificence to which we must cling as to a treasure, and not squander on our way through life in the small coin of empty words, or in exact and priggish argument.

author: Bo Bennett
title: Faked enthusiasm is worse than bad acting - it is bad acting with the intent to deceive.

author: James Baldwin
title: Fires can't be made with dead embers, nor can enthusiasm be stirred by spiritless men. Enthusiasm in our daily work lightens effort and turns even labor into pleasant tasks.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: Flaming enthusiasm, backed up by horse sense and persistence, is the quality that most frequently makes for success.

author: Ching I
title: He who possesses the source of enthusiasm will achieve great things. Doubt not. You will gather friends around you as a hair clasp gathers the hair.

author: Jim Valvano
title: How do you go from where you are to where you want to be? I think you have to have an enthusiasm for life. You have to have a dream, a goal, and you have to be willing to work for it.

author: James Thomson
title: I know no subject more elevating, more amazing, more ready to the poetical enthusiasm, the philosophical reflection, and the moral sentiment than the works of nature. Where can we meet such variety, such beauty, such magnificence?

author: Aishwarya Rai
title: I was studying to be an architect, I wasn't plotting to join the movies. Films were just another career option. I took acting up with the same schoolgirl enthusiasm I had for examinations. Acting is a job and I take it very seriously.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: If you are prepared to accept the consequences of your dreams then you must still regard America today with the same naive enthusiasm as the generations that discovered the New World.

author: Vince Lombardi
title: If you aren't fired up with enthusiasm, you'll be fired with enthusiasm.

author: Bruce Barton
title: If you can give your son or daughter only one gift, let it be enthusiasm.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: In things pertaining to enthusiasm, no man is sane who does not know how to be insane on proper occasions.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: It is energy - the central element of which is will - that produces the miracle that is enthusiasm in all ages. Everywhere it is what is called force of character and the sustaining power of all great action.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: It is faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth looking at.

author: Patrick Kavanagh
title: It is impossible to read the daily press without being diverted from reality. You are full of enthusiasm for the eternal verities - life is worth living, and then out of sinful curiosity you open a newspaper. You are disillusioned and wrecked.

author: Arthur James Balfour
title: It is unfortunate, considering that enthusiasm moves the world, that so few enthusiasts can be trusted to speak the truth.

author: Bruce Cockburn
title: It sounds strange to say it, but you can be in a war zone and have a lot of fun. Even though war is essentially pain on all sides, human beings have the capacity to enjoy themselves. The soldiers are mostly young people, full of enthusiasm and energy, and that's an exciting thing for an old guy like me.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title:
It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.,
,

author: Harry Houdini
title: Keep up your enthusiasm! There is nothing more contagious than exuberant enthusiasm.

author: Ivern Ball
title: Knowledge is power, but enthusiasm pulls the switch.

author: Alban Berg
title: Music is at once the product of feeling and knowledge, for it requires from its disciples, composers and performers alike, not only talent and enthusiasm, but also that knowledge and perception which are the result of protracted study and reflection.

author: Tuckerman
title: National enthusiasm is the nursery of genius.

author: John O'Brian
title: No battle of any importance can be won without enthusiasm.

author: James A. Froude
title: No person is ever good for much, that hasn't been swept off their feet by enthusiasm between ages twenty and thirty.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title:
Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.,
,

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
title: Nothing is so contagious as enthusiasm.

author: Robert Schumann
title: Nothing right can be accomplished in art without enthusiasm.

author: Arne Jacobsen
title: On the other hand, I don't understand the enthusiasm for everything in the antique shop that Grandma threw out. There, the sense of quality has declined; otherwise Grandma wouldn't have thrown it out.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: One lesson is that if you want to predict voter turnout, you should ask whether at least one candidate is attracting high levels of enthusiasm - not whether the stakes are high, or even perceived to be high. That fits the historical pattern.

author: Bode Miller
title: One of the really important things about the Olympics is, to enjoy yourself, you have to accept that it's different and feed off the enthusiasm of everyone and the inspiration and hopefully that will elevate your performance.

author: Paul J. Meyer
title: Plan your progress carefully; hour-by hour, day-by-day, month-by-month. Organized activity and maintained enthusiasm are the wellsprings of your power.

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Protect your enthusiasm from the negativity of others.,

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Ridicule has always been the enemy of enthusiasm, and the only worthy opponent to ridicule is success.

author: Adam Smith
title: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.

author: Benito Mussolini
title: Speeches made to the people are essential to the arousing of enthusiasm for a war.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.,

author: Winston Churchill
title: Success is going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.

author: Bernard Lown
title: Summits like those in Geneva promote hope. But hope without action is hopeless. Our enthusiasm for the positive spirit in these deliberations must not blind us to the absence of genuine progress toward disarmament. Twenty-four nuclear bombs are being added weekly to world arsenals.

author: George Orwell
title: The four great motives for writing prose are sheer egoism, esthetic enthusiasm, historical impulse, and political purpose.

author: Thomas J. Watson
title: The great accomplishments of man have resulted from the transmission of ideas and enthusiasm.

author: James Whitcomb Riley
title: The most essential factor is persistence - the determination never to allow your energy or enthusiasm to be dampened by the discouragement that must inevitably come.

author: Angela Merkel
title: The people in East Germany have lived through so many changes in the last 15 years like never before in the country, and they did this often with great enthusiasm. But in the West we also have a high degree of transformations.

author: Walter Chrysler
title: The real secret to success is enthusiasm.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The secret of genius is to carry the spirit of the child into old age, which means never losing your enthusiasm.,

author: Mme de Stael
title: The sense of this word among the Greeks affords the noblest definition of it; enthusiasm signifies God in us.

author: Henry Giles
title: The silent influence of books, is a mighty power in the world; and there is a joy in reading them known only to those who read them with desire and enthusiasm. Silent, passive, and noiseless though they be, they yet set in action countless multitudes, and change the order of nations.

author: Alexander Hamilton
title: There is a certain enthusiasm in liberty, that makes human nature rise above itself, in acts of bravery and heroism.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: There is a real magic in enthusiasm. It spells the difference between mediocrity and accomplishment.

author: David Viscott
title: To fail is a natural consequence of trying, To succeed takes time and prolonged effort in the face of unfriendly odds. To think it will be any other way, no matter what you do, is to invite yourself to be hurt and to limit your enthusiasm for trying again.

author: Tryon Edwards
title: To waken interest and kindle enthusiasm is the sure way to teach easily and successfully.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: Today is life-the only life you are sure of. Make the most of today. Get interested in something. Shake yourself awake. Develop a hobby. Let the winds of enthusiasm sweep through you. Live today with gusto.

author: Artur Davis
title: We have built a genuine level of enthusiasm and goodwill with people throughout this district. People are really excited about the possibilities this election holds, not just for this district, but because of the message Alabama sent to the rest of the country.

author: Boris Johnson
title: What I worry about is that people are losing confidence, losing energy, losing enthusiasm, and there's a real opportunity to get them into work.

author: W. Clement Stone
title: When you discover your mission, you will feel its demand. It will fill you with enthusiasm and a burning desire to get to work on it.

author: Bo Bennett
title: While we are focusing on fear, worry, or hate, it is not possible for us to be experiencing happiness, enthusiasm or love.

author: Thomas J. Peters
title: Winners must learn to relish change with the same enthusiasm and energy that we have resisted it in the past.

author: Bernard Montgomery
title: With stout hearts, and with enthusiasm for the contest, let us go forward to victory.

author: Samuel Ullman
title: Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul. Worry, fear, self-distrust bows the heart and turns the spirit back to dust.

author: Donald Trump
title: You have to put the idea into action. If you don’t have the motivation and the enthusiasm, your great idea will simply sit on top of your desk or inside your head and go nowhere.

author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
title: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Your enthusiasm will be infectious, stimulating and attractive to others. They will love you for it. They will go for you and with you.
