title: title

author: Maureen Reagan
title: I will feel equality has arrived when we can elect to office women who are as unqualified as some of the men who are already there.

author: Bono
title: 20 years on I'm not that interested in charity. I'm interested in justice. There's a difference. Africa needs justice as much as it needs charity. , Equality for Africa is a big idea. It's a big expensive idea.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: 2013 was a year of myths falling apart. The myth of President Obama - a myth in which Obama was a messianic figure descending to bequeath health care, equality, and brotherhood on mankind - imploded. The myth of an America embracing the leftist social agenda collapsed.

author: Andrea Dworkin
title: A commitment to sexual equality with males is a commitment to becoming the rich instead of the poor, the rapist instead of the raped, the murderer instead of the murdered.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: A feminist is anyone who recognizes the equality and full humanity of women and men.

author: Barack Obama
title: A woman who is denied an education is denied equality.

author: Mary Daly
title: A woman's asking for equality in the church would be comparable to a black person's demanding equality in the Ku Klux Klan.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Achieving gender equality requires the engagement of women and men, girls and boys. It is everyone's responsibility.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Achieving gender equality requires the engagement of women and men, girls and boys. It is everyones responsibility.

author: Bob Dylan
title: All this talk about equality. The only thing people really have in common is that they are all going to die.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: Allowing women the power to decide when and whether to have children is the only way to solve the 7 billion human load on this planet that threatens to destroy it. Women's equality is also men's survival.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: American society will never completely understand the true meaning of equality.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: Americans are so enamored of equality that they would rather be equal in slavery than unequal in freedom.

author: Bernadette Devlin
title: Among the best traitors Ireland has ever had, Mother Church ranks at the very top, a massive obstacle in the path to equality and freedom. She has been a force for conservatism... to ward off threats to her own security and influence.

author: Arthur Henderson
title: As a first step there must be an offer to achieve equality of rights in disarmament by abolishing the weapons forbidden to the Central Powers by the Peace Treaties.

author: Andrea Dworkin
title: As long as there is rape... there is not going to be any peace or justice or equality or freedom. You are not going to become what you want to become or who you want to become. You are not going to live in the world you want to live in.

author: Carol Gilligan
title: At a time when efforts are being made to eradicate discrimination between the sexes in the search for social equality and justice, the differences between the sexes are being rediscovered.

author: Barack Obama
title: But let's remember that we're all part of one American family. We are united in common values, and that includes belief in equality under the law; a basic respect for public order and the right to peaceful public protest.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Countries with higher levels of gender equality have higher economic growth. Companies with more women on their boards have higher returns. Peace agreements that include women are more successful. Parliaments with more women take up a wider range of issues - including health, education, anti-discrimination, and child support.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Courage consists in equality to the problem before us.

author: Alice S. Rossi
title: Demands for equality for women are threats to men's self-esteem and sense of sexual turf.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: Democracy and socialism have nothing in common but one word, equality. But notice the difference: while democracy seeks equality in liberty, socialism seeks equality in restraint and servitude.

author: Irving Kristol
title: Democracy does not guarantee equality of conditions - it only guarantees equality of opportunity.

author: Plato
title: Democracy is a charming form of government, full of variety and disorder, and dispensing a sort of equality to equals and unequal alike.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Disease generally begins that equality which death completes.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Education promotes equality and lifts people out of poverty. It teaches children how to become good citizens. Education is not just for a privileged few, it is for everyone. It is a fundamental human right.

author: Bob Ney
title: Effective use of Braille is as important to the blind as independent mobility, knowledge in the use of adaptive technology, and the core belief that equality, opportunity and security are truly possible for all people who are blind.

author: Anne Campbell
title: Elections are also about the future - the pledges that we are making for this country. For those who care about equality and fairness in the UK, and beyond, Labour really is the only choice.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Englishmen hate Liberty and Equality too much to understand them. But every Englishman loves a pedigree.

author: Aristotle
title: Equality consists in the same treatment of similar persons.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: Equality may perhaps be a right, but no power on earth can ever turn it into a fact.

author: James Fenimore Cooper
title: Equality, in a social sense, may be divided into that of condition and that of rights. Equality of condition is incompatible with civilization, and is found only to exist in those communities that are but slightly removed from the savage state. In practice, it can only mean a common misery.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Feminism has exceeded its proper mission of seeking political equality for women and has ended by rejecting contingency, that is, human limitation by nature or fate.

author: Carl Schurz
title: From the equality of rights springs identity of our highest interests; you cannot subvert your neighbor's rights without striking a dangerous blow at your own.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Gender equality and women's empowerment have been a top priority for me from day one as Secretary-General. And I am committed to making sure that the U.N. leads by example.

author: Kofi Annan
title: Gender equality is more than a goal in itself. It is a precondition for meeting the challenge of reducing poverty, promoting sustainable development and building good governance.

author: Sir James Matthew Barrie
title: His lordship may compel us to be equal upstairs, but there will never be equality in the servants hall.

author: Anne Hathaway
title: I believe I've always been a big believer in equality. No one has ever been able to tell me I couldn't do something because I was a girl.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: I believe in equality for everyone, except reporters and photographers.

author: Thomas Paine
title: I believe in the equality of man; and I believe that religious duties consist in doing justice, loving mercy, and endeavoring to make our fellow-creatures happy.

author: Phyllis Mcginley
title: I do not know who first invented the myth of sexual equality. But it is a myth willfully fostered and nourished by certain semi-scientists and other fiction writers. And it has done more, I suspect, to unsettle marital happiness than any other false doctrine of this myth-ridden age.

author: Susan Sontag
title: I do not think white America is committed to granting equality to the American Negro... this is a passionately racist country; it will continue to be so in the foreseeable future.

author: Agnes Macphail
title: I do not want to be the angel of any home: I want for myself what I want for other women, absolute equality. After that is secured, then men and women can take turns being angels.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: I have no respect for the passion of equality, which seems to me merely idealizing envy.

author: Agnes Macphail
title: I want for myself what I want for other women, absolute equality.

author: Rosa Parks
title: I would like to be known as a person who is concerned about freedom and equality and justice and prosperity for all people.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Idiots are always in favour of inequality of income (their only chance of eminence), and the really great in favour of equality.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: If interviewers are prejudiced against women or Hispanics, for example, a face-to-face interview will predictably result in discrimination. Reliance on tests, or on actual or past performance, can promote equality.

author: Aristotle
title: If liberty and equality, as is thought by some, are chiefly to be found in democracy, they will be best attained when all persons alike share in government to the utmost.

author: Bella Abzug
title: Imperfect though it may be, the Beijing Platform for Action is the strongest statement of consensus on women's equality, empowerment and justice ever produced by governments.

author: Carol Bellamy
title: In choosing global corporate partners UNICEF emphasises compatibility with our core values and looks to build alliances that advance our mission of ensuring the health, education, equality and protection for all the world's children.

author: Mary McCarthy
title: In science, all facts no matter how trivial, enjoy democratic equality.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: Indians today are governed by two different ideologies. Their political ideal set in the preamble of the Constitution affirms a life of liberty, equality and fraternity. Their social ideal embodied in their religion denies them.

author: Thomas Mann
title: It is a strange fact that freedom and equality, the two basic ideas of democracy, are to some extent contradictory. Logically considered, freedom and equality are mutually exclusive, just as society and the individual are mutually exclusive.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: It is better that some should be unhappy than that none should be happy, which would be the case in a general state of equality.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: It is equality of monotony which makes the strength of the British Isles.

author: Bono
title: It's annoying, but justice and equality are mates. Aren't they? Justice always wants to hang out with equality. And equality is a real pain.

author: Erich Fromm
title: Just as modern mass production requires the standardization of commodities, so the social process requires standardization of man, and this standardization is called equality.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: Liberty, equality - bad principles! The only true principle for humanity is justice; and justice to the feeble is protection and kindness.

author: Adrian Cronauer
title: Martin Luther King, Jr. didn't carry just a piece of cloth to symbolize his belief in racial equality; he carried the American flag.

author: Benigno Aquino III
title: My father offered his life so our democracy could live. My mother devoted her life to nurturing that democracy. I will dedicate my life to making our democracy reach its fullest potential: that of ensuring equality for all. My family has sacrificed much, and I am willing to do this again if necessary.

author: Francis Picabia
title: Nature is unfair? So much the better, inequality is the only bearable thing, the monotony of equality can only lead us to boredom.

author: George Orwell
title: No advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimeter nearer.,

author: Angela Davis
title: No march, movement, or agenda that defines manhood in the narrowest terms and seeks to make women lesser partners in this quest for equality can be considered a positive step.

author: Malcolm X
title: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.,

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: Political democracy cannot last unless there lies at the base of it social democracy. What does social democracy mean? It means a way of life which recognizes liberty, equality and fraternity as the principles of life.

author: Mario Vargas Llosa
title: Prosperity or egalitarianism - you have to choose. I favor freedom - you never achieve real equality anyway: you simply sacrifice prosperity for an illusion.

author: Bono
title: So what we're talking about here is human rights. The right to live like a human. The right to live, period. And what we're facing in Africa is an unprecedented threat to human dignity and equality.

author: Campbell Brown
title: Some women are smarter than men, and some aren't. But to suggest to women that they deserve dominance instead of equality is at best a cheap applause line.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Subordination tends greatly to human happiness. Were we all upon an equality, we should have no other enjoyment than mere animal pleasure.

author: Benjamin Tucker
title: Such security is equal liberty. But it is not necessarily equality in the use of the earth.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The deadly Hydra now is the hydra of Equality. Liberty, Equality and Fraternity is the three-fanged serpent.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The doctrine of human equality reposes on this: that there is no man really clever who has not found that he is stupid.

author: Kofi Annan
title: The future of peace and prosperity that we seek for all the world's peoples needs a foundation of tolerance, security, equality and justice.

author: Arthur Hugh Clough
title: The highest political buzz word is not liberty, equality, fraternity or solidarity; it is service.

author: Anatole France
title: The law, in its majestic equality, forbids the rich as well as the poor, to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets and to steal bread.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: The main business of religions is to purify, control, and restrain that excessive and exclusive taste for well-being which men acquire in times of equality.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: The Millennium Development Goals were a pledge to uphold the principles of human dignity, equality and equity, and free the world from extreme poverty. The MDGs, with eight goals and a set of measurable time-bound targets, established a blueprint for tackling the most pressing development challenges of our time.

author: Hitopadesa
title: The mind is lowered through association with inferiors. With equals it attains equality; and with superiors, superiority.

author: Carolyn Maloney
title: The only way to ensure equality for women is to clearly declare it in our Constitution.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: The principle of equality does not destroy the imagination, but lowers its flight to the level of the earth.

author: Bayard Rustin
title: The real radical is that person who has a vision of equality and is willing to do those things that will bring reality closer to that vision...

author: Gloria Steinem
title: The story of women's struggle for equality belongs to no single feminist nor to any one organization but to the collective efforts of all who care about human rights.

author: Pope John XXIII
title: The true and solid peace of nations consists not in equality of arms, but in mutual trust alone.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.

author: Betty Buckley
title: The work that must be done for each woman to reconnect with her psyche and to give herself a chance to live her own life is essentially the same. The realization of the equality of all races, the equality of all beings is essential.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: There are many ways of supporting gender equality, from something as simple as paid sick leave and flexible work hours to attributing an economic value to all care-giving, and making that amount tax deductible.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: There is always inequity in life. Some men are killed in a war, and some men are wounded, and some men are stationed in the Antarctic and some are stationed in San Francisco. It's very hard in military or personal life to assure complete equality. Life

author: Francoise D'Aubegne Maintenon
title: There is an important difference between love and friendship. While the former delights in extremes and opposites, the latter demands equality.

author: Suzan B. Anthony
title:
There never will be complete equality until women themselves help to make laws and elect lawmakers.,
,

author: Plato
title: These, then, will be some of the features of democracy... it will be, in all likelihood, an agreeable, lawless, parti-colored commonwealth, dealing with all alike on a footing of equality, whether they be really equal or not.

author: Anna Howard Shaw
title: Think of submitting our measure to the advice of politicians! I would as soon submit the subject of the equality of a goose to a fox.

author: Adam Clayton
title: Unless man is committed to the belief that all mankind are his brothers, then he labors in vain and hypocritically in the vineyards of equality.

author: Adam Clayton Powell
title: Unless man is committed to the belief that all of mankind are his brothers, then he labors in vain and hypocritically in the vineyards of equality.

author: Kofi Annan
title: Violence against women is perhaps the most shameful human rights violation, and it is perhaps the most pervasive. It knows no boundaries of geography, culture or wealth. As long as it continues, we cannot claim to be making real progress towards equality, development and peace.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: We are all different. Yet we are all God's children. We are all united behind this country and the common cause of freedom, justice, fairness, and equality. That is what unites us.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson
title: We must recover the element of quality in our traditional pursuit of equality. We must not, in opening our schools to everyone, confuse the idea that all should have equal chance with the notion that all have equal endowments.

author: A. Philip Randolph
title: We want the full works of citizenship with no reservations. We will accept nothing less... This condition of freedom, equality, and democracy is not the gift of gods. It is the task of men, yes, men, brave men, honest men, determined men.

author: Arthur C. Brooks
title: We will have bigger bureaucracies, bigger labor unions, and bigger state-run corporations. It will be harder to be an entrepreneur because of punitive taxes and regulations. The rewards of success will be expropriated for the sake of attaining greater income equality.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When I speak of The Case for Equality I mean human equality; and that, of course, can only mean one thing: it means equality of income.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: When I was coming of age, I remembered reading and studying the initial ideas within the feminist movement. There was this idea with my parents' generation that in order to find equality, a woman would need to behave like a man.

author: Paula Nelson
title: Women's battle for financial equality has barely been joined, much less won. Society still traditionally assigns to woman the role of money-handler rather than money-maker, and our assigned specialty is far more likely to be home economics than financial economics.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: You cannot be friends upon any other terms than upon the terms of equality.

author: Bono
title: You see, Africa makes a fool of our idea of justice. It makes a farce of our idea of equality. It mocks our pieties. It doubts our concern. It questions our commitment. Because there is no way we can look at what's happening in Africa, and if we're honest, conclude that it would ever be allowed to happen anywhere else.

author: Simone Weil
title: Equality is the public recognition, effectively expressed in institutions and manners, of the principle that an equal degree of attention is due to the needs of all human beings.

author: author
title: title

author: Cato the Elder
title: We cannot control the evil tongues of others; but a good life enables us to disregard them.

author: Edmund Burke
title: All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good men do nothing.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: There are thousands hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at the root.

author: Carl Jung
title: A criminal becomes a popular figure because he unburdens in no small degree the consciences of his fellow man, for now they know once more where evil is to be found.

author: Buddha
title: A good friend who points out mistakes and imperfections and rebukes evil is to be respected as if he reveals a secret of hidden treasure.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: A good thing which prevents us from enjoying a greater good is in truth an evil.

author: Joseph Addison
title: A misery is not to be measure from the nature of the evil, but from the temper of the sufferer.

author: Thomas Hardy
title: A resolution to avoid an evil is seldom framed till the evil is so far advanced as to make avoidance impossible.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title:
A Sunday school is a prison in which children do penance for the evil conscience of their parents.,
,

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: A vigorous temper is not altogether an evil. Men who are easy as an old shoe are generally of little worth.

author: Bodhidharma
title: According to the Sutras, evil deeds result in hardships and good deeds result in blessings.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: All evil is like a nightmare; the instant you stir under it, the evil is gone.

author: Scott Alexander
title: All good is hard. All evil is easy. Dying, losing, cheating, and mediocrity is easy. Stay away from easy.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: All government is an evil, but, of the two form's of that evil, democracy or monarchy, the sounder is monarchy; the more able to do its will, democracy.

author: Sir Walter Raleigh
title: All histories do show, and wise politicians do hold it necessary that, for the well-governing of every Commonweal, it behoveth man to presuppose that all men are evil, and will declare themselves so to be when occasion is offered.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: All human evil comes from a single cause, man's inability to sit still in a room.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Although modesty is natural to man, it is not natural to children. Modesty only begins with the knowledge of evil.

author: William S. Burroughs
title: America is not a young land: it is old and dirty and evil before the settlers, before the Indians. The evil is there waiting.

author: Ovid
title: An evil life is a kind of death.

author: Buddha
title: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.

author: Henry Miller
title: Analysis brings no curative powers in its train; it merely makes us conscious of the existence of an evil, which, oddly enough, is consciousness.

author: Edmund Burke
title: And having looked to government for bread, on the very first scarcity they will turn and bite the hand that fed them. To avoid that evil, government will redouble the causes of it; and then it will become inveterate and incurable.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: And if your friend does evil to you, say to him, ''I forgive you for what you did to me, but how can I forgive you for what you did to yourself?''

author: William Cobbett
title: Another great evil arising from this desire to be thought rich; or rather, from the desire not to be thought poor, is the destructive thing which has been honored by the name of ''speculation''; but which ought to be called Gambling.

author: Mary McCarthy
title: Anti-Semitism is a horrible disease from which nobody is immune, and it has a kind of evil fascination that makes an enlightened person draw near the source of infection, supposedly in a scientific spirit, but really to sniff the vapors and dally with the possibility.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Art is one of the means whereby man seeks to redeem a life which is experienced as chaotic, senseless, and largely evil.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: At some point we must make a decision not to allow the mere threat of charges of cultural or religious insensitivity to stop us from dealing with this evil.

author: Abu Bakr
title: Be good to others, that will protect you against evil.

author: Arthur E. Waite
title: Behind the man is the Tree of Life, bearing twelve fruits, and the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil is behind the woman; the serpent is twining round it.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Boredom is the root of all evil - the despairing refusal to be oneself.

author: Charles Simmons
title: Both mind and heart when given up to reveries and dreaminess, have a thousand avenues open for the entrance of evil.

author: Bodhidharma
title: Buddha means awareness, the awareness of body and mind that prevents evil from arising in either.

author: Thomas Hood
title: But evil is wrought by want of thought as well as want of heart!

author: John Maynard Keynes
title: But, soon or late, it is ideas, not vested interests, which are dangerous for good or evil.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Capital as such is not evil; it is its wrong use that is evil. Capital in some form or other will always be needed.

author: Ching I
title: Change is certain. Peace is followed by disturbances; departure of evil men by their return. Such recurrences should not constitute occasions for sadness but realities for awareness, so that one may be happy in the interim.

author: Basil Hume
title: Christ shared our experience; he suffered as we suffer; he died as we shall die, and for forty days in the desert he underwent the struggle between good and evil.

author: Doug Horton
title: Conscience is the window of our spirit, evil is the curtain.

author: Jerry Garcia
title: Constantly choosing the lesser of two evils is still choosing evil.

author: Abu Bakr
title: Cursed is the man who dies, but the evil done by him survives.

author: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin
title: Despair is typical of those who do not understand the causes of evil, see no way out, and are incapable of struggle. The modern industrial proletariat does not belong to the category of such classes.

author: Comte de Lautréamont
title: Despair, feeding, as it always does, on phantasmagoria, is imperturbably leading literature to the rejection, en masse, of all divine and social laws, towards practical and theoretical evil.

author: Bram Cohen
title: Despite my emphasis on technology, I do not view laws as inherently evil. My goals are political ones, even if my techniques are not. The only way to fundamentally succeed is by changing existing laws. If I rejected all help from the political arena I would inevitably fail.

author: Aesop
title: Destroy the seed of evil, or it will grow up to your ruin.

author: Milan Kundera
title: Dogs are our link to paradise. They don't know evil or jealousy or discontent.

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: Don't speak evil of someone if you don't know for certain, and if you do know ask yourself, why am I telling it?

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Enjoy things which are pleasant; that is not the evil: it is the reducing of our moral self to slavery by them that is.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Enlighten the people generally, and tyranny and oppressions of body and mind will vanish like evil spirits at the dawn of day.

author: Adam Clarke
title: Even papists could not see that a moral evil was detained in the soul through its physical connection with the body; and that it required the dissolution of this physical connection before the moral contagion could be removed.

author: Jean de la Fontaine
title: Every journalist owes tribute to the evil one.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Every sweet has its sour; every evil its good.

author: Richard Cecil
title: Every year of my life I grow more convinced that it is wisest and best to fix our attention on the beautiful and the good, and dwell as little as possible on the evil and the false.

author: O. Sitwell
title: Evil and ugliness are the same thing, and dullness is the mother of both.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Evil comes at leisure like the disease. Good comes in a hurry like the doctor.

author: Benjamin Banneker
title: Evil communication corrupts good manners. I hope to live to hear that good communication corrects bad manners.

author: Aristophanes
title: Evil events from evil causes spring.

author: Thomas Malthus
title: Evil exists in the world not to create despair but activity.

author: Marquis de Sade
title: Evil is a moral entity and not a created one, an eternal and not a perishable entity: it existed before the world; it constituted the monstrous, the execrable being who was also to fashion such a hideous world. It will hence exist after the creatures which people this world.

author: Anne Rice
title: Evil is always possible. Goodness is a difficulty.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: Evil is done without effort, naturally, it is the working of fate; good is always the product of an art.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Evil is easy, and has infinite forms.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Evil is like water, it abounds, is cheap, soon fouls, but runs itself clear of taint.

author: Agatha Christie
title:
Evil is not something superhuman, it's something less than human.,
,

author: Virgil
title: Evil is nourished and grows by concealment.

author: Alain Badiou
title: Evil is the interruption of a truth by the pressure of particular or individual interests.

author: Alain Badiou
title: Evil is the moment when I lack the strength to be true to the Good that compels me.

author: W. H. Auden
title: Evil is unspectacular and always human, and shares our bed and eats at our own table.

author: Franz Kafka
title: Evil is whatever distracts.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Evil report carries further than any applause.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Evil requires the sanction of the victim.

author: Eric Butterworth
title: Evil, and evil spirits, devils and devil possession, are the outgrowth of man's inadequate consciousness of God. We must avoid thinking of evil as a thing in itself-a force that works against man or, against God, if you will.

author: Henry Miller
title: Example moves the world more than doctrine. The great exemplars are the poets of action, and it makes little difference whether they be forces for good or forces for evil.

author: Socrates
title: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.

author: August Strindberg
title: Family... the home of all social evil, a charitable institution for comfortable women, an anchorage for house-fathers, and a hell for children.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Far from idleness being the root of all evil, it is rather the only true good.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Fear is implanted in us as a preservative from evil; but its duty, like that of other passions, is not to overbear reason, but to assist it. It should not be suffered to tyrannize

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Foolish men imagine that because judgment for an evil thing is delayed, there is no justice; but only accident here below. Judgment for an evil thing is many times delayed some day or two, some century or two, but it is sure as life, it is sure as death.

author: Annie Besant
title: For centuries the leaders of Christian thought spoke of women as a necessary evil, and the greatest saints of the Church are those who despise women the most.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: For every life and every act consequence of good and evil can be shown and as in time results of many deeds are blended so good and evil in the end become confounded.

author: Joyce Cary
title: For good and evil, man is a free creative spirit. This produces the very queer world we live in, a world in continuous creation and therefore continuous change and insecurity.

author: John Milton
title: For neither man nor angel can discern hypocrisy, the only evil that walks invisible, except to God alone.

author: Thomas Browne
title: Forcible ways make not an end of evil, but leave hatred and malice behind them.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil. Tis the sole remedy against misfortune, the very ventilation of the soul.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: God is an oppressor, He is incapable of human sympathy; behind a smiling face He hides an evil heart.

author: John Locke
title: Good and evil, reward and punishment, are the only motives to a rational creature: these are the spur and reins whereby all mankind are set on work, and guided.

author: Plautus
title: Good courage in a bad affair is half of the evil overcome.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Good is that which makes for unity. Evil is that which makes for separateness.

author: Boethius
title: Good men seek it by the natural means of the virtues; evil men, however, try to achieve the same goal by a variety of concupiscences, and that is surely an unnatural way of seeking the good. Don't you agree?

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: Good, and evil, are names that signify our appetites, and aversions; which in different tempers, customs, and doctrines of men, are different.

author: Bhumibol Adulyadej
title: Goodness is something that makes us serene and content; it is magnificent. Those who are not good are evil.

author: Desmond Tutu
title: Goodness is stronger than evil; love is stronger than hate; light is stronger than darkness; life is stronger than death; victory is ours through him who loved us.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Government is an evil; it is only the thoughtlessness and vices of men that make it a necessary evil. When all men are good and wise, government will of itself decay.

author: Thomas Paine
title: Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil; in its worst state, an intolerable one.

author: David Gemmell
title: Hate is the father of all evil.

author: Machiavelli
title: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.

author: Joel Hawes
title: He that cannot decidedly say, ''No,'' when tempted to evil, is on the highway to ruin. He loses the respect even of those who would tempt him, and becomes but the pliant tool and victim of their evil designs.

author: Sir Walter Raleigh
title: He that doth not as other men do, but endeavoureth that which ought to be done, shall thereby rather incur peril than preservation; for who so laboreth to be sincerely perfect and good shall necessarily perish, living among men that are generally evil.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: He that is kind is free, though he is a slave; he that is evil is a slave, though he be a king.

author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
title: He who busies himself with things other than improvement of his own self becomes perplexed in darkness and entangled in ruin. His evil spirits immerse him deep in vices and make his bad actions seem handsome.

author: Augustus William Hare
title: He who does evil that good may come, pays a toll to the devil to let him into heaven.

author: Buddha
title: He who gives away shall have real gain. He who subdues himself shall be free; he shall cease to be a slave of passions. The righteous man casts off evil, and by rooting out lust, bitterness, and illusion do we reach Nirvana.

author: Martin Luther King
title: He who passively accepts evil is as much involved in it as he who helps to perpetrate it.

author: Boris Johnson
title: Hitler showed the evil that could be done by the art of rhetoric. Churchill showed how it could help to save humanity.

author: Elizabeth Gaskell
title: How easy it is to judge rightly after one sees what evil comes from judging wrongly!

author: Karl Wilhelm Von Humboldt
title: However great an evil immorality may be, we must not forget that it is not without its beneficial consequences. It is only through extremes that men can arrive at the middle path of wisdom and virtue.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: However things may seem, no evil thing is success and no good thing is failure.

author: Margaret Thatcher
title: I am in politics because of the conflict between good and evil, and I believe that in the end good will triumph.

author: Marie Curie
title: I am one of those who think like Nobel, than humanity will draw more good than evil from new discoveries.

author: Lord George Byron
title: I am so changeable, being every thing by turns and nothing long,— I am such a strange mélange of good and evil.

author: Martin Luther King
title: I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. That is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: I believe that, as long as there is plenty, poverty is evil.,

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
title: I can not think of any circumstances in which advertising would not be an evil.

author: William Shakespeare
title: I come to bury Caesar, not to praise him. The evil that men do lives after them; the good is oft interred with their bones.

author: Ayn Rand
title: I consider promiscuity immoral. Not because sex is evil, but because sex is too good and too important.

author: Kathleen Raine
title: I couldn't claim that I have never felt the urge to explore evil, but when you descend into hell you have to be very careful.

author: Albert Einstein
title: I do not believe in the God of theology who rewards good and punishes evil.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: I have also seen children successfully surmounting the effects of an evil inheritance. That is due to purity being an inherent attribute of the soul.

author: Alva Myrdal
title: I have always regarded global development as a struggle between the forces of good and evil. Not to be simplified as a struggle between Jesus and Satan, since I do not consider that the process is restricted to our own sphere of culture.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: I have discovered that all human evil comes from this, man's being unable to sit still and quiet in a room alone.

author: Martin Luther
title: I have no pleasure in any man who despises music. It is no invention of ours: it is a gift of God. I place it next to theology. Satan hates music: he knows how it drives the evil spirit out of us.

author: Charles Dickens
title: I hope that real love and truth are stronger in the end than any evil or misfortune in the world.

author: David Gemmell
title: I make little distinction between those who commit evil and those who stand by and do nothing.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: I see with sympathy , The swollen veins on his brow, showing , How exhausting it is to be evil.

author: Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani
title: I think that Americans should gradually begin to adopt positive behavior rather than doing evil. They should not expect an immediate reaction in return for their positive measures. It will take time.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: I think what's exciting about playing a villain - particularly a villain who's totally unapologetic about their evil intentions - is that it's not anything remotely like what you get to do in real life. You're never allowed to be evil and not feel bad about it afterwards, let alone be evil, period.

author: Auberon Herbert
title: I venture to prophesy that there lies before us a bitter and an evil time.

author: Adam Savage
title: I wouldn't say Jamie is an evil genius. I'm not sure he's evil and I'm not sure he's a genius.

author: Antonia Fraser
title: I'm very interested in good and evil and the moral natures of people.

author: Hannah More
title: Idleness among children, as among men, is the root of all evil, and leads to no other evil more certain than ill temper.

author: Albrecht Durer
title: If a man devotes himself to art, much evil is avoided that happens otherwise if one is idle.

author: Buddha
title: If a man offend a harmless, pure, and innocent person, the evil falls back upon that fool, like light dust thrown up against the wind.

author: Aeschylus
title: If a man suffers ill, let it be without shame; for this is the only profit when we are dead. You will never say a good word about deeds that are evil and disgraceful.

author: Epictetus
title: If evil be spoken of you and it be true, correct yourself, if it be a lie, laugh at it.

author: Woody Allen
title: If it turns out that there is a God, I don't think that he's evil. But the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: If men were born free, they would, so long as they remained free, form no conception of good and evil.

author: Joseph De Maistre
title: If there was no moral evil upon earth, there would be no physical evil.

author: Ben Stein
title: If you want to fight the evil you see in finance and industry, get to work reading the corporate filings, see if there has been fraud, and where you find it, report it to the SEC or write about it or blog about it.

author: Plato
title: Ignorance of all things is an evil neither terrible nor excessive, nor yet the greatest of all; but great cleverness and much learning, if they be accompanied by a bad training, are a much greater misfortune.

author: George Eliot
title: Ignorance... is a painless evil; so, I should think, is dirt, considering the merry faces that go along with it.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: In each of us, two natures are at war – the good and the evil. All our lives the fight goes on between them, and one of them must conquer. But in our own hands lies the power to choose – what we want most to be we are.

author: Lydia Sigourney
title: In early childhood you may lay the foundation of poverty or riches, industry of idleness, good or evil, by the habits to which you train your children. Teach them right habits then, and their future life is safe.

author: Anna Jameson
title: In morals what begins in fear usually ends in wickedness; in religion what begins in fear usually ends in fanaticism. Fear, either as a principle or a motive, is the beginning of all evil.

author: George R. R. Martin
title: In real life, the hardest aspect of the battle between good and evil is determining which is which.

author: Elie Wiesel
title: Indifference, to me, is the epitome of evil.

author: Eric Burdon
title: Inside each of us, there is the seed of both good and evil. It's a constant struggle as to which one will win. And one cannot exist without the other.

author: Gerard De Nerval
title: It has been rightly said that nothing is unimportant, nothing powerless in the universe; a single atom can dissolve everything, and save everything! What terror! There lies the eternal distinction between good and evil.

author: Samuel Butler
title: It has been said that the love of money is the root of all evil. The want of money is so quite as truly.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: It is a beautiful trait in the lovers character, that they think no evil of the object loved.

author: Charles Darwin
title: It is a cursed evil to any man to become as absorbed in any subject as I am in mine.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: It is a fact that cannot be denied: the wickedness of others becomes our own wickedness because it kindles something evil in our own hearts.

author: Benjamin Graham
title: It is a fact worth pondering that four centuries ago the evil of an abundance or surplus arose from its being kept off the market, while today the evil of surplus lies in its being thrown upon the market.

author: Buddha
title: It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways.

author: Comte de Lautréamont
title: It is a power stronger than will. Could a stone escape from the laws of gravity? Impossible. Impossible, for evil to form an alliance with good.

author: Augustus Hare
title: It is a proof of our natural bias to evil, that gain is slower and harder than loss in all things good; but in all things bad getting is quicker and easier than getting rid of.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: It is a sin to believe evil of others, but it is rarely a mistake.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: It is by its promise of a sense of power that evil often attracts the weak.

author: John Maynard Keynes
title: It is ideas, not vested interests, which are dangerous for good or evil.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: It is impossible that anything so natural, so necessary, and so universal as death, should ever have been designed by providence as an evil to mankind.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: It is no little wisdom for a man to keep himself in silence and in good peace when evil words are spoken to him, and to turn his heart to God and not to be troubled with man's judgment.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: It is remarkable by how much a pinch of malice enhances the penetrating power of an idea or an opinion. Our ears, it seems, are wonderfully attuned to sneers and evil reports about our fellow men.

author: George Mcgovern
title: It is simply untrue that all our institutions are evil that all politicians are mere opportunists, that all aspects of university life are corrupt. Having discovered an illness, it's not terribly useful to prescribe death as a cure.

author: Seneca
title: It is the constant fault and inseparable evil quality of ambition, that it never looks behind it.

author: Bram Stoker
title: It is the eve of St. George's Day. Do you not know that tonight, when the clock strikes midnight, all the evil things in the world will have full sway?

author: Vita Sackville-West
title: It is very necessary to have markers of beauty left in a world seemingly bent on making the most evil ugliness.

author: Algernon H. Blackwood
title: It is, alas, chiefly the evil emotions that are able to leave their photographs on surrounding scenes and objects and whoever heard of a place haunted by a noble deed, or of beautiful and lovely ghosts revisiting the glimpses of the moon?

author: Menander of Athens
title: It must be that evil communications corrupt good dispositions.

author: Archibald Alexander
title: It will never do to plead sin as an excuse for sin, or to attempt to justify sinful acts by pleading that we have an evil heart. This instead of being a valid apology, is the very ground of our condemnation.

author: Bob Thaves
title: It's not that Good doesn't triumph over Evil, it's that the point spread is too small.

author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
title: January, month of empty pockets! Let us endure this evil month, anxious as a theatrical producer's forehead.

author: King George III
title: Knavery seems to be so much a the striking feature of its inhabitants that it may not in the end be an evil that they will become aliens to this kingdom.

author: Plato
title: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.

author: Plato
title: Knowledge becomes evil if the aim be not virtuous.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Lack of money is the root of all evil.

author: Jean Petit-Senn
title: Let us believe neither half of the good people tell us of ourselves, nor half the evil they say of others.

author: Paul Gauguin
title: Life has no meaning unless one lives it with a will, at least to the limit of one's will. Virtue, good, evil are nothing but words, unless one takes them apart in order to build something with them; they do not win their true meaning until one knows how to apply them.

author: Thornton T. Munger
title: Life is given for wisdom, and yet we are not wise; for goodness, and we are not good; for overcoming evil, and evil remains; for patience and sympathy and love, and yet we are fretful and hard and weak and selfish. We are keyed not to attainment, but to the struggle toward it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.

author: E. M. Cioran
title: Man must vanquish himself, must do himself violence, in order to perform the slightest action untainted by evil.

author: William Hazlitt
title: Mankind are an incorrigible race. Give them but bugbears and idols - it is all that they ask; the distinctions of right and wrong, of truth and falsehood, of good and evil, are worse than indifferent to them.

author: George Carlin
title: May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.-

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from religious conviction.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Men never do evil so fully and cheerfully as when we do it out of conscience.

author: Bruce Catton
title: Men see things late, and it may be that at times an evil fate drives them on.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Men's evil manners live in brass, their virtues we write in water.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Men's hearts ought not to be set against one another, but set with one another, and all against evil only.

author: Aaron Hill
title: Mischief and malice grow on the same branch of the tree of evil.

author: Marquis de Sade
title: Miserable creatures, thrown for a moment on the surface of this little pile of mud, is it decreed that one half of the flock should be the persecutor of the other? Is it for you, mankind, to pronounce on what is good and what is evil?

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: Mistrust the person who finds everything good, and the person who finds everything evil, and mistrust even more the person who is indifferent to everything.

author: Martin Amis
title: Money doesn't mind if we say it's evil, it goes from strength to strength. It's a fiction, an addiction, and a tacit conspiracy.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Money is power, freedom, a cushion, the root of all evil, the sum of blessings.

author: Henry Fielding
title: Money is the fruit of evil, as often as the root of it.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: Most modern reproducers of life, even including the camera, really repudiate it. We gulp down evil, choke at good.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Must I do all the evil I can before I learn to shun it? Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up.

author: Anatole France
title: Nature has no principles. She makes no distinction between good and evil.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
title: Nature, more of a stepmother than a mother in several ways, has sown a seed of evil in the hearts of mortals, especially in the more thoughtful men, which makes them dissatisfied with their own lot and envious of another s.

author: William Wordsworth
title: Neither evil tongues, rash judgments, nor the sneers of selfish men, nor greetings where no kindness is, nor all the dreary intercourse of daily life, shall ever prevail against us.

author: Robert Southey
title: Never let any man imagine that he can pursue a good end by evil means, without sinning against his own soul! Any other issue is doubtful; the evil effect on himself is certain.

author: Baltasar Gracián
title: Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other ones invariably slink in after it.

author: Julius Charles Hare
title: Never put much confidence in such as put no confidence in others. A man prone to suspect evil is mostly looking in his neighbour for what he sees in himself. As to the pure all things are pure, even so to the impure all things are impure.

author: J. C. Hare
title: Never put much confidence in such, as put no confidence in others. A man prone to suspect evil is mostly looking in his neighbor for what he sees in himself. As to the pure all things are pure, even so to the impure all things are impure.

author: George Eliot
title: No evil dooms us hopelessly except the evil we love, and desire to continue in, and make no effort to escape from.

author: Citium Zeno
title: No evil is honorable: but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.

author: Seneca
title: No evil is without its compensation. The less money, the less trouble; the less favor, the less envy. Even in those cases which put us out of wits, it is not the loss itself, but the estimate of the loss that troubles us.

author: Seneca
title: No evil propensity of the human heart is so powerful that it may mot be subdued by discipline.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
title: No man chooses evil because it is evil; he only mistakes it for happiness.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: No man is justified in doing evil on the ground of expediency.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: No man, perhaps, is so wicked as to commit evil for its own sake. Evil is generally committed under the hope of some advantage the pursuit of virtue seldom obtains. Yet the most successful result of the most virtuous heroism is never without its alloy.

author: Aristotle
title: No notice is taken of a little evil, but when it increases it strikes the eye.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: No one can be brave who considers pain to be the greatest evil in life, or can they be temperate who considers pleasure to be the highest good.

author: Hitopadesa
title: No one should form an acquaintance with one who has an evil character. A piece of coal, if it is hot burns, and if it's cold, blackens the hands.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Non-cooperation with evil is as much a duty as is cooperation with good.

author: Lord George Byron
title:
None are all evil, ,
quickening round his heart, ,
one softer feeling would not yet depart.

author: Honoré Gabriel Riqueti Count of Mirabeau
title: Nothing baffles the schemes of evil people so much as the calm composure of great souls.

author: Bjornstjerne Bjornson
title: Nothing has ever moulded our conscience so strongly as our knowledge of what is good and what is evil.

author: John Berger
title: Nothing in the nature around us is evil. This needs to be repeated since one of the human ways of talking oneself into inhuman acts is to cite the supposed cruelty of nature.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Nothing is so contagious as an example. We never do great good or evil without bringing about more of the same on the part of others.

author: Seneca
title: Nothing is so wretched or foolish as to anticipate misfortunes. What madness is it to be expecting evil before it comes.

author: John Ruskin
title: Of all the things that oppress me, this sense of the evil working of nature herself - my disgust at her barbarity -clumsiness - darkness - bitter mockery of herself - is the most desolating.

author: Alfred de Vigny
title: Of what use is the memory of facts, if not to serve as an example of good or of evil?

author: André Maurois
title: Old age is far more than white hair, wrinkles, the feeling that it is too late and the game finished, that the stage belongs to the rising generations. The true evil is not the weakening of the body, but the indifference of the soul.

author: André Maurois
title: Old age is far more than white hair, wrinkles, the feeling that it is too late and the game finished, that the stage belongs to the rising generations. The true evil is not the weakening of the body, but the indifference of the soul.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: Once to every person and nation come the moment to decide. In the conflict of truth with falsehood, for the good or evil side.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: One concept corrupts and confuses the others. I am not speaking of the Evil whose limited sphere is ethics; I am speaking of the infinite.

author: George Eliot
title: One soweth and another reapeth is a verity that applies to evil as well as good.

author: Edmund Burke
title: One that confounds good and evil is an enemy to good.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: Only among people who think no evil can Evil monstrously flourish.

author: Elie Wiesel
title: Only one enemy is worse than despair: indifference. In every area of human creativity, indifference is the enemy; indifference of evil is worse than evil, because it is also sterile.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: Our greatest pretenses are built up not to hide the evil and the ugly in us, but our emptiness. The hardest thing to hide is something that is not there.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Our minds should not be empty because if they are not preoccupied by good, evil will break in upon them.

author: Eva Le Gallienne
title: People who are born even-tempered, placid and untroubled - secure from violent passions or temptations to evil - those who have never needed to struggle all night with the Angel to emerge lame but victorious at dawn, never become great saints.

author: Anne Rice
title: People who cease to believe in God or goodness altogether still believe in the devil. I don't know why. No, I do indeed know why. Evil is always possible. And goodness is eternally difficult.

author: Bertie Carvel
title: People's character is their behaviour - we're all capable of good and evil.

author: Abu Bakr
title: Piety is the most solid goodness, and the vilest of what is evil is vice.

author: Carice van Houten
title: Playing evil is just not interesting. I don't think anyone who does evil stuff thinks they're doing evil stuff. That's the scary part.

author: Plato
title: Pleasure is the greatest incentive to evil.

author: Graham Greene
title: Point me out the happy man and I will point you out either egotism, selfishness, evil - or else an absolute ignorance.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
title: Prudishness is pretense of innocence without innocence. Women have to remain prudish as long as men are sentimental, dense, and evil enough to demand of them eternal innocence and lack of education. For innocence is the only thing which can ennoble lack of education.

author: Robert Hayden
title: Religion and education are no match for evil without the grace of God.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Set me free from evil passions, and heal my heart of all inordinate affections; that being inwardly cured and thoroughly cleansed, I may be made fit to love, courageous to suffer, steady to persevere.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Since boredom advances and boredom is the root of all evil, no wonder, then, that the world goes backwards, that evil spreads. This can be traced back to the very beginning of the world. The gods were bored; therefore they created human beings.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: So far as we are human, what we do must be either evil or good: so far as we do evil or good, we are human: and it is better, in a paradoxical way, to do evil than to do nothing: at least we exist.

author: Ayn Rand
title: So you think that money is the root of all evil? [...] Have you ever asked what is the root of money?

author: Thomas Paine
title: Society in every state is a blessing, but Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil; in its worst state, an intolerable one.

author: Bill James
title: Some people give themselves over to their most evil desires, and those people becomes evil. But in general, it's reductive to think of evil as something foreign and separate from the rest of us. Evil is part of everyone. We all have the capacity to commit evil acts.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: Some people show evil as a great racehorse shows breeding. They have the dignity of a hard chancre.

author: Benjamin Whichcote
title: Some things must be good in themselves, else there could be no measure whereby to lay out good and evil.

author: Chilo
title: Speak no evil of the dead.

author: Mary Wortley Montagu
title: Strictly speaking, there is but one real evil: I mean acute pain. All other complaints are so considerably diminished by time that it is plain the grief is owing to our passion, since the sensation of it vanishes when that is over.

author: Plato
title: Submit to the present evil, lest a greater one befall you.

author: Antonio Porchia
title: That in man which cannot be domesticated is not his evil but his goodness.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: The belief in a supernatural source of evil is not necessary; men alone are quite capable of every wickedness.

author: George Orwell
title: The common people, on the whole, are still living in the world of absolute good and evil from which the intellectuals have long since escaped.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: The confession of evil works is the first beginning of good works.

author: Jean Paul
title: The conscience of children is formed by the influences that surround them; their notions of good and evil are the result of the moral atmosphere they breathe.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The devil can site scripture for his own purpose! An evil soul producing holy witness is like a villain with a smiling cheek.

author: Ajay Devgan
title: The difference being that in films, unlike in life, good does always win over evil in the end.

author: Georges Bataille
title: The essence of morality is a questioning about morality; and the decisive move of human life is to use ceaselessly all light to look for the origin of the opposition between good and evil.

author: Albert Camus
title: The evil that is in the world almost always comes of ignorance, and good intentions may do as much harm as malevolence if they lack understanding.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The evil that men do lives after them; the good is oft interred with their bones.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: The evil that men do lives on the front pages of greedy newspapers, but the good is oft interred apathetically inside.

author: William S. Burroughs
title: The face of evil is always the face of total need.

author: Plutarch
title: The first evil those who are prone to talk suffer, is that they hear nothing.

author: Maria Montessori
title: The first idea that the child must acquire, in order to be actively disciplined, is that of the difference between good and evil; and the task of the educator lies in seeing that the child does not confound good with immobility, and evil with activity.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The first prison I ever saw had inscribed on it 'CEASE TO DO EVIL: LEARN TO DO WELL'; but as the inscription was on the outside, the prisoners could not read it.

author: Aristotle
title: The generality of men are naturally apt to be swayed by fear rather than reverence, and to refrain from evil rather because of the punishment that it brings than because of its own foulness.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: The greatest evil is physical pain.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The humblest individual exerts some influence, either for good or evil, upon others.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
title: The longest day must have its close -the gloomiest night will wear on to a morning. An eternal, inexorable lapse of moments is ever hurrying the day of the evil to an eternal night, and the night of the just to an eternal day.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The man who promises everything is sure to fulfil nothing, and everyone who promises too much is in danger of using evil means in order to carry out his promises, and is already on the road to perdition.

author: F. L. Lucan
title: The mere apprehension of a coming evil has put many into a situation of the utmost danger.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: The most important of all sciences man can and must learn is the science of living so as to do the least evil and the greatest possible good.

author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison
title: The most painful moral struggles are not those between good and evil, but between the good and the lesser good.

author: Martin Luther
title: The multitude of books is a great evil. There is no limit to this fever for writing.

author: Henry Miller
title: The new always carries with it the sense of violation, of sacrilege. What is dead is sacred; what is new, that is different, is evil, dangerous, or subversive.

author: Socrates
title: The only good is knowledge and the only evil is ignorance.

author: Edmund Burke
title: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The person who in shaky times also wavers only increases the evil, but the person of firm decision fashions the universe.

author: Stuart Wilde
title: The person who said money is the root of all evil just flat out didn't have any.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: The pious pretence that evil does not exist only makes it vague, enormous and menacing.

author: Boris Sidis
title: The principle of recognition of evil under all its guises is at the basis of the true education of man.

author: Alan Cohen
title: The purpose of life is not to fight against evil and misfortune; it is to unveil magnificence.

author: Albert Camus
title: The rebel can never find peace. He knows what is good and, despite himself, does evil. The value which supports him is never given to him once and for all - he must fight to uphold it, unceasingly.

author: Carl Romanelli
title: The Senate needs to protect the interests of the American people and the world community, not provide political cover to President Bush. It's not enough to call Saddam Hussein evil incarnate.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The sum of evil, Pascal remarked, would be much diminished if men could only learn to sit quietly in their rooms.

author: Joseph Brodsky
title: The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even - if you will - eccentricity. That is, something that can't be feigned, faked, imitated; something even a seasoned imposter couldn't be happy with.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: The suspicious mind believes more than it doubts. It believes in a formidable and ineradicable evil lurking in every person.

author: Gerard De Nerval
title: The tree of knowledge is not the tree of life! And yet can we cast out of our spirits all the good or evil poured into them by so many learned generations? Ignorance cannot be learned.

author: Carl Jung
title: The unconscious is not just evil by nature, it is also the source of the highest good: not only dark but also light, not only bestial, semihuman, and demonic but superhuman, spiritual, and, in the classical sense of the word, divine.

author: Bobby Fischer
title: The United States is evil. There's this axis of evil. What about the allies of evil - the United States, England, Japan, Australia? These are the evildoers.

author: Heywood Broun
title: The urge to gamble is so universal and its practice so pleasurable that I assume it must be evil.

author: Jacob Bronowski
title: The values by which we are to survive are not rules for just and unjust conduct, but are those deeper illuminations in whose light justice and injustice, good and evil, means and ends are seen in fearful sharpness of outline.

author: Samuel Butler
title: The want of money is the root of all evil.

author: Malcolm X
title: The white man is not inherently evil, but America's racist society influences him to act evilly. The society has produced and nourishes a psychology which brings out the lowest, most base part of human beings.

author: Joseph De Maistre
title: The whole earth, perpetually steeped in blood, is nothing but an immense altar on which every living thing must be sacrificed without end, without restraint, without respite until the consummation of the world, the extinction of evil, the death of death.

author: Caleb Cushing
title: The winged words uttered in this House have gone forth to the world, on their mission of good or of evil.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: The wise man avoids evil by anticipating it.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The world is a dangerous place to live; not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: The world is not dialectical - it is sworn to extremes, not to equilibrium, sworn to radical antagonism, not to reconciliation or synthesis. This is also the principle of evil.

author: Francis H. Bradley
title: The world is the best of all possible worlds, and everything in it is a necessary evil.

author: Bede Jarrett
title: The world needs anger. The world often continues to allow evil because it isn't angry enough.

author: Samuel Butler
title: The youth of an art is, like the youth of anything else, its most interesting period. When it has come to the knowledge of good and evil it is stronger, but we care less about it.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: There are few things wholly evil or wholly good. Almost everything, especially of government policy, is an inseparable compound of the two, so that our best judgment of the preponderance between them is continually demanded.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: There are heroes in evil as well as in good.

author: A. P. Gouthey
title: There are two great forces in this world - good and evil; and no man is worth his salt unless he has lost and won battle for a principle.

author: Billy Graham
title: There are two great forces, God's force of good and the devil's force of evil, and I believe Satan is alive and he is working, and he is working harder than ever, and we have many mysteries that we don't understand.

author: Ayn Rand
title: There are two sides to every issue: one side is right and the other is wrong, but the middle is always evil.

author: William James
title: There can be no existence of evil as a force to the healthy-minded individual.

author: Buddha
title: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: There is a concept which corrupts and upsets all others. I refer not to Evil, whose limited realm is that of ethics; I refer to the infinite.

author: Bob Moses
title: There is a weariness... from constant attention to the things you are doing, the struggle of good against evil.

author: David Gemmell
title: There is evil in all of us, and it is the mark of a man how he defies the evil within.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: There is hardly a man clever enough to recognize the full extent of the evil he does.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: There is no evil in the atom; only in men's souls.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: There is no explanation for evil. It must be looked upon as a necessary part of the order of the universe. To ignore it is childish, to bewail it senseless.

author: Socrates
title: There is only one good - knowledge; and only one evil - ignorance.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.

author: Cameron Bright
title: There's no set-in-stone way to be a vampire, especially with the evil ones.

author: Donald Trump
title: They are evil people, the press, the media, they are bad people, and nobody, nobody lies like they do.

author: William Shakespeare
title: They do not love that do not show their love. The course of true love never did run smooth. Love is a familiar. Love is a devil. There is no evil angel but Love.

author: Ben Jonson
title: They that know no evil will suspect none.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: This is the curse of an evil deed, that it incites and must bring forth more evil.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: This is the very worst wickedness, that we refuse to acknowledge the passionate evil that is in us. This makes us secret and rotten.

author: Peace Pilgrim
title: This is the way of peace: Overcome evil with good, falsehood with truth, and hatred with love.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: This persistence as private firms continued because it ensured the maximum of anonymity and secrecy to persons of tremendous public power who dreaded public knowledge of their activities as an evil almost as great as inflation.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: Those who corrupt the public mind are just as evil as those who steal from the public purse.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Those who forget good and evil and seek only to know the facts are more likely to achieve good than those who view the world through the distorting medium of their own desires.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: Those who write for lucre or fame are grosser than the cartel robbers, for they steal the genius of the people, which is its will to resist evil.

author: Albert Camus
title: To assert in any case that a man must be absolutely cut off from society because he is absolutely evil amounts to saying that society is absolutely good, and no-one in his right mind will believe this today.

author: Aeschylus
title: To be free from evil thoughts is God's best gift.

author: William Penn
title: To be innocent is to be not guilty; but to be virtuous is to overcome our evil inclinations.

author: Plutarch
