author: Claudius
title: To do no evil is good, to intend none better.

author: Claudius
title: To do nothing evil is good; to wish nothing evil is better.

author: Abu Bakr
title: To fight against the infidels is Jihad; but to fight against your evil self is greater Jihad.

author: Wayne Dyer
title: To sit in judgment of those things which you perceive to be wrong or imperfect is to be one more person who is part of judgment, evil or imperfection.

author: Abbie Hoffman
title: To steal from a brother or sister is evil. To not steal from the institutions that are the pillars of the Pig Empire is equally immoral.

author: Bob Riley
title: Tolerating evil leads only to more evil. And when good people stand by and do nothing while wickedness reigns, their communities will be consumed.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Truly it is an evil to be full of faults; but it is a still greater evil to be full of them and to be unwilling to recognize them, since that is to add the further fault of a voluntary illusion.

author: Carl Jung
title: Understanding does not cure evil, but it is a definite help, inasmuch as one can cope with a comprehensible darkness.

author: Albert Camus
title: Virtue cannot separate itself from reality without becoming a principle of evil.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Vivisection is a social evil because if it advances human knowledge, it does so at the expense of human character.

author: Joseph Rudyard Kipling
title: War is an ill thing, as I surely know. But 'twould be an ill world for weaponless dreamers if evil men were not now and then slain.

author: Barbara Lee
title: We all agree that we've got to bring these terrorists to justice and to make sure that they're never allowed to perpetrate such an evil act as they did. And so all of us are dealing with that. We know that the President has the authority to go to war under the War Powers Act.

author: Joseph De Maistre
title: We are tainted by modern philosophy which has taught us that all is good, whereas evil has polluted everything and in a very real sense all is evil, since nothing is in its proper place.

author: R. W. Dale
title: We ask God to forgive us for our evil thoughts and evil temper, but rarely, if ever ask Him to forgive us for our sadness.

author: Madame Dorothé Deluzy
title: We believe at once in evil, we only believe in good upon reflection. Is this not sad?

author: John Stuart Mill
title: We can never be sure that the opinion we are endeavoring to stifle is a false opinion; and even if we were sure, stifling it would be an evil still.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: We can only write well about our sins because it is too difficult to recall a virtuous act or even whether it was the result of good or evil motives.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: We cheerfully assume that in some mystic way love conquers all, that good outweighs evil in the just balances of the universe and at the 11th hour something gloriously triumphant will prevent the worst before it happens.

author: Maria Weston Chapman
title: We may draw good out of evil; we must not do evil, that good may come.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: We must hold a man amenable to reason for the choice of his daily craft or profession. It is not an excuse any longer for his deeds that they are the custom of his trade. What business has he with an evil trade?

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We often do good in order that we may do evil with impunity.

author: C. A. R. Hoare
title: We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil.

author: Norman Mailer
title: What characterizes a member of a minority group is that he is forced to see himself as both exceptional and insignificant, marvelous and awful, good and evil.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: What is objectionable, what is dangerous, about extremists is not that they are extreme, but that they are intolerant. The evil is not what they say about their cause, but what they say about their opponents.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: What makes people happy is activity; changing evil itself into good by power, working in a God like manner.

author: John Milton
title: What wisdom can there be to choose, what continence to forbear without the knowledge of evil? He that can apprehend and consider vice with all her baits and seeming pleasures, and yet abstain, and yet distinguish, and yet prefer that which is truly better, he is the true wayfaring Christian.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: Whatever evil a man may think of women, there is no woman but thinks more.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Whatever is done for love always occurs beyond good and evil.

author: Brian K. Vaughan
title: When I wrote 'Runaways,' I was a naive kid who thought that all parents were evil. Now that I'm a wise old man with children of my own, I am certain that all parents are evil.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: When money speaks, the truth keeps silent. Russian Proverb Money is power, freedom, a cushion, the root of all evil, the sum of blessings.

author: Buddha
title: When one has the feeling of dislike for evil, when one feels tranquil, one finds pleasure in listening to good teachings; when one has these feelings and appreciates them, one is free of fear.

author: Max Lerner
title: When you choose the lesser of two evils, always remember that it is still an evil.

author: Epictetus
title: Whenever you are angry, be assured that it is not only a present evil, but that you have increased a habit.

author: Cardinal de Retz
title: Where princes are concerned, a man who is able to do good is as dangerous and almost as criminal as a man who intends to do evil.

author: Lord George Byron
title:
Where there is mystery, it is generally suspected there must also be evil.,
,
,
,
,
,

author: Sir Walter Raleigh
title: Who so taketh in hand to frame any state or government ought to presuppose that all men are evil, and at occasions will show themselves so to be.

author: Anthony Collins
title: Willing or preferring is the same with respect to good and evil, that judging is with respect to truth or falsehood.

author: John Cheever
title: Wisdom we know is the knowledge of good and evil - not the strength to choose between the two.

author: Steven Weinberg
title: With or without religion, you would have good people doing good things and evil people doing evil things. But for good people to do evil things, that takes religion.

author: André Gide
title: Work and struggle and never accept an evil that you can change.

author: Mark Twain
title: Work is a necessary evil to be avoided.

author: Joel Rosenberg
title: Yea, though I walk through the valley of death I will fear no evil, for I am the meanest son of a bitch in the valley.

title: You are right on target when you say that mad scientists have a total disregard for the wellbeing of others. We don't want to spread evil; we just see no point in bothering to spread good.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: You cannot have power for good without having power for evil too. Even mother's milk nourishes murderers as well as heroes.

author: Ben Affleck
title: You know George M. Steinbrenner III is the center of all evil in the universe.

author: John Ruskin
title: You may either win your peace or buy it: win it, by resistance to evil; buy it, by compromise with evil.

author: Hermann Hesse
title: You treat world history as a mathematician does mathematics, in which nothing but laws and formulas exist, no reality, no good and evil, no time, no yesterday, no tomorrow, nothing but an eternal, shallow, mathematical present.

author: Simone Weil
title: At the bottom of the heart of every human being, from earliest infancy until the tomb, there is something that goes on indomitably expecting, in the teeth of all experience of crimes committed, suffered, and witnessed, that good and not evil will be done

author: Simone Weil
title: Evil being the root of mystery, pain is the root of knowledge.

author: author
title: title

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you.

author: François Fénelon
title: All earthly delights are sweeter in expectation than in enjoyment; but all spiritual pleasures more in fruition than in expectation.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.

title: Do I have a reasonable expectation of privacy in any information that I share with a company? My Google searches? The emails I send? Do I have a reasonable expectation of privacy in anything but maybe a letter I hand deliver to my wife?

author: Alan Dundes
title: Future orientation is combined with a notion and expectation of progress, and nothing is impossible.

author: Jack Kinder

author: Dr. Robert Anthony

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

title: I know it's hard to blame the time, but there's a bit of an expectation for a summer movie. I think that 'Superman Returns' was a bit nostalgic and romantic, and I don't think that was what people were expecting, especially in the summer.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: I know not anything more pleasant, or more instructive, than to compare experience with expectation, or to register from time to time the difference between idea and reality. It is by this kind of observation that we grow daily less liable to be disappointed.

author: Atom Egoyan
title: I think ultimately if you have a very high expectation of your audience and you know exactly what it is you're trying to express through the medium of film, there will always be an audience for you.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith

author: Horace
title: Life is largely a matter of expectation.

author: Bill Buford

If you find yourself at the restaurant tomorrow, you will eat duck in the confidence that it was what someone ate a hundred years ago. You will eat it in the expectation that someone else will be served it a hundred years from now.

author: Amos Bronson Alcott
title: That is a good book which is opened with expectation, and closed with delight and profit.

author: Andre Breton
title: The approval of the public is to be avoided like the plague. It is absolutely essential to keep the public from entering if one wishes to avoid confusion. I must add that the public must be kept panting in expectation at the gate by a system of challenges and provocations.

author: William Hazlitt
title: The are of will-making chiefly consists in baffling the importunity of expectation.

author: Billy Collins
title: The disappointing second novel is measured against the brilliant first novel - often no novel lives up to the first. Literary improvement seems like an unfair expectation.

author: Seneca

author: William Congreve

author: Samuel Johnson
title: We love to expect, and when expectation is either disappointed or gratified, we want to be again expecting.

author: Voltaire

author: Arthur Golden

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

title: title

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love all, but trust a few.

title: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change. So suffering must become Love. That is the mystery.

author: Aristotle

title: Darkness can not drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.

author: Martin Luther King

title: Sex alleviates tension. Love causes it.

author: Katherine Mansfield
title: I love the rain. I want the feeling of it on my face.

author: William R. Alger
title: Words of love, are works of love.

author: Douglas Adams
title: I love deadlines. I especially like the whooshing sound they make as they go flying by.

title: Love of country is like love of woman - he loves her best who seeks to bestow on her the highest good.

title: Falling out of love is chiefly a matter of forgetting how charming someone is.

author: Euripides
title: He is not a lover who does not love forever.

author: William Congreve
title: If there's delight in love, 'Tis when I see that heart, which others bleed for, bleed for me.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
title: Anyway, no drug, not even alcohol, causes the fundamental ills of society. If we're looking for the source of our troubles, we shouldn't test people for drugs, we should test them for stupidity, ignorance, greed and love of power.

title: A desire arises in the mind. It is satisfied immediately another comes. In the interval which separates two desires a perfect calm reigns in the mind. It is at this moment freed from all thought, love or hate. Complete peace equally reigns between two mental waves.

title: A man can be happy with any woman as long as he does not love her.

title: A man is lucky if he is the first love of a woman. A woman is lucky if she is the last love of a man.

title: As much as I converse with sages and heroes, they have very little of my love and admiration. I long for rural and domestic scene, for the warbling of birds and the prattling of my children

title: At the touch of love, everyone becomes a poet.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: Blindness hatred is blind, as well as love.

title: Bu'' is a word that cools many a warm impulse, stifles many a kindly thought, puts a dead stop to many a brotherly deed. No one would ever love his neighbor as himself if he listened to all the ''Buts'' that could be said.

title: But I always think that the best way to know God is to love many things.

title: But love is blind, and lovers cannot see What petty follies they themselves commit

title: Courage is like love; it must have hope to nourish it.

title: Don't you stay at home of evenings? Don you love a cushioned seat in a corner, by the fireside, with your slippers on your feet?

title: Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.

title: From success you get a lot of things, but not that great inside thing that love brings you.

title: Happiness held is the seed; Happiness shared is the flower-Author Unknown People need your love the most when they appear to deserve it the least.

title: Hate is not the opposite of love; apathy is.

title: Hatred can be overcome only by love.

title: Immature love says: "I love you because I need you." Mature love says: "I need you because I love you."

author: Erich Fromm
title: Immature love says: ''I love you because I need you.'' Mature love says: ''I need you because I love you.''

title: Information is not knowledge. Knowledge is not wisdom. Wisdom is not truth. Truth is not beauty. Beauty is not love. Love is not music. Music is the best.

author: Fjodor M. Dostojewski

author: George Jean Nathan
title: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.

author: Louisa May Alcott
title: Love is a great beautifier.

author: Molière
title: Love is often the fruit of marriage.

author: Gerald G. Jampolsky

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The Bible tells us to love our neighbors, and also to love our enemies; probably because they are generally the same people.

author: Amelia Earhart
title: The effect of having other interests beyond those domestic works well. The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.

author: David Bearwald
title:
The Greatest thing you'll ever learn, is just to love, and be loved in,
return.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The love of life is necessary to the vigorous prosecution of any undertaking.

author: Molière
title: The more we love our friends, the less we flatter them; it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself.

author: George Eliot
title: Vanity is as ill at ease under indifference as tenderness is under a love which it cannot return.

author: Barbara Sher
title: ''Doing your own thing'' is a generous act. Being gifted creates obligations, which means you owe the world your best effort at the work you love. You too are a natural resource.

author: W. H. Auden
title: ''God is Love,'' we are taught as children to believe. But when we first begin to get some inkling of how He loves us, we are repelled; it seems so cold, indeed, not love at all as we understand the word.

author: John Boyle O'Reilly
title: ''You gave me the key of your heart, my love; then why did you make me knock?'' Oh that was yesterday, saints above! And last night - I changed the lock!

author: Ben Foster
title: 'A Streetcar Named Desire' is one of the best, if not the best, modern American plays. It deals with family dynamics, mental health, PTSD, war, and love. It's hard to beat.

author: Carl Honore
title: 'In Praise of Slowness' chronicles the global trend towards deceleration that has come to be known as the Slow Movement. Don't worry, though: it is not a Luddite rant. I love speed. Going fast can be fun, liberating and productive. The problem is that our hunger for speed, for cramming more and more into less and less time, has gone too far.

author: Carl Lewis
title: 'm so fortunate to have done what I love to do for so long, but the day I retired was one of the best days of my life. Not because I was happy to get away from the sport, but because it was clear in my mind that I had done all I possibly could, and that it was time to go.

author: Caroline Shaw
title: 'Partita' is a simple piece. Born of a love of surface and structure, of the human voice, of dancing and tired ligaments, of music, and of our basic desire to draw a line from one point to another.

author: Bryan Singer
title: 'Superman' has always been about Lois Lane, Superman and Clark Kent and this love triangle between these three people who really are only two people.

author: Helen Rowland
title: A Bachelor of Arts is one who makes love to a lot of women, and yet has the art to remain a bachelor.

author: Thomas Love Peacock
title: A book that furnishes no quotations is no book, it is a plaything.

author: Cameron Sinclair
title: A career is a job you love, right? That's what a career should be. If you're in a job that you hate, you should quit. That's the way I look at it. I'm in a job that I love, so I'm going to make it my career.

author: Arthur Miller
title: A child's spirit is like a child, you can never catch it by running after it; you must stand still, and, for love, it will soon itself come back.

author: Giuseppe Mazzini

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: A coward is incapable of exhibiting love; it is the prerogative of the brave.

author: Brene Brown
title: A deep sense of love and belonging is an irreducible need of all people. We are biologically, cognitively, physically, and spiritually wired to love, to be loved, and to belong. When those needs are not met, we don't function as we were meant to. We break. We fall apart. We numb. We ache. We hurt others. We get sick.

author: Josh Billings
title: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.,

author: Pearl S. Buck
title: A good marriage is one which allows for change and growth in the individuals and in the way they express their love.

author: Brad Henry
title: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.

author: Alfred Nobel
title: A heart can no more be forced to love than a stomach can be forced to digest food by persuasion.,

author: Amy Hempel
title: A love affair begins with a fantasy. For instance, that the beloved will always be there.

author: Abbott Eliot Kittredge
title: A love to Christ which is so cowardly and selfish that it is unwilling to proclaim by a public confession its faith in Him who hung before all the world crucified for sinners, is a love which is hardly worth the name.

author: Bell Hooks
title: A major part of love is commitment. If we are committed to someone, if I'm committed to loving you, then it's not possible for me to 'fall out of love.'

author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
title: A man in love is incomplete until he has married - then he's finished.

author: Mae West
title: A man in love is like a clipped coupon - it's time to cash in.

author: Elwyn Brooks White
title: A man is not expected to love his country, lest he make an ass of himself. Yet our country, seen through the mists of smog, is curiously lovable, in somewhat the way an individual who has got himself into an unconscionable scrape seems lovable - or at least deserving of support.

author: Ben Hecht
title: A man nearly always loves for other reasons than he thinks. A lover is apt to be as full of secrets from himself as is the object of his love from him.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: A man's love, till it has been chastened and fastened by the feeling of duty which marriage brings with it, is instigated mainly by the difficulty of pursuit.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: A man's real life is that accorded to him in the thoughts of other men by reason of respect or natural love.

author: Abraham Cowley
title:
A mighty pain to love it is, ,
 And 't is a pain that pain to miss; ,
 But of all pains, the greatest pain ,
 It is to love, but love in vain.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: A name pronounced is the recognition of the individual to whom it belongs. He who can pronounce my name aright, he can call me, and is entitled to my love and service.

author: William B. Yeats
title: A pity beyond all telling is hid in the heart of love.

author: Paul Bourget
title: A proof that experience is of no use, is that the end of one love does not prevent us from beginning another.

author: Rob Cella
title: A relationship is like a rose, How long it lasts, no one knows; Love can erase an awful past, Love can be yours, you'll see at last; To feel that love, it makes you sigh, To have it leave, you'd rather die; You hope you've found that special rose, 'Cause you love and care for the one you chose.

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: A religious man is a person who holds God and man in one thought at one time, at all times, who suffers harm done to others, whose greatest passion is compassion, whose greatest strength is love and defiance of despair.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: A scholar who cherishes the love of comfort is not fit to be deemed a scholar.

author: Lorrie Moore
title: A short story is a love affair, a novel is a marriage. A short story is a photograph; a novel is a film.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: A slight touch of friendly malice and amusement towards those we love keeps our affections for them from turning flat.

author: George Eliot
title: A supreme love, a motive that gives a sublime rhythm to a woman's life, and exalts habit into partnership with the soul's highest needs, is not to be had where and how she wills.

author: Thomas B. Macaulay
title: A system in which the two great commandments are to hate your neighbor and to love your neighbor's wife.

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: A test of a people is how it behaves toward the old. It is easy to love children. Even tyrants and dictators make a point of being fond of children. But the affection and care for the old, the incurable, the helpless are the true gold mines of a culture.

author: Annie Leibovitz
title: A thing that you see in my pictures is that I was not afraid to fall in love with these people.

author: Marcel Proust
title: A woman one loves rarely suffices for all our needs, so we deceive her with another whom we do not love.

author: Barbara Cartland
title: A woman should say: "Have I made him happy? Is he satisfied? Does he love me more than he loved me before? Is he likely to go to bed with another woman?" If he does, then it's the wife's fault because she is not trying to make him happy.

author: Barbara Cartland
title: A woman should say: 'Have I made him happy? Is he satisfied? Does he love me more than he loved me before? Is he likely to go to bed with another woman?' If he does, then it's the wife's fault because she is not trying to make him happy.

author: Lawrence Durrell
title: A woman's best love letters are always written to the man she is betraying.

author: Carol Shields
title: A woman's life isn't worth a plateful of cabbage if she hasn't felt life stir under her heart. Taking a little one to nurse, watching him grow to manhood, that's what love is.

author: Abel Stevens
title: A woman... always feels herself complimented by love, though it may be from a man incapable of winning her heart, or perhaps even her esteem.

author: Comte DeBussy-Rabutin
title: Absence is to love what wind is to fire; it extinguishes the small, it enkindles the great.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: Absence, that common cure of love.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Absences are a good influence in love and keep it bright and delicate.

author: Albert Ellis
title: Acceptance is not love. You love a person because he or she has lovable traits, but you accept everybody just because they're alive and human.

author: Bob Riley
title: According to our Christian ethics, we're supposed to love God, love each other and help take care of the poor. It is immoral to charge somebody making $5,000 an income tax.

author: Anita Brookner
title: Accountability in friendship is the equivalent of love without strategy.

author: Caity Lotz
title: Acting is my number one, but dancing will always be a part of who I am and in my heart. I love doing stunts when they are a part of my acting.

author: Aaron Stanford
title: Actors, we like stories, we like storytelling, we love being a part of the story, and if you give us a story that's interesting then we'll want to do it.

author: Benny Green
title: Actually, I've had very little classical training, although I love listening to classical music very much.

author: Don Alan Pennebaker
title: After love, the most sacred gift you can give is your labor.

author: Jeanne Moreau
title: Age does not protect you from love but love to some extent protects you from age.

author: Anais Nin
title: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.

author: George Burns
title: Age to me means nothing. I can't get old; I'm working. I was old when I was twenty-one and out of work. As long as you're working, you stay young. When I'm in front of an audience, all that love and vitality sweeps over me and I forget my age.

author: Robert Frost
title: Ah, when to the heart of man was it ever less than a treason to go with the drift of things to yield with a grace to reason and bow and accept at the end of a love or a season.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: Ah, yet, e'er I descend to th' grave, May I a small House and a large Garden have. And a few Friends, and many Books both true, Both wise, and both delightful too. And since Love ne'er will from me flee, A mistress moderately fair, And good as Guardian angels are, Only belov'd and loving me.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: Alcohol is like love. The first kiss is magic, the second is intimate, the third is routine. After that you take the girl's clothes off.

author: Frank Sinatra
title: Alcohol may be man's worst enemy, but the bible says love your enemy.,

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: All brave men love; for he only is brave who has affections to fight for, whether in the daily battle of life, or in physical contests.

author: Billie Holiday
title: All dope can do for you is kill you... the long hard way. And it can kill the people you love right along with you.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: All happiness or unhappiness solely depends upon the quality of the object to which we are attached by love.

author: Brody Jenner

author: Bruce Forsyth

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: All love is sweet, Given or returned. Common as light is love, And its familiar voice wearies not ever. They who inspire is most are fortunate, As I am now: but those who feel it most Are happier still.

author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
title: All love that has not friendship for its base, is like a mansion built upon the sand.

author: Ann Landers

author: Berthold Auerbach
title: All men are selfish, but the vain man is in love with himself. He admires, like the lover his adored one, everything which to others is indifferent.

author: A. R. Rahman

author: Betty Wright
title: All of my babies know that I preach all day... I ain't trying to hide no light under no bushel. Everybody needs a little light in their life, and when they need prayer, they know where to come because they know I love them all, and I ain't judging nobody.

author: Buddy Holly
title:
All of my love - all of my kissin' 
 You don't know what you've been a-missin' 
 Oh boy - when you're with me - oh boy 
 The world will see that you were meant for me

author: Joseph De Maistre
title: All pain is a punishment, and every punishment is inflicted for love as much as for justice.

author: Vera Brittain
title: All that a pacifist can undertake - but it is a very great deal - is to refuse to kill, injure or otherwise cause suffering to another human creature, and untiringly to order his life by the rule of love though others may be captured by hate.

title: All this happens without him knowing - they actually install cameras in his apartment and hire this girl to get him to fall in love with her so that she can be in the apartment and present him products without him knowing.

author: Laurence Sterne
title: All womankind, from the highest to the lowest love jokes; the difficulty is to know how they choose to have them cut; and there is no knowing that, but by trying, as we do with our artillery in the field, by raising or letting down their breeches, till we hit the mark.

author: August Wilson
title: All you need in the world is love and laughter. That's all anybody needs. To have love in one hand and laughter in the other.

author: John Lennon
title: All you need is love.,

author: Cate Campbell
title: All's fair in love and war and sport - even when you're fighting against your sister.

title: Ambition is like love, impatient both of delays and rivals.

author: Ben Nelson

author: Charlotte Bunch
title: America is like an unfaithful love who promises us more than we got.

author: Bill Flores
title: America's history is exemplified in the efforts of the men and women who died for our country. The one thing that they all have in common is their selfless love for our nation and their courage to stand up to protect and defend it. They raised their gaze in the face of conflict, believed in what America could be, and pushed forward.

author: Cal Thomas
title: America's most dangerous diseases have developed an immunity to politics. We suffer not from a failure of political organization or power, but a failure of love.

author: Alice Hoffman
title: Among men and women, those in love do not always announce themselves with declarations and vows. But they are the ones who weep when you're gone. Who miss you every single night, especially when the sky is so deep and beautiful, and the ground so very cold.

title: Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.

title: An author must be nothing if he do not love truth; a barrister must be nothing if he do.

title: And I say also this. I do not think the forest would be so bright, nor the water so warm, nor love so sweet, if there were no danger in the lakes.

title: And I think maybe all women, if they just had a chance, would be romantic and believe in love and not sex. And men believe in sex and not love.

title: And I'm not so in love with making people mad that I want to live my life around it.

title: And we love to dance - especially that new one called the Civil War Twist. The Northern part of you stands still while the Southern part tries to secede.

title: Anger and jealousy can no more bear to lose sight of their objects than love.

title: Animals speak with pure affection. It's important to me to get something going in NY so we can get to be a no-kill city, and give the animals homes and more attention and love.

title: Antipathy, dissimilarity of views, hate, contempt, can accompany true love.

title: Any fool knows that bravado is always a cover-up for insecurity. That's the truth. And on that note, I'll say goodnight. God love you.

title: Any man who can write a page of living prose adds something to our life, and the man who can, as I can, is surely the last to resent someone who can do it even better. An artist cannot deny art, nor would he want to. A lover cannot deny love.

title: Any one must see at a glance that if men and women marry those whom they do not love, they must love those whom they do not marry.

Who knows; you might find love in the second relationship.

title: Any woman can fool a man if she wants to and if he's in love with her.,

title: Anyone can hate. It costs to love.

title: Anyway, the sort of love that will not wait is probably best to pass by.

title: As an inspiration to the author, I do not think the cat can be over-estimated. He suggests so much grace, power, beauty, motion, mysticism. I do not wonder that many writers love cats; I am only surprised that all do not.

title: As far as other instrumentalists, I used to love mellow sax players like Paul Desmond. I love piano.

title: As human beings, we need to know that we are not alone, that we are not crazy or completely out of our minds, that there are other people out there who feel as we do, live as we do, love as we do, who are like us.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: As love without esteem is capricious and volatile; esteem without love is languid and cold.

author: John Hawkesworth
title: As love without esteem is volatile and capricious; esteem without love is languid and cold.

title: As selfishness and complaint pervert and cloud the mind, so love with its joy clears and sharpens the vision.

title: Attachment to spiritual things is... just as much an attachment as inordinate love of anything else.

title: Be as romantic as you please about love... but you mustn't be romantic about money.

title: Be glad of life because it gives you a chance to love and to work and to play and to look up at stars.

author: Zoroaster

author: Graham Greene
title: Beauty is like success: we can't love it for long.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: Because of a great love, one is courageous.

author: Rita Rudner
title: Before I met my husband, I'd never fallen in love, though I'd stepped in it a few times.

author: Joan Rivers
title: Before we make love my husband takes a pain killer.,

title: Being a kid growing up with Kurosawa films and watching Sergio Leone movies just made me love what it could do to you, and how it could influence you - make you dream.

There is no transition into being a woman; you literally become a mum and being a mum means you always love someone else more than yourself and it is an unexplainable situation.

title: Being a survivor doesn't mean being strong - it's telling people when you need a meal or a ride, company, whatever. It's paying attention to heart wisdom, feelings, not living a role, but having a unique, authentic life, having something to contribute, finding time to love and laugh. All these things are qualities of survivors.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Being hurt by someone you truly care about leaves a hole in you heart that only love can fill.

author: Armistead Maupin
title: Being in love is the only transcendent experience.

title: Brought up to respect the conventions, love had to end in marriage. I'm afraid it did.

title: But as to women, who can penetrate the real sufferings of their she condition? Man's very sympathy with their estate has much of selfishness and more suspicion. Their love, their virtue, beauty, education, but form good housekeepers, to breed a nation.

title: But I will say that living in Ireland has changed the cadence and fullness of speech, since the Irish love words and use as many of them in a sentence as possible.

title: But I would never insult the people that love this music and I would never insult the blessing of music in my life and I would never insult myself by playing uninspired music.

author: Agatha Christie
title: But surely for everything you have to love you have to pay some price.

title: But the lover's power is the poet's power. He can make love from all the common strings with which this world is strung.

title: But the one thing that has power completely is love, because when a man loves, he seeks no power, and therefore he has power.

title: But whatever the Lord throws at me right now, I think I've been given more blessings than I ever deserved. If he wants to top it off with anything - boy, girl - I would love either of them.

title: But, in the end, even a song that's as politically bland as Blowin in the Wind, you probably wouldn't get up and sing that now, whereas some of Bob Dylan's love songs that were contemporary with that, like say Girl from the North Country, you can still get up an play now.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: By abolishing private property one takes away the human love of aggression.

title: By the time I was a senior in high school, I knew I wanted to move to Silicon Valley and learn more about computers and the Internet. I just fell in love with technology and the potential of everything the Internet had to offer.

author: Jackie Mason

author: Susan Sontag
title: Camp is a vision of the world in terms of style - but a particular kind of style. It is love of the exaggerated.

author: Arthur Miller
title: Can anyone remember love? It's like trying to summon up the smell of roses in a cellar. You might see a rose, but never the perfume.

author: John Gay
title: Can Love be controll'd by advice?

author: Richard Bach
title: Can miles truly separate us from friends? If we want to be with someone we love, aren't we already there?

title: Career is too pompous a word. It was a job, and I have always felt privileged to be paid for what I love doing.

title: Chance can allow you to accomplish a goal every once in a while, but consistent achievement happens only if you love what you are doing.

author: Adam Sandler
title: Chemistry can be a good and bad thing. Chemistry is good when you make love with it. Chemistry is bad when you make crack with it.

title: Chicago has definitely played a part in my character development. I love the essence of the city, the personalities of the people, the hard-working spirit that you need to get through the winters. And every neighborhood has its great restaurants and the local hot-dog stand.

author: Gordon B. Hinckley
title: Children can be disciplined with love.,

author: Confucius
title: Chose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Christianity, with its doctrine of humility, of forgiveness, of love, is incompatible with the state, with its haughtiness, its violence, its punishment and its wars.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Civilized people cannot fully satisfy their sexual instinct without love.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: Classic economic theory, based as it is on an inadequate theory of human motivation, could be revolutionized by accepting the reality of higher human needs, including the impulse to self actualization and the love for the highest values.

author: Christopher Marlowe
title: Come live with me, and be my love, and we will all the pleasures prove.

author: John Donne
title: Come live with me, and be my love, And we will some new pleasures prove Of golden sands, and crystal brooks, With silken lines, and silver hooks.

author: Benjamin Tucker
title: Commanded love of all men indiscriminately is an obliteration of distinction between love and hate, and therefore is not love at all.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Commerce is of trivial import; love, faith, truth of character, the aspiration of man, these are sacred.

author: Mao Tse-Tung
title: Communism is not love. Communism is a hammer which we use to crush the enemy.

author: Bryan Callen
title: Compare sending someone a text message and getting a love letter delivered by carrier pigeon. No contest.

author: Betty Williams
title: Compassion is more important than intellect in calling forth the love that the work of peace needs, and intuition can often be a far more powerful searchlight than cold reason.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Constancy... that small change of love, which people exact so rigidly, receive in such counterfeit coin, and repay in baser metal.

author: Seneca
title: Conversation has a kind of charm about it, an insinuating and insidious something that elicits secrets just like love or liquor.

author: Anna Jameson
title: Conversation may be compared to a lyre with seven chords - philosophy, art, poetry, love, scandal, and the weather.

author: A. E. Housman
title:
Could man be drunk for ever ,
 With liquor, love, or fights, ,
 Lief should I rouse at mornings ,
 And lief lie down of nights. ,
 But men at whiles are sober ,
 And think by fits and starts, ,
 And if they think, they fasten ,
 Their hands upon their hearts.

author: Bill Hicks
title: Courtroom for Ted Bundy's trial is packed with women, trying to meet him and give him love letters and wedding-fucking-proposals...and the first thought that enters my mind is, And I'm not getting laid. What am I doing wrong?

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Cowardice and courage are never without a measure of affectation. Nor is love. Feelings are never true. They play with their mirrors.

author: John Gay
title: Cowards are cruel, but the brave love mercy and delight to save.

author: Thomas De Quincey
title: Cows are amongst the gentlest of breathing creatures; none show more passionate tenderness to their young when deprived of them; and, in short, I am not ashamed to profess a deep love for these quiet creatures.

author: Rose Macaulay
title: Cranks live by theory, not by pure desire. They want votes, peace, nuts, liberty, and spinning-looms not because they love these things, as a child loves jam, but because they think they ought to have them. That is one element which makes the crank.

author: Alice Walker
title: Criticism is painful when it's not done with love.

author: Alan Paton
title: Cry, the beloved country, for the unborn child that is the inheritor of our fear. Let him not love the earth too deeply... For fear will rob him of all if he gives too much.

author: Billy Collins
title: Cummings' career as a writer - and a painter - was as wobbly as his love life. He tried his hand at playwriting, satirical essays, and even a dance scenario for Lincoln Kirsten.

author: Alexander Pope
title: Curse on all laws, but those that love has made.

author: Anacreon
title: Cursed be he above all others Who's enslaved by love of money. Money takes the place of brothers, Money takes the place of parents, Money brings us war and slaughter.

author: Carmen Electra
title: Dancing is my number one love. That was my first goal as a child. I would love to do stage, maybe do Chicago. I love being in front of an audience. It's so stimulating. I also love to barbecue.

author: Brene Brown
title: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves, even when we risk disappointing others.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.

author: Paul Theroux
title: Death is an endless night so awful to contemplate that it can make us love life and value it with such passion that it may be the ultimate cause of all joy and all art.

author: Adam Clymer
title: Democratic politicians have disliked things I've written, Republican politicians... if they all love you, you might as well be driving a Good Humor truck.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: Difficult times always create opportunities for you to experience more love in your life.

author: Walt Disney
title: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn't go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.,

author: Og Mandino
title: Do all things with love.,

author: Og Mandino
title: Do all things with love.

author: William Goldman
title: Do I love you? My God, if your love were a grain of sand, mine would be a universe of beaches.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title:
Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.,
,
,
,
,

author: Anais Nin
title: Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Do not think that love in order to be genuine has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired. Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.

author: Aravind Adiga
title: Do we loathe our masters behind a facade of love - or do we love them behind a facade of loathing?

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Do what you love. Know you own bone; gnaw at it, bury it, unearth it, and gnaw it still.

author: Abraham Polonsky
title: Do you know what it's like to love and be alone?

author: Erica Jong
title: Do you want me to tell you something really subversive? Love is everything it's cracked up to be. That's why people are so cynical about it. It really is worth fighting for, being brave for, risking everything for. And the trouble is, if you don't risk anything, you risk even more.

author: Richard Bandler
title: Do you want to know a good way to fall in love? Just associate with all your pleasant experiences with someone, and disassociate from all the unpleasant ones.

author: Sir John Lubbock
title: Don't be afraid of showing affection. Be warm and tender, thoughtful and affectionate. Men are more helped by sympathy than by service. Love is more than money, and a kind word will give more pleasure than a present.

author: Henry Rollins
title: Don't do anything by half. If you love someone, love them with all your soul. When you go to work, work your ass off. When you hate someone, hate them until it hurts.,

author: Peggy Noonan
title: Don't fall in love with politicians, they're all a disappointment. They can't help it, they just are.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: Don't hold to anger, hurt or pain. They steal your energy and keep you from love.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Don't interfere with anything in the Constitution. That must be maintained, for it is the only safeguard of our liberties. And not to Democrats alone do I make this appeal, but to all who love these great and true principles.

author: Woody Allen
title: Don't knock masturbation - it's sex with someone I love.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: Don't let love interfere with your appetite. It never does with mine.

author: Bob Marley
title: Don't let them fool ya, Or even try to school ya! Oh, no! We've got a mind of our own, So go to hell if what you're thinking is not right! Love would never leave us alone, A-yin the darkness there must come out to light.

author: Billie Holiday
title: Don't threaten me with love, baby. Let's just go walking in the rain.

author: Cate Blanchett
title: Don't you find that work, if you love it, is actually really invigorating?

author: Bruno Mars
title: Don't you love it that Prince doesn't use Twitter? Don't you think he's somewhere on a unicorn?

author: Toni Morrison
title: Don’t beg anybody for anything, especially love.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.

author: William Shakespeare
title:
Doubt thou, the stars are fire;,
Doubt that the sun doth move;,
Doubt truth to be a liar;,
But never doubt I love.

author: Carl Jung
title: Dreams are the guiding words of the soul. Why should I henceforth not love my dreams and not make their riddling images into objects of my daily consideration?

author: Dorothy Parker
title: Drink, and dance and laugh and lie, love the reeling midnight through, for tomorrow we shall die! (But, alas, we never do.)

author: Pierre de Beaumarchais
title: Drinking, when we are not thirsty and making love all year round, madam; that is all there is to distinguish us from other animals.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Dying is almost the least spiritual of our acts, more strictly carnal even than the act of love.

author: Tim O'Brien
title: Each of us, I suppose needs his illusions. Life after death. A maker of planets. A woman to love, a man to hate. Something sacred. But what a waste.

author: Audre Lorde
title: Each time you love, love as deeply as if it were forever.

author: Ouida
title:
Eagles that love the high light-penetrated air, ,
that has no dust and clog of earthborn dust, ,
must ever dwell in solitude.

author: Bruce Vilanch
title: Eddie Izzard is absolutely brilliant. I would love to write something for him.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Enjoy the Spring of Love and Youth, to some good angel leave the rest; For Time will teach thee soon the truth, there are no birds in last year's nest!

author: Barry Cornwall
title: Enter upon thy paths, O year! Thy paths, which all who breathe must tread, Which lead the Living to the Dead, I enter; for it is my doom To tread thy labyrinthine gloom; To note who round me watch and wait; To love a few; perhaps to hate; And do all duties of my fate.

author: William Hazlitt
title: Envy among other ingredients has a mixture of the love of justice in it. We are more angry at undeserved than at deserved good-fortune.

author: William Blake
title: Eternity is in love with the productions of time.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: Even during the worst hardships, when the other things in our lives seem to fall apart, we can still find peace in the eternal love of God.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Even from their infancy we frame them to the sports of love: their instruction, behavior, attire, grace, learning and all their words azimuth only at love, respects only affection. Their nurses and their keepers imprint no other thing in them.

author: William Hazlitt
title:
Even in the common affairs of life, in love, friendship, and marriage, how little security have we when we trust our happiness in the hands of others! ,
,

author: Plato
title: Even the gods love jokes.

author: Anita Desai
title: Ever since I could first write I have been doing so. When I was taught how to write and read at school, I made up my mind that this was what I love to do best and this was the world I was going to occupy.

author: John Berger
title: Every city has a sex and an age which have nothing to do with demography. Rome is feminine. So is Odessa. London is a teenager, an urchin, and, in this, hasn't changed since the time of Dickens. Paris, I believe, is a man in his twenties in love with an older woman.

author: Aga Khan III
title: Every day has been so short, every hour so fleeting, every minute so filled with the life I love that time for me has fled on too swift a wing.

author: Mary Cholmondeley
title: Every day I live I am more convinced that the waste of life lies in the love we have not given, the powers we have not used, the selfish prudence that will risk nothing and which, shirking pain, misses happiness as well.

author: Francoise Sagan
title: Every little girl knows about love. It is only her capacity to suffer because of it that increases.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Every poet and musician and artist, but for Grace, is drawn away from love of the thing he tells to love of the telling till, down in Deep Hell, they cannot be interested in God at all but only in what they say about Him.

author: Barbara Sher
title: Every single one of us can do things that no one else can do - can love things that no one else can love. We are like violins. We can be used for doorstops, or we can make music. You know what to do.

author: Germaine Greer
title: Every time a man unburdens his heart to a stranger he reaffirms the love that unites humanity.

author: Betsy Brandt
title: Everybody - even huge movie stars - have downs. That's just how it is. The work ebbs and flows. My manager and I were saying, 'Let's remember that in 2013 we were soooo busy.' So whenever it is that we're not, maybe it'll come back again. Maybe it won't. But you've gotta love the ride.

author: Boris Kodjoe
title: Everybody goes through obstacles and problems and issues and turn their backs on people that we are fond of and love just because we hurt; and everybody goes through that.

author: Betty Wright
title: Everybody needs a little light in their life, and when they need prayer, they know where to come, because they know I love them all, and I ain't judging nobody.

author: Brooke Shields
title: Everybody says, 'When you have kids, you really get away from yourself.' But really, it's the most selfish thing I've ever done. It's like, Okay, I'm going to create unconditional love for myself, and I'm going to need it and want it and ask for it every day, and I'm going to get it.

author: Carole King
title: Everybody understands friendship, and friendship is different than love - it's a different kind of love. Friendship has more freedom, more latitude. You don't expect your friend to be as you think your friend should be; you expect your friend just to love you as a friend.

author: Jean Cocteau
title: Everything one does in life, even love, occurs in an express train racing toward death. To smoke opium is to get out of the train while it is still moving. It is to concern oneself with something other than life or death.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Everything that I understand, I understand only because I love.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Everywhere, we learn only from those whom we love.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: Except for poverty, incompatibility, opposition of parents, absence of love on one side and of desire to marry on both, nothing stands in the way of our happy union.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.

author: Caroline Knapp
title: Fall in love with a dog, and in many ways you enter a new orbit, a universe that features not just new colors but new rituals, new rules, a new way of experiencing attachment.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common-sense.

author: Mario Puzo
title: Falling in love is great but being in love is a disaster.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Familiar acts are beautiful through love.

author: Matt Groening
title: Families are about love overcoming emotional torture.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
title: Family life is too intimate to be preserved by the spirit of justice. It can be sustained by a spirit of love which goes beyond justice.

author: Bill Dedman
title: Fans love McGwire for his powerful physique, for his on-field hugs of his son, the part-time bat boy. He is Big Mac, or Paul Bunyan in Cardinals red with a white-ash bat instead of an ax.

author: Bill Dedman
title: Fans love Sosa for his exuberance, for the kisses he blows to his mother, wife and four children. He is Slammin' Sammy, a fairy-tale figure rising from poverty in the Dominican Republic to the 55th floor above Chicago's Lake Shore Drive.

author: Andy Warhol
title: Fantasy love is much better than reality love. Never doing it is very exciting. The most exciting attractions are between two opposites that never meet.

author: Carolina Herrera
title: Fashion is a dream. It's difficult, and there are many aspects of fashion that are very difficult, but if you love it like I do, because I really have a passion, now, for fashion, it's not easy, but nothing is easy in life.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Fear secretes acids; but love and trust are sweet juices.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.

author: Bell Hooks
title: Feminist politics aims to end domination, to free us to be who we are - to live lives where we love justice, where we can live in peace.

author: John Gay
title: Fill it up. I take as large draughts of liquor as I did of love. I hate a flincher in either.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: Films with female protagonists don't attract many eyeballs. Most of them are perceived as feminist films. If Bollywood starts giving women major roles in entertaining movies, then the audience, too, will open up to the idea of watching commercial films in which the actresses do more than just play the role of the hero's love interest.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity: no really self-respecting woman would take advantage of it.

author: William Arthur Ward
title: Flatter me, and I may not believe you. Criticize me, and I may not like you. Ignore me, and I may not forgive you. Encourage me, and I will not forget you. Love me and I may be forced to love you.

author: Francis Bacon
title: For a crowd is not company; and faces are but a gallery of pictures; and talk but a tinkling cymbal, where there is no love.

author: Bill Bradley
title: For a long time, I operated under the Chinese proverb that there are four kinds of leaders: those who you laugh at, those who you hate, those who you love and those who you don't even know that they're leaders.

author: John Burroughs
title: For anything worth having one must pay the price; and the price is always work, patience, love, self-sacrifice - no paper currency, no promises to pay, but the gold of real service.

author: Carter Heyward
title: For god is nothing other than the eternally creative source of our relational power, our common strength, a god whose movement is to empower, bringing us into our own together, a god whose name in history is love.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
title: For it is the suffering flesh, it is suffering, it is death, that lovers perpetuate upon the earth. Love is at once the brother, son, and father of death, which is its sister, mother, and daughter. And thus it is that in the depth of love there is a depth

author: Virginia Woolf
title: For love... has two faces; one white, the other black; two bodies; one smooth, the other hairy. It has two hands, two feet, two tails, two, indeed, of every member and each one is the exact opposite of the other. Yet, so strictly are they joined together

author: Billy Zane
title: For me it's always about first impressions. I trust my instincts. I love to prepare if it's something that requires training. But I don't like to prepare the psychology too much. I enjoy the psychology of the character but I work better from a first impression.

author: Carla Hall
title: For me, I love the flavors of Southern food, and people usually think of Southern food as heavy and fattening, but it doesn't have to be.

author: Charles Dickens
title: For not an orphan in the wide world can be so deserted as the child who is an outcast from a living parent's love.,

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: For one human being to love another: that is perhaps the most difficult of all our tasks, the ultimate, the last test and proof, the work for which all other work is but preparation.

author: Christina Rossetti
title: For one man is my world of all the men this wide world holds; O love, my world is you.

author: Billy Eichner
title: For some reasons, I have WWE wrestlers tweeting me all the time. Like, my biggest fans. Why they can connect with my love for Meryl Streep, I don't know.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: For the sake of the troops, for the love of the troops, we must not add yet another casualty to this war. We must not let truth be a casualty of this war.

author: Lord George Byron
title: For the sword outwears its sheath, and the soul wears out the breast. And the heart must pause to breathe, and love itself have rest.

author: Aristotle
title: For though we love both the truth and our friends, piety requires us to honor the truth first.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: For true love is inexhaustible; the more you give, the more you have. And if you go to draw at the true fountainhead, the more water you draw, the more abundant is its flow.

author: George Eliot
title: For what is love itself, for the one we love best? An enfolding of immeasurable cares which yet are better than any joys outside our love.

author: Ovid
title: Fortune and love favor the brave.

author: Dorothy Parker
title: Four be the things I'd better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt.

author: Barbara Cartland
title: France is the only place where you can make love in the afternoon without people hammering on your door.

author: Casey Wilson
title: Frankly, 'Bride Wars' got made because movies with women need to be about weddings and love.

author: Caroll Spinney
title: Frankly, I think if I won the lottery and won a billion dollars, I'd still want to continue doing this job. I love expressing myself through it. I've gotten to really love acting. And I've gotten to know Big Bird from the inside out so thoroughly it's like playing my kid. I can't imagine deliberately stopping.

author: Mario Puzo
title: Fredo you're my older brother and I love you. But don't ever take sides against the Family.

author: Seneca
title: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Friendship is a disinterested commerce between equals; love, an abject intercourse between tyrants and slaves.

author: Jane Austen
title: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Friendship is constant in all other things save in the office and affairs of love.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Friendship is far more tragic than love. It lasts longer.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Friendship is Love without his wings!

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship, never.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Friendship, like love, is destroyed by long absence, though it may be increased by short intermissions.

author: Hilaire Belloc
title: From quiet homes and first beginning, out to the undiscovered ends, there's nothing worth the wear of winning, but laughter and the love of friends.

author: A. C. Swinburne
title: From too much love of living, From hope and fear set free, We thank with brief thanksgiving Whatever gods may be That no life lives for ever; That dead men rise up never; That even the weariest river Winds somewhere safe to sea.

author: William Blake
title: Fun I love, but too much fun is of all things the most loathsome. Mirth is better than fun, and happiness is better than mirth.

author: Friedrich Schlegel
title: Genius is, to be sure, not a matter of arbitrariness, but rather of freedom, just as wit, love, and faith, which once shall become arts and disciplines. We should demand genius from everybody, without, however, expecting it.

author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
title: Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.

author: Boris Becker
title: Girls had never been important. I'd had a girlfriend or two and had liked them a lot but it wasn't love, because my first love was tennis.

author: Ashley Montagu
title: Girls marry for love. Boys marry because of a chronic irritation that causes them to gravitate in the direction of objects with certain curvilinear properties.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Girls we love for what they are; men for what they promise to be.

author: John Ruskin
title: Give little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.

author: Stephen Levine
title: Go to the truth beyond the mind. Love is the bridge.

author: Joseph Rudyard Kipling
title: God gives all men all earth to love, but since man's heart is small, ordains for each one spot shall prove belovèd over all.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: God grant that not only the love of liberty but a thorough knowledge of the rights of man may pervade all the nations of the earth, so that a philosopher may set his foot anywhere on its surface and say: This is my country!

author: Giuseppe Mazzini
title: God has given you your country as cradle, and humanity as mother; you cannot rightly love your brethren of the cradle if you love not the common mother.

author: Bono
title: God is so big. It's a gigantic concept in God. The idea that God might love us and be interested in us is kind of huge and gigantic, but we turn it, because we're small-minded, into this tiny, petty, often greedy version of God, that is religion.

author: Bryan Batt
title: God love Neil Patrick Harris - how great is that. People grew up with him; they go, 'Oh it's him, it's that little boy and he just happens to be gay. How great for him!' The more of those kind of examples that happen, the better it's going to be.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: God must love the common man, he made so many of them.

author: Billy Graham
title: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, ''I love you.''

author: Bernie Siegel
title: God wants us to know that life is a series of beginnings, not endings. Just as graduations are not terminations, but commencements. Creation is an ongoing process, and when we create a perfect world where love and compassion are shared by all, suffering will cease.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: God will look to every soul like its first love because He is its first love.

author: Bob Balaban
title: God, I'd love to do a big commercial movie that made a lot of money and whose plot was interesting too.

author: Saul Bellow
title: Goodness is achieved not in a vacuum, but in the company of other men, attended by love.

author: Desmond Tutu
title: Goodness is stronger than evil; love is stronger than hate; light is stronger than darkness; life is stronger than death; victory is ours through him who loved us.

author: Henry van Dyke
title: Gratitude is a twofold love - love coming to visit us, and love running out to greet a welcome guest.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Gratitude looks to the past and love to the present; fear, avarice, lust, and ambition look ahead.

author: Benito Martinez
title: Great film roles, they always take you to another place. I'd love to do more of that, but I keep doing lots of voiceovers, some TV spots, and some film roles have come along, so I'm okay.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: Greed, like the love of comfort, is a kind of fear.

author: Erica Jong
title: Growing up female in America. What a liability! You grew up with your ears full of cosmetic ads, love songs, advice columns, whoreoscopes, Hollywood gossip, and moral dilemmas on the level of TV soap operas. What litanies the advertisers of the good life chanted at you! What curious catechisms!

author: Carl Clinton Van Doren
title: Guy Rivers, a conventional piece as regards the love affair which makes a part of the plot, is a tale of deadly strife between the laws of Georgia and a fiendish bandit.

author: Thomas Traherne
title: Had we not loved ourselves at all, we could never have been obliged to love anything. So that self-love is the basis of all love.

author: Ben Gibbard
title: Hall & Oates is one of the few musical groups as satisfying now as it was back then. There's something incredibly musically satisfying about their songs. Nothing has diminished my love for them.

author: Bar Refaeli
title: Happiness is when you love who you are and you are able to accept yourself and others.

author: Ovid
title: Happy are those who dare courageously to defend what they love.

author: Rufus Choate
title: Happy is he who has laid up in his youth, and held fast in all fortune, a genuine and passionate love for reading.

author: James Allen
title: Harmony is one phase of the law whose spiritual expression is love.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: Hate controls everything it touches, but love sets everything it touches free.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: Hate leaves ugly scars, love leaves beautiful ones.

author: Buddha
title: Hatred does not cease through hatred at any time. Hatred ceases through love. This is an unalterable law.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Hatred of enemies is easier and more intense than love of friends. But from men who are more anxious to injure opponents than to benefit the world at large no great good is to be expected.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Hatred paralyzes life; love releases it. Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life; love illuminates it.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: Hatred which is entirely conquered by love passes into love, and love on that account is greater than if it had not been preceded by hatred.

author: Bill Cosby
title: Having a child is surely the most beautifully irrational act that two people in love can commit.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: Having books published is very destructive to writing. It is even worse than making love too much. Because when you make love too much at least you get a damned clarte that is like no other light. A very clear and hollow light.

author: Brett Ratner
title: Having love in your heart doesn't count for much if what comes out of your mouth is ugly and bigoted.

author: Anne Brontë
title: He despises me, because he knows I love him.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: He had that curious love of green, which in individuals is always the sign of a subtle artistic temperament, and in nations is said to denote a laxity, if not a decadence of morals.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: He that falls in love with himself will have no rivals.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: He who falls in love with himself will have no rivals.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: He who is in love is wise and is becoming wiser, sees newly every time he looks at the object beloved, drawing from it with his eyes and his mind those virtues which it possesses.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: He who is in love with himself has at least this advantage - he won't encounter many rivals.

author: Harry Emerson Fosdick
