author: Jalal-Uddin Rumi
title: Let the beauty we love be what we do.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.,

author: John Donne
title: Let us love nobly, and live, and add again years and years unto years, till we attain to write threescore: this is the second of our reign.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Let us more and more insist on raising funds of love, of kindness, of understanding, of peace. Money will come if we seek first the Kingdom of God - the rest will be given.

author: Maria Weston Chapman
title: Let us rise in the moral power of womanhood; and give utterance to the voice of outraged mercy, and insulted justice, and eternal truth, and mighty love and holy freedom.

author: Ann Coulter
title: Liberals become indignant when you question their patriotism, but simultaneously work overtime to give terrorists a cushion for the next attack and laugh at dumb Americans who love their country and hate the enemy.

author: Abel Hermant
title: Lies kill love, it's been said. Well, what about frankness, then.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: Life and love are life and love, a bunch of violets is a bunch of violets, and to drag in the idea of a point is to ruin everything. Live and let live, love and let love, flower and fade, and follow the natural curve, which flows on, pointless.

author: Edna Ferber
title: Life cannot defeat a writer who is in love with writing; for life itself is a writer's love until death.

author: Georges Bataille
title: Life has always taken place in a tumult without apparent cohesion, but it only finds its grandeur and its reality in ecstasy and in ecstatic love.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
title: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward in the same direction.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Life in abundance comes only through great love.

author: Victor Hugo
title: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.

author: Thornton T. Munger
title: Life is given for wisdom, and yet we are not wise; for goodness, and we are not good; for overcoming evil, and evil remains; for patience and sympathy and love, and yet we are fretful and hard and weak and selfish. We are keyed not to attainment, but to the struggle toward it.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Life is indeed darkness save when there is urge, and all urge is blind save when there is knowledge, and all knowledge is vain save when there is work, and all work is empty save when there is love.

author: Bob Fosse
title: Life is just a bowl of cherries, don't take it serious, its mysterious. Life is just a bowl of cherries, so live and laugh and laugh at love, love a laugh, laugh and love.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.

author: Yann Martel
title: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous, possessive love that grabs at what it can. But life leaps over oblivion lightly, losing only a thing or two of no importance.

author: Victor Hugo
title: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.

author: Sydney Smith
title: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Life isn't long enough for love and art.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Life may change, but it may fly not; Hope may vanish, but can die not; Truth be veiled, but still it burneth; Love repulsed,  but it returneth.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that. And living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on Earth.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.

author: Caroline Lawrence
title: Like every child growing up in America, I read 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' and 'Huckleberry Finn.' I liked them well enough, but I didn't love them.

author: Armistead Maupin
title: Like I've always said, love wouldn't be blind if the braille weren't so damned much fun.

author: Lord George Byron
title:
Like the measles, love is most dangerous when it comes late in life.,
,

author: Butch Trucks
title: Listen to John Coltrane. When he plays 'A Love Supreme,' that guy is totally into himself.

author: Caroline Leavitt
title: Literature can allow us to experience the best side of humankind, where instead of giving up, we struggle desperately in the ruins for love, connection and hope.

author: Mae West
title: Look your best - who said love is blind?,

author: Billie Holiday
title: Lord I love my man, tell the world I do , I love my man, tell the world I do , But when he mistreats me , Makes me feel so blue.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
title: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
title: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where these is hatred, let me sow love.

author: James Joyce
title: Love (understood as the desire of good for another) is in fact so unnatural a phenomenon that it can scarcely repeat itself, the soul being unable to become virgin again and not having energy enough to cast itself out again into the ocean of another's soul.

author: William Shakespeare
title:
Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.,
,

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
title: Love alone can unite living beings so as to complete and fulfill them... for it alone joins them by what is deepest in themselves. All we need is to imagine our ability to love developing until it embraces the totality of men and the earth.

author: Pearl S. Buck
title: Love alone could waken love.

author: Robert Hayden
title: Love and death are the two great hinges on which all human sympathies turn.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Love and doubt have never been on speaking terms.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title:
Love and kindness are never wasted. They always make a difference. They bless the one who receives them, and they bless you, the giver.,
,

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Love and peace of mind do protect us. They allow us to overcome the problems that life hands us. They teach us to survive... to live now... to have the courage to confront each day.

author: William Law
title: Love and pity and wish well to every soul in the world; dwell in love, and then you dwell in God.

author: Henry Fielding
title: Love and scandal are the best sweeteners of tea.

author: Andy Warhol
title: Love and sex can go together and sex and unlove can go together and love and unsex can go together. But personal love and personal sex is bad.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: Love and war are the same thing, and stratagems and policy are as allowable in the one as in the other.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Love and you shall be loved. All love is mathematically just, as much as the two sides of an algebraic equation.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love bears it out even to the edge of doom.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.

author: R. H. Delaney
title: Love builds bridges where there are none.

author: John Donne
title: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Love can do much, but duty more.

author: Marina Warner
title: Love can make you turn on yourself, and it can do harmful things to you.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: Love can never grow old. Locks may lose their brown and gold. Cheeks may fade and hollow grow. But the hearts that love will know, never winter's frost and chill, summer's warmth is in them still.

author: Barry Cornwall
title: Love can take what shape he pleases; and when once begun his fiery inroad in the soul, how vain the after knowledge which his presence gives! We weep or rave; but still he lives, and lives master and lord, amidst pride and tears and pain.

author: Jim Morrison
title:
Love cannot save you from your own fate.,
,
,
,

author: Aphra Behn
title: Love ceases to be a pleasure, when it ceases to be a secret.

author: Comte de Bussy-Rabutin
title: Love comes from blindness, friendship from knowledge.

author: Dr. Joyce Brothers
title: Love comes when manipulation stops; when you think more about the other person than about his or her reactions to you. When you dare to reveal yourself fully. When you dare to be vulnerable.

author: Virgil
title: Love conquers all; let us surrender to Love.

author: St. John of the Cross
title: Love consists not in feeling great things but in having great detachment and in suffering for the Beloved.

author: Karl A. Menninger
title: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: Love delayed is lust augmented.

author: Pearl S. Buck
title: Love dies only when growth stops.

author: James Baldwin
title: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
title: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: Love does not just sit there, like a stone; it had to be made, like bread, remade all the time, made new.

author: Franklin P. Jones
title: Love doesn't make the world go round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.

author: Og Mandino
title: Love doesn't sit there like a stone, it has to be made, like bread: remade all the time, made new.

author: John Oxenham
title: Love ever gives. Forgives outlives. And ever stands with open hands. And while it lives, it gives. For this is love's prerogatives - to give, and give, and give.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Love feels no burden, regards not labors, strives toward more than it attains, argues not of impossibility, since it believes that it may and can do all things. Therefore it avails for all things, and fulfils and accomplishes much where one not a lover falls and lies helpless.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Love feels no burden, thinks nothing of trouble, attempts what is above its strength.... It is therefore able to undertake all things, and it completes many things, and warrants them to take effect, where he who does not love would faint and lie down.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Love for all means coldness to something or someone. Even Jesus, let us recall, was unnecessarily rude to his mother at Cana.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Love gives itself; it is not bought.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Love gives naught but itself and takes naught but from itself. Love possesses not nor would it be possessed; For love is sufficient unto love.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Love grows by giving. The love we give away is the only love we keep. The only way to retain love is to give it away.,

author: John Galsworthy
title: Love has no age, no limit; and no death. ,

author: William Law
title: Love has no errors, for all errors are the want for love.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Love Him, and keep Him for thy Friend, who, when all go away, will not forsake thee, nor suffer thee to perish at the last.

author: Babyface
title: Love hurts the most when you really love. Sometimes you think you're in love, and then you find out that you're not because you're not really hurting. But when it's real love, then it's gonna hurt. It's supposed to hurt because it's real.

author: Alphonse Karr
title: Love in marriage should be the accomplishment of a beautiful dream, and not, as it too often is, the end.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Love is a better teacher than duty.

author: Voltaire
title: Love is a canvas furnished by Nature and embroidered by imagination.

author: Truman Capote
title: Love is a chain of love as nature is a chain of life.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: Love is a choice you make from moment to moment.,

author: Bell Hooks
title: Love is a combination of care, commitment, knowledge, responsibility, respect and trust.

author: Al Goldstein
title: Love is a deception and a trap. Love is as big a myth that God sits with his flowing white beard in a throne and looks at us.

author: Lorrie Moore
title: Love is a fever, she said. And when you come out of it you'll discover whether you've been lucky - or not.

author: Joan Crawford
title: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: Love is a force more formidable than any other. It is invisible - it cannot be seen or measured, yet it is powerful enough to transform you in a moment, and offer you more joy than any material possession could.

author: E. Joseph Cossman
title: Love is a friendship set to music.

author: Doug Horton
title: Love is a given, hatred is acquired.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else.

author: Ben Hecht
title: Love is a hole in the heart.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: Love is a kind of dementia with very precise and oft-repeated clinical symptoms.

author: Matt Groening
title: Love is a perky elf dancing a merry little jig and then suddenly he turns on you with a miniature machine gun.

author: Steve Martin
title:
Love is a promise delivered already broken.,
,
,

author: John Lennon
title: Love is a promise, love is a souvenir, once given never forgotten, never let it disappear.

author: Plato
title: Love is a serious mental disease.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Love is a simple thing and a deep thing: it is an act of life and not an illusion. Art is an illusion.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs. Being purged, a fire sparkling in lovers eyes. Being vexed, a sea nourished with lovers tears. What is it else? A madness most discreet, a choking gall and a preserving sweet.

author: Matt Groening
title: Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come.

author: Paul Scherer
title: Love is a spendthrift, leaves it arithmetic at home, is always in the red.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Love is a state in which a man sees things most decidedly as the are not.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: Love is a temporary madness. It erupts like an earthquake and then subsides.

author: Pierre Corneille
title: Love is a tyrant sparing none.

author: Euripides
title: Love is all we have, the only way that each can help the other.

author: Paul Mccartney
title: Love is all you need.

author: Andreas Capellanus
title: Love is always a stranger in the house of avarice.

author: Peter Ustinov
title: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Love is an alliance of friendship and animalism; if the former predominates it is passion exalted and refined; if the latter, gross and sensual.

author: George Jean Nathan
title: Love is an emotion experienced by the many and enjoyed by the few.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Love is an emotion that is based on an opinion of women that is impossible for those who have had any experience with them.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Love is an expression and assertion of self-esteem, a response to one's own values in the person of another. One gains a profoundly personal, selfish joy from the mere existence of the person one loves. It is one's own personal, selfish happiness that one seeks, earns, and derives from love.

author: Ericka Huggins
title: Love is an expression of power. We can use it to transform our world.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: Love is an ideal thing, marriage a real thing; a confusion of the real with the ideal never goes unpunished.

author: Robert Frost
title: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.

author: Lord Dewar
title: Love is an ocean of emotions entirely surrounded by expenses.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Love is as necessary to human beings as food and shelter; [but] without intelligence, ... love is impotent and freedom unattainable.

author: Pauline Thomason
title: Love is blind - marriage is the eye-opener.

author: James Graham
title: Love is blind and marriage is the institution for the blind.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love is blind, and lovers cannot see the pretty follies that themselves commit

author: Geoffrey Chaucer
title: Love is blind.

author: Alexander Smith
title: Love is but the discovery of ourselves in others, and the delight in the recognition.

author: Ralph Waldo Trine
title: Love is everything. It is the key to life, and its influences are those that move the world.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Love is free; to promise for ever to love the same woman is not less absurd than to promise to believe the same creed; such a vow in both cases excludes us from all inquiry.

author: Ann Landers
title: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.

author: Ovid
title: Love is full of anxious fears.

author: Alan Cohen
title: Love is heaven and fear is hell. Where you place your attention is where you live.

author: Herbert Spencer
title: Love is life's end, but never ending. Love is life's wealth, never spent, but ever spending. Love's life's reward, rewarded in rewarding.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Love is life. All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. Everything is, everything exists, only because I love. Everything is united by it alone. Love is God, and to die means that I, a particle of love, shall return to the general and eternal source.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.

author: Helen Keller
title: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but the smell makes the garden a place of joy.

author: Bruce Lee
title: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.

author: Jules Renard
title: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: Love is like any other luxury. You have no right to it unless you can afford it.

author: P. Fletcher
title: Love is like linen, often changed the sweeter.

author: Dorothy Parker
title: Love is like quicksilver in the hand. Leave the fingers open and it stays. Clutch is, and it darts away.

author: Mary Roberts Rhinehart
title: Love is like the measles. The older you get it, the worse the attack.

author: Jerome K. Jerome
title: Love is like the measles; we all have to go through it.

author: Emily Brontë
title: Love is like the wild rose-briar; Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.

author: John Dryden
title: Love is love's reward.

author: Louis Aragon
title: Love is made by two people, in different kinds of solitude. It can be in a crowd, but in an oblivious crowd.

author: Ellen Key
title: Love is moral even without legal marriage, but marriage is immoral without love.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: Love is most nearly itself when here and now cease to matter.

author: Judith Viorst
title: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident, a tight girdle, a higher tax bracket, or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.

author: John Keats
title: Love is my religion - I could die for it.,

author: Toni Morrison
title: Love is never any better than the lover.

author: Washington Irving
title: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Love is not altogether a delirium, yet it has many points in common therewith.

author: Rabbi Julins Gordon
title: Love is not blind - it sees more, not less. But because it sees more, it is willing to see less.

author: Bette Davis
title: Love is not enough. It must be the foundation, the cornerstone - but not the complete structure. It is much too pliable, too yielding.

author: John Dryden
title: Love is not in our choice but in our fate.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: Love is not just looking at each other, it's looking in the same direction.

author: Theodore Roethke
title: Love is not love until love's vulnerable.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love is not love when it is mingled with regards that stand aloof from the entire point.

author: Sydney Joseph Perelman
title: Love is not the dying moan of a distant violin-it's the triumphant twang of a bedspring.

author: St. Jerome
title: Love is not to be purchased, and affection has no price.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Love is not weakness. It is strong. Only the sacrament of marriage can contain it.

author: Erich Fromm
title: Love is often nothing but a favorable exchange between two people who get the most of what they can expect, considering their value on the personality market.

author: Candice Glover
title: Love is one of my favorite things to talk about. Every song will be about losing it or finding it, seeing a guy and not knowing if you want to tell him how you feel yet. I guess I'm a hopeless romantic.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Love is only a dirty trick played on us to achieve continuation of the species.,

author: Frank Gelett Burgess
title: Love is only chatter, friends are all that matter.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Love is only one of many passions.,

author: Mangnu Hirschfield
title: Love is only the game that is not called on account of darkness.

author: Toni Morrison
title: Love is or it ain't. Thin love ain't love at all.

author: Thomas Merton
title: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.

author: Charles Péguy
title: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.

author: Josh Billings
title: Love is said to be blind, but I know some fellows in love who can see twice as much in their sweethearts as I do.

author: Doug Horton
title: Love is seeing without eyes, hearing without ears; hatred is nothing.

author: Jerome Cummings
title: Love is shown in your deeds, not in your words.

author: Aristophanes
title: Love is simply the name for the desire and the pursuit of the whole.

author: Michael Ondaatje
title: Love is so small it can tear itself through the eye of a needle.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: Love is something eternal; the aspect may change, but not the essence.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Love is something far more than desire for sexual intercourse; it is the principal means of escape from the loneliness which afflicts most men and women throughout the greater part of their lives.

author: Sting
title: Love is stronger than justice.

author: Hermann Hesse
title: Love is stronger than violence.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Love is swift, sincere, pious, joyful, generous, strong, patient, faithful, prudent, long-suffering, courageous, and never seeking its own; for wheresoever a person seeketh his own, there he falleth from love.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Love is temporary insanity curable by marriage.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
title: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.

author: Wayne Dyer
title: Love is the ability and willingness to allow those that you care for to be what they choose for themselves, without any insistence that they satisfy you.

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
title: Love is the affinity which links and draws together the elements of the world... Love, in fact, is the agent of universal synthesis.

author: Woody Allen
title: Love is the answer. But while you're waiting for the answer, sex raises some pretty good questions.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: Love is the beauty of the soul.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: Love is the cheapest of religions.

author: Erich Fromm
title: Love is the child of freedom, never that of domination.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Love is the delusion that one woman differs from another.

author: Judith Rossner
title: Love is the direct opposite of hate. By definition it's something you can't feel for more than a few minutes at a time, so what's all this bullshit about loving somebody for the rest of your life?

author: Mme de Stael
title: Love is the emblem of eternity; it confounds all notion of time; effaces all memory of a beginning, all fear of an end.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Love is the expression of one's values, the greatest reward you can earn for the moral qualities you have achieved in your character and person, the emotional price paid by one man for the joy he receives from the virtues of another.

author: Quentin Crisp
title: Love is the extra effort we make in our dealings with those whom we do not like and once you understand that, you understand all. This idea that love overtakes you is nonsense. This is but a polite manifestation of sex. To love another you have to undertake some fragment of their destiny.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: Love is the flower of life, and blossoms unexpectedly and without law, and must be plucked where it is found, and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.

author: John Lennon
title: Love is the flower you've got to let grow.,

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Love is the flowering of meditation. Meditation brings many treasures; perhaps love is the greatest roseflower that grows on the bush of meditation.

author: Louise Hay
title: Love is the great miracle cure. Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.

author: Smiley Blanton
title: Love is the immortal flow of energy that nourishes, extends and preserves. Its eternal goal is life.

author: Plato
title: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.

author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti
title: Love is the last relay and ultimate outposts of eternity.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Love is the master key which opens the gates of happiness.

author: Alphonse Karr
title: Love is the most terrible, and also the most generous of the passions; it is the only one which includes in its dreams the happiness of someone else.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: Love is the only gold.,

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: Love is the only gold.

author: Erich Fromm
title: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.

author: Victor Frankel
title: Love is the only way to grasp another human being in the innermost core of his personality.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Love is the river of life in the world.

author: Judith Viorst
title: Love is the same as like except you feel sexier.

author: James Thurber
title: Love is the strange bewilderment that overtakes one person on account of another person.

author: Thomas Traherne
title: Love is the true means by which the world is enjoyed: our love to others, and others love to us.

author: Tom Wolfe
title: Love is the ultimate expression of the will to live.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.

author: John Ciardi
title: Love is the word used to label the sexual excitement of the young, the habituation of the middle-aged, and the mutual dependence of the old.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love is too young to know what conscience is.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Love is what happens to a man and woman who don't know each other.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Love is what happens to men and women who don't know each other.

author: James Thurber
title: Love is what you've been through with somebody.

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.,

author: Andre Breton
title: Love is when you meet someone who tells you something new about yourself.

author: Umberto Eco
title: Love is wiser than wisdom.

author: Jean Anouilh
title: Love is, above all, the gift of oneself.

author: Kazuo Ishiguro
title: Love isn't about when you first meet. It's about the many, many years you spend together, when you're trying to keep that flame burning.

author: Mae West
title: Love isn't an emotion or an instinct - it's an art.,

author: Stephen King
title: Love isn't soft, like the poets say. Love has teeth which bite and the wounds never close.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Love keeps the cold out better than a cloak.,

author: Arthur Rubenstein
title: Love life and life will love you back. Love people and they will love you back.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: Love looks forward, hate looks back, anxiety has eyes all over its head.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind; And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.

author: Josh Billings
title: Love looks through a telescope; envy, through a microscope.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Love makes everything that is heavy light.

author: Lady Blessington
title: Love matches are made by people who are content, for a month of honey, to condemn themselves to a life of vinegar.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Love matches, so called, have illusion for their father and need for their mother.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Love may forgive all infirmities and love still in spite of them: but Love cannot cease to will their removal.

author: Bradley Whitford
title: Love means never having to say you're a zero.,

author: Erich Segal
title: Love means never having to say you're sorry.

author: Guy de Maupassant
title: Love means the body, the soul, the life, the entire being. We feel love as we feel the warmth of our blood, we breathe love as we breathe air, we hold it in ourselves as we hold our thoughts. Nothing more exists for us.

author: Erich Fromm
title: Love means to commit oneself without guarantee, to give oneself completely in the hope that our love will produce love in the loved person. Love is an act of faith, and whoever is of little faith is also of little love.

author: Anne Campbell
title: Love means to commit yourself without guarantee.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Love must be as much a light, as it is a flame.

author: Emma Goldman
title: Love needs no protection; it is its own protection

author: Anais Nin
title: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish it's source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.

author: Hannah More
title: Love never reasons, but profusely gives; it gives like a thoughtless prodigal its all, and then trembles least it has done to little.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.,

author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand
title: Love of glory can only create a great hero; contempt of glory creates a great man.

author: Ben Stein
title: Love of God and compassion and empathy leads you to a very glorious place- science leads you to killing people.

author: Michael Leunig
title: Love one another and you will be happy. It's as simple and as difficult as that.

author: Billy Strayhorn
title: Love or not, I wouldn't subject a wife to the road. It's punishment.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title:
Love prefers twilight to daylight.,
,

author: William Blake
title: Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair.

author: Bernard of Clairvaux
title: Love seeks no cause beyond itself and no fruit; it is its own fruit, its own enjoyment. I love because I love; I love in order that I may love.

author: Christina Rossetti
title: Love shall be our token; love be yours and love be mine.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Love should be a tree whose roots are deep in the earth, but whose branches extend into heaven.

author: Aaron Carter
title: Love shouldn't be about jealousy or anything like that. It should be about commitment and being able to trust that person. If you can't have that from the get-go, there's a problem.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love sought is good, but given unsought is better.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: Love stories are only fit for the solace of people in the insanity of puberty. No healthy adult human being can really care whether so-and-so does or does not succeed in satisfying his physiological uneasiness by the aid of some particular person or not.

author: Konstantin Stanislavisky
title: Love the art in yourself and not yourself in the art.

author: Brigham Young
title: Love the giver more than the gift.

author: Sister Corita Kent
title: Love the moment and the energy of the moment will spread beyond all boundaries.

author: Buddha
title: Love the whole world as a mother lovers her only child.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: Love thou the rose, yet leave it on its stem.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Love thy neighbor - but don't pull down your hedge.

author: Confucius
title: Love thy neighbor as thyself: Do not to others what thou wouldn't not wish be done to thyself: Forgive injuries. Forgive thy enemy, be reconciled to him, give him assistance, invoke God in his behalf.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Love to faults is always blind, always is to joy inclined. Lawless, winged, and unconfined, and breaks all chains from every mind.

author: John Donne
title: Love was as subtly caught, as a disease; But being got it is a treasure sweet, which to defend is harder than to get: And ought not be profaned on either part, for though 'Tis got by chance,  'Tis kept by art.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Love well, whip well.

author: Norman O. Brown
title: Love without attachment is light.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: Love won't be tampered with, love won't go away. Push it to one side and it creeps to the other.

author: John Dryden
title: Love works a different way in different minds, the fool it enlightens and the wise it blinds.

author: G. Crabbe
title: Love wraps the mind a little from the right.

author: R A Dickson
title: Love your enemies just in case your friends turn out to be a bunch of bastards.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.

author: Lucille Ball
title: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.

author: Les Brown
title: Love yourself unconditionally, just as you love those closest to you despite their faults.

author: Betty Shabazz
title: Love yourself, appreciate yourself, see the good in you... and respect yourself.

author: John Donne
title: Love, all alike, no season knows, nor clime, nor hours, days, months, which are the rags of time.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: Love, and do what you like.

author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine
title: Love, Arthur, is a poodle's chance of attaining the infinite, and personally I have my pride.

author: Hannah Arendt
title: Love, by its very nature, is unworldly, and it is for this reason rather than its rarity that it is not only apolitical but anti-political, perhaps the most powerful of all anti-political human forces.

author: Anton Chekhov
title: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.

author: Truman Capote
title: Love, having no geography, knows no boundaries.

author: Zora Neale Hurston
title: Love, I find, is like singing. Everybody can do enough to satisfy themselves, though it may not impress the neighbors as being very much.

author: Augustus Hare
title: Love, it has been said, flows downward. The love of parents for their children has always been far more powerful than that of children for their parents; and who among the sons of men ever loved God with a thousandth part of the love which God has manifested to us?

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: Love, safety, belongingness and respect from other people are almost panaceas for the situational disturbances and even for some of the mild character disturbances.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Love, the quest; marriage, the conquest; divorce, the inquest.

author: David Seabury
title: Love... Force it and it disappears. You cannot will love, nor even control it. You can only guide its expression. It comes or it goes according to those qualities in life that invite it or deny its presence.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Love: A temporary insanity curable by marriage or by removal of the patient from the influences under which he incurred the disorder.

author: Terence
title: Lovers quarrels are the renewal of love.

author: Anatole France
title: Lovers who love truly do not write down their happiness.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: Lukewarmness I account a sin, as great in love as in religion.

author: Carl Lewis
title: M so fortunate to have done what I love to do for so long, but the day I retired was one of the best days of my life. Not because I was happy to get away from the sport, but because it was clear in my mind that I had done all I possibly could, and that it was time to go.

author: Ovid
title: Majesty and love do not consort well together, nor do they dwell in the same place.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: Man dreams of fame while woman wakes to love.

author: Albert Camus
title: Man is an idea, and a precious small idea once he turns his back on love.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Man is born passionate of body, but with an innate though secret tendency to the love of Good in his main-spring of Mind. But God help us all! It is at present a sad jar of atoms.

author: James Allen
title: Man is made or unmade by himself. By the right choice he ascends. As a being of power, intelligence, and love, and the lord of his own thoughts, he holds the key to every situation.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Man's love is of man's life a part; it is a woman's whole existence. In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.

author: John Ruskin
title: Man's only true happiness is to live in hope of something to be won by him. Reverence something to be worshipped by him, and love something to be cherished by him, forever.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Mankind must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression, and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.

author: Sydney Smith
title: Manners are like the shadows of virtues, they are the momentary display of those qualities which our fellow creatures love and respect.

author: Quentin Crisp
title: Manners are love in a cool climate.

author: Maurice Chevalier
title: Many a man has fallen in love with a girl in light so dim he would not have chosen a suit by it.

author: Stephen B. Leacock
title: Many a man in love with a dimple makes the mistake of marrying the whole girl.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Many can brook the weather that love not the wind.

author: Billy Porter
title: Many movie stars or American Idol contestants sort of fall into theater... and say, 'Oh, yeah, I would love to do theater.' And then they get here and say, 'Oh, wait a minute, this actually is a craft!' It's not just show up one day and do it. It's show up eight times a week, twice on Wednesdays and twice on Saturdays.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Many people mistake our work for our vocation. Our vocation is the love of Jesus.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Many people when they fall in love look for a little haven of refuge from the world, where they can be sure of being admired when they are not admirable, and praised when they are not praiseworthy.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: Marriage is not a noun; it's a verb. It isn't something you get. It's something you do. It's the way you love your partner every day.

author: Sir Pelham Grenville Wodehouse
title: Marriage isn't a process of prolonging the life of love, but of mummifying the corpse.

author: Thomas Love Peacock
title: Marriage may often be a stormy lake, but celibacy is almost always a muddy horse pond.

author: Jean Kerr
title: Marrying a man is like buying something you've been admiring for a long time in a shop window. You may love it when you get it home, but it doesn't always go with everything else in the house.

author: William Wycherley
title: Marrying to increase love is like gaming to become rich; alas, you only lose what little stock you had before.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: Martin Luther King dedicated his life to love and to justice between fellow human beings. ,

author: Antonia Fraser
title: Mary Queen of Scots was my first love, and that is always something special.

author: Caroline Knapp
title: Mastery over the body - its impulses, its needs, its size - is paramount; to lose control is to risk beauty, and to risk beauty is to risk desirability, and to risk desirability is to risk entitlement to sexuality and love and self-esteem.

author: Ada V. Hendricks
title: May you have the gladness of Christmas which is hope; The spirit of Christmas which is peace; The heart of Christmas which is love.

author: Bobby Darin
title: Maybe I should quit the business. There's no one left for me to love. Mama's dead. Mr. Burns couldn't care less about me. What's left?

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Meditation is the most significant because it opens the door for all other significant things: love, prayer, God, light, music, poetry.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Men always want to be a woman's first love. Women have a more subtle instinct: What they like is to be a man's last romance.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: Men and women are not free to love decently until they have analyzed themselves completely and swept away every mystery from sex; and this means the acquisition of a profound philosophical theory based on wide reading of anthropology and enlightened practice.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Men have died from time to time, and worms have eaten them, but not for love.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: Men have social needs. They have a need for other people; they have a need to love and be loved.

author: Woody Allen
title: Men learn to love the woman they are attracted to. Women learn to become attracted to the man they fall in love with.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Men love to wonder and that is the seed of our science.

author: Peter Wastholm
title: Men mistake friendship, but not sex, for love; women mistake sex, but not friendship, for love.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: Men often discover their affinity to each other by the mutual love they have for a book.

author: Candice Bergen
title: Men say they love independence in a woman, but they don't waste a second demolishing it brick by brick.

author: Adela Florence Nicolson
title: Men should be judged not by their tint of skin, the gods they serve, the vintage they drink, nor by the way they fight, or love, or sin, but by the quality of the thought they think.

author: Machiavelli
title: Men shrink less from offending one who inspires love than one who inspires fear.

author: Vince Lombardi
title: Mental toughness is many things. It is humility because it behooves all of us to remember that simplicity is the sign of greatness and meekness is the sign of true strength. Mental toughness is spartanism with qualities of sacrifice, self-denial, dedication. It is fearlessness, and it is love.

author: Marianne Williamson
title: Miracles occur naturally as expressions of love. The real miracle is the love that inspires them. In this sense everything that comes from love is a miracle.

author: Don DeLillo
title: Mirrors and images. Or sex and love. These are two separate systems that we miserably try to link.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: Money is a singular thing. It ranks with love as man's greatest source of joy. And with death as his greatest source of anxiety. Over all history it has oppressed nearly all people in one of two ways: either it has been abundant and very unreliable, or reliable and very scarce.

author: Doug Horton
title: Money is good, love is wealth.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Money is like love; it kills slowly and painfully the one who withholds it, and enlivens the other who turns it on his fellow man.

author: George Farquhar
title: Money is the sinews of love, as of war.

author: Bill Hybels
title: More than anything, people want the reality of the discussion at hand. If what is going on in that building is the real thing, if the transforming love and power of Jesus Christ is being experienced, you can sit on a metal folding chair or in a plush theater seat.

author: Barry McGee
title: Most inspiration still comes from bicycling around San Francisco. This city never fails to inspire me. It is one of the most vibrant cities - especially visually - with a constant influx of young energy arriving daily. I love it.

author: John Maynard Keynes
title: Most men love money and security more, and creation and construction less, as they get older.

author: Bruce Coville
title: Most of all, I love being a storyteller. And yes, I want to make a good living, but I'm not always driven by the best commercial sense.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Most people experience love, without noticing that there is anything remarkable about it.

author: Caitlin Moran
title: Most women I know love the idea of fashion, but the practicalities that go with it are just distressing.

author: Barbara Walters
title: Motherhood is tough. If you just want a wonderful little creature to love, you can get a puppy.

author: Robert Browning
title: Motherhood: All love begins and ends there.,

author: Ann Beattie
title: Much of what happens in Love Always is really from overheard conversations in the Russian Tea Room. It's an improvisation of the way certain Hollywood agents think and talk to each other.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Much that passes as idealism is disguised hatred or disguised love of power.

author: Octave Mirbeau
title: Murder is born of love, and love attains the greatest intensity in murder.

author: Harry Mathews
title: Music had been my first love among the arts, and I was fascinated by it, as I still am.

author: Sidney Lanier
title: Music is Love in search of a word.

author: A. J. McLean
title: Music is love, love is music, music is life, and I love my life. Thank you and good night.

author: Lawrence Durrell
title: Music is only love looking for words.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Must I do all the evil I can before I learn to shun it? Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: Mutual respect implies discretion and reserve even in love itself; it means preserving as much liberty as possible to those whose life we share. We must distrust our instinct of intervention, for the desire to make one's own will prevail is often disguised under the mask of solicitude.

author: William Shakespeare
title: My bounty is as boundless as the sea, my love as deep. The more I give thee, the more I have, For both are infinite

author: Brendan Coyle
title: My dad was a master butcher and I trained to be a butcher when I left school. I didn't enjoy it at the time but I love cooking now, so perhaps I would have been a chef.

author: Edward Gibbon
title: My early and invincible love of reading I would not exchange for all the riches of India.

author: Casey Affleck
title: My family would be supportive if I said I wanted to be a Martian, wear only banana skins, make love to ashtrays, and eat tree bark.

author: Bryan Batt
title: My family's business was actually an amusement park in New Orleans. My grandfather had started that, and my grandmother was a dance maven in New Orleans. It was just the theatricality and the Mardi Gras and the pageantry that I fell in love with at an early age.

author: Beyonce Knowles
title: My fans kept asking where they could get clothes like 'Destiny's Child's', so it was only natural for us to do a clothing line. I was adamant about not putting my name on something that I didn't love.

author: Bow Wow
title: My fans saw 'Roll Bounce,' but also that older crowd who might not have been familiar with me on the music tip saw 'Roll Bounce' and loved it. 'Roll Bounce' opened up that door for me to have older people love Bow Wow and opened up that door so all of the kids would love Bow Wow. My fan base is really diverse; it's all ages and all colors.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: My father taught me to work, but he did not teach me to love it.

author: Ang Lee
title: My first instinct was to cast as close to the short story as possible, but then I realized that I needed actors who could go for it and that they had to function well as a couple in a love story.

author: Bria Skonberg
title: My first love of jazz came from joining the Chilliwack Middle School band - it was like an 18-piece jazz band, and I wanted to join just because the older kids looked like they were having so much fun.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: My first thoughts are that I should not let people down, that I should support them and love them.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: My friends knew I was obsessed with these 'Twilight' boys because I love a dangerous love story.

author: Carson Daly
title: My girlfriend Siri is a food blogger, and we both love to entertain and eat. This is what happens when you're in your thirties: what was once a passion and real appetite for nightlife in New York City manifests itself into other things, like entertaining at home.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: My God, these folks don't know how to love - that's why they love so easily.

author: Brendan Gleeson
title: My grandfather played a mandolin, so I got my hands on that. Then on down to a banjo, and I found I couldn't play any kind of soft or mournful music with that so I took up the fiddle in my late 20s or early 30s - and that was far too late. But it keeps me off the streets. It has been a love of mine since I was 17 maybe.

author: Maya Angelou
title: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: My heart, my heart, be whole and free: Love is thine only enemy.

author: Annie Leibovitz
title: My hope is that we continue to nurture the places that we love, but that we also look outside our immediate worlds.

author: Bryce Courtenay
title: My job, and that's my job, is to dress the naked truth. To make it interesting, to make it viable, to make it seem like something you understand and feel and love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: My life is an indivisible whole, and all my attitudes run into one another; and they all have their rise in my insatiable love for mankind.

author: Robert Burns
title: My love is like a red, red rose, that's newly sprung in June.

author: Woody Allen
title: My love life is terrible. The last time I was inside a woman was when I visited the Statue of Liberty.

author: Bonnie Tyler
title: My mother, who died aged 82, had Alzheimer's. Losing your memory is bad enough, but everything shuts down. You can't remember how to eat or go to the toilet. It's a terrible disease and so distressing to watch it take over someone you love.

author: Ben Stein
title: My pals, such as they are, in Hollywood, ask me why I love to travel to D.C. so much, why it's a vacation destination for me. I say, 'Because I sometimes have perfect days there.'

author: Barack Obama
title: My parents shared not only an improbable love, they shared an abiding faith in the possibilities of this nation. They would give me an African name, Barack, or blessed, believing that in a tolerant America your name is no barrier to success.

author: Bridget Moynahan
title: My son has two loving parents and an extended family, whether it's cousins or stepmothers or boyfriends. My son is surrounded by love.

author: Blair Underwood
title: My Soul to Keep is the ultimate love story with a black man and a black woman. I call it the ultimate love story. It's about an immortal. We're shooting for this Fall and that's been a six year development right there.

author: Bill Hader
title: My wife and I were on our honeymoon in Turks and Caicos, in the middle of nowhere, and I'm sitting on this deserted beach, and I see one lone person walking along the shore. He walks right up to me and says, 'I love 'Laser Cats,' and then just walks away.

author: Bruce Willis
title: My wife heard me say I love you a thousand times, but she never once heard me say sorry

author: Thomas Szasz
title: Narcissist: psychoanalytic term for the person who loves himself more than his analyst; considered to be the manifestation of a dire mental disease whose successful treatment depends on the patient learning to love the analyst more and himself less.

author: W. H. Auden
title: Narcissus does not fall in love with his reflection because it is beautiful, but because it is his. If it were his beauty that enthralled him, he would be set free in a few years by its fading.

author: David Seabury
title: Nature is at work.. Character and destiny are her handiwork. She gives us love and hate, jealousy and reverence. All that is ours is the power to choose which impulse we shall follow.

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: Neatness begets order; but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.

author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
title: Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius.

author: Bill Hybels
title: Never forget that if you are God's child through Jesus Christ, you are praying to a Father who couldn't love you more than he already does.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: Never go on trips with anyone you do not love.

author: Cynthia Heimel
title: Never judge someone by who he's in love with; judge him by his friends. People fall in love with the most appalling people. Take a cool, appraising glance at his pals.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary.

author: Alan W. Watts
title: Never pretend to a love which you do not actually feel, for love is not ours to command.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Never, my dear Sir, do you take it into your head that I do not love you; you may settle yourself in full confidence both of my love and my esteem; I love you as a kind man, I value you as a worthy man, and hope in time to reverence you as a man of exemplary piety.

author: Jimmy Connors
title: New Yorkers love it when you spill your guts out there. Spill your guts at Wimbledon and they make you stop and clean it up.

author: George Borrow
title: Next to the love of God, the love of country is the best preventive of crime.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: Next to ye both I love the palm, with his leaves of beauty, his fruit of balm.

author: M. Scott Peck
title: Nirvana or lasting enlightenment or true spiritual growth can be achieved only through persistent exercise of real love.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: No armies are needed, no weapons are needed, no nations are needed, no religions are needed. All that is needed is a little meditativeness, a little silence, a little love, a little more humanity... just a little more, and existence will become fragrant with something so totally unique and new that you will have to find a new category for it.

author: Robert Burton
title: No cord nor cable can so forcibly draw, or hold so fast, as love can do with a twined thread.

author: Robert Burton
title: No cord or cable can draw so forcibly, or bind so fast, as love can do with a single thread.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: No deep and strong feeling, such as we may come across here and there in the world, is unmixed with compassion. The more we love, the more the object of our love seems to us to be a victim.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
title: No drug, not even alcohol, causes the fundamental ills of society. If we're looking for the sources of our troubles, we shouldn't test people for drugs, we should test them for stupidity, ignorance, greed and love of power.

author: George Eliot
title: No evil dooms us hopelessly except the evil we love, and desire to continue in, and make no effort to escape from.

author: Greil Marcus
title: No failure in America, whether of love or money, is ever simple; it is always a kind of betrayal, of a mass of shadowy, shared hopes.

author: Jean Paul
title: No heroine can create a hero through love of one, but she can give birth to one.

author: Iris Murdoch
title: No love is entirely without worth, even when the frivolous calls to the frivolous and the base to the base.

author: John Milton
title: No man can love freedom heartily, but good men; tbc rest lovc not freedom, but licence.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: No man can worship God or love his neighbor on an empty stomach.

author: Jane Austen
title: No man dies of love but on the stage

author: Lee Iacocca
title: No matter what you've done for yourself or for humanity, if you can't look back on having given love and attention to your own family, what have you really accomplished?

author: Abdul Qadeer Khan
title: No money on earth can buy the love and affection that has been given to me by a grateful nation.

author: Anna Held
title: No one ever tells us the truth, even those we love.

author: James Baldwin
title: No one knows very much about the life of another. This ignorance becomes vivid, if you love another. Love sets the imagination on fire, and, also, eventually, chars the imagination into a harder element: imagination cannot match love, cannot plunge so deep, or range so wide.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: No one sat me down with a piece of paper and said, “This is what is expected of you. But… I’m lucky enough in the fact that I have found my role… I love being with people.”

author: Benjamin Harrison
title: No other people have a government more worthy of their respect and love or a land so magnificent in extent, so pleasant to look upon, and so full of generous suggestion to enterprise and labor.

author: Shirley Williams
title: No test tube can breed love and affection. No frozen packet of semen ever read a story to a sleepy child.

author: Alexander Pope
title: No woman ever hates a man for being in love with her, but many a woman hate a man for being a friend to her.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: No woman marries for money; they are all clever enough, before marrying a millionaire, to fall in love with him first.

author: Alan W. Watts
title: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.

author: Albert Einstein
title: No, this trick wont work...How on earth are you ever going to explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love?

author: David Sarnoff
title: Nobody can be successful if he doesn't love his work, love his job.

author: Barbra Streisand
title: Nobody on this earth has the right to tell anyone that their love for another human being is morally wrong.

author: Augustus William Hare
title: Nobody who is afraid of laughing, and heartily too, at his friend, can be said to have a true and thorough love for him.

author: John Milton
title: None can love freedom heartily, but good men... the rest love not freedom, but license.

author: Brene Brown
title: Normally, when someone we love is turning away from a struggle, we self-protect by also turning away. That's definitely my first response. I think change is more likely to happen if both partners have common language and a shared lens to see problems.

author: Carol Ann Duffy
title: Not a red rose or a satin heart. , I give you an onion. , It is a moon wrapped in brown paper. , It promises light , like the careful undressing of love... I am trying to be truthful.

author: Salman Rushdie
title: Not even the visionary or mystical experience ever lasts very long. It is for art to capture that experience, to offer it to, in the case of literature, its readers; to be, for a secular, materialist culture, some sort of replacement for what the love of god offers in the world of faith.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Not necessity, not desire -no, the love of power is the demon of men. Let them have everything - health, food, a place to live, entertainment - they are and remain unhappy and low-spirited: for the demon waits and waits and will be satisfied.

author: Bruno Bettelheim
title: Not only is our love for our children sometimes tinged with annoyance, discouragement, and disappointment, the same is true for the love our children feel for us.

author: Ralph Waldo Trine
title: Not to love is not to live or it is to live a living death. The life, that goes out in love to all, is the life, that is full and rich and continually expanding in beauty and power.

author: Robert Southey
title: Not where I breathe, but where I love, I live; Not where I love, but where I am, I die.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
title: Nothing can be love or hated unless it is first known.

author: Thomas Love Peacock
title: Nothing can be more obvious than all animals were created solely and exclusively for the use of man.

author: Aurelius Clemens Prudentius
title: Nothing is higher than the love of truth.

author: Jerome K. Jerome
title: Nothing is more beautiful than the love that has weathered the storms of life. The love of the young for the young, that is the beginning of life. But the love of the old for the old, that is the beginning of things longer.

author: David Gemmell
title: Nothing of real worth can ever be bought. Love, friendship, honour, valour, respect. All these things have to be earned.

author: Charlie Brown
title: Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Now hatred is by far the longest pleasure; Men love in haste, but they detest at leisure.

author: Virgil
title: Now I know what love is.

author: C. Day Lewis
title: Now the peak of summer's past, the sky is overcast And the love we swore would last for an age seems deceit.

author: Bobby Hull
title: Now we're doing it for different reasons. We're doing it to bring back the families to the game, people who love the game, and make it an affordable night's entertainment.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Nowadays love is a matter of chance, matrimony a matter of money and divorce a matter of course.

author: Sir Thomas Malory
title: Nowadays men cannot love seven night but they must have all their desires: that love may not endure by reason; for where they be soon accorded and hasty, heat soon it cooleth. Right so fareth love nowadays, soon hot soon cold: this is no stability. But the old love was not so.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Nuptial love makes mankind; friendly love perfects it; but wanton love corrupts and debases it.

author: Robert Browning
title: O lyric Love, half angel and half bird. And all a wonder and a wild desire.

author: Walt Whitman
title: O public road, I say back I am not afraid to leave you, yet I love you, you express me better than I can express myself.

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
title: O Time and change! With hair as gray as was my sire's that winter day, how strange it seems, with so much gone of life and love, to still live on!

author: Anthony de Mello
title: Obedience keeps the rules. Love knows when to break them.

author: Carolyn Gold Heilbrun
title: Odd, the years it took to learn one simple fact: that the prize just ahead, the next job, publication, love affair, marriage always seemed to hold the key to satisfaction but never, in the longer run, sufficed.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness.

author: C. Fitzhugh
title: Of all great poems, love is the absolute and essential foundation.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Of all that is written, I love only what a person has written with his own blood.

author: Shelby Foote
title: Of all the passions of mankind, the love of novelty most rules the mind. In search of this, from realm to realm we roam. Our fleets come loaded with every folly home.

author: Bruce Eric Kaplan
title: Of course I loved 'I Love Lucy' and saw every episode over and over again. I found it heartbreaking that Ricky got to be famous and have an exciting life at the Tropicana while Lucy was stuck in that terrible apartment with the Mertzes.

author: Brea Grant
title: Oh my God, I'm so excited. I love Comic-Con, it feels like a weird nerd camp. All my nerd friends are there and all the comic book writers I know and then a lot of actors, too, and you hang out with these people for just a few days, but you hang out with them all day, every day. It's like camp - it's like a weird camp. I love it.

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
title: Oh worse than everything, is kindness counterfeiting absent love.

author: Bob Balaban
title: Oh, I was completely hooked on movies and plays and theater from the time I was a day old - I was very, very early on in love with movies and I loved plays.

author: Tennessee Williams
title: Oh, Jacques, we're used to each other, we're a pair of captive hawks caught in the same cage, and so we've grown used to each other. That's what passes for love at this dim, shadowy end of the Camino Real.

author: Jean Anouilh
title: Oh, love is real enough; you will find it someday, but it has one archenemy - and that is life.

author: A. E. Housman
title:
Oh, when I was in love with you ,
 Then I was clean and brave, ,
 And miles around the wonder grew ,
 How well did I behave. ,
  ,
 And now the fancy passes by ,
 And nothing will remain, ,
 And miles around they'll say that I ,
 Am quite myself again.

author: André Gide
title: Old hands soil, it seems, whatever they caress, but they too have their beauty when they are joined in prayer. Young hands were made for caresses and the sheathing of love. It is a pity to make them join too soon.

author: Germaine Greer
title: Older women can afford to agree that femininity is a charade, a matter of colored hair, ecru lace and whalebones, the kind of slap and tat that transvestites are in love with, and no more.

author: Janis Joplin
title: On stage I make love to twenty five thousand people; and then I go home alone.

author: Henry Drummond
title: On the last analysis, then, love is life. Love never faileth and life never faileth so long as there is love.

author: Bruno Tonioli
title: Once I moved to London I thought it was unbeatable. I work a lot in L.A. and love it, but would never give up London. It's a true world city, with an energy that's unique.

author: Lorrie Moore
title: Once love had seemed like magic. Now it seemed like tricks.

author: Audre Lorde
title: Once we recognize what it is we are feeling, once we recognize we can feel deeply, love deeply, can feel joy, then we will demand that all parts of our lives produce that kind of joy.

author: Ace Frehley
title: Once you come and see Kiss, you either love us or you hate us.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Once you start drinking a little of meditativeness, a little of love, you start growing wings.

author: George Orwell
title: One can love a child, perhaps, more deeply than one can love another adult, but it is rash to assume that the child feels any love in return.

author: Georgia O'Keeffe
title: One can not be an American by going about saying that one is an American. It is necessary to feel America, like America, love America and then work.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.,

author: Karl A. Menninger
title: One does not fall in love; one grows into love, and love grows in him.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: One does not kill oneself for love of a woman, but because love - any love - reveals us in our nakedness, our misery, our vulnerability, our nothingness.

author: Jane Austen
title: One does not love a place the less for having suffered in it, unless it has been all suffering, nothing but suffering.

author: Aphra Behn
title: One hour of right-down love is worth an age of dully living on.

author: Bobby Sherman
title: One I built when I was a kid, and it was a real miniature of Disneyland. I fell in love with the park when I went there with my parents on my 12th birthday.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: One is very crazy when in love.

author: Gaston Bachelard
title: One must always maintain one's connection to the past and yet ceaselessly pull away from it. To remain in touch with the past requires a love of memory. To remain in touch with the past requires a constant imaginative effort.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: One must learn to love oneself with a wholesome and healthy love, so that one can bear to be with oneself and need not roam.

author: Bob Hoskins
title: One of the things I've realised is that I am very simple. My wife asked me once if I loved her. I said: 'Look love, I'm a simple man. I love you. End of story.' But I guess you gotta keep saying it with women. I guess she needed reassurance.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.

author: Ace Frehley
title: One thing I love to do is produce. I've produced a couple of bands. I mean, nothing ever really happened with 'em, but I enjoy getting a young band into the studio and guiding them, and making them feel at ease.

author: John Locke
title: One unerring mark of the love of truth is not entertaining any proposition with greater assurance than the proofs it is built upon will warrant.

author: Sophocles
title: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life; that word is love.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
title: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.

author: Kingsley Amis
title: Only a world without love strikes me as instantly and decisively more terrible than one without music.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: Only connect! That was the whole of her sermon. Only connect the prose and the passion, and both will be exalted, and human love will be seen at its height. Live in fragments no longer. Only connect, and the beast and the monk, robbed of the isolation that is life to either, will die.

author: Arthur Rimbaud
title: Only divine love bestows the keys of knowledge.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: Only he can understand what a farm is, what a country is, who shall have sacrificed part of himself to his farm or country, fought to save it, struggled to make it beautiful. Only then will the love of farm or country fill his heart.

author: Elizabeth Bowen
title: Only in a house where one has learnt to be lonely does one have this solicitude for things. One's relation to them, the daily seeing or touching, begins to become love, and to lay one open to pain.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Only in books has mankind known perfect truth, love and beauty.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue, and abiding love.

author: Katharine Hepburn
title: Only the really plain people know about love - the very fascinating ones try so hard to create an impression that they very soon exhaust their talents.

author: Billy Graham
title: Only the supernatural love of God through changed lives can solve the problems that we face in our world.

author: Arlo Guthrie
title: Only the words of love kept alive are worthy of not being wasted

author: Abel Stevens
title: Only those who love with the heart can animate the love of others.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Opera is when a tenor and soprano want to make love, but are prevented from doing so by a baritone.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Ought to be easy, ought to be simple enough: , Man meets woman, and they fall in love, , But the house is haunted and the ride gets rough. , You got to learn to live with what you can't rise above.

author: Bo Sanchez
title: Our Feast gatherings, which has spread all over the world, is attended by young people - and they love to sing worship songs.

author: Colley Cibber
title: Our hours in love have wings; in absence, crutches.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Our life of poverty is as necessary as the work itself. Only in heaven will we see how much we owe to the poor for helping us to love God better because of them.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Our pleasures are short, and can only charm at intervals; love is a method of protraction our greatest pleasure.

author: Mary Caroline Richards
title: Our works and our play. All our pleasures experienced as the pleasure of love. What could be better that? To feel in one's work the tender and flushed substance of one's dearest concern.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Out of love and hatred, out of earnings and borrowings and leadings and losses; out of sickness and pain; out of wooing and worshipping; out of traveling and voting and watching and caring; out of disgrace and contempt, comes our tuition in the serene and beautiful laws.

author: Sir John Suckling
title: Out upon it, I have lov'd three whole days together, and am like to love three more if it proves fair weather.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: Oxford is Oxford: not a mere receptacle for youth, like Cambridge. Perhaps it wants its inmates to love it rather than to love one another.

author: John Dryden
title: Pains of love be sweeter far than all the other pleasures are.

author: Barbara Delinsky
title: Parents do bear some of the responsibility if they don't talk to their kids, are never around, even deny their kids the love that young girls often crave when they decide to have a baby.

author: Carine Roitfeld
title: Paris is mostly retired people - I love it, and it's a beautiful city, but it's quite slow.

title: The hottest love has the coldest end.
