title: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.

author: Ray Bradbury
title: The important thing is to be in love with something.,

author: Nelson Algren
title: The Impossible Generalized Man today is the critic who believes in loving those unworthy of love as well as those worthy -yet believes this only insofar as no personal risk is entailed. Meaning he loves no one, worthy or no. This is what makes him impossible.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The impulse to cruelty is, in many people, almost as violent as the impulse to sexual love - almost as violent and much more mischievous.

author: William Hazlitt
title:
The incentive to ambition is the love of power.,
,

author: Barbara Deming
title: The injunction that we should love our neighbors as ourselves means to us equally that we should love ourselves as we love our neighbors.

author: Bede Griffiths
title: The inspiration came suddenly again to surrender to the Mother. It was quite unexpected: And so somehow I made a surrender to the Mother. Then I had an experience of overwhelming love. Waves of love sort of flowed into me.

author: Ben Nicholson
title: The Irish and British, they love satire, it's a large part of the culture.

author: Bradley Chicho
title: The joys of friendship inert the heart and fizzy home bouncing jubilantly with laughter-buttered love.

author: Billy Campbell
title: The kind of people that love 'The Rocketeer' are the kind of people that love good storytelling and innocence and a better world, so to speak, so they're almost always nice people to bump into.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: The kindness and affection from the public have carried me through some of the most difficult periods, and always your love and affection have eased the journey.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: The little trouble in the world that is not due to love is due to friendship.

author: William Wordsworth
title: The little unremembered acts of kindness and love are the best parts of a person's life.

author: Ouida
title: The longest absence is less perilous to love than the terrible trials of incessant proximity.

author: Alan Cohen
title: The love affair you seek is with yourself.

author: Vladimir Mayakovsky
title: The love boat has crashed against the everyday.

author: M. Russell Ballard
title: The love for work needs to be re-enthroned in our lives. Every family should have a plan for work that touches the life of each family member so that this eternal principle will be ingrained in their lives.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: The love of beauty in its multiple forms is the noblest gift of the human cerebrum.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The love of economy is the root of all virtue.

author: William Hazlitt
title: The love of fame is almost another name for the love of excellence; or it is the ambition to attain the highest excellence, sanctioned by the highest authority, that of time.

author: Tacitus
title: The love of fame is the last weakness which even the wise resign.

author: Ovid
title: The love of glory gives an immense stimulus.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title:
The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,,
And all the sweet serenity of books.

author: William Hazlitt
title: The love of liberty is the love of others; the love of power is the love of ourselves. We cannot force love.

author: Juvenal
title: The love of money grows as the money itself grows.

author: John Henry Newman
title: The love of Our private friends is the only preparatory exercise for the love of all men.

author: Susan Sontag
title: The love of the famous, like all strong passions, is quite abstract. Its intensity can be measured mathematically, and it is independent of persons.

author: Marquis de Custine
title: The love of their country is with them only a mode of flattering its master; as soon as they think that master can no longer hear, they speak of everything with a frankness which is the more startling because those who listen to it become responsible.

author: Robertson Davies
title: The love of truth lies at the root of much humor.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: The love that lasts longest is the love that is never returned.,

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The love we give away is the only love we keep.

author: Will Durant
title: The love we have in our youth is superficial compared to the love that an old man has for his old wife.,

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: The machine has had a pernicious effect upon virtue, pity, and love, and young men used to machines which induce inertia, and fear, are near impotent.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: The magic of first love is our ignorance that it can ever end.

author: George Orwell
title: The main motive for 'nonattachment' is a desire to escape from the pain of living, and above all from love, which, sexual or non-sexual, is hard work.

author: Bill Cunningham
title: The main thing I love about street photography is that you find the answers you don't see at the fashion shows. You find information for readers so they can visualize themselves.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The man who does not work for the love of work but only for money is not likely to make money nor find much fun in life.

author: Theodor Reik
title: The man who has never made a fool of himself in love will never be wise in love.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The mintage of wisdom is to know that rest is rust, and that real life is love, laughter, and work.

author: Byron Katie
title: The miracle of love comes to us in the presence of the uninterpreted moment.

author: Bell Hooks
title: The moment we choose to love we begin to move against domination, against oppression. The moment we choose to love we begin to move towards freedom, to act in ways that liberate ourselves and others.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
title: The moment you have in your heart this extraordinary thing called love and feel the depth, the delight, the ecstasy of it, you will discover that for you the world is transform.

author: Jane Austen
title: The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic that to love others.

author: Doug Horton
title: The more we are filled with thoughts of lust the less we find true romantic love.

author: Vladimir Nabokov
title: The more you love a memory, the stronger and stranger it is.

author: Jerry Gillies
title: The more you love what you are doing, the more successful it will be for you.

author: Ben Okri
title: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.

author: George Meredith
title: The most dire disaster in love is the death of imagination.

author: Theodore M. Hesburgh
title: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.

author: John Wooden
title: The most important thing in the world is family and love.,

author: Brandan Behan
title: The most important things to do in the world are to get something to eat, something to drink and somebody to love you.

author: Eldridge Cleaver
title: The most revolutionary statement in history is: love thine enemy.

author: Malcolm Muggeridge
title: The most terrible thing about materialism, even more terrible than its proneness to violence, is its boredom, from which sex, alcohol, drugs, all devices for putting out the accusing light of reason and suppressing the unrealizable aspirations of love, offer a prospect of deliverance.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The most valuable things in life are not measured in monetary terms. The really important things are not houses and lands, stocks and bonds, automobiles and real state, but friendships, trust, confidence, empathy, mercy, love and faith.

author: Adrienne Rich
title: The mother's battle for her child with sickness, with poverty, with war, with all the forces of exploitation and callousness that cheapen human life needs to become a common human battle, waged in love and in the passion for survival.

author: Erich Fromm
title: The mother-child relationship is paradoxical and, in a sense, tragic. It requires the most intense love on the mother's side, yet this very love must help the child grow away from the mother, and to become fully independent.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.

author: A.C. Van Cherub
title: The music may have stopped but my heart beats to another tune, this rhythm called love.

author: Matthew Arnold
title: The need of expansion is as genuine an instinct in man as the need in a plant for the light, or the need in man himself for going upright. The love of liberty is simply the instinct in man for expansion.

author: John Steinbeck
title: The new American finds his challenge and his love in the traffic-choked streets, skies nested in smog, choking with the acids of industry, the screech of rubber and houses leashed in against one another while the town lets wither a time and die.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: The noblest spirit is most strongly attracted by the love of glory.

author: Wilson Woodrow
title: The object of love is to serve, not to win.

author: Anais Nin
title: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.

author: Brenda Ueland
title: The only good teachers for you are those friends who love you, who think you are interesting, or very important, or wonderfully funny.

author: Philip Roth
title: The only obsession everyone wants: 'love.' People think that in falling in love they make themselves whole? The Platonic union of souls? I think otherwise. I think you're whole before you begin. And the love fractures you. You're whole, and then you're cracked open.

author: Napoleon
title: The only victory over love is flight.

author: Elie Wiesel
title: The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference.

author: Brian Hwang
title: The opposite of love is not hate, the opposite of love is ignorance.

author: William S. Burroughs
title: The people in power will not disappear voluntarily, giving flowers to the cops just isn't going to work. This thinking is fostered by the establishment; they like nothing better than love and nonviolence. The only way I like to see cops given flowers is in a flower pot from a high window.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The perfect love affair is one which is conducted entirely by post.

author: Ben Schwartz
title: The perfect thing for me is to be on something I love, where I'm doing it and have enough money not to be poor, and I'm allowed to go on vacation.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The person who does not work for the love of work but only for money is not likely to make money nor to find much fun in life.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: The planter, the farmer, the mechanic, and the laborer... form the great body of the people of the United States, they are the bone and sinew of the country men who love liberty and desire nothing but equal rights and equal laws.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The power of love, as the basis of a State, has never been tried.

author: Caity Lotz
title: The power of the human spirit inspires me. Movies, books, stories, people, anything that reminds us that we are more than just this physical body and our capacity for love and courage can bend reality.

author: Agnes de Mille
title: The practice mirror is to be used for the correction of faults, not for a love affair, and the figure you watch should not become your dearest friend.

author: Sir James Matthew Barrie
title: The praise that comes from love does not make us vain, but more humble.

author: Iris Murdoch

author: Germaine Greer
title: The principle of the brotherhood of man is narcissistic... for the grounds for that love have always been the assumption that we ought to realize that we are the same the whole world over.

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
title: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: The Prodigal Son at least walked home on his own feet. But who can duly adore that Love which will open the high gates to a prodigal who is brought in kicking, struggling, resentful, and darting his eyes in every direction for a chance of escape?

author: Billy Corgan
title: The Pumpkins love rock-and-roll, we absolutely love it, but we also think it's a flatulent, ego-serving kiddie playground. You can have your cake and eat it too.

author: John Ruskin
title: The purest and most thoughtful minds are those which love color the most.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The purity men love is like the mists which envelope the earth, and not like the azure ether beyond.

author: James Baldwin
title: The question of sexual dominance can exist only in the nightmare of that soul which has armed itself, totally, against the possibility of the changing motion of conquest and surrender, which is love.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The question of the next generation will not be one of how to liberate the masses, but rather, how to make them love their servitude.

author: Henry Miller
title: The real enemy can always be met and conquered, or won over. Real antagonism is based on love, a love which has not recognized itself.

author: Bill Medley

author: Elbert Hubbard
title:
The reason men oppose progress is not that they hate progress, but that they love inertia.,
,
,

author: Alfred de Musset
title: The return makes one love the farewell.

author: Richard M. DeVos
title: The riches of life, the love and joy and exhilaration of life can be found only with an upward look. This is an exciting world. It's cram-packed with opportunity. Great moments wait around every corner.

author: Lawrence Durrell
title: The richest love is that which submits to the arbitration of time.

author: Bertrand Russell

title: The sadness of the women's movement is that they don't allow the necessity of love. See, I don't personally trust any revolution where love is not allowed.

title: The same people who are murdered slowly in the mechanized slaughterhouses of work are also arguing, singing, drinking, dancing, making love, holding the streets, picking up weapons and inventing a new poetry.

author: George Meredith
title: The season of love is the carnival of egoism and it brings a touchstone to our natures.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The soul gives unity to what it looks at with love.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The spiritualization of sensuality is called love: it is a great triumph over Christianity.

author: Helen Hayes
title: The story of a love is not important - what is important is that one is capable of love. It is perhaps the only glimpse we are permitted of eternity.

author: Samuel M. Shoemaker

title: The thing I love most about acting is that your capacity evolves as you evolve as a human being.

title: The things that will destroy America are prosperity-at-any-price, peace-at-any-price, safety-first instead of duty-first, the love of soft living, and the get-rich-quick theory of life.

author: Buddha

title: The three grand essentials of happiness are: Something to do, someone to love, and something to hope for.

author: James Baldwin

title: The trouble with music appreciation in general is that people are taught to have too much respect for music; they should be taught to love it instead.

author: Helen Hayes

title: The two-martinis-for-lunch bunch would love for us to fight each other over the resources they have made scarce.

author: John Irving
title: The unspoken factor is love. The reason I can work so hard at my writing is that it's not work for me.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

author: Thomas Love Peacock
title: The waste of plenty is the resource of scarcity.

title: The way of peace is the way of love. Love is the greatest power on earth. It conquers all things.

author: Joe E. Lewis
title: The way taxes are, you might as well marry for love.

author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
title: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.,

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The way to love anything is to realize that it might be lost.

author: Allen Ginsberg
title: The weight of the world is love. Under the burden of solitude, under the burden of dissatisfaction.

author: Bill Hicks
title: The whole image is that eternal suffering awaits anyone who questions God's infinite love. That's the message we're brought up with, isn't it? Believe or die! Thank you, forgiving Lord, for all those options.

author: Candace Bushnell
title: The women I know who have children and have careers, they seem to be very happy. They love their children and they love their jobs. But happiness comes out of being willing to do your work in your twenties to find out who you are, what you love.

author: Alan Cohen
title: The word courage comes from the French word 'coeur', which means heart. True power proceeds not from force, but from love.

author: Robert Fulghum
title: The world does not need tourists who ride by in a bus clucking their tongues. The world as it is needs those who will love it enough to change it, with what they have, where they are.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The world is wonderful and beautiful and good beyond one's wildest imagination. Never, never, never could one conceive what love is, beforehand, never. Life can be great - quite god-like. It can be so. God be thanked I have proved it.

author: Ben Okri
title: The worst time was 1983. Love and life and everything went wrong. I reached absolute rock bottom. I saw the Minotaur at the bottom of the abyss. I learnt of the harshness of the world and its impartiality to human failure.

author: Carson McCullers
title: The writer by nature of his profession is a dreamer and a conscious dreamer. He must imagine, and imagination takes humility, love and great courage. How can you create a character without live and the struggle that goes with love?

author: André Malraux
title: Then I despair... I remember that all through history, the way of truth and love has always won. There have been murderers and tyrants, and for a time they can seem invincible. But in the end they always fall. Think of it always.

author: Billy Boyd
title: Then there are actors my age like Ethan Hawke, he's in 'Moby Dick,' I love his work. I've been lucky. Alfred Molina, he has real class.

author: Jane Austen
title: There are as many sorts of love, as there are moments in time.

author: Caity Lotz
title: There are different types of talents and intelligences, and traditional schools sometimes ignore the creative ones. It is important for us to give kids every platform for them to find what they are good at and what they love. The arts also provide a space for newfound creativity.

author: Victor Hugo
title: There are fathers who do not love their children, but there is no grandfather who does not adore his grandson.

title: There are many ways of breaking a heart. Stories were full of hearts broken by love, but what really broke a heart was taking away its dream - whatever that dream might be.

author: Ernest Hello
title: There are men who would quickly love each other if once they were speak to each other; for when they spoke they would discover that their souls had only separated by phantoms and delusions.

author: Frank Zappa
title: There are more love songs than anything else. If songs could make you do something we'd all love one another.

author: St. Francis de Sales
title: There are no galley-slaves in the royal vessel of divine love - every man works his oar voluntarily!

author: William Hazlitt
title: There are no rules for friendship. It must be left to itself. We cannot force it any more than love.,

author: Lawrence Durrell
title: There are only three things to be done with a woman. You can love her, suffer for her, or turn her into literature.

author: Emile Chartier
title: There are only two kinds of scholars; those who love ideas and those who hate them.

author: Boris Vian
title: There are only two things: love, all sorts of love, with pretty girls, and the music of New Orleans or Duke Ellington. Everything else ought to go, because everything else is ugly.

author: Brendan Dooling
title: There are so many quirky characters, it's easy to fall in love with any number of the characters on 'The Carrie Diaries'.

author: Bonnie McKee
title: There are some artists that don't like working with other females, which is fine. They have their own thing. I personally love being surrounded by other females.

author: Caitlin Fitzgerald
title: There are some jobs where you think, 'There's no way! This would be too, too good. The universe would love me too much were it to actually happen.'

author: Brandi Carlile
title: There are still civil rights issues. There are still people who can't be visited by their spouse in the hospital because they're gay. These are humanitarian issues. At the end of the day, all you want is for people to be happy in the pursuit of life, love and liberty.

author: Bjorn Ulvaeus
title: There are still many places I haven't seen that I'd like to travel to. I've never seen the Pyramids, and I'd love to explore the culture in North India. I think walking in the Andes would also be awesome.

author: Annie Leibovitz
title: There are still so many places on our planet that remain unexplored. I'd love to one day peel back the mystery and understand them.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: There are very few people who are not ashamed of having been in love when they no longer love each other.

author: Patrick Campbell
title: There can be a fundamental gulf of gracelessness in a human heart which neither our love nor our courage can bridge.

author: Martin Luther King
title: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.

author: Samuel P. Huntington
title: There can be no true friends without true enemies. Unless we hate what we are not, we cannot love what we are.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: There exists, between people in love, a kind of capital held by each. This is not just a stock of affects or pleasure, but also the possibility of playing double or quits with the share you hold in the other's heart.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: There is a courtesy of the heart; it is allied to love. From its springs the purest courtesy in the outward behavior.

author: Sophia Loren
title: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind, your talents, the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of the people you love. When you learn to tap into this source, you will truly have defeated age.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: There is a land of the living and a land of the dead and the bridge is love, the only survival, the only meaning.

author: Alfred Adler
title: There is a law that man should love his neighbor as himself. In a few hundred years it should be as natural to mankind as breathing or the upright gait; but if he does not learn it he must perish.

author: George Gordon
title: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes. By the deep sea, and music in its roars; I love not man the less, but nature more.

author: Washington Irving
title: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.

author: George Eliot
title: There is a sort of subjection which is the peculiar heritage of largeness and of love; and strength is often only another name for willing bondage to irremediable weakness.

author: Coco Chanel
title: There is a time for work and a time for love. That leaves no other time.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: There is a warning love sends and the cost of it is never written till long afterward.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: There is always some madness in love, but there is also always some reason in madness.

author: Mother Teresa
title: There is always the danger that we may just do the work for the sake of the work. This is where the respect and the love and the devotion come in -that we do it to God, to Christ, and that's why we try to do it as beautifully as possible.

author: Francoise D'Aubegne Maintenon
title: There is an important difference between love and friendship. While the former delights in extremes and opposites, the latter demands equality.

author: Mother Teresa
title: There is hunger for ordinary bread, and there is hunger for love, for kindness, for thoughtfulness; and this is the great poverty that makes people suffer so much.

author: Sir John Bowring
title: There is in every human heart Some not completely barren part, Where seeds of truth and love might grow, And flowers of generous virtue flow; To plant, to watch, to water there, This be our duty, be our care.

author: Jean Anouilh
title: There is love of course. And then there's life, its enemy.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: There is no disguise that can for long conceal love where it exists or simulate it where it does not.

author: La Rochefoucauld
title: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.

author: Lope de Vega
title: There is no greater glory than love, nor any great punishment than jealously.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: There is no lonelier man in death, except the suicide, than that man who has lived many years with a good wife and then outlived her. If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: There is no love without forgiveness, and there is no forgiveness without love.

author: Carlos Santana
title: There is no person that love cannot heal; there is no soul that love cannot save.

author: Corrie ten Boom
title: There is no pit so deep, that God's love is not deeper still.

author: Anna Sewell
title: There is no religion without love, and people may talk as much as they like about their religion, but if it does not teach them to be good and kind to man and beast, it is all a sham.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: There is no remedy for love than to love more.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
title: There is no true love save in suffering, and in this world we have to choose either love, which is suffering, or happiness. Man is the more man - that is, the more divine - the greater his capacity for suffering, or rather, for anguish.

author: Barbara Howar
title: There is nothing better for the spirit or the body than a love affair. It elevates the thoughts and flattens the stomachs.

author: Barbra Streisand
title: There is nothing more important in life than love.

author: James Boswell
title: There is nothing worth the wear of winning, but laughter and the love of friends.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: There is nothing wrong with America that faith, love of freedom, intelligence, and energy of her citizens cannot cure.

author: George Sand
title: There is only one happiness in life - to love and to be loved.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: There is only one kind of love, but there are a thousand imitations.

author: Helen Hayes
title: There is only one terminal dignity - love.

author: Henry van Dyke
title: There is only one way to get ready for immortality, and that is to love this life and live it as bravely and faithfully and cheerfully as we can.

author: Jane Austen
title: There is safety in reserve, but no attraction. One cannot love a reserved person.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: There is something in the unselfish and self-sacrificing love of a brute, which goes directly to the heart of him who has had frequent occasion to test the paltry friendship and gossamer fidelity of mere Man.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: There isn't any formula or method. You learn to love by loving - by paying attention and doing what one thereby discovers has to be done.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: There may come a day Which crowns Desire with gift, and Art with truth, And Love with bliss, and Life with wiser youth!

author: Joseph Rudyard Kipling
title: There rise her timeless capitals of empires daily born, whose plinths are laid at midnight and whose streets are packed at morn; and here come tired youths and maids that feign to love or sin in tones like rusty razor blades to tunes like smitten tin.

author: Lydia Davis
title: There seemed to be three choices: to give up trying to love anyone, to stop being selfish, or to learn to love a person while continuing to be selfish.

author: Brody Jenner
title: There will be a time very shortly that I just might not be in front of the camera at all, and I might just be behind the scenes. I love doing television, though. I don't necessarily love being in front of the camera.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: There will still be things that machines cannot do. They will not produce great art or great literature or great philosophy; they will not be able to discover the secret springs of happiness in the human heart; they will know nothing of love and friendship.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: There's a certain part of the contented majority who love anybody who is worth a billion dollars.

author: Barbara Kruger
title: There's a moment of recognition. It's that white-light kind of stuff that just "works." I love that. And you know it when it happens, whether it's a movie, music, a building, a book.

author: Cassandra Clare
title: There's a stigma that guys hate romance and hate love, but that's not true. Look at 'Iron Man.' There's a whole through-line plot about his relationship with Pepper, and everybody loves it.

author: Bradley Cooper
title: There's got to be something you want to tell and that's the engine which spurs all of the work you have to do in order to create the story, but you have to love some sort of nugget of what you're telling to be a filmmaker.

author: Arianna Huffington
title: There's no love more intense than the love we have for our kids - and where there is intense love, there is also intense fear lurking beneath the surface.

author: Wayne Dyer
title: There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen.

author: Barry Cornwall
title: There's not a wind but whispers of thy name; And not a flow'r that grows beneath the moon, But in its hues and fragrance tells a tale Of thee, my love.

author: Brantley Gilbert
title: There's nothing like having somebody that loves every single bit of you, and that you love the same way, to actually, really share it with.

author: Bill Skarsgard
title: There's something I love about how stark the contrast is between January and June in Sweden.

author: Bill Medley
title: There's this Bruno Mars guy. I met him in Hawaii when was doing Elvis imitations at the age of about five or six years old. There's a lot of old school in him. He's got a depth that I just love.

author: Boy George
title: There's this illusion that homosexuals have sex and heterosexuals fall in love. That's completely untrue. Everybody wants to be loved.

author: Derek Jarman
title: These names: gay, queer, homosexual are limiting. I would love to finish with them. We're going to have to decide which terms to use and where we use them. For me to use the word ''queer'' is a liberation; it was a word that frightened me, but no longer.

author: Benjamin Britten
title: These two are not two Love has made them one Amo Ergo Sum! And by its mystery Each is no less but more.

author: John Ruskin
title: They are the weakest-minded and the hardest-hearted men that most love change.

author: William Shakespeare
title: They do not love that do not show their love. The course of true love never did run smooth. Love is a familiar. Love is a devil. There is no evil angel but Love.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: They don't ask much of you. They only want you to hate the things you love and to love the things you despise.

author: Bil Keane
title: They invented hugs to let people know you love them without saying anything.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: They sang of love and not of fame; Forgot was Britain's glory; Each heart recalled a different name, But all sang Annie Laurie.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: They sang of love, and not of fame; , Forgot was Britain's glory; , Each heart recalled a different name, , But all sang Annie Lawrie.

author: Allan K. Chalmers
title: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world. Someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.

author: Adam Garcia
title: They spend an awful lot of money on I-don't-know-what in Hollywood movies; I certainly didn't get any of it. But they sure do love spending money.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: They would need to be already wise, in order to love wisdom.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: They would say, he answered, that you do not fail in obedience through lack of love, but have lost love because you never attempted obedience.

author: Jean Anouilh
title: Things are beautiful if you love them.

author: Abbott Eliot Kittredge
title: This bread and wine are the simple but eloquent monument to the infinite love of the Son of God, around which we gather with tender, tearful gratitude, because He loved us'so, and because we know that our garlands of affection and consecration are pleasing to Him.

author: Rita Mae Brown
title: This is a celebration of individual freedom, not of homosexuality. No government has the right to tell its citizens when or whom to love. The only queer people are those who don't love anybody.

author: Bert McCracken
title: This is a song about the reason we all came down here today, and that's because we (expletive) love music. This is a crowd-surfing song.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: This is one of the miracles of love: It gives a power of seeing through its own enchantments and yet not being disenchanted.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love; the more they give, the more they possess.

author: William Shakespeare
title: This is the monstrosity in love, lady, that the will is infinite and the execution confined; that the desire is boundless, and the act a slave to limit.

author: Bill Bailey
title: This is the news theme, but it sounds like pure Hollywood entertainment. It sounds like E.T. on a horse being chased by Darth Vader, which is something I'd love to see.

author: Peace Pilgrim
title: This is the way of peace: Overcome evil with good, falsehood with truth, and hatred with love.

author: Rebecca West
title: This is the worst of life, that love does not give us common sense but a sure way of losing it.

author: Lorrie Moore
title: This is what happened in love. One of you cried a lot and then both of you grew sarcastic.

author: Ezra Taft Benson
title: This latter day work is spiritual. It takes spirituality to comprehend it, to love it, to discern it. Therefore, seek the spirit in all you do. Keep it with you continually. That is our challenge.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: This love is silent.,

author: Earl Wilson
title: This would be a much better world if more married couples were as deeply in love as they are in debt.

author: Bernard Malamud
title: Thoreau gave an otherwise hidden passion and drew from woods and water the love affair with earth and sky he'd recorded in his journals.

author: John Milton
title: Those graceful acts, those thousand decencies, that daily flow from all her words and actions, mixed with love and sweet compliance, which declare unfeigned union of mind, or in us both one soul.

author: Johann Gottfried Von Herder
title: Those that embrace the entire universe with love, for the most part love nothing, but their narrow selves.

author: William Butler Yeats
title:
Those that I fight I do not hate, those that I guard I do not love.,
,

author: William B. Yeats
title: Those that I fight I do not hate, those that I guard I do not love.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Those thinkers who cannot believe in any gods often assert that the love of humanity would be in itself sufficient for them; and so, perhaps, it would, if they had it.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Those who are faithful know only the trivial side of love: it is the faithless who know love's tragedies.

author: Robert Runcie
title: Those who dare to interpret God's will must never claim Him as an asset for one nation or group rather than another. War springs from the love and loyalty which should be offered to God being applied to some God substitute, one of the most dangerous being nationalism.

author: A. Trollope
title: Those who have courage to love should have courage to suffer.

author: Plato
title: Those who intend on becoming great should love neither themselves or their own things, but only what is just, whether it happens to be done by themselves or others.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: Those who know the truth are not equal to those who love it Confucius All truth is safe and nothing else is safe, but he who keeps back truth, or withholds it from men, from motives of expediency, is either a coward or a criminal.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Those who love deeply never grow old; they may die of old age, but they die young.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Those who love not their fellowbeings live unfruitful lives, and prepare for their old age a miserable grave.

author: St. Francis de Sales
title: Those who love to be feared fear to be loved, and they themselves are more afraid than anyone, for whereas other men fear only them, they fear everyone.

author: Edwin Way Teale
title: Those who wish to pet and baby wild animals, ''love'' them. But those who respect their natures and wish to let them live normal lives, love them more.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Those whom the gods love grow young.

author: Seneca
title: Those whom true love has held, it will go on holding.

author: Queen Elizabeth I
title: Though God hath raised me high, yet this I count the glory of my crown: that I have reigned with your loves. And though you have had, and may have, many mightier and wiser princes sitting in this seat; yet you never had, nor shall have any that will love you better.

author: Lord George Byron
title:
Though I love my country, I do not love my countrymen.,
,
,
,

author: Dylan Thomas
title: Though lovers be lost love shall not; And death shall have no dominion.

author: George Washington Burnap
title: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, someone to love, and something to hope for.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Three passions simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life; the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.

author: Abbott Eliot Kittredge
title: Throw away the Old Testament! What part of it will you throw away? That which I do not understand? Take down then yonder blood-stained cross; for there is a love there which passeth knowledge, and a Divine hatred of sin which shook the solid earth.

author: Henry van Dyke
title: Time is Too slow for those who wait, Too swift for those who fear, Too long for those who grieve, Too short for those who rejoice. But for those who love, time is not.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: Time makes friendship stronger, but love weaker

author: Bruce Lee
title: Time means a lot to me because, you see, i, too, am also a learner and am often lost in the joy of forever developing and simplifying. If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Tis much to gain universal admiration; more, universal love.

author: Albert Camus
title: To abandon oneself to principles is really to die - and to die for an impossible love which is the contrary of love.

author: George Orwell
title: To an ordinary human being, love means nothing if it does not mean loving some people more than others.

author: Denis Diderot
title: To attempt the destruction of our passions is the height of folly. What a noble aim is that of the zealot who tortures himself like a madman in order to desire nothing, love nothing, feel nothing, and who, if he succeeded, would end up a complete monster!

author: Alex Grey
title: To bare our souls is all we ask, to give all we have to life and the beings surrounding us. Here the nature spirits are intense and we appreciate them, make offerings to them - these nature spirits who call us here - sealing our fate with each other, celebrating our love.

author: Francesco Petrarca
title: To be able to say how much love, is love but little.

author: Helen Rowland
title: To be happy with a man you must understand him a lot and love him a little. To be happy with a woman you must love her a lot and not try to understand her at all.

author: Bill Engvall
title: To be honest with you, I still eat whatever I want. It's all about portion control. I still love pizza, but instead of eating half, I eat a slice.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: To be in love is merely to be in a perpetual state of anesthesia.

author: George Santayana
title: To be interested in the changing seasons is, in this middling zone, a happier state of mind than to be hopelessly in love with spring.

author: William Shakespeare
title: To be wise and love exceeds man's might.

author: Sir Richard Steele
title: To behold her is an immediate check to loose behavior; to love her is a liberal education.

author: William Shakespeare
title: To business that we love, we rise betime and go to't with delight.

author: Mark Van Doren
title: To fail to love is not to exist at all.

author: Anna Louise Strong
title: To fall in love is easy, even to remain in it is not difficult; our human loneliness is cause enough. But it is a hard quest worth making to find a comrade through whose steady presence one becomes steadily the person one desires to be.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.

author: Bette Davis
title: To fulfill a dream, to be allowed to sweat over lonely labor, to be given the chance to create, is the meat and potatoes of life. The money is the gravy. As everyone else, I love to dunk my crust in it. But alone, it is not a diet designed to keep body and soul together.

author: Joan Didion
title: To have that sense of one's intrinsic worth which constitutes self-respect is potentially to have everything: the ability to discriminate, to love and to remain indifferent. To lack it is to be locked within oneself, paradoxically incapable of either love or indifference.

author: Ogden Nash
title: To keep your marriage brimming, with love in the wedding cup, whenever you're wrong, admit it; whenever you're right, shut up.

author: Confucius
title: To love a thing means wanting it to live.

author: Henry Drummond
title: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.

author: Jean Rostand
title: To love an idea is to love it a little more than one should.

author: Sydney Smith
title: To love and be loved is the great happiness of existence.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: To love another another human in all of her splendor and imperfect perfection , it is a magnificent task...tremendous and foolish and human.

author: Victor Hugo
title: To love another person is to see the face of God. [Les Miserables]

author: Alphonse de Lamartine
title: To love for the sake of being loved is human, but to love for the sake of loving is angelic.

author: Gottfried Wilhelm Von Leibniz
title: To love is to place our happiness in the happiness of another.

author: Karen Sunde
title: To love is to receive a glimpse of heaven.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.

author: Marguerite Duras
title: To love one child and to love all children, whether living or dead - somewhere these two loves come together. To love a no-good but humble punk and to love an honest man who believes himself to be an honest man - somewhere these, too, come together.

author: Thomas Traherne
title: To love one person with a private love is poor and miserable: to love all is glorious.

author: Madame Neckar
title: To love one that is great, is almost to be great one's self.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: To love oneself is the beginning of a life long romance.

author: John Locke
title: To love our neighbor as ourselves is such a truth for regulating human society, that by that alone one might determine all the cases in social morality.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: To love someone deeply gives you strength. Being loved by someone deeply gives you courage.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: To love someone is to isolate him from the world, wipe out every trace of him, dispossess him of his shadow, drag him into a murderous future. It is to circle around the other like a dead star and absorb him into a black light.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
title: To love with the spirit is to pity, and he who pities most loves most.

author: Rita Mae Brown
title: To love without role, without power plays, is revolution.

author: Baroness Orczy
title: To love, for us men, is to clasp one woman with our arms, feeling that she lives and breathes just as we do, suffers as we do, thinks with us, loves with us, and, above all, sins with us.

author: Edmund Burke
title: To make us love our country, our country ought to be lovely.

author: Bill Sienkiewicz
title: To me, that's one of the things that I love about doing this stuff. One day I can work on this piece in watercolor, and then work on something else on the computer, or work on something else that's a completely different approach.

author: John Selden
title: To preach long, loud, and Damnation, is the way to be cried up. We love a man that damns us, and we run after him again to save us.

author: Boufflers
title: To reason about love is to lose reason.

author: Karl von Bonstetten
title: To resist the frigidity of old age one must combine the body, the mind and the heart - and to keep them in parallel vigor one must exercise, study and love.

author: Ayn Rand
title: To say "I love you" one must first be able to say the "I.".

author: William Shakespeare
title: To say the truth, reason and love keep little company together now-a-days.

author: Edmund Burke
title: To tax and to please, no more than to love and to be wise, is not given to men.

author: Roland Barthes
title: To try to write love is to confront the muck of language: that region of hysteria where language is both too much and too little, excessive and impoverished.

author: John Ruskin
title: To watch the corn grow, or the blossoms set; to draw hard breath over the plough or spade; to read, to think, to love, to pray, are the things that make men happy.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: To write a good love letter, you ought to begin without knowing what you mean to say, and to finish without knowing what you have written.

author: Edmond and Jules de Goncourt
title: Today I begin to understand what love must be, if it exists. When we are parted, we each feel the lack of the other half of ourselves. We are incomplete like a book in two volumes of which the first has been lost. That is what I imagine love to be: incompleteness in absence.

author: Bruno Mars
title: Today, I'd like to talk to Bob Marley. I'd just like to ask him what was his method. Bob is one of the greatest songwriters ever. I don't know if people understand how powerful his songs are and the simplicity and genius behind them, from 'Redemption Song' to 'Is This Love?' and 'I Shot the Sheriff.'

author: Hannah Tom
title: Tolerance and celebration of individual differences is the fire that fuels lasting love.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: Tolerance is a very dull virtue. It is boring. Unlike love, it has always had a bad press. It is negative. It merely means putting up with people, being able to stand things.

author: Bridget Moynahan
title: Tom Selleck brings in the babes of all ages, I have to tell you. You can be 60, 80, or 16 and still love that man.

author: Carole King
title: Tonight You're mine completely, , You give your love so sweetly , Tonight the light of love is in your eyes, , But will you love me tomorrow?

author: Bianca Kajlich
title: Too many people get married and lose themselves. You have to fiercely hold on to who you are, and you need to celebrate that in the other person because that's what made you fall in love in the first place.

author: Lisa St. Aubin de Teran
title: Travelling is like flirting with life. It's like saying, ''I would stay and love you, but I have to go; this is my station.''

author: Og Mandino
title: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your good health has vanished.

author: Dinah Shore
title: Trouble is a part of your life, and if you don't share it, you don't give the person that loves you enough chance to love you enough.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: True humor springs not more from the head than from the heart. It is not contempt; its essence is love. It issues not in laughter, but in still smiles, which lie far deeper.

author: Erich Segal
title: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.

author: St. Theresa of Lisieux
title: True love grows by sacrifice and the more thoroughly the soul rejects natural satisfaction the stronger and more detached its tenderness becomes.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: True love is like ghosts, which everybody talks about and few have seen.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: True love is the parent of humility.

author: Stendhal
title: True love makes the thought of death frequent, easy, without terrors; it merely becomes the standard of comparison, the price one would pay for many things.

author: Richard Bach
title: True love stories never have endings.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: True politeness is perfect ease and freedom. It simply consists in treating others just as you love to be treated yourself.

author: Stephen King
title: True sorrow is as rare as true love.

author: Barbara Smith
title: Trust is to human relationships what faith is to gospel living. It is the beginning place, the foundation upon which more can be built. Where trust is, love can flourish.

author: Doris Lessing
title: Trust no friend without faults, and love a woman, but no angel.

author: A. N. Wilson
title: Truth comes to us mediated by human love.

author: Buckminster Fuller
title: Truth is cosmically total: synergetic. Verities are generalized principles stated in semimetaphorical terms. Verities are differentiable. But love is omniembracing, omnicoherent, and omni-inclusive, with no exceptions. Love, like synergetics, is nondifferentiable, i.e., is integral.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.

author: Sri Anandamayi Ma
title: Try to treat with equal love all the people with whom you have relations. Thus the abyss between 'myself' and 'yourself' will be filled in, which is the goal of all religious worship.

author: Ramsay Clark
title: Turbulence is life force. It is opportunity. Let's love turbulence and use it for change.

author: Emily Carr
title: Twenty can't be expected to tolerate sixty in all things, and sixty gets bored stiff with twenty's eternal love affairs.

author: David Mitchell
title: Two people who are a little bit deluded in each other's favour. That's what love is, isn't it?

author: Margaret Fuller
title: Two persons love in one another the future good which they aid one another to unfold.

author: Brooke Elliott
title: Ty Burrell could be one of the funniest people on the planet. I'd love to meet him.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Under the summer roses , When the flagrant crimson , Lurks in the dusk , Of the wild red leaves, , Love, with little hands, , Comes and touches you , With a thousand memories, , And asks you , Beautiful, unanswerable questions.

author: Richard Whately
title: Unless people can be kept in the dark, it is best for those who love the truth to give them the full light.

author: Harper Lee
title: Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing.

author: Anita Diament
title: Until very recently men and women inhabited very separate spheres. There was always interconnection, passion, love. But men and women didn't hang out at the end of the day and chat about what their day was like at the office.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Voters like to fall in love with presidential candidates, at least a little bit.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: War is like love, it always finds a way.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: War is like love; it always finds a way.

author: U. Thant
title: Wars begin in the minds of men, and in those minds, love and compassion would have built the defenses of peace.

author: Bjornstjerne Bjornson
title: Watch over your child, as it struggles for breath on the outermost verge of life, or see your wife follow the child to that outermost verge, beside herself for anxiety and sleeplessness, - then love will teach you that life comes first.

author: Bette Davis
title: Wave after wave of love flooded the stage and washed over me, the beginning of the one great durable romance of my life.

author: Aldo Leopold
title: We abuse land because we regard it as a commodity belonging to us. When we see land as a community to which we belong, we may begin to use it with love and respect.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: We all go about longing for love: it is the first need of our natures, the loudest cry of our hearts.

author: Samuel Butler
title: We all like to forgive, and love best not those who offend us least, nor who have done most for us, but those who make it most easy for us to forgive them.

author: Albert Camus
title: We always deceive ourselves twice about the people we love - first to their advantage, then to their disadvantage.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We always love those who admire us; we do not always love those whom we admire.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: We are all born for love. It is the principle of existence, and its only end.

author: Jane Austen
title: We are all fools in love.

author: William Penn
title: We are apt to love praise, but not deserve it. But if we would deserve it, we must love virtue more than that.

author: Angelina Grimké
title: We are commanded to love God with all our minds, as well as with all our hearts, and we commit a great sin if we forbid or prevent that cultivation of the mind in others which would enable them to perform this duty.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We are nearer loving those who hate us than those who love us more than we wish.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love, never so forlornly unhappy as when we have lost our love object or its love.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.

author: Alexander Smith
title: We bury love; Forgetfulness grows over it like grass: That is a thing to weep for, not the dead.

author: Milan Kundera
title: We can never establish with certainty what part of our relations with others is the result of our emotions - love, antipathy, charity, or malice - and what part is predetermined by the constant power play among individuals.

author: Mother Teresa
title: We can not do great things. We can only do little things with great love.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: We can only love what we know, and we can never know completely what we do not love. Love is a mode of knowledge.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: We can recognize the dawn and the decline of love by the uneasiness we feel when alone together.

author: Anna Brownell Jameson
title: We can sometimes love what we do not understand, but it is impossible completely to understand what we do not love.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: We can't command our love, but we can our actions.

author: Martin Buber
title: We cannot avoid using power, cannot escape the compulsion to afflict the world, so let us, cautious in diction and mighty in contradiction, love powerfully.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: We cannot fashion our children after our desires, we must have them and love them as God has given them to us.

author: Agnes Repplier
title: We cannot really love anybody with whom we never laugh.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: We cheerfully assume that in some mystic way love conquers all, that good outweighs evil in the just balances of the universe and at the 11th hour something gloriously triumphant will prevent the worst before it happens.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: We conceal it from ourselves in vain - we must always love something. In those matters seemingly removed from love, the feeling is secretly to be found, and man cannot possibly live for a moment without it.

author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
title: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.

author: Jacques Maritain
title: We don't love qualities, we love persons; sometimes by reason of their defects as well as of their qualities.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: We find it hard to apply the knowledge of ourselves to our judgment of others. The fact that we are never of one kind, that we never love without reservations and never hate with all our being cannot prevent us from seeing others as wholly black or white.

author: Bernard of Clairvaux
title: We find rest in those we love, and we provide a resting place for those who love us.

author: Billy Graham
title: We have an idea that we Americans are God's chosen people, that God loves us more than any other people, and that we are God's blessed. I tell you that God doesn't love us any more than He does the Russians.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: We have dreamt of every woman there is, and dreamt too of the miracle that would bring us the pleasure of being a woman, for women have all the qualities - courage, passion, the capacity to love, cunning - whereas all our imagination can do is naively pile up the illusion of courage.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: We have just enough religion to make us hate, but not enough to make us love one another.

author: Swami Ramdas
title: We have to take the whole universe as the expression of the one Self. Then only our love flows to all beings and creatures in the world equally.

author: John Irving
title: We invent what we love and what we fear.

author: Jean Paul
title: We learn our virtues from our friends who love us; our faults from the enemy who hates us. We cannot easily discover our real character from a friend. He is a mirror, on which the warmth of our breath impedes the clearness of the reflection.

author: William E. Gladstone
title: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of Peace.

author: William Gladstone
title: We look forward to the time when the power to love of will replace the love of power. Then will our world know the blessings of peace.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: We love a tale of heroes and villains and conflicts requiring a neat resolution.

author: Nikki Giovanni
title: We love because it's the only true adventure.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: We love but once, for once only are we perfectly equipped for loving.

author: Avi Arad
title: We love Cyclops and as you know, we love James. It's a great team and we'll continue the team, obviously.

author: Irving Layton
title: We love in another's soul whatever of ourselves we can deposit in it; the greater the deposit, the greater the love.

author: Richard Henry Stoddard
title: We love in others what we lack in ourselves, and would be everything, but what we are.

author: George Farquhar
title: We love the precepts for the teacher's sake.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We love those who admire us, but not those whom we admire.

author: Samuel Johnson

author: Samuel Johnson
title: We love to overlook the boundaries which we do not wish to pass.

author: Bernard Meltzer
title: We may give without loving, but we cannot love without giving

author: Al Stewart
title: We measure our days out in steps of uncertainty not turning to see how far we've come. And peer down the highway from here to eternity and reach out for love on the run.

author: W. H. Auden
title: We must love one another or die.

author: Malcolm X
title: We need more light about each other. Light creates understanding, understanding creates love, love creates patience, and patience creates unity.

author: Anne Rice
title: We need to stop fighting Christian against Christian. I have no time for anything but trying to love other people. That is a full-time job.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: We never know the love of the parent till we become parents ourselves.

author: Thomas Szasz
title: We often speak of love when we really should be speaking of the drive to dominate or to master, so as to confirm ourselves as active agents, in control of our own destinies and worthy of respect from others.

author: André Maurois
title: We owe to the Middle Ages the two worst inventions of humanity - gunpowder and romantic love.

author: André Maurois
title: We owe to the Middle Ages the two worst inventions of humanity - gunpowder and romantic love.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We pardon to the extent that we love.

author: Bruce Barton
title: We pay just as dearly for our triumphs as we do for our defeats. Go ahead and fail. But fail with wit, fail with grace, fail with style. A mediocre failure is as insufferable as a mediocre success. Embrace failure! Seek it out. Learn to love it. That may be the only way any of us will ever be free. Tom Robbins Before you give up hope, turn back and read the attacks that were made on Lincoln.

author: La Bruyere
title: We perceive when love begins and when it declines by our embarrassment when alone together.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
title: We really have to understand the person we want to love. If our love is only a will to possess, it is not love. If we only think of ourselves, if we know only our own needs and ignore the needs of the other person, we cannot love.

author: Alfred de Vigny
title: We shall find in our troubled hearts, where discord reigns, two needs which seem at variance, but which merge, as I think, in a common source - the love of the true, and the love of the fabulous.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: We shouldn't teach great books; we should teach a love of reading.

author: Mohsin Hamid
title: We think of the romance novel as a lesser form of literature, but I don't think that's true. Love is a very important aspect of human life and worth exploring.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: We travel together, passengers on a little spaceship, dependent on it's vulnerable reserves of air and soil, all committed, for our safety, to it's security and peace. Preserved from annihilation only by the care, the work and the love we give our fragile craft.

author: Brigham Young
title: We want men to rule the nation who care more for and love better the nation's welfare than gold and silver, fame or popularity.

author: Betty Williams
title: We want to live, love and build a just and peaceful society. We dedicate ourselves to working with our neighbors day in and day out to create this peaceful society.

author: Cecil Day Lewis
title: We'd like to fight but we fear defeat, we'd like to work but we're feeling too weak, we'd like to be sick but we'd get the sack, we'd like to behave, we'd like to believe, we'd like to love, but we've lost the knack.

author: Alanis Morissette
title: We'll love you just the way you are if you're perfect.

author: Orson Welles
title:
We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.,
,

author: Barbara Mandrell
title: We're only here to love God and each other. I'm not saying I've never gotten angry at anyone. I do. But you've got to forgive and move on.

author: Audre Lorde
title: We're supposed to see "universal" love as heterosexual. What I insist upon in my work is that there is no such thing as universal love in literature.

author: John Lennon
title: We've got this gift of love, but love is like a precious plant. You can't just accept it and leave it in the cupboard or just think it's going to get on by itself. You've got to keep watering it. You've got to really look after it and nurture it.

author: Candace Bushnell

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Well let there be sunlight, let there be rain , Let the brokenhearted love again , Sherry, we can run with our arms open before the tide.

author: Benjamin Bratt
title: Well, for me, the real excitement of doing physical things in films, whether you're talking about a fight scene or a stunt sequence or even a love scene, for that matter, is by necessity it has to be choreographed very much like a dance. That being said, you have to rehearse it over and over again and find a mathematical precision.

author: Billy Ray Cyrus
title: Well, I've never left my faith - but have I made a lot of mistakes? But was I fortunate that I was brought up in that Pentecostal church, where I heard about God's love and God's forgiveness.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Well, if you, my love, must think that-a-way, , I'm sure your mind is roamin'. , I'm sure your heart is not with me, , But with the country to where you're goin'.

title: Well, love is insanity. The ancient Greeks knew that. It is the taking over of a rational and lucid mind by delusion and self-destruction. You lose yourself, you have no power over yourself, you can't even think straight.

author: Bobby Farrelly
title: Well, there are conjoined twins in real life and we can tell a story about them so long as they're not the brunt of the jokes. In this, they're the heroes of this story; we love these guys.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: What a fuss people make about fidelity! Why, even in love it is purely a question for physiology. It has nothing to do with our own will. Young men want to be faithful, and are not; old men want to be faithless, and cannot: that is all one can say.

title: What a man calls his ''conscience'' is merely the mental action that follows a sentimental reaction after too much wine or love.

author: Meister Eckhart
title: What a man takes in by contemplation, that he pours out in love.

title: What do I have , to help me, without spell or prayer, , endure this hour, endless, heartless, anonymous, , the death of love?

title: What do I love about acting? I love traveling, meeting new people, exploring and just doing what I love.

author: Mark Twain
title: What do we call love, hate, charity, revenge,  humanity, forgiveness? Different results of the master impulse, the necessity of securing one's self-approval.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo

author: Igor Stravinsky
title: What force is more potent than love?

author: Charles Dickens
title: What greater gift than the love of a cat.

author: Anais Nin
title: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?

author: Barbara Mandrell
title: What I do miss that I don't get anymore? You're going to think I'm crazy, but you want the truth, so here it is. The lights! I miss the spotlights. I don't mean it figuratively. I mean it literally. I love the feeling of lights.

author: Annie Leibovitz
title: What I learned from Lennon was something that did stay with me my whole career, which is to be very straightforward. I actually love talking about taking pictures, and I think that helps everyone.

author: Carla Hall
title: What I love about 'The Chew' is that we have these celebrities come on, and you get to see them in a different light, cooking or enjoying food, when we usually don't see them in that setting. author: Arthur Schwartz
title: What I love about Brooklyn is there are more wonderful little joints than anywhere.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: What I needed most was to love and to be loved, eager to be caught. Happily I wrapped those painful bonds around me; and sure enough, I would be lashed with the red-hot pokers or jealousy, by suspicions and fear, by burst of anger and quarrels.

author: Doris Lessing
title: What is a hero without love for mankind.

author: Sinclair Lewis
title: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.

author: Marina Tsvetaeva
title: What is the main thing in love? to know and to hide. To know about the one you love and to hide that you love. At times the hiding (shame) overpowers the knowing (passion). The passion for the hidden - the passion for the revealed.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
title: What light is to the eyes - what air is to the lungs - what love is to the heart, liberty is to the soul of man.

author: Pearl Bailey
title: What the world really needs is more love and less paper work.

title: What then in love can woman do? If we grow fond they shun us. And when we fly them, they pursue: But leave us when they've won us.

title: What though youth gave love and roses, Age still leaves us friends and wine.,

title: What unites Oklahomans today is what has always united us: Our unshakable faith. Our love of family and compassion for others. The unlimited promise of a hopeful future.

title: What we women need to do, instead of worrying about what we don't have, is just love what we do have.

author: Doris Lessing
title: What's terrible is to pretend that the second-rate is first-rate, that you don't need love when you do or that you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.

author: James Joyce
title: Whatever else is unsure in this stinking dunghill of a world a mother's love is not.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Whatever is done for love always occurs beyond good and evil.

author: Maya Angelou
title:
Whatever you want to do, if you want to be great at it, you have to love it and be able to make sacrifices for it.,
,
,

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When a man has once loved a woman, he will do anything for her, except continue to love her.

author: Blaise Pascal

title: When a writer talks about his work, he's talking about a love affair.

author: Carl Jung
title: When animus and anima meet, the animus draws his sword of power and the anima ejects her poison of illusion and seduction. The outcome need not always be negative, since the two are equally likely to fall in love (a special instance of love at first sight).

title: When Christ says, ‘Forgive your enemies,’ it is not for the sake of the enemy, but for one’s own sake that he says so, and because love is more beautiful than hate.

author: Robert Bridges
title: When first we met we did not guess that Love would prove so hard a master.

title: When I think about atheist friends, including my father, they seem to me like people who have no ear for music, or who have never been in love.

author: Bob Harper
title: When I was first introduced to CrossFit, I found it to be the hardest workout that I'd ever done. It wiped the floor with me, and I fell in love with it immediately. author: Byron Howard
title: When I was up in Washington state, I always thought, 'I'm going to go to Los Angeles where films are made and stories are told, and they're going to love me and welcome me with open arms.' But, there was no welcoming committee.

author: John Ruskin
title:
When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.,
,

author: William Shakespeare
title: When love begins to sicken and decay it uses an enforced ceremony.

title: When men and women are able to respect and accept their differences then love has a chance to blossom.

title: When once estrangement has arisen between those who truly love each other, everything seems to widen the breach.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.

author: Zora Neale Hurston
title:
When one is too old for love, one finds great comfort in good dinners.,
,

author: Bernie Siegel
title: When one teenager dying of cystic fibrosis asked me, 'Why am I different?' I answered, 'Tony, because it makes you beautiful.' author: Brene Brown
title: When the people we love stop paying attention, trust begins to slip away and hurt starts seeping in.

title: When they attack you and you notice that you love them with all your heart, your Work is done.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: When they have really learned to love their neighbours as themselves, they will be allowed to love themselves as their neighbours.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: When we are in love we seem to ourselves quite different from what we were before.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: When we first fall in love, we feel that we know all there is to know about life, and perhaps we are right.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: When we really worship anything, we love not only its clearness but its obscurity. We exult in its very invisibility.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: When women love us, they forgive us everything, even our crimes; when they do not love us, they give us credit for nothing, not even out virtues.

author: Taylor Swift
title: When you are missing someone, time seems to move slower, and when I'm falling in love with someone, time seems to be moving faster.,

author: Brene Brown
title: When you get to a place where you understand that love and belonging, your worthiness, is a birthright and not something you have to earn, anything is possible.

title: When you lose your hair, it has an impact on confidence and your overall self-esteem whether it affects your career or your love life.

title: When you love fashion, there is no weekend. Everything just blends together.

title: When you love someone all your saved-up wishes start coming out.

title: When you protect yourself from pain, be sure you do not protect yourself from love.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When you really want love you will find it waiting for you.

title: When you're 50 you start thinking about things you haven't thought about before. I used to think getting old was about vanity - but actually it's about losing people you love. Getting wrinkles is trivial.

author: Britney Spears
title: When you're comfortable with someone you love, the silence is the best. And, that's how me and J. are. When we're in a room together, we don't have to say anything. It's for real.

author: Billy Porter
title: When you're doing what you love, it's not exhausting at all, actually. It's completely empowering and exhilarating.

author: Rose Tremain
title: When you've finished a piece of work you've had a kind of love affair with it.

title: Whenever I have free time, I love to just lay in my bed and watch YouTube videos, watch movies. Just basically do nothing.

title: Whenever I realize I'm being a goofball, I write it down. When I release the joke onstage, I love watching the effect it has on the audience. No one wants to see someone talk who takes themselves too seriously.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent. Conquer him with love.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Whenever you have truth it must be given with love, or the message and the messenger will be rejected.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Whenever you hear a man speak of his love for his country, it is a sign that he expects to be paid for it.

author: Christopher Marlowe

title: Where love and wisdom drink out of the same cup, in this everyday world, it is the exception.

author: Pierre de Beaumarchais

author: Willa Cather
title: Where there is great love there are always miracles.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Where there is love there is life.

author: Benjamin Franklin

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Where there is no extravagance there is no love, and where there is no love there is no understanding.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

author: George Eliot
title: Where women love each other, men learn to smother their mutual dislike.

author: R. D. Laing
title: Whether life is worth living depends on whether there is love in life.

author: Brit Morin
title: While it's true that women are the minority in most tech companies, I don't think that inhibits entry into the tech space.
