author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: While the womanly god demands our veneration, the godlike woman kindles our love; but while we allow ourselves to melt in the celestial loveliness, the celestial self-sufficiency holds us back in awe.

author: Bo Bennett
title: While we are focusing on fear, worry, or hate, it is not possible for us to be experiencing happiness, enthusiasm or love.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.

author: Billie Holiday
title: Who love my man, I'm a liar if I say I don't , But I'll quit my man, I'm a liar if I say I wont.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: Whoever loves above all the approach of love will never know the joy of attaining it.

author: Aristotle
title: Wicked men obey from fear; good men, from love.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: Wit is so shining a quality that everybody admires it; most people aim at it, all people fear it, and few love it unless in themselves. A man must have a good share of wit himself to endure a great share of it in another.

author: Britney Spears
title: With love, you should go ahead and take the risk of getting hurt because love is an amazing feeling.

author: Bria Skonberg
title: With my trumpet voice, I love gritty, plunger, growly sounds. But vocally, I love Anita O'Day - a raspier but definitely softer sound. Part of the fun has been finding vehicles or writing for both of those sounds.

author: William Blake
title: Without contraries is no progression. Attraction and repulsion, reason and energy, love and hate, are necessary to human existence.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.

author: Charles Edward Jerningham
title: Woman often feigns love; man, oftener, passion.

author: Bonnie Somerville
title: Women do love each other; this whole women-against-each other, 'Dynasty' thing... we're not all after each other.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Women have simple tastes. They get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Women love us for our defects. If we have enough of them, they will forgive us everything, even our gigantic intellects.

author: William Wycherley
title: Women of quality are so civil, you can hardly distinguish love from good breeding.

author: Andre Breton
title: Words make love with one another.

author: Theodor Reik
title: Work and love; these are the basics. Without them there is neurosis.

author: Kahlil Gibran

author: Socrates
title: Worthless people love only to eat and drink; people of worth eat and drink only to live.

author: George Eliot
title: Would not love see returning penitence afar off, and fall on its neck and kiss it?

author: Ann Patchett
title: Write because you love the art and the discipline, not because you're looking to sell something.

author: Beyonce Knowles
title: Y'all are so cute and y'all talk so proper over here. I love England.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: Years of love have been forgot, In the hatred of a minute.

author: Bill Cosby
title: Yes, having a child is surely the most beautifully irrational act that two people in love can commit.

author: Barbara Hershey
title: Yes, it was love at first sight. I feel that after all these years, I have finally found my soul mate.

author: Agnes Smedley
title: Yet it is awful to love a person who is a torture to you. And a fascinating person who loves you and won't hear of anything but your loving him and living right by his side through all eternity!.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Yet some can be patriotic who have no self-respect, and sacrifice the greater to the less. They love the soil which makes their graves, but have no sympathy with the spirit which may still animate their clay. Patriotism is a maggot in their heads.

author: Bob Saget
title: Yet there are some people - Steve Allen would dissect comedy forever; he's a really funny guy, but he would love talking about comedy. I'm doing it right now and you all seem bored.

author: Ben Zobrist
title: You are either good or you're not at whatever your job is. And it is more important that you understand the grace and love and peace you have in Christ, whether you are good or bad at whatever you are doing every day.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: You ask whether I have ever been in love: fool as I am, I am not such a fool as that. But if one is only to talk from first-hand experience, conversation would be a very poor business. But though I have no personal experience of the things they call love, I have what is better - the experience of Sappho, of Euripides, of Catallus, of Shakespeare, of Spenser, of Austen, of Bronte, of anyone else I have read.

author: Alan Cohen
title: You believe that a lover will bring you love, but it is your love that will bring you a lover.

author: A. Waugh
title: You can fall in love at first sight with a place as with a person.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.

author: Amy Carmichael
title: You can give without loving, but you cannot love without giving.

author: Anita Brookner
title: You can never betray the people who are dead, so you go on being a public Jew; the dead can't answer slurs, but I'm here. I would love to think that Jesus wants me for a sunbeam, but he doesn't.

author: Philip Roth
title: You can no more make someone tell the truth than you can force someone to love you.

author: Buddha
title: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection.

author: A. W. Tozer
title: You can see God from anywhere if your mind is set to love and obey Him.

author: H. Youngman
title: You can't buy love, but you can pay heavily for it.

author: Arthur Miller
title: You cannot catch a child's spirit by running after it; you must stand still and for love it will soon itself return.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: You cannot love a thing without wanting to fight for it.

author: Anais Nin
title: You cannot save people, you can only love them.

author: Annie Sullivan
title: You cannot touch love either; but you feel the sweetness that it pours into everything.

author: Lorrie Moore
title: You chose love like a belief, a faith, a place, a box for one's heart to knock against like a spook in the house.

author: Ben Zobrist
title: You don't get a chance to go to the playoffs and World Series very often, but to be able to experience it with the people you love most in the world is really fun.

author: Robert Frost
title: You don't have to deserve your mother's love. You have to deserve your father s. He's more particular. The father is always a Republican towards his son, and his mother's always a Democrat.

author: Calvin Klein
title: You don't only worry about the people who hate or resent you; in a way, you're more worried about the people who love you.

author: Bow Wow
title: You got to keep all your weaknesses away, and my weakness is women. I love women too much. Which has definitely road-blocked me. I just try my best to channel my energy to other things and remain focused while making my work as fun as everything else.

author: Lech Walesa
title: You have riches and freedom here but I feel no sense of faith or direction. You have so many computers, why don't you use them in the search for love?

author: Marguerite Duras
title: You have to be very fond of men. Very, very fond. You have to be very fond of them to love them. Otherwise they're simply unbearable.

author: Aaliyah
title: You have to love what you do to want to do it everyday.

author: Barbara Bush
title: You have to love your children unselfishly. That is hard. But it is the only way.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart.

author: Jonathan Carroll
title: You have to walk carefully in the beginning of love; the running across fields into your lover's arms can only come later when you're sure they won't laugh if you trip.

author: Byron Howard
title: You hope, when you're working on these things, that people love them whether it makes a lot of money or not.

author: Beatrice Wood
title: You know, God, the power that makes life, whatever it is, had just to make two things, masculine and feminine, for all this mischief. And made them so there is this entirely different point of view about love and sex.

author: Bret Easton Ellis
title: You learn to move on without the people you love.

author: St. Francis de Sales
title: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.

author: Meister Eckhart
title: You may call God love, you may call God goodness. But the best name for God is compassion.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: You may give them your love but not your thoughts. For they have their own thoughts. You may house their bodies but not their souls, for their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: You meet your soulmate, and you're like, 'Well, this is it. This is the feeling of falling in love, and it's the most intense it can ever be.' Then you have a child, and it's like - it's huge!

author: Ethel Barrymore
title: You must learn day by day, year by year, to broaden your horizon. The more things you love, the more you are interested in.

author: Angela Carter
title: You must realize that I was suffering from love and I knew him as intimately as I knew my own image in a mirror. In other words, I knew him only in relation to myself.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: You must see that if two things are alike, then it is a further question whether the first is copied from the second, or the second from the first, or both from a third.' 'Some that thought that all these loves were copies of our love for the landlord.

author: Hector Hugh Munro
title: You needn't tell me that a man who doesn't love oysters and asparagus and good wines has got a soul, or a stomach either. He's simply got the instinct for being unhappy highly developed.

author: Brooke Elliott
title: You put your heart and soul into something, and you really hope that people love it as much as you do.

author: Tennessee Williams
title: You said, ''They're harmless dreamers and they're loved by the people.'' - ''What,'' I asked you, ''is harmless about a dreamer, and what,'' I asked you, ''is harmless about the love of the people? Revolution only needs good dreamers who remember their dreams.''

author: Aldous Huxley
title: You should hurry up and acquire the cigar habit. It's one of the major happinesses. And so much more lasting than love, so much less costly in emotional wear and tear.

author: Andrea Dworkin
title: You think intercourse is a private act; it's not, it's a social act. Men are sexually predatory in life; and women are sexually manipulative. When two individuals come together and leave their gender outside the bedroom door, then they make love.

author: Henry Drummond
title: You will find as you look back upon your life that the moments when you have truly lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.

author: Henry Drummond
title: You will find, as you look back upon your life, that the moments when you really lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.

author: Buddha
title: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.

author: Brene Brown
title: You're imperfect, and you're wired for struggle, but you are worthy of love and belonging.

author: Carole King
title: You've got to get up every morning with a smile on your face , And show the world all the love in your heart , The people gonna treat you better, , You're gonna find, yes you will, , That you're beautiful as you feel.

author: Billie Holiday
title: You've got to have something to eat and a little love in your life before you can hold still for any damn body's sermon on how to behave.

author: Gordie Howe
title: You've got to love what you're doing. If you love it, you can overcome any handicap or the soreness or all the aches and pains, and continue to play for a long, long time.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Young love is a flame; very pretty, often very hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. The love of the older and disciplined heart is as coals, deep-burning, unquenchable.

author: B. Jowett
title: Young men make great mistakes in life; for one thing, they idealize love too much.

author: Paul Geraldy
title: Young men wish; love, money and health. One day, they'll say; health, money and love.

author: Guy Debord
title: Young people everywhere have been allowed to choose between love and a garbage disposal unit. Everywhere they have chosen the garbage disposal unit.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Your body loves you, but if you do not love your life, it will end it far sooner, thinking it is doing you a favor.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Your enthusiasm will be infectious, stimulating and attractive to others. They will love you for it. They will go for you and with you.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Your friend is your field which you sow with love and reap with thanksgiving.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Your love will deepen as your meditation deepens, and vice-versa: as your meditation blossoms, your love will also blossom.

author: Carlos Santana
title: Your mind is a magnet. You don't attract what you need or what you want; you attract who you are. And I love who I am!

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Youth fades; love droops, the leaves of friendship fall; A mother's secret hope outlives them all.

author: Aaron Hill
title:
Youth is ever apt to judge in haste, ,
 And lose the medium in the wild extreme, ,
 Do not repent, but regulate your passion: ,
 Though love is reason, its excess is rage. ,
 Give me, at least, your promise to reflect, ,
 In cool, impartial solitude, and still. ,
 No last decision till we meet again.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: Youth is not enough. And love is not enough. And success is not enough. And, if we could achieve it, enough would not be enough.

author: Barbara Walters
title: [Being a parent] is tough. If you just want a wonderful little creature to love, you can get a puppy.

author: Basil of Caesarea
title: A good deed is never lost. He who sows courtesy, reaps friendship; he who plants kindness, gathers love; pleasure bestowed on a grateful mind was never sterile, but generally gratitude begets reward.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love.

author: Simone Weil
title: An atheist may be simply one whose faith and love are concentrated on the impersonal aspects of God.

author: Walt Whitman
title: Camerado, I give you my hand, I give you my love more precious than money, I give you myself before preaching or law; Will you give me yourself?

author: Simone Weil
title: Charity. To love human beings in so far as they are nothing. That is to love them as God does.

author: Dwight L. Moody
title: Faith makes all things possible... love makes all things easy.

author: Alain de Botton
title: I was uncomfortable writing fiction. My love was the personal essay, rather than the novel.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: One can find women who have never had one love affair, but it is rare indeed to find any who have had only one.

author: author
title: title

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.

author: Sholem Aleichem
title: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A kiss may ruin a human life.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
title: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.

author: Geoffrey F. Abert
title: When you take charge of your life, there is no longer need to ask permission of other people or society at large. When you ask permission, you give someone veto power over your life.

author: Katherine Mansfield
title: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change. So suffering must become Love. That is the mystery.

author: Plato
title: Attention to health is life greatest hindrance.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Forbid a man to think for himself or to act for himself and you may add the joy of piracy and the zest of smuggling to his life.

author: David M. Burns
title: Aim for success, not perfection. Never give up your right to be wrong, because then you will lose the ability to learn new things and move forward with your life.

author: Greg Anderson
title: Let us be about setting high standards for life, love, creativity, and wisdom. If our expectations in these areas are low, we are not likely to experience wellness. Setting high standards makes every day and every decade worth looking forward to.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A day for toil, an hour for sport, but for a friend is life too short.

author: Fran Lebowitz
title: Life is something you do when you can't get to sleep.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself

author: Henry Ford
title: Life is a series of experiences, each one of which makes us bigger, even though sometimes it is hard to realize this. For the world was built to develop character, and we must learn that the setbacks and grieves which we endure help us in our marching onward.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: A man's life is what his thoughts make of it.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Our truest life is when we are in our dreams awake.

author: August Strindberg
title: A man with a so-called character is often a simple piece of mechanism; he has often only one point of view for the extremely complicated relationships of life.

author: Joseph Addison
title: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship. To raise this to the highest pitch of enjoyment, is a secret which but few discover.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.

author: Anais Nin
title: Dreams are necessary to life.

author: Karl Albrecht
title: The typical human life seems to be quite unplanned, undirected, unlived, and unsavored. Only those who consciously think about the adventure of living as a matter of making choices among options, which they have found for themselves, ever establish real self-control and live their lives fully.

author: Fred A. Allen
title: A celebrity is a person who works hard all of their life to become well known, and then wears dark glasses to avoid being recognized.

author: Les Brown
title: Accept responsibility for your life. Know that it is you who will get you where you want to go, no one else.

author: William Arthur Ward
title: Committing a great truth to memory is admirable; committing it to life is wisdom.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Dear to us are those who love us... but dearer are those who reject us as unworthy, for they add another life; they build a heaven before us whereof we had not dreamed, and thereby supply to us new powers out of the recesses of the spirit, and urge us to new and unattempted performances.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: A sedentary life is the real sin against the Holy Spirit. Only those thoughts that come by walking have any value.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Every philosophy is the philosophy of some stage of life.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Experience has taught me this, that we undo ourselves by impatience. Misfortunes have their life and their limits, their sickness and their health.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.

author: Denis Waitley
title: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.

author: Robertson Davies
title: A happy childhood has spoiled many a promising life.

author: Tennessee Williams
title: A high station in life is earned by the gallantry with which appalling experiences are survived with grace.

author: Ernest Hemingway

author: Sydney Smith
title: All this class of pleasures inspires me with the same nausea as I feel at the sight of rich plum-cake or sweetmeats; I prefer the driest bread of common life.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Believe me! The secret of reaping the greatest fruitfulness and the greatest enjoyment from life is to live dangerously!

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

author: George Ade

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: Honesty prospers in every condition of life.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: I know of no more encouraging fact than the unquestionable ability of man to elevate his life by conscious endeavor.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
title: Life always rides in strength to victory, not through internationalism... but only through the direct responsibility of the individual

title: The good we secure for ourselves is precarious and uncertain until it is secured for all of us and incorporated into our common life.

title: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.

author: William James

author: W. Mitchell

author: Ann Landers

author: William Shakespeare
title: Death makes no conquest of this conqueror: For now he lives in fame, though not in life.

author: Arthur Rubenstein
title: Even when I'm sick and depressed, I love life.

author: Richard Bach
title: Every person, all the events of your life are there because you have drawn them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.

author: Robert Frost
title: Friends make pretence of following to the grave but before one is in it, their minds are turned and making the best of their way back to life and living people and things they understand.

author: John Dryden
title: He has not learned the first lesson of life who does not every day surmount a fear.

author: Damon Runyon
title: I came to the conclusion long ago that all life is six to five against.

author: Walter Cronkite
title: I can't imagine a person becoming a success who doesn't give this game of life everything he's got.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: I do not know how to distinguish between our waking life and a dream. Are we not always living the life that we imagine we are?

title: I really want to clear my life so that I have to make as few decisions as possible about anything except how to best serve this community.

author: Dave Barry
title: If a woman has to choose between catching a fly ball and saving an infant's life, she will choose to save the infant's life without even considering if there are men on base.

title: If I knew for a certainty that a man was coming to my house with the conscious design of doing me good, I should run for my life.

title: If it were weren't for pickpockets, I'd have no sex life at all.

author: Rodney Dangerfield
title: If it weren't for pickpockets, I'd have no sex life at all.

author: Joseph Addison
title: If we hope for what we are not likely to possess, we act and think in vain, and make life a greater dream and shadow than it really is.

author: Joseph Addison
title: If you wish success in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother and hope your guardian genius.

title: In the last analysis it is our conception of death which decides our answers to all the questions life puts to us.

author: Henry van Dyke
title: Individualsm is a fatal poison. But individuality is the salt of common life.

author: Seneca
title: It is more fitting for a man to laugh at life than to lament over it.

author: Les Brown
title: Life has no limitations, except the ones you make.

title: Life is filigree work. What is written clearly is not worth much, it's the transparency that counts.

author: Shirley Conran
title: Life is too short to stuff a mushroom.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Mark how fleeting and paltry is the estate of man - yesterday in embryo, tomorrow a mummy or ashes. So for the hairsbreadth of time assigned to thee, live rationally, and part with life cheerfully, as drops the ripe olive, extolling the season that bore it and the tree that matured it.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Most of the luxuries and many of the so-called comforts of life are not only not indispensable, but positive hindrances to the elevation of mankind.

author: George Orwell
title: Most people get a fair amount of fun out of their lives, but on balance life is suffering, and only the very young or the very foolish imagine otherwise.

author: Joseph Addison
title: Of all the diversions of life, there is none so proper to fill up its empty spaces as the reading of useful and entertaining authors.

author: Joseph Addison
title: One should take good care not to grow too wise for so great a pleasure of life as laughter.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Quality questions create a quality life. Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.

author: Paul E. Little
title: Some people think that God peers over the balcony of heaven trying to find anybody who is enjoying life. And when He spots a happy person, He yells, ''Now cut that out!'' That concept of God should make us shudder because it's blasphemous!

author: Aristotle
title: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.

author: Aristotle
title: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.

author: Joseph Addison
title: The important question is not, what will yield to man a few scattered pleasures, but what will render his life happy on the whole amount.

author: William R. Alger
title: The line of life is a ragged diagonal between duty and desire.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The love of life is necessary to the vigorous prosecution of any undertaking.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: The man who insists upon seeing with perfect clearness before he decides, never decides. Accept life, and you must accept regret.

author: Lester Bangs
title: The only questions worth asking today are whether humans are going to have any emotions tomorrow, and what the quality of life will be if the answer is no.

author: John Mortimer
title: The shelf life of the modern hardback writer is somewhere between the milk and the yogurt.

author: William Shakespeare
title: There is a tide in the affairs of men, which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune; Omitted, all the voyage of their life is bound by shallows and in misery.

author: Aristotle
title: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: To read well, that is, to read true books in a true spirit, is a noble exercise, and one that will task the reader more than any other exercise which the customs of the day esteem. It requires a training such as the athletes underwent, the steady intention almost of the whole life to this object.

author: Dame Barbara Ward
title: We cannot cheat on DNA. We cannot get round photosynthesis. We cannot say I am not going to give a damn about phytoplankton. All these tiny mechanisms provide the preconditions of our planetary life. To say we do not care is to say in the most literal sense that ''we choose death.''

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
title: What makes saintliness in my view, as distinguished from ordinary goodness, is a certain quality of magnanimity and greatness of soul that brings life within the circle of the heroic.

author: Molière
title: Without knowledge, life is not more than the shadow of death.

author: Daniel Francois Esprit Auber
title: Aging seems to be the only available way to live a long life.

author: C. C. H. Pounder
title: 'Bagdad Cafe' was a film that changed many, many people's lives... how they saw themselves and how they looked at their life situation. I thought I made a little movie. All the mail that I get is about how it changed lives, and that's wonderful.

author: Barbara Windsor
title: 'EastEnders' has been wonderful to me and it's no secret that it changed my life all of those years ago. I'll be so sad to leave Peggy behind; she's such a wonderful character to play. I have had the pleasure of working with a marvelous cast and crew and have made many lasting good friends.

author: Carl Lewis
title: 'm so fortunate to have done what I love to do for so long, but the day I retired was one of the best days of my life. Not because I was happy to get away from the sport, but because it was clear in my mind that I had done all I possibly could, and that it was time to go.

author: Campbell Brown
title: 'Morning Joe' host Mika Brzezinski's personal life is a minefield. Her father is Zbigniew Brzezinski, former national security adviser to President Jimmy Carter, and while one brother is an Obama appointee, the other advises Romney.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: 'The Butler' has virtually nothing in common with its source material, the life of White House butler Gene Allen, except for the fact that the main character of the film and Allen were both black butlers in the White House.

author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
title: 'Tis easy enough to be pleasant, When life flows along like a song; But the man worth while is the one who will smile when everything goes dead wrong.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: 'Tis the maddest trick a man can ever play in his whole life, to let his breath sneak out of his body without any more ado, and without so much as a rap o'er the pate, or a kick of the guts; to go out like the snuff of a farthing candle, and die merely of the mulligrubs, or the sullens.

author: William Shakespeare
title: 'Tis the soldier's life to have their balmy slumbers waked with strife.

author: Byron Howard
title: 'Zootopia' features such a large and diverse range of characters - one of our biggest casts ever for a Disney Animation film. We needed talented actors who could help bring these animals to life.

author: Betty Ford
title: ... a woman... told us she was forever getting herself into trouble. But I just keep coming back, she said. I just keep showing up for my life. Showing up for life. Being blessed with the rebirth that recovery brings.

author: Benjamin E. Mays
title: ... the circumference of life cannot be rightly drawn until the center is set.

author: Bell Hooks
title: ...there is an element of Play that is almost ritualistic in Black folk life. It serves to mediate the tensions, stress, and pain of constant exploitation and oppression.

author: Francis Bacon
title:
A bachelor's life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.,
,
,

author: Henry Miller
title: A book is a part of life, a manifestation of life, just as much as a tree or a horse or a star. It obeys its own rhythms, its own laws, whether it be a novel, a play, or a diary. The deep, hidden rhythm of life is always there - that of the pulse, the heart beat.

author: Bill Watterson
title: A box of new crayons! Now they're all pointy, lined up in order, bright and perfect. Soon they'll be a bunch of ground down, rounded, indistinguishable stumps, missing their wrappers and smudged with other colors. Sometimes life seems unbearably tragic.

author: Carter Burwell
title: A carefree quality is a whole aspect of life that I will never understand. I don't think I have ever been carefree and can't see the pleasure of it.

author: Fred Allen
title: A celebrity is a person who works hard all his life to become well known, then wears dark glasses to avoid being recognized.

author: Alice Meynell
title: A child is beset with long traditions. And his infancy is so old, so old, that the mere adding of years in the life to follow will not seem to throw it further back - it is already so far.

author: Bernard Berenson
title: A complete life may be one ending in so full an identification with the not-self that there is no self left to die.

author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
title: A confession has to be part of your new life.

author: Kofi Annan
title: A developed country is one that allows all its citizens to enjoy a free and healthy life in a safe environment.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: A dog reflects the family life. Whoever saw a frisky dog in a gloomy family, or a sad dog in a happy one? Snarling people have snarling dogs, dangerous people have dangerous ones.

author: Albert Einstein
title: A finely tempered nature longs to escape from the personal life into the world of objective perception and thought.

author: Erasmus Darwin
title: A fool... is a man who never tried an experiment in his life.

author: Epicurus
title: A free life cannot acquire many possessions, because this is not easy to do without servility to mobs or monarchs...

author: Samuel Butler
title: A genius can never expect to have a good time anywhere, if he is a genuine article, but America is about the last place in which life will be endurable at all for an inspired writer of any kind.

author: John Milton
title: A good book is the precious life-blood of the master spirit, embalmed and treasured up on purpose for a life beyond.

author: Ann Plato
title: A good education is that which prepares us for our future sphere of action and makes us contented with that situation in life in which God, in his infinite mercy, has seen fit to place us, to be perfectly resigned to our lot in life, whatever it may be.

author: Christopher Hampton
title: A great number of the disappointments and mishaps of the troubled world are the direct result of literature and the allied arts. It is our belief that no human being who devotes his life and energy to the manufacture of fantasies can be anything but fundamentally inadequate

author: Walter Bagehot
title: A great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.

author: Seneca
title: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: A happy life must be to a great extent a quiet life, for it is only in an atmosphere of quiet that true joy dare live.

author: Andrew Matthews
title: A healthy self-love means we have no compulsion to justify to ourselves or others why we take vacations, why we sleep late, why we buy new shoes, why we spoil ourselves from time to time. We feel comfortable doing things which add quality and beauty to life.

author: Joseph Campbell
title: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.,

author: Bill Moyers
title: A journalist is basically a chronicler, not an interpreter of events. Where else in society do you have the license to eavesdrop on so many different conversations as you have in journalism? Where else can you delve into the life of our times?

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A large city cannot be experientially known; its life is too manifold for any individual to be able to participate in it.

author: Brandon Lee
title: A large part of my life revolves around my dad. Sometimes, I even feel a strong sense of connection, something very tangible when I learn something new in the martial arts.

author: Laurence Sterne
title: A large volume of adventures may be grasped within this little span of life, by him who interests his heart in everything.

author: Norman Cousins
title: A library is the delivery room for the birth of ideas, a place where history comes to life.

author: Ann Bancroft
title: A life lesson for me is, how do you muster the courage to take on a new risk? Whether it's starting up a business or taking on a new project or expedition. I think the risks that we take are all relative to the risk-taker.

author: Denis Waitley
title: A life lived with integrity - even if it lacks the trappings of fame and fortune is a shinning star in whose light others may follow in the years to come.

author: William Cowper
title: A life of ease is a difficult pursuit.

author: Chuck Noll
title: A life of frustration is inevitable for any coach whose main enjoyment is winning.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: A life of leisure and a life of laziness are two things. There will be sleeping enough in the grave.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: A life of pleasure makes even the strongest mind frivolous at last.

author: George Jean Nathan
title: A life spent in constant labor is a life wasted, save a man be such a fool as to regard a fulsome obituary notice as ample reward.

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
title: A life which does not go into action is a failure.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: A life without adventure is likely to be unsatisfying, but a life in which adventure is allowed to take whatever form it will is sure to be short.

author: Alan Cohen
title: A life without change is not a life; it is a stagnant pool.

author: Elisabeth Gaskell
title: A little credulity helps one on through life very smoothly.,

author: Alfred Hitchcock
title: A lot of movies are about life, mine are like a slice of cake.

author: Cate Blanchett
title: A lot of people are frightened by old age - by being around people who are, basically, on their way out - but I'm fascinated by it. It's an amazing thing to be around someone who has had a life well lived.

author: Andrew Cohen
title: A lot of people in spiritual life use the awareness of difference, and the spiritual glorification of difference, as a justification to indulge in that which is ultimately unreal.

author: Bette Midler
title: A lot of people say that my life is wasted on me because I could be a bigger asshole than I am, but I've chosen not to be.

author: Ben Gibbard
title: A lot of the material is about the inevitable disappointment people feel as they move through life, and things don't feel the way they expect. No experience will ever match up to the idealized version in your mind.

author: Brantley Gilbert
title: A lot of things in my life changed, but I'm still a party animal. I'm leading the pack.

author: Vince Lombardi
title: A man can be as great as he wants to be. If you believe in yourself and have the courage, the determination, the dedication, the competitive drive and if you are willing to sacrifice the little things in life and pay the price for the things that are worthwhile, it can be done.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.

author: Robin George Collingwood
title: A man ceases to be a beginner in any given science and becomes a master in that science when he has learned that he is going to be a beginner all his life.

author: Abraham Polonsky
title: A man could spend the rest of his life trying to remember what he shouldn't have said.

author: Charles Dickens
title: A man in public life expects to be sneered at - it is the fault of his elevated situation, and not of himself.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man is ethical only when life, as such, is sacred to him, that of plants and animals as that of his fellow men, and when he devotes himself helpfully to all life that is in need of help.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man is truly ethical only when he obeys the compulsion to help all life which he is able to assist, and shrinks from injuring anything that lives.

author: James Allen
title: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.

author: Charles Darwin
title: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.,

author: Sigmund Freud
title: A man who has been the indisputable favorite of his mother keeps for life the feeling of a conqueror.

author: Muhammad Ali
title: A man who views the world the same at fifty as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.,

author: Lucius Accius
title: A man whose life has been dishonourable is not entitled to escape disgrace in death.

author: William Booth
title: A man's labor is not only his capital but his life. When it passes it returns never more. To utilize it, to prevent its wasteful squandering, to enable the poor man to bank it up for use hereafter, this surely is one of the most urgent tasks before civilization.

author: Georges Clemenceau
title: A man's life is interesting primarily when he has failed - I well know. For it's a sign that he tried to surpass himself.

author: John Keats
title: A man's life of any worth is a continual allegory.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: A man's real life is that accorded to him in the thoughts of other men by reason of respect or natural love.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A man's very highest moment is, I have no doubt at all, when he kneels in the dust, and beats his breast, and tells all the sins of his life.

author: Bjornstjerne Bjornson
title: A meaningful life - this is what we look for in art, in its smallest dewdrops as in its unleashing of the tempest. We are at peace when we have found it and uneasy when we have not.

author: Bill Gothard
title: A message prepared in the mind reaches a mind; a message prepared in a life reaches a life.

author: Sri Swami Sivananda
title: A mountain is composed of tiny grains of earth. The ocean is made up of tiny drops of water. Even so, life is but an endless series of little details, actions, speeches, and thoughts. And the consequences whether good or bad of even the least of them are far-reaching.

author: John Stuart Mill
title: A party of order or stability, and a party of progress or reform, are both necessary elements of a healthy state of political life.

author: Cam Newton
title: A person that says, 'Losing is not difficult,' I don't even want to be around that person. And obviously, that person has never won anything relevant in their life.

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: A photograph can be an instant of life captured for eternity that will never cease looking back at you.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: A Pike, in the California dialect, is a native of Missouri, Arkansas, Northern Texas, or Southern Illinois. The first emigrants that came over the plains were from Pike County, Missouri; but as the phrase, 'a Pike County man,' was altogether too long for this short life of ours, it was soon abbreviated into 'a Pike.'

author: Hubert H. Humphrey
title: A politician never forgets the precarious nature of elective life. We have never established a practice of tenure in public office.

author: Robert Byrne
title: A promising young man should go into politics so that he can go on promising for the rest of his life.

author: John Keats
title: A proverb is not a proverb to you until life has illustrated it.

author: Alfred Nobel
title: A recluse without books and ink is already in life a dead man.,

author: Camille Paglia
title: A serious problem in America is the gap between academe and the mass media, which is our culture. Professors of humanities, with all their leftist fantasies, have little direct knowledge of American life and no impact whatever on public policy.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: A silly idea is current that good people do not know what temptation means. This is an obvious lie. Only those who try to resist temptation know how strong it is.... A man who gives in to temptation after five minutes simply does not know what it would have been like an hour later. That is why bad people, in one sense, know very little about badness. They have lived a sheltered life by always giving in.

author: Anne Spencer
title: A simple enough pleasure, surely, to have breakfast alone with one's husband, but how seldom married people in the midst of life achieve it.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: A society in which all men and women would become people of substantive reason, whose independent reasoning would have structural consequences for their societies, its history and thus for their own life fates.

author: Christopher Lasch
title: A society that has made ''nostalgia'' a marketable commodity on the cultural exchange quickly repudiates the suggestion that life in the past was in any important way better than life today.

author: Carl Jung
title: A special ability means a heavy expenditure of energy in a particular direction, with a consequent drain from some other side of life.

author: Hitopadesa
title: A store of grain, Oh king is the best of treasures. A gem put in your mouth will not support life.

author: George Eliot
title: A supreme love, a motive that gives a sublime rhythm to a woman's life, and exalts habit into partnership with the soul's highest needs, is not to be had where and how she wills.

author: Carl Sagan
title: A tiny blue dot set in a sunbeam. Here it is. That's where we live. That's home. We humans are one species and this is our world. It is our responsibility to cherish it. Of all the worlds in our solar system, the only one so far as we know, graced by life.

author: Cameron Sinclair
title: A true architect is not an artist but an optimistic realist. They take a diverse number of stakeholders, extract needs, concerns, and dreams, then create a beautiful yet tangible solution that is loved by the users and the community at large. We create vessels in which life happens.

author: Billy Joel
title: A typical day in the life of a heavy metal musician consists of a round of golf and an AA meeting.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: A useful definition of liberty is obtained only by seeking the principle of liberty in the main business of human life, that is to say, in the process by which men educate their responses and learn to control their environment.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: A useless life is an early death.

author: William Arthur Ward
title: A well-developed sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to your steps as you walk the tightrope of life.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: A well-written life is almost as rare as a well-spent one.

author: Mary Baker Eddy
title: A wicked mortal is not the idea of God. He is little else than the expression of error. To suppose that sin, lust, hatred, envy, hypocrisy, revenge, have life abiding in them, is a terrible mistake. Life and Life's idea, Truth and Truth's idea, never make men sick, sinful, or mortal.

author: Betty Friedan
title: A woman has got to be able to say, and not feel guilty, 'Who am I, and what do I want out of life?' She mustn't feel selfish and neurotic if she wants goals of her own, outside of husband and children.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: A woman's body is the gate to this life. A man's body is the gate to the next life.

author: Washington Irving
title: A woman's life is a history of the affections.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: A woman's life is not perfect or whole till she has added herself to a husband. Nor is a man's life perfect or whole till he has added to himself a wife.

author: Carol Shields
title: A woman's life isn't worth a plateful of cabbage if she hasn't felt life stir under her heart. Taking a little one to nurse, watching him grow to manhood, that's what love is.

author: Freya Stark
title: Absence is one of the most useful ingredients of family life, and to dose it rightly is an art like any other.

author: Albert Camus
title: Accept life, take it as it is? Stupid. The means of doing otherwise? Far from our having to take it, it is life that possesses us and on occasion shuts our mouths.

author: Charles J. Givens
title: Achieve success in any area of life by identifying the optimum strategies and repeating them until they become habits.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Achievement of your happiness is the only moral purpose of your life, and that happiness, not pain or mindless self-indulgence, is the proof of your moral integrity, since it is the proof and the result of your loyalty to the achievement of your values.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Achieving life is not the equivalent of avoiding death.

author: Hesiod
title: Acquisition means life to miserable mortals.

author: Marlon Brando
title: Acting is the expression of a neurotic impulse. It's a bum's life.

author: Bette Davis
title: Acting should be bigger than life. Scripts should be bigger than life. It should all be bigger than life.

author: Donald Sinden
title: Actors ought to be larger than life. You come across quite enough ordinary, nondescript people in daily life and I don't see why you should be subjected to them on the stage too.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Adult life is dealing with an enormous amount of questions that don't have answers. So I let the mystery settle into my music. I don't deny anything, I don't advocate anything, I just live with it.

author: Karl Kraus
title: Adults who still derive childlike pleasure from hanging gifts of a ready-made education on the Christmas tree of a child waiting outside the door to life do not realize how unreceptive they are making the children to everything that constitutes the true surprise of life.

author: Bill Clinton
title: Advances in computer technology and the Internet have changed the way America works, learns, and communicates. The Internet has become an integral part of America's economic, political, and social life.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Advertising signs that con you into thinking you are the one , That can do what's never been done, , That can win what's never been won , Meanwhile, life outside goes on all around you

author: Bryce Courtenay
title: Advertising was only meant to be a very small part of my life. I had intended that I would work extensively in journalism for about five or six years and then I'd become a writer.

author: Alan Alda
title: After a while I started to think of that as an image of something that went a lot deeper than the dead dog, which is you can't bring back anything to life.

author: Joseph Brodsky
title: After all, it is hard to master both life and work equally well. So if you are bound to fake one of them, it had better be life.

author: Rohinton Mistry
title: After all, our lives are but a sequence of accidents - a clanking chain of chance events. A string of choices, casual or deliberate, which add up to that one big calamity we call life.

author: Woody Allen
title: After all, there are worse things in life than death. If you've ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman, you know what I'm talking about.

author: George Macdonald
title: Age is not all decay; it is the ripening, the swelling, of the fresh life within, that withers and bursts the husk.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Age. That period of life in which we compound for the vices that remain by reviling those we have no longer the vigor to commit.

author: Edwin Markham
title: Ah, great it is to believe the dream as we stand in youth by the starry stream; but a greater thing is to fight life through and say at the end, the dream is true!

author: Susanna Moodie
title: Ah, Hope! what would life be, stripped of thy encouraging smiles, that teach us to look behind the dark clouds of to-day, for the golden beams that are to gild the morrow.

author: Bill Watterson
title: Ah, the life of a newspaper cartoonist -- how I miss the groupies, drugs and trashed hotel rooms!

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Ahimas is the attribute of the soul, and therefore, to be practiced by everybody in all affairs of life. If it cannot be practiced in all departments, it has no practical value.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Alcohol is the anesthesia by which we endure the operation of life.

author: Samuel Butler
title: All animals except man know that the ultimate of life is to enjoy it.

author: Samuel Butler
title: All animals, except man, know that the principal business of life is to enjoy it.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: All brave men love; for he only is brave who has affections to fight for, whether in the daily battle of life, or in physical contests.

author: Gail Sheehy
title: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter into another!

author: Anatole France
title: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: All customs and traditions, all our way of life, everything to do with home and order, has crumbled into dust in the general upheaval and reorganization of society. The whole human way of life has been destroyed and ruined. All that's left is the naked human soul stripped to the last shred, for which nothing has changed because it was always cold and shivering and reaching out to its nearest neighbor, as cold and lonely as itself.

author: Robert Southey
title: All deception in the course of life is indeed nothing else but a lie reduced to practice, and falsehood passing from words into things.

author: Rebecca West
title: All good biography, as all good fiction, comes down to the study of original sin, of our inherent disposition to choose death when we ought to choose life.

author: Khaled Hosseini
title: All good things in life are fragile and easily lost.

author: Brandon Lee
title: All I can tell you is that you cannot make choices in your own career, either career choices or choices when you're actually working as an actor, based on trying to downplay or live up to a comparison with somebody else. You just can't do that. You have to do your own work based on your own gut, your own instincts, and your own life.

author: Bobby Hull
title: All I've done all my life is just tried to better the game for our players and for those people watching.

author: Ralph Ransom
title: All life demands struggle. Those who have everything given to them become lazy, selfish, and insensitive to the real values of life. The very striving and hard work that we so constantly try to avoid is the major building block in the person we are today.

author: Ezra Pound
title: All my life I believed I knew something. But then one strange day came when I realized that I knew nothing, yes, I knew nothing. And so words became void of meaning. I have arrived too late at ultimate uncertainty.

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: All my life I have always known I was born to greatness.

author: A. R. Rahman
title: All my life I have had a choice of hate and love. I chose love and I am here.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: All my life I have tried to pluck a thistle and plant a flower wherever the flower would grow in thought and mind.

author: Curtis Carlson
title: All my life I knew that there was all the money you could want out there. All you have to do is go after it.

author: Billy Graham
title: All my life I've been taught how to die, but no one ever taught me how to grow old.

author: Ted Turner
title: All my life people have said that I wasn't going to make it.

author: Marie Curie
title: All my life through, the new sights of Nature made me rejoice like a child.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: All my life, as down an abyss without a bottom. I have been pouring van loads of information into that vacancy of oblivion I call my mind.

author: Billy Paul
title: All my life, I wanted to sound like myself. I never wanted to sound like anybody else.

author: Khaled Hosseini
title: All my life, I'd been around men. That night, I discovered the tenderness of a woman

author: Bret Michaels
title: All my life, I've been a type 1 diabetic. I've always taken life day by day.

author: Bobby Bowden
title: All my life, I've been right next to a football field. I never knew nothing else.

author: Harry S. Truman
title: All my life, whenever it comes time to make a decision, I make it and forget about it.

author: Anton Chekhov
title: All of life and human relations have become so incomprehensibly complex that, when you think about it, it becomes terrifying and your heart stands still.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: All of life is a dispute over taste and tasting.

author: Jack Kerouac
title: All of life is a foreign country.

author: Jim Rohn
title: All of life is a risk; in fact we're not going to get out alive. Casualness leads to casualties. Communication is the ability to affect other people with words.

author: John Wooden
title:
All of life is peaks and valleys. Don't let the peaks get too high and the valleys too low.,
,

author: Betty Wright
title: All of my babies know that I preach all day... I ain't trying to hide no light under no bushel. Everybody needs a little light in their life, and when they need prayer, they know where to come because they know I love them all, and I ain't judging nobody.

author: Babe Didrikson Zaharias
title: All of my life I've always had the urge to do things better than anybody else.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: All of the troubles that some people have in life is that which they married into.

author: Vera Brittain
title: All that a pacifist can undertake - but it is a very great deal - is to refuse to kill, injure or otherwise cause suffering to another human creature, and untiringly to order his life by the rule of love though others may be captured by hate.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: All that I am or hope to be I owe to my angel mother. I remember my mother's prayers and they have always followed me. They have clung to me all my life.

author: James Allen
title: All that you accomplish or fail to accomplish with your life is the direct result of your thoughts.

author: C. Richards
title:
All the arts we practice are apprenticeship. The big art is our life.,
M.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: All the breaks you need in life wait within your imagination, Imagination is the workshop of your mind, capable of turning mind energy into accomplishment and wealth.

author: Bee Wilson
title: All the foods that you regularly eat are ones that you learned to eat. Everyone starts life drinking milk. After that, it's all up for grabs. From our first year of life, human tastes are astonishingly diverse.

author: Bess Myerson
title: All the praise I received couldn't substitute for the praise I had never received from my mother at home. I longed for some wonderful man to come and save me from my life - but there didn't seem to be any, at least not for me.

author: Alberto Giacometti
title: All the sculptures of today, like those of the past, will end one day in pieces... So it is important to fashion ones work carefully in its smallest recess and charge every particle of matter with life.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: All their life in this world and all their adventures in Narnia had only been the cover and the title page: now at last they were beginning Chapter One of the Great Story which no one on earth has read: which goes on for ever: in which every chapter is better than the one before.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: All this will not be finished in the first one hundred days. Nor will it be finished in the first thousand days, nor in the life of this administration, nor even perhaps in our lifetime on this planet. But let us begin.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: All trials are trials for one's life, just as all sentences are sentences of death.

author: Mark Twain
title: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then Success is sure.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Almost every man wastes part of his life attempting to display qualities which he does not possess.,

author: Carrie Fisher
title: Along with aging comes life experience, so in every way that is consistent with even being human, Leia has changed.

author: Tatyana Tolstaya
title: Already the writers are complaining that there is too much freedom. They need some pressure. The worse your daily life, the better your art. If you have to be careful because of oppression and censorship, this pressure produces diamonds.

author: Anna Pavlova
title: Although one may fail to find happiness in theatrical life, one never wishes to give it up after having once tasted its fruits.

author: Siddha Nagarjuna
title: Although you may spend your life killing, You will not exhaust all your foes. But if you quell your own anger, your real enemy will be slain.

author: Robert Frost
title: Always fall in with what you're asked to accept. Take what is given, and make it over your way. My aim in life has always been to hold my own with whatever's going. Not against: with.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: Always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter. Walt Disney Every decision you make is a mistake.

author: Earl Nightingale
title: Am I motivated by what I really want out of life - or am I mass-motivated?

author: Mary Caroline Richards
title: Am I willing to give up what I have in order to be what I am not yet? Am I able to follow the spirit of love into the desert? It is a frightening and sacred moment. There is no return. One's life is charged forever. It is the fire that gives us our shape.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: America is neither free nor brave, but a land of tight, iron-clanking little wills, everybody trying to put it over everybody else, and a land of men absolutely devoid of the real courage of trust, trust in life's sacred spontaneity. They can't trust life until they can control it.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: America is rather like life. You can usually find in it what you look for. It will probably be interesting, and it is sure to be large.

author: George W. Bush
title: America is the land of the second chance - and when the gates of the prison open, the path ahead should lead to a better life.,

author: Simon Hoggart
title: America loves the representation of its heroes to be not just larger than life, but stupendously, awesomely bigger than anything else. If blue whales built statues to each other they'd be smaller then these.

author: Carl Jung
title: Among all my patients in the second half of life... every one of them fell ill because he had lost what the living religions of every age have given their followers, and none of them has been really healed who did not regain his religious outlook.

author: Sydney Smith
title: Among the smaller duties of life I hardly know any one more important than that of not praising where praise is not due.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: An ''unemployed'' existence is a worse negation of life than death itself.

author: Harold Loukes
title: An act of love that fails is just as much a part of the divine life as an act of love that succeeds, for love is measured by fullness, not by reception.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.

author: Thomas Mann
title: An art whose medium is language will always show a high degree of critical creativeness, for speech is itself a critique of life: it names, it characterizes, it passes judgment, in that it creates.

author: E. F. Schumacher
title: An attitude to life which seeks fulfillment in the single-minded pursuit of wealth - in short, materialism - does not fit into this world, because it contains within itself no limiting principle, while the environment in which it is placed is strictly limited.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: An awareness of one's mortality can lead you to wake up and live an authentic, meaningful life.

author: Samuel Butler
title: An empty house is like a stray dog or a body from which life has departed.

author: Ovid
title: An evil life is a kind of death.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: An expensive arms race, under cover of the military metaphysic, and in a paranoid atmosphere of fright, is an economically attractive business. To many utopian capitalists, it has become the Business Way of American Life.

author: Carl von Clausewitz
title: An intellectual instinct which extracts the essence from the phenomena of life, as a bee sucks honey from a flower. In addition to study and reflections, life itself serves as a source.

author: Jacques Prevert
title: An orange on the table, your dress on the rug, and you in my bed, sweet present of the present, cool of night, warmth of my life.

author: Socrates
title: An unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: An unforgettable experience happened on December 15, 1996 when I won the Supermodel contest while still in school. I was just seventeen years old then. Winning that competition was the turning point of my life. That's how I got into modeling and later started acting.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: And above all things, never think that you're not good enough yourself. A man should never think that. My belief is that in life people will take you at your own reckoning

author: Barbara Walters
title: And I really do believe that the most important thing is the way you live your life on earth. But I think it's enormously comforting to believe that you're going to see your loved ones.

author: Aaron McGruder
title: And I'm not so in love with making people mad that I want to live my life around it.

author: Bob Dylan
title: And if my thought-dreams could be seen, they'd probably put my head in a guillotine. , But it's alright, Ma, it's life, and life only.

author: Alan Thicke
title: And introduce an element of cynicism and darkness into it and just realize that we're all vulnerable. We are humans. There is a finite end to this life and we're all going to face it and a little silliness can help.

author: Bram Stoker
title: And so we remained till the red of the dawn began to fall through the snow gloom. I was desolate and afraid, and full of woe and terror. But when that beautiful sun began to climb the horizon life was to me again.

author: Billy Gardell
title: And then as I got older, see, I think a lot of times with comics, your life kind of permeates your act. Whatever is happening in your life is what's going on on stage. So if you're angry in your life, then that's going to be on stage. If you're looking for the guy that's just going to make you laugh for an hour and forget about, that's me.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: And thou wilt give thyself relief, if thou doest every act of thy life as if it were the last.

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
title: Animals are in possession of themselves; their soul is in possession of their body. But they have no right to their life, because they do not will it.

author: Brad Bird
title: Animation is about creating the illusion of life. And you can't create it if you don't have one.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Antonin Scalia was witty, warm, funny, and full of life. He was not only one of the most important justices in the nation's history; he was also among the greatest.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: Any man who can write a page of living prose adds something to our life, and the man who can, as I can, is surely the last to resent someone who can do it even better. An artist cannot deny art, nor would he want to. A lover cannot deny love.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: Any man who does not accept the conditions of human life sells his soul.

author: Cavett Robert
title: Any man who selects a goal in life which can be fully achieved has already defined his own limitations.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Anyone can carry his burden, however hard, until nightfall. Anyone can do his work, however hard, for one day. Anyone can live sweetly, patiently, lovingly, purely, until the sun goes down. And this is all that life really means.

author: Augusto Roa Bastos
title: Anyone who attempts to relate his life loses himself in the immediate. One can only speak of another.

author: Franz Kafka
title: Anyone who cannot come to terms with his life while he is alive needs one hand to ward off a little his despair over his fate... but with his other hand he can note down what he sees among the ruins.

author: Anderson Cooper
title: Anyone who has experienced a certain amount of loss in their life has empathy for those who have experienced loss.

author: Henry Ford
title: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.,

author: Charles Dickens
title: Anything for the quick life, as the man said when he took the situation at the lighthouse.

author: Bruce Dickinson
title: Apart from death and taxes, the one thing that's certain in this life is that I'll never be a fashion icon.

author: Arne Jacobsen
title: Architecture tends to consume everything else, it has become one's entire life.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: Are wars... anything but the means whereby a nation's problems are set, where creation is stimulated - there you have adventure. But there is no adventure in heads-or-tails, in betting that the toss will come out of life or death. War is not an adventure. It is a disease. It is like typhus.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: Are you bored with life? Then throw yourself into some work you believe in with all your heart, live for it, die for it, and you will find happiness that you had thought could never be yours.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Art always serves beauty, and beauty is the joy of possessing form, and form is the key to organic life since no living thing can exist without it.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Art has two constant, two unending concerns: It always meditates on death and thus always creates life. All great, genuine art resembles and continues the Revelation of St John.

author: Al Jourgensen
title: Art is commenting on what's going on around you in your life.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Art is interested in life at the moment when the ray of power is passing through it.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Art is long, life short, judgment difficult, opportunity transient.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Art is merely the refuge which the ingenious have invented, when they were supplied with food and women, to escape the tediousness of life.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Art is one of the means whereby man seeks to redeem a life which is experienced as chaotic, senseless, and largely evil.

author: Henry Miller
title: Art is only a means to life, to the life more abundant. It is not in itself the life more abundant. It merely points the way, something which is overlooked not only by the public, but very often by the artist himself. In becoming an end it defeats itself.

author: Kenneth Tynan
title: Art is parasitic on life, just as criticism is parasitic on art.

author: William Blake
title:
Art is the tree of life. Science is the tree of death.,
,

author: Ben Elliot
title: Art is the ultimate luxury good, but one that can make you think, give a you a blast of beauty and enhance your life. Even if the work's made of plasticine.

author: Günther Grass
title: Art is uncompromising and life is full of compromises.

author: Henry Miller
title: Art teaches nothing, except the significance of life.

author: Bliss Carman
title: Art thou a hyacinth blossom The shepherds upon the hills Have trodden into the ground? Shall I not life thee?

author: Pablo Picasso
title: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.

author: Billy Joel
title: Artist - musicians, painters, writers, poets, always seem to have had the most accurate perception of what is really going on around them, not the official version or the popular perception of contemporary life.

author: Alberto Giacometti
title: Artistically I am still a child with a whole life ahead of me to discover and create. I want something, but I won't know what it is until I succeed in doing it.

author: Billy Joel
title: Artists - musicians, painters, writers, poets - always seem to have had the most accurate perception of what is really going on around them, not the official version or the popular perception of contemporary life.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: As a general rule, the most successful man in life is the man who has the best information.

author: Annie Dillard
title: As a life's work, I would remember everything - everything, against loss. I would go through life like a plankton net.

author: Albert Camus
title: As a remedy to life in society I would suggest the big city. Nowadays, it is the only desert within our means.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
title: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: As a wicked man I am a complete failure. Why, there are lots of people who say I have never really done anything wrong in the whole course of my life. Of course they only say it behind my back.

author: Carl Hubbell
title: As far as control and stuff is concerned, I never had any more in my life than for that All-Star game in 1934.

author: Benjamin Bratt
title: As far as I know, you only get one shot at this life. It only goes round once and time is precious. When I'm not working, you'd better spend that time with someone important.

author: Seneca
title: As for old age, embrace and love it. It abounds with pleasure if you know how to use it. The gradually declining years are among the sweetest in a man's life, and I maintain that, even when they have reached the extreme limit, they have their pleasure still.

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
title: As high as mind stands above nature, so high does the state stand above physical life. Man must therefore venerate the state as a secular deity. The march of God in the world, that is what the State is.

author: Candice Millard
title: As I have encountered difficult moments in my own life, I have been privileged to learn from the great men I have come to know as a writer.

author: Artur Davis
title: As I prepare for this next phase in my life, I ask that people continue to offer the prayers that have protected me thus far. I also pray that I will always see those who are not seen and easy to forget in the hustle and bustle of Washington politics.

author: Brad Meltzer
title: As I tell my daughter, when you want something in life - no matter how impossible it seems - you need to fight for it.

author: Bill Maris
title: As life expectancy extends beyond 80 years in some parts of the world, more people are struggling with brain diseases. For older people, Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and other conditions become a major impediment to quality of life.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: As life grows more terrible, its literature grows more terrible.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: As life is action and passion, it is required of a man that he should share the passion and action of his time, at the peril of being not to have lived.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: As life runs on, the road grows strange with faces new - and near the end. The milestones into headstones change, Neath every one a friend.

author: Albert J. Nock
title: As might be supposed, my parents were quite poor, but we somehow never seemed to lack anything we needed, and I never saw a trace of discontent or a failure in cheerfulness over their lot in life, as indeed over anything.

author: Raoul Vaneigem
title: As poverty has been reduced in terms of mere survival, it has become more profound in terms of our way of life.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: As repressed sadists are supposed to become policemen or butchers so those with an irrational fear of life become publishers.

author: Benny Goodman
title: As soon as it was understood that we could handle things in our own way, it was the thrill of my life to walk out on that stage with people just hemming the band in.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: As soon as there is life there is danger.,

author: Stephen Bayley
title: As the twentieth century ends, commerce and culture are coming closer together. The distinction between life and art has been eroded by fifty years of enhanced communications, ever-improving reproduction technologies and increasing wealth.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: As to conforming outwardly, and living your own life inwardly, I have not a very high opinion of that course.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: As to happiness in this life it is hardly compatible with that diminished respect which ever attends the relinquishing of labour.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: As to that leisure evening of life, I must say that I do not want it. I can conceive of no contentment of which toil is not to be the immediate parent.

author: James A. Froude
title: As we advance in life we learn the limits of our abilities.

author: Beth Ditto
title: As with most phobias, the fear of flying does make some sense, but if ever there was a fear worth quashing then this is it. After all, life is short, and there's a great big world to explore out there.

author: Susan Jeffers
title: As you begin to understand the immense power and love you hold inside, you will find an unending surge of joy, light and love that will nourish and support you all the days of your life.

author: Harper Lee
title: As you grow older, you'll see white men cheat black men every day of your life, but let me tell you something and don't you forget it - whenever a white man does that to a black man, no matter who he is, how rich he is, or how fine a family he comes from, that white man is trash.

author: Ben Hogan
title: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.

author: Bill Rancic
title: Ask any successful person to look back over the events of his or her life, and chances are there'll be a turning point of one kind or another. It doesn't matter if that success has come on a ball field or in a boardroom, in a research laboratory or on a campaign trail - it can usually be traced to some pivotal moment.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: At any given moment, life is completely senseless. But viewed over a period, it seems to reveal itself as an organism existing in time, having a purpose, trending in a certain direction.

author: Maya Angelou
title: At fifteen life had taught me undeniably that surrender, in its place, was as honorable as resistance, especially if one had no choice.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: At great periods you have always felt, deep within you, the temptation to commit suicide. You gave yourself to it, breached your own defenses. You were a child. The idea of suicide was a protest against life; by dying, you would escape this longing for death.

author: Toni Morrison
title: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: At some point in my life I'd honestly hoped love would rescue me from the cold, drafty castle I lived in. But at another point, much earlier I think, I'd quietly begun to hope for nothing at all in the way of love, so as not to be disappointed. It works. It gets to be a habit.

author: Barbara Bush
title: At the end of your life, you will never regret not having passed one more test, not winning one more verdict or not closing one more deal. You will regret time not spent with a husband, a friend, a child, or a parent.

author: Cate Campbell
title: At the Olympics, you have almost nothing to lose, but at the Olympic trials, you have everything to lose. You have the last four years of your life to lose.

author: Rose Macaulay
title: At the worst, a house unkept cannot be so distressing as a life unlived.

author: Ben Gibbard
