title: It was really like waking up one morning and going, Wow, I enjoy being with this person more than anybody else in my life, and it just turned out to be mutual.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: It was Vikram Bhatt and 'Raaz' that got me interested in the medium of cinema. Before that, I was like any other youngster dabbling with various things - modelling, films - without a definite direction or focus. Now that I'm working with all of them, life has come full circle for me.

author: Scott O'Grady
title: It wasn't the reward that mattered or the recognition you might harvest. It was your depth of commitment, your quality of service, the product of your devotion - these were the things that counted in a life. When you gave purely, the honor came in the giving, and that was honor enough.

author: Belinda Carlisle
title: It will shock many - I've lived a full life and really enjoyed my time as a pop star.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: It's a funny thing about life: if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.

author: Barbara Mandrell
title: It's an exciting life. I don't know where God is leading us. I just know that He opens doors and He closes the doors, and it is always the best for us.

author: Anne Baxter
title: It's best to have failure happen early in life. It wakes up the Phoenix bird in you so you rise from the ashes.

author: Aristotle
title: It's best to rise from life like a banquet, neither thirsty or drunken.

author: Sister Elizabeth Kenny
title: It's better to be a lion for a day, than a sheep all your life.

author: Yoko Ono
title: It's better to dance than to march through life.

author: Freeman Dyson
title: It's better to get mugged than to live a life of fear.

author: Silas Weir Mitchell
title: It's easier traveling the road of life when I don't have so much to carry on my back.

author: Jim Rohn
title: It's easy to let life deteriorate into making a living instead of making a life. It's not the hours you put in, but what you out into the hours that count. Learn to express rather than impress. Expressing evokes a ''me too'' attitude while impressing evokes a ''so what'' attitude.

author: Bethany Hamilton
title: It's easy to look at the things of this world to solve our challenges and obstacles in life, but when we submit our lives to Christ, His grace, mercy, peace and love will bring true fulfillment to our lives.

author: Bianca Kajlich
title: It's easy when you've had difficulty or strife in your life to look at other people who seem like they've had it easier. But the thing we forget is that it is all relative, and each person's experience is uniquely their own, so that the worst thing they may be going through is truly the worst thing for them... it's just about having compassion.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: It's extraordinary how we go through life with eyes half shut, with dull ears, with dormant thoughts. Perhaps it's just as well; and it may be that it is this very dullness that makes life to the incalculable majority so supportable and so welcome.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title:
It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.,
,

author: Bruce Forsyth
title: It's frightening, the way life speeds up. When you're at school, time can't go fast enough.

author: Ben Whishaw
title: It's fun to pretend you're good at something you know you wouldn't be good at in real life.

author: Jack Lemmon
title: It's hard enough to write a good drama, it's much harder to write a good comedy, and it's hardest of all to write a drama with comedy. Which is what life is.

author: Ann Beattie
title: It's interesting, though, that in daily life, I think of myself as being relatively unobservant.

author: Adam Grant
title: It's ironic that when you go through a tragedy, you appreciate more. You realize how fragile life is and that there are so many things to still be thankful for.,

author: Brian Austin Green
title: It's just a fact of life. Everybody grows up and goes through changes, and our audience has seen it all.

author: Alan Alda
title: It's not an epitaph. I felt I could look back at my life and get a good story out of it. It's a picture of somebody trying to figure things out. I'm not trying to create some impression about myself. That doesn't interest me.

author: Candice Bergen
title: It's not just in Hollywood that women run the risk of being passed by once they reach 50. It happens in real life, too.

author: Bernhard Langer
title: It's not life or death it's a game and at the end of the game there is going to be a winner and a loser.

author: Mae West
title: It's not the men in my life that counts, it's the life in my men.

author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
title: It's not true that life is one damn thing after another; it's one damn thing over and over.

author: Millard Fuller
title: It's not your blue blood, your pedigree or your college degree. It's what you do with your life that counts.

author: Andy Rooney
title: It's paradoxical, that the idea of living a long life appeals to everyone, but the idea of getting old doesn't appeal to anyone.

author: Max Frisch
title: It's precisely the disappointing stories, which have no proper ending and therefore no proper meaning, that sound true to life.

author: Alan Alda
title: It's really clear to me that you can't hang onto something longer than its time. Ideas lose certain freshness, ideas have a shelf life, and sometimes they have to be replaced by other ideas.

author: Beth Riesgraf
title: It's so weird, not knowing what your life is going to be. I'm being optimistic. And when 'Leverage' comes to an end, I have lots of ideas for other things. You can't really sit and wait for things to come to you.

author: Agnetha Faltskog
title: It's strange that the newspapers don't see a connection between their false revelations about my private life and my need for seclusion and security.

author: Sidney J. Harris
title: It's surprising how many persons go through life without ever recognizing that their feelings toward other people are largely determined by their feelings toward themselves, and if you're not comfortable within yourself, you can't be comfortable with others.

author: Bill Bailey
title: It's the augmented fourth, or diminished fifth, depending on your outlook on life...

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: It's the decomposition that gets me. You spend your whole life looking after your body. And then you rot away.

author: Brenda Blethyn
title: It's the same as any role and I find that you can't lump characters together; because they all have different life experiences, different reasons for being the way they are.

author: Bjorn Borg
title: It's tough when you're No. 1. You don't have any private life, you can't even walk anywhere. I think that was one reason why I lost my motivation to play tennis.

author: Alex Trebek
title: It's very important in life to know when to shut up. You should not be afraid of silence.

author: Barry Gibb
title: It's very questionable, and we will pursue every factor, every element, every second of the timeline, of the final hours of Maurice's life. We will pursue that relentlessly. That will be our quest from now on.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: It's your unlimited power to care and to love that can make the biggest difference in the quality of your life.

author: Billy Dee Williams
title: Jazz is very much a part of my life. I work with the Thelonious Monk Institute and do the artwork for their program every year.

author: Bill Allred
title: Jesus is a place-kicker and he's gonna kick you through the goal-posts of life.

author: Mikhail Gorbachev
title: Jesus was the first socialist, the first to seek a better life for mankind.

author: Barbara Ward
title: Jews were the first to believe that history itself has meaning and that progress, not repetition, is the law of life.

author: Buddy Wakefield
title: Jordan tattoos the words forgive me in thick black letters down the inside of his arm so that when he looks at his wrist he will remember not to hate himself so much. What he keeps forgetting is that there is life after survival.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Journalism is popular, but it is popular mainly as fiction. Life is one world, and life seen in the newspapers another.

author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
title: Journalism is popular, but it is popular mainly as fiction. Life is one world, and life seen in the newspapers is another.,

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Joy can be real only if people look on their life as a service, and have a definite object in life outside themselves and their personal happiness.

author: Rollo May
title: Joy, rather than happiness, is the goal of life, for joy is the emotion which accompanies our fulfilling our natures as human beings. It is based on the experience of one's identity as a being of worth and dignity.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Judgments, value judgments concerning life, for or against, can in the last resort never be true: they possess value only as symptoms, they come into consideration only as symptoms - in themselves such judgments are stupidities.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
title: Jupiter, not wanting man's life to be wholly gloomy and grim, has bestowed far more passion than reason - you could reckon the ration as twenty-four to one. Moreover, he confined reason to a cramped corner of the head and left all the rest of the body to the passions.

author: Buddha
title: Just as a candle cannot burn without fire, men cannot live without a spiritual life.

author: Leonardo Da Vinci
title: Just as courage imperils life; fear protects it.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Just as in earthly life lovers long for the moment when they are able to breathe forth their love for each other, to let their souls blend in a soft whisper, so the mystic longs for the moment when in prayer he can, as it were, creep into God.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: Just as Mars - a desert planet - gives us insights into global climate change on Earth, the promise awaits for bringing back to life portions of the Red Planet through the application of Earth Science to its similar chemistry, possibly reawakening its life-bearing potential.

author: Regis McKenna
title: Just as one year in a dog's life is equivalent to seven years in a human life, one year in the high-technology business is like seven years in any other industry.

author: Vaclav Havel
title: Just as the constant increase of entropy is the basic law of the universe, so it is the basic law of life to be ever more highly structured and to struggle against entropy.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Just as the wave cannot exist for itself, but is ever a part of the heaving surface of the ocean, so must I never live my life for itself, but always in the experience which is going on around me.

author: Buddha
title: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.

author: Benny Green
title: Just to have that sense of family, it gives you something that you know you need to take care of for the rest of your life. People gave it to him, and he passed it on to us.

author: Hugh Prather
title: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes and I am left the same. The more things change the more I am the same. I am what I started with, and when it is all over I will be all that is left of me.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.,

author: John McCain
title: Keep moving if you love life, and keep your troubles well behind you.

author: Emanuel Swedenborg
title: Kindness is an inner desire that makes us want to do good things even if we do not get anything in return. It is the joy of our life to do them. When we do good things from this inner desire, there is kindness in everything we think, say, want and do.

author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
title: Kindness, I've discovered, is everything in life.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: King Louis Philippe once said to me that he attributed the great success of the British nation in political life to their talking politics after dinner.

author: William James
title: Knowledge about life is one thing; effective occupation of a place in life, with its dynamic currents passing through your being, is another.

author: Bhagat Singh
title: L. Ram Saran Das was sentenced to death in 1915, and the sentence was later commuted to life transportation. Today myself, sitting in the condemned cell, I can let the readers know as authoritatively that the life-imprisonment is comparatively a far harder lot than that of death.

author: Bill Shorten
title: Labor should not be about creating monuments on hills or statues in parks. Labor's monuments and statues are when a young person can find a job, when a person with disability can get access to the ordinary life that others take for granted.

author: John Ruskin
title: Labour may be shortly divided into positive and negative labour: positive, that which produces life; negative, that which produces death.

author: Allen Klein
title: Laughter, and the broader category of humor, are key elements in helping us go on with our life after a loss.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Lawyers know life practically. A bookish man should always have them to converse with.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: Lead the life that will make you kindly and friendly to everyone about you, and you will be surprised what a happy life you will lead.

author: Bill Owens
title: Leadership offers an opportunity to make a difference in someone's life, no matter what the project.

author: Earl Nightingale
title: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don't wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it's at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.

author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
title: Learn to get in touch with silence within yourself, and know that everything in this life has purpose. There are no mistakes, no coincidences, all events are blessings given to us to learn from.

author: Bethany Hamilton
title: Learning how to deal with people and their reactions to my life is one of the most challenging things... people staring at me, people asking rude questions, dealing with media, stuff like that.

author: Robert Byrne
title: Learning to dislike children at an early age saves a lot of expense and aggravation later in life.

author: Carol Shields
title: Learning to skip has brought control into her life. Whenever she feels all sad, she switches into this wholly happy gait, sliding, hopping, and sliding again; when doing this, it seems as though her head separates from her body, making her feel dizzy and emptied out of bad thoughts. Does anyone else know this trick, she wonders? Probably not, although her Mother sometimes smiles and waves from the window.

author: Andre Breton
title: Leave everything. Leave Dada. Leave your wife. Leave your mistress. Leave your hopes and fears. Leave your children in the woods. Leave the substance for the shadow. Leave your easy life, leave what you are given for the future. Set off on the roads.

author: Adrienne Rich
title: Lesbian existence comprises both the breaking of a taboo and the rejection of a compulsory way of life. It is also a direct or indirect attack on the male right of access to women.

author: Edward Young
title: Less base the fear of death than fear of life.

author: William M. Thackeray
title: Let a man who has to make his fortune in life remember this maxim: Attacking is the only secret. Dare and the world yields, or if it beats you sometimes, dare it again and you will succeed.

author: John Ruskin
title: Let every dawn of the morning be to you as the beginning of life. And let every setting of the sun be to you as its close. Then let everyone of these short lives leave its sure record of some kindly thing done for others; some good strength of knowledge gained for yourself.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Let everyone try and find that as a result of daily prayer he adds something new to his life, something with which nothing can be compared.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: Let life happen to you. Believe me: life is in the right, always.

author: Basil of Caesarea
title: Let sleep itself be an exercise in piety, for such as our life and conduct have been, so also of necessity will be our dreams.

author: Horace Mann
title: Let the public mind become corrupt, and all efforts to secure property, liberty, or life by the force of laws written on paper will be as vain as putting up a sign in an apple orchard to exclude canker worms.

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Let the refining and improving of your own life keep you so busy that you have little time to criticize others.

author: Bruce Nordstrom
title: Let there be no mistake: John W. Nordstrom was no retail expert. But throughout his life, he did what he had to do - hopefully we all have that in us.

author: John Milton
title: Let those who would write heroic poems make their life an heroic poem.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.

author: Francois René de Chateaubriand
title: Let us not disdain glory too much; nothing is finer, except virtue. The height of happiness would be to unite both in this life.

author: Voltaire
title: Let us work without theorizing, 'Tis the only way to make life endurable.

author: Buddha
title: Let yourself be open and life will be easier. A spoon of salt in a glass of water makes the water undrinkable. A spoon of salt in a lake is almost unnoticed.

author: Greg Anderson
title: Let's face it. In most of life we really are interdependent. We need each other. Staunch independence is an illusion, but heavy dependence isn't healthy, either. The only position of long-term strength is interdependence: win/win.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Let's not unman each otherpart at once; All farewells should be sudden, when forever, Else they make an eternity of moments, And clog the last sad sands of life with tears.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Liberty is the breath of life to nations.

author: V. S. Pritchett
title: Life - how curious is that habit that makes us think it is not here, but elsewhere.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: Life - No, I've nothing to teach you about it for the moment. May be writing about it another week.

author: C. Everett Koop
title: Life affords no greater responsibility, no greater privilege, than raising of the next generation.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Life affords no higher pleasure than that of surmounting difficulties, passing from one step of success to another, forming new wishes and seeing them gratified.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Life and language are alike sacred. Homicide and verbicide - that is, violent treatment of a word with fatal results to its legitimate meaning, which is its life - are alike forbidden.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: Life and love are life and love, a bunch of violets is a bunch of violets, and to drag in the idea of a point is to ruin everything. Live and let live, love and let love, flower and fade, and follow the natural curve, which flows on, pointless.

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs.

author: Morarji Desai
title: Life at any time can become difficult: life at any time can become easy. It all depends upon how one adjusts oneself to life.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life at its noblest leaves mere happiness far behind; and indeed cannot endure it. Happiness is not the object of life: life has no object: it is an end in itself; and courage consists in the readiness to sacrifice happiness for an intenser quality of life.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Life at the greatest and best is but a froward child, that must be humored and coaxed a little till it falls asleep, and then all the care is over.

author: Stella Adler
title: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.

author: Sarah Bernhardt
title: Life begets life. Energy creates energy. It is by spending oneself that one becomes rich.

author: William Feather
title: Life begins at 40 - but so do fallen arches, rheumatism, faulty eyesight, and the tendency to tell a story to the same person, three or four times.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: Life begins on the other side of despair.

author: Marcelene Cox
title: Life begins when a person first realizes how soon it will end.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.

author: Viktor E. Frankl
title: Life can be pulled by goals just as surely as it can be pushed by drives.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forward.

author: Edna Ferber
title: Life cannot defeat a writer who is in love with writing; for life itself is a writer's love until death.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Life cannot subsist in society but by reciprocal concessions.

author: Joan Didion
title: Life changes fast. Life changes in the instant. You sit down to dinner and life as you know it ends.

author: Rollo May
title: Life comes from physical survival; but the good life comes from what we care about.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day.,

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Life consists in what a person is thinking of all day.

author: Josh Billings
title: Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well.

author: Socrates
title: Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your heart's desire; the other is to get it.

author: Charlie Chaplin
title:
Life could be wonderful if people would leave you alone.,
,

author: Anton Chekhov
title: Life does not agree with philosophy: There is no happiness that is not idleness, and only what is useless is pleasurable.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh.

author: Mark Twain
title: Life does not consist mainly, or even largely, of facts and happenings. It consists mainly of the storm of thought that is forever flowing through one's head.

author: Woody Allen
title: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.,

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Life doesn't require that we be the best, only that we try our best.,

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Life doesn't require that we be the best, only that we try our best.

author: Alfred Rosenberg
title: Life drew me and I followed it.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Life every man holds dear; but the dear man holds honor far more precious dear than life.

author: Doug Larson
title: Life expectancy would grow by leaps and bounds if green vegetables smelled as good as bacon.

author: George Harrison
title: Life flows on within you and without you.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Life for both sexes is arduous, difficult, a perpetual struggle. More than anything... it calls for confidence in oneself...And how can we generate this imponderable quality most quickly? By thinking that other people are inferior to oneself.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: Life for delays and doubts no time does give, None ever yet made haste enough to live.

author: Horace
title: Life gives nothing to man without labor.

author: Philip Larkin
title: Life has a practice of living you, if you don't live it.

author: Carl Jung
title: Life has always seemed to me like a plant that lives on its rhizome. Its true life is invisible, hidden in the rhizome. The part that appears above ground lasts only a single summer. What we see is the blossom, which passes. The rhizome remains.

author: Georges Bataille
title: Life has always taken place in a tumult without apparent cohesion, but it only finds its grandeur and its reality in ecstasy and in ecstatic love.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Life has been compared to a race, but the allusion improves by observing, that the most swift are usually the least manageable and the most likely to stray from the course. Great abilities have always been less serviceable to the possessors than moderate ones.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Life has been your art. You have set yourself to music. Your days are your sonnets.

author: Barbara Bush
title: Life has changed enormously, and I hope - I hope more people read good things.

author: Woody Guthrie
title: Life has got a habit of not standing hitched. You got to ride it like you find it. You got to change with it. If a day goes by that don't change some of your old notions for new ones, that is just about like trying to milk a dead cow.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Life has its own hidden forces which you can only discover by living.

author: Alan Cohen
title: Life has meaning only if you do what is meaningful to you.

author: Euripides
title: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.

author: Paul Gauguin
title: Life has no meaning unless one lives it with a will, at least to the limit of one's will. Virtue, good, evil are nothing but words, unless one takes them apart in order to build something with them; they do not win their true meaning until one knows how to apply them.

author: Albert J. Nock
title: Life has obliged him to remember so much useful knowledge that he has lost not only his history, but his whole original cargo of useless knowledge; history, languages, literatures, the higher mathematics, or what you will - are all gone.

author: Bernard Berenson
title: Life has taught me that it is not for our faults that we are disliked and even hated, but for our qualities.

author: Alexander Herzen
title: Life has taught me to think, but thinking has not taught me to live.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
title: Life has taught us that love does not consist in gazing at each other but in looking outward in the same direction.

author: Carolyn Heilbrun
title: Life has this in common with prizefighting: if you've received a belly blow, it's likely to be followed by a right to the jaw.

author: Henry Miller
title: Life has to be given a meaning because of the obvious fact that it has no meaning.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Life in abundance comes only through great love.

author: Billy Boyd
title: Life in LA is not lying in the sun for months. It is having a 4pm meeting and leaving at noon to sit in traffic for four hours. It's not glam.

author: Margaret Mead
title: Life in the twentieth century is like a parachute jump; you have to get it right the first time.

author: Brad Stone
title: Life inside successful Web startups - especially the really successful ones - can be nasty, brutish, and short. As companies grow exponentially, egos clash, investors jockey for control, and business complexities rapidly exceed the managerial abilities of the founders.

author: Irving Berlin
title: Life is 10 percent what you make it and 90 percent how you take it.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
title: Life is a battle between faith and reason in which each feeds upon the other, drawing sustenance from it and destroying it.

author: Don Piatt
title: Life is a campaign not a battle, and has its defeats as well as its victories.

author: Robert Thibodeau
title: Life is a classroom in which each of us is being tested, tried, and passed.

author: Horace Walpole
title: Life is a comedy for those who think... and a tragedy for those who feel.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title:
Life is a constant oscillation between the sharp horns of dilemmas.,
,

author: Saul Alinsky
title: Life is a corrupting process from the time a child learns to play his mother off against his father in the politics of when to go to bed; he who fears corruption fears life.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title:
Life is a dead-end street.,
,
,
,

author: Abdul Kalam
title: Life is a difficult game. You can win it only by retaining your birthright to be a person. And to retain this right, you will have to be willing to take the social or external risks involved in ignoring pressures to do things the way others say they should be done.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life is a disease; and the only difference between on man and another is the stage of the disease at which he lives.,

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Life is a festival only to the wise.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life is a first draft... with no rewrite.

author: Victor Hugo
title: Life is a flower of which love is the honey.

author: Christopher Morley
title: Life is a foreign language: all men mispronounce it.

author: Tom Stoppard
title: Life is a gamble at terrible odds, if it were a bet, you would not take it.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.

author: Tony Robbins
title: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back.,

author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
title: Life is a gift, given in trust - like a child.

author: William Adams Brown
title: Life is a glass given to us to fill; a busy life is filling it with as much as it can hold; a hurried life has had more poured into it than it can contain.

author: Rose Macaulay
title: Life is a great and noble game between the citizen and the government.

author: Danny Kaye
title: Life is a great big canvas; throw all the paint you can at it.

author: Vladimir Nabokov
title: Life is a great surprise. I don't see why death should not be an even greater one.

author: Jean Cocteau
title: Life is a horizontal fall.

author: Bette Davis
title: Life is a jest; and all things show it. I thought so once; but now I know it.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Life is a journey that must be traveled no matter how bad the roads and accommodations.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Life is a little gleam of time between two eternity s.

author: Sir James Matthew Barrie
title: Life is a long lesson in humility.

author: William Butler Yeats
title: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.,

author: William B. Yeats
title: Life is a long preparation for something that never happens.

author: Robert Stone
title: Life is a means of extracting fiction.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Life is a miracle, and we need to not fear trying to achieve our potential and reveal the remarkable creation we and all living things are and that our Creator has built into us the ability to induce self-healing.

author: Truman Capote
title: Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: Life is a petty thing unless it is moved by the indomitable urge to extend its boundaries. Only in proportion as we are desirous of living more do we really live.

author: Anais Nin
title: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.

author: Anne Wilson Schaef
title: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Life is a progress from want to want, not from enjoyment to enjoyment.

author: George Moore
title: Life is a rose that withers in the iron fist of dogma.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Life is a scene and we are the actors

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: Life is a series of collisions with the future; it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be.

author: Matthew McConaughey
title:
Life is a series of commas, not periods.,
,
,

author: Lao-Tzu
title: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.

author: Ralph Ransom
title: Life is a series of steps. Things are done gradually. Once in a while there is a giant step, but most of the time we are taking small, seemingly insignificant steps on the stairway of life.

author: Eugene O'Neill
title: Life is a solitary cell whose walls are mirrors.

author: John Burroughs
title: Life is a struggle, but not a warfare.

author: Ernest Dimnet
title: Life is a succession of lessons enforced by immediate reward, or, oftener, by immediate chastisement.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.

author: Wilson Mizner
title: Life is a tough proposition and the first hundred years are the hardest.

author: Charlie Chaplin
title: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.

author: Khaled Hosseini
title: Life is a train, get on board.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Life is a warfare and a stranger's sojourn, and after fame is oblivion.

author: John Tyndall
title: Life is a wave, which in no two consecutive moments of its existence is composed of the same particles.

author: Anthony Burgess
title: Life is a wretched gray Saturday, but it has to be lived through.

author: Peter de Vries
title: Life is a zoo in a jungle.

author: Gilda Radner
title: Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next. Delicious ambiguity.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Life is action and passion; therefore, it is required of a man that he should share the passion and action of the time, at peril of being judged not to have lived.

author: Tennessee Williams
title: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.

author: Russell Wayne Baker
title: Life is always walking up to us and saying, ''Come on in, the living's find,'' and what do we do? Back off and take its picture.

author: Edward Blishen
title: Life is amazing: and the teacher had better prepare himself to be a medium for that amazement.

author: Norman Cousins
title: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Life is an end in itself, and the only question as to whether it is worth living is whether you have had enough of it.

author: Helen Keller
title: Life is an exciting business and most exciting when it is lived for others.

author: Ashleigh Brilliant
title: Life is an incurable condition: the only known treatment is to try to keep the patient comfortable.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: Life is an incurable disease.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: Life is an offensive, directed against the repetitious mechanism of the Universe.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: Life is an operation which is done in a forward direction. One lives toward the future, because to live consists inexorably in doing, in each individual life making itself.

author: Dave Barry
title: Life is anything that dies when you stomp on it.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Life is as tedious as a twice-told tale, vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man.

author: Alice Walker
title: Life is better than death, I believe, if only because it is less boring, and because it has fresh peaches in it.

author: Cormac McCarthy
title: Life is brief and to have to spend every day of it doing what somebody else wants you to do is not the way to live it.

author: Robert H. Schuller
title: Life is but a moment, death also is but another.

author: Criss Angel
title: Life is but a series of memories you make.

author: Henry Miller
title: Life is constantly providing us with new funds, new resources, even when we are reduced to immobility. In life's ledger there is no such thing as frozen assets.

author: Woody Allen
title: Life is divided into the horrible and the miserable.,

author: Woody Allen
title: Life is divided up into the horrible and the miserable.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
title: Life is doubt, and faith without doubt is nothing but death.

author: Kathleen Norris
title: Life is easier to take than you think; all that is necessary is to accept the impossible, do without the indispensable and bear the intolerable.

author: Bill Walton
title: Life is easy when you're hot. But what happens when the ball bounces the other way? You just keep getting back up and climbing up.

author: Helen Keller
title: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.

author: Helen Keller
title: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.

author: Billy West
title: Life is for the living. I was a little scared before surgery 'cause of the release you sign that says there's always a very small percent chance that you'll die during the operation.

author: Eileen Caddy
title: Life is full and overflowing with the new. But it is necessary to empty out the old to make room for the new to enter.

author: Woody Allen
title: Life is full of misery, loneliness, and suffering - and it's all over much too soon.,

author: Alan Bennett
title: Life is generally something that happens elsewhere.

author: Thornton T. Munger
title: Life is given for wisdom, and yet we are not wise; for goodness, and we are not good; for overcoming evil, and evil remains; for patience and sympathy and love, and yet we are fretful and hard and weak and selfish. We are keyed not to attainment, but to the struggle toward it.

author: Doug Horton
title: Life is good when we think it's good. Life is bad when we don't think.

author: Carolina Herrera
title: Life is hard. It is not too short, it is too long. But you have to learn how to live; you have to have a sense of humour.

author: Paul Gauguin
title: Life is hardly more than a fraction of a second. Such a little time to prepare oneself for eternity!

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Life is indeed darkness save when there is urge, and all urge is blind save when there is knowledge, and all knowledge is vain save when there is work, and all work is empty save when there is love.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: Life is infinitely stranger than anything which the mind of man could invent.

author: Denis Waitley
title: Life is inherently risky. There is only one big risk you should avoid at all costs, and that is the risk of doing nothing.

author: Bob Fosse
title: Life is just a bowl of cherries, don't take it serious, its mysterious. Life is just a bowl of cherries, so live and laugh and laugh at love, love a laugh, laugh and love.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: Life is just a journey

author: Philip Roth
title: Life is just a short period of time in which you are alive.

author: Antony Sher
title: Life is just more comfortable if you're honest and open about everything. I spent so many years being in the closet about one thing or another.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Life is just one damned thing after another.

author: Horace
title: Life is largely a matter of expectation.

author: Benjamin Clementine
title: Life is life. You have to learn how to forgive people and how to gain forgiveness for yourself.

author: Mario Puzo
title: Life is like a box of hand grenades, you never know what will blow you to kingdom come.

author: Alan Bennett
title: Life is like a box of sardines and we are all looking for the key.,

author: Fulton John Sheen
title: Life is like a cash register, in that every account, every thought, every deed, like every sale, is registered and recorded.

author: Lewis Grizzard
title: Life is like a dogsled team. If you ain't the lead dog, the scenery never changes.

author: Jawaharlal Nehru
title: Life is like a game of cards. The hand that is dealt you represents determinism; the way you play it is free will.

author: Nick Mirov
title: Life is like a movie - since there aren't any commercial breaks, you have to get up and go to the bathroom in the middle of it.

author: Tom Lehrer
title: Life is like a piano. What you get out of it depends on how you play it.

author: Bret Easton Ellis
title: Life is like a typographical error: we're constantly writing and rewriting things over each other.

author: Stephen King
title: Life is like a wheel. Sooner or later, it always come around to where you started again.,

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Life is like an onion. You peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Life is like playing a violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Life is like playing the violin solo in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving .

author: Claude D. Pepper
title: Life is like riding a bicycle. You don't fall off unless you stop peddling.

author: Lou Reed
title: Life is like Sanskrit read to a pony.

author: Charles Dickens
title: Life is made of ever so many partings welded together.

author: Trinidad Hunt
title: Life is made of millions of moments, but we live only one of these moments at a time. As we begin to change this moment, we begin to change our lives.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: Life is made up of marble and mud.

author: Sir Humphrey Davy
title: Life is made up, not of great sacrifices or duties, but of little things, in which smiles and kindness, and small obligations given habitually, are what preserve the heart and secure comfort.

author: Anthony J. D'Angelo
title: Life is meant to be enjoyed, not endured.

author: Gordon B. Hinckley
title: Life is meant to be enjoyed, not just endured.,

author: George Eliot
title: Life is measured by the rapidity of change, the succession of influences that modify the being.

author: Abraham Cahan
title: Life is much shorter than I imagined it to be.

author: Louisa May Alcott
title: Life is my college. May I graduate well, and earn some honors.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.

author: Wayne Dyer
title: Life is never boring, but some people choose to be bored.

author: Bruce Lee
title: Life is never stagnation. It is constant movement, unrhythmic movement, as we as constant change. Things live by moving and gain strength as they go.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life is no brief candle to me. It is a sort of splendid torch which I have got a hold of for the moment, and I want to make it burn as brightly as possible before handing it on to future generations.

author: Jack London
title: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but sometimes, playing a poor hand well.

author: Imelda Marcos
title: Life is not a matter of place, things or comfort; rather, it concerns the basic human rights of family, country, justice and human dignity.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Life is not a series of gig lamps symmetrically arranged; life is a luminous halo, a semi-transparent envelope surrounding us from the beginning of consciousness to the end.

author: George Santayana
title: Life is not a spectacle or a feast; it is a predicament.

author: Denis Waitley
title: Life is not accountable to us. We are accountable to life.

author: Jennie Jerome Churchill
title: Life is not always not always what one wants it to be., but to make the best of it as it is the only way of being happy.

author: Leon Trotsky
title: Life is not an easy matter. You cannot live through it without falling into frustration and cynicism unless you have before you a great idea which raises you above personal misery, above weakness, above all kinds of perfidy and baseness.

author: Bill Gates
title: Life is not divided into semesters. You don't get summers off and very few employers are interested in helping you find yourself.

author: Ogden Nash
title: Life is not having been told that the man has just waxed the floor.

author: Stephen Vincent Benét
title: Life is not lost by dying; life is lost minute by minute, day by dragging day, in all the thousand small uncaring ways.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life is not meant to be easy, my child; but take courage: it can be delightful.

author: Anna Quindlen
title: Life is not so much about beginnings and endings as it is about going on and on and on. It is about muddling through the middle.

author: David Gemmell
title: Life is nothing unless death has been faced down.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Life is nothing without friendship.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
title: Life is obstinate and clings closest where it is most hated.

author: Bob Marley
title: Life is one big road with lots of signs. So when you riding through the ruts, don't complicate your mind. Flee from hate, mischief and jealousy. Don't bury your thoughts, put your vision to reality. Wake Up and Live!

author: Ronald Reagan
title: Life is one grand, sweet song, so start the music.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Life is one long process of getting tired.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Life is our dictionary.,

author: Cesare Pavese
title: Life is pain and the enjoyment of love is an anesthetic.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Life is painting a picture, not doing a sum.

author: Isaac Asimov
title: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.,

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Life is real! Life is earnest! And death is not its goal. Dust thou art, to dust returneth, was not spoken of the soul.

author: James Redfield
title: Life is really about a spiritual unfolding that is personal and enchanting - an unfolding that no science or philosophy or religion has yet fully clarified.

author: Confucius
title: Life is really simple, but men insist on making it complicated.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: Life is seldom as unendurable as, to judge by the facts, it logically ought to be.

author: John Irving
title: Life is serious but art is fun!

author: Ben Harper
title: Life is short and if you're looking for extension, you had best do well. 'Cause there's good deeds and then there's good intentions. They are as far apart as Heaven and Hell.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Life is short and information endless: nobody has time for everything.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.

author: Josh Billings
title: Life is short, but it's long enough to ruin any man who wants to be ruined.

author: Hippocrates
title: Life is short, the art long, opportunity fleeting, experiment treacherous, judgment difficult.

author: Nikita Khrushchev
title: Life is short; live it up.

author: Yann Martel
title: Life is so beautiful that death has fallen in love with it, a jealous, possessive love that grabs at what it can. But life leaps over oblivion lightly, losing only a thing or two of no importance.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: Life is so unlike theory.

author: Fran Lebowitz
title: Life is something to do when you can't get to sleep.

author: Frank Dane
title: Life is strange. Every so often a good man wins.

author: Bern Williams
title: Life is supposed to be a series of peaks and valleys. The secret is to keep the valleys from becoming Grand Canyons.

author: Lou Holtz
title: Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.

author: William Hazlitt
title: Life is the art of being well deceived.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Life is the art of drawing sufficient conclusions from insufficient premises.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Life is the childhood of our immortality.

author: Herbert Spencer
title: Life is the continuous adjustment of internal relations to external relations.

author: Edward Young
title: Life is the desert, life the solitude, death joins us to the great majority.

author: Arthur Rimbaud
title: Life is the farce which everyone has to perform.

author: Victor Hugo
title: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: Life is the jailer, death the angel sent to draw the unwilling bolts and set us free.

author: Denis Waitley
title: Life is the movie you see through your own eyes. It makes little difference what's happening out there. It's how you take it that counts.

author: Lewis Mumford
title: Life is the only art that we are required to practice without preparation, and without being allowed the preliminary trials, the failures and botches, that are essential for training.

author: Ashleigh Brilliant
title: Life is the only game in which the object of the game is to learn the rules.

author: Sydney Smith
title: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.

author: Katharine Hepburn
title: Life is to be lived. If you have to support yourself, you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting. And you don't do that by sitting around.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: Life is to entered upon with courage.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Life is too important to be taken seriously.

author: Barbara Jordan
title: Life is too large to hang out a sign: "For Men Only.

author: George Eliot
title: Life is too precious to be spent in this weaving and unweaving of false impressions, and it is better to live quietly under some degree of misrepresentation than to attempt to remove it by the uncertain process of letter-writing.

author: Mike Leonard
title: Life is too serious to be taken seriously.

author: Mary Wortley Montagu
title: Life is too short for a long story.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: Life is too short to be little. Man is never so manly as when he feels deeply, acts boldly, and expresses himself with frankness and with fervor.

author: R. Porson
title: Life is too short to learn German.

author: James Joyce
title: Life is too short to read a bad book.

author: Vivien Leigh
title: Life is too short to work so hard.,

author: John Wayne
title: Life is tough, but it's tougher if you're stupid.,

author: James Baldwin
title: Life is tragic simply because the earth turns and the sun inexorably rises and sets, and one day, for each of us, the sun will go down for the last, last time.

author: Ryszard Kapuscinski
title: Life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity and stumble from defeat to defeat.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: Life is uncharted territory. It reveals its story one moment at a time.

author: Audre Lorde
title: Life is very short and what we have to do must be done in the now.

author: Douglas Adams
title: Life is wasted on the living.

author: John Lennon
title: Life is what happens to you, while you're busy making other plans.

author: Abel Ferrara
title: Life is what happens when you're doing other things, right?

author: John Lennon
title: Life is what happens while you're busy making other plans.

author: Grandma Moses
title: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.

author: Al Hirschfeld
title: Life isn't a science. We make it up as we go.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Life isn't like a book. Life isn't logical or sensible or orderly. Life is a mess most of the time. And theology must be lived in the midst of that mess.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Life isn't long enough for love and art.

author: Richard Nixon
title: Life isn't meant to be easy. It's hard to take being on the top - or on the bottom. I guess I'm something of a fatalist. You have to have a sense of history, I think, to survive some of these things. Life is one crisis after another.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself

author: Jorge Luis Borges
title: Life itself is a quotation.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: Life itself is short, but lasts longer than misfortunes.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: Life leaps like a geyser for those who drill through the rock of inertia.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life levels all men. Death reveals the eminent.

author: C. Neil Strait
title: Life lived amidst tension and busyness needs leisure. Leisure that recreates and renews. Leisure should be a time to think new thoughts, not ponder old ills.

author: Bruce Lee
title: Life lives; and in the living flow, no questions are raised. The reason is that life is a living now! So, in order to live life whole-heartedly, the answer is life simply is.

author: Maya Angelou
title: Life loves the liver of it.

author: Maya Angelou
title: Life loves to be taken by the lapel and told: ''I'm with you kid. Let's go.''

author: Joy Baluch
title: Life marches by, I suggest you get on with it.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Life may change, but it may fly not; Hope may vanish, but can die not; Truth be veiled, but still it burneth; Love repulsed,  but it returneth.

author: Sir John Robert Seeley
title: Life may not be beautiful, but it is interesting.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Life must be filled up, and the man who is not capable of intellectual pleasures must content himself with such as his senses can afford.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: Life must be lived and curiosity kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Life must be lived forward, but can only be understood backwards.

author: Anna Julia Cooper
title: Life must be something more than dilettante speculation.

author: Katherine Mansfield
title: Life never becomes a habit to me. It's always a marvel.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life on board a pleasure steamer violates every moral and physical condition of healthy life except fresh air. It is a guzzling, lounging, gambling, dog's life. The only alternative to excitement is irritability.

author: Bruce Dickinson
title: Life on the road can get a little one-dimensional. I didn't want to reach 40 and have to say all I'd done was look out the window of a tour bus and get drunk.

author: Dag Hammarskjöld
title: Life only demands from you the strength that you possess. Only one feat is possible; not to run away.

author: Aberjhani
title: Life possesses an amazing array of profoundly sad faces.

author: Jane Austen
title: Life seems but a quick succession of busy nothings.

author: Rose Tremain
title: Life should be embraced like a lover.

author: Anais Nin
title: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.

author: Carl Friedrich Gauss
title: Life stands before me like an eternal spring with new and brilliant clothes.

author: Balthazar Getty
title: Life started getting good when I started making money.

author: Les Brown
title: Life takes on meaning when you become motivated, set goals and charge after them in an unstoppable manner.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Life too near paralyses art.

author: Quentin Crisp
title: Life was a funny thing that happened to me on the way to the grave.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that. And living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on Earth.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Life will not bear refinement. You must do as other people do.

author: John Ruskin
title: Life without industr is guilt, and industry without art is brute lity.

author: John Ruskin
title: Life without industry is guilt. Industry without Art is Brutality.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Life would be a perpetual flea hunt if a man were obliged to run down all the innuendoes, inveracities, and insinuations and misrepresentations which are uttered against him.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Life would be dull without them.

author: Mark Twain
title: Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Life would be tolerable but for its amusements.

author: Stephen Hawking
title: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.

author: Dag Hammarskjöld
title: Life yields only to the conqueror. Never accept what can be gained by giving in. You will be living off stolen goods, and your muscles will atrophy.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Life! Life! Don't let us go to life for our fulfillment or our experience. It is a thing narrowed by circumstances, incoherent in its utterance, and without that fine correspondence of form and spirit which is the only thing that can satisfy the artistic

author: Marsha Sinetar
title: Life's up and downs provide windows of opportunity to determine your values and goals. Think of using all obstacles as stepping stones to build the life you want.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Life, an age to the miserable, and a moment to the happy.

author: Henry Miller
title: Life, as it is called, is for most of us one long postponement.

author: Jonathan Raban
title: Life, as the most ancient of all metaphors insists, is a journey; and the travel book, in its deceptive simulation of the journey's fits and starts, rehearses life's own fragmentation. More even than the novel, it embraces the contingency of things.

author: Fred A. Allen
title: Life, in my estimation, is a biological misadventure that we terminate on the shoulders of six strange men whose only objective is to make a hole in one with you.

author: Alan Dundes
title: Life, it seems, is nothing if not a series of initiations, transitions, and incorporations.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Life, Lady Stutfield, is simply a mauvais quart d'heure made up of exquisite moments.

author: Stephen B. Leacock
title: Life, we learn too late, is in the living, the tissue of every day and hour.

author: Dwight L. Moody
title: light for every darkness, life in death, the promise of our Lord's return, and the assurance of everlasting glory.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Like a French poem is life; being only perfect in structure when with the masculine rhymes mingled the feminine are.

author: Jean Paul
title: Like a morning dream, life becomes more and more bright the longer we live, and the reason of everything appears more clear. What has puzzled us before seems less mysterious, and the crooked paths look straighter as we approach the end.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: Like actors and writers who are on and off again in terms of employment, I had a very unstructured life.

author: Pearl S. Buck
title: Like Confucius of old, I am so absorbed in the wonder of the earth and the life upon it, that I  cannot think of heaven and the angels.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: Like hatred, jealousy is forbidden by the laws of life because it is essentially destructive.

author: Bill Burr
title: Like most comics, I tried to come up with a sitcom idea that was based around my life. And it didn't work out. But maybe because it didn't work out, that's why I ended up on 'Breaking Bad;' I don't know.

author: Lord George Byron
title:
Like the measles, love is most dangerous when it comes late in life.,
,

author: Walter Benjamin
title: Like ultraviolet rays memory shows to each man in the book of life a script that invisibly and prophetically glosses the text.

author: James Dillet Freeman
title: Listen to life, and you will hear the voice of life crying, Be!

author: Buddy Guy
title: Listen to the lyrics - we're singing about everyday life: rich people trying to keep money, poor people tying to get it, and everyone having trouble with their husband or wife!

author: C. S. Lewis
title: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides; and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Literature always anticipates life. It does not copy it, but moulds it to its purpose. The nineteenth century, as we know it, is largely an invention of Balzac.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: Literature is a defense against the attacks of life. It says to life: ''You can't deceive me. I know your habits, foresee and enjoy watching all your reactions, and steal your secret by involving you in cunning obstructions that halt your normal flow.''

author: Antonio Tabucchi
title: Literature is my life of course, but from an ontological point of view. From an existential point of view, I like being a teacher.

author: Carlos Fuentes
title: Literature overtakes history, for literature gives you more than one life. It expands experience and opens new opportunities to readers.

author: Henry James
title: Live all you can; it's a mistake not to. It doesn't so much matter what you do in particular, so long as you have your life. If you haven't had that what have you had?

author: Eileen Caddy
title: Live and work but do not forget to play, to have fun in life and really enjoy it.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Live not as though there were a thousand years ahead of you. Fate is at your elbow; make yourself good while life and power are still yours.

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: Live your life and forget your age.

author: Immanuel Kant
title: Live your life as though your every act were to become a universal law.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Live your life, do your work, then take your hat.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Live! Live the wonderful life that is in you! Let nothing be lost upon you. Be always searching for new sensations. Be afraid of nothing.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: Living creatures are nourished by food, and food is nourished by rain; rain itself is the water of life, which comes from selfless worship and service.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Living is death; dying is life. We are not what we appear to be. On this side of the grave we are exiles, on that citizens; on this side orphans, on that children;

author: Omar Khayyam
title: Living Life Tomorrow's fate, though thou be wise, Thou canst not tell nor yet surmise; Pass, therefore, not today in vain, For it will never come again.

author: Ben Gibbard
title: Living this life in the same sorta way that Kerouac lived, you get to hang out at shows and drink and you're able to not really face reality and adulthood the way most of my friends are.

author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine
title: Living, just by itself - what a dirge that is! Life is a classroom and Boredom's the usher, there all the time to spy on you; whatever happens, you've got to look as if you were awfully busy all the time doing something that's terribly exciting - or he'll come along and nibble your brain.

author: Barrett Foa
title: LL Cool J is a huge presence. He is a music mogul. He brings that experience and that life into the room.

author: George Burns
title: Look to the future, because that is where you'll spend the rest of your life.

author: Lauren Bacall
title: Looking at yourself in a mirror isn't exactly a study of life.

author: Albert Claude
title: Looking back 25 years later, what I may say is that the facts have been far better than the dreams. In the long course of cell life on this earth it remained, for our age for our generation, to receive the full ownership of our inheritance.

author: John Steinbeck
title: Lord, how the day passes! It is like a life, so quickly when we don't watch it, and so slowly if we do.

author: Hilaire Belloc
title: Loss and possession, Death and life are one. There falls no shadow where There shines no sun.

author: B. H. Liddell Hart
title: Loss of hope rather than loss of life is what decides the issues of war. But helplessness induces hopelessness.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Love and peace of mind do protect us. They allow us to overcome the problems that life hands us. They teach us to survive... to live now... to have the courage to confront each day.

author: Truman Capote
title: Love is a chain of love as nature is a chain of life.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Love is a simple thing and a deep thing: it is an act of life and not an illusion. Art is an illusion.

author: Ralph Waldo Trine
title: Love is everything. It is the key to life, and its influences are those that move the world.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Love is life. All, everything that I understand, I understand only because I love. Everything is, everything exists, only because I love. Everything is united by it alone. Love is God, and to die means that I, a particle of love, shall return to the general and eternal source.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.

author: Thomas Merton
title: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.

author: Judith Rossner
title: Love is the direct opposite of hate. By definition it's something you can't feel for more than a few minutes at a time, so what's all this bullshit about loving somebody for the rest of your life?

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: Love is the flower of life, and blossoms unexpectedly and without law, and must be plucked where it is found, and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.

author: Smiley Blanton
title: Love is the immortal flow of energy that nourishes, extends and preserves. Its eternal goal is life.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Love is the river of life in the world.

author: Arthur Rubenstein
title: Love life and life will love you back. Love people and they will love you back.

author: Lady Blessington
title: Love matches are made by people who are content, for a month of honey, to condemn themselves to a life of vinegar.

author: Guy de Maupassant
title: Love means the body, the soul, the life, the entire being. We feel love as we feel the warmth of our blood, we breathe love as we breathe air, we hold it in ourselves as we hold our thoughts. Nothing more exists for us.

author: Douglas William Jerrold
title: Love's like the measles; all the worse when it comes late in life.

author: David Seabury
title: Love... Force it and it disappears. You cannot will love, nor even control it. You can only guide its expression. It comes or it goes according to those qualities in life that invite it or deny its presence.

author: Maxwell Maltz
title: Low self-esteem is like driving through life with your hand-break on.

author: Alfred Hitchcock
title: Luck is everything... My good luck in life was to be a really frightened person. I'm fortunate to be a coward, to have a low threshold of fear, because a hero couldn't make a good suspense film.

author: Brendon Urie
title: Luckily, my wife is amazing. She's one of the few people in my life I'm completely honest with. I've told her everything about my past. She knows me inside and out. There's no secrets at all.

author: Savinien Cyrano de Bergerac
title: Luckless is the country in which the symbols of procreation are the objects of shame, while the agents of destruction are honored! And yet you call that member your pudendum, or shameful part, as if there were anything more glorious than creating life, or anything more atrocious than taking it away.

author: Marquis de Sade
title: Lust is to the other passions what the nervous fluid is to life; it supports them all, lends strength to them all ambition, cruelty, avarice, revenge, are all founded on lust.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Lying is not only excusable; it is not only innocent; it is, above all, necessary and unavoidable. Without the ameliorations that it offers, life would become a mere syllogism and hence too metallic to be borne.

author: Carl Lewis
title: M so fortunate to have done what I love to do for so long, but the day I retired was one of the best days of my life. Not because I was happy to get away from the sport, but because it was clear in my mind that I had done all I possibly could, and that it was time to go.

author: Sydney Smith
title: Madam, I have been looking for a person who disliked gravy all my life; let us swear eternal friendship.

author: Frances Cornford
title: Magnificently unprepared for the long littleness of life.

author: Peace Pilgrim
title: Make food a very incidental part of your life by filling your life so full of meaningful things that you'll hardly have time to think about food.

author: Arnold H. Glasgow
title: Make your life a mission - not an intermission.

author: Federico Fellini
title: Making movies is my vacation. All the rest - the traveling about to premiers, the social life, the endless arguments with producers who don't understand me - that is the work.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: Man arrives as a novice at each age of his life.

author: William James
title: Man can alter his life by altering his thinking.,

author: Aristotle
title: Man is a goal seeking animal. His life only has meaning if he is reaching out and striving for his goals.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Man is an amphibian who lives simultaneously in two worlds-the given and the home-made, the world of matter, life and consciousness and the world of symbols.

author: Cat Stevens
title: Man is created to be God's deputy on earth and it is important to realize the obligation to rid ourselves of all illusions and to make our lives a preparation for the next life.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: Man is eminently a storyteller. His search for a purpose, a cause, an ideal, a mission and the like is largely a search for a plot and a pattern in the development of his life story - a story that is basically without meaning or pattern.

author: Karl Wilhelm Von Humboldt
title: Man is more disposed to domination than freedom; and a structure of dominion not only gladdens the eye of the master who rears and protects it, but even its servants are uplifted by the thought that they are members of a whole, which rises high above the life and strength of single generations.

author: Menander of Athens
title: Man must be prepared for every event of life, for there is nothing that is durable.

author: Antoine Rivarol
title: Man spends his life in reasoning on the past, in complaining of the present, in fearing future.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: Man staggers through life yapped at by his reason, pulled and shoved by his appetites, whispered to by fears, beckoned by hopes. Small wonder that what he craves most is self-forgetting.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Man's life is a warfare against the malice of men.

author: Bishop Joseph Henshaw
title: Man's life is like unto a winter's day, Some break their fast and so depart away, Others stay dinner then depart full fed; The longest age but sups and goes to bed. Oh, reader, then behold and see, As we are now so must you be.

author: Eugene O'Neill
title: Man's loneliness is but his fear of life.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Man's love is of man's life a part; it is a woman's whole existence. In her first passion, a woman loves her lover, in all the others all she loves is love.

author: Erich Fromm
title: Man's main task in life is to give birth to himself, to become what he potentially is. The most important product of his effort is his own personality.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: Man's real life is happy, chiefly because he is ever expecting that it soon will be so.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication.

author: Maurice Maeterlinck
title: Many a happiness in life, as many a disaster, can be due to chance, but the peace within us can never be governed by chance.

author: Bruce Barton
title: Many a man who pays rent all his life owns his own home; and many a family has successfully saved for a home only to find itself at last with nothing but a house.

author: Ben Bernanke
title: Many foreclosed homes are neglected or abandoned, as legal proceedings or other factors delay their resale. Deteriorating or vacant properties can, in turn, directly affect the quality of life in a neighborhood, for example, by leading to increases in vandalism or crime.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: Many of us go through life feeling as an actor might feel who does not like his part, and does not believe in the play.

author: George Halas
title: Many people flounder about in life because they do not have a purpose, an objective toward which to work.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Many times a day I realize how much my own life is built on the labors of my fellowmen, and how earnestly I must exert myself in order to give in return as much as I have received.

author: Bob Newhart
title: Mark Twain gave us an insight into the life on the Mississippi at the turn of the century.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: Marriage is a school itself. Also, having children. Becoming a father changed my whole life. It taught me as if by revelation.,

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Marriage is like life - it is a field of battle, not a bed of roses.

author: Sir Pelham Grenville Wodehouse
title: Marriage isn't a process of prolonging the life of love, but of mummifying the corpse.

author: Jane Harrison
title: Marriage, for a woman at least, hampers the two things that made life to me glorious - friendship and learning.

author: Al Goldstein
title: Married life is an existence with bars around it.

author: Richard Ford
title: Married life requires shared mystery even when all the facts are known.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: Martin Luther King dedicated his life to love and to justice between fellow human beings. ,

author: Wayne Dyer
title: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.

author: David Gemmell
title: May all your dreams but one come true, for what is life without a dream?

author: May Sarton
title: May we agree that private life is irrelevant? Multiple, mixed, ambiguous at best - out of it we try to fashion the crystal clear, the singular, the absolute, and that is what is relevant; that is what matters.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: May you live all the days of your life.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: May you live every day of your life.

author: Caroline Dhavernas
title: Maybe because she doesn't try so hard to seduce and impress, I guess that's why some guys fell for her. Because she's so different and crazy and we all like a little bit of that in our life.

author: Bill Vaughan
title: Maybe the answer to Selective Service is to start everyone off in the army and draft them for civilian life as needed.

author: David Mitchell
title: Maybe the meaning of life lies in looking for it.

author: Paracelsus
title: Medicine is not only a science; it is also an art. It does not consist of compounding pills and plasters; it deals with the very processes of life, which must be understood before they may be guided.

author: Brendon Burchard
title: Meditation is a lifelong process. Give it a try. As you get deeper and more disciplined into the process, you'll get deeper and more disciplined in your mind and life.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Meditation is a silent heart, a peaceful mind which can make life more lovable, more livable....

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Meditation is nothing but coming to terms with your inner emptiness: recognizing it, not escaping; living through it, not escaping; being through it, not escaping. Then suddenly the emptiness becomes the fullness of life.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Meditation is the antidote to all the poisons of your life. It is the nourishment of your authentic nature.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Meditation is the breath of your soul. Just as breathing is the life of the body, meditation is the life of the soul.

author: Francis Quarles
title: Meditation is the life of the soul: Action, the soul of meditation. and honor the reward of action.

author: Günther Grass
title: Melancholy has ceased to be an individual phenomenon, an exception. It has become the class privilege of the wage earner, a mass state of mind that finds its cause wherever life is governed by production quotas.

author: André Maurois
title: Memory is a great artist. For every man and for every woman it makes the recollection of his or her life a work of art and an unfaithful record.

author: André Maurois
title: Memory is a great artist. For every man and for every woman it makes the recollection of his or her life a work of art and an unfaithful record.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Men are run ragged by female sexuality all their lives. From the beginning of his life to the end, no man ever fully commands any woman. It's an illusion. Men are pussy-whipped. And they know it. That's what the strip clubs are about; not woman as victim, not woman as slave, but woman as goddess.

author: George Orwell
title: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness

author: Aristotle
title: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.

author: Gabriel Heatter
title: Mere longevity is a good thing for those who watch Life from the side lines. For those who play the game, an hour may be a year, a single day's work an achievement for eternity.

author: Sidney J. Harris
title: Middle Age is that perplexing time of life when we hear two voices calling us, one saying, ''Why not?'' and the other, ''Why bother?''

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Millions of people miss meditation because meditation has taken on a wrong connotation. It looks very serious, looks gloomy, has something of the church in it, looks as if it is only for people who are dead, or almost dead, who are gloomy, serious, have long faces, who have lost festivity, fun, playfulness, celebration.... A really meditative person is playful: life is fun for him.... He enjoys it tremendously. He is not serious. He is relaxed.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Miracles, in the sense of phenomena we cannot explain, surround us on every hand: life itself is the miracle of miracles.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Mirth is the sweet wine of human life. It should be offered sparkling with zestful life unto God.

author: Epicurus
title: Misfortune seldom intrudes upon the wise man; his greatest and highest interests are directed by reason throughout the course of life.

author: Nikki Giovanni
title: Mistakes are a fact of life it is the response to error that counts.

author: Al Franken
title: Mistakes are a part of being human. Appreciate your mistakes for what they are: precious life lessons that can only be learned the hard way. Unless it's a fatal mistake, which, at least, others can learn from.

author: Sophia Loren
title: Mistakes are part of the dues one pays for a full life.

author: Brit Marling
title: Modern life has gotten so strange, we all get 150 emails and text messages a day, and it's hard when things are moving that quickly to keep that sense of wonder about being alive.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Money and time are the heaviest burdens of life, and the unhappiest of all mortals are those who have more of either than they know how to use.

author: Richard M. DeVos
