author: John Updike
title: Rain is grace; rain is the sky condescending to the earth; without rain, there would be no life.

author: Benny Green
title: Ray had so much love of life and the music. He had so much integrity. He treated the music with so much dignity and respect. I spent four and a half years as a sideman with Ray Brown's trio. Music was his life, more so than anyone I could mention.

author: George Holbrook Jackson
title: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: Read no history: nothing but biography, for that is life without theory.

author: Mortimer J. Adler
title: Reading is a basic tool in the living of a good life.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Reading, solitude, idleness, a soft and sedentary life, intercourse with women and young people, these are perilous paths for a young man, and these lead him constantly into danger.

author: Beau Willimon
title: Real leaders have to live a paradoxical life, where they must break the rules in order to maintain them. If your expectations are high, you're setting yourself up for disillusionment. The land of governance is paved with gray streets, not black or white ones.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Real life is, to most men, a long second-best, a perpetual compromise between the ideal and the possible; but the world of pure reason ;knows no compromise, no practical limitations, no barrier to the creative activity.

author: Barbara Boxer
title: Really, life is complicated enough without having a bunch of Senators deciding what we should do in the privacy of our own homes.

author: Aleksandr Solzjenitsyn
title: Religion always remains higher than everyday life. In order to make the elevation towards religion easier for people, religion must be able to alter its forms in relation to the consciousness of modern man.

author: John Updike
title: Religion enables us to ignore nothingness and get on with the jobs of life.

author: Umberto Eco
title: Religion has nothing to do with God. It's a fundamental attitude of human beings, who ask about the origins of life and what happens after death. For many, the answer is a personal god. In my opinion, it's religion that produces God, not the other way round.

author: Alan W. Watts
title: Religion is not a department of life; it is something that enters into the whole of it.

author: Paul Tillich

title: Surely a long life must be somewhat tedious, since we are forced to call in so many trifling things to help rid us of our time, which will never return.

title: That winter two things happened which made me see that the world, the flesh, and the devil were going to be more powerful influences in my life after all than the chapel bell. First, I tasted champagne, second, the theatre.

author: Anderson Cooper
title: That's the thing about suicide. Try as you might to remember how a person lived his life, you always end up thinking about how he ended it.

author: Carolyn Chute
title: That's the way we see life: your community is your survival. And if you live in a small community like this, even the people you hate you have as friends.

author: Barbara Mandrell
title: That's what I loved about show business, no two days were alike. It's an exciting life.

author: Doris Lessing
title: That's what learning is. You suddenly understand something you understood all your life, but in a new way.

author: Bruce Barton
title: The ablest men in all walks of modern life are men of faith. Most of them have much more faith than they themselves realize.

author: Jean Cocteau
title: The actual tragedies of life bear no relation to one's preconceived ideas. In the event, one is always bewildered by their simplicity, their grandeur of design, and by that element of the bizarre which seems inherent in them.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: The agent never receipts his bill, puts his hat on and bows himself out. He stays around forever, not only for as long as you can write anything that anyone will buy, but as long as anyone will buy any portion of any right to anything that you ever did write. He just takes ten per cent of your life.

author: Edmund White
title: The AIDS epidemic has rolled back a big rotting log and revealed all the squirming life underneath it, since it involves, all at once, the main themes of our existence: sex, death, power, money, love, hate, disease and panic. No American phenomenon has been so compelling since the Vietnam War.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The aim of life is appreciation; there is no sense in not appreciating things; and there is no sense in having more of them if you have less appreciation of them.

author: Henry Miller
title: The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: The aim of the college, for the individual student, is to eliminate the need in his life for the college; the task is to help him become a self-educating man.

author: Robert Browning
title: The aim, if reached or not, makes great the life: try to be Shakespeare, leave the rest to fate!

author: Primo Levi
title: The aims of life are the best defense against death.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The American father is never seen in London. He passes his life entirely in Wall Street and communicates with his family once a month by means of a telegram in cipher.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The American lives even more for his goals, for the future, than the European. Life for him is always becoming, never being.

author: C. L. R. James
title: The antagonisms between men and women express themselves in the most delicate phase of their life together - in their sexual relationship.

author: Bruce Lee
title: The aphorism as a man thinketh in his heart so is he contains the secret of life.

author: Wyndham Lewis
title: The art of advertisement, after the American manner, has introduced into all our life such a lavish use of superlatives, that no standard of value whatever is intact.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: The art of life is not controlling what happens to us, but using what happens to us.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: The art of life is the art of avoiding pain; and he is the best pilot, who steers clearest of the rocks and shoals with which it is beset.

author: Paul Klee
title: The art of mastering life is the prerequisite for all further forms of expression, whether they are paintings, sculptures, tragedies, or musical compositions.

author: W. Edward Brown
title: The artist has one function - to affirm and glorify life.

author: Henry Miller
title: The artist is the opposite of the politically minded individual, the opposite of the reformer, the opposite of the idealist. The artist does not tinker with the universe; he recreates it out of his own experience and understanding of life.

author: Anatole France
title: The average man does not know what to do with this life, yet wants another one which will last forever.

author: Calvin Trillin
title: The average trade book has a shelf life of between milk and yogurt, except for books by any member of the Irving Wallace family - they have preservatives.

author: Buzz Osborne
title: The band that changed my life was The Who. It's hard to pick just one album, but if I had to pick the one that really showed me how things could be done, it's 'The Who Sell Out.' They really went to town on that, doing something that no one had ever done before.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: The battle of life is, in most cases, fought uphill; and to win it without a struggle were perhaps to win it without honor. If there were no difficulties there would be no success; if there were nothing to struggle for, there would be nothing to be achieved.

author: George Harrison
title: The Beatles exist apart from my Self. I am not really Beatle George. Beatle George is like a suit or shirt that I once wore on occasion and until the end of my life people may see that shirt and mistake it for me.

author: George Eliot
title: The beginning of compunction is the beginning of a new life.

author: William James
title: The best argument I know for an immortal life is the existence of a man who deserves one.

author: Bob Moawad
title: The best day of your life is the one on which you decide your life is your own. No apologies or excuses. No one to lean on, rely on, or blame. The gift is yours - it is an amazing journey - and you alone are responsible for the quality of it. This is the day your life really begins.

author: Carl Lewis
title: The best kids are going to become the best. But the best thing about it is that you're going to learn lessons in playing those sports about winning and losing and teamwork and teammates and arguments and everything else that are going to affect you positively for the rest of your life.

author: Barbara Corcoran
title: The best mistake I ever made was believing that I was stupid. It was a childhood thing, but it played out big-time as an adult. It scorned me the rest of my life - in a good way.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: The best part of married life is the fights. The rests is merely so.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: The best path through life is the highway.

author: William Wordsworth
title: The best portion of a good man's life, his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.

author: Jeremy Taylor
title: The best theology is rather a divine life than a divine knowledge.

author: John Ruskin
title: The best thing in life aren't things.

author: Dorothy Day
title: The best thing to do with the best things in life is to give them up.

author: Art Buchwald
title: The best things in life aren't things.

author: Albert Ellis
title: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.,

author: Malcolm S. Forbes
title: The biggest mistake people make in life is not trying to make a living at doing what they most enjoy.

author: Garry Kasparov
title: The biggest problem I see among people who want to excel in chess – and in business and in life in general – is not trusting their instincts enough.

author: Bobby Orr
title: The biggest thing we get out of it is seeing the kids smile. And hopefully we will also see that the lessons we're teaching - not only the fundamentals of hockey, but also the life values - are sinking in.

author: Carol Gilligan
title: The blind willingness to sacrifice people to truth, however, has always been the danger of an ethics abstracted from life.

author: Richard Bach
title: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life.

author: Philip Roth
title: The book really comes to life in the rewriting.

author: Norman Douglas
title: The business of life is to enjoy oneself; everything else is a mockery.

author: Archibald Macleish
title: The business of the law is to make sense of the confusion of what we call human life - to reduce it to order but at the same time to give it possibility, scope, even dignity.

author: Barbara Demick
title: The cadence of life is slower in North Korea.

author: Hermann Hesse
title: The call of death is a call of love. Death can be sweet if we answer it in the affirmative, if we accept it as one of the great eternal forms of life and transformation.

author: Norman Cousins
title: The capacity for hope is the most significant fact of life. It provides human beings with a sense of destination and the energy to get started.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: The care of human life and happiness and not their destruction is the only legitimate object of good government.

author: Carl Van Vechten
title: The cat seldom interferes with other people's rights. His intelligence keeps him from doing many of the fool things that complicate life.

author: Albert Claude
title: The cell, over the billions of years of her life, has covered the earth many times with her substance, found ways to control herself and her environment, and insure her survival.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: The changes in our life must come from the impossibility to live otherwise than according to the demands of our conscience not from our mental resolution to try a new form of life.

author: Billy Crudup
title: The characters that I'm typically drawn to are sensitive men who are experiencing some sense of identity crisis or growth in their life that they don't know how to overcome.

author: Wes Smith
title: The chief beneficiary of life insurance policies for young, single people is the life insurance agent.

author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon
title: The chief condition on which, life, health and vigor depend on, is action. It is by action that an organism develops its faculties, increases its energy, and attains the fulfillment of its destiny.

author: Alfred Adler
title: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.

author: Robert Frost
title: The chief reason for going to school is to get the impression fixed for life that there is a book side for everything.

author: Wayne Dyer
title: The child in you, like all children, loves to laugh, to be around people who can laugh at themselves and life. Children instinctively know that the more laughter we have in our lives, the better.,

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: The child is naturally meditative. He is a sort of samadhi; he's coming out of the womb of existence. His life river is yet absolutely fresh, just from the source. He knows the truth, but he does not know that he knows.... His knowledge is not yet aware. It is innocent. It is simply there, as a matter of fact. And he is not separate from his knowledge; he is his knowledge. He has not mind, he has simple being.

author: Billy Graham
title: The Christian life is not a constant high. I have my moments of deep discouragement. I have to go to God in prayer with tears in my eyes, and say, 'O God, forgive me,' or 'Help me.'

author: Jean-Luc Godard
title: The cinema is not an art which films life: the cinema is something between art and life. Unlike painting and literature, the cinema both gives to life and takes from it, and I try to render this concept in my films. Literature and painting both exist as art from the very start; the cinema doesn't.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The cinema, like the detective story, makes it possible to experience without danger all the excitement, passion and desirousness which must be repressed in a humanitarian ordering of life.

author: Rabbi Harold S. Kushner
title: The circumstances of your life have uniquely qualified you to make a contribution. And if you don't make that contribution, nobody else can make it.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: The civilized are those who get more out of life than the uncivilized, and for this we are not likely to be forgiven.

author: Benjamin Tucker
title: The claim of the State Socialists, however, that this right would not be exercised in matters pertaining to the individual in the more intimate and private relations of his life is not borne out by the history of governments.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: The clearest way to show what the rule of law means to us in everyday life is to recall what has happened when there is no rule of law.

author: Barney Frank
title: The Clinton tax increase - which was an increase in taxes primarily on upper-income people - not only made the tax code more nearly progressive, it preceded one of the most productive economic periods in American life.

author: Earl Rochester
title: The clog of all pleasure, the luggage of life, is the best can be said for a very good wife.

author: Arthur Miller
title: The closer a man approaches tragedy the more intense is his concentration of emotion upon the fixed point of his commitment, which is to say the closer he approaches what in life we call fanaticism.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The closing years of life are like the end of a masquerade party, when the masks are dropped.

author: Joyce Meyer
title: The conscience can be a strong guide in life if we allow it.,

author: Campbell Brown
title: The consequences of substandard teaching go far beyond whether college or a good job is in reach. They affect earning potential, with implications throughout a person's life.

author: Walter Benjamin
title: The construction of life is at present in the power of facts far more than convictions.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The cost of a thing is the amount of what I will call life which is required to be exchanged for it, immediately or in the long run.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of the final moment; but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: The course of my long life hath reached at last in fragile bark over a tempestuous sea the common harbor, where must rendered be account for all the actions of the past.

author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin
title: The creed of a true saint is to make the best of life, and to make the most of it.

author: Bruce Sutter
title: The Cubs gave me a chance to play. They signed me as a free agent and brought me to the Major Leagues. The first day I walked into Wrigley Field was one of the best days of my life. And I owe them an awful lot.

author: Lydia Maria Child
title: The cure for all ills and wrongs, the cares, the sorrows and the crimes of humanity, all lie in the one word 'love.' It is the divine vitality that everywhere produces and restores life.

author: Lydia M. Child
title: The cure for all the ills and wrongs, the cares, the sorrows, and the crimes of humanity, all lie in that one word ''Love.'' It is the divine vitality that everywhere produces and restores life.

author: Horace Greeley
title: The darkest day of any man's life is when he sits down to plan how to get money without earning it.

author: John Maynard Keynes
title: The day is not far off when the economic problem will take the back seat where it belongs, and the arena of the heart and the head will be occupied or reoccupied, by our real problems - the problems of life and of human relations, of creation and behavior and religion.

author: Abraham Cahan
title: The dearest days in one's life are those that seem very far and very near at once.

author: Annie Dillard
title: The dedicated life is worth living. You must give with your whole heart.

author: Alice Munro
title: The deep, personal material of the latter half of your life is your children. You can write about your parents when they're gone, but your children are still going to be here, and you're going to want them to come and visit you in the nursing home.

author: Billy Corgan
title: The deeper I get into my life as a musician, I'm discovering that it becomes less and less about other people, and more about what I want to do. And that's a good place to be.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: The deepest definition of youth is life as yet untouched by tragedy.

author: Emma Goldman
title: The demand for equal rights in every vocation of life is just and fair; but, after all, the most vital right is the right to love and be loved.

author: James Joyce
title: The demand that I make of my reader is that he should devote his whole Life to reading my works.

author: Leon Trotsky
title: The depth and strength of a human character are defined by its moral reserves. People reveal themselves completely only when they are thrown out of the customary conditions of their life, for only then do they have to fall back on their reserves.

author: Walter Benjamin
title: The destructive character lives from the feeling, not that life is worth living, but that suicide is not worth the trouble.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The devil has put a penalty on all things we enjoy in life. Either we suffer in health or we suffer in soul or we get fat.

author: Ajay Devgan
title: The difference being that in films, unlike in life, good does always win over evil in the end.

author: Bruce Dern
title: The difference between my generation of actors and their generation is that they were bigger than life. We are not bigger than life.

author: Tom Bodett
title: The difference between school and life? In school, you're taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you're given a test that teaches you a lesson.

author: George Moore
title: The difficulty in life is the choice.

author: Arthur Keith
title: The discovery of agriculture was the first big step toward a civilized life.

author: Archibald Macleish
title: The dissenter is every human being at those moments of his life when he resigns momentarily from the herd and thinks for himself.

author: Minna Antrim
title: The drama of life begins with a wail and ends with a sigh.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The early Christian rules of life were not made to last, because the early Christians did not believe that the world itself was going to last.

author: Carl Sagan
title: The Earth is the only world known so far to harbor life. There is nowhere else, at least in the near future, to which our species could migrate. Visit, yes. Settle, not yet. Like it or not, for the moment the Earth is where we make our stand.

author: Beau Willimon
title: The economics of being a playwright are abysmal. I like to think of the work I do out in Hollywood as a way to actually make a life in the theater easier.

author: Steven Weinberg
title: The effort to understand the universe is one of the very few things that lifts human life a little above the level of farce, and gives it some of the grace of tragedy.

author: Socrates
title: The end of life is to be like God, and the soul following God will be like Him.

author: Chauncey Depew
title: The enjoyment of life would be instantly gone if you removed the possibility of doing something.

author: Pliny the Elder
title: The enjoyments of this life are not equal to its evils.

author: Denis Waitley
title: The essence of life is finding something you really love and then making the daily experience worthwhile.

author: Georges Bataille
title: The essence of morality is a questioning about morality; and the decisive move of human life is to use ceaselessly all light to look for the origin of the opposition between good and evil.

author: Karl Kraus
title: The esthete stands in the same relation to beauty as the pornographer stands to love, and the politician stands to life.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: The European style of living is seductive: fewer hours worked, more hours at the cafe, less concern over self-betterment. But that style of living does not produce a purposeful life.

author: Joseph A. Schumpeter
title: The evolution of the capitalist style of life could be easily - and perhaps most tellingly - described in terms of the genesis of the modern Lounge Suit.

author: Confucius
title: The expectations of life depend upon diligence; the mechanic that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: The experience gathered from books, though often valuable, is but the nature of learning; whereas the experience gained from actual life is one of the nature of wisdom.

author: Anita Hill
title: The experience of testifying and the aftermath have changed my life.

author: E. M. Cioran
title: The fact that life has no meaning is a reason to live - moreover, the only one.

author: Joan Didion
title: The fancy that extraterrestrial life is by definition of a higher order than our own is one that soothes all children, and many writers.

author: Kabbalah
title: The Father is the Giver of Life; but the Mother is the Giver of Death, because her womb is the gate of ingress to matter, and through her life is ensouled to form, and no form can be either infinite or eternal. Death is implicit in birth.

author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr
title: The feeling about a soldier is, when all is said and done, he wasn't really going to do very much with his life anyway. The example usually is: ''he wasn't going to compose Beethoven's Fifth.''

author: Beeban Kidron
title: The film that changed my life is a 1951 film by Vittorio De Sica, 'Miracle in Milan.' It's a remarkable comment on slums, poverty and aspiration.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The first duty of life is to be as artificial as possible. What the second duty is no one as yet discovered.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The first forty years of life give us the text; the next thirty supply the commentary on it.

author: Mark Twain
title: The first half of life consists of the capacity to enjoy without the chance; the last half consists of the chance without the capacity.

author: Clarence Darrow
title: The first half of our life is ruined by our parents and the second half by our children.

author: Ken Blanchard
title: The first principle of ethical power is Purpose. By purpose, I don't mean your objective or intention-something toward which you are always striving. Purpose is something bigger. It is the picture you have of yourself-the kind of person you want to be or the kind of life you want to lead.

author: Pablo Casals
title: The first thing to do in life is to do with purpose what one purposes to do.

author: Margaret Oliphant
title: The first thing which I can record concerning myself is, that I was born. These are wonderful words. This life, to which neither time nor eternity can bring diminution - this everlasting living soul, began. My mind loses itself in these depths.

author: Carl Hiaasen
title: The Florida in my novels is not as seedy as the real Florida. It's hard to stay ahead of the curve. Every time I write a scene that I think is the sickest thing I have ever dreamed up, it is surpassed by something that happens in real life.

author: Jean Giraudoux
title: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is the example of the eternal seductiveness of life.

author: George Santayana
title: The fly that prefers sweetness to a long life may drown in honey.

author: Helen Rowland
title: The follies which a man regrets the most in his life are those which he didn't commit when he had the opportunity.

author: Asa Gray
title: The former conviction that these two kingdoms were wholly different in structure, in function, and in kind of life, was not seriously disturbed by the difficulties which the naturalist encountered when he undertook to define them.

author: Art Linkletter
title: The four stages of life are infancy, childhood, adolescence, and obsolescence.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: The free way of life proposes ends, but it does not prescribe means.

author: Julie Burchill
title: The freedom that women were supposed to have found in the Sixties largely boiled down to easy contraception and abortion; things to make life easier for men, in fact.

author: Bernard Montgomery
title: The frightful casualties appalled me. The so-called good fighting generals of the war appeared to me to be those who had a complete disregard for human life. There were of course exceptions and I suppose one was Plumer; I had only once seen him and I had never spoken to him.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The full value of this life can only be got by fighting; the violent take it by storm. And if we have accepted everything we have missed something - war. This life of ours is a very enjoyable fight, but a very miserable truce.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The further the spiritual evolution of mankind advances, the more certain it seems to me that the path to genuine religiosity does not lie through the fear of life, and the fear of death, and blind faith, but through striving after rational knowledge.

author: Ogden Nash
title: The further through life I drift the more obvious it becomes that I am lacking in thrift.

author: Michael Jordan
title: The game is my life. It demands loyalty and responsibility, and it gives me back fulfillment and peace.

author: Florence Scovel Shinn
title: The game of life is a game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later with astounding accuracy.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: The genuine artist is never ''true to life.'' He sees what is real, but not as we are normally aware of it. We do not go storming through life like actors in a play. Art is never real life.

author: George Borrow
title: The Germans are the most philosophic people in the world, and the greatest smokers: now I trace their philosophy to their smoking. Smoking has a sedative effect upon the nerves, and enables a man to bear the sorrows of this life (of which every one has his share) not only decently, but dignifiedly.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The goal in life is to discover that you’ve always been where you were supposed to be.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time.

author: Carol P. Christ
title: The Goddess of Old Europe and Ancient Crete represented the unity of life in nature, delight in the diversity of form, the powers of birth, death and regeneration.

author: F. L. Lucan
title: The gods conceal from men the happiness of death, that they may endure life.

author: George Eliot
title: The golden moments in the stream of life rush past us, and we see nothing but sand; the angels come to visit us, and we only know them when they are gone.

author: Carl Rogers
title: The good life is a process, not a state of being. It is a direction not a destination.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.,

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The good life, as I conceive it, is a happy life. I do not mean that if you are good you will be happy; I mean that if you are happy you will be good.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: The good parts of a book may be only something a writer is lucky enough to overhear or it may be the wreck of his whole damn life - and one is as good as the other.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The great advantage of a hotel is that it is a refuge from home life.

author: Lord George Byron
title: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.

author: John Morley
title: The great business of life is to be, to do, to do without and to depart.

author: Voltaire
title: The great consolation in life is to say what one thinks.

author: Carl Jung
title: The great decisions of human life usually have far more to do with the instincts and other mysterious unconscious factors than with conscious will and well-meaning reasonableness. The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no universal recipe for living. Each of us carries his own life-form within him-an irrational form which no other can outbid.

author: Thomas Henry Huxley
title: The great end of life is not knowledge but action.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The great events of life often leave one unmoved; they pass out of consciousness, and, when one thinks of them, become unreal. Even the scarlet flowers of passion seem to grow in the same meadow as the poppies of oblivion.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: The great majority of us are required to live a life of constant duplicity. Your health is bound to be affected if, day after day, you say the opposite of what you feel, if you grovel before what you dislike, and rejoice at what brings you nothing but misfortune. Our nervous system isn't just a fiction, it's a part of our physical body, and our soul exists in space, and is inside us, like the teeth in our mouth. It can't be forever violated with impunity.

author: Kate Millet
title: The great mass of women throughout history have been confined to the cultural level of animal life in providing the male with sexual outlet and exercising the animal functions of reproduction and care of the young.

author: David Sarnoff
title: The great menace to the life of an industry is industrial self-complacency.

author: Caleb Deschanel
title: The great photographers of life - like Diane Arbus and Walker Evans and Robert Frank - all must have had some special quality: a personality of nurturing and non-judgment that frees the subjects to reveal their most intimate reality. It really is what makes a great photographer, every bit as much as understanding composition and lighting.

author: Carl Jung
title: The great problems of life, including of course sex, are always related to the primordial images of the collective unconscious. These images are balancing and compensating factors that correspond to the problems which life confronts us with in reality. This is not matter for astonishment, since these images are deposits of thousands of years of experience of the struggle for existence and for adaptation.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: The great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.

author: Camilla Belle
title: The great thing about life - I'd rather not know and just hope I'm happy and healthy and I feel as good about my life as I do now.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: The great tragedy of life is not that men perish, but that they cease to love.

author: William James
title: The great use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The great virtue in life is real courage that knows how to face facts and live beyond them.

author: John A. Hannah
title: The greatest ability in business is to get along with others and influence their actions. A chip on the shoulder is too heavy a piece of baggage to carry through life.

author: Carl Jung
title: The greatest and most important problems of life are all fundamentally insoluble. They can never be solved but only outgrown.

author: Hubert Humphrey
title:
The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.,
,

author: Victor Hugo
title: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved, loved for ourselves, or rather loved in spite of ourselves.

author: Benjamin Clementine
title: The greatest in heroes in life are the anonymous. That's what I believe. Your neighbours are heroes. People who, when you walk down the street, you see them feeding their little baby - these people are heroes because they are living under difficult situations, but they're still trying to save a life.

author: R.D. Clyde
title: The greatest joy of life is to love and be loved.

author: Billy Graham
title: The greatest legacy one can pass on to one's children and grandchildren is not money or other material things accumulated in one's life, but rather a legacy of character and faith.

author: Winston Churchill
title: The greatest lesson in life is to know that even fools are right sometimes.

author: Ellen Hubbard
title: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing that you will make one.

author: Buffalo Bill
title: The greatest of all the Sioux in my time, or in any time for that matter, was that wonderful old fighting man, Sitting Bull, whose life will some day be written by a historian who can really give him his due.

author: Walter Bagehot
title: The greatest pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.

author: Mychal Wynn
title: The greatest quest in life is to reach one's potential.

author: Alfred P. Sloan
title: The greatest real thrill that life offers is to create, to construct, to develop something useful. Too often we fail to recognize and pay tribute to the creative spirit. It is that spirit that creates our jobs.

author: Robert Frost
title: The greatest thing in family life is to take a hint when a hint is intended - and not to take a hint when a hint isn't intended.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The greatest thing in life is to die young - but delay it as long as possible.

author: William James
title: The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The greenhorn is the ultimate victor in everything; it is he that gets the most out of life.

author: George Eliot
title: The growing good of the world is partly dependent on unhistorical acts; and that things are not so ill with you and me as they might have been, is half owing to the number who lived faithfully a hidden life, and rest in unvisited tombs.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: The guiding motto in the life of every natural philosopher should be, seek simplicity and distrust it.

author: Brendan Gill
title: The guns of the big events rumble through our pages, but the tiny firecrackers are constantly hissing and popping there as well; it appears that much of my life as a journalist has been devoted to sedulously setting off firecrackers.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The happiest part of a man's life is what he passes lying awake in bed in the morning.

author: Brian Tracy
title: The happiest people in the world are those who feel absolutely terrific about themselves, and this is the natural outgrowth of accepting total responsibility for every part of their life.

author: Josh Billings
title: The happiest time in a man's life is when he is in the red hot pursuit of a dollar with a reasonable prospect of overtaking it.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title:
The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.,
,
,

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
title: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little soon forgotten charities of a kiss or smile, a kind look, a heartfelt compliment, and the countless infinitesimal of pleasurable and genial feeling.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title:
The happiness of this life depends less on what befalls you than the way in which you take it.,
,

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.

author: Caroline Knapp
title: The hard things in life, the things you really learn from, happen with a clear mind.

author: Helen Rowland
title: The hardest task in a girl's life is to prove to a man that his intentions are serious.

author: Helen Rowland
title: The hardest task of a girl's life, nowadays, is to prove to a man that his intentions are serious.

author: Ben Horowitz
title: The hardest thing about starting a company and running a company is, there's just so many expectations on you, and there are so many people who have things that they want you to do. It's a lot like life about that.

author: David Russell
title: The hardest thing in life is to know which bridge to cross and which to burn.

author: Helen Hayes
title: The hardest years in life are those between ten and seventy.

author: Bill Hybels
title: The heart and soul of the Christian life is learning to hear God's voice and then developing the courage to do what he asks us to do.

author: Felix Adler
title: The hero is one who kindles a great light in the world, who sets up blazing torches in the dark streets of life for men to see by.

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
title: The highest manifestation of life consists in this: that a being governs its own actions. A thing which is always subject to the direction of another is somewhat of a dead thing.

author: Henry Ford
title:
The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more service for the betterment of life.,
,
,
,
,
,

author: Charles Péguy
title: The honest man must be a perpetual renegade, the life of an honest man a perpetual infidelity. For the man who wishes to remain faithful must take himself perpetually unfaithful to all the continual, successive, indefatigable, renascent errors.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The horror no less than the charm of real life consists precisely in the recurrent actualization of the inconceivable.

author: Hannah Arendt
title: The human condition is such that pain and effort are not just symptoms which can be removed without changing life itself; they are the modes in which life itself, together with the necessity to which it is bound, makes itself felt. For mortals, the ''easy life of the gods'' would be a lifeless life.

author: Eliza Farnham
title: The human face is the organic seat of beauty. It is the register of value in development, a record of Experience, whose legitimate office is to perfect the life, a legible language to those who will study it, of the majestic mistress, the soul.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
title: The human mind is indeed a cave swarming with strange forms of life, most of them unconscious and unilluminated. Unless we can understand something as to how the motives that issue from this obscurity are generated, we can hardly hope to foresee or control them.

author: John W. Gardner
title: The idea for which this nation stands will not survive if the highest goal free man can set themselves is an amiable mediocrity. Excellence implies striving for the highest standards in every phase of life.

author: Alan Cranston
title: The idea of being a foreign correspondent and wandering the world and witnessing great events, having adventures and covering the activities of world leaders, appealed to me greatly. It was a very glamorous life in those days.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
title: The idea that seeing life means going from place to place and doing a great variety of obvious things is an illusion natural to dull minds.

author: Anna Howard Shaw
title: The idealists dream and the dream is told, and the practical men listen and ponder and bring back the truth and apply it to human life, and progress and growth and higher human ideals come into being and so the world moves ever on.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The ideas that have lighted my way and, time after time, have given me new courage to face life cheerfully have been Kindness, Beauty, and Truth.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The images of the unconscious place a great responsibility upon a man. Failure to understand them, or a shirking of ethical responsibility, deprives him of his wholeness and imposes a painful fragmentariness on his life.

author: John Keats
title: The imagination of a boy is healthy, and the mature imagination of a man is healthy; but there is a space of life between, in which the soul is in a ferment, the character undecided, the way of life uncertain, the ambition thick-sighted: thence proceeds mawkishness.

author: Glenda Jackson
title: The important thing in acting is to be able to laugh and cry. If I have to cry I think of my sex life. If I have to laugh, I think of my sex life.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: The important thing isn't the house. It's the ability to make it. You carry that in your brains and in your hands, wherever you go... It's one thing to carry your life wherever you go. Another thing to always go looking for it somewhere else.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: The impression forces itself upon one that men measure by false standards, that everyone seeks power, success, riches for himself, and admires others who attain them, while undervaluing the truly precious thing in life.

author: Charles A. Lindbergh
title: The improvement of our way of life is more important than the spreading of it. If we make it satisfactory enough, it will spread automatically. If we do not, no strength of arms can permanently oppose it.

author: Arthur Middleton
title: The Incarnation is the medicine of the soul, undoing the Fall and bringing man to the Tree of Life, and the office of a priest is to administer this medicine in the sacraments.

author: Logan Pearsall Smith
title: The indefatigable pursuit of an unattainable perfection -even though nothing more than the pounding of an old piano -is what alone gives a meaning to our life on this unavailing star.

author: Ben Stein
title: The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: Decide what you want.

author: William B. Yeats
title: The intellect of man is forced to choose perfection of the life, or of the work, and if it take the second must refuse a heavenly mansion, raging in the dark.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: The interest in life does not lie in what people do, nor even in their relations to each other, but largely in the power to communicate with a third party, antagonistic, enigmatic, yet perhaps persuadable, which one may call life in general.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The invalid is a parasite on society. In a certain state it is indecent to go on living. To vegetate on in cowardly dependence on physicians and medicaments after the meaning of life, the right to life, has been lost ought to entail the profound contempt of society.

author: Candace Bushnell
title: The joke that I make is that there are instances on the TV series that happen to me, - except on Sex and the City they always make it better or worse than real life and I am actually saying that in a joking way.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: The journey between what you once were and who you are now becoming is where the dance of life really takes place.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The joy in life is to be used for a purpose. I want to be used up when I die.

author: Barbara Corcoran
title: The joy is in the getting there. The beginning years of starting your business, the camaraderie when you're in the pit together, are the best years of your life. So rather than being so focused on when you get big and powerful, if you can just get the juice out of that... don't miss it.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: The joy of life consists in the exercise of one's energies, continual growth, constant change, the enjoyment of every new experience. To stop means simply to die. The eternal mistake of mankind is to set up an attainable ideal.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The jury, passing on the prisoner's life, may have in the sworn twelve a thief or two guiltier than him they try.

author: Earl Nightingale
title: The key that unlocks energy is ''Desire.'' It's also the key to a long and interesting life. If we expect to create any drive, any real force within ourselves, we have to get excited.

author: Bette Davis
title: The key to life is accepting challenges. Once someone stops doing this, he's dead.

author: Candace Bushnell
title: The key to life is your attitude. Whether you're single or married or have kids or don't have kids, it's how you look at your life, what you make of it. It's about making the best of your life wherever you are in life.

author: Julius Erving
title: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.

author: Mary McCarthy
title: The labor of keeping house is labor in its most naked state, for labor is toil that never finishes, toil that has to be begun again the moment it is completed, toil that is destroyed and consumed by the life process.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: The lamp of genius burns quicker than the lamp of life.

author: Buck Owens
title: The last 16 years of my daddy's life, he got to work for me, and that made him his own boss and he like that.

author: Abel Ferrara
title: The last day of your life is still going to be a day.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: The latter part of a wise person's life is occupied with curing the follies, prejudices and false opinions they contracted earlier.

author: Joseph Edward Murphy
title: The Law of Attraction attracts to you everything you need, according to the nature of your thought life. Your environment and financial condition are the perfect reflection of your habitual thinking. Thought rules the world.

author: Carl Jung
title: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: The Left despises Texas, with its stellar record of job growth; Texas, with its strong support for traditional marriage and the sanctity of life; Texas, the root of the conservative tree. Should the Left succeed in its attempt to turn Texas purple, America could turn permanently blue.

author: Amos Bronson Alcott
title: The less routine the more life.

author: Anita Brookner
title: The lessons taught in great books are misleading. The commerce in life is rarely so simple and never so just.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The lie is a condition of life.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: The life expectancy of people going to Mars may be decreased by the higher level of radiation that they receive.

author: William Cowper
title: The life of ease is a difficult pursuit.

author: Sir James Matthew Barrie
title: The life of every person is like a diary in which he means to write one story, and writes another.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: The life of man is a journey; a journey that must be traveled, however bad the roads or the accommodation.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The life of man is a long march through the night, surrounded by invisible foes, tortured by weariness and pain, towards a goal that few can hope to reach, and where none may tarry long.

author: David Hume
title: The life of man is of no greater importance to the universe than that of an oyster.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The life of man is the true romance, which when it is valiantly conduced, will yield the imagination a higher joy than any fiction.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: The life of our city is rich in poetic and marvelous subjects. We are enveloped and steeped as though in an atmosphere of the marvelous; but we do not notice it.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.

author: Hippocrates
title: The life so short, the craft so long to learn.

author: William Wordsworth
title: The little unremembered acts of kindness and love are the best parts of a person's life.

author: Ajay Naidu
title: The loneliness is when you pick up and move, even if you are not originally from that place, and you have some memories that you want to embrace. Having a life in transit, I feel like you are always looking out the back window.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
title: The longer I live the more beautiful life becomes. If you foolishly ignore beauty, you will soon find yourself without it. Your life will be impoverished. But if you invest in beauty, it will remain with you all the days of your life.

author: Barbara Deming
title: The longer we listen to one another - with real attention - the more commonality we will find in all our lives. That is, if we are careful to exchange with one another life stories and not simply opinions.

author: M. Russell Ballard
title: The love for work needs to be re-enthroned in our lives. Every family should have a plan for work that touches the life of each family member so that this eternal principle will be ingrained in their lives.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: The lover of life makes the whole world into his family, just as the lover of the fair sex creates his from all the lovely women he has found, from those that could be found, and those who are impossible to find.

author: Burt Shavitz
title: The magic of living life for me is, and always has been, the magic of living on the land, not in the magic of money.

author: Nancy Astor
title: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything or nothing.

author: Konstantin Stanislavisky
title: The main factor in any form of creativeness is the life of a human spirit, that of the actor and his part, their joint feelings and subconscious creation.

author: Bill Dedman
title: The main threads running through the lives of W. A. Clark and his daughter Huguette include the costs of ambition, the burdens of inherited wealth, the fragility of reputation, the folly of judging someone's life from the outside, and the tension between engaging with the world, with all its risks, and keeping a safe distance from danger.

author: Jim Rohn
title: The major value in life is not what you get. The major value in life is what you become.,

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The man who does not work for the love of work but only for money is not likely to make money nor find much fun in life.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: The man who is aware of himself is henceforward independent; and he is never bored, and life is only too short, and he is steeped through and through with a profound yet temperate happiness.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The man who says he has exhausted life generally means that life has exhausted him.

author: C. Northcote Parkinson
title: The man whose life is devoted to paperwork has lost the initiative. He is dealing with things that are brought to his notice, having ceased to notice anything for himself.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The man without a purpose is like a ship without a rudder - waif, a nothing, a no man. Have a purpose in life, and, having it, throw such strength of mind and muscle into your work as God has given you.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: The mantram becomes one's staff of life and carries one through every ordeal. Each repetition has a new meaning, carrying you nearer and nearer to God.

author: Sir Richard Steele
title: The marriage state, with and without the affection suitable to it, is the completest image of Heaven and Hell we are capable of receiving in this life.

author: Carolyn Heilbrun
title: The married are those who have taken the terrible risk of intimacy and, having taken it, know life without intimacy to be impossible.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: The mass production of distraction is now as much a part of the American way of life as the mass production of automobiles.

author: Carlos Gershenson
title: The meaning of life does not depend on where one is standing, but on towards where one is heading.

author: Bruce Lee
title: The meaning of life is that it is to be lived, and it is not to be traded and conceptualized and squeezed into a pattern of systems.

author: Corrie Ten Boom
title: The measure of a life, after all, is not its duration, but its donation.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: The men and women who have the right ideals... are those who have the courage to strive for the happiness which comes only with labor and effort and self-sacrifice, and those whose joy in life springs in part from power of work and sense of duty.

author: Charles Kingsley
title: The men whom I have seen succeed best in life always have been cheerful and hopeful men; who went about their business with a smile on their faces; and took the changes and chances of this mortal life like men; facing rough and smooth alike as it came.

author: William Bolitho
title: The mere idea of marriage, as a strong possibility, if not always nowadays a reasonable likelihood, existing to weaken the will by distracting its straight aim in the life of practically every young girl, is the simple secret of their confessed inferiority in men's pursuits and professions to-day.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The mintage of wisdom is to know that rest is rust, and that real life is love, laughter, and work.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: The moment in between what you once were, and who you are now becoming, is where the dance of life really takes place.

author: Haniel Long
title: The moment one accosts a stranger or is accosted by him is above all in this life the moment of drama... Whoever we meet watches us intently at the quick, strange moment of meeting, to see whether we are disposed to be friendly.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The monotony and solitude of a quiet life stimulates the creative mind.

author: Buddy DeSylva
title: The moon belongs to everyone; , The best things in life are free. , The stars belong to everyone; , They gleam there for you and me.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: The more a man can forget, the greater the number of metamorphoses which his life can undergo, the more he can remember the more divine his life becomes.

author: Arthur C. Brooks
title: The more control you have over your life, the more responsible you feel for your own success - or failure.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: The more highly public life is organized the lower does its morality sink.

author: Jean Paul
title: The more sand has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.

author: Cate Blanchett
title: The more you can remove the obstacles between you and the world as a woman, the easier and simpler life becomes.

author: William Boetcker
title: The more you learn what to do with yourself, and the more you do for others, the more you will learn to enjoy the abundant life.

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: The more you praise and celebrate your life, the more there is in life to celebrate.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: The most conservative persons I ever met are college undergraduates. The radicals are the men past middle life.

author: Eugenio Montale
title: The most dangerous aspect of present-day life is the dissolution of the feeling of individual responsibility. Mass solitude has done away with any difference between the internal and the external, between the intellectual and the physical.

author: André Gide
title: The most decisive actions of our life - I mean those that are most likely to decide the whole course of our future - are, more often than not, unconsidered.

author: Maxwell Maltz
title: The most delightful surprise in life is to suddenly recognize your own worth.

author: Amelia Earhart
title: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure , the process is its own reward.

author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
title: The most exhausting thing in life, I have discovered, is being insincere.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: The most fatal illusion is the narrow point of view. Since life is growth and motion, a fixed point of view kills anybody who has one.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: The most fatal illusion is the settled point of view. Since life is growth and motion, a fixed point of view kills anybody who has one.

author: Gustave Flaubert
title: The most glorious moments in your life are not the so-called days of success, but rather those days when out of dejection and despair you feel rise in you a challenge to life, and the promise of future accomplishments.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The most happy man is he who knows how to bring into relation the end and beginning of his life.

author: Charles Dickens
title: The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will.' Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.

author: Audrey Hepburn
title: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.,

author: Candace Bushnell
title: The most important thing to strive for in life is some kind of personal and professional achievement. Not as a man or a woman, but as a person.

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
title: The most satisfying thing in life is to have been able to give a large part of oneself to others.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The most spiritual human beings, assuming they are the most courageous, also experience by far the most painful tragedies: but it is precisely for this reason that they honor life, because it brings against them its most formidable weapons.

author: Antisthenes
title: The most useful piece of learning for the uses of life is to unlearn what is untrue.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The most valuable things in life are not measured in monetary terms. The really important things are not houses and lands, stocks and bonds, automobiles and real state, but friendships, trust, confidence, empathy, mercy, love and faith.

author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman
title: The mother as a social servant instead of a home servant will not lack in true mother duty. From her work, loved and honored though it is, she will return to her home life, the child life, with an eager, ceaseless pleasure, cleansed of all the fret and fraction and weariness that so mar it now.

author: Adrienne Rich
title: The mother's battle for her child with sickness, with poverty, with war, with all the forces of exploitation and callousness that cheapen human life needs to become a common human battle, waged in love and in the passion for survival.

author: Barbara Tuchman
title: The nastiness of women [in the 14th century] was generally perceived at the close of life when a man began to worry about hell, and his sexual desire in any case fading.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: The nation's honor is dearer than the nation's comfort; yes, than the nation's life itself.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The natural rhythm of human life is routine punctuated by orgies.,

author: Barbara Hepworth
title: The naturalness of life... the sense of community is, I think, a very important factor in an artist's life.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
title: The nearer people approach old age the closer they return to a semblance of childhood, until the time comes for them to depart this life, again like children, neither tired of living nor aware of death.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: The necessary has never been man's top priority. The passionate pursuit of the nonessential and the extravagant is one of the chief traits of human uniqueness. Unlike other forms of life, man's greatest exertions are made in the pursuit not of necessities but of superfluities.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
title: The need to exert power, when thwarted in the open fields of life, is the more likely to assert itself in trifles.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: The object in life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The object of art is to give life a shape.

author: Anna Julia Cooper
title: The old, subjective, stagnant, indolent and wretched life for woman has gone. She has as many resources as men, as many activities beckon her on. As large possibilities swell and inspire her heart.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: The one way to get thin is to re-establish a purpose in life.

author: Les Brown
title: The only limits to the possibilities in your life tomorrow are the buts you use today.

author: Samuel Butler
title: The only living works are those which have drained much of the author's own life into them.

author: Al McGuire
title: The only mystery in life is why the kamikaze pilots wore helmets.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The only prudence in life is concentration.

author: Henry James
title: The only reason for the existence of a novel is that it does attempt to represent life.

author: Clark Gable
title: The only reason they come to see me is that I know that life is great - and they know I know it.

author: Milan Kundera
title: The only relationship that can make both partners happy is one in which sentimentality has no place and neither partner makes any claim on the life and freedom of the other.

author: Thomas Mann
title: The only religious way to think of death is as part and parcel of life.

author: Bryce Courtenay
title: The only thing I can say that is wonderful about my mother is she forced me to learn three verses of the Bible every day of my life, and I've read the Bible now five times and it taught me the English language.

author: Richard M. DeVos
title: The only thing that stands between a man and what he wants from life is often merely the will to try it and the faith to believe that it is possible.

author: Ansel Adams
title: The only things in my life that compatibly exists with this grand universe are the creative works of the human spirit.

author: Stephen Vizinczey
title: The only virtue a character needs to possess between hardcovers, even if he bears a real person's name, is vitality: if he comes to life in our imaginations, he passes the test.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The only wealth is life.

author: Elie Wiesel
title: The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference.

author: Peter Ackroyd
title: The ordinary routines of life are never chronicled by the historian, but they make up almost the whole of experience.

author: Abraham Cahan
title: The orthodox Jewish faith practically excludes woman from religious life.

author: Benjamin N. Cardozo
title: The outstanding truths of life, the great and unquestioned phenomena of society, are not to be argued away as myths and vagaries when they do not fit within our little moulds. If necessary, we must remake the moulds.

author: Javan
title: The pain we feel When someone leaves our life is in direct proportion to the joy they bring while a part of our life for a few moments. In my life you made me feel as if I truly meant something to someone

author: Jackson Pollock
title: The painting has a life of its own. I try to let it come through.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: The paradox is really the pathos of intellectual life and just as only great souls are exposed to passions it is only the great thinker who is exposed to what I call paradoxes, which are nothing else than grandiose thoughts in embryo.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: The past is never the past. It is always present. And you better reckon with it in your life and in your daily experience, or it will get you. It will get you really bad.

author: Billy Ray Cyrus
title: The people at the record company had asked me if I could write a song about my life, my relationship with God, and where I'm from. Well, I can't write a song on purpose, my songs come in a moment of inspiration or desperation.

author: Epictetus
title: The people have a right to the truth as they have a right to life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.

author: Bruce Dern
title: The people I worked with were bigger than life. Once you put them on the screen, they were huge.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The perplexity of life arises from there being too many interesting things in it for us to be interested properly in any of them.

author: Robert Herrick
title: The person lives twice who lives the first life well.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The person who cannot laugh is not only ready for treason, and deceptions, their whole life is already a treason and deception.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The person who does not work for the love of work but only for money is not likely to make money nor to find much fun in life.

author: Anais Nin
title: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.

author: Buckminster Fuller
title: The physical is inherently entropic, giving off energy in ever more disorderly ways. The metaphysical is antientropic, methodically marshalling energy. Life is antientropic. It is spontaneously inquisitive. It sorts out and endeavors to understand.

author: Dame Edith Sitwell
title: The poet speaks to all men of that other life of theirs that they have smothered and forgotten.

author: Al Franken
title: The point is that there is tremendous hypocrisy among the Christian right. And I think that Christian voters should start looking at global warming and extreme poverty as a religious issue that speaks to the culture of life.

author: Barbara Deming
title: The point is to change one's life. The point is not to give some vent to the emotions that have been destroying one; the point is so to act that one can master them now.

author: Lord George Byron
title: The poor dog, in life the firmest friend. The first to welcome, foremost to defend.

author: Jean-Paul Sartre
title: The poor don't know that their function in life is to exercise our generosity.

author: Agatha Christie
title: The popular idea that a child forgets easily is not an accurate one. Many people go right through life in the grip of an idea which has been impressed on them in very tender years.

author: Carlos Fuentes
title: The possibility of being as free with the camera as we are with the pen is a fantastic prospect for the creative life of the 21st century.

author: C. J. Mahaney
title: The presence of any humility in my life is purely and completely an evidence of God's grace. From my perspective, I am not a humble man. I am a proud man pursuing humility by the grace of God.

author: J. Clare
title: The present is the funeral of the past, and man the living sepulchre of life.

author: Arthur Middleton
title: The priest is Christ's slave, and Christ himself took the form of a slave and became obedient to death. So the priest in serving human needs lives a Godward life, possessed by God and witnessing that only when lives are utterly possessed by God do they find their true freedom.

author: Anthony Holden
title: The Princess's so-called 'time and space speech' at the end of '93 about a year after the formal separation, looking back on it it's called her retirement from public life but we've seen in fact it's nothing of the kind.

author: Bayard Rustin

author: Barry Cornwall
title: The progress from infancy to boyhood is imperceptible. In that long dawn of the mind we take but little heed. The years pass by us, one by one, little distinguishable from each other. But when the intellectual sun of our life is risen, we take due note of joy and sorrow.

author: Arthur Koestler
title: The progress of science is strewn, like an ancient desert trail, with the bleached skeleton of discarded theories which once seemed to possess eternal life.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title:
The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.,
,

author: Robert Byrne
title: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.

author: Alan Cohen
title: The purpose of life is not to fight against evil and misfortune; it is to unveil magnificence.

author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
title: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things

title: The purpose of life, after all, is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experiences.

title: The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: The quality of life is more important than life itself.

author: Martin Luther King

How can they become blessings to society, as a life threatening disease is to an individual, by teaching us about the meaning of our life and existence?

author: Billy Tauzin
title: The question is what I wanted to do with the new life God has given me. This is the mission I want to take on.

author: Anita Loos

author: Garry Kasparov
title: The real political life in Russia unfortunately is not in the parliament but on the streets and in the media.

author: Katherine Anne Porter
title: The real sin against life is to abuse and destroy beauty, even one's own -even more, one's own, for that has been put in our care and we are responsible for its well-being.

author: Eugene Kennedy

author: André Maurois
title: The really great novel tends to be the exact negative of its author's life.

author: André Maurois
title: The really great novel tends to be the exact negative of its author's life.

author: Eustace Budgell
title: The reason why we see that people of the greatest capacity are not rich, is either they despise wealth in comparison to something else, or, they are not content in getting an estate, unless they may do it in their own way, while at the same time enjoying all the pleasures and gratitude's of life.

author: Sister Elizabeth Kenny
title: The record of one's life must needs prove more interesting to him who writes it than to him who reads what has been written.

author: Carol Shields
title: The recounting of a life is a cheat... even our own stories are obscenely distorted.

author: Giuseppe Mazzini
title: The republic, as I at least understand it, means association, of which liberty is only an element, a necessary antecedent. It means association, a new philosophy of life, a divine Ideal that shall move the world, the only means of regeneration vouchsafed to the human race.

author: Richard M. DeVos
title: The riches of life, the love and joy and exhilaration of life can be found only with an upward look. This is an exciting world. It's cram-packed with opportunity. Great moments wait around every corner.

author: Mason Cooley
title: The routines of tourism are even more monotonous than those of daily life.

author: Busy Philipps
title: The rugs that I picked out and the pillows with the little owls, sort of like whimsical throw pillows - I feel like you can never enough whimsical throw pillows in your house, in your life. My husband probably disagrees.

author: Aaron Burr
title: The rule of my life is to make business a pleasure, and pleasure my business.

author: A. N. Wilson
title: The scribbler's life is never done.

author: Bayard Ruskin
title: The scupltor does not work for the anatomist, but for the common observer of life and nature.

author: Walker Percy

author: Groucho Marx
title:
The secret of life is honesty and fair dealing. If you can fake that, you've got it made.,
,
,

author: Stokely Carmichael
title: The secret of life is to have no fear; it's the only way to function.

author: David Ogilvy

author: Bo Bennett
title: The secret to having everything you want out of life is the realization that you really don't want most of the things you think you want.

author: Calvin Trillin
title: The shelf life of the average trade book is somewhere between milk and yogurt.

author: Calvin Trillin
title: The shelf life of the modern hardback writer is somewhere between the milk and the yoghurt.

author: Juvenal
title: The short bloom of our brief and narrow life flies far away. While we are calling for flowers and wine and woman, old age is upon us.

author: William Bolitho
title: The shortest way out of Manchester is notoriously a bottle of Gordon's gin; out of any businessman's life there is the mirage of Paris; out of Paris, or mediocrity of talent and imagination, there are all the drugs, from subtle, all-conquering opium to cheating, cozening cocaine.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: The simple reality of life is that everyone is wrong on a regular basis. By confronting these inevitable errors, you allow yourself to make corrections before it is too late.

author: Ernest Renan
title: The simplest school boy is now familiar with truths for which Archimedes would have sacrificed his life.

title: The simplification of life is one of the steps to inner peace. A persistent simplification will create an inner and outer well-being that places harmony in one's life.

title: The small courtesies sweeten life; the greater ennoble it.

title: The society of life on Mars, or the challenge of making Mars more livable, will have significant benefits on our attempts to modify and change in some ways the environment here on Earth.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: The soul which has no fixed purpose in life is lost; to be everywhere, is to be nowhere.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The source of all life and knowledge is in man and woman, and the source of all living is in the interchange and the meeting and mingling of these two: man-life and woman-life, man-knowledge and woman-knowledge, man-being and woman-being.

title: The spirit or life spark which animates this manifestation could be called God.

title: The stage is life, music, beautiful girls, legs, breasts, not talk or intellectualism or dried-up academics.

title: The stage is not merely the meeting place of all the arts, but is also the return of art to life.

title: The story of a poor man's life is written on his body, in a sharp pen.

author: Arthur Rimbaud
title: The Sun, the hearth of affection and life, pours burning love on the delighted earth.

author: Arnold Bennett

author: Victor Hugo
title: The supreme happiness in life is the conviction that we are loved - loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.

author: Victor Hugo
title: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather in spite of ourselves.

author: Bill Watterson
title: The surest sign that intelligent life exists elsewhere in the universe is that it has never tried to contact us.

author: John C. Calhoun
title: The surrender of life is nothing to sinking down into acknowledgment of inferiority.

author: Arthur Middleton
title: The task of a priest, in some respects, may be different today, but the principles upon which Herbert built his life as a priest are of universal application.

title: The tension between 'yes' and 'no,' between 'I can' and 'I cannot,' makes us feel that, in so many instances, human life is an interminable debate with one's self.

title: The theater is so endlessly fascinating because it's so accidental. It's so much like life.,

title: The thing I'm the most proud of in my personal life is that my daughter actually thinks that I'm fabulous.

author: Edwin Markham

title: The three great moments of my life had to be the concerts of Ellington in 1938, Dizzy in '48, and Ella in '52.

title: The time of life is short: to spend that shortness basely were too long.

title: The tragedy of life is not that man loses, but that he almost wins.

author: Carly Fiorina
title: The truth is, I'm proud of the life I've lived so far, and though I've made my share of mistakes, I have no regrets.

author: Mark Twain

title: The ultimate goal of a more effective and efficient life is to provide you with enough time to enjoy some of it.

author: Tom Morris
title: The unlived life is not worth examining.

author: Charles Darwin

title: The way you think, the way you behave, the way you eat, can influence your life by 30 to 50 years.

title: The weariest and most loathed worldly life, that age, ache, penury and imprisonment can lay on nature is a paradise, to what we fear of death.

title: The work that must be done for each woman to reconnect with her psyche and to give herself a chance to live her own life is essentially the same. The realization of the equality of all races, the equality of all beings is essential.

author: Annie Leibovitz
title: The work which is manipulated looks a little boring to me. I think life is pretty strange anyway. It is wooo, wooo, wooo!

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The world is wonderful and beautiful and good beyond one's wildest imagination. Never, never, never could one conceive what love is, beforehand, never. Life can be great - quite god-like. It can be so. God be thanked I have proved it.

author: Bill Watterson
title: The world of a comic strip ought to be a special place with its own logic and life... I don't want the issue of Hobbes's reality settled by a doll manufacturer.
