title: We think a happy life consists in tranquility of mind.

author: Mohsin Hamid
title: We think of the romance novel as a lesser form of literature, but I don't think that's true. Love is a very important aspect of human life and worth exploring.

author: Bonnie Tyler
title: We were brought up Protestant, and I went to church three times a day on a Sunday. My parents weren't Bible-bashers, but we all have a strong belief in God and a strong faith. We had a huge garden; our house was a bit like a scene from 'The Good Life.' I think Mam and Dad had it really hard, bringing up a big family on very little.

author: Barbara Ehrenreich
title: We who officially value freedom of speech above life itself seem to have nothing to talk about but the weather.

author: Adam Schiff
title: We will not let terrorists change our way of life; we will not live in fear; and we will not undermine the civil liberties that characterize our Democracy.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: We're all here for a limited amount of time, and life is difficult - not unfair, but difficult. The key is to really confront our fears because when we do, and when we look at them, we really begin to realize that we are capable of handling them.

author: Bill Murray
title: We're born alone. We do need each other. It's lonely to really effectively live your life, and anyone you can get help from or give help to; that's part of your obligation.

author: Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador
title: We're not going to meddle in the internal life of other peoples and other governments, because we don't want them meddling in ours.

author: Bob Seger
title: We've got to practice three weeks, get the kinks out, then we've got to practice three weeks with the crew, and then go out for four months. It's just a huge chunk of time out of life.

author: Billy Beane
title: We've got to use every piece of data and piece of information, and hopefully that will help us be accurate with our player evaluation. For us, that's our life blood.

author: Adolph Green
title: We've managed to keep a spirit of fun, I guess, of urban satire and finding new and odd interesting angles to the ways of life to put on the stage.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Wealth is the ability to fully experience life.

author: Sean O'Casey
title: Wealth often takes away chances from men as well as poverty. There is none to tell the rich to go on striving, for a rich man makes the law that hallows and hollows his own life.

author: Anthony Holden
title: Well I'm a very similar age to Prince Charles. I'm a year older than him. I was at university at the same time as him. I think in the sixties, like all the Royals, he really had very little impact on my life at all and he seemed, if anything a lot older in his attitudes.

author: Candace Bushnell
title: Well in the book Carrie was my alter ego. In real life, Sarah Jessica and I don't look anything alike. But people do say that we sound alike. Sarah Jessica is an adorable girl and she is very funny.

author: Ann Beattie
title: Well, a few years ago I think I could have given you a more enthusiastic answer about that but in the last few years, for the first time in my life, I really haven't listened to much music. I used to work with music on and now I don't.

author: Bud Abbott
title: Well, I always had a chauffer, because I have never driven a car in my life. I still can't drive.

author: Ann Patchett
title: Well, I always say that the two things I was most disastrous at in my life, being a teenager and being a wife, were the two things I really wound up cashing in on when I was writing fluffy magazine pieces.

author: Bill Scott
title: Well, I think that those of us in public life that are trying to do a good job, and that are faced with this popular new game that the media has of being critical of everything that anybody in public office does probably are thin-skinned.

author: Bobby Farrelly
title: Well, there are conjoined twins in real life and we can tell a story about them so long as they're not the brunt of the jokes. In this, they're the heroes of this story; we love these guys.

author: Bryn Terfel
title: Welsh is my mother tongue, and my children speak it. If you come and live in this community you'll work out pretty quickly that it's beneficial to learn the language, because if you're going to the pub or a cafe you need to be a part of the local life.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: Were art to redeem man, it could do so only by saving him from the seriousness of life and restoring him to an unexpected boyishness.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Were it offered to my choice, I should have no objection to a repetition of the same life from its beginning, only asking the advantages authors have in a second edition to correct some faults in the first.

author: John Howe
title: What a folly it is to dread the thought of throwing away life at once, and yet have no regard to throwing it away by parcels and piecemeal.

author: Arthur Rimbaud
title: What a life! True life is elsewhere. We are not in the world.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: What a miserable thing life is: you're living in clover, only the clover isn't good enough.

author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette
title: What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner.

author: Barbara de Angelis
title: What allows us, as human beings, to psychologically survive life on earth, with all of its pain, drama, and challenges, is a sense of purpose and meaning

author: John Masefield
title: What am I, Life? A thing of watery salt held in cohesion by unresting cells. Which work they know not why, which never halt, myself unwitting where their Master dwells?

author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps
title: What an immense power over the life is the power of possessing distinct aims. The voice, the dress, the look, the very motion of a person, define and alter when he or she begins to live for a reason.

author: Elizabeth Bishop
title: What childishness is it that while there's breath of life in our bodies, we are determined to rush to see the sun the other way around?

author: Nelson Mandela
title: What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived. It is what difference we have made to the lives of others that will determine the significance of the life we lead.

author: George Eliot
title: What do we live for; if it is not to make life less difficult to each other?

author: Joseph Campbell
title: What each must seek in his life never was on land or sea. It is something out of his own unique potentiality for experience, something that never has been and never could have been experienced by anyone else.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: What has influenced my life more than any other single thing has been my stammer. Had I not stammered I would probably... have gone to Cambridge as my brothers did, perhaps have become a don and every now and then published a dreary book about French literature.

author: Audre Lorde
title: What I leave behind has a life of its own.

author: Bruce Eric Kaplan
title: What I like about graduation speeches is that they're an opportunity for someone to make sense of their life and to impart that wisdom to someone else. It's like a sanctioned self-help moment.

author: Bernard Cornwell
title: What I mean by that is that the point of life, as I see it, is not to write books or scale mountains or sail oceans, but to achieve happiness, and preferably an unselfish happiness.

author: Bonnie Blair
title: What I've learned from my own journey, and from my family's experience with cancer, is how important it is to stay positive and move forward. Not every day is going to be perfect; that's life. But staying positive is going to get you to the next day.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: What is a novel if not a conviction of our fellow-men's existence strong enough to take upon itself a form of imagined life clearer than reality and whose accumulated verisimilitude of selected episodes puts to shame the pride of documentary history?

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
title: What is art but life upon the larger scale, the higher. When, graduating up in a spiral line of still expanding and ascending gyres, it pushes toward the intense significance of all things, hungry for the infinite?

author: Carl Jung
title: What is essential in a work of art is that it should rise far above the realm of personal life and speak to the spirit and heart of the poet as man to the spirit and heart of mankind.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: What is important in life is life, and not the result of life.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: What is laid down, ordered, factual is never enough to embrace the whole truth: life always spills over the rim of every cup.

author: Pedro Calderón de la Barca
title: What is life? A frenzy. What is life? An illusion, a shadow, a fiction. And the greatest good is trivial; for all life is a dream and all dreams are dreams.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: What is my life if I am no longer useful to others.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: What is peculiar in the life of a man consists not in his obedience, but his opposition, to his instincts. In one direction or another he strives to live a supernatural life.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: What life half gives a man, posterity gives entirely.

author: George Eliot
title: What makes life dreary is the want of a motive.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: What our eyes behold may well be the text of life but one's meditations on the text and the disclosures of these meditations are no less a part of the structure of reality.

author: George Eliot
title: What quarrel, what harshness, what unbelief in each other can subsist in the presence of a great calamity, when all the artificial vesture of our life is gone, and we are all one with each other in primitive mortal needs?

author: Joseph Brodsky
title: What should I say about life? That it's long and abhors transparence.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.

author: Buddha
title: What we are today comes from our thoughts of yesterday, and our present thoughts build our life of tomorrow: Our life is the creation of our mind.

author: Ben Gibbard
title: What we aspired to in 1998, we have wildly surpassed. And I know we all feel incredibly grateful and lucky this band has been able to have the life that it's had.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: What we call education and culture is for the most part nothing but the substitution of reading for experience, of literature for life, of the obsolete fictitious for the contemporary real.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: What we call the secret of happiness is no more a secret than our willingness to choose life.

author: Bob Taft
title: What we don't talk about enough is Ohio's unique and remarkable quality of life. We are a state of cities, small towns and growing suburbs where life is affordable and destinations within reach. There is no better place to raise a family.

author: Louis Armstrong
title: What we play is life.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: What would life be if we had no courage to attempt anything?

author: Sydney Smith
title: What would life be without arithmetic, but a scene of horrors?

author: Bill Gates
title: What's amazing is, if young people understood how doing well in school makes the rest of their life so much interesting, they would be more motivated. It's so far away in time that they can't appreciate what it means for their whole life.

author: Alexander Pope
title: What's fame? a fancy'd life in other's breath. A thing beyond us, even before our death.

author: Julia Roberts
title: What's nice about my dating life is that I don't have to leave my house. All I have to do is read the paper: I'm marrying Richard Gere, dating Daniel Day-Lewis, parading around with John F. Kennedy, Jr., and even Robert De Niro was in there for a day.

author: Satchel Paige
title: What's scary in life is not what people know (or don't know), but what they know that ain't so.

author: Chief Seattle
title: Whatever befalls the earth befalls the son of the earth. Man did not weave the web of life; he is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: Whatever failures I have known, whatever errors I have committed, whatever follies I have witnessed in private and public life have been the consequence of action without thought.

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: Whatever has happened to you in your past has no power over this present moment, because life is now.

author: Amelia E. Barr
title: Whatever the scientists may say, if we take the supernatural out of life, we leave only the unnatural.

author: Henry Miller
title: Whatever there be of progress in life comes not through adaptation but through daring, through obeying the blind urge.

author: Marilyn French
title: Whatever they may be in public life, whatever their relations with men, in their relations with women, all men are rapists and that's all they are. They rape us with their eyes, their laws, their codes.

author: John Wooden
title: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.,

author: Samuel Johnson
title:
When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life; for there is in London all that life can afford.,
,

author: Simone Weil
title: When a man's life is destroyed or damaged by some wound or privation of soul or body, which is due to other men's actions or negligence, it is not only his sensibility that suffers but also his aspiration toward the good. Therefore there has been sacrilege towards that which is sacred in him.

author: Mme de Stael
title: When a noble life has prepared old age, it is not decline that it reveals, but the first days of immortality.

author: W. Temple
title: When all is done, human life is, at the greatest and the best, but like a forward child, that must be play'd with and humoured a little to keep it quiet till it falls asleep, and then the care is over.

author: Sir William Temple
title: When all is done, human life is, at the greatest and the best, but like a froward child, that must be played with and humored a little to keep it quiet till it falls asleep, and then the care is over.

author: Haniel Long
title: When an individual fear or apathy passes by the unfortunate, life is of no account.

author: Edmund Burke
title: When ancient opinions and rules of life are taken away, the loss cannot possibly be estimated. From that moment, we have no compass to govern us, nor can we know distinctly to what port to steer.

author: Bonnie Bassler
title: When antibiotics became industrially produced following World War II, our quality of life and our longevity improved enormously. No one thought bacteria were going to become resistant.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: When food prices surge, poor families suddenly find themselves unable to afford enough nutritious food. If this happens during the first thousand days of a child's life, the damage to his or her body and mind can be permanent.

author: Billy Graham
title: When granted many years of life, growing old in age is natural, but growing old with grace is a choice. Growing older with grace is possible for all who will set their hearts and minds on the Giver of grace, the Lord Jesus Christ.

author: Wayne Dyer
title: When I chased after money, I never had enough. When I got my life on purpose and focused on giving of myself and everything that arrived into my life, then I was prosperous.

author: John Dryden
title: When I consider life, it is all a cheat. Yet fooled with hope, people favor this deceit.

author: Gloria Swanson
title: When I die, my epitaph should read: She Paid the Bills. That's the story of my private life.

author: Blair Underwood
title: When I doing dinner theater in high school, I was talking to a woman who had been in the business for a while and I said I want to act, that's all I want to do with my life and she said if you're serious then you need to hone every discipline you can.

author: Ben Lovett
title: When I joined the Mumfords I made a commitment to them so they'll always come first. But I'm a bit of a workaholic and Communion helps me get a grip on dealing with my life.

author: Ben Nicholson
title: When I left school I went on trip around the world - I only got as far as Australia, but like a bloody fool I cut it short because of a girl. It's probably one of my big regrets in life.

author: Winston Churchill
title: When I look back on all the worries I remember the story of the old man who said on his deathbed that he had a lot of trouble in his life, most of which never happened.

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: When I love, I do it without counting. I give myself entirely. And each time, it is the grand love of my life.

author: Betsy Brandt
title: When I read both pilots for 'Breaking Bad' and the 'Michael J. Fox Show,' I turned to my husband in real life, and I'm like, 'That is an amazing script.'

author: Ang Lee
title: When I sent those scripts, that was the lowest point of my life. We'd just had our second son, and when I went to collect them from hospital, I went to the bank to try and get some money to buy some diapers, the screen showed I've got $26 left.

author: Erma Bombeck
title: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left and could say, ''I used everything you gave me.''.

author: Agnes Martin
title: When I think of art I think of beauty. Beauty is the mystery of life. It is not in the eye it is in the mind. In our minds there is awareness of perfection.

author: Herman Melville
title: When I think of this life I have led; the desolation of solitude it has been; the masoned, walled-town of a Captain's exclusiveness, which admits but small entrance to any sympathy from the green country without - oh, weariness! heaviness! Guinea-coast slavery of solitary command!

author: Boris Becker
title: When I was a child, I had posters of James Dean in my room. I was a big admirer of his work and was fascinated by him living on the edge. Looking back, my life was kind of the same.

author: Bruce Forsyth
title: When I was a child, life felt so slow because all I wanted to do was get into show business. Each day seemed like a year, but when you get older, years pass like minutes. I wish there was a tape recorder where we could just slow our lives down.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: When I was a little kid, we only knew about our nine planets. Since then, we've downgraded Pluto but have discovered that other solar systems and stars are common. So life is probably quite prevalent.

author: Brooke Burke
title: When I was a new mom, I used to think that life was going to be balanced, and I strived for that. But life is crazy!

author: Bethany Hamilton
title: When I was about five, I gave my heart to Jesus Christ, and since then it's just been a stronghold in my life. Really, through the shark attack and all the hard times that my family and I went through, it gave us unity and perseverance to push through all this crazy stuff that we never knew was going to happen.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When I was young I used to think that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old, I know it is.

author: Albert Claude
title: When I went to the University, the medical school was the only place where one could hope to find the means to study life, its nature, its origins, and its ills.

author: Barry McGuire
title: When I wrote "Green, Green," it was like a really a statement of where I was at philosophically in my life.

author: Barry McGuire
title: When I wrote 'Green, Green,' it was like a really a statement of where I was at philosophically in my life.

author: Agnetha Faltskog
title: When I'm living in the world of luxury and celebrity, which is where I found myself for a large part of my life, it's a walk-on part. Not a vital necessity, like it is for so many people. I enjoy it but I can see right through it!.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: When it comes to life the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.

author: Les Brown
title: When life knocks you down, try to land on your back. Because if you can look up, you can get up. Let your reason get you back up.

author: John Galsworthy
title: When Man evolved Pity, he did a queer thing - deprived himself of the power of living life as it is without wishing it to become something different.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: When men are not regretting that life is so short, they are doing something to kill time.

author: Francois Cavanna
title: When Michelangelo finished the painting of the Sistine Chapel's ceiling, he spent the rest of his life trying to remove the paint that had poured into his sleeve.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: When my body gets to the point where I can no longer function or feel gratitude, then I'll leave it and become grateful again. But until then, I will appreciate what I have and not whine about what I don't have. I will feel blessed by life and the opportunity to help others see that they are blessed, too.

author: Simone Weil
title: When once a certain class of people has been placed by the temporal and spiritual authorities outside the ranks of those whose life has value, then nothing comes more naturally to men than murder.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: When one realizes that his life is worthless he either commits suicide or travels.

author: Lord George Byron
title: When one subtracts from life infancy (which is vegetation), sleep, eating and swilling, buttoning and unbuttoning - how much remains of downright existence? The summer of a dormouse.

author: Ernest Renan
title: When people complain of life, it is almost always because they have asked impossible things of it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When people shake their heads because we are living in a restless age, ask them how they would like to life in a stationary one, and do without change

author: Shall Sinha
title: When subjected to the rain of criticism, let’s not curse the rain. Let’s accept it as a part of life. Let’s remember that the more criticism we can successfully handle, the more zest we will experience in our lives.

author: Martin Amis
title: When success happens to an English writer, he acquires a new typewriter. When success happens to an American writer, he acquires a new life.

author: Gerard De Nerval
title: When the soul drifts uncertainly between life and the dream, between the mind's disorder and the return to cool reflection, it is in religious thought that we should seek consolation.

author: Benazir Bhutto
title: When the United States aligns with dictatorships and totalitarian regimes, it compromises the basic democratic principles of its foundation - namely, life, liberty and justice for all.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: When things have gone really wrong in my life, I've cried like a child. I have really, really cried. I cry it out. Two-three days I cry, and then I'm like, enough, time to deal with reality and figure a way out. This is the way I have dealt with everything.

author: Bjorn Lomborg
title: When thinking about the future, it is fashionable to be pessimistic. Yet the evidence unequivocally belies such pessimism. Over the past centuries, humanity's lot has improved dramatically - in the developed world, where it is rather obvious, but also in the developing world, where life expectancy has more than doubled in the past 100 years.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: When thou art above measure angry, bethink thee how momentary is man's life.

author: Carine Roitfeld
title: When Tom Ford asked me to consult for Gucci, I had never consulted in my life. I didn't know what consulting was, and look, we made something amazing.

author: Greg Anderson
title: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live life.

author: Charles A. Stoddard
title: When we can say no not only to things that are wrong and sinful, but also to things pleasant, profitable, and good which would hinder and clog our grand duties and our chief work, we shall understand more fully what life is worth, and how to make the most of it.

author: Jack Kornfield
title: When we come into the present, we begin to feel the life around us again, but we also encounter whatever we have been avoiding. We must have the courage to face whatever is present - our pain, our desires, our grief, our loss, our secret hopes our love - everything that moves us most deeply.

author: Helen Keller
title: When we do the best we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life, or in the life of another.

author: Mignon McLaughlin
title: When we first fall in love, we feel that we know all there is to know about life, and perhaps we are right.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: When we get there, if we don't find any life on Mars, from that point on there will be life on Mars because we'll bring it there, whether it's germs and leftover urine bags, whatever it is.

author: W. C. Fields
title: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.,

author: Mark Twain
title: When we remember that we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.

author: Antonin Artaud
title: When we speak the word "life," it must be understood we are not referring to life as we know it from its surface of fact, but to that fragile, fluctuating center which forms never reach.

author: John Berger
title: When we suffer anguish we return to early childhood because that is the period in which we first learnt to suffer the experience of total loss. It was more than that. It was the period in which we suffered more total losses than in all the rest of our life put together.

author: Ernest Becker
title: When we understand that man is the only animal who must create meaning, who must open a wedge into neutral nature, we already understand the essence of love. Love is the problem of an animal who must find life, create a dialogue with nature in order to experience his own being.

author: Kofi Annan
title: When women thrive, all of society benefits, and succeeding generations are given a better start in life.

author: Maxim Gorky
title: When work is a pleasure, life is joy.! When work is a duty, life is slavery.

author: Bobby Davro
title: When work is going well, your home life struggles and vice versa. If my kids are OK - that is the most important thing. I strive for balance in my life, though.

author: Bono
title: When you align yourself with God's purpose as described in the Scriptures, something special happens to your life.

author: Bill Walton
title: When you are in unrelenting, excruciating and debilitating pain that never goes away for years on end, your life is over.

author: Boris Becker
title: When you are thrown onto the stage at 17 in such an enormous way, it becomes living on the edge because every step you take, every word you speak, every action you do becomes headline news. And it became, for me, life or death.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: When you automate an industry you modernize it; when you automate a life you primitivize it.

author: George Washington Carver
title: When you can do the common things in life in a uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world.

author: George Washington Carver
title: When you do the common things in life in an uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world.

author: Ben Folds
title: When you don't care then , You've got nothing to loose , And I won't hesitate , Because every moment life is slipping away , It's okay.

author: Eileen Caddy
title: When you feel that you have reached the end and that you cannot go one step further, when life seems to be drained of all purpose: What a wonderful opportunity o start all over again, to turn over a new page.

author: John Mortimer
title: When you get to my age life seems little more than one long march to and from the lavatory.

author: Carine Roitfeld
title: When you give a lot of confidence in people and you don't get it back, you are a bit disappointed, but it's life.

author: Carol Ann Duffy
title: When you have a child, your previous life seems like someone else's. It's like living in a house and suddenly finding a room you didn't know was there, full of treasure and light.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: When you have children it completely shifts your focus; they become the most passionate love of your life.

author: Audrey Hepburn
title: When you have nobody you can make a cup of tea for, when nobody needs you, that's when I think life is over.

author: Bill Rancic
title: When you lose your hair, it has an impact on confidence and your overall self-esteem whether it affects your career or your love life.

author: Brigitte Nielsen
title: When you makes movies, you usually make good money. But it is also a very tough job. Once you enter the public's eye, you have to be aware that you give up a huge part of your own life. And it is never a job from nine to five.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: When you move amidst the world of sense, free from attachment and aversion alike, there comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and you life in the wisdom of the Self.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: When you pick up a novel from the bed side table, you put down your own life at the same time and you become another person for the duration.

author: Barbara Sher
title: When you play it too safe, you're taking the biggest risk of your life. Time is the only wealth we're given.

author: Jean Shinoda Bolen
title: When you recover or discover something that nourishes your soul and bring joy, care enough about yourself to make room for it in your life.

author: Bonnie Wright
title: When you start so young working, you build a hunger for acting, working, and a busy life.

author: Bono
title: When you truly accept that those children in some far off place in the global village have the same value as you in God's eyes or even in just your eyes, then your life is forever changed; you see something that you can't un-see.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: When you're at war, you think about a better life; when you're at peace you think about a more comfortable one.

author: Bryan Burrough
title: When you're going off to prison for the rest of your life, a lot of people do feel the need to explain themselves to all the people they have known.

author: Bruce Forsyth
title: When you've been brought up in variety, I think timing is always important in your life. If I'm ever late for anything, whether it's personal or business, I always apologise. 'I'm sorry I'm late,' and all that. And if somebody is late meeting me, I expect them to say 'I'm sorry I'm late.' It's just, shall we say, showbiz etiquette of my day.

author: Yann Martel
title: When you've suffered a great deal in life, each additional pain is both unbearable and trifling.

author: Duffy Daugherty
title: When your are playing for the national championship, it's not a matter of life or death. It's more important than that.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: When your heart speaks to you about what you need to do to sustain life on this planet, listen to it, make a difference, and be an inspiration for generations to come. Be inspired by people like Gandhi, Mother Teresa, Rosa Parks, Martin Luther King, Christopher Reeve, Albert Schweitzer, Helen Keller, and many others.

author: Carolyn Chute
title: Whenever I write, I write what I find to be the way people are. I never use any symbolism at all, but if you write as true to life as you possibly can, people will see symbolism. They'll all see different symbolism, but they're apt to because you can see it in life.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?,

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Where life is possible at all, a right life is possible; life in a palace is possible; therefore even in a palace a right life is possible.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: Where one person shapes their life by precept and example, there are a thousand who have shaped it by impulse and circumstances.

author: Gerald F. Lieberman
title: Where there is life there is wishful thinking.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Where there is love there is life.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: Where wise actions are the fruit of life, wise discourse is the pollination.

author: Francis Picabia
title: Wherever art appears, life disappears.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: Wherever our life touches yours, we help or hinder... wherever your life touches ours, you make us stronger or weaker.... There is no escape - man drags man down, or man lifts man up.

author: John Ruskin
title: Whether for life or death, do your own work well.

author: R. D. Laing
title: Whether life is worth living depends on whether there is love in life.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Whether you find satisfaction in life depends not on your tale of years, but on your will.

author: Benigno Aquino III
title: While I accept that there are certain things about my private life that will always be of interest to the public, it would be better if you give the same amount of attention to issues that matter as well.

author: Bill Murray
title: While I have felt lonely many times in my life, the oddest feeling of all was after my mother, Lucille, died. My father had already died, but I always had some attachment to our big family while she was alive. It seems strange to say now that I felt so lonely, yet I did.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: While there's life, there's hope.

author: Bill de Blasio
title: While this has been a private part of my family's life, it is now clear a media story will soon emerge. My father tragically ended his life while battling terminal cancer in 1979.

author: Seneca
title: While we are postponing, life speeds by.

author: Arthur Hoppe
title: Who knows? Maybe my life belongs to God. Maybe it belongs to me. But I do know one thing: I'm damned if it belongs to the government.

author: Martin Luther
title: Who loves not women, wine and song remains a fool his whole life long.

author: Angela Merkel
title: Whoever decides to dedicate their life to politics knows that earning money isn't the top priority.

author: Mark Twain
title: Whoever has lived long enough to find out what life is, knows how deep a debt of gratitude we owe to Adam, the first great benefactor of our race. He brought death into the world.

author: Boethius
title: Whose happiness is so firmly established that he has no quarrel from any side with his estate of life?

author: Robert Frost
title: Why abandon a belief merely because it ceases to be true? Cling to it long enough and... it will turn true again, for so it goes. Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.

author: Caroline Knapp
title: Why do I find the fantasy - husband, family, kids - exhausting instead of alluring? Is there something wrong with me? Do I have a life?

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: Why does a person even get up in the morning? You have breakfast, you floss your teeth so you'll have healthy gums in your old age, and then you get in your car and drive down I-10 and die. Life is so stupid I can't stand it.

author: Philip Larkin
title: Why should I let the toad work Squat on my life? Can't I use my wit as a pitchfork and drive the brute off?

author: William James
title: Why should we think upon things that are lovely? Because thinking determines life. It is a common habit to blame life upon the environment. Environment modifies life but does not govern life. The soul is stronger than its surroundings.

author: Bill Parcells
title: Why would you live your life worrying about something that's not going to happen?

author: Roland Barthes
title: Wine is a part of society because it provides a basis not only for a morality but also for an environment; it is an ornament in the slightest ceremonials of French daily life, from the snack to the feast, from the conversation at the local café to the speech at a formal dinner.

author: Denis Waitley
title: Winners are people with definite purpose in life.

author: Bill Rancic
title: Winning 'The Apprentice' changed my life in ways I could never have imagined. It has been an amazing experience working for Donald Trump and I am very grateful for the whole opportunity.

author: Seneca
title: Wisdom does not show itself so much in precept as in life - in firmness of mind and a mastery of appetite. It teaches us to do as well as to talk; and to make our words and actions all of a color.

author: Stephen R. Covey
title: Wisdom is your perspective on life, your sense of balance, your understanding of how the various parts and principles apply and relate to each other. It embraces judgment, discernment, comprehension. It is a gestalt or oneness, and integrated wholeness.

author: Aristophanes
title: Wise people, even though all laws were abolished, would still lead the same life.

author: William Wordsworth
title: With an eye made quiet by the power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, we see into the life of things.

author: George Eliot
title: With memory set smarting like a reopened wound, a man's past is not simply a dead history, an outworn preparation of the present: it is not a repented error shaken loose from the life: it is a still quivering part of himself, bringing shudders and bitter flavors and the tinglings of a merited shame.

author: Amelia E. Barr
title: With renunciation life begins.

author: Carl Rogers
title: With the price of life these days, you've got to get everything for free you can.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Without a measureless and perpetual uncertainty, the drama of human life would be destroyed.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: Without communities, no infant will be sufficiently socialized... and that occurs in the first four or five years of life....The first two years are important....of vital importance. He has to be loved, above all he has to be talked to.

author: Katharine Hepburn
title:
Without discipline, there's no life at all.,
,

author: Joseph Joubert
title: Without duty, life is sort of boneless; it cannot hold itself together.

author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi
title: Without energy life would be extinguished instantaneously, and the cellular fabric would collapse.

author: Lewis Mumford
title: Without fullness of experience, length of days is nothing. When fullness of life has been achieved, shortness of days is nothing. That is perhaps why the young have usually so little fear of death; they live by intensities that the elderly have forgotten.

author: Buddha
title: Without health life is not life; it is only a state of langour and suffering - an image of death.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: Without knowing what I am and why I am here, life is impossible.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Without music life would be a mistake.

author: Jane Austen
title: Without music, life would be a blank to me.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Without music, life would be an error. The German imagines even God singing songs

author: Albert Camus
title: Without work, all life goes rotten. But when work is soulless, life stifles and dies.

author: Voltaire
title: Woe to the makers of literal translations, who by rendering every word weaken the meaning! It is indeed by so doing that we can say the letter kills and the spirit gives life.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Woman's first duty in life is to her dressmaker. What the second duty is no one has yet discovered.

author: Nellie Mcclung
title: Women who set a low value on themselves make life hard for all women.

author: Midge Decter
title: Women's Liberation calls it enslavement but the real truth about the sexual revolution is that it has made of sex an almost chaotically limitless and therefore unmanageable realm in the life of women.

author: Ben Sweetland
title: Wonder if there is life on another planet? Let's suppose there is. Suppose further, that only one star in a trillion has a planet that could support life. If that were the case, then there would be at least 100 million planets that harbored life.

author: Carol Shields
title: Words are our life. We are human because we use language. So I think we are less human when we use less language.

author: Charles Swindoll
title: Words can never adequately convey the incredible impact of our attitudes toward life. The longer I live the more convinced I become that life is 10 percent what happens to us and 90 percent how we respond to it.

author: George Steiner
title: Words that are saturated with lies or atrocity, do not easily resume life.

author: Stephen Hawking
title: Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.,

author: John Lennon
title: Work is life, you know, and without it, there's nothing but fear and insecurity.

author: B. C. Forbes
title: Work is the meat of life, pleasure the dessert.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Work is the order of the day, just as it was at one time, with our first starts and our best efforts. Do you remember? Therein lies its delight. It brings back the forgotten; one's stores of energy, seemingly exhausted, come back to life.

author: Sir Theodore Martin
title: Work is the true elixir of life. The busiest man is the happiest man.

author: Sean O'Casey
title: Work! labor the asparagus me of life; the one great sacrament of humanity from which all other things flow - security, leisure, joy, art, literature, even divinity itself.

author: Heywood Broun
title: Write the news as if your very life depended on it. It does!

author: Anne McCaffrey
title: Writing has been so much a part of my life that I'm really quite annoyed that I can't do as much as I used to.

author: Francoise Sagan
title: Writing is a question of finding a certain rhythm. I compare it to the rhythms of jazz. Much of the time life is a sort of rhythmic progression of three characters. If one tells oneself that life is like that, one feels it less arbitrary.

author: Ahmed Ben Bella
title: Yes, my life is a life of combat; I can say that this has never stopped for a single instant. It is a combat that started for me at the age of 16. I'm 90 years old now, and my motivation hasn't changed; it's the same fervour that drives me.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: Yet the order of the acts is planned And the end of the way inescapable. I am alone; all drowns in the Pharisees' hypocrisy. To live your life is not as simple as to cross a field.

author: W. Clement Stone
title: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?

author: Alan Cohen
title: You are in integrity when the life you are living on the outside matches who you are on the inside.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: You are my heart, my life, my one and only thought.

author: Les Brown
title: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.

author: Dr. Robert Anthony
title: You are wholly complete and your success in life will be in direct proportion to your ability to accept this truth about you.

author: Barry Marshall
title: You can always find stress in someone's life if you want to. You ask a few questions, and eventually, it's, 'Yes, I admit, I was worried about something recently.'

author: Marcia Wieder
title: You can come to understand your purpose in life by slowing down and feeling your heart's desires.

author: Carol Ann Duffy
title: You can find poetry in your everyday life, your memory, in what people say on the bus, in the news, or just what's in your heart.

author: A.L. Williams
title: You can give in to the failure messages and be a bitter deadbeat of excuses. Or you can choose to be happy and positive and excited about life.

author: Zig Ziglar
title: You can have everything in life you want, if you will just help other people get what they want.,

author: Norman Vincent Peale
title: You can have peace of mind, improved health and an ever-increasing flow of energy. Life can be full of joy and satisfaction.

author: Barbara Sher
title: You can learn new things at any time in your life if you're willing to be a beginner. If you actually learn to like being a beginner, the whole world opens up to you.

author: Mohsin Hamid
title: You can live in the same city your entire life and still be completely a foreigner when you step out, in your old age, onto the street.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: You can preach a better sermon with your life than with your lips.

author: Charles E. Popplestone
title: You can really have everything you want, if you go after it, but you will have to want it. The desire for success must be so strong within you that it is the very breath of your life - your first though when you awaken in the morning, your last thought when you go to bed at night...

author: Stevie Wonder
title: You can't base your life on other people's expectations.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: You can't be afraid of getting old. Old is good, if you're gathering in life. Our band is good at understanding that equation.

author: Kimo Paki
title: You can't bring back the past, and you're not promised the future, so enjoy life now.

author: Angela Davis
title: You can't criticize people for wanting to have a decent life or wanting to live decently.

author: Richard Dawkins
title: You can't imagine how gratifying it is to have a reader come up to you and say, 'You changed my life.',

author: Bernhard Goetz
title: You can't let yourself be pushed around. You can't live in fear. I mean, some people do live in fear. You can't live in fear. That's no way to live your life.

author: Junot Diaz
title: You can't regret the life you didn't lead.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.,

author: Zig Ziglar
title: You cannot tailor make your situation in life, but you can tailor make your attitudes to fit those situations.

author: Jo Coudert
title: You do not need to be loved, not at the cost of yourself. The single relationship that is truly central and crucial in a life is the relationship to the self. Of all the people you will know in a lifetime, you are the only one you will never lose.

author: Warren Buffett
title: You do things when the opportunities come along. I've had periods in my life when I've had a bundle of ideas come along, and I've had long dry spells. If I get an idea next week, I'll do something. If not, I won't do a damn thing.

author: Les Brown
title: You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.

author: Bill Bryson
title: You don't have to know anything about baseball to respond to Babe Ruth because he's just this magnificent human being. And a really good story because he was this kid who grew up essentially as an orphan, you know, had a tough life, and then he became the most successful baseball player ever. But he was also a really good guy.

author: Carolyn See
title: You don't want to burden some poor wretch with the entire story of your life.

author: Boris Pasternak
title: You fall into my arms. You are the good gift of destruction's path, When life sickens more than disease. And boldness is the root of beauty. Which draws us together.

author: Brock Lesnar
title: You get so brainwashed. You're on the road 300 days a year, and that's why guys get so messed up. This life becomes a part of them. It's not real, but some guys who are still in the business think it is.

author: Marcus Valerius Martial
title: You give me nothing during your life, but you promise to provide for me at your death. If you are not a fool, you know what I wish for!

author: Carolyn Chute
title: You go through your life feeling like an outsider, and you respond to society in a different way when you feel like an outsider.

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: You had no right to be born; for you make no use of life. Instead of living for, in, and with yourself, as a reasonable being ought, you seek only to fasten your feebleness on some other person's strength.

author: Winston Churchill
title: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.,

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: You have no right to say that I am not sincere. I have found a happiness in art that real life has never given me. I am intensely in earnest about art. There is is a magic and mystery in art that you know nothing of.

author: Vernon Howard
title: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.

author: Ben Carson
title: You have the ability to choose which way you want to go. You have to believe great things are going to happen in your life. Do everything you can - prepare, pray and achieve - to make it happen.

author: Bai Ling
title: You have to accept the storms and the rainy days and the things in life that you sometimes don't want to face.

author: Kevin Costner
title: You have to decide if you're going to wilt like a daisy or if you're just going to go forward and live the life that you've been granted.

author: Carre Otis
title: You have to find a balance with food in your life - you can't take out food. It can be absolutely terrifying.

author: Bob Cousy
title: You have to remember that coaching wasn't sophisticated back then - you didn't have the camps, clinics and all the technical advances that are available today - so from that standpoint, playing with a cast on my arm was a fortunate event in my life.

author: Carlo Rubbia
title: You have two alternatives. One: you can put your life on hold and wait for the phone to ring. Two: you run ahead as if your life depended on it.

author: Bill Bailey
title: You knew exactly who the good guys were and who were the bad guys just by the chord: the good guys got a perfect fifth - strong, compassionate - the bad guys got an augmented fourth... Just a semitone, but sometimes in life when you make the wrong choices, it's just a semitone out.

author: Beatrice Wood
title: You know, God, the power that makes life, whatever it is, had just to make two things, masculine and feminine, for all this mischief. And made them so there is this entirely different point of view about love and sex.

author: Bea Arthur
title: You know, I spend most of my life turning things down. There's a lot of crap out there.

author: Bill Burr
title: You know, it wasn't even that I'm a funny guy, I just loved stand-up comedy and I wanted to do it. It was one of the few things in my life that I knew I was going to be able to do, and I also felt as though I'd be able to do it the way I wanted to do it.

author: Kurt Vonnegut
title: You learn about life by the accidents you have, over and over again

author: Jack Youngblood
title: You learnt that, whatever you are doing in life, obstacles don't matter very much. Pain or other circumstances can be there, but if you want to do a job bad enough, you'll find a way to get it done.

author: Bill Maris
title: You make a great investment in the consumer Internet, maybe you make a lot of money and create something useful, interesting, or fun. But in life sciences, you have a chance to be part of something that lets people live longer and healthier and not lose the people they care about. That is really profound.

author: Marsha Sinetar
title: You may feel like dwelling on your limits or your fears. Don't do it. A perfect prescription for a squandered, unfulfilled life is to accommodate self-defeating feelings while undercutting your finest, most productive ones.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: You may find many contradictory statements and philosophies within my writings. However, to this I will say such is life, for life is full of contradictions.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: You must get your living by loving, or at least half your life is a failure.

author: Barbara Sher
title: You must go after your wish. As soon as you start to pursue a dream, your life wakes up and everything has meaning.

author: John M. Thomas
title: You must regulate your life by the standards you admire when you are at your best.

author: Les Brown
title: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.

author: Yann Martel
title: You must take life the way it comes at you and make the best of it.

author: Anton Chekhov
title: You must trust and believe in people or life becomes impossible.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
title: You must understand the whole of life, not just one little part of it. That is why you must read, that is why you must look at the skies, that is why you must sing and dance, and write poems, and suffer, and understand, for all that is life.

author: Les Brown
title: You need to make a commitment, and once you make it, then life will give you some answers.

author: Warren Buffett
title: You only have to do a very few things right in your life so long as you don't do too many things wrong.

author: Clare Boothe Luce
title: You see few people here in America who really care very much about living a Christian life in a democratic world.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: You see, in life, lots of people know what to do, but few people actually do what they know. Knowing is not enough! You must take action.

author: Carlos Slim
title: You should have more time for you during all of your life - not when you're 65 and retired.

author: Jane Fonda
title: You spend all your life trying to do something they put people in asylums for.

author: Brad Garrett
title: You take away all the other luxuries in life, and if you can make someone smile and laugh, you have given the most special gift: happiness.

author: William Shakespeare
title: You take my life when you do take the means whereby I live.

author: Philip Roth
title: You tasted it. Isn't that enough? Of what do you ever get more than a taste? That's all we're given in life, that's all we're given of life. A taste. There is no more.

author: Andrea Dworkin
title: You think intercourse is a private act; it's not, it's a social act. Men are sexually predatory in life; and women are sexually manipulative. When two individuals come together and leave their gender outside the bedroom door, then they make love.

author: Benjamin Walker
title: You think of George Washington, this man who was larger than life, and in some ways he was. But at the same time, he's just a person.

author: Bronislaw Malinowski
title: You utter a vow or forge a signature and you may find yourself bound for life to a monastery, a woman or prison.

author: Caleb Carr
title: You want to believe that there's one relationship in life that's beyond betrayal. A relationship that's beyond that kind of hurt. And there isn't.

author: Michael Cunningham
title: You want to give him the book of his own life, the book that will locate him, parent him, arm him for the changes.

author: Carlos Slim
title: You want to have a toy and another toy, and that's not maturity. The biggest things in life are not materials.

author: Henry Drummond
title: You will find as you look back upon your life that the moments when you have truly lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: You will find rest from vain fancies if you perform every act in life as though it were your last.

author: Henry Drummond
title: You will find, as you look back upon your life, that the moments when you really lived are the moments when you have done things in the spirit of love.

author: H. Stanley Judd
title: You will live your life secure in that you are no longer manipulated by what other people want you to do and be, but are directed by your own inner desires.

author: Albert Camus
title: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.

author: Mike Murdock
title: You will never change your life until you change something you do daily.

author: Brandi Chastain
title: You'll be dedicated and that's what you should want to be in anything in life - whether it's sports or academics or your relationship. It all stems from finding that fun, that thrill, that excitement.

author: Barbara Hall
title: You're alive. Do something. The directive in life, the moral imperative was so uncomplicated. It could be expressed in single words, not complete sentences. It sounded like this: Look. Listen. Choose. Act.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: You're born single, you die single, but why not being in a relationship is some special 'single' status, I don't understand. Life is less stress being single, I have to admit.

author: Arthur Ashe
title: You've got to get to the stage in life where going for it is more important than winning or losing.

author: Billie Holiday
title: You've got to have something to eat and a little love in your life before you can hold still for any damn body's sermon on how to behave.

author: B. Jowett
title: Young men make great mistakes in life; for one thing, they idealize love too much.

author: Barry Bonds
title: Young players need to know how to take care of themselves for life after baseball.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Your body loves you, but if you do not love your life, it will end it far sooner, thinking it is doing you a favor.

author: Dag Hammarskjöld
title: Your body must become familiar with its death - in all its possible forms and degrees - as a self-evident, imminent, and emotionally neutral step on the way towards the goal you have found worthy of your life.

author: Bruce Lipton
title: Your brain sends out vibrations all the time, and your thoughts affect your life and other people's. They pick up these thoughts and get changed by them. That's why, say, a pacifist gets caught up in a riot situation. It's a field of vibrations - you can 'feel' someone else's thoughts when close to them.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Your capacity to keep your vow will depend on the purity of your life.

author: Gabriele Lusser Rico
title: Your Design mind (right brain) attends to the melody of life, whereas your Sign mind (left brain) attends to the notes that compose the melodies. And here is the key to natural writing: the melodies must come first.

author: Busy Philipps
title: Your first pregnancy you have nothing to do except sleep and take care of yourself and go to prenatal yoga or whatever. Now I have a full-time job, I have a four-year-old, I've got a life that is demanding my attention, so I've gone to prenatal yoga once. It's such a bummer.

author: Les Brown
title: Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.

author: Henrik Ibsen
title: Your home is regarded as a model home, your life as a model life. But all this splendor, and you along with it... it's just as though it were built upon a shifting quagmire. A moment may come, a word can be spoken, and both you and all this splendor will collapse.

author: Alexander Volkov
title: Your journey never ends. Life has a way of changing things in incredible ways.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Your life changes the moment you make a new, congruent, and committed decision.

author: Alan Cohen
title: Your life is not a problem to be solved, but an adventure to be enjoyed. You are doing better than you think.

author: Joseph Campbell
title: Your life is the fruit of your own doing. You have no one to blame but yourself.,

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Your life is what your thoughts make it.

author: Alfred A. Montapert
title: Your life will be no better than the plans you make and the action you take. You are the architect and builder of your own life, fortune, destiny.

author: Werner Erhard
title: Your life works to the degree you keep your agreements.

author: J. G. Gallimore
title: Your self image is your pattern!. Every thought has an activity visualized. Every activity belongs to a pattern. You identify with your pattern or thought. Your patterns leads your life.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Your success story is a bigger story than whatever you're trying to say on stage. Success makes life easier. It doesn't make living easier.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Your success story is a bigger story than whatever you're trying to say on stage... Success makes life easier. It doesn't make living easier.

author: Steve Jobs
title: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.

author: Alan Bennett
title: Your whole life is on the other side of the glass. And there is nobody watching.,

author: Carolyn Wells
title: Youth is a silly, vapid state, Old age with fears and ills is rife; This simple boon I beg of Fate - A thousand years of Middle Life.

author: Samuel Ullman
title: Youth is not a time of life; it is a state of mind.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Youth is to all the glad season of life; but often only by what it hopes, not by what it attains, or what it escapes.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
title: Youth is too tumultuous for felicity; old age too insecure for happiness. The period most favorable to enjoyment, in a vigorous, fortunate, and generous life, is that between forty and sixty.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Youth! There is nothing like youth. The middle-aged are mortgaged to Life. The old are in Life's lumber-room. But youth is the Lord of Life. Youth has a kingdom waiting for it. Every one is born a king, and most people die in exile.

author: Barbara Hepworth
title: [My works are] an imitation of my own past and present and of my own creative vitality as I experience them in one particular instant of my emotional and imaginative life...

author: William Wordsworth
title: … with an eye made by quite by power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, We see into the life of things.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
title: ''I'' is a militant social tendency, working to hold and enlarge its place in the general current of tendencies. So far as it can it waxes, as all life does. To think of it as apart from society is a palpable absurdity of which no one could be guilty who really saw it as a fact of life.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: A bachelor's life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.

author: Lewis Mumford
title: A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth or perfection is a poverty-stricken day; and a succession of such days is fatal to human life.

author: Walter Bagehot
title: A family on the throne is an interesting idea. It brings down the pride of sovereignty to the level of petty life.

author: Albert Einstein
title: A hundred times every day I remind myself that my inner and outer life depend on the labors of other men, living and dead, and that I must exert myself in order to give in the same measure as I have received and am still receiving.

author: Anthony Burgess
title: All human life is here, but the Holy Ghost seems to be somewhere else.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: All the fame you should look for in life is to have lived it quietly.

author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
title: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death. If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present.

author: Simone Weil
title: Every perfect life is a parable invented by God.

author: Dag Hammarskjöld
title: Fatigue dulls the pain, but awakes enticing thoughts of death. So! that is the way in which you are tempted to overcome your loneliness - by making the ultimate escape from life. - No! It may be that death is to be your ultimate gift to life: it must not be an act of treachery against it.

author: Douglas Adams
title: He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.

author: Maya Angelou
title: I find it interesting that the meanest life, the poorest existence, is attributed to God's will, but as human beings become more affluent, as their living standard and style begin to ascend the material scale, God descends the scale of responsibility at a commensurate speed.

author: William Hazlitt
title: I would like to spend my whole life traveling, if I could borrow another life to spend at home.

author: Simone Weil
title: Imagination and fiction make up more than three quarters of our life.

author: Simone Weil
title: Imagination is always the fabric of social life and the dynamic of history. The influence of real needs and compulsions, of real interests and materials, is indirect because the crowd is never conscious of it.

author: Aristotle
title: In poverty and other misfortunes of life, true friends are a sure refuge. The young they keep out of mischief; to the old they are a comfort and aid in their weakness, and those in the prime of life they incite to noble deeds.

author: Simone Weil
title: Learn to reject friendship, or rather the dream of friendship. To want friendship is a great fault. Friendship ought to be a gratuitous joy, like the joys afforded by art, or life (like aesthetic joys). I must refuse it in order to be worthy to receive it

author: Simone Weil
title: Life does not need to mutilate itself in order to be pure.

author: Henry Brooks Adams
title: One friend in a lifetime is much, two are many, three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.

author: Elias Canetti
title: One should not confuse the craving for life with endorsement of it.

author: Alfred Adler
title: The feeling of inferiority rules the mental life and can be clearly recognized in the sense of incompleteness and unfulfillment, and in the uninterrupted struggle both of individuals and humanity.

author: Randolph Silliman Bourne
title: The logic of the heart is usually better than the logic of the head, and the consistency of sympathy is superior as rule for life to the consistency of the intellect.

author: Greg Anderson
title: The perfect no-stress environment is the grave. When we change our perception we gain control. The stress becomes a challenge, not a threat. When we commit to action, to actually doing something rather than feeling trapped by events, the stress in our life becomes manageable.

author: Andre Breton
title: The work of art, just like any fragment of human life considered in its deepest meaning, seems to me devoid of value if it does not offer the hardness, the rigidity, the regularity, the luster on every interior and exterior facet, of the crystal.

author: Bernard Mandeville
title: There is no intrinsic worth in money but what is alterable with the times, and whether a guinea goes for twenty pounds or for a shilling, it is the labor of the poor and not the high and low value that is set on gold or silver, which all the comforts of life must arise from.

author: John Ruskin
title: There is no wealth but life.

author: Elias Canetti
title: When you write down your life, every page should contain something no one has ever heard about.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A well-tied tie is the first serious step in life.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Anybody can write a three-volume novel. It merely requires a complete ignorance of both life and literature.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Misfortunes one can endure - they come from outside, they are accidents. But to suffer for one's own faults - Ah! there is the sting of life.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Before success comes in any man's life, he's sure to meet with much temporary defeat and, perhaps some failures. When defeat overtakes a man, the easiest and the most logical thing to do is to quit. That's exactly what the majority of men do.

author: author
title: title

author: Helen Schucman
title: Dreams show you that you have the power...

author: Dr. Joyce Brothers
title: Before your dreams can come true, you have to have those dreams.

author: Les Brown
title: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.

author: John Barrymore
title: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.

author: J. G. Ballard
title: The American Dream has run out of gas. The car has stopped. It no longer supplies the world with its images, its dreams, its fantasies. No more. It's over. It supplies the world with its nightmares now: the Kennedy assassination, Watergate, Vietnam...

author: Zadok Rabinwitz
title: A man's dreams are an index to his greatness.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Our truest life is when we are in our dreams awake.

author: Umberto Eco
title: A dream is a scripture, and many scriptures are nothing but dreams.

author: Anais Nin
title: Dreams are necessary to life.

author: Les Brown
title: A lot of people do not muster the courage to live their dreams because they are afraid to die.

author: Les Brown
title: Choosing goals that are important to you is one of the most essential things you can do in order to live your dreams.

author: Barbara Sher
title: And our dreams are who we are.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Dream no small dreams for they have no power to move the hearts of men.

author: Thomas E. Lawrence
title: All men dream, but unequally. Those that dream at night in the dusty recesses of their minds awake the next day to find that their dreams were just vanity. But those who dream during the day with their eyes wide open are dangerous men; they act out their dreams to make them reality.

author: Elizabeth Jennings
title: At last now you can be what the old cannot recall and the young long for in dreams, yet still include them all.

author: William B. Yeats
title: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.

author: Assata Shakur
title: Dreams and reality are opposites. Action synthesizes them.

author: Robert Conklin
title: Dreams get you into the future and add excitement to the present.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: Freedom is not an ideal, it is not even a protection, if it means nothing more than freedom to stagnate, to live without dreams, to have no greater aim than a second car and another television set.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Friends, such as we desire, are dreams and fables.

author: Emile Durkheim
title: From top to bottom of the ladder, greed is aroused without knowing where to find ultimate foothold. Nothing can calm it, since its goal is far beyond all it can attain. Reality seems valueless by comparison with the dreams of fevered imaginations; reality is therefore abandoned.

author: Les Brown
title: Help others achieve their dreams and you will achieve yours.

author: Aeschylus
title: I know how men in exile feed on dreams of hope.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.

author: Madonna
title: I stand for freedom of expression, doing what you believe in, and going after your dreams.

author: Eugène Ionesco
title: Ideologies separate us. Dreams and anguish bring us together.

author: Erma Bombeck
title: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.

author: Pindar
title: Men are the dreams of a shadow.

author: Louis Aragon
title: O reason, reason, abstract phantom of the waking state, I had already expelled you from my dreams, now I have reached a point where those dreams are about to become fused with apparent realities: now there is only room here for myself.

author: Heywood Broun
title: The most prolific period of pessimism comes at twenty-one or thereabouts, when the first attempt is made to translate dreams into reality.

author: Hervey Allen
title: The only time you really live fully is from thirty to sixty. The young are slaves to dreams; the old servants of regrets. Only the middle-aged have all their five senses in the keeping of their wits.

author: Cameron Sinclair
title: A true architect is not an artist but an optimistic realist. They take a diverse number of stakeholders, extract needs, concerns, and dreams, then create a beautiful yet tangible solution that is loved by the users and the community at large. We create vessels in which life happens.

author: Gaston Bachelard
title: A word is a bud attempting to become a twig. How can one not dream while writing? It is the pen which dreams. The blank page gives the right to dream.

author: Carl Perkins
title: After all those days in the cotton fields, the dreams came true on a gold record on a piece of wood. It's in my den where I can look at it every day. I wear it out lookin' at it.

author: Amy Lowell
title: All books are either dreams or swords.

author: William Faulkner
title: All of us failed to match our dreams of perfection. So I rate us on the basis of our splendid failure to do the impossible.

author: Walt Disney
title: All our dreams can come true — if we have the courage to pursue them.

author: Alice Hoffman
title: All the characters in my books are imagined, but all have a bit of who I am in them - much like the characters in your dreams are all formed by who you are.

author: Beth Henley
title: And all writing is creating or spinning dreams for other people so they won't have to bother doing it themselves.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Cherish you visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul; the blue prints of your ultimate achievements.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: Codi: So you think we all just have animal dreams. We can't think of anything to dream except our ordinary lives. Loyd: Only if you have an ordinary life. If you want sweet dreams, you've got to live a sweet life.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before.

author: Barbara Billingsley
title: Don't think your dreams don't come true, because they do. You'd better be careful what you wish for. And I truly and honestly - one day I am doing the 'Beaver' show and I said, 'This is the show I have always wanted to do.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: Dream manfully and nobly, and thy dreams shall be prophets.

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
title: Dreams about the future are always filled with gadgets.

author: Abdul Kalam
title: Dreams are not what you see in sleep. They are the things that do not let you sleep.

author: Benjamin Rush
title: Dreams are nothing but incoherent ideas, occasioned by partial or imperfect sleep.

author: Havelock Ellis
title: Dreams are real as long as they last. Can we say more of life?

author: Carl Jung
title: Dreams are the guiding words of the soul. Why should I henceforth not love my dreams and not make their riddling images into objects of my daily consideration?

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Dreams are the touchstones of our character.,

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title:
Dreams are true while they last, and do we not live in dreams?,
,

author: John Updike
title: Dreams come true; without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.

author: Sir James Matthew Barrie
title: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.

author: Adelaide Anne Procter
title: Dreams grow holy put in action.

author: Zig Ziglar
title: Dreams grow if you grow.,

author: Djuna Barnes
title: Dreams have only the pigmentation of fact.

author: Anais Nin
title: Dreams pass into the reality of action. From the actions stems the dream again; and this interdependence produces the highest form of living.

author: Gail Godwin
title: Dreams say what they mean, but they don't say it in daytime language.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: Dreams will get you nowhere, a good kick in the pants will take you a long way.

author: Amy Hempel
title: Dreams: the place most of us get what we need.

author: Brendan Dooling
title: Every young male actor dreams of being James Bond in an action movie. And that's their first role. But the truth is, when it comes down to it, that's not relatable.

author: Arthur Christopher Benson
title: Friend, of my infinite dreams Little enough endures; Little howe'er it seems, It is yours, all yours.

author: Vladimir Nabokov
title: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.

author: Jean Rostand
title: God, that checkroom of our dreams.

author: Jean Rostand
title: God, that dumping ground of our dreams.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: Going back to the moon is not visionary in restoring space leadership for America. Like its Apollo predecessor, it will prove to be a dead end littered with broken spacecraft, broken dreams and broken policies.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Gonna be a twister to blow everything down , That ain't got the faith to stand its ground , Blow away the dreams that tear you apart , Blow away the dreams that break your heart , Blow away the lies that leave you nothing but lost and brokenhearted.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Half of the people can be part right all of the time, , Some of the people can be all right part of the time, , But all the people can't be all right all the time. , I think Abraham Lincoln said that. , I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours. , I said that.

author: Anatoly Karpov
title: Happiness should always remain a bit incomplete. After all, dreams are boundless.

author: Langston Hughes
title: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken winged bird that cannot fly.

author: John Huston
title: Hollywood has always been a cage... a cage to catch our dreams.

author: Matthew Prior
title: Hopes are but the dreams of those that wake.

author: Bram Stoker
title: How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads; to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams.

author: Bob Dylan
title: I am against nature. I don't dig nature at all. I think nature is very unnatural. I think the truly natural things are dreams, which nature can't touch with decay.

author: Arsenio Hall
title: I am consumed with the fear of failing. Reaching deep down and finding confidence has made all my dreams come true.

author: Allen Tate
title: I am not ridiculing verbal mechanisms, dreams, or repressions as origins of poetry; all three of them and more besides may have a great deal to do with it.

author: Robert Fulghum
title: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge - that myth is more potent than history. I believe that dreams are more powerful than facts - That hope always triumphs over experience - That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.

author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach
title: I don't use drugs, my dreams are frightening enough.

author: Toni Morrison
title: I dream a dream that dreams back at me.

author: Bruce Dickinson
title: I enjoy making solo albums because over the years it's evolved into more of a genuine personal expression of story-telling and day dreams, and I work in a way that has more control.

author: Andre Breton
