title: I have always been amazed at the way an ordinary observer lends so much more credence and attaches so much more importance to waking events than to those occurring in dreams... Man... is above all the plaything of his memory.

author: Emily Brontë
title: I have dreamed in my life, dreams that have stayed with me ever after, and changed my ideas; they have gone through and through me, like wine through water, and altered the color of my mind.

author: Jonas Edward Salk
title: I have had dreams, and I have had nightmares. I overcame the nightmares because of my dreams.

author: William B. Yeats
title: I have spread my dreams under your feet; Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.

author: H. P. Lovecraft
title:
I never ask a man what his business is, for it never interests me. What I ask him about are his thoughts and dreams.,
,

author: Man Ray
title: I paint what cannot be photographed, that which comes from the imagination or from dreams, or from an unconscious drive. I photograph the things that I do not wish to paint, the things which already have an existence.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: I prefer to be a dreamer among the humblest, with visions to be realized, than lord among those without dreams and desires.

author: Bill Gates
title: I really had a lot of dreams when I was a kid, and I think a great deal of that grew out of the fact that I had a chance to read a lot.

author: Augusten Burroughs
title: I think people tend to see the bigger point, which is maybe not fitting in and feeling like you didn't have the childhood that you expected you would have, or that you felt lonely or struggled with drugs and alcohol or just that you were able to achieve your dreams.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: I want my boys to have an understanding of people's emotions, their insecurities, people's distress, and their hopes and dreams.

author: Joseph Heller
title: I want to keep my dreams, even bad ones, because without them, I might have nothing all night long.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: I want to say to you that there is life and dreams and surprises after 30-and 40, and 50, and 60, and 77! Believe me, life is one long surprise.

author: Luigi Pirandello
title: I would love to spend all my time writing to you; I'd love to share with you all that goes through my mind, all that weighs on my heart, all that gives air to my soul; phantoms of art, dreams that would be so beautiful if they could come true.

author: Walt Disney
title: I'd say it's been my biggest problem all my life... it's money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.,

author: Bob Dylan
title: I'll let you be in my dreams if I can be in yours.,

author: Anthony Robbins
title: I've continued to recognize the power individuals have to change virtually anything and everything in their lives in an instant. I've learned that the resources we need to turn our dreams into reality are within us, merely waiting for the day when we decide to wake up and claim our birthright.

author: Bill Paxton
title: I've had a life where things have worked out for me beyond my wildest dreams, and my brother's had just the opposite.

author: Benjamin Clementine
title: I've learned in the little bit of my life so far that you can't fool people. And so I only tell people what I think about: my ambitions, my dreams, what inspires me.

author: Bruce Coville
title: Ideas are all around you - everything gives you ideas. But the real source is the part of your brain that dreams.

author: Arthur Machen
title: If a man dreams that he has committed a sin before which the sun hid his face, it is often safe to conjecture that, in sheer forgetfulness, he wore a red tie, or brown boots with evening dress.

author: Adam Duritz
title: If dreams are like movies, then memories are films about ghosts.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.

author: B. W. Powe
title: If our dreams can last, then we could turn our time and place to gold.

author: Herman Melville
title: If some books are deemed most baneful and their sale forbid, how, then, with deadlier facts, not dreams of doting men? Those whom books will hurt will not be proof against events. Events, not books, should be forbid.

author: Yann Martel
title: If we, citizens, do not support our artists, then we sacrifice our imagination on the altar of crude reality and we end up believing in nothing and having worthless dreams.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: If you are prepared to accept the consequences of your dreams then you must still regard America today with the same naive enthusiasm as the generations that discovered the New World.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: If you can't read, it's going to be hard to realize dreams.,

author: Alice Walker
title: If you want to have a life that is worth living, a life that expresses your deepest feelings and emotions and cares and dreams, you have to fight for it.,

author: Billy Campbell
title: If you were to ask my agent, they would confirm this: I'm drawn to locations. What really drew me to 'The 4400,' aside from the fact that it was sci-fi, was the fact that it was shot in the city of my dreams: Vancouver.

author: William B. Yeats
title: In dreams begin responsibility.

author: Leonard Cohen
title: In dreams the truth is learned that all good works are done in the absence of a caress.

author: Bo Burnham
title: In high school, I worked eight hours a day just so I could get into the college of my dreams and say that I got in - and I never went.

author: Abram L. Urban
title: In my garden there is a large place for sentiment. My garden of flowers is also my garden of thoughts and dreams. The thoughts grow as freely as the flowers, and the dreams are as beautiful.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: In your Salvation shelter I saw poverty, misery, cold and hunger. You gave them bread and treacle and dreams of heaven. I give from thirty shillings a week to twelve thousand a year. They find their own dreams; but I look after the drainage.

author: Haniel Long
title: In youth the human body drew me and was the object of my secret and natural dreams. But body after body has taken away from me that sensual phosphorescence which my youth delighted in. Within me is no disturbing interplay now, but only the steady currents of adaptation and of sympathy.

author: Georges Bataille
title: Intellectual despair results in neither weakness nor dreams, but in violence. It is only a matter of knowing how to give vent to one's rage; whether one only wants to wander like madmen around prisons, or whether one wants to overturn them.

author: Man Ray
title: It has never been my object to record my dreams, just the determination to realize them.

author: Arthur Machen
title: It is all nonsense, to be sure; and so much the greater nonsense inasmuch as the true interpretation of many dreams - not by any means of all dreams - moves, it may be said, in the opposite direction to the method of psycho-analysis.

author: Don DeLillo
title: It is so much simpler to bury reality than it is to dispose of dreams.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: It is the individual only who is timeless. Societies, cultures, and civilizations - past and present - are often incomprehensible to outsiders, but the individual's hungers, anxieties, dreams, and preoccupations have remained unchanged through the millennia.

author: Benjamin E. Mays
title: It isn't a calamity to die with dreams unfulfilled, but it is a calamity not to dream.

author: Les Brown
title: It takes someone with a vision of the possibilities to attain new levels of experience. Someone with the courage to live his dreams.

author: Blanche Lincoln
title: It's not my job to dream your dreams. It's my job to make your dreams become a reality.

author: Billie Jean King
title: It's really impossible for athletes to grow up. On the one hand, you're a child, still playing a game. But on the other hand, you're a superhuman hero that everyone dreams of being. No wonder we have such a hard time understanding who we are.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: Keep true to the dreams of your youth.

author: James Redfield
title: Knowing our personal mission further enhances the flow of mysterious coincidences as we are guided toward our destinies. First we have a question, then dreams, daydreams, and intuitions lead us toward the answers, which usually are synchronistically provided by the wisdom of another human being.

author: Basil of Caesarea
title: Let sleep itself be an exercise in piety, for such as our life and conduct have been, so also of necessity will be our dreams.

author: Arna Bontemps
title: Let us keep the dance of rain our fathers kept and tread our dreams beneath the jungle sky.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Like dreams, statistics are a form of wish fulfillment.

author: Antonio Tabucchi
title: Literature for me isn't a workaday job, but something which involves desires, dreams and fantasy.

author: Albert Claude
title: Looking back 25 years later, what I may say is that the facts have been far better than the dreams. In the long course of cell life on this earth it remained, for our age for our generation, to receive the full ownership of our inheritance.

author: Alphonse Karr
title: Love is the most terrible, and also the most generous of the passions; it is the only one which includes in its dreams the happiness of someone else.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: Man dreams of fame while woman wakes to love.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Man, alone, has the power to transform his thoughts into physical reality; man, alone, can dream and make his dreams come true.,

author: David Gemmell
title: May all your dreams but one come true, for what is life without a dream?

author: Sister Corita Kent
title: Maybe we are less than our dreams, but that less would make us more than some Gods would dream of.

author: William James
title: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they've got a second. Give your dreams all you've got and you'll be amazed at the energy that comes out of you.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: Much can be inferred about a man from his mistress: in her one beholds his weaknesses and his dreams.

author: Joseph Campbell
title: Myths are public dreams, dreams are private myths.

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Never give up on what you really want to do. The person with big dreams is more powerful than the one with all the facts.,

author: José Saramago
title: No human being can achieve all he or she desires in this life except in dreams, so good night all.

author: W. Clement Stone
title: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.

author: Marian Wright Edelman
title: No person has the right to rain on your dreams.

author: William Wordsworth
title: Not Chaos, not the darkest pit of lowest Erebus, nor aught of blinder vacancy, scooped out by help of dreams - can breed such fear and awe as fall upon us often when we look into our Minds, into the Mind of Man.

author: Arthur Machen
title: Now, everybody, I suppose, is aware that in recent years the silly business of divination by dreams has ceased to be a joke and has become a very serious science.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Old age realizes the dreams of youth: look at Dean Swift; in his youth he built an asylum for the insane, in his old age he was himself an inmate.

author: A. B. Yehoshua
title: One of the dreams of Zionism was to be a bridge. Instead, we are creating exclusion between the East and the West instead of creating bridges; we are contributing to the conflict between East and West by our stupid desire to have more.

author: J. B. Yeats
title: Only for his dreams is a man responsible, his actions are what he must do.

author: Terry Pratchett
title:
Only in our dreams are we free. The rest of the time we need wages.,
,
,
,
,

author: Gerard De Nerval
title: Our dreams are a second life. I have never been able to penetrate without a shudder those ivory or horned gates which separate us from the invisible world.

author: Amos Bronson Alcott
title: Our dreams drench us in senses, and senses steps us again in dreams.

author: Anais Nin
title: Our life is composed greatly from dreams, from the unconscious, and they must be brought into connection with action. They must be woven together.

author: Ralph Lauren
title: People ask how can a Jewish kid from the Bronx do preppy clothes? Does it have to do with class and money? It has to do with dreams.

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: People's dreams are made out of what they do all day. The same way a dog that runs after rabbits will dream of rabbits. It's what you do that makes your soul, not the other way around.

author: Ben Nicholson
title: Politics are beautiful. They enable a community to live collectively with one another. It's not about stabbing each other in the back; it's about enabling people to reach their dreams and pursue happiness.

author: Raoul Vaneigem
title: Production and consumption are the nipples of modern society. Thus suckled, humanity grows in strength and beauty; rising standard of living, all modern conveniences, distractions of all kinds, culture for all, the comfort of your dreams.

author: Tupac Shakur
title: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for real.,

author: Ludwig Feuerbach
title: Religion is the dream of the human mind. But even in dreams we do not find ourselves in emptiness or in heaven, but on earth, in the realm of reality; we only see real things in the entrancing splendor of imagination and caprice, instead of in the simple daylight of reality and necessity.

author: Mary Webb
title: Saddle your dreams before you ride em.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: Say Yes to the seedlings and a giant forest cleaves the sky. Say Yes to the universe and the planets become your neighbors. Say Yes to dreams of love and freedom. It is the password to utopia.

author: Bernard Malamud
title: She entered his dreams sane and left mad. She began with words of love and ended with sounds that frightened him.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Sleep hath its own world, and a wide realm of wild reality. And dreams in their development have breath, and tears, and tortures, and the touch of joy.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: Sometimes an hour of Fate's serenest weather Strikes through our changeful sky its coming beams; Somewhere above us, in elusive ether, Waits the fulfilment of our dearest dreams.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: Sports nurtures dreams of achieving self confidence and masculine striving for the skinny kid watching a boxer dance around the ring with sublime ease.

author: Barack Obama
title: That is the true genius of America, a faith in the simple dreams of its people, the insistence on small miracles.

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.,

author: Henry Miller
title: The dreamer whose dreams are non-utilitarian has no place in this world. In this world the poet is anathema, the thinker a fool, the artist an escapist, the man of vision a criminal.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Carl Sagan
title: The gears of poverty, ignorance, hopelessness and low self-esteem interact to create a kind of perpetual failure machine that grinds down dreams from generation to generation. We all bear the cost of keeping it running. Illiteracy is its linchpin.

author: John Berger
title: The human imagination... has great difficulty in living strictly within the confines of a materialist practice or philosophy. It dreams, like a dog in its basket, of hares in the open.

author: Vic Braden
title: The moment of enlightenment is when a person's dreams of possibilities become images of probabilities.

author: H Broun
title: The most profilic period of pessimism comes at twenty-one, or thereabouts, when the first attempt is made to translate dreams into reality.

author: Tupac Shakur
title: The only thing that comes to a sleeping man is dreams.,

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: The present generation, wearied by its chimerical efforts, relapses into complete indolence. Its condition is that of a man who has only fallen asleep towards morning: first of all come great dreams, then a feeling of laziness, and finally a witty or clever excuse for remaining in bed.

author: Karl Kraus
title: The psychoanalysts pick our dreams as if they were our pockets.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The true critic is he who bears within himself the dreams and ideas and feelings of myriad generations, and to whom no form of thought is alien, no emotional impulse obscure.

author: Og Mandino
title: The victory of success is half won when one gains the habit of setting goals and achieving them. Even the most tedious chore will become endurable as you parade through each day convinced that every task, no matter how menial or boring, brings you closer to fulfilling your dreams.

author: Audre Lorde
title: The white fathers told us: I think, therefore I am. The black goddess within each of us - the poet - whispers in our dreams: I feel, therefore I can be free.

author: Bob Goddard
title: The years forever fashion new dreams when old ones go. God pity a one-dream man.

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: There's a good deal in common between the mind's eye and the TV screen, and though the TV set has all too often been the boobtube, it could be, it can be, the box of dreams.

author: Carrie Fisher
title: There's a line I have that our family was designed more for public than for private. But there are definitely some things that are only mine. I am someone who dreams at night, and you don't know what I'm dreaming.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: They've promised that dreams can come true - but forgot to mention that nightmares are dreams, too.

author: Abdul Kalam
title: This is my belief: that through difficulties and problems God gives us the opportunity to grow. So when your hopes and dreams and goals are dashed, search among the wreckage, you may find a golden opportunity hidden in the ruins.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Thought are but dreams till their effects are tried.

author: Ben Carson
title: Through hard work, perseverance and a faith in God, you can live your dreams.

author: Leonard Cohen
title: To every people the land is given on condition. Perceived or not, there is a Covenant, beyond the constitution, beyond sovereign guarantee, beyond the nation's sweetest dreams of itself.

author: Ernst Fischer
title: To provoke dreams of terror in the slumber of prosperity has become the moral duty of literature.

author: Les Brown
title: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.

author: William Butler Yeats
title: Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.,

author: Peter Ustinov
title: Unfortunately, the balance of nature decrees that a super-abundance of dreams is paid for by a growing potential for nightmares.

author: Jesse Owens
title: We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort.

author: Billy Barty
title: We are people with all the hopes, dreams, passions, and faults of everyone else. Eighty percent of us are born into families with no history of dwarfism.

author: Carl Jung
title: We are so captivated by and entangled in our subjective consciousness that we have forgotten the age-old fact that God speaks chiefly through dreams and visions.

author: William Shakespeare
title:
We are such stuff,
As dreams are made off, and our little life,
Is rounded with a sleep.

author: William Shakespeare
title: We are such stuff as dreams are made on, and our little life, is rounded with a sleep.

author: Jimmy Carter
title: We become not a melting pot but a beautiful mosaic. Different people, different beliefs, different yearnings, different hopes, different dreams.

author: Raoul Vaneigem
title: We can escape the commonplace only by manipulating it, controlling it, thrusting it into our dreams or surrendering it to the free play of our subjectivity.

author: Judy Garland
title: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: We do not really feel grateful toward those who make our dreams come true; they ruin our dreams.

author: Zelda Fitzgerald
title: We grew up founding our dreams on the infinite promise of American advertising. I still believe that one can learn to play the piano by mail and that mud will give you a perfect complexion.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: We grow by our dreams.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: We grow great by dreams. All big men are dreamers.

author: Burt Rutan
title: We need affordable space travel to inspire our youth, to let them know that they can experience their dreams, can set significant goals and be in a position to lead all of us to future progress in exploration, discovery and fun. Thanks to the X Prize for the inspiration.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: We seem but to linger in manhood to tell the dreams of our childhood, and they vanish out of memory ere we learn the language.

author: Henry S. Haskins
title: We should train our desires to show the way to our dreams.

author: Jesse Jackson
title: We've removed the ceiling above our dreams. There are no more impossible dreams.

author: Salvador Dali
title: What is a television apparatus to man, who has only to shut his eyes to see the most inaccessible regions of the seen and the never seen, who has only to imagine in order to pierce through walls and cause all the planetary Baghdad's of his dreams to rise from the dust.

author: Pedro Calderón de la Barca
title: What is life? A frenzy. What is life? An illusion, a shadow, a fiction. And the greatest good is trivial; for all life is a dream and all dreams are dreams.

author: Greg Anderson
title: When we are motivated by goals that have deep meaning, by dreams that need completion, by pure love that needs expressing, then we truly live life.

author: Les Brown
title: When you face your fear, most of the time you will discover that it was not really such a big threat after all. We all need some form of deeply rooted, powerful motivation - it empowers us to overcome obstacles so we can live our dreams.

author: Marian Anderson
title: When you stop having dreams and ideals - well, you might as well stop altogether.

author: Libby Houston
title: When your dreams tire, they go underground and out of kindness that's where they stay.

author: Seneca
title: Why do people not confess vices? It is because they have not yet laid them aside. It is a waking person only who can tell their dreams.

author: Rosa Parks
title: Without a vision the people perish, but without courage dreams die.

author: Rohinton Mistry
title: World can be a bewildering place, and dreams and ambitions are often paths to the most pernicious of traps.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Yet it is in our idleness, in our dreams, that the submerged truth sometimes comes to the top.

author: Marcia Wieder
title: You can change your beliefs so they empower your dreams and desires. Create a strong belief in yourself and what you want.

author: Mark Victor Hansen
title: You control your future, your destiny. What you think about comes about. By recording your dreams and goals on paper, you set in motion the process of becoming the person you most want to be. Put your future in good hands - your own.

author: Bryce Harper
title: You don't ever want to go out there and not be the best. You want to be the best cop that you can. Be the best writer you can be. Everybody has their goals. Everybody has their dreams.

author: Denis Waitley
title: You have all the reason in the world to achieve your grandest dreams. Imagination plus innovation equals realization.

author: Les Brown
title: You have the courage and power to live your dreams.

author: Abdul Kalam
title: You have to dream before your dreams can come true.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: You may give them your love but not your thoughts. For they have their own thoughts. You may house their bodies but not their souls, for their souls dwell in the house of tomorrow, which you cannot visit, not even in your dreams.

author: Tennessee Williams
title: You said, ''They're harmless dreamers and they're loved by the people.'' - ''What,'' I asked you, ''is harmless about a dreamer, and what,'' I asked you, ''is harmless about the love of the people? Revolution only needs good dreamers who remember their dreams.''

author: Ben Gibbard
title: You'll be loved you'll be loved , Like you never have known , The memories of me , Will seem more like bad dreams , Just a series of blurs , Like I never occurred , Someday you will be loved

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakens.

author: Simone Weil
title: A test of what is real is that it is hard and rough. Joys are found in it, not pleasure. What is pleasant belongs to dreams.

author: James Allen
title: Dream lofty dreams, and as you dream, so shall you become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall one day be; your ideal is the prophecy of what you shall at last unveil.

author: author
title: title

author: Lana Turner
title: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.

author: Mark Twain
title: Honesty is the best policy - when there is money in it.

author: John Berry
title: A good idea plus capable men cannot fail; it is better than money in the bank.

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: I don't want to make money. I just want to be wonderful.

author: Douglas Adams
title: To give real service you must add something which cannot be bought or measured with money, and that is sincerity and integrity.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Because people have no thoughts to deal in, they deal cards, and try and win one another's money. Idiots!

author: Fjodor M. Dostojewski
title: A real gentleman, even if he loses everything he owns, must show no emotion. Money must be so far beneath a gentleman that it is hardly worth troubling about.

author: Rose Macaulay
title: : One should, I think, always give children money, for they will spend it for themselves far more profitably than we can ever spend it for them.

author: Stephen Leacock
title: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting human intelligence long enough to get money from it.

author: Katherine Mansfield
title: : I must say I hate money but it's the lack of it I hate most.

author: S. Leacock
title: Advertising may be described as the science of arresting the human intelligence long enough to get money from it.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Almost any man knows how to earn money, but not one in a million knows how to spend it.

author: Charles Swindoll
title: Attitude is more important than the past, than education, than money, than circumstances, than what people do or say. It is more important than appearance, giftedness, or skill.

author: Joey Adams
title: Bankruptcy is a legal proceeding in which you put your money in your pants pocket and give your coat to your creditors.

author: Ann Landers
title: Class is an aura of confidence that is being sure without being cocky. Class has nothing to do with money. Class never runs scared. It is self-discipline and self-knowledge. It's the sure footedness that comes with having proved you can meet life.

author: Billy Wilder
title: France is the country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: He that is of the opinion money will do everything may well be suspected of doing everything for money.

author: Robert Graves
title: If there's no money in poetry, neither is there poetry in money.

author: Beth Ditto
title: 'Get a Job' is about all the rich kids we knew when we were younger, kids who never had jobs but always had money for partying or getting their hair done.

author: Bobby Flay
title: 'The Food Network' was just starting in New York, and I was getting lots of attention from Mesa Grill. They had no money, so if you couldn't get there by subway, you couldn't be on. It wasn't like TV was something I really wanted to do - but I knew it would be great publicity for my restaurants.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: ...when a society is reaching its end, in the last couple of centuries you have... a misplacement of satisfactions. You find your emotional satisfaction in making a lot of money... or in proving to the poor, half-naked people in Southeast Asia that you can kill them in large numbers.

author: Bob Saget
title: 25, 30 years ago, that meant something, they were making some money. And they were doing all sorts of comedy, screaming at the audience, basically crowd control. And then there was the whole urban comedy scene.

author: Bob Hope
title: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.

author: Everett M. Dirksen
title: A billion here, a billion there, and soon you're talking about real money.

author: Henry Ford
title: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: A drinker has a hole under his nose that all his money runs into.

author: Brendan I. Koerner
title: A duped newspaper or magazine could contend that a fiction-spouting journalist obtained part of his salary via fraud, and use a criminal proceeding to try and recoup that money. Given the profession's notoriously low wages, however, it's probably not worth the publicity headache and legal fees. No news organization has ever pursued such a case.

author: Helen Rowland
title: A fool and her money are soon courted.

author: Will Rogers
title:
A fool and his money are soon elected.,
,

author: Al Bernstein
title: A fool and his money get a lot of publicity.

author: William Shenstone
title: A fool and his words are soon parted; a man of genius and his money.

author: Bobby Bowden
title: A guy's who has all the money he needs and never faced any hard times, he won't have any character. But when you've had it tough and you've had it rough and you thought you were at the end of the rope and you work your way out of it, that's the way you build character.

author: Anne Northup
title: A large family and Democrats have a lot in common: teenagers and Democrats are always happy spending other people's money.

author: John Ruskin
title:
A little thought and a little kindness are often worth more than a great deal of money.,
,

author: Bob Newhart
title: A lot of money is spent trying to keep people alive who don't necessarily want to be alive.

author: Bradley Joseph
title: A lot of musicians don't learn the business. You just have to be well-rounded in both areas. You have to understand publishing. You have to understand how you make money, what's in demand, what helps you make the most out of your talent.

author: Billy Eichner
title: A lot of people in Hollywood, and everywhere pretty much, operate on fear. No one wants to get fired, so everyone's scared to take a chance. There's money involved, and there are careers and reputations on the line.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.,

author: Babe Ruth
title: A man who knows he's making money for other people ought to get some of the profits he brings in. Don't make any difference if it's baseball or a bank or a vaudeville show. It's business, I tell you. There ain't no sentiment to it. Forget that stuff.

author: Andrew William Mellon
title: A nation is not in danger of financial disaster merely because it owes itself money.

author: W. C. Fields
title: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.,

author: Imamu Amiri Baraka
title: A rich man told me recently that a liberal is a man who tells other people what to do with their money.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction.,

author: Aristotle Onassis
title: After a certain point, money is meaningless. It ceases to be the goal. The game is what counts.

author: Bernard Cornwell
title: Agents will read unpublished work because they might make money, and that's their job. It isn't mine.

author: Bobby Vinton
title: All around as a person, on right decisions, on holding your money, on doing your trade, a good education is a must. I don't think I would've done as good without an education.

author: Aaron C. Brown
title: All exchange stimulates productive activity, whether exchange by gift, gambling, barter, or money transaction.

author: George Orwell
title: All human relationships must be purchased with money.

author: Adam Smith
title: All money is a matter of belief.,

author: Ray Kroc
title: All money means to me is a pride in accomplishment.

author: Prince Philip
title: All money nowadays seems to be produced with a natural homing instinct for the Treasury.

author: Curtis Carlson
title: All my life I knew that there was all the money you could want out there. All you have to do is go after it.

author: Robert Collier
title: All riches have their origin in mind. Wealth is in ideas - not money.

author: Joseph Rudyard Kipling
title: All the money in the world is no use to a man or his country if he spends it as fast as he makes it. All he has left is his bills and the reputation for being a fool.

author: A. A. Milne
title: Almost anyone can be an author; the business is to collect money and fame from this state of being.

author: Bill Gurley
title: Almost everybody who thinks about local thinks about daily deals, but companies like OpenTable and Zillow and Yelp are all getting their money from the local market.

author: Benjamin Tucker
title: Almost the only persons who may be said to comprehend even approximately the significance, principles, and purposes of Socialism are the chief leaders of the extreme wings of the Socialistic forces, and perhaps a few of the money kings themselves.

author: Beth Behrs
title: Always make sure you have your rent. At the end of the month, if you have to eat Ramen for a week because you won't have your rent money, just do it but make sure your rent is all there so you're not stressing about that. As long as you have your rent at least you have somewhere to live.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: America is just a nation of two hundred million used car salesmen with all the money we need to buy guns and no qualms about killing anybody else in the world who tries to make us uncomfortable.

author: Paula Nelson
title: Americans want action for their money. They are fascinated by its self-reproducing qualities if it's put to work. Gold-hoarding goes against the American grain; it fits in better with European pessimism than with America's traditional optimism.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Among the very rich you will never find a really generous man, even by accident. They may give their money away, but they will never give themselves away; they are egoistic, secretive, dry as old bones. To be smart enough to get all that money you must be dull enough to want it.

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: An actress is not a machine, but they treat you like a machine. A money machine.,

author: Socrates
title: An education obtained with money is worse than no education at all

author: Ronald Reagan
title: And I have to point out that government doesn't tax to get the money it needs, government always needs the money it gets.

author: Bobby Scott
title: And what is needed to prevent them from joining gangs was ample recreation for boys as well as girls, jobs and internships for training and money, and assistance to allow their families to live in decent homes.

author: Arthur Laffer
title: And you can't have a prosperous economy when the government is way overspending, raising tax rates, printing too much money, over regulating and restricting free trade. It just can't be done.

author: Bob Edwards
title: Any outfit that has to beg its listeners for money is an organization that has to constantly please its listeners or it will dry up and go away. It shouldn't work when you think about it.

author: Brad Grey
title: Any time there is a lot of money or ego involved, people tend to behave badly.

author: Bumper Sticker
title: Anyone who says money can't buy happiness just doesn't know where to shop.

author: Bo Bennett
title: Anyone who wants to sell you overnight success or wealth is not interested in your success; they are interested in your money.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Architect. One who drafts a plan of your house, and plans a draft of your money.

author: Al Gore
title: As I have said for many years throughout this land, we're borrowing money from China to buy oil from the Persian Gulf to burn it in ways that destroy the future of human civilization. Every bit of that has to change.

author: Calamity Jane
title: As many of the riders before me had been held up and robbed of their packages, mail and money that they carried, for that was the only means of getting mail and money between these points.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: As one digs deeper into the national character of the Americans, one sees that they have sought the value of everything in this world only in the answer to this single question: how much money will it bring in?

author: Cal Thomas
title: As pressure grows to ease the financial burden on social security, pressure will also grow to eliminate the elderly and infirm to 'free up' more money for the 'fit' and those who contribute more than they take from society.

author: Buchi Emecheta
title: As soon as I finish a book, I sell the paperback rights to different publishers and that's where I recoup my money.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: Asset managers have different approaches, and I don't wish to suggest there is only one way to run money. There are many ways one can attempt to reduce risk, improve performance, lower drawdowns and reduce volatility.

author: Bill Maris
title: Back in the late 1990s, venture capitalists got very excited about the Internet. A whole lot of money was poured into some companies that failed rather spectacularly, and a lot of people lost a lot of money.

author: William J. Durant
title: Bankers know that history is inflationary and that money is the last thing a wise man will hoard.

author: Bob Diamond
title: Banks hold deposits and savings entrusted to them by individuals, by businesses, by governments and by central banks. They put that money to work, helping people to buy homes, for example, or lending to businesses to invest in expansion.

author: Kin Hubbard
title: Bargain... anything a customer thinks a store is losing money on.

author: Brendan I. Koerner
title: Barkley was the first of many American skyjackers whose primary interest was money; by 1972, the majority of the nation's hijackings would involve demands for ransom. Barkley himself was declared incompetent to stand trial in November 1971, at which point he was committed to a psychiatric hospital in Georgia.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Be as romantic as you please about love... but you mustn't be romantic about money.

author: Bill Wyman
title: Because of the fashion, the young people don't have any access to the history of music, unless people like me revive it. There are very few people to revive it, because you can't earn any money doing it.

author: Bill Clinton
title: Because primarily of the power of the Internet, people of modest means can band together and amass vast sums of money that can change the world for some public good if they all agree.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Because they did not see merit where they should have seen it, people, to express their regret, will go and leave a lot of money to the very people who will be the first to throw stones at the next person who has anything to say and finds a difficulty in getting a hearing.

author: Ada Leverson
title: Before he left, Aunt William pressed a sovereign into his hand guiltily, as if it were conscience money. He, on his side, took it as though it were a doctor's fee, and both ignored the transaction.

author: Brendon Urie
title: Before I had a steady job, I was broke, and I didn't have any money to buy anything, so I would illegally download stuff.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: Behavior used to be reinforced by great deprivation; if people weren't hungry, they wouldn't work. Now we are committed to feeding people whether they work or not. Nor is money as great a reinforcer as it once was. People no longer work for punitive reasons, yet our culture offers no new satisfactions.

author: Andy Warhol
title: Being good in business is the most fascinating kind of art. Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.

author: André Malraux
title: Between eighteen and twenty, life is like an exchange where one buys stocks, not with money, but with actions. Most men buy nothing.

author: Bill Lipinski
title: Beyond highways and roads, we need more money for mass transit, intercity passenger rail and freight rail. We have a long way to go to bridge the funding gaps.

author: Thomas Henry Huxley
title: Books are the money of Literature, but only the counters of Science.

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: Business, that's easily defined; it's other people's money.

author: Jane Austen
title: Business, you know, may bring you money, but friendship hardly ever does.

author: Bob Schieffer
title: But if you don't enjoy doing something, you'll be miserable no matter how much money you make.

author: Bob Crosby
title: But just as I was ready to call it quits, I got the necessary money from a third party, who had been instructed by Bing to help me out, without letting me know where the help came from.

author: Barney Frank
title: But when others suggested that the poor should not simply be the objects of these programs but also the subjects - that they should be actively involved in shaping the programs, making decisions about how to spend the money etc. - some of the previous supporters reconsidered.

author: John Gay
title: Can you support the expense of a husband, hussy, in gaming, drinking and whoring? Have you money enough to carry on the daily quarrels of man and wife about who shall squander most?

author: Karl Marx
title: Capital is money, capital is commodities. By virtue of it being value, it has acquired the occult ability to add value to itself. It brings forth living offspring, or, at the least, lays golden eggs.

author: Bethany McLean
title: Capital isn't this pile of money sitting somewhere; it's an accounting construct.

author: Brin-Jonathan Butler
title: Castro always used the boxers as a symbolic war against American values to demonstrate that they fight for something more than money.

author: William Blake
title: Christianity is art and not money. Money is its curse.

author: Martin Luther
title: Christians are to be taught that the pope would and should wish to give of his own money, even though he had to sell the basilica of St. Peter, to many of those from whom certain hawkers of indulgences cajole money.

author: Alfred Marshall
title: Civilized countries generally adopt gold or silver or both as money.

author: Donald Trump
title: Climate change is a big scam for a lot of people to make a lot of money.

author: Robin Williams
title: Cocaine is God's way of saying you're making too much money.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: Commissions add up, taxes are a big drag, margin ain't cheap. A good accountant costs money as well. The math on this one is obvious, yet investors often fail to recognize it: Keep your costs low and your turnover lower, and you will win in the end.

author: Bill Gross
title: Companies typically borrow money at less than their return on equity and therefore compound their return at the expense of lenders.

author: Blake Farenthold
title: Congress has the constitutional authority to investigate the other agencies of government. We are the watchdogs of the taxpayer's money, and we have the right to know how that money is being spent and to conduct oversight over the government.

author: Bono
title: Contrary to reports, this boy is not a billionaire or going to be richer than any Beatle... and not just in the sense of money, by the way; the Beatles are untouchable - those billionaire reports are a joke.

author: Ben Carson
title: Corporations are not in business to be social-welfare organizations; they are there to make money.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Courage charms us, because it indicates that a man loves an idea better than all things in the world, that he is thinking neither of his bed, nor his dinner, nor his money, but will venture all to put in act the invisible thought of his mind.

author: Anacreon
title: Cursed be he above all others Who's enslaved by love of money. Money takes the place of brothers, Money takes the place of parents, Money brings us war and slaughter.

author: Don G. Mitchell
title: Determine to become one of the best. Sufficient money will almost automatically follow if you get to be one of the ''best'' in your chosen field, whatever it is.

author: Walt Disney
title: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn't go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.,

author: Henry David Thoreau
title:
Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.,
,
,
,
,

author: Bernie Sanders
title: Do the elected officials in Washington stand with ordinary Americans - working families, children, the elderly, the poor - or will the extraordinary power of billionaire campaign contributors and Big Money prevail? The American people, by the millions, must send Congress the answer to that question.

author: Horace
title: Does he council you better who bids you, ''Money, by right means, if you can: but by any means, make money ?

author: Sir John Lubbock
title: Don't be afraid of showing affection. Be warm and tender, thoughtful and affectionate. Men are more helped by sympathy than by service. Love is more than money, and a kind word will give more pleasure than a present.

author: Joe Karbo
title: Don't be too busy earning a living to make any money.

author: Lord Burleigh
title: Don't borrow money from a neighbor or a friend, but of a stranger where, paying for it you shall hear of it no more.

author: Billy Joel
title: Don't make music for some vast, unseen audience or market or ratings share or even for something as tangible as money. Though it's crucial to make a living, that shouldn't be your inspiration. Do it for yourself.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Don't matter how much money you got, there's only two kinds of people: there's saved people and there's lost people.

author: George Burns
title: Don't stay in bed....unless you can make money in bed.

title: Each time you go to the grocery store with your kids, it is a potential learning opportunity. In order not to overemphasize materialism, focus on other things to do with money. In 'Beyond the Lemonade Stand,' I try to emphasize the importance of saving money, and of using it to help other people.

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: Economy is half the battle of life. It is not so hard to earn money as to spend it well.

author: Boomer Esiason
title: Educate yourself. Understand what you're dealing with. Then figure out how to fight it. Then figure out how to raise money for that fight. It'll help you cope. It'll help your child.

author: Bradley A. Smith
title: Elections are a competition with only one winner. Giving more money to the opponent every time one speaks on behalf of a favored candidate discourages the speech that triggers the matching funds.

author: Bob Seger
title: Even in junior high, I always knew I had a talent for music and I knew I could make money that way.

author: Caprice Bourret
title: Even someone who works with me, like this girl who works with me, her name is Sue. She lives with me and holds the fort; she takes care of all these little things. She takes care of the money situation, and I would not be able to live without someone like that.

author: Bernie Sanders
title: Every day we are paying more for energy than we should due to poor insulation, inefficient lights, appliances, and heating and cooling equipment - money we could save by investing in energy efficiency.

author: Zig Ziglar
title: Every sale has five basic obstacles: no need, no money, no hurry, no desire, no trust.,

author: Arthur Miller
title: Everybody likes a kidder, but nobody lends him money.

author: Barry Schwartz
title: Everybody makes money for a living, but most of us actually do something that has a point, in addition to just making money. We examine and treat patients, we teach students, we draw up contracts and wills, we write for newspapers, magazines, and web sites, we clean floors, or we serve meals.

author: Joseph De Maistre
title: False opinions are like false money, struck first of all by guilty men and thereafter circulated by honest people who perpetuate the crime without knowing what they are doing.

author: Brantley Gilbert
title: Fame and money and all that - you hear people say it a lot, but they don't mean a thing to me.

author: Bruce Dickinson
title: Fans want to see people who can play; they respect certain values like professionalism, and they don't want to be treated like shit. They pay good money and they look forward to seeing some good music being played by decent musicians, who really put their soul into it.

author: Seneca
title: Fidelity purchased with money, money can destroy.

author: Aristotle
title: First, have a definite, clear practical ideal; a goal, an objective. Second, have the necessary means to achieve your ends; wisdom, money, materials, and methods. Third, adjust all your means to that end.

author: Bert Lance
title: Folks are serious about three things: Their religion, their family and, most of all, their money.

author: Bill Janklow
title: Folks can't carry around money in their pocket. They've got to go to an ATM machine, and they've got to pay a few dollars to get their own dollars out of the machine. Who ever thought you'd pay cash to get cash? That's where we've gotten to.

author: Bo Burnham
title: For me, comedy is constantly presented as this fake casualness, like a guy just walked on stage going, 'This crazy thing happened to me the other day.' And he's in front of 3000 people, and he's acting like an everyman, and he's getting paid so much money.

author: Caroline Wozniacki
title: For me, it's about the tennis and the trophies. I'm not motivated by money.

author: Brad Feld
title: For those trying to protect the past, it is a way of retaining power, status, money, a way a life, predictability, comfort, control, and a bunch of other things like that. It is a struggle against the inevitability of change.

author: Billy Wilder
title: France is a country where the money falls apart in your hands and you can't tear the toilet paper.

author: Billy Wilder
title: France is a place where the money falls apart in your hands but you can't tear the toilet paper.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Gambling with cards or dice or stocks is all one thing. It's getting money without giving an equivalent for it.

author: Andrew William Mellon
title: Give tax breaks to large corporations, so that money can trickle down to the general public, in the form of extra jobs.

author: Barbara Coloroso
title: Given the choice, children who don't want for anything will not save... We have an obligation as parents to give our children what they need. What they want we can give them as a special gift, or they can save their money for it.

author: P. J. O'Rourke
title: Giving money and power to government is like giving whiskey and car keys to teenage boys.

author: John Dryden
title: Go miser go, for money sell your soul. Trade wares for wares and trudge from pole to pole, So others may say when you are dead and gone. See what a vast estate he left his son.

author: Ben Affleck
title: God help me if I ever do another movie with an explosion in it. If you see me in a movie where stuff is exploding you'll know I've lost all my money.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: God makes, and apparel shapes; but it's money that finishes the man.

author: Bob Balaban
title: God, I'd love to do a big commercial movie that made a lot of money and whose plot was interesting too.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: Good nature is worth more than knowledge, more than money, more than honor, to the persons who possess it.

author: Bill Richardson
title: Had I stayed longer in some primaries, I would have probably done better in states like Nevada, California, and New Mexico - but I ran out of the money after the second primary in New Hampshire.

author: John Wanamaker
title: Half the money I spend on advertising is wasted; the trouble is I don't know which half.

title: He 63 ways of getting money, the most common, most honorable ones being staling, thieving, and robbing.

author: Molière
title: He must have killed a lot of men to have made so much money.

author: William Shakespeare
title: He that wants money, means and content is without three good friends.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: Hedge funds are not especially liquid. Many are 'gated' - meaning there are only small windows when you can withdraw your money. They typically have a high minimum investment and often require investors keep their money in the fund for at least one year.

author: Adriana Lima
title: Here in the big city people spend their time thinking about work and about money; they don't give some value to friendships and it can be depressing.

author: Mark Twain
title: His money is twice tainted: taint yours and taint mine.''

title: Hollywood held this double lure for me, tremendous sums of money for work that required no more effort than a game of pinochle.

title: Hollywood money isn't money. It's congealed snow, melts in your hand, and there you are.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: However toplofty and idealistic a man may be, he can always rationalize his right to earn money.

title: I actually thought that it would be a little confusing during the same period of your life to be in one meeting when you're trying to make money, and then go to another meeting where you're giving it away.

author: Anita Roddick
title: I am still looking for the modern equivalent of those Quakers who ran successful businesses, made money because they offered honest products and treated their people decently... This business creed, sadly, seems long forgotten.

author: Steve Martin
title:
I believe that sex is one of the most beautiful, natural, wholesome things that money can buy.,
,

author: Ahmed Chalabi

author: Judy Garland
title: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.

title: I don't like money actually, but it quiets the nerves.

author: Jackie Mason

author: John D. Rockefeller
title:
I have ways of making money that you know nothing of.,
,

author: Josh Billings
title: I haven't got as much money as some folks, but I've got as much impudence as any of them, and that's the next thing to money.

title: I know of nothing more despicable and pathetic than a man who devotes all the hours of the waking day to the making of money for money's sake.

title: I make a lot of money, but I don't want to talk about that. I work very hard and I'm worth every cent.

author: Larry Bird

author: Adam Sandler
title: I shouldn't be near Vegas and have money in my pocket.

author: Donald Trump
title: I supported John McCain for president. I raised a million dollars for him. Still a lot of money. I supported him. He lost. He let us down. So I never liked him as much after that because I don`t like losers.

author: Bryan Ferry
title: I suppose young people think football is glamorous - soccer - it's big money and the stars of it, they look good and have a great big house and a huge Ferrari.

author: Hippocrates

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: I think the American Dream used to be achieving one's goals in your field of choice - and from that, all other things would follow. Now, I think the dream has morphed into the pursuit of money: Accumulate enough of it, and the rest will follow.

title: I think the person who takes a job in order to live - that is to say, for the money - has turned himself into a slave.,

title: I think the situation in Toronto is such that there are funding organizations which make it easy for a film to raise more money than it needs and very often that works against a film.

title: I used to have a drug problem, now I make enough money.

author: Allan Carr
title: I went to Montreal. My first gig went very badly. They just weren't laughing at anything. I found out they were a load of Christians, and it was a gig to raise money for a new church roof.

title: I will not let anyone tell me we must spend more money. This crisis did not come about because we issued too little money but because we created economic growth with too much money and it was not sustainable growth.

author: Hedy Lamarr
title: I win because I learned years ago that scared money always loses. I never care, so I win.

author: Arne Duncan
title: I worry when athletes are simply used by their universities to produce revenue, to make money for them, nothing to show at the back end. I grew up with a lot of players who had very, very tough lives after the ball started bouncing for them. And that's why I'm going to continue to fight.

author: Andy Warhol
title: I'd asked around 10 or 15 people for suggestions. Finally one lady friend asked the right question, 'Well, what do you love most?' That's how I started painting money.

author: Walt Disney
title: I'd say it's been my biggest problem all my life... it's money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.,

title: I'm a pretty disciplined investor and pretty disciplined buyer. I do my due diligence. I do my homework. I don't waste money.

title: I'm a prize fighter. Titles don't pay bills. I fight for money. I'm making money. They're making money. Everybody's making money. That's what this is all about.
