title: I'm a socialist. I'm amazed at how the spirit of socialism is alive and well in New York. I had always thought I wouldn't want to be here without a lot of money, but I was wrong about that.

author: Bill Goldberg
title: I'm an active participation guy. No matter how much money you make, no matter how famous you are, you're not above going outside and cutting trees. I do it all the time.

author: Bryan White
title: I'm an entertainer. If people are paying good money for tickets they deserve the best show they can see. I don't get into lighting stuff on fire, but I do believe in going the extra mile.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: I'm convinced that sending people to Mars is so expensive that if you go once and bring the people back and then go again and bring the people back, we're eventually going to run out of money. But what if we send people the first time and they don't come back? What if they stay there?

author: Bryan Greenberg
title: I'm excited that 'The Good Guy' is getting distribution because indie movies they're not - people ran out of money and they're not making these movies anymore. It's all superhero movies or real obvious tent pole studio films.

author: Benjamin Clementine
title: I'm from a middle class family, but my father squandered all the money, so I didn't really run around with rich people.

author: Marilyn Monroe
title: I'm not interested in money, I just want to be wonderful.

author: Arthur Godfrey
title: I'm proud to pay taxes in the United States; the only thing is, I could be just as proud for half the money.

author: Hilaire Belloc
title: I'm tired of love; I'm still more tired of rhyme; but money gives me pleasure all the time.

author: Bill Plympton
title: I'm very happy with the success of short films. In fact, for me, the short films make more money than the features.

author: Robert Fulghum
title: I've always thought anyone can make money. Making a life worth living, that's the real test.

author: Bill Murray
title: I've been lucky, I've had movies that made a lot of money, so I don't feel like I have to kill every time out. I don't want that pressure. I don't need it.

author: Bruno Mars
title: I've definitely seen bands before they made money kind of change their thing on the next tour, and I prefer it when it's a little more raw.

author: H. Youngman
title: I've got all the money I'll ever need, if I die by four o clock.

author: Beth Ditto
title: I've had people ask me in interviews what it's like to have money, but that's not how it is. I have a middle-class life. I have a room in London but not a house, nor a BMW.

author: Beryl Bainbridge
title: I've never been drawn to the feminist movement. I was brought up to believe that men had little to do with the home or children - except to bring in the money.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: If a nation values anything more than freedom, it will lose its freedom: and the irony of it is that if it is comfort or money that it values more, it will lose that, too.

author: Ezra Pound
title: If a patron buys from an artist who needs money (needs money to buy tools, time, food), the patron then makes himself equal to the artist; he is building art into the world; he creates.

author: Billy Graham
title: If a person gets his attitude toward money straight, it will help straighten out almost every other area in his life.

author: Will Rogers
title:
If advertisers spent the same amount of money on improving their products as they do on advertising then they wouldn't have to advertise them.,
,
,

author: James Baldwin
title: If all you want to do is make money, the very last thing you need is imagination.

author: Bradley A. Smith
title: If candidates spend money on ads and other political speech and their opponents are rewarded with government handouts to attack them, that chills speech and is unconstitutional. Non-participating candidates certainly don't volunteer to allow their opponents to receive taxpayer subsidies to bash them.

author: Bill Gross
title: If financial assets no longer work for you at a rate far and above the rate of true wealth creation, then you must work longer for your money.

author: Alan Alda
title: If I can't get the girl, at least give me more money.

author: Bobby Riggs
title: If I can't play for big money, I play for a little money. And if I can't play for a little money, I stay in bed that day.

author: Ben Elton
title: If I did things for the money, I'd have done adverts in the 1980s, when I was hot enough to be offered them, and 'Police Academy 6,' which I was asked to write.

author: Ben Simmons
title: If I ever make a lot of money in the NBA, I'm going to have this massive tank, and it's going to have an alligator in it.

author: Bill Gates
title: If I hadn't given my money away, I'd have had more than anyone else on the planet.,

author: Bill Maris
title: If I were to leave and raise a venture fund, I would have to find 10 or 100 LPs. They would all give me a bunch of money, and I would take a percentage of that to pay myself. They would expect me to invest that over the next three years, and they want that money back in seven or eight years.

author: John Updike
title: If men do not keep on speaking terms with children, they cease to be men, and become merely machines for eating and for earning money.

author: Francis Bacon
title: If money be not they servant, it will be thy master. The covetous man cannot so properly be said to possess wealth, as that may be said to possess him.

author: Herbert N. Casson
title: If money is all that a man makes, then he will be poor. Poor in happiness and poor in all that makes life worth living.

author: Henry Ford
title: If money is your hope for independence you will never have it. The only real security that a man will have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience, and ability.,

author: Sun Tzu
title: If our soldiers are not overburdened with money, it is not because they have a distaste for riches; if their lives are not unduly long, it is not because they are disinclined to longevity.

author: Bjorn Ulvaeus
title: If that doomsday scenario happens, will it help if you have heaps of paper money? I don't think so.

author: Carl Karcher
title: If the money we donate helps one child or can ease the pain of one parent, those funds are well spent.

author: Billy Sunday
title: If there is no hell, a good many preachers are obtaining money under false pretenses.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: If we go back to the moon, we're guaranteed second, maybe third place because while we are spending all that money, Russia has its eye on Mars. Landing people on the moon will be terribly consuming of resources we don't have. It sounds great - 'Let's go back. This time we're going to stay.' I don't know why you would want to stay on the moon.

author: Aristotle Onassis
title: If women didn't exist, all the money in the world would have no meaning.

author: J. Paul Getty
title: If you can actually count your money, then you're not a rich man.

author: J. Paul Getty
title: If you can count your money, you don't have a billion dollars.

author: Bill Bennett
title: If you can take my tax money and assure me that it'll go to the right purpose, that it will help the poor, then fine. But I'm not sure a lot of it does. In fact, I know a lot of it doesn't.

author: Ogden Nash
title: If you don't want to work, you have to work to earn enough money so that you won't have to work.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: If you give money, spend yourself with it.

author: Austan Goolsbee
title: If you had asked people in 1929, 'Here is what is about to happen. How much would you pay to avoid the Great Depression from occurring?' The answer is they would have paid a lot. They would have borrowed money if it could be used to prevent the Great Depression.

author: Carly Fiorina
title: If you have a line of business - I know this as a CEO - or if you have a teenager - I know this as a parent - who have a spending problem, what do you do? You quit giving them money.

author: Theodore Harold White
title: If you make a living, if you earn your own money, you're free - however free one can be on this planet.

author: Henry Fielding
title: If you make money your god, it will plague you like the devil.

author: Ben Goldacre
title: If you put me in charge of the medical research budget, I would cancel all primary research, I would cancel all new trials, for just one year, and I would spend the money exclusively on making sure that we make the best possible use of the clinical evidence that we already have.

author: James Allen
title: If you real desire is to be good, there is no need to wait for the money before you do it; you can do it now, this very moment, and just where you are.

author: Arthur C. Brooks
title: If you think spreading money around by force seems like an odd definition of fairness, you're not alone.

author: B. B. King
title: If you want to be a good blues singer, people are going to be down on you, so dress like you're going to the bank to borrow money.

author: Bill Maris
title: If you want to invest in early-stage technologies, putting a timeframe on it does behold you to Silicon Valley economics. You've got a certain time period where you have to make the money. And you have to invest that money whether you find good companies or not.

author: Baz Luhrmann
title: If you wanted to show a mirror to people that says, 'You've been drunk on money,' they're not going to want to see it. But if you reflected that mirror on another time they'd be willing to. People will need an explanation of where we are and where we've been, and 'The Great Gatsby' can provide that explanation.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: If you would know the value of money, go and try to borrow some.

author: Carl Paladino
title: If you're a citizen of the State of New York, your kid has as much a right as another kid to an education, and the best education. The money should be distributed equally to all.

author: Bill Kurtis
title: If you're a producer, you always spend too much money because you want that shot - and you're willing to spend a bundle to get it.

author: Arthur Scargill
title: If you've got an industry where you've got massive investment, it doesn't matter whether you bring in alternative supplies. You still lose the money on that industry.

author: Bruce Lipton
title: If your environment keeps draining your energy, it's like having a leaky bank account, where any money you're putting into the bank, such as by seeing an energy healer, keeps slipping out. You have to change your environment, including any harmful beliefs, before the energy can stay high.

author: Bobby Rahal
title: In 1982 when I showed up, the average age of the drivers in the series was something like 40, 41. The crowds were small. There was not much prize money. The competition wasn't very tight.

author: Carl Icahn
title: In 2008, people who invested in hedge funds needed capital badly, but many of the funds would not return their money. However, I gave money back to any investor who requested it. It was the bottom of the market and a pretty tough time.

author: Benjamin Todd Jealous
title: In a democracy there are only two types of power: there's organized people and organized money, and organized money only wins when people aren't organized.

author: Barry Schwartz
title: In an ideal world, nobody's work would be just about the money. People could pursue excellence in what they do, take pride in achievement, and derive meaning from knowing that their work improved the lives of others.

author: Voltaire
title: In general, the art of government consists in taking as much money as possible from one party of the citizens to give to the other.

author: William Penn
title: In marriage do thou be wise; prefer the person before money; virtue before beauty; the mind before the body.

author: Barry White
title: In my day, we didn't have the cocaine, so we went out and knocked somebody over the head and took the money. But today, all this cocaine and crack, it doesn't give kids a chance.

author: Bernie Sanders
title: In my view, a corporation is not a person. A corporation does not have First Amendment rights to spend as much money as it wants, without disclosure, on a political campaign.

author: William Randolph Hearst
title: In suggesting gifts: Money is appropriate, and one size fits all.

author: Ajay Devgan
title: In the industry, you do need some ethics - if one film does well, then thousands get work and money comes back to the industry. I guess the bottomline is, if there are two versions, then the better one will click.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Individual investors beware: If you're constantly worried about a crash, you're probably making some big mistakes - and losing a lot of money in the process.

author: Plato
title: Is it not also true that no physician, in so far as he is a physician, considers or enjoins what is for the physician's interest, but that all seek the good of their patients? For we have agreed that a physician strictly so called, is a ruler of bodies, and not a maker of money, have we not?

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: Is it not odd that the only generous person I ever knew, who had money to be generous with, should be a stockbroker.

author: Henry Wheeler Shaw
title: It ain't often that a man's reputation outlasts his money.

author: Samuel Butler
title: It costs a lot of money to die comfortably.

author: Billy Idol
title: It doesn't matter about money; having it, not having it. Or having clothes, or not having them. You're still left alone with yourself in the end.

author: Joe E. Lewis
title: It doesn't matter whether you are rich or poor - as long as you've got money.

author: Bill Mumy
title: It got to the point in the late 70s and early 80s that I was spending so much money buying golden age comics that I could only justify it if I got work in the media.

author: Samuel Butler
title: It has been said that the love of money is the root of all evil. The want of money is so quite as truly.

author: Albert Camus
title: It is a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.

author: W. H. Auden
title: It is a sad fact about our culture that a poet can earn much more money writing or talking about his art than he can by practicing it.

author: Bill Scott
title: It is essential that there should not only be a limit on campaign spending but it should be required to say where that money is spent and how it is spent. I think there has been more abuse in campaign spending, actually, than in campaign contributors.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: It is foolish to lay out money for the purchase of repentance.

author: Henry Ford
title: It is not the employer who pays the wages. Employers only handle the money. It is the customer who pays the wages.,

author: Barry Gibb
title: It is not the money but the self-respect and wanting to create good music.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: It is said that anyone who does commercial cinema is not acting, and anyone who does an art film is acting. I don't believe it. I feel whenever you are doing a film, you are acting. So you need to be applauded for that. I won't do art house cinemas. I want to make commercial films. I want my films to make money.

author: George S. Clason
title: It is true that money cannot buy happiness but it does make it possible for you to enjoy the best that the world has to offer.

author: Albert J. Nock
title: It is unfortunately none too well understood that, just as the State has no money of its own, so it has no power of its own.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: It is unfortunately very true that, without leisure and money, love can be no more than an orgy of the common man. Instead of being a sudden impulse full of ardor and reverie, it becomes a distastefully utilitarian affair.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: It is wonderful to think how men of very large estates not only spend their yearly income, but are often actually in want of money. It is clear, they have not value for what they spend.

author: Ben E. King
title: It never dawned on me at any particular time of my life that people are paid tremendous money to sing.

author: Bernadette Peters
title: It was one of the most exciting, perfect evenings of my life, my solo debut at Carnegie Hall. And knowing we were all there to raise money for Gay Men's Health Crisis made the evening an extraordinary experience.

author: Barry Sheene
title: It wasn't about the money. I just wanted them to admit it was their fault.

author: Carlos Ghosn
title: It would be easier to make money in other sectors, but since I was a kid, I liked cars.

author: Bill Vaughan
title: It would be nice if the poor were to get even half of the money that is spent in studying them.

author: Albert Camus
title: It's a kind of spiritual snobbery that makes people think they can be happy without money.

author: Bill Hicks
title: It's all about money, not freedom, ya'll, okay? Nothing to do with fuckin' freedom. If you think you're free, try going somewhere without fucking money, okay?

author: Bill Forsyth
title: It's easier for me to get three times the amount of money I really want.

author: Ben Schwartz
title: It's funny: I put money into short films, and I put really good actors in it, and I write some stuff that's really funny, and I'll get, like, a million views. But to the right of me, there will be a video of a kitten that falls into a toilet bowl, and it's three seconds long, and it will get 25 million views.

author: Les Brown
title: It's important to me that money not be important to me.

author: Carrie Mae Weems
title: It's impossible to change the social without changing the personal - you have to put your money where your mouth is. And if you're not making those challenges at home, it's unlikely you'll make them in a larger setting.

author: Bill Hicks
title: It's just a ride and we can change it any time we want. It's only a choice. No effort, no work, no job, no savings and money, a choice, right now, between fear and love. The eyes of fear want you to put bigger locks on your door, buy guns, close yourself off. The eyes of love instead see all of us as one.

author: Bode Miller
title: It's nice, being brought up with no money at all. It's just not how I measure success, so that makes it a bunch easier.

author: Antoine Fuqua
title: It's not worth it, it's not about money, especially when you're dealing with a culture. It should be about elevating the idea of what we are and who we are as people in the cinema, and that kind of stuff keeps dragging us back down.

author: Billy Porter
title: Just because you're working does not mean you're making money. That's two very different things in show business.

author: Josh Billings
title: Knowledge is like money: the more he gets, the more he craves.

author: Adam Smith
title: Labour was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things. It was not by gold or by silver, but by labour, that all wealth of the world was originally purchased.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Lack of money is the root of all evil.

author: Artemus Ward
title: Let us all be happy, and live within our means, even if we have to borrow the money to do it with.

author: Mother Teresa
title: Let us more and more insist on raising funds of love, of kindness, of understanding, of peace. Money will come if we seek first the Kingdom of God - the rest will be given.

author: Balthazar Getty
title: Life started getting good when I started making money.

author: Buddy Guy
title: Listen to the lyrics - we're singing about everyday life: rich people trying to keep money, poor people tying to get it, and everyone having trouble with their husband or wife!

author: W. H. Auden
title: Literary confessors are contemptible, like beggars who exhibit their sores for money, but not so contemptible as the public that buys their books.

author: Bob Fosse
title: Live like you'll die tomorrow, work like you don't need the money, and dance like nobody's watching.

author: Anita Roddick
title: Look at the Quakers - they were excellent business people that never lied, never stole; they cared for their employees and the community which gave them the wealth. They never took more money out than they put back in.

author: Alan Greenspan
title: Look, I'm very much in favor of tax cuts, but not with borrowed money. And the problem that we've gotten into in recent years is spending programs with borrowed money, tax cuts with borrowed money, and at the end of the day that proves disastrous. And my view is I don't think we can play subtle policy here.

author: Donald Trump
title: Look, they have taken our jobs, they have taken our money, and on top of that they have loaned the money to us and we actually pay them interest now on money. We owe China and Japan each $1.4 trillion.

author: Carlos Slim
title: Low interest rates are a big opportunity for investment. But the issue is that this money should go to the real economy, not the financial economy.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Make money and the whole nation will conspire to call you a gentleman.

author: Scott Alexander
title: Making money is a hobby that will complement any other hobbies you have, beautifully.

author: Andy Warhol
title:
Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.,
,

author: Bobby Scott
title: Mandatory minimums have been shown to be discriminatory and waste the taxpayers' money.

author: Carol Roth
title: Many businesses fail because the owner wasn't willing to invest and wasn't educated on the difference between spending money frivolously and investing money into the business for growth, and the risks and rewards of that cash infusion.

author: Frank A. Clark
title: Many folks think they aren't good at earning money, when what they don't know is how to use it.

author: Johann Georg Ritter von Zimmermann
title: Many good qualities are not sufficient to balance a single want - the want of money.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.

author: John Morley
title: Many people think of knowledge as money, They would like knowledge, but do not want to face the perseverance and self-denial that goes into the acquisition of it.

author: Ann Landers
title: Maturity: Be able to stick with a job until it is finished. Be able to bear an injustice without having to get even. Be able to carry money without spending it. Do your duty without being supervised.

author: Lilian Hellmann
title: Maybe money is unreal for most of us, easier to give away than things we want.

author: Robert H. Jackson
title: Men are more often bribed by their loyalties and ambitions than by money.

author: David Mitchell
title: Men invented money. Women invented mutual aid.

author: Billie Jean King
title: Men still get a lot more opportunity. It is still a big part of the old boy network. They have more companies they can get money from.

author: Charles J. Fillmore
title: Men who accomplish great things in the industrial world are the ones who have faith in the money producing power of ideas.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Money and time are the heaviest burdens of life, and the unhappiest of all mortals are those who have more of either than they know how to use.

author: Marty Feldman
title: Money can't buy poverty.

author: Somers White
title: Money can't buy you friends; but you do get a better class of enemies.

author: Annni-Frid Lyngstad
title: Money cannot buy happiness.

author: Richard M. DeVos
title: Money cannot buy peace of mind. It cannot heal ruptured relationships, or build meaning into a life that has none.

author: Adam Osborne
title: Money coming in says I've made the right marketing decisions.

author: Spike Milligan
title: Money couldn't buy friends, but you get a better class of enemy.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Money demands that you sell, not your weakness to men's stupidity, but your talent to their reason.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: Money differs from an automobile or mistress in being equally important to those who have it and those who do not.

author: Sean O'Casey
title: Money does not make you happy, but it quiets the nerves.

author: Carolina Herrera
title: Money doesn't buy elegance. You can take an inexpensive sheath, add a pretty scarf, gray shoes, and a wonderful bag, and it will always be elegant.

author: Martin Amis
title: Money doesn't mind if we say it's evil, it goes from strength to strength. It's a fiction, an addiction, and a tacit conspiracy.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Money doesn't talk, it swears. , Obscenity, who really cares? Propaganda all is phony.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Money has never made man happy, nor will it, there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.

author: Louis Bernieres
title: Money has no religion except itself.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: Money helps, though not so much as you think when you don't have it.

author: Earl Wilson
title: Money in the bank is like toothpaste in the tube. Easy to take out, hard to put back.

author: Marshall Mcluhan
title: Money is a poor man's credit card.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith

author: P.T. Barnum

author: Gertrude Stein
title: Money is always there but the pockets change.

author: Woody Allen
title: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.

author: Alan Cohen

author: Beau Willimon
title: Money is finite; it's limited by a number and what you can buy with it. Power has no limits if you're willing to go far enough in order to get as much of it as you can.

author: Doug Horton
title: Money is good, love is wealth.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Money is human happiness in the abstract: he, then, who is no longer capable of enjoying human happiness in the concrete devotes his heart entirely to money.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Money is indeed the most important thing in the world; and all sound and successful personal and national morality should have this fact for its basis.

author: H. L. Hunt
title: Money is just a way of keeping score.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Money is like a sixth sense without which you cannot make a complete use of the other five.

author: Henry Ford

author: Kahlil Gibran

author: J. Paul Getty

author: Francis Bacon
title: Money is like muck, not good except it is be spread.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Money is not required to buy one necessity of the soul.

author: Barack Obama
title: Money is not the only answer, but it makes a difference.

author: Burt Shavitz
title: Money is nothing really worth squabbling about. This is what puts people six feet under. You know, I don't need it.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.

author: George S. Clason
title: Money is plentiful for those who understand the simple laws which govern its acquisition.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: Money is power, and in that government which pays all the public officers of the states will all political power be substantially concentrated.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Money is power, freedom, a cushion, the root of all evil, the sum of blessings.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Money is the barometer of a society's virtue.

author: Elizabeth Taylor

author: Henry Fielding
title: Money is the fruit of evil, as often as the root of it.

author: Bobby Seale

author: George Bernard Shaw

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Money is the representative of a certain quantity of corn or other commodity. It is so much warmth, so much bread.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

author: George Farquhar
title: Money is the sinews of love, as of war.

author: Jim Rohn
title: Money is usually attracted, not pursued.

author: Oliver Stone
title: Money itself isn't lost or made, it's simply transferred from one perception to another. This painting here. I bought it 10 years ago for 60 thousand dollars. I could sell it today for 600. The illusion has become real and the more real it becomes, the more desperately they want it.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Money makes a good servant, but a bad master.

author: Al Pacino
title: Money makes your life easier. If you're lucky to have it, you're lucky.,

author: Henrik Ibsen
title: Money may be the husk of many things, but not the kernel. It brings you food, but not appetite; medicine, but not health; acquaintances, but not friends; servants, but not faithfulness; days of joy, but not peace and happiness.

author: Freddie Mercury
title: Money may not buy happiness, but it can damn well give it!

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Money never made a fool of anybody; it only shows them up.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Money never made a man happy yet, nor will it. The more a man has, the more he wants. Instead of filling a vacuum, it makes one.

author: W. J. Cameron
title: Money never starts an idea; it is the idea that starts the money.

author: Calvin Trillin
title: Money not spent on a luxury one considered even briefly is the equivalent of windfall income and should be spent accordingly.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Money often costs too much.

author: Aphra Behn
title: Money speaks sense in a language all nations understand.

author: Andrea Dworkin
title:
Money speaks, but it speaks with a male voice.,
,

author: Bjorn Lomborg
title: Money spent on carbon cuts is money we can't use for effective investments in food aid, micronutrients, HIV/AIDS prevention, health and education infrastructure, and clean water and sanitation.

author: Barbara Kruger
title: Money talks. It starts rumors about careers and complicity and speaks of the tragedies and triumphs of our social lives.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: Money was made, not to command our will, But all out lawful pleasure to fulfil. Shame and woe to use, if we our wealth obey; The horse doth with the horseman run away.

author: Donald Trump
title: Money was never a big motivation for me, except as a way to keep score. The real excitement is playing the game.

author: Barbara Tuchman
title: Money was the crux. Raising money to pay the cost of war was to cause more damage to 14th century society than the physical destruction of war itself.

author: Josh Billings
title: Money will buy a pretty good dog, but it won't buy the wag of his tail.

author: Henry Fielding
title: Money will say more in one moment than the most eloquent lover can in years.

author: Napoleon Hill
title:
Money without brains is always dangerous.,
,

author: William E. Vaughan
title: Money won't buy happiness, but it will pay the salaries of a huge research staff to study the problem.

author: Zig Ziglar
title: Money won't make you happy... but everybody wants to find out for themselves.

author: Boris Yeltsin
title: Money, big money (which is actually a relative concept) is always, under any circumstances, a seduction, a test of morals, a temptation to sin.

author: James Baldwin
title: Money, it turned out, was exactly like sex, you thought of nothing else if you didn't have it and thought of other things if you did.

author: Anton Chekhov
title: Money, like vodka, turns a person into an eccentric.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Money, which represents the prose of life, and which is hardly spoken of in parlors without an apology, is, in its effects and laws, as beautiful as roses.

author: Billie Holiday
title: Money, you've got lots of friends , Crowding round the door , When you're gone, spending ends , They don't come no more , Rich relations give , Crust of bread and such , You can help yourself , But don't take too much.

author: Ann Macbeth
title: Most independent filmmakers in Britain and North America work for commercial crews and then have their own projects when they've got enough money saved up to do so.

author: John Maynard Keynes
title: Most men love money and security more, and creation and construction less, as they get older.

author: Aaron C. Brown
title: Most people wander through life, carelessly taking whatever risk crosses their paths without compensation, but never consciously accepting extra risk to pick up the money and other good things lying all around them.

author: Callie Khouri
title: Movie studios are owned by giant corporations. They care about money; they don't care about movies.

author: Ben Nicholson
title: MTV lets us do whatever we want. For me, there is freedom in serving an experienced client who knows what they want and has the money to do it. MTV is that for us.

author: Arnold Bennett
title: Much ingenuity with a little money is vastly more profitable and amusing than much money without ingenuity.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: Much work is merely a way to make money; much leisure is merely a way to spend it.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: Mutual fund managers want your money in their funds. They get paid based on assets under management.

author: Bill Gross
title: My clients don't pay me to feel sorry; they pay me to bring them money. I am tough, but I have a soft side.

author: J. Paul Getty
title: My father said: ''You must never try to make all the money that's in a deal. Let the other fellow make some money too, because if you have a reputation for always making all the money, you won't have many deals.''

author: Steve Jobs
title: My favorite things in life don't cost any money. It's really clear that the most precious resource we all have is time.,

author: Bill Hader
title: My first real job, I sold Christmas trees when I was twelve for extra money. I did that until I was fifteen. Then I bagged groceries, and I worked at the first Borders ever in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

author: Bidzina Ivanishvili
title: My main capital isn't the money. I respect myself; I respect my country.

author: Glenda Jackson
title: My money goes to my agent, then to my accountant and from him to the tax man.

author: Bo Sanchez
title: My parents were the traditional Filipino parents who didn't talk about money around the dinner table.

author: Muhammad Ali
title: My principles are more important than the money or my title.,

author: Barbara Park
title: My senior year of high school, I was voted 'Wittiest.' So, several years later, I decided to try my hand at writing humor to see if I could be witty enough to make some money.

author: Edward Franklin Albee III
title: Never marry for money; you can borrow it cheaper.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Never spend your money before you have earned it.

author: Adam Smith
title: No complaint... is more common than that of a scarcity of money.

author: Seneca
title: No evil is without its compensation. The less money, the less trouble; the less favor, the less envy. Even in those cases which put us out of wits, it is not the loss itself, but the estimate of the loss that troubles us.

author: Greil Marcus
title: No failure in America, whether of love or money, is ever simple; it is always a kind of betrayal, of a mass of shadowy, shared hopes.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: No man but a blockhead ever wrote, except for money.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: No man's credit is ever as good as his money.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: No money is better spent than what is laid out for domestic satisfaction.

author: Abdul Qadeer Khan
title: No money on earth can buy the love and affection that has been given to me by a grateful nation.

author: Barbara Ehrenreich
title: No one should be incarcerated for debt or squeezed for money they have no chance of getting their hands on.

author: Margaret Thatcher
title: No one would remember the Good Samaritan if he only had good intentions. He had money as well.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: No woman marries for money; they are all clever enough, before marrying a millionaire, to fall in love with him first.

author: Bill Scott
title: No, I was pleased that it is possible for somebody who makes full disclosure as I've done, not only of the contributors, but also how the money is spent.

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
title: No, not rich. I am a poor man with money, which is not the same thing.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Nobel Prize money is a life-belt thrown to a swimmer who has already reached the shore in safety.

author: Jack Lemmon
title: Nobody deserves this much money - certainly not an actor.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: Nobody ever lost money taking a profit.

author: Beth Broderick
title: Nobody wants to sit where I'm sitting and say, 'Hey, this is the reality. I did two movies, six guest-star spots and I starred in a one-woman show, and I'm not making any money. I'm on TV every day in every country in the world, and I don't make any money.'

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Nothing induces me to read a novel except when I have to make money by writing about it. I detest them.,

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: Nothing is easier than spending the public money. It does not appear to belong to anybody. The temptation is overwhelming to bestow it on somebody.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Nothing is so strongly fortified that it cannot be taken by money.

author: Bob Riley
title: Nothing is worse, or more of a breach of the social contract between citizen and state, than for government officials, bureaucrats and agencies to waste the money entrusted to them by the people they serve.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: Nothing more clearly shows how little God esteems his gift to men of wealth, money, position and other worldly goods, than the way he distributes these, and the sort of men who are most amply provided with them.

author: Tertullian
title: Nothing that is God's is obtainable by money.

author: Ad Reinhardt
title: Now almost every artist outside of New York is connected with some school or some museum school, and even in New York the majority are. That's an interesting fact when you take the idea of making money, making a living selling paintings. Only a dozen or two painters do that.

author: Bill Hicks
title: Now, you have to tighten your belts, because we, your leaders, mis-spent your hard-earned money. Know what would make tightening my belt a little easier? If I could tighten it around Jesse Helms' scrawny little chicken-neck.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Nowadays love is a matter of chance, matrimony a matter of money and divorce a matter of course.

author: Ovid
title: Nowadays nothing but money counts: a fortune brings honors, friendships, the poor man everywhere lies low.

author: Bill Gross
title: Obama/Romney, Romney/Obama - the most important election of our lifetime? Fact is they're all the same - bought and paid for with the same money. Ours is a country of the SuperPAC, by the SuperPAC, and for the SuperPAC.

author: Bo Bice
title: Obviously everybody knows that I'm an original songwriter and I got my band. And the guys in 'Sugar Money,' no matter what, are part of my family and they always got something to do with me, and I don't care if they just hang out with me.

author: Barry Schwartz
title: Of course, bankers were always interested in making money. But when bankers had clients, they bore some responsibility for the clients' welfare.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Of course, money will do after its kind, and will steadily work to unspiritualize and unchurch the people to whom it was bequeathed.

author: Margaret Young
title: Often people attempt to live their lives backwards; they try to have more things, or more money, in order to do more of what they want, so they will be happier.

author: Barry Ritholtz
title: Often, investors will discover a manager after he's had a terrific run, usually when he lands on a magazine cover somewhere. Invariably, funds swell up with new investor money just before they revert to their long-term averages.

author: Brody Jenner
title: Once I'm satisfied and I've made enough money where I can afford to live in Malibu, because it's very expensive, I will definitely be back there.

author: Boman Irani
title: One can understand a person by the way he removes his wallet and puts his hand to take out money.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: One might think that the money value of an invention constitutes its reward to the man who loves his work. But speaking for myself, I can honestly say this is not so... I continue to find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.

author: Birch Bayh
title: One of the big challenges for our party is to demonstrate to people that we have an agenda for economic prosperity and that we can be trusted with their money.

author: Finley Peter Dunne
title: One of the strangest things about life is that the poor, who need the money the most, are the ones that never have it.

author: Carlton Cuse

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Confusing monogamy with morality has done more to destroy the conscience of the human race than any other error.

author: Giuseppe Mazzini
title: Constancy is the complement of all other human virtues.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Contempt for happiness is usually contempt for other people's happiness, and is an elegant disguise for hatred of the human race.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees all others.

author: Aristotle
title: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.

author: Bill Viola
title: Creativity is not the property of artists alone. It's a basic element of the human character, no matter what culture you're in, no matter where you are on Earth or in history.

author: Georges Bataille
title: Crime is a fact of the human species, a fact of that species alone, but it is above all the secret aspect, impenetrable and hidden. Crime hides, and by far the most terrifying things are those which elude us.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Criticism may not be agreeable, but it is necessary. It fulfils the same function as pain in the human body. It calls attention to an unhealthy state of things.,

author: William Blake
title: Cruelty has a Human Heart, And jealousy a Human Face; Terror the Human Form Divine, And secrecy the Human Dress. The Human Dress is forged Iron, The Human Form a Fiery Forge, The Human Face a Furnace seal d, The Human Heart its hungry gorge.

author: Brin-Jonathan Butler
title: Cuban athletes represent the most expensive human cargo on earth. They are sitting on over a billion dollars of human capital if these boxers and baseball players would come over to any other field or ring in the world and begin to ply their trade.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: Cultivation of mind should be the ultimate aim of human existence.

author: Bjorn Ulvaeus
title: Cultural variety is always worth striving for, but must never precede the declaration of human rights.

author: Matthew Arnold
title: Culture, the acquainting ourselves with the best that has been known and said in the world, and thus with the history of the human spirit.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: Curiosity is one of the lowest of the human faculties. You will have noticed in daily life that when people are inquisitive they nearly always have bad memories and are usually stupid at bottom.

author: David Hume
title:
Custom is the great guide to human life.,
,
,

author: David Hume
title: Custom, then, is the great guide of human life.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: Danger is the very basis of superstition. It produces a searching after help supernaturally when human means are no longer supposed to be available.

author: Buckminster Fuller
title: Dear reader, traditional human power structures and their reign of darkness are about to be rendered obsolete.

author: N. Rowe
title: Death is the privilige of human nature and life without it were not worth our taking.

author: Socrates
title: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.

author: Hannah Arendt
title: Death not merely ends life, it also bestows upon it a silent completeness, snatched from the hazardous flux to which all things human are subject.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: Democratic societies can no longer give religious fanatics a free hand to abuse and murder non believers. Such action betrays contempt for the basic human rights which animate any democracy with meaning.

author: Auberon Herbert
title: Deny human rights, and however little you may wish to do so, you will find yourself abjectly kneeling at the feet of that old-world god, Force.

author: Bob Barr
title: Despite two decisions, in 2008 and 2010, by the U.S. Supreme Court unequivocally affirming that the Second Amendment to the Constitution guarantees an individual right to keep and bear arms against infringement by the government, state legislatures continue to do just that - enact laws that significantly infringe this fundamental human right.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Determination is the wake-up call to the human will.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Different though the sexes are, they inter-mix. In every human being a vacillation from one sex to the other takes place, and often it is only the clothes that keep the male or female likeness, while underneath the sex is very opposite of what it is above.

author: Georg Groddeck
title: Disease is a vital expression of the human organism.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Disillusioned words like bullets bark , As human gods aim for their marks. , Make everything from toy guns that spark , To flesh-colored Christs that glow in the dark. , It's easy to see without looking too far that not much is really sacred.

author: Rita Mae Brown
title: Divorce is the one human tragedy that reduces everything to cash.

author: Agnes Macphail
title: Do not rely completely on any other human being, however dear. We meet all life's greatest tests alone.

author: Voltaire
title: Doctors are men who prescribe medicines of which they know little, to cure diseases of which they know less, in human beings of whom they know nothing.

author: Emily Dickinson
title:
Dogs are better than human beings because they know but do not tell.,
,
,

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Don't overestimate the decency of the human race.

author: Ben Johnson
title: Don't tell me I cheated the system because that's. I didn't get treated fairly by the system. They cast me out and they were jealous because I turned in the fastest time ever run by a human and it was impossible at the time.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Dreading that climax of all human ills the inflammation of his weekly bills.

author: Bob Graham
title: During the Cold War, we gathered information by listening to the Soviets, taking pictures of the Soviets, and we allowed our human intelligence to decline.

author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross
title: Dying is something we human beings do continuously, not just at the end of our physical lives on this earth.

author: Anais Nin
title: Each contact with a human being is so rare, so precious, one should preserve it.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: Each human being is a more complex structure than any social system to which he belongs.

author: Kofi Annan
title: Education is a human right with immense power to transform. On its foundation rest the cornerstones of freedom, democracy and sustainable human development.

author: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit
title: Education is not merely a means for earning a living or an instrument for the acquisition of wealth. It is an initiation into life of spirit, a training of the human soul in the pursuit of truth and the practice of virtue.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Education promotes equality and lifts people out of poverty. It teaches children how to become good citizens. Education is not just for a privileged few, it is for everyone. It is a fundamental human right.

author: Horace Mann
title: Education, then, beyond all other devices of human origin, is the great equalizer of the conditions of men - the balance-wheel of the social machinery.

author: Bill Viola
title: Emotions are the key to many aspects of life. They are precisely the elements that make human beings human. I think the fact that emotions have been reduced and put off to the side in intellectual work, particularly in the 20th Century, is tragic.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: Empathy is the most radical of human emotions.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: Enthusiasm is the energy and force that builds literal momentum of the human soul and mind.

author: Claude Lévi-Strauss
title: Enthusiastic partisans of the idea of progress are in danger of failing to recognize... the immense riches accumulated by the human race. By underrating the achievements of the past, they devalue all those which still remain to be accomplished.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Europe and Africa share proximity and history, ideas and ideals, trade and technology. You are tied together by the ebb and flow of people. Migration presents policy challenges - but also represents an opportunity to enhance human development, promote decent work, and strengthen collaboration.

author: Oswald C. Hoffman
title: Evangelism as the New Testament describes it is not child's play. Evangelism is work, often hard work. Yet it is not drudgery. It puts person in good humor, and makes him truly human.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Even if smog were a risk to human life, we must remember that life in nature, without technology, is wholesale death.

author: Andreas Capellanus
title: Even if the whole earth and sea were turned to gold, they could hardly satisfy the avarice of a woman... You can more easily scratch a diamond with your fingernail than you can by any human ingenuity get a woman to consent to giving any of her savings.

author: Horace Mann
title: Every addition to true knowledge is an addition to human power.

author: Arthur Machen
title: Every branch of human knowledge, if traced up to its source and final principles, vanishes into mystery.

author: Samuel P. Huntington
title: Every civilization sees itself as the center of the world and writes its history as the central drama of human history.

author: Emma Goldman
title: Every daring attempt to make a great change in existing conditions, every lofty vision of new possibilities for the human race, has been labeled Utopian.

author: Bo Bennett
title: Every day, people settle for less than they deserve. They are only partially living or at best living a partial life. Every human being has the potential for greatness.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: Every human being has a work to carry on within, duties to perform abroad, influence to exert, which are peculiarly his, and which no conscience but his own can teach.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: Every human being has an assortment of diverse identities, and it greatly matters which one is triggered by social situations, which hold up different kinds of mirrors. The same is true for nations.

author: Mel Brooks
title: Every human being has hundreds of separate people living under his skin. The talent of a writer is his ability to give them their separate names, identities, personalities and have them relate to other characters living with him.

author: Lydia M. Child
title: Every human being has, like Socrates, an attendant spirit; and wise are they who obey its signals. If it does not always tell us what to do, it always cautions us what not to do.

author: Charlie Rivel
title: Every human being is a clown but only few have the courage to show it.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: Every human being is intended to have a character of his own; to be what no others are, and to do what no other can do.

author: Caleb Carr
title: Every human being must find his own way to cope with severe loss, and the only job of a true friend is to facilitate whatever method he chooses.

author: U. Thant
title: Every human being, of whatever origin, of whatever station, deserves respect. We must each respect others even as we respect ourselves.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: Every idea is endowed of itself with immortal life, like a human being. All created form, even that which is created by man, is immortal. For form is independent of matter: molecules do not constitute form.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Every idol, however exalted, turns out, in the long run, to be a Moloch, hungry for human sacrifice.

author: Henry Miller
title: Every man with a bellyful of the classics is an enemy to the human race.

author: Carl Sagan
title: Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Every other enjoyment malice may destroy; every other panegyric envy may withhold; but no human power can deprive the boaster of his own encomiums.

author: Thomas Mann
title: Every reasonable human being should be a moderate Socialist.

author: Anne Sullivan Macy
title: Every renaissance comes to the world with a cry, the cry of the human spirit to be free.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Every stage of human life, except the last, is marked out by certain and defined limits; old age alone has no precise and determinate boundary.

author: Adam Ferguson
title: Every step and every movement of the multitude, even in what are termed enlightened ages, are made with equal blindness to the future; and nations stumble upon establishments, which are indeed the result of human action, but not the execution of any human design.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Every violation of truth is not only a sort of suicide in the liar, but is a stab at the health of human society.

author: Billy Gardell
title: Everybody wants to be a better version of themselves - everybody. And I hope one day I can lose some weight. Maybe, who knows, I'll hire myself a trainer and a fancy cook. In five years, maybe I'll be an action hero. Then again, maybe I'll just be this guy. Who knows? But the fun part is embracing the human side of that.

author: William James
title: Everyone knows that on any given day there are energies slumbering in him which the incitement's of that day do not call forth. Compared with what we ought to be, we are only half awake. The human individual usually lives far within his limits.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Everyone who wants to do good to the human race always ends in universal bullying.

author: Viktor E. Frankl
title: Everything can be taken away from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedom - to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way.

author: Gerda Lerner
title: Everything that explains the world has in fact explained a world that does not exist, a world in which men are at the center of the human enterprise and women are at the margin ''helping'' them. Such a world does not exist - never has.

author: Walter Savage Landor
title: Everything that looks to the future elevates human nature. Never is life so low or so little as when occupied with the present.

author: Agatha Christie
title:
Evil is not something superhuman, it's something less than human.,
,

author: W. H. Auden
title: Evil is unspectacular and always human, and shares our bed and eats at our own table.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Faith is different from proof; the latter is human, the former is a Gift from God.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Faith is the highest passion in a human being. Many in every generation may not come that far, but none comes further.

author: Jean Rostand
title: Falsity cannot keep an idea from being beautiful; there are certain errors of such ingenuity that one could regret their not ranking among the achievements of the human mind.

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: Feeling without judgment is a washy draught indeed; but judgment untempered by feeling is too bitter and husky a morsel for human deglutition.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Feminism has exceeded its proper mission of seeking political equality for women and has ended by rejecting contingency, that is, human limitation by nature or fate.

author: Phyllis Schlafly
title: Feminism is doomed to failure because it is based on an attempt to repeal and restructure human nature.

author: Herbert J. Muller
title: Few have heard of Fra Luca Parioli, the inventor of double entry bookkeeping; but he has probably had much more influence on human life than has Dante or Michelangelo.

author: Susan Sontag
title: Fewer and fewer Americans possess objects that have a patina, old furniture, grandparents pots and pans - the used things, warm with generations of human touch, essential to a human landscape. Instead, we have our paper phantoms, transistorized landscapes. A featherweight portable museum.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Folly is perennial, yet the human race has survived.

author: Carl Sagan
title: For a long time the human instinct to understand was thwarted by facile religious explanations.

author: Milan Kundera
title: For a novelist, a given historic situation is an anthropologic laboratory in which he explores his basic question: What is human existence?

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: For it is mutual trust, even more than mutual interest that holds human associations together. Our friends seldom profit us but they make us feel safe. Marriage is a scheme to accomplish exactly that same end.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: For one human being to love another: that is perhaps the most difficult of all our tasks, the ultimate, the last test and proof, the work for which all other work is but preparation.

author: Victor Hugo
title: For prying into any human affairs, non are equal to those whom it does not concern.

author: Thornton Wilder
title: For what human ill does dawn not seem to be alternative?

author: Arthur Henderson
title: Four years of world war, at a cost in human suffering which our minds are mercifully too limited to imagine, led to the very clear realization that international anarchy must be abandoned if civilization was to survive.

author: Ban Ki-moon
title: Freedom is a timeless value. The United Nations Charter calls for encouraging respect for fundamental freedoms. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights mentions freedom more than twenty times. All countries have committed to protecting individual freedoms on paper - but in practice, too many break their pledge.

author: Herbert Hoover
title:
Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.,
,

author: Herbert Clark Hoover
title: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.

author: Mikhail Bakunin
title: Freedom, morality, and the human dignity of the individual consists precisely in this; that he does good not because he is forced to do so, but because he freely conceives it, wants it, and loves it.

author: Charles Sumner
title: From the beginning of our history the country has been afflicted with compromise. It is by compromise that human rights have been ;abandoned.

author: Beth Orton
title: From the beginning, I wanted to make dance music with a human element to it.

author: Bela Karolyi
title: Genetics is all about showcasing human beauty along with high-quality performance.

author: Anna Lindh
title: Global markets must be balanced by global values such as respect for human rights and international law, democracy, security and sustainable economic and environmental development.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: Globalisation means many other countries are asserting themselves and trying to take over leadership. Please don't ask Americans to let others assume the leadership of human exploration. We can do wonderful science on the Moon, and wonderful commercial things. Then we can pack up and move on to Mars.

author: Francis Bacon
title:
God Almighty first planted a garden. And indeed, it is the purest of human pleasures.,
,
,

author: Louis Bernieres
title: God is an oppressor, He is incapable of human sympathy; behind a smiling face He hides an evil heart.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: God made us: invented us as a man invents an engine. A car is made to run on petrol, and it would not run properly on anything else. Now God designed the human machine to run on Himself.

author: J.G. Ballard
title: God was a clever idea ... The human race came up with a winner there.

author: Alfred Adler
title: God who is eternally complete, who directs the stars, who is the master of fates, who elevates man from his lowliness to Himself, who speaks from the cosmos to every single human soul, is the most brilliant manifestation of the goal of perfection.

author: Bob Barr
title: Going to war against Iran - whether one calls such a move 'surgical' or 'total' - would be an extremely serious undertaking; with worldwide economic, military, diplomatic and human ramifications in both the short- and the long-term.

author: Grenville Kleiser
title: Good humor is a tonic for mind and body. It is the best antidote for anxiety and depression. It is a business asset. It attracts and keeps friends. It lightens human burdens. It is the direct route to serenity and contentment.

author: Phyllis Mcginley
title: Gossip isn't scandal and it's not merely malicious. It's chatter about the human race by lovers of the same. Gossip is the tool of the poet, the shop-talk of the scientist, and the consolation of the housewife, wit, tycoon and intellectual. It begins in the nursery and ends when speech is past.

author: Ann Veneman
title: Great Britain had a much different situation than we do and did here in the United States, in that they had literally thousands of infected animals with human health risks. Their infectivity in this disease happened before very much was known about it.

author: Elizabeth Janeway
title: Growing up human is uniquely a matter of social relations rather than biology. What we learn from connections within the family takes the place of instincts that program the behavior of animals; which raises the question, how good are these connections?

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Hand: A singular instrument worn at the end of the human arm and commonly thrust into somebody's pocket.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: Hard conditions of life are indispensable to bringing out the best in human personality.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: Hardly a book of human worth, be it heaven's own secret, is honestly placed before the reader; it is either shunned, given a Periclean funeral oration in a hundred and fifty words, or interred in the potter's field of the newspapers back pages.

author: Brian K. Vaughan
title: Having children changes you forever, as a writer and as a human being. I hope it's for the better on both counts, but I guess we'll see.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: He that can carp in the most eloquent or acute manner at the weakness of the human mind is held by his fellows as almost divine.

author: Albert Camus
title: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: He who is only a traveler learns things at second-hand and by the halves, and is poor authority. We are most interested when science reports what those men already know practically or instinctively, for that alone is a true humanity, or account of human experience.

author: Harry Emerson Fosdick
title: He who knows no hardships will know no hardihood. He who faces no calamity will need no courage. Mysterious though it is, the characteristics in human nature which we love best grow in a soil with a strong mixture of troubles.

author: Harold Wilson
title: He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.

author: Arthur Miller
title: He's not the finest character that ever lived. But he's a human being, and a terrible thing is happening to him. So attention must be paid.

author: Akhenaton
title: Hear the words of prudence, give heed unto her counsels, and store them in thine heart; her maxims are universal, and all the virtues lean upon her; she is the guide and the mistress of human life.

author: Robert Wilson
title: Hedonic Engineering - The human nervous system studying and improving itself: intelligence studying and improving intelligence. Why be depressed, dumb, and agitated when you can be happy, smart, and tranquil?

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: Her body moved with the frankness that comes from solitary habits. But solitude is only a human presumption. Every quiet step is thunder to beetle life underfoot; every choice is a world made new for the chosen. All secrets are witnessed.

author: John A. Hannah
title: Higher education must lead the march back to the fundamentals of human relationships, to the old discovery that is ever new, that man does not live by bread alone.

author: Abdallah II
title: Historic changes and challenges. Breakthroughs in human knowledge and opportunity. And yet, for vast numbers across the globe, the daily realities have not altered.

author: Bill Nye
title: History is but the record of the public and official acts of human beings. It is our object, therefore, to humanize our history and deal with people past and present; people who ate and possibly drank; people who were born, flourished and died; not grave tragedians, posing perpetually for their photographs.

author: Lydia M. Child
title: Home - that blessed word, which opens to the human heart the most perfect glimpse of Heaven, and helps to carry it thither, as on an angel's wings.

author: Alexander Pope
title: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always To be Blest.

author: Ann Oakley
title: Housework is work directly opposed to the possibility of human self-actualization.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: How can a woman be expected to be happy with a man who insists on treating her as if she were a perfectly normal human being.

author: Alexander Smith
title: How deeply seated in the human heart is the liking for gardens and gardening.

author: Toni Morrison
title: How exquisitely human was the wish for permanent happiness, and how thin human imagination became trying to achieve it.

author: Sylvia Plath
title: How frail the human heart must be - a mirrored pool of thought...

author: Wallace Stevens
title: How has the human spirit ever survived the terrific literature with which it has had to contend?

author: Iris Murdoch
title: Human affairs are not serious, but they have to be taken seriously.

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: Human being is both being in the world and living in the world. Living involves responsible understanding of one's role in relation to all other beings. For living is not being in itself, but living of the world, affecting, exploiting, consuming, comprehending, deriving, depriving.

author: Laurens van der Post
title: Human beings are perhaps never more frightening than when they are convinced beyond doubt that they are right.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Human beings are the only animals of which I am thoroughly and cravenly afraid.

author: Bill Cosby
title: Human beings are the only creatures that allow their children to come back home.

author: Ashley Montagu
title: Human beings are the only creatures who are able to behave irrationally in the name of reason.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
title: Human beings hardly ever learn from the experience of others. They learn; when they do, which isn't often, on their own, the hard way.

author: Carl Sagan
title: Human beings have a demonstrated talent for self-deception when their emotions are stirred.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Human beings must be known to be loved; but Divine beings must be loved to be known.

author: George Eliot
title: Human beings must have action; and they will make it if they cannot find it.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: Human beings seem to be far more autonomous and self-governed than modern psychological theory allows for.

author: Ronald Laing
title: Human beings seem to have an almost unlimited capacity to deceive themselves into taking their own lies for truth.

author: Aung San Suu Kyi
title: Human beings the world over need freedom and security that they may be able to realize their full potential.

author: Aleksandr Solzjenitsyn
title: Human beings yield in many situations, even important and spiritual and central ones, as long as it prolongs one's well-being.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Human beings, by change, renew, rejuvenate ourselves; otherwise we harden.

author: William James
title: Human beings, by changing the inner attitudes of their minds, can change the outer aspects of their lives.

author: W. J. Reichmann
title: Human beings, for all their pretensions, have a remarkable propensity for lending themselves to classification somewhere within neatly labeled categories. Even the outrageous exceptions may be classified as outrageous exceptions!

author: Douglas Adams
title: Human beings, who are almost unique in having the ability to learn from the experience of others, are also remarkable for their apparent disinclination to do so.

author: George Eliot
title: Human beliefs, like all other natural growths, elude the barrier of systems.

author: A. J. P. Taylor
title: Human blunders usually do more to shape history than human wickedness.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: Human brutes, like other beasts, find snares and poison in the provision of life, and are allured by their appetites to their destruction.

author: Aaron Klug
title: Human curiosity, the urge to know, is a powerful force and is perhaps the best secret weapon of all in the struggle to unravel the workings of the natural world.

author: James Thurber
title: Human Dignity has gleamed only now and then and here and there, in lonely splendor, throughout the ages, a hope of the better men, never an achievement of the majority.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Human felicity is produced not as much by great pieces of good fortune that seldom happen as by little advantages that occur every day.

author: James Lendall Basford
title: Human happiness depends mainly upon the improvement of small opportunities.

author: H. G. Wells
title: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.

author: H.G. Wells
title: Human history in essence is the history of ideas.

author: James A. Froude
title: Human improvement is from within outward.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
title: Human judges can show mercy. But against the laws of nature, there is no appeal.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: Human kindness has never weakened the stamina or softened the fiber of a free people. A nation does not have to be cruel in order to be tough.

author: Camille Paglia
title: Human life began in flight and fear. Religion rose from rituals of propitiation, spells to lull the punishing elements.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: Human life is driven forward by its dim apprehension of notions too general for its existing language.

author: Christopher Leach
title: Human Love... It is that extra creation that stands hurt and baffled at the place of death. Being human, wanting children and sunlight and breath to go on, forever.

author: Primo Levi
title: Human memory is a marvelous but fallacious instrument. The memories which lie within us are not carved in stone; not only do they tend to become erased as the years go by, but often they change, or even increase by incorporating extraneous features.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
title: Human nature is above all things lazy.

author: Thomas Paine
title: Human nature is not of itself vicious.

author: Jane Austen
title: Human nature is so well disposed towards those who are in interesting situations, that a young person, who either marries or dies, is sure of being kindly spoken of.

author: George Moore
title: Human nature is very perverse, and we only care to hear of another's happiness when we are the givers of it.

author: Bill Gross
title: Human nature means that institutions at some point lose their sense of mission. That sense of vulnerability drives Pimco.

author: Thomas Mann
title: Human reason needs only to will more strongly than fate, and she is fate.

author: Amelia E. Barr
title: Human relations are built on feeling, not on reason or knowledge. And feeling is not an exact science; like all spiritual qualities, it has the vagueness of greatness about it.

author: Albert Camus
title: Human relationships always help us to carry on because they always presuppose further developments, a future -and also because we live as if our only task was precisely to have relationships with other people.

author: Anna Lindh
title: Human rights are praised more than ever - and violated as much as ever.

author: Malcolm X
title: Human rights are something you were born with. Human rights are your God-given rights. Human rights are the rights that are recognized by all nations of this earth.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Human salvation lies in the hands of the creatively maladjusted.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Human service is the highest form of self-interest for the person who serves.

author: Bernard Beckett
title: Human spirit is the ability to face the uncertainty of the future with curiosity and optimism. It is the belief that problems can be solved, differences resolved. It is a type of confidence. And it is fragile. It can be blackened by fear and superstition.

author: Leonardo DaVinci
title: Human subtelty will never devise an invention more beautiful, more simple or more direct than does Nature, because in her inventions, nothing is lacking and nothing is superfluous.

author: Barbara Block
title: Human technology has made it to Mars. We are transmitting gorgeous pictures from it. Yet we have not explored our own planet. Two-thirds of it is covered with oceans that are still mysterious places.

author: Blake Farenthold
title: Human trafficking robs victims of their basic human rights, and it occurs right under our noses. Many efforts have been focused in other regions of the world, but this is a major problem here at home.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Humanitarianism consists in never sacrificing a human being to a purpose.

author: Buckminster Fuller
title: Humans have always unknowingly affected all Universe by every act and thought they articulate or even consider.... Realistic, comprehensively responsible, omni-system-considerate, unselfish thinking on the part of humans does absolutely affect human destiny.

author: Edward de Bono
title: Humor is by far the most significant activity of the human brain.

author: Bill Nye
title: Humor is everywhere in that there's irony in just about anything a human does.

author: Bill Nye
title: Humor is everywhere, in that there's irony in just about anything a human does.

author: Alex Grey
title: I acknowledge the privilege of being alive in a human body at this moment, endowed with senses, memories, emotions, thoughts, and the space of mind in its wisdom aspect.

author: Stokely Carmichael
title: I also know that while I am black I am a human being, and therefore I have the right to go into any public place. White people didn't know that. Every time I tried to go into a place they stopped me.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: I am certain that after the dust of centuries has passed over our cities, we, too, will be remembered not for victories or defeats in battle or in politics, but for our contribution to the human spirit.

author: Terence
title: I am human and let nothing human be alien to me.

author: Jim Murray
title: I am not a literary man. I am a man of science, and I am interested in that branch of Anthropology which deals with the history of human speech.

author: Italo Calvino
title: I am prisoner of a gaudy and unlivable present, where all forms of human society have reached an extreme of their cycle and there is no imagining what new forms they may assume.

author: Mikhail Bakunin
title: I am truly free only when all human beings, men and women, are equally free. The freedom of other men, far from negating or limiting my freedom, is, on the contrary, its necessary premise and confirmation.

author: George Eliot
title: I at least have so much to do in unraveling certain human lots, and seeing how they were woven and interwoven, that all the light I can command must be concentrated on this particular web, and not dispersed over that tempting range of relevancies called the universe.

author: Anita Roddick
title: I believe in businesses where you engage in creative thinking, and where you form some of your deepest relationships. If it isn't about the production of the human spirit, we are in big trouble.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: I believe in democracy, because it releases the energies of every human being.

author: George Santayana
title: I believe in general in a dualism between facts and the ideas of those facts in human heads.

author: Malcolm X
title: I believe in human beings, and that all human beings should be respected as such, regardless of their color.,

author: Albert Einstein
title: I believe in Spinoza's God who reveals himself in the orderly harmony of what exists, not in a God who concerns himself with the fates and actions of human beings.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: I believe that a man is converted when first he hears the low, vast murmur of life, of human life, troubling his hitherto unconscious self.

author: Buzz Aldrin
title: I believe that every human has a finite number of heart-beats. I don't intend to waste any of mine running around doing exercises.

author: M. Russell Ballard
title: I believe that every human soul is teaching something to someone nearly every minute here in mortality.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: I believe that if we really want human brotherhood to spread and increase until it makes life safe and sane, we must also be certain that there is no one true faith or path by which it may spread.

author: Ace Frehley
title: I believe that the only way that the human race is gonna survive is to start colonizing space and setting up colonies on the moon, and then space stations.

author: Rosa Parks
title: I believe there is only one race - the human race.

author: Ben Stein
title: I came to realize that life lived to help others is the only one that matters and that it is my duty...This is my highest and best use as a human.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: I can forgive Alfred Nobel for having invented dynamite, but only a fiend in human form could have invented the Nobel Prize.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: I can only really speak for myself and what I've noticed in my kids and the people in my life, but because dinosaurs were real, and yet they seem so fantastical, is why they held such a huge fascination for me as a child. They're so different from human beings.

author: H. A. L. Fisher
title: I can see only one safe rule for the historian: that he should recognize in the development of human destinies the play of the contingent and the unforeseen.

author: Alban Berg
title: I can tell you, dearest friend, that if it became known how much friendship, love and a world of human and spiritual references I have smuggled into these three movements, the adherents of programme music - should there be any left - would go mad with joy.

author: Albert Einstein
title: I cannot imagine a God who rewards and punishes the objects of his creation and is but a reflection of human frailty.

author: Dudley Nichols
