title: Talk to every woman as if you loved her, and to every man as if he bored you, and at the end of your first season you will have the reputation of possessing the most perfect social tact.

title: Tell me what gives a man or woman their greatest pleasure and I'll tell you their philosophy of life.

title: The '90s are really the 'Sex and the City' woman, and I think, right now, the new contemporary woman is the 'Lipstick Jungle' woman.

title: The charms of the passing woman are generally in direct proportion to the swiftness of her passing.

author: Suzan B. Anthony
title:
The day may be approaching when the whole world will recognize woman as the equal of man.,
,

author: Edgar Allan Poe

title: The one woman who never gives herself is your free woman, who is always giving herself.

title: The quickest way to know a woman is to go shopping with her.

title: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.

title: The voting booth is the only place that a pauper equals a billionaire, and any woman equals any man.

title: War is to man what motherhood is to a woman. From a philosophical and doctrinal viewpoint, I do not believe in perpetual peace.

title: We know that ever woman wants to be thin. Our images of womanhood are almost synonymous with thinness.

title: What a profound significance small things assume when the woman we love conceals them from us.

title: What a woman says to her avid lover should be written in wind and running water.

title: What breadth, what beauty and power of human nature and development there must be in a woman to get over all the palisades, all the fences, within which she is held captive!

author: Bonnie Hunt

author: Robert Southey

title: Whatever evil a man may think of women, there is no woman but thinks more.

title: When a man gives his opinion, he's a man. When a woman gives her opinion, she's a bitch.

title: When a man says he had pleasure with a woman he does not mean conversation.,

author: Marguerite Duras

author: Tacitus
title: When a woman has lost her chastity she will shrink from nothing.

author: Leon Blum
title: When a woman is twenty, a child deforms her; when she is thirty, he preserves her; and when forty, he makes her young again.

title: When a woman is very, very bad, she is awful, but when a man is correspondingly good, he is weird.

author: Anton Chekhov
title: When a woman isn't beautiful, people always say, 'You have lovely eyes, you have lovely hair.'.

author: Alice Duer Miller
title:
When a woman like that whom I've seen so much, ,
All of a sudden drops out of touch; ,
Is always busy and never can, ,
Spare you a moment, it means a man.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When a woman marries again it is because she detested her first husband. When a man marries again it is because he adored his first wife. Women try their luck; men risk theirs.

author: Adrienne Rich
title: When a woman tells the truth she is creating the possibility for more truth around her.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When God created man and woman, he did not take a patent. That's why any imbecile has been able to do so ever since.

author: Blair Underwood
title: When I doing dinner theater in high school, I was talking to a woman who had been in the business for a while and I said I want to act, that's all I want to do with my life and she said if you're serious then you need to hone every discipline you can.

author: Quentin Crisp
title: When I told the people of Northern Ireland that I was an atheist, a woman in the audience stood up and said,  yes, but is it the God of the Catholics or the God of the Protestants in whom you don't believe?''

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: When I was coming of age, I remembered reading and studying the initial ideas within the feminist movement. There was this idea with my parents' generation that in order to find equality, a woman would need to behave like a man.

author: Brian K. Vaughan
title: When I was in college, I was belittling the woman who later become my wife for not knowing who Boba Fett was, and she responded by asking me if I knew who the Prime Minister of Israel was. Surprisingly? Not Mon Mothma.

author: Bradley Cooper
title: When I'm into a woman, I literally can't stop staring. I'm like a little kid. I become completely entranced.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: When lovely woman stoops to folly, and finds too late that men betray, what charm can soothe her melancholy, what art can wash her guilt away?

title: When men and woman die, as poets sung, his heart's the last part moves, her last, the tongue.

title: When men hold the greater majority of all professional positions of power, it is impossible for a woman to advance her career without the support of men.

author: Betty Friedan
title: When she stopped conforming to the conventional picture of femininity she finally began to enjoy being a woman.

author: Ang Lee
title: When there is a strong woman character in a story - that always grabs me.

author: Billie Jean King
title: When they take surveys of women in business, of the Fortune 500, the successful women, 80% of them, say they were in sports as a young woman.

author: Akhenaton
title: When virtue and modesty enlighten her charms, the lustre of a beautiful woman is brighter than the stars of heaven, and the influence of her power it is in vain to resist.

author: Barbara Taylor Bradford
title: When you are a strong woman, you will attract trouble. When a man feels threatened, there is always trouble.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: When you find Fortune favorable, stride boldly forward, for she favors the bold, and being a woman, the young.

author: Desiderius Erasmus

title: A body of water occupying about two-thirds of a world made for man, who has no gills.

author: Jean Rostand
title: A body of work such as Pasteur's is inconceivable in our time: no man would be given a chance to create a whole science. Nowadays a path is scarcely opened up when the crowd begins to pour in.

author: John Steinbeck
title: A book is like a man: clever and dull, brave and cowardly, beautiful and ugly. For every flowering thought there will be a page like a wet and mangy mongrel, and for every looping flight a tap on the wing and a reminder that wax cannot hold the feathers firm too near the sun.

author: Edmond and Jules de Goncourt
title: A book is never a masterpiece: it becomes one. Genius is the talent of a dead man.

author: Gian Vincenzo Gravina
title: A bore is a man who deprives you of solitude without providing you with company.

author: Bert Leston Taylor
title: A bore is a man who, when you ask him how he is, tells you.

author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
title: A businessman is the only man who is forever apologizing for his occupation.,

author: Robert Frost
title: A champion of the working man has never yet been known to die of overwork.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
title: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He says "I was beaten," he does not say "My men were beaten".

author: B. F. Skinner
title: A child who has been severely punished for sex play is not necessarily less inclined to continue; and a man who has been imprisoned for violent assault is not necessarily less inclined toward violence.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A child-like man is not a man whose development has been arrested; on the contrary, he is a man who has given himself a chance of continuing to develop long after most adults have muffled themselves in the cocoon of middle-aged habit and convention.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A Christian is nothing but a sinful man who has put himself to school for Christ for the honest purpose of becoming better.

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
title: A city that outdistances man's walking powers is a trap for man.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: A civilization is a heritage of beliefs, customs, and knowledge slowly accumulated in the course of centuries, elements difficult at times to justify by logic, but justifying themselves as paths when they lead somewhere, since they open up for man his inner distance.

author: Ezra Pound
title: A civilized man is one who will give a serious answer to a serious question. Civilization itself is a certain sane balance of values.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: A clever child brought up with a foolish one can itself become foolish. Man is so perfectible and corruptible he can become a fool through good sense.

author: Anthony Holden
title: A close associate of his gave an interview in which the book was described as quotes 'fiction from being to end'. I suffered trial by tabloid for a couple of weeks, lots of insults in the press, in the columns - this man should be put in the tower and so on.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: A committee is a thing which takes a week to do what one good man can do in an hour.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A conquered nation is like a man with cancer: he can think of nothing else.

author: Frank Dane
title: A conservative is a fellow who thinks a rich man should have a square deal.

author: Alfred E. Wiggam
title: A conservative is a man who believes that nothing should be done for the first time.

author: Frank Vanderlip
title: A conservative is a man who does not think that anything should be done for the first time.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: A conservative is a man who is too cowardly to fight and too fat to run.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs, who has never learned to walk.

author: Walter Bagehot
title: A constitutional statesman is in general a man of common opinions and uncommon abilities.

author: Joseph Addison
title: A contented mind is the greatest blessing a man can enjoy in this world.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: A cosmic philosophy is not constructed to fit a man; a cosmic philosophy is constructed to fit a cosmos. A man can no more possess a private religion than he can possess a private sun and moon.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: A coward is much more exposed to quarrels than a man of spirit.

author: Ayn Rand
title: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.

author: Carl Jung
title: A criminal becomes a popular figure because he unburdens in no small degree the consciences of his fellow man, for now they know once more where evil is to be found.

author: Channing Pollock
title: A critic is a legless man who teaches running.

author: Kenneth Tynan
title: A critic is a man who knows the way, but can't drive the car.

author: Carolyn Wells
title: A cynic is a man who looks at the world with a monocle in his mind's eye.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: A cynic is a man who, when he smells flowers, looks around for a coffin.

author: John Adams
title: A desire to be observed, considered, esteemed, praised, beloved, and admired by his fellows is one of the earliest as well as the keenest dispositions discovered in the heart of man.

author: Robert Frost
title: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.

author: Lord Melbourne
title: A doctrinaire is a fool but an honest man.

author: Aesop
title: A doubtful friend is worse than a certain enemy. Let a man be one thing or the other, and we then know how to meet him.

author: Arthur Keith
title: A drunkard is one thing, and a temperate man is quite another.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: A failure is a man who has blundered, but is not able to cash in on the experience.

author: Finley Peter Dunne
title: A fanatic is a man that does what he thinks the Lord would do if He knew the facts of the case.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A fanatic is a man who consciously over compensates a secret doubt.

author: George Orwell
title: A fat man is never so happy as when he is describing himself as "robust".

author: Bruno Rossi
title: A feeling that was possibly generated by experiences in my previous work on cosmic rays; more likely it was inborn and was the reason why, as a young man, I went into the field of cosmic rays.

author: Cass Sunstein
title: A few weeks ago, I was at the gym, talking to a friend about politics. Overhearing the conversation, a young man - maybe 25 years old - interrupted to say, 'Obama? He hasn't done a single thing!'

author: Joseph Roux
title: A fine quotation is a diamond in the hand of a man of wit and a pebble in the hand of a fool.

author: William Shenstone
title: A fool and his words are soon parted; a man of genius and his money.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: A fool flatters himself, a wise man flatters the fool.

author: William Blake
title: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.

author: Erasmus Darwin
title: A fool... is a man who never tried an experiment in his life.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: A funeral is not death, any more than baptism is birth or marriage union. All three are the clumsy devices, coming now too late, now too early, by which Society would register the quick motions of man.

author: Algernon Sydney
title: A general presumption that Icings will govern well, is not a sufficient security to the People... those who subjected themselves to the will of a man were governed by a beast.

author: Lord Greville
title: A generous man places the benefits he confers beneath his feet; those he receives, nearest his heart.

author: William B. Yeats
title: A gentleman is a man whose principal ideas are not connected with his personal needs and his personal succes.

author: Ben Jonson
title: A gentleman reading a poem that began with Where is that man that never yet did hear , Of fair Penelope, Ulysses' queen? calling his cook, asked if he had ever heard of her, who answering No, demonstrate to him Lo, there the man that never yet did hear , Of fair Penelope, Ulysses' queen.

author: Frederick Douglas
title: A gentleman will not insult me, and no man not a gentleman can insult me.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: A good cigar is as great a comfort to a man as a good cry is to a woman.

author: Elwyn Brooks White
title: A good farmer is nothing more nor less than a handy man with a sense of humus.

author: Iris Murdoch
title: A good man often appears gauche simply because he does not take advantage of the myriad mean little chances of making himself look stylish. Preferring truth to form, he is not constantly at work upon the façade of his appearance.

author: Brigham Young
title: A good man, is a good man, whether in this church, or out of it.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest; Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem; and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A great man is always willing to be little.,

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: A great man is different from an eminent one in that he is ready to be the servant of the society.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: A great man is made up of qualities that meet or make great occasions.

author: Alexander Smith
title: A great man is the man who does something for the first time.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A grindstone that had not grit in it, how long would it take to sharpen an ax? And affairs that had not grit in them, how long would they take to make a man?

author: Bruno Mars
title: A grown man should always carry cash, right? I don't know who told me, but someone told me that a long time ago, and the biggest turnoff is when a guy doesn't have cash on him.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is braver five minutes longer.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: A hungry man is not a free man.,

author: Philip Roth
title: A Jewish man with parents alive is a fifteen-year-old boy, and will remain a fifteen-year-old boy until they die!

author: John Selden
title: A king is a thing men have made for their own sakes, for quietness sake. Just as in a family one man is appointed to buy the meat.

author: Samuel Butler
title: A lawyers dream of heaven; every man reclaimed his property at the resurrection, and each tried to recover it from all his forefathers.

author: Miles Davis
title: A legend is an old man with a cane known for what he used to do. I'm still doing it.

author: Robert Frost
title: A liberal is a man too broadminded to take his own side in a quarrel.

author: Gregory Nunn
title: A liberal is a man who is right most of the time, but he's right too soon.

author: Heywood Broun
title: A liberal is a man who leaves a room when the fight begins.

author: Frank Dane
title: A liberal is man who will give away everything he doesn't own.

author: Robert Frost
title: A liberal man is too broad-minded to take his own side in a quarrel.

author: George Jean Nathan
title: A life spent in constant labor is a life wasted, save a man be such a fool as to regard a fulsome obituary notice as ample reward.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A lifetime of happiness! No man alive could bear it: it would be hell on earth.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: A light supper, a good night's sleep, and a fine morning have sometimes made a hero of the same man who, by an indigestion, a restless night, and a rainy morning would have proved a coward.

author: James Monroe
title: A little flattery will support a man through great fatigue.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: A little skill in antiquity inclines a man to Popery.

author: James Thomson
title: A little, round, fat, oily man of God.

author: John Cheever
title: A lonely man is a lonesome thing, a stone, a bone, a stick, a receptacle for Gilbey's gin, a stooped figure sitting at the edge of a hotel bed, heaving copious sighs like the autumn wind.

author: Burning Spear
title: A lot of things encouraged me to start my label. I think it's very important for an artist to know how many records they've sold and where they've sold. I know that I have never been treated the way I'm supposed to be treated - like an artist. That's why I do things for myself. I feel like I'm a free man.

author: Juvenal
title: A lucky man is rarer than a white crow.

author: Herodotus
title: A man calumniated is doubly injured - first by him who utters the calumny, and then by him who believes it.

author: Vince Lombardi
title: A man can be as great as he wants to be. If you believe in yourself and have the courage, the determination, the dedication, the competitive drive and if you are willing to sacrifice the little things in life and pay the price for the things that are worthwhile, it can be done.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: A man can be destroyed but not defeated.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.

author: Beryl Markham
title: A man can be riddled with malaria for years on end, with its chills and its fevers and its nightmares, but if one day he sees that the water from his kidneys is black, he knows he will not leave that place again, wherever he is, or wherever he hoped to be.

author: Helen Rowland
title: A man can become so accustomed to the thought of his own faults that he will begin to cherish them as charming little ''personal characteristics.''

author: Norman Douglas
title: A man can believe a considerable deal of rubbish, and yet go about his daily work in a rational and cheerful manner.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man can do only what a man can do. But if he does that each day he can sleep at night and do it again the next day.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: A man can do what he wants, but not want what he wants.

author: John Burroughs
title: A man can get discouraged many times but he is not a failure until he begins to blame somebody else and stops trying.

author: Anita Brookner
title: A man can go from being a lover to being a stranger in three moves flat but a woman under the guise of friendship will engage in acts of duplicity which come to light very much later. There are different species of self-justification.

author: Will Rogers
title: A man can learn only two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word, 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.

author: George Gurdjieff
title: A man can only attain knowledge with the help of those who possess it. This must be understood from the very beginning. One must learn from him who knows.

author: Mark Twain
title: A man can seldom - very, very, seldom - fight a winning fight against his training; the odds are too heavy.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A man can smile and smile and be a villain.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: A man can succeed at almost anything for which he has unlimited enthusiasm.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A man can't be too careful in the choice of his enemies.

author: Carole Bouquet
title: A man can't pass on, like a mother could, an awareness of your body, or sensuality, or what it means to be a woman. I was never taught what femininity was. I learnt it - or rather I invented it - on my own. I tended not to talk at all, if people were staring at me.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.

author: Thomas Scott
title: A man cannot leave a better legacy to the world than a well-educated family.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: A man cannot make a pair of shoes rightly unless he do it in a devout manner.

author: Ralph Waldo Trine
title: A man carries his success or his failure with him, it does not depend on outside conditions.

author: Robin George Collingwood
title: A man ceases to be a beginner in any given science and becomes a master in that science when he has learned that he is going to be a beginner all his life.

author: Abraham Polonsky
title: A man could spend the rest of his life trying to remember what he shouldn't have said.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man does not have to be an angel in order to be a saint.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: A man does not know what he is saying until he knows what he is not saying.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: A man does not sin by commission only, but often by ommission.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: A man does what he must - in spite of personal consequences, in spite of obstacles and dangers - and this is the basis of all human morality.

author: Frank Sinatra
title: A man doesn't know what happiness is until he's married. By then, it's too late.

author: Alexander Smith
title: A man doesn't plant a tree for himself. He plants it for posterity.

author: Alexander Smith
title: A man gazing on the stars is proverbially at the mercy of the puddles in the road.

author: William Shenstone
title: A man generally has the good or ill qualities he attributes to mankind.

author: Carlos Castaneda
title: A man goes to knowledge as he goes to war, wideawake, with fear, with respect, and with absolute assurance. Going to knowledge or going to war in any other manner is a mistake, and whoever makes it will live to regret his steps.

author: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek
title: A man has always to be busy with his thoughts if anything is to be accomplished.

author: William James
title: A man has as many social selves as there are individuals who recognize him.

author: St. Thomas Aquinas
title: A man has free choice to the extent that he is rational.

author: W. H. Auden
title: A man has his distinctive personal scent which his wife, his children and his dog can recognize. A crowd has a generalized stink. The public is odorless.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: A man has no religion who has not slowly and painfully gathered one together, adding to it, shaping it; and one's religion is never complete and final, it seems, but must always be undergoing modification.

author: Clare Boothe Luce
title: A man has only one escape from his old self: to see a different self in the mirror of some woman's eyes.

author: Ted Williams
title: A man has to have goals- for a day, for a lifetime- that was mine, to have people say, ''There goes Ted Williams, the greatest hitter who ever lived.''

author: Carolina Herrera
title: A man has to have sensibility, wit, mystery, tolerance, and strength... Romance also helps.

author: Charles Evans Hughes
title: A man has to live with himself, and he should see to it that he always has good company.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man in debt is so far a slave.,

author: Zsa Zsa Gabor
title: A man in love is incomplete until he has married - then he's finished.

author: Mae West
title: A man in love is like a clipped coupon - it's time to cash in.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: A man in passion rides a horse that runs away with him.

author: Charles Dickens
title: A man in public life expects to be sneered at - it is the fault of his elevated situation, and not of himself.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
title:
A man is a fool if he drinks before he reaches the age of 50, and a fool if he doesn't afterward.,
,

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man is a god in ruins.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: A man is a worker. If he is not that he is nothing.

author: Bernard Malamud
title: A man is an island in the only sense that matters, not an easy way to be. We live in mystery, a cosmos of separate lonely bodies, men, insects, stars. It is all a loneliness and men know it best.

author: Imamu Amiri Baraka
title: A man is either free or he is not. There cannot be any apprenticeship for freedom.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man is ethical only when life, as such, is sacred to him, that of plants and animals as that of his fellow men, and when he devotes himself helpfully to all life that is in need of help.

author: Anzia Yezierska
title: A man is free to go up as high as he can reach up to; but I, with all my style and pep, can't get a man my equal because a girl is always judged by her mother.

author: Aleksandr Solzjenitsyn
title: A man is happy so long as he chooses to be happy and nothing can stop him.

author: Demosthenes
title: A man is his own easiest dupe, for what he wishes to be true he generally believes to be true.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: A man is in general better pleased when he has a good dinner upon his table, than when his wife talks Greek.

author: Paul Valery
title: A man is infinitely more complicated than his thoughts.

author: Saadi
title: A man is insensible to the relish of prosperity until he has tasted adversity.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: A man is known by the company he organizes.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: A man is like a fraction whose numerator is what he is and whose denominator is what he thinks of himself. The larger the denominator the smaller the fraction.

author: James Allen
title: A man is literally what he thinks

author: George Santayana
title: A man is morally free when, in full possession of his living humanity, he judges the world, and judges other men, with uncompromising sincerity.

author: Cesare Pavese
title: A man is never completely alone in this world. At the worst, he has the company of a boy, a youth, and by and by a grown man - the one he used to be.

author: Joe E. Lewis
title: A man is never drunk if he can lay on the floor without holding on.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: A man is never more serious than when he praise himself.

author: Elwyn Brooks White
title: A man is not expected to love his country, lest he make an ass of himself. Yet our country, seen through the mists of smog, is curiously lovable, in somewhat the way an individual who has got himself into an unconscionable scrape seems lovable - or at least deserving of support.

author: Richard Nixon
title: A man is not finished when he's defeated; he's finished when he quits.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: A man is not good or bad for one action.

author: Victor Hugo
title: A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is visible labor and there is invisible labor.

author: John Banville
title: A man is not much if he can't depend on himself, and nothing if others can't depend on him.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: A man is not necessarily intelligent because he has plenty of ideas, any more than he is a good general because he has plenty of soldiers.

author: Jean Rostand
title: A man is not old as long as he is seeking something.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title:
A man is not paid for having a head and hands, but for using them.,
,

author: James Allen
title: A man is not rightly conditioned until he is a happy, healthy, and prosperous being; and happiness, health, and prosperity are the result of a harmonious adjustment of the inner with the outer of the man with his surroundings.

author: Patrick Kavanagh
title: A man is original when he speaks the truth that has always been known to all good men.

author: Ovid
title: A man is sorry to be honest for nothing.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: A man is the sum of his actions, of what he has done, of what he can do, Nothing else.

author: Harry Mathews
title: A man is too apt to forget that in this world he cannot have everything. A choice is all that is left him.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: A man is truly ethical only when he obeys the compulsion to help all life which he is able to assist, and shrinks from injuring anything that lives.

author: Beryl Bainbridge
title: A man is two people, himself and his cock. A man always takes his friend to the party. Of the two, the friend is the nicer, being more able to show his feelings.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.,

author: Raymond Hitchcock
title: A man isn't poor if he can still laugh.

author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
title: A man knows when he is growing old because he begins to look like his father.

author: Israel Zangwill
title: A man likes his wife to be just clever enough to appreciate his cleverness, and just stupid enough to admire it.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: A man lives by believing something: not by debating and arguing about many things.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man makes inferiors his superiors by heat; self-control is the rule.

author: Barten Holyday
title: A man may as well open an oyster without a knife, as a lawyer's mouth without a fee.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: A man may be a fool and not know it, but not if he is married.,

author: John Milton
title: A man may be a heretic in the truth; and if he believe things only because his pastor says so, or the assembly so determines, without knowing other reason, though his belief be true, yet the very truth he holds becomes his heresy.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: A man may be a pessimistic determinist before lunch and an optimistic believer in the will's freedom after it.

author: Anna Jameson
title: A man may be as much a fool from the want of sensibility as the want of sense.

author: George Gurdjieff
title: A man may be born, but in order to be born he must first die, and in order to die he must first awake.

author: Thomas Browne
title: A man may be in as just possession of truth as of a city, and yet be forced to surrender.

author: Samuel Johnson
title:
A man may be so much of everything that he is nothing of anything.,
,
,

author: Dean William R. Inge
title: A man may build himself a throne of bayonets, but he can't sit on it.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.

author: Elmer G. Letterman
title: A man may fall many times but he won't be a failure until he says someone pushed him.

author: Stevie Smith
title: A man may forgive many wrongs, but he cannot easily forgive anyone who makes it plain that his conversation is tedious.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: A man may fulfill the object of his existence by asking a question he cannot answer, and attempting a task he cannot achieve.

author: Sir Isaac Newton
title: A man may imagine things that are false, but he can only understand things that are true, for if the things be false, the apprehension of them is not understanding.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: A man may speak very well in the House of Commons, and fail very completely in the House of Lords. There are two distinct styles requisite: I intend, in the course of my career, if I have time, to give a specimen of both.

author: W.E. Charming
title: A man might pass for insane who should see things as they are.

author: John C. Maxwell
title: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.

author: Joseph Addison
title: A man must be both stupid and uncharitable who believes there is no virtue or truth but on his own side.

author: William Frederick Book
title: A man must be master of his hours and days, not their servant.

author: Amy Lowell
title: A man must be sacrificed now and again to provide for the next generation of men.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man must consider what a rich realm he abdicates when he becomes a conformist.

author: William Frederick Book
title: A man must drive his energy, not be driven by it.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: A man must eat a peck of salt with his friend, before he knows him.

author: Mme de Stael
title: A man must know how to fly in the face of opinion; a woman to submit to it.

author: William Feather
title: A man must not deny his manifest abilities, for that is to evade his obligations.

author: Havelock Ellis
title: A man must not swallow more beliefs than he can digest.

author: Lord George Byron
title: A man must serve his time to every trade save censure - critics all are ready made.

author: Ben Hecht
title: A man nearly always loves for other reasons than he thinks. A lover is apt to be as full of secrets from himself as is the object of his love from him.

author: Sherwood Anderson
title: A man needs a purpose for real health.

author: Helen Rowland
title: A man never knows how to say goodbye; a woman never knows when to say it.

author: Mark Twain
title: A man never reaches that dizzy height of wisdom that he can no longer be lead by the nose.

author: William Dean Howells
title: A man never sees all that his mother has been to him until it's too late to let her know he sees it.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A man never tells you anything until you contradict him.

author: John Galsworthy
title: A man of action forced into a state of thought is unhappy until he can get out of it.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: A man of courage is also full of faith.

author: Joyce Carey
title: A man of eighty has outlived probably three new schools of painting, two of architecture and poetry and a hundred in dress.

author: Joyce Cary
title: A man of eighty has outlived probably three new schools of painting, two of architecture and poetry, a hundred in dress.

author: Ezra Pound
title: A man of genius has a right to any mode of expression.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A man of genius is privileged only as far as he is genius. His dullness is as insupportable as any other dullness.

author: James Joyce
title: A man of genius makes no mistakes. His errors are volitional and are the portals of discovery.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A man of great common sense and good taste - meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.

author: George Herbert
title: A man of great memory without learning hath a rock and a spindle and no staff to spin.

author: Baltasar Gracian
title: A man of honour should never forget what he is because he sees what others are.

author: Carlos Castaneda
title: A man of knowledge chooses a path with a heart and follows it and then he looks and rejoices and laughs and then he sees and knows.

author: Carlos Castaneda
title: A man of knowledge lives by acting, not by thinking about acting.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: A man of meditation functions differently. Whatever profession he chooses, it does not matter. He will bring to his profession some quality of sacredness. He may be making shoes, or he may be cleaning the roads, but he will bring to his work some quality, some grace, some beauty, which is not possible without samÄdhi.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: A man of sense only trifles with them, plays with them, humors and flatters them, as he does with a sprightly and forward child; but he neither consults them about, nor trusts them with, serious matters.

author: Anita Brookner
title: A man of such obvious and exemplary charm must be a liar.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: A man of the world must seem to be what he wishes to be thought.

author: Will Rogers
title:
A man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.,
,

author: Samuel Johnson
title: A man ought to read just as his inclination leads him; for what he reads as a task will do him little good.

author: Michelangelo
title: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: A man perfects himself by working. Foul jungles are cleared away, fair seed-fields rise instead, and stately cities; and with the man himself first ceases to be a jungle, and foul unwholesome desert thereby. The man is now a man.

author: George Orwell
title: A man receiving charity always hates his benefactor- it is a fixed characteristic of human nature.

author: William Cowper
title: A man renowned for repartee will seldom scruple to make free with friendship's finest feeling, will thrust a dagger at your breast, and say he wounded you in jest, by way of balm for healing.

author: Joseph Addison
title: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.

author: Francis Thompson
title: A man should be an individual, but not independent.

author: David Gemmell
title: A man should be free to do what he wants to do, as long as it doesn't hurt others.

author: Samuel Butler
title: A man should be just cultured enough to be able to look with suspicion upon culture at first, not second hand.

author: Buddha
title: A man should first direct himself in the way he should go. Only then should he instruct others.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: A man should keep his little brain attic stocked with all the furniture that he is likely to use, and the rest he can put away in the lumber room of his library, where he can get it if he wants it.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
title: A man should keep his little brain attic stocked with all the furniture that he is likely to use, and the rest he can put away in the lumber-room of his library, where he can get it if he wants it.

author: Albert Pike
title: A man should live with his superiors as he does with his fire: not too near, lest he burn; nor too far off, lest he freeze.

author: Albert Einstein
title: A man should look for what is, and not for what he thinks should be.

author: Alexander Pope
title: A man should never be ashamed to own that he is wrong, which is but saying in other words that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.

author: Walt Disney
title: A man should never neglect his family for business.,

author: Sigmund Freud
title: A man should not strive to eliminate his complexes, but to get into accord with them; they are legitimately what directs his conduct in the world.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: A man sits as many risks as he runs.

author: James Allen
title: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: A man surprised is half beaten.

author: Sir Richard Burton
title: A man that hoards up riches and enjoys them not, is like an ass that carries gold and eats thistles.

author: Mary Wortley Montagu
title: A man that is ashamed of passions that are natural and reasonable is generally proud of those that are shameful and silly.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: A man that is born falls into a dream like a man who falls into the sea. If he tries to climb out into the air as inexperienced people endeavor to do, he drowns.

author: Epictetus
title: A man that seeks truth and loves it must be reckoned precious to any human society.

author: Francis Bacon
title: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: A man thinks as well through his legs and arms as this brain.

author: Don Marquis
title: a man thinks he amounts to a great deal but to a flea or a mosquito a human being is merely something good to eat

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: A man to carry on a successful business must have imagination. He must see things as in a vision, a dream of the whole thing.

author: George Moore
title: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.

author: Mark Twain
title: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.

author: Francis Bacon
title: A man who contemplates revenge keeps his wounds green.

author: Lucille Ball
title: A man who correctly guesses a woman's age may be smart, but he's not very bright.,

author: Charles Darwin
title: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.,

author: Confucius
title: A man who does not think and plan long ahead will find trouble right at his door.

author: Mario Puzo
title: A man who doesn't spend time with his family can never be a real man.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: A man who exposes himself when he is intoxicated, has not the art of getting drunk.

author: Richard Whately
title: A man who gives his children habits of industry provides for them better than by giving them a fortune.

author: Barbra Streisand
title: A man who graduated high in his class at Yale Law School and made partnership in a top law firm would be celebrated. A man who invested wisely would be admired, but a woman who accomplishes this is treated with suspicion.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: A man who has been the indisputable favorite of his mother keeps for life the feeling of a conqueror.

author: Confucius
title: A man who has committed a mistake and doesn't correct it is committing another mistake.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: A man who has never gone to school may steal from a freight car; but if he has a university education, he may steal the whole railroad.

author: Richard Nixon
title: A man who has never lost himself in a cause bigger than himself has missed one of life's mountaintop experiences. Only in losing himself does he find himself. Only then does he discover all the latent strengths he never knew he had and which otherwise would have remained dormant.

author: Khaled Hosseini
title: A man who has no conscience, no goodness, does not suffer.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A man who has no office to go to - I don't care who he is - is a trial of which you can have no conception.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: A man who has not passed through the inferno of his passions has never overcome them.

author: Juvenal
title: A man who has nothing can whistle in a robber's face.

author: Jane Austen
title: A man who has nothing to do with his own time has no conscience in his intrusion on that of others.

author: John Stuart Mill
title: A man who has nothing which he cares about more than he does about his personal safety is a miserable creature who has no chance of being free, unless made and kept so by the existing of better men than himself.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: A man who is a politician at forty is a statesman at three score and ten. It is at this age, when he would be too old to be a clerk or a gardener or a police-court magistrate, that he is ripe to govern a country.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: A man who is eating or lying with his wife or preparing to go to sleep in humility, thankfulness and temperance, is, by Christian standards, in an infinitely higher state than one who is listening to Bach or reading Plato in a state of pride.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: A man who is good enough to go to heaven is not good enough to be a clergyman.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: A man who is good enough to shed his blood for his country is good enough to be given a square deal afterwards. More than that no man is entitled to, and less than that no man shall have.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: A man who is much talked about is always very attractive.

author: Babe Ruth
title: A man who knows he's making money for other people ought to get some of the profits he brings in. Don't make any difference if it's baseball or a bank or a vaudeville show. It's business, I tell you. There ain't no sentiment to it. Forget that stuff.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: A man who leaves home to mend himself and others is a philosopher; but he who goes from country to country, guided by the blind impulse of curiosity, is a vagabond.

author: Phillips Brooks
title: A man who lives right, and is right, has more power in his silence than another has by his words.

author: P. D. James
title: A man who lives with nature is used to violence and is companionable with death. There is more violence in an English hedgerow than in the meanest streets of a great city.

author: Archibald Macleish
title: A man who lives, not by what he loves but what he hates, is a sick man.

author: Henry James
title: A man who pretends to understand women is ad manners. For him to really to understand them is bad morals.

author: Elwyn Brooks White
title: A man who publishes his letters becomes a nudist - nothing shields him from the world's gaze except his bare skin. A writer, writing away, can always fix himself up to make himself more presentable, but a man who has written a letter is stuck with it for all time.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: A man who sees another man on the street corner with only a stump for an arm will be so shocked the first time he'll give him sixpence. But the second time it'll only be a three penny bit. And if he sees him a third time, he'll have him cold-bloodedly handed over to the police.

author: Malcolm X
title: A man who stands for nothing will fall for anything.,

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: A man who strains himself on the stage is bound, if he is any good, to strain all the people sitting in the stalls.

author: Seneca
title: A man who suffers before it is necessary, suffers more than is necessary.

author: Nelson Mandela
title: A man who takes away another man's freedom is a prisoner of hatred, he is locked behind the bars of prejudice and narrow-mindedness.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: A man who trims himself to suit everybody will soon whittle himself away.

author: Muhammad Ali
title: A man who views the world the same at fifty as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.,

author: Georges Clemenceau
title: A man who waits to believe in action before acting is anything you like, but he's not a man of action.. You must act as you breathe.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act.

author: Martin Luther King
title: A man who won't die for something is not fit to live.

author: C. S. Forester
title: A man who writes for a living does not have to go anywhere in particular, and he could rarely afford to if he wanted.

author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
title: A man whose errors take ten years to correct is quite a man.

author: Lucius Accius
title: A man whose life has been dishonourable is not entitled to escape disgrace in death.

author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
title: A man will be imprisoned in a room with a door that's unlocked and opens inwards; as long as it does not occur to him to pull rather than push.

author: George Gurdjieff
title: A man will renounce any pleasures you like but he will not give up his suffering.

author: Barbara Cartland
title: A man will teach his wife what is needed to arouse his desires. And there is no reason for a woman to know any more than what her husband is prepared to teach her. If she gets married knowing far too much about what she wants and doesn't want then she will be ready to find fault with her husband.

author: Don Henley
title: A man with a briefcase can steal millions more than any man with a gun.

author: Harvey S. Firestone
title: A man with a surplus can control circumstances, but a man without a surplus is controlled by them, and often has no opportunity to exercise judgment.

author: Randolph Silliman Bourne
title: A man with few friends is only halfdeveloped; there are whole sides of his nature which are locked up and have never been expressed.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: A man without a goal is like a ship without a rudder.,

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
title: A man without a vote is man without protection.

author: Walter H. Cottingham
title: A man without ambition is like a bird without wings.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A man without an address is a vagabond; a man with two addresses is a libertine.

author: Malcolm X
title: A man without any history is like a tree without roots.

author: John W. Foster
title: A man without decision can never be said to belong to himself.

author: Marlene Dietrich
title: A man would prefer to come home to an unmade bed and a happy woman than to a neatly made bed and an angry woman.

author: William Booth
title: A man's labor is not only his capital but his life. When it passes it returns never more. To utilize it, to prevent its wasteful squandering, to enable the poor man to bank it up for use hereafter, this surely is one of the most urgent tasks before civilization.

author: Fawn M. Brodie
title: A man's memory is bound to be a distortion of his past in accordance with his present interests, and the most faithful autobiography is likely to mirror less what a man was than what he has become.

author: Alexander Graham Bell
title: A man, as a general rule, owes very little to what he is born with - a man is what he makes of himself.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: A man, to be greatly good, must imagine intensely and comprehensively; he must put himself in the place of another and of many others; the pains and pleasures of his species must become his own.

author: Jose Ferrer
title: A man, when he wishes, is the master of his fate.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A married man forms married habits and becomes dependent on marriage just as a sailor becomes dependent on the sea.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: A married man is a man with a past, while a bachelor is a man with a future.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: A mere literary man is a dull man; a man who is solely a man of business is a selfish man; but when literature and commerce are united, they make a respectable man.

author: Eugene Field
title: A mighty good sausage stuffer was spoiled when the man became a poet.

author: William Shakespeare
title: A miser grows rich by seeming poor. An extravagant man grows poor by seeming rich.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: A modest man is usually admired, if people ever hear of him.

author: Fred A. Allen
title: A molehill man is a pseudo-busy executive who comes to work at 9 am and finds a molehill on his desk. He has until 5 p.m. to make this molehill into a mountain. An accomplished molehill man will often have his mountain finished before lunch.

author: William Cowper
title: A moral, sensible, and wellbred man, I will not affront me, and no other can.

author: George Eliot
title: A mother's yearning feels the presence of the cherished child even in the degraded man.

author: Billy Childish
title: A moustache to a man is the same as a fringe is to a woman. When you've got it, you want to grow it out; when you've grown it out, you want to cut it.

author: Graham Greene
title: A murderer is regarded by the conventional world as something almost monstrous, but a murderer to himself is only an ordinary man. It is only if the murderer is a good man that he can be regarded as monstrous.

author: Thomas Beecham
title: A musicologist is a man who can read music but can't hear it.

author: Sir Thomas Beecham
title: A musicologist is a man who can read music but cannot hear it.

author: Sydney Smith
title: A nation grown free in a single day is a child born with the limbs and the vigor of a man, who would take a drawn sword for his rattle, and set the house in a blaze that he might chuckle over the splendor.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: A nice man is a man of nasty ideas.

author: William Hazlitt
title: A nickname is the heaviest stone that the devil can throw at a man.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: A nun, at best, is only half a woman, just as a priest is only half a man.

author: Bobby Seale
title: A people who have suffered so much for so long at hands of a racist society must draw the line somewhere.... the black communities of America must rise up as one man to halt the progression of a trend that leads inevitably to their total destruction.

author: Vilayat Inayat Khan
title: A perfect human being: Man in search of his ideal of perfection. Nothing less.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms agains himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: A Pike, in the California dialect, is a native of Missouri, Arkansas, Northern Texas, or Southern Illinois. The first emigrants that came over the plains were from Pike County, Missouri; but as the phrase, 'a Pike County man,' was altogether too long for this short life of ours, it was soon abbreviated into 'a Pike.'

author: Benjamin Rush
title: A pioneer is generally a man who has outlived his credit or fortune in the cultivated parts.

author: Harry S. Truman
title:
A politician is a man who understands government. A statesman is a politician who's been dead for 15 years.,
,

author: Edward. E. Cummings
title: A politician is an ass upon which everyone has sat except a man.

author: Ali ibn Abi Talib
title: A poor man is like a foreigner in his own country.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: A poor man who eats too much, as contradistinguished from a gourmand, who is a rich man who ''lives well.''

author: Georges Bernanos
title: A poor man with nothing in his belly needs hope, illusion, more than bread.

author: Winston Churchill
title: A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails, and then asks you not to kill him.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: A process which led from the amoebae to man appeared to the philosophers to be obviously a progress - though whether the amoebae would agree with this opinion is not known.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: A prohibitionist is the sort of man one couldn't care to drink with, even if he drank.

author: Robert Byrne
title: A promising young man should go into politics so that he can go on promising for the rest of his life.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.

author: Richard Nixon
title: A public man must never forget that he loses his usefulness when he as an individual, rather than his policy, becomes the issue.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: A radical is a man with both feet firmly planted in the air.

author: Otto von Bismarck
title: A really great man is known by three signs... generosity in the design, humanity in the execution, moderation in success.

author: Alfred Nobel
title: A recluse without books and ink is already in life a dead man.,

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: A religious man is a person who holds God and man in one thought at one time, at all times, who suffers harm done to others, whose greatest passion is compassion, whose greatest strength is love and defiance of despair.

author: W. C. Fields
title: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.,

author: Imamu Amiri Baraka
title: A rich man told me recently that a liberal is a man who tells other people what to do with their money.

author: Henry Fielding
title: A rich man without charity is a rogue; and perhaps it would be no difficult matter to prove that he is also a fool.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.

author: Peter McArthur
title: A satirist is a man who discovers unpleasant things about himself and then says them about other people.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A sect or party is an incognito devised to save man from the vexation of thinking.

author: Al Goldstein
title: A self made man is a rarity and hated by the parasites that floated to fame thought their parents, relatives and contacts.

author: William Cowper
title: A self-made man? Yes, and one who worships his creator.

author: Andrew Coyle Bradley
title: A Shakespearean tragedy as so far considered may be called a story of exceptional calamity leading to the death of a man in high estate. But it is clearly much more than this, and we have now to regard it from another side.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: A silly idea is current that good people do not know what temptation means. This is an obvious lie. Only those who try to resist temptation know how strong it is.... A man who gives in to temptation after five minutes simply does not know what it would have been like an hour later. That is why bad people, in one sense, know very little about badness. They have lived a sheltered life by always giving in.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: A single conversation across the table with a wise man is better than ten years mere study of books.,

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: A single man has not nearly the value he would have in a state of union. He is an incomplete animal. He resembles the odd half of a pair of scissors.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: A slave has but one master. An ambition man, has as many as there are people who helped him get his fortune.

author: George Washington
title: A slender acquaintance with the world must convince every man that actions, not words, are the true criterion of the attachment of friends.

author: Shawn McCabe
title:
A snake is afraid of a mongoes, a mongoes is afraid of a dog, a dog is,
afraid of man, but why is man not afraid of God?

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: A society which allows an abominable event to burgeon from its dung heap and grow on its surface is like a man who lets a fly crawl unheeded across his face or saliva dribble from his mouth - either epileptic or dead.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: A speculator is a man who observes the future, and acts before it occurs.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: A strong and secure man digests his experiences (deeds and misdeeds alike) just as he digests his meat, even when he has some bits to swallow.

author: Francis Bacon
title: A sudden bold and unexpected question doth many times surprise a man and lay him open.

author: Mary Elizabeth Hewitt
title: A sumptuous dwelling the rich man hath. And dainty is his repast; but remember that luxury's prodigal hand keeps the furnace of toil in blast.

author: Albert Einstein
title: A table, a chair, a bowl of fruit and a violin; what a man needs to be happy ?

author: Dag Hammarskjöld
title: A task becomes a duty from the moment you suspect it to be an essential part of that integrity which alone entitles a man to assume responsibility.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A tool is but the extension of a man's hand, and a machine is but a complex tool. And he that invents a machine augments the power of a man and the well-being of mankind.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: A tree trunk the size of a man grows from a blade as thin as a hair. A tower nine stories high is built from a small heap of earth.

author: W. H. Auden
title: A tremendous number of people in America work very hard at something that bores them. Even a rich man thinks he has to go down to the office everyday. Not because he likes it but because he can't think of anything else to do.

author: Napoleon
title: A true man hates no one.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: A vain man finds it wise to speak good or ill of himself; a modest man does not talk of himself.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: A vow is fixed and unalterable determination to do a thing, when such a determination is related to something noble which can only uplift the man who makes the resolve.

author: William Hazlitt
title: A Whig is properly what is called a Trimmer - that is, a coward to both sides of the question, who dare not be a knave nor an honest man, but is a sort of whiffing, shuffling, cunning, silly, contemptible, unmeaning negation of the two.

author: Bruce Lee
title: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.

author: Mark Twain
title: A wise man does not waste so good a commodity as lying for naught.

author: Epictetus
title: A wise man is he who does not grieve for the thing which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.

author: Baltasar Gracián
title: A wise man learns more from his enemies than a fool from his friends.

author: Robert Cecil
title: A wise man looks upon men as he does on horses; all their comparisons of title, wealth, and place, he consider but as harness.

author: John Churton Collins
title: A wise man thinks what is easy is difficult.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: A wise man turns chance into good fortune.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: A wise man who stands firm is a statesman, a foolish man who stands firm is a catastrophe.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: A wise man will live as much within his wit as within his income.

author: Francis Bacon
title: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.

author: Machiavelli
title: A wise man will see to it that his acts always seem voluntary and not done by compulsion, however much he may be compelled by necessity.

author: David Hume
title: A wise man, therefore, proportions his belief to the evidence.

author: Sir John Lubbock
title: A wise system of education will at last teach us how little man yet knows, how much he has still to learn.

author: James Stephens
title: A woman is a branchy tree and man a singing wind; and from her branches carelessly he takes what he can find.

author: Betty Friedan
title: A woman is handicapped by her sex, and handicaps society, either by slavishly copying the pattern of man's advance in the professions, or by refusing to compete with man at all.

author: Lord George Byron
title: A woman who gives any advantage to a man may expect a lover - but will sooner or later find a tyrant.

author: Julie Burchill
title: A woman who looks like a girl and thinks like a man is the best sort, the most enjoyable to be and the most pleasurable to have and to hold.

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
title: A woman's always younger than a man at equal years.

author: Lawrence Durrell
title: A woman's best love letters are always written to the man she is betraying.

author: Oliver Herford
title: A woman's mind is cleaner than a man s: She changes it more often.

author: Abel Stevens
title: A woman... always feels herself complimented by love, though it may be from a man incapable of winning her heart, or perhaps even her esteem.

author: Malcolm de Chazal
title: A women knows how to keep quiet when she is in the right, whereas a man, when he is in the right, will keep on talking.

author: Anton Chekhov
title: A writer is not a confectioner, a cosmetic dealer, or an entertainer. He is a man who has signed a contract with his conscious and his sense of duty.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: A young man is a theory, an old man is a fact.

author: Homer
title: A young man is embarrassed to question an older one.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: A young man who does not have what it takes to perform military service is not likely to have what it takes to make a living.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Absolutely speaking, Do unto others as you would that they should do unto you is by no means a golden rule, but the best of current silver. An honest man would have but little occasion for it. It is golden not to have any rule at all in such a case.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Abstainer. A weak man who yields to the temptation of denying himself a pleasure.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: Abuse a man unjustly, and you will make friends for him.

author: Pablo Picasso
title: Accidents, try to change them - it's impossible. The accidental reveals man.

author: Joan Collins
title: According to my sister, the expert novelist Jackie Collins, most men stray. And sex doesn't mean anything to most men. But I wouldn't date a man who slept around. Absolutely not. I've divorced people for that.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Act, if you like, but you do it at your peril. Men's actions are too strong for them. Show me a man who has acted and who has not been the victim and slave of his action.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Action hangs, as it were, ''dissolved'' in speech, in thoughts whereof speech is the shadow; and precipitates itself therefrom. The kind of speech in a man betokens the kind of action you will get from him.

author: Albert Pike
title: Action is greater than writing. A good man is a nobler object of contemplation than a great author. There are but two things worth living for: to do what is worthy of being written; and to write what is worthy of being read; and the

author: Patrick Kavanagh
title: Actors are loved because they are unoriginal. Actors stick to their script. The unoriginal man is loved by the mediocrity because this kind of ''artistic'' expression is something to which the merest five-eighth can climb.

author: Mark Twain
title: Adam was the luckiest man; he had no mother-in-law.

author: David Grayson
title: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: Adversities do not make a man frail. They show what sort of man he is.

author: Josh Billings
title: Adversity has the same effect on a man that severe training has on the pugilist - it reduces him to his fighting weight.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Adversity is the state in which man mostly easily becomes acquainted with himself, being especially free of admirers then.

author: John Donne
title: Affliction is a treasure, and scarce any man hath enough of it.

author: Robert Southey
title: Affliction is not sent in vain, young man, from that good God, who chastens whom he loves.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: After all he is only a man, that is to say capable of little and of much, of all and of nothing; he is neither angel nor brute, but man.

author: Ben Stein
title: After all the black man has been through in this world, he can still often reach levels of spirituality the most pampered white man cannot touch. Maybe what he's been through is the reason why.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: Against criticism a man can neither protest nor defend himself; he must act in spite of it, and then it will gradually yield to him.

author: Bernard Baruch
title: Age is only a number, a cipher for the records. A man can't retire his experience. He must use it. Experience achieves more with less energy and time.

author: Robert Frost
