title: Of what value is a mind when placed in the brain of a coward? If mind is a gift of God to man for his use, let him use it. A mind is not in use when doing no good.

author: Marcel Proust
title: Often it is just lack of imagination that keeps a man from suffering very much.

author: Bob Dylan
title: Oh God said to Abraham, Kill me a son. , Abe says, Man, you must be puttin' me on. , God say, No. Abe say, What? , God say, You can do what you want Abe, but , the next time you see me comin' you better run. , Well Abe says, Where do you want this killin' done? , God says, Out on Highway 61.

author: Adam Weishaupt
title: Oh mortal man, is there anything you cannot be made to believe.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Oh senseless man, who cannot possibly make a worm, and yet will make Gods by dozens.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Oh, give us the man who sings at his work.

author: Zelda Fitzgerald
title: Oh, the secret life of man and woman -dreaming how much better we would be than we are if we were somebody else or even ourselves, and feeling that our estate has been unexploited to its fullest.

author: Beck
title: Oh, the tragedy and the anguish. You just gotta Rage Against the Appliance, man. The toast is burning and you just gotta rip it out and free it before it fills the house with smoke. Rage Against the Toaster.

author: Felix Frankfurter
title: Old age and sickness bring out the essential characteristics of a man.

author: Herman Melville
title: Old age is always wakeful; as if, the longer linked with life, the less man has to do with aught that looks like death.

author: Leon Trotsky
title: Old age is the most unexpected of all the things that can happen to a man.

author: Boris Johnson
title: Old Man Howard, that Old Man Howard, he just keeps rolling, just keeps rolling.

author: Bowen
title: On a metaphysician: A blind man in a dark room - looking for a black hat - which isn't there.

author: William Hamilton
title: On earth there is nothing great but man; in man there is nothing great but mind.

title: On leaf of palm, on sedge-wrought roll; on plastic clay and leather scroll, man wrote his thoughts; the ages passed, and lo! the Press was found at last!

author: Buddha
title: On life's journey faith is nourishment, virtuous deeds are a shelter, wisdom is the light by day and right mindfulness is the protection by night. If a man lives a pure life, nothing can destroy him.

author: Bruce Forsyth
title: On stage, I think I'm 35. Working takes over my whole body and I become a younger man - that's why I won't stop.

author: Alfred de Vigny
title: On the day when man told the story of his life to man, history was born.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: On the pinnacle of success man does not stand firm long.

author: Alfred Russel Wallace
title: On the spiritual theory, man consists essentially of a spiritual nature or mind intimately associated with a spiritual body or soul, both of which are developed in and by means of a material organism.

author: Oscar Wilde

author: Thomas De Quincey
title: Once a man indulges himself in murder, very soon he comes to think little of robbing; and from robbing he comes next to drinking and Sabbath-breaking, and from that to incivility and procrastination.

author: Simeon Strunsky

author: Friedrich Nietzsche

title: Once you are really challenged, you find something in yourself. Man doesn't know what he is capable of until he is asked.

title: One anecdote of a man is worth a volume of biography.

title: One can only give an unbiased opinion about things that do not interest one, which is no doubt the reason an unbiased opinion is always valueless. The man who sees both sides of a question is a man who sees absolutely nothing.

title: One cannot be always laughing at a man without now and then stumbling on something witty.

title: One definition of man is ''an intelligence served by organs.''

title: One feels inclined to say that the intention that man should be ''happy'' is not included in the plan of ''Creation.''

title: One learns little more about a man from his feats of literary memory than from the feats of his alimentary canal.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.

author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar
title: One man can be a crucial ingredient on a team, but one man cannot make a team.

title: One man cannot hold another man down in the ditch without remaining down in the ditch with him.

author: B. Joweit
title: One man is as good as another until he has written a book.

author: Albert Pike
title: One man is equivalent to all Creation. One man is a World in miniature.

author: Knute Rockne

author: Andrew Jackson
title: One man with courage makes a majority.

title: One might think that the money value of an invention constitutes its reward to the man who loves his work. But speaking for myself, I can honestly say this is not so... I continue to find my greatest pleasure, and so my reward, in the work that precedes what the world calls success.

author: Jean Cocteau
title: One must be a living man and a posthumous artist.

title: One must not forget that recovery is brought about not by the physician, but by the sick man himself. He heals himself, by his own power, exactly as he walks by means of his own power, or eats, or thinks, breathes or sleeps.

title: One of humanity's prime drives is to understand and be understood. All other living creatures are designed for highly specialized tasks. Man seems unique as the comprehensive comprehender and co-ordinator of local universe affairs.

author: Josh Billings
title: One of rarest things that a man ever does is to do the best he can.

author: Groucho Marx
title: One of the best hearing aids a man can have is an attentive wife.

author: Samuel Butler
title: One of the first businesses of a sensible man is to know when he is beaten, and to leave off fighting at once.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
title: One of the great reasons for the popularity of strikes is that they give the suppressed self a sense of power. For once the human tool knows itself a man, able to stand up and speak a word or strike a blow.

author: Henry Ford
title: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't do.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: One of the illusions of life is that the present hour is not the critical, decisive hour. Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year. No man has learned anything rightly, until he knows that every day is Doomsday.

author: Josh Billings
title: One of the rarest things that a man ever does, is to do the best he can.

author: Man Ray
title: One of the satisfactions of a genius is his will-power and obstinacy.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: One of the surest evidences of an elevated taste is the power of enjoying works of impassioned terrorism, in poetry, and painting. The man who can look at impassioned subjects of terror with a feeling of exultation may be certain he has an elevated taste.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: One of the surprising things in this world is the respect a worthless man has for himself.

author: Bob Hoskins
title: One of the things I've realised is that I am very simple. My wife asked me once if I loved her. I said: 'Look love, I'm a simple man. I love you. End of story.' But I guess you gotta keep saying it with women. I guess she needed reassurance.

author: Bruce Eric Kaplan
title: One quintessential moment in time is when you're 22, when you graduate college. And then another quintessential time is as a middle-age man. That's the convergence.

author: Ching I
title: One should act in consonance with the way of heaven and earth, which is enduring and eternal. The superior man perseveres long in his course, adapts to the times, but remains firm in his direction and correct in his goals.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: One ungrateful man does an injury to all who stand in need of aid.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: One's only rival is one's own potentialities. One's only failure is failing to live up to one's own possibilities. In this sense, every man can be a king, and must therefore be treated like a king.

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: Only a man who has felt ultimate despair is capable of feeling ultimate bliss.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Only an inventor knows how to borrow, and every man is or should be an inventor.

author: Novalis
title: Only as far as a man is happily married to himself is he fit for married life and family life in general.

author: J. B. Yeats
title: Only for his dreams is a man responsible, his actions are what he must do.

author: John Dryden
title: Only man clogs his happiness with care, destroying what is, with thoughts of what may be.

author: Ronald Knox
title: Only man has dignity; only man, therefore, can be funny.

author: Hugh Blair
title: Only mediocrity of enjoyment is allowed to man.

author: Groucho Marx
title: Only one man in a thousand is a leader of men - the other 999 follow women.

author: Frederick W. Robertson
title: Only so far as a man believes strongly, mightily, can he act cheerfully, or do anything that is worth doing.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: Only the consciousness of a purpose that is mightier than any man and worthy of all men can fortify and inspirit and compose the souls of men.

author: Joan Didion
title: Only the dying man can tell how much time he has left.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Only the man who does not need it, is fit to inherit wealth, the man who would make his fortune no matter where he started.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: Only the unknown frightens men. But once a man has faced the unknown, that terror becomes the known.

author: Clark Kenneth
title: Opera, next to Gothic architecture, is one of the strangest inventions of Western man. It could not have been foreseen by any logical process.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: Opportunity is like a bald-headed man with only a patch of hair right in front. You have to grab that hair, grasp the opportunity while it's confronting you, else you'll be grasping a slick bald head.

author: George Eliot
title: Opposition may become sweet to a man when he has christened it persecution.

author: Robert Browning
title: Oppression makes the wise man mad.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Ordering a man to write a poem is like commanding a pregnant woman to give birth to a red-haired child.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Ordering a man to write a poem is like commanding a pregnant woman to give birth to a red-headed child.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Ought to be easy, ought to be simple enough: , Man meets woman, and they fall in love, , But the house is haunted and the ride gets rough. , You got to learn to live with what you can't rise above.

author: James Allen
title: Our life is what our thoughts make it. A man will find that as he alters his thoughts toward things and other people, things and other people will alter towards him.

author: Seneca
title: Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbor he is making for, no wind is the right wind.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: Our problems are man-made, therefore they may be solved by man. No problem of human destiny is beyond human beings.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Our tastes greatly alter. The lad does not care for the child's rattle, and the old man does not care for the young man's whore.

author: Richard Buckminster Fuller
title: Out of my general world-pattern-trend studies there now comes strong evidence that nothing is going to be quite so surprising and abrupt in the future history of man as the forward evolution in the educational process.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Out of the east on an Irish stallion came bounty hunter Dan , His heart quickened and burdened by the need to get his man , He found Pete peacefully fishing by the river, pulled his gun and got the drop , He said, Pete, you think you've changed, but you have not.

author: Immanuel Kant
title: Out of timber so crooked as that from which man is made nothing entirely straight can be carved.

author: Kingsley Amis
title: Outside every fat man there was an even fatter man trying to close in.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: Oxford is the most dangerous place to which a young man can be sent.

author: John Patrick
title: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.

author: William Penn
title: Passion is the mob of the man, that commits a riot upon his reason.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: Patience is the most necessary quality for business, many a man would rather you heard his story than grant his request.

author: James Thomson
title: Peace is the happy natural state of man; war is corruption and disgrace.

author: André Maurois
title: People are what you make them. A scornful look turns into a complete fool a man of average intelligence. A contemptuous indifference turns into an enemy a woman who, well treated, might have been an angel.

author: André Maurois
title: People are what you make them. A scornful look turns into a complete fool a man of average intelligence. A contemptuous indifference turns into an enemy a woman who, well treated, might have been an angel.

author: Bow Wow
title: People ask for this life, but they don't really understand what comes with it. People just see the outside and that looks good - big houses, cars, girls, but you never see how the person is feeling deep down inside. Me personally, being a man, I'm going to feel better displaying all of this and pouring my heart out on each record.

author: Diana Spencer Princess of Wales
title: People think that at the end of the day a man is the only answer. Actually, a fulfilling job is better for me.

author: Marcel Proust
title: People who are not in love fail to understand how an intelligent man can suffer because of a very ordinary woman. This is like being surprised that anyone should be stricken with cholera because of a creature so insignificant as the comma bacillus.

author: Robin George Collingwood
title: Perfect freedom is reserved for the man who lives by his own work and in that work does what he wants to do.

author: George Orwell
title: Perhaps a man really dies when his brain stops, when he loses the power to take in a new idea.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Perhaps man is the only being that can properly be called idle.

author: George Santayana
title: Perhaps the only true dignity of man is his capacity to despise himself.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Perpetual devotion to what a man calls his business, is only to be sustained by perpetual neglect of many other things.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Persistence is to the character of man as carbon is to steel.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: Personality is only ripe when a man has made the truth his own.

author: C.M. Schwab
title: Personality is to a man what perfume is to a flower.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: Personally, I hold that a man, who deliberately and intelligently takes a pledge and then breaks it, forfeits his manhood.

author: John Paul II
title: Pervading nationalism imposes its dominion on man today in many different forms and with an aggressiveness that spares no one. The challenge that is already with us is the temptation to accept as true freedom what in reality is only a new form of slavery.

author: Al Goldstein
title: Philosophy is an attempt by man to find cause and effect. Religion has the same goal.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: Physics does not change the nature of the world it studies, and no science of behavior can change the essential nature of man, even though both sciences yield technologies with a vast power to manipulate the subject matters.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Pleasure is Nature's test, her sign of approval. When man is happy, he is in harmony with himself and his environment.

author: Henry L. Doherty
title: Plenty of men can do good work for a spurt and with immediate promotion in mind, but for promotion you want a man in whom good work has become a habit.

author: Graham Greene
title: Point me out the happy man and I will point you out either egotism, selfishness, evil - or else an absolute ignorance.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: Political tyranny is nothing compared to the social tyranny and a reformer who defies society is a more courageous man than a politician who defies Government.

author: Sidney Madwed
title: Poor is the man who does not know his own intrinsic worth and tends to measure everything by relative value. A man of financial wealth who values himself by his financial net worth is poorer than a poor man who values himself by his intrinsic self worth.

author: Madonna
title: Poor is the man whose pleasures depend on the permission of another.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: Poor man wanna be rich, , rich man wanna be king , And a king ain't satisfied , till he rules everything.

author: Bill Williams
title: Pope John Paul, a man of peace and compassion, was one of the most revered leaders of our time.

author: Tacitus
title: Posterity gives every man his true value.

author: Stevie Smith
title: Poverty is no disgrace to a man, but it is confoundedly inconvenient.

author: James A. Garfield
title: Poverty is uncomfortable; but 9 times out of 10 the best thing that can happen to a young man is to be tossed overboard and be compelled to sink or swim.

author: Anzia Yezierska
title: Poverty was an ornament on a learned man like a red ribbon on a white horse.

author: James F. Byrnes
title: Power intoxicates men. When a man is intoxicated by alcohol, he can recover, but when intoxicated by power, he seldom recovers.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: Power is not of a man. Wealth does not center in the person of the wealthy. Celebrity is not inherent in any personality. To be celebrated, to be wealthy, to have power requires access to major institutions.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Power will intoxicate the best hearts, as wine the strongest heads. No man is wise enough, nor good enough to be trusted with unlimited power.

author: John Keats
title: Praise or blame has but a momentary effect on the man whose love of beauty in the abstract makes him a severe critic on his own works.

author: Leonard Cohen
title: Prayer is translation. A man translates himself into a child asking for all there is in a language he has barely mastered.

author: Henry Bolingbroke
title: Pride defeats its own end, by bringing the man who seeks esteem and reverence into contempt.

author: Abu Bakr
title: Pride in the case of a rich man is bad, but pride in the case of a poor man is worse.

author: Carl von Clausewitz
title: Principles and rules are intended to provide a thinking man with a frame of reference.

author: Germaine Greer
title: Probably the only place where a man can feel really secure is in a maximum security prison, except for the imminent threat of release.

author: Ezra Pound
title: Properly, we should read for power. Man reading should be man intensely alive. The book should be a ball of light in one's hand.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Property is intended to serve life, and no matter how much we surround it with rights and respect, it has no personal being. It is part of the earth man walks on. It is not man.

author: Eva Figes
title: Providing for one's family as a good husband and father is a water-tight excuse for making money hand over fist. Greed may be a sin, exploitation of other people might, on the face of it, look rather nasty, but who can blame a man for ''doing the best'' for his children?

author: Joey Adams
title: Psychiatrist: A man who asks you a lot of expensive questions your wife asks you for nothing.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Public opinion is a weak tyrant compared with our own private opinion. What a man thinks of himself, that it is which determines, or rather indicates, his fate.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: Putin himself is a character out of fiction, an uber-macho former Soviet thug running a massive, expansionist kleptocracy. The man stages photographs riding horses barechested and hunting tigers. His enemies find themselves on the wrong end of radioactive poisoning.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Quarrel not at all. No man resolved to make the most of himself can spare time for personal contention. Still less can he afford to take all the consequences, including the vitiating of his temper and loss of self control. Yield larger things to which you can show no more than equal right; and yield lesser ones, though clearly your own. Better give your path to a dog than be bitten by him in contesting for the right. Even killing the dog would not cure the bite.

author: Ann Beattie
title: Quite often my narrator or protagonist may be a man, but I'm not sure he's the more interesting character, or if the more complex character isn't the woman.

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: Racism is man's gravest threat to man - the maximum of hatred for a minimum of reason.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Rascals are always sociable - more's the pity! and the chief sign that a man has any nobility in his character is the little pleasure he takes in others company.

author: Aneurin Bevan
title: Reactionary: A man walking backwards with his face to the future.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Reading makes a full man, conference a ready man, and writing an exact man.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Reading makes a full man, meditation a profound man, discourse a clear man.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Reading maketh a full man; conference a ready man; and writing an exact man.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Reading, solitude, idleness, a soft and sedentary life, intercourse with women and young people, these are perilous paths for a young man, and these lead him constantly into danger.

author: Sammy Davis Jr
title: Real success is not on the stage, but off the stage as a human being, and how you get along with your fellow man.

author: Joseph Roux
title: Reason guides but a small part of man, and the rest obeys feeling, true or false, and passion, good or bad.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: Recognize the cunning man not by the corpses he pays homage to but by the living writers he conspires against with the most shameful weapon, Silence, or the briefest review.

author: Charles Dickens
title: Reflect upon your present blessings — of which every man has many — not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

author: Aleksandr Solzjenitsyn
title: Religion always remains higher than everyday life. In order to make the elevation towards religion easier for people, religion must be able to alter its forms in relation to the consciousness of modern man.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: Religion brings to man an inner strength, spiritual light, and ineffable peace.

author: George Gurdjieff
title: Religion is doing; a man does not merely think his religion or feel it, he ''lives'' his religion as much as he is able, otherwise it is not religion but fantasy or philosophy.

author: Elie Wiesel
title: Religion is not man's relationship to God, it is man's relationship to man.

author: Epitaph
title: Remember man as you walk by, as you are now so once was I, as I am now, so you will be, so prepare for death and follow me.

author: Bryant H. McGill
title: Remember that the greatest fool in the world may ask more than the wisest man can answer.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Remember that what pulls the strings is the force hidden within; there lies the power to persuade, there the life - there, if one must speak out, the real man.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Republicans are for both the man and the dollar, but in case of conflict the man before the dollar.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: Resistance to the organized mass can be effected only by the man who is as well organized in his individuality as the mass itself.

author: James Howell
title: Respect a man, he will do it the more.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: Restlessness is discontent and discontent is the first necessity of progress. Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: Result! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Revenge... is like a rolling stone, which, when a man hath forced up a hill, will return upon him with a greater violence, and break those bones whose sinews gave it motion.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Reverence: the spiritual attitude of a man to a god and a dog to a man.

author: Solomon
title: Riches are a stronghold in the imagination of a rich man.

author: Benedict Wong
title: Ridley Scott is a cinematic master and a great man. It was a real honour working with him on 'Prometheus.'

author: Lord George Byron
title: Roll on, deep and dark blue ocean, roll. Ten thousand fleets sweep over thee in vain. Man marks the earth with ruin, but his control stops with the shore.

author: Anita Brookner
title: Romanticism is not just a mode; it literally eats into every life. Women will never get rid of just waiting for the right man.

author: Ardal O'Hanlon
title: Running is never fun. Running is something that you do when there's a man chasing you with a knife.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Sadder than destitution, sadder than a beggar is the man who eats alone in public. Nothing more contradicts the laws of man or beast, for animals always do each other the honor of sharing or disputing each other's food.

author: Paul Klee
title: Satire must not be a kind of superfluous ill will, but ill will from a higher point of view. Ridiculous man, divine God. Or else, hatred against the bogged-down vileness of average man as against the possible heights that humanity might attain.

author: Myriam Miedzian
title: Saving lives is not a top priority in the halls of power. Being compassionate and concerned about human life can cause a man to lose his job. It can cause a woman not to get the job to begin with.

author: Johann Gottfried Von Herder
title: Say oh wise man how you have come to such knowledge? Because I was never ashamed to confess my ignorance and ask others.

author: Eric Gill
title: Science is analytical, descriptive, informative. Man does not live by bread alone, but by science he attempts to do so. Hence the deadliness of all that is purely scientific.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Seek always to do some good, somewhere. Every man has to seek in his own way to realize his true worth. You must give some time to your fellow man. For remember, you don't live in a world all your own. Your brothers are here too.

author: Albert Ellis
title: Self-esteem is the greatest sickness known to man or woman because it's conditional.

author: Florence King
title: Self-help books are making life downright unsafe. Women desperate to catch a man practice all the ploys recommended by these authors. Bump into him, trip over him, knock him down, spill something on him, scald him, but meet him.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: Self-interest is but the survival of the animal in us. Humanity only begins for man with self-surrender.

author: Charles Buxton
title: Self-laudation abounds among the unpolished, but nothing can stamp a man more sharply as ill-bred.

author: Andrew Marvell
title: Self-preservation, nature's first great law, all the creatures, except man, doth awe.

author: Aeschylus
title: Self-will in the man who does not reckon wisely is by itself the weakest of all things.

author: D. H. Lawrence
title: Sex goes through the rhythm of the year, in man and woman, ceaselessly changing: the rhythm of the sun in his relation to the earth.

author: Barry Humphries
title: Sex is the most beautiful thing that can take place between a happily married man and his secretary.,

author: Marty Feldman
title: Sex is two plus two making five, rather than four. Sex is the X ingredient that you can't define, and it's that X ingredient between two people that make both a man and a woman good in bed. It's all relative. There are no rules.

author: Brigham Young
title: Shall I tell you the law of God in regard to the African race? If the white man who belongs to the chosen seed mixes his blood with the seed of Cain, the penalty, under the law of God, is death on the spot. This will always be so.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Shame is the feeling you have when you agree with the woman who loves you that you are the man she thinks you are.

author: Brantley Gilbert
title: She's definitely an angel sent from above. How can that not rub off on a man? What can I say? I'm a mama's boy.

author: Charles Péguy
title: Short of genius a rich man cannot even imagine poverty.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Should not every apartment in which man dwells be lofty enough to create some obscurity overhead, where flickering shadows may play at evening about the rafters?

author: Bill Kristol
title: Shouldn't Democrats insist that Sen. Durbin step down as their whip, the number two man in their leadership?

author: Julie Burchill
title: Show me a frigid women and, nine times out of ten, I'll show you a little man.

author: Charles Bukowski
title: Show me a man who lives alone and has a perpetually clean kitchen, and 8 times out of 9 I'll show you a man with detestable spiritual qualities.

author: Joe E. Lewis
title: Show me a man with both feet on the ground and I'll show you a man who can't get his pants on.

author: Joe E. Lewis
title: Show me a man with very little money and I will show you a bum.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: Show me a sane man and I will cure him for you.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure.

author: Erica Jong
title: Show me a woman who doesn't feel guilty and I'll show you a man.

author: B. F. Harris
title: Show me the business man or institution not guided by sentiment and service; by the idea that he profits most who serves best and I will show you a man or an outfit that is dead or dying.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Show me the man you honor, and I will know what kind of man you are.,

author: Desmond Tutu
title: Show me where Christ said "Love thy fellow man, except for the gay ones." Gay people, too, are made in my God's image. I would never worship a homophobic God.

author: H. L. Wayland
title: Show us a man who never makes a mistake and we will show you a man who never makes anything. The capacity for occasional blundering is inseparable from the capacity to bring things to pass. The only men who are past the danger of making mistakes are the men who sleep at Greenwood.

author: Aaron Hill
title: Shun fear, it is the ague of the soul! a passion man created for himself - for sure that cramp of nature could not dwell in the warm realms of glory.

author: Lord George Byron
title: Sighing that Nature formed but one such man, and broke the die.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Silence is the safest course for any man to adopt who distrust himself.

author: John Dryden
title: Since every man who lives is born to die, and none can boast sincere felicity, with equal mind, what happens, let us bear, nor joy nor grieve too much for things beyond our care.

author: John Tillotson
title: Sincerity is like traveling on a plain, beaten road, which commonly brings a man sooner to his journey's end than by-ways, in which men often lose themselves.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Sincerity is the luxury allowed, like diadems and authority, only to the highest rank. Every man alone is sincere. At the entrance of a second person, hypocrisy begins.

author: Billy Joel
title: Sing us a song you're the piano man Sing us a song tonight Well we're all in the mood for a melody And you've got us feeling alright.

author: Billie Holiday
title: Singing songs like 'The Man I Love' or 'Porgy' is no more work than sitting down and eating Chinese roast duck, and I love roast duck.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Sir, a man may be so much of everything, that he is nothing of anything.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Sir, a man who cannot get to heaven in a green coat, will not find his way thither the sooner in a gray one.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Sir, I do not call a gamester a dishonest man; but I call him an unsociable man, an unprofitable man. Gaming is a mode of transferring property without producing any intermediate good.

author: Art Buchwald
title: So far things are going my way. I am known in the hospice as The Man Who Wouldn't Die. I don't know if this is true or not, but I think some people, not many, are starting to wonder why I'm still around.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: So long as a man imagines that he cannot do this or that, so long as he is determined not to do it; and consequently so long as it is impossible to him that he should do it.

author: Laurence Sterne
title: So long as a man rides his Hobby-Horse peaceably and quietly along the King's highway, and neither compels you or me to get up behind him - pray, Sir, what have either you or I to do with it?

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: So long as we are loved by others I should say that we are almost indispensable; and no man is useless while he has a friend.

author: Antonin Artaud
title: So long as we have failed to eliminate any of the causes of human despair, we do not have the right to try to eliminate those means by which man tries to cleanse himself of despair.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: So much for industry, my friends, and attention to one's own business; but to these we must add frugality if we would make our industry more certainly successful. A man may, if he knows not how to save as he gets, keep his nose all his life to the grindstone, and die not worth a grout at last.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: So much of our lives is given over to the consideration of our imperfections that there is no time to improve our imaginary virtues. The truth is we only perfect our vices, and man is a worse creature when he dies than he was when he was born.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: So near is falsehood to truth that a wise man would do well not to trust himself on the narrow edge.

author: Boethius
title: So nothing is ever good or bad unless you think it so, and vice versa. All luck is good luck to the man who bears it with equanimity.

author: John Dryden
title: So over violent, or over civil that every man with him was God or Devil.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: So they put a rifle in my hand Sent me off to a foreign land To go and kill the yellow man Born in the U.S.A.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Some collaboration has to take place in the mind between the woman and the man before the art of creation can be accomplished. Some marriage of opposites has to be consummated. The whole of the mind must lie wide open if we are to get the sense that the

author: Billie Holiday
title: Some men like me talkin' happy , Some calls it snappy , Some call me honey , Others think I got money , Some tell me baby you're built for speed , Now if you put that all together , Makes me everything a good man needs.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Some women can be fooled all of the time, and all women can be fooled some of the time, but the same woman can't be fooled by the same man in the same way more than half of the time.

author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
title: Someday, after mastering winds, waves, tides and gravity, we shall harness the energy of love; and for the second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.

author: Plutarch
title: Someone praising a man for his foolhardy bravery, Cato, the elder, said, ''There is a wide difference between true courage and a mere contempt of life.''

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: Sometimes a man hits upon a place to which he mysteriously feels that he belongs.

author: Willa Cather
title: Sometimes a neighbor whom we have disliked a lifetime for his arrogance and conceit lets fall a single commonplace remark that shows us another side, another man, really; a man uncertain, and puzzled, and in the dark like ourselves.

author: Boris Kodjoe
title: Sometimes in the black culture, being raised as an independent woman is misconstrued as someone who doesn't need a man. I think that's wrong. I think we all need someone.

author: Alfred Einstein
title: Sometimes the picture that emerges of the man seems no longer to agree with our conception of the musician. In reality, however, there is a glorious unity.

author: Ruth E. Renkel
title: Sometimes the poorest man leaves his children the richest inheritance.

author: Arnold J. Toynbee
title: Sooner or later, man has always had to decide whether he worships his own power or the power of God.

author: Adolf Hitler
title: Sooner will a camel pass through a needle's eye than a great man be 'discovered' by an election.

author: James Thurber
title: Sophistication might be described as the ability to cope gracefully with a situation involving the presence of a formidable menace to one's poise and prestige (such as the butler, or the man under the bed - but never the husband).

author: Arthur Cohn
title: Speak slowly, Michael. He is an honourable man.

author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand
title: Speech has been given to man to disguise his thoughts.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: Speech is the mirror of the soul; as a man speaks, so he is.

author: Benjamin Stillingfleet
title: Spite of all the fools that pride has made, 'Tis not on man a useless burthen laid; Pride has ennobled some, and some disgraced; It hurts not in itself, but as 'tis placed; When right, its views know none but virtue's bound; When wrong, it scarcely looks one inch around.

author: Aneurin Bevan
title: Stand not too near the rich man lest he destroy thee - and not too far away lest he forget thee.

author: Dame Edith Sitwell
title: Still falls the rain - dark as the world of man, black as our loss - blind as the nineteen hundred and forty nails upon the Cross.

author: Samuel Pepys
title: Strange, to see what delight we married people have to see these poor fools decoyed into our condition, every man and wife gazing and smiling at them.

author: Adolf Hitler
title: Struggle is the father of all things. It is not by the principles of humanity that man lives or is able to preserve himself above the animal world, but solely by means of the most brutal struggle.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Stupidity often saves a man from going mad.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: Style is not something applied. It is something that permeates. It is of the nature of that in which it is found, whether the poem, the manner of a god, the bearing of a man. It is not a dress.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Subtract from the great man all that he owes to opportunity, all that he owes to chance, and all that he gained by the wisdom of his friends and the folly of his enemies, and the giant will often be seen to be a pygmy.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Success in its highest and noblest form calls for peace of mind and enjoyment and happiness which come only to the man who has found the work that he likes best.

author: Captain J. G. Stedman
title: Such indeed is the superior longevity of the fair females of Surinam, compared to that of the males (owing chiefly, as I said, to their excesses of all sorts) that I have frequently known wives who have buried four husbands, but never met a man in this country who had survived two wives.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Suffrage, noun. Expression of opinion by means of a ballot. The right of suffrage (which is held to be both a privilege and a duty) means, as commonly interpreted, the right to vote for the man of another man's choice, and is highly prized.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: Surely a man has come to himself only when he has found the best that is in him, and has satisfied his heart with the highest achievement he is fit for.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Surely God would not have created such a being as man, with an ability to grasp the infinite, to exist only for a day! No, no, man was made for immortality.

author: Barbara Ehrenreich
title: Surely there must be some way to find a husband or, for that matter, merely an escort, without sacrificing one's privacy, self-respect, and interior decorating scheme. For example, men could be imported from the developing countries, many parts of which are suffering from a man excess, at least in relation to local food supply.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes the furthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare. The “sure thing” boat never gets far from shore.

author: Ouida
title: Take hope from the heart of man and you make him a beast of prey.

author: Joseph Rudyard Kipling
title: Take my word for it, the silliest woman can manage a clever man; but it needs a very clever woman to manage a fool.

author: George Moore
title: Taking something from one man and making it worse is plagiarism.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: Talk to a man about himself and he will listen for hours.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Talk to a woman as if you loved her, and to a man as if he bored you.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Talk to every woman as if you loved her, and to every man as if he bored you, and at the end of your first season you will have the reputation of possessing the most perfect social tact.

author: Ben Casnocha
title: Talk to people no one else is talking to. Who would have thought that giving a speech at a funeral at age 12 would introduce me to a man who would introduce me to my first business contact who would introduce me to several other important people in my life. That's luck. That's randomness.

author: Ben Jonson
title: Talking and eloquence are not the same: to speak, and to speak well, are two things. A fool may talk, but a wise man speaks.

author: Annie Jump Cannon
title: Teaching man his relatively small sphere in the creation, it also encourages him by its lessons of the unity of Nature and shows him that his power of comprehension allies him with the great intelligence over-reaching all.

author: Johann Gottfried Seume
title: Tear man out of his outward circumstances; and what he then is; that only is he.

author: Max Frisch
title: Technology is a way of organizing the universe so that man doesn't have to experience it.

author: William Lloyd Garrison
title: Tell a man whose house is on fire to give a moderate alarm; tell him to moderately rescue his wife from the hands of the ravisher; tell the mother to gradually extricate her babe from the fire into which it has fallen; but urge me not to use moderation in a case like the present.

author: Ayn Rand
title: Tell me what a man finds sexually attractive and I will tell you his entire philosophy of life.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: Tell me what gives a man or woman their greatest pleasure and I'll tell you their philosophy of life.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Telling lies is a fault in a boy, an art in a lover, an accomplishment in a bachelor, and second-nature in a married man.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: Temperance and labor are the two real physicians of man.

author: A. N. Wilson
title: Tennyson seems to be the patron saint of the wishy washies, which is perhaps why I admire him so much, not only as a poet, but as a man.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: That government is the strongest of which every man feels himself a part.

author: Antonio Porchia
title: That in man which cannot be domesticated is not his evil but his goodness.

author: Freda Adler
title: That man is a creature who needs order yet yearns for change is the creative contradiction at the heart of the laws which structure his conformity and define his deviancy.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: That man is a success who has lived well, laughed often and loved much.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: That man is not truly brave who is afraid either to seem or to be, when it suits him, a coward.

author: Anatole France
title: That man is prudent who neither hopes nor fears anything from the uncertain events of the future.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title:
That man is rich whose pleasures are the cheapest.,
,
,

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: That man is the noblest creature may also be inferred from the fact that no other creature has yet contested this claim.

author: Harold J. Smith
title: That man is the richest whose pleasures are the cheapest.

author: Sir Richard Steele
title: That man never grows old who keeps a child in his heart.

author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
title: That old man dies prematurely whose memory records no benefits conferred. They only have lived long who have lived virtuously.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: That there should one Man die ignorant who had capacity for Knowledge, this I call a tragedy.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: That which we call character is a reserved force which acts directly by presence, and without means. It is conceived of as a certain undemonstrable force, a familiar or genius, by whose impulses the man is guided, but whose counsels he cannot impart.

author: Neil Armstrong
title: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.

author: George Eliot
title: That's what a man wants in a wife, mostly; he wants to make sure one fool tells him he's wise.

author: Barry McGuire
title: That's why I had to leave Hair on Broadway, because I did it for about a year, and one night I was doing the show, and I realized, well, this is not real. I told the director. He says, man, it was a killer show tonight.

author: Rachel Carson
title: The ''control of nature'' is a phrase conceived in arrogance, born of the Neanderthal age of biology and the convenience of man.

author: Eldridge Cleaver
title: The ''paper tiger'' hero, James Bond, offering the whites a triumphant image of themselves, is saying what many whites want desperately to hear reaffirmed: I am still the White Man, lord of the land, licensed to kill, and the world is still an empire at my feet.

author: Sir William Temple
title: The abilities of man must fall short on one side or the other, like too scanty a blanket when you are abed. If you pull it upon your shoulders, your feet are left bare; if you thrust it down to your feet, your shoulders are uncovered.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: The ablest man I ever met is the man you think you are.

author: Hosea Ballou
title: The act of divine worship is the inestimable privilege of man, the only created being who bows in humility and adoration.

author: H. Ross Perot
title: The activist is not the man who says the river is dirty. The activist is the man who cleans up the river.

author: Alfred de Vigny
title: The acts of the human race on the world's stage have doubtless a coherent unity, but the meaning of the vast tragedy enacted will be visible only to the eye of God, until the end, which will reveal it perhaps to the last man.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: The aim of the college, for the individual student, is to eliminate the need in his life for the college; the task is to help him become a self-educating man.

author: Paul De Man
title: The ambivalence of writing is such that it can be considered both an act and an interpretive process that follows after an act with which it cannot coincide. As such, it both affirms and denies its own nature.

author: Dave Thomas
title: The anger that appears to be building up between the sexes becomes more virulent with every day that passes. And far from women taking the blame... the fact is that men are invariably portrayed as the bad guys. Being a good man is like being a good Nazi.

author: James Thurber
title: The animals that depend on instinct have an inherent knowledge of the laws of economics and of how to apply them; Man, with his powers of reason, has reduced economics to the level of a farce which is at once funnier and more tragic than Tobacco Road.

author: Bruce Lee
title: The aphorism as a man thinketh in his heart so is he contains the secret of life.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The apparel oft proclaims the man.

author: Seneca
title: The approach of liberty makes even an old man brave.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The Artist is he who detects and applies the law from observation of the works of Genius, whether of man or Nature. The Artisan is he who merely applies the rules which others have detected.

author: Adam Ferguson
title: The attainments of the parent do not descend in the blood of his children, nor is the progress of man to be considered as a physical mutation of the species.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The average man does not get pleasure out of an idea because he thinks it is true; he thinks it is true because he gets pleasure out of it.

author: Anatole France
title: The average man does not know what to do with this life, yet wants another one which will last forever.

author: Bern Williams
title: The average man will bristle if you say his father was dishonest, but he will brag a little if he discovers that his great-grandfather was a pirate.

author: A. E. Housman
title: The average man, if he meddles with criticism at all, is a conservative critic.

author: Alexander Chase
title: The banalities of a great man pass for wit.

author: Aristotle
title: The beauty of the soul shines out when a man bears with composure one heavy mischance after another, not because he does not feel them, but because he is a man of high and heroic temper.

author: Susan Sontag
title: The becoming of man is the history of the exhaustion of his possibilities.

author: William James
title: The best argument I know for an immortal life is the existence of a man who deserves one.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The best fortune that can fall to a man is that which corrects his defects and makes up for his failings.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: The best product should be bought, the best man should be rewarded more. Interfering factors which befuddle this triumph of virtue, justice, truth, and efficiency, etc., should be kept to an absolute minimum or should approach zero as a limit.

author: Sir William Temple
title: The best rules to form a young man, are, to talk little, to hear much, to reflect alone upon what has passed in company, to distrust one's own opinions, and value others that deserve it.

author: Mae West
title:
The best way to hold a man is in your arms.,
,
,

author: Peter F. Drucker
title: The better a man is the more mistakes he will make for the more things he will try.

author: Billy Graham
title: The Bible is clear - God's definition of marriage is between a man and a woman.

author: I. F. Stone
title: The biggest difference between ancient Rome and the USA is that in Rome the common man was treated like a dog. In America he sets the tone. This is the first country where the common man could stand erect.

author: William Blake
title: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.,

author: Adam Clayton Powell
title: The black man continues on his way. He plods wearily no longer - he is striding freedom road with the knowledge that if he hasn't got the world in a jug, at least he has the stopper in his hand.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: The boy who is going to make a great man must not make up his mind merely to overcome a thousand obstacles, but to win in spite of a thousand repulses and defeats.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: The brave man carves out his fortune, and every man is the son of his own works.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: The brave man inattentive to his duty, is worth little more to his country than the coward who deserts in the hour of danger.

author: Nelson Mandela
title: The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.

author: Seneca
title: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.

author: R. D. Laing
title: The brotherhood of man is evoked by particular men according to their circumstances. But it seldom extends to all men. In the name of our freedom and our brotherhood we are prepared to blow up the other half of mankind and to be blown up in our turn.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The brotherhood of man is not a mere poet's dream: it is a most depressing and humiliating reality.

author: Marshall Mcluhan
title: The car has become the carapace, the protective and aggressive shell, of urban and suburban man.

author: Carl Van Vechten
title: The cat, it is well to remember, remains the friend of man because it pleases him to do so and not because he must.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The chief knowledge that a man gets from reading books is the knowledge that very few of them are worth reading.

author: William Wordsworth
title: The child is father of the man.

author: William Wordsworth
title: The child is the father of the man.

author: John Milton
title: The childhood shows the man, as morning shows the day.

author: Josiah Gilbert Holland
title: The choicest thing this world has for a man is affection.

author: Burn Gorman
title: The cliches are all true! My son Max has just turned two, and he's literally turned into this driven young man overnight! The terrible twos are not a myth, but he's such a laugh to be around.

author: Arthur Miller
title: The closer a man approaches tragedy the more intense is his concentration of emotion upon the fixed point of his commitment, which is to say the closer he approaches what in life we call fanaticism.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The condition of being forgiven is self-abandonment. The proud man prefers self-reproach, however painful --because the reproached self isn't abandoned; it remains intact.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: The condition of man is a condition of war of every one against everyone.

author: Napoleon
title: The conscience is the sacred haven of the liberty of man.

author: Victor Hugo
title: The convent, which belongs to the West as it does to the East, to antiquity as it does to the present time, to Buddhism and Muhammadanism as it does to Christianity, is one of the optical devices whereby man gains a glimpse of infinity.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The cosmos is about the smallest hole that a man can hide his head in.

author: Ben Johnson
title: The covetous man never has money. The prodigal will have none shortly.

author: Antonio Gaudi
title: The creation continues incessantly through the media of man.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: The creative artist seems to be almost the only kind of man that you could never meet on neutral ground. You can only meet him as an artist. He sees nothing objectively because his own ego is always in the foreground of every picture.

author: Paul De Man
title: The critical method which denies literary modernity would appear - and even, in certain respects, would be - the most modern of critical movements.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The crowning fortune of a man is to be born to some pursuit which finds him employment and happiness, whether it be to make baskets, or broadswords, or canals, or statues, or songs.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: The cruelest lies are often told in silence. A man may have sat in a room for hours and not opened his mouth, and yet come out of that room a disloyal friend or a vile calumniator.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The cruelest thing a man can do to a woman is to portray her as perfection.

author: Ashley Montagu
title: The cultured man is an artist, an artist in humanity.

author: Adam Ferguson
title: The cunning man uses deceit, but the more cunning man shuns deception.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The curse of man, and the cause of nearly all his woe, is his stupendous capacity for believing the incredible.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The cynic is one who never sees a good quality in a man, and never fails to see a bad one. He is the human owl, vigilant in darkness and blind to light, mousing for vermin, and never seeing noble game.

author: John W. Gardner
title: The cynic says, ''One man can't do anything.'' I say, ''Only one man can do anything.''

author: Suzan B. Anthony
title:
The day may be approaching when the whole world will recognize woman as the equal of man.,
,

author: A. N. Wilson
title: The death of any man aged 56 is very sad for his widow and family. And no one would deny that Steve Jobs was a brilliant and highly innovative technician, with great business flair and marketing ability.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The desire to create continually is vulgar and betrays jealousy, envy, ambition. If one is something one really does not need to make anything - and one nonetheless does very much. There exists above the ''productive'' man a yet higher species.

author: Sir William Osler
title: The desire to take medicine is perhaps the greatest feature which distinguishes man from animals.

author: Herodotus
title: The destiny of man is in his own soul

author: William James
title: The difference between a good man and a bad is the choice of the cause.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: The difference between a man of sense and a fop is that the fop values himself upon his dress; and the man of sense laughs at it, at the same time he knows he must not neglect it.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The difference between a moral man and a man of honor is that the latter regrets a discreditable act, even when it has worked and he has not been caught.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: The discontented man finds no easy chair.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The discovery of this strange society was a curiously refreshing thing; to realize that there were ten new trades in the world was like looking at the first ship or the first plough. It made a man feel what he should feel, that he was still in the childhood of the world.

author: George Santayana
title: The diseases which destroy a man are no less natural than the instincts which preserve him.

author: Thomas Arnold
title: The distinction between Christianity and all other systems of religion consists largely in this, that in these other men are found seeking after God, while Christianity is God seeking after man.

author: Jean Rostand
title: The divine is perhaps that quality in man which permits him to endure the lack of God.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The doctor learns that if he gets ahead of the superstitions of his patients he is a ruined man; and the result is that he instinctively takes care not to get ahead of them.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The doctrine of human equality reposes on this: that there is no man really clever who has not found that he is stupid.

author: Henry Miller
title: The dreamer whose dreams are non-utilitarian has no place in this world. In this world the poet is anathema, the thinker a fool, the artist an escapist, the man of vision a criminal.

author: John Stuart Mill
title: The duty of man is the same in respect to his own nature as in respect to the nature of all other things, namely not to follow it but to amend it.

author: Robert E. Lee
title: The education of a man is never completed until he dies.,

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The eloquent man is he who is no eloquent speaker, but who is inwardly drunk with a certain belief.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The end of man is action, and not thought, though it be of the noblest.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The end of man is an action and not a thought, though it were the noblest.

author: James Agate
title: The English instinctively admire any man who has no talent, and is modest about it.

author: Francis Picabia
title: The essence of a man is found in his faults.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: The essence of man is, discontent, divine discontent; a sort of love without a beloved, the ache we feel in a member we no longer have.

author: Henry Kissinger
title: The essence of this man [Richard M. Nixon] is loneliness.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: The explanation of the propensity of the English people to portrait painting is to be found in their relish for a Fact. Let a man do the grandest things, fight the greatest battles, or be distinguished by the most brilliant personal heroism, yet the English people would prefer his portrait to a painting of the great deed. The likeness they can judge of; his existence is a Fact. But the truth of the picture of his deeds they cannot judge of, for they have no imagination.

author: Albert Pike
title: The eyes of the cheerful and of the melancholy man are fixed upon the same creation; but very different are the aspects which it bears to them.

author: Machiavelli
title: The fact is that a man who wants to act virtuously in every way necessarily comes to grief among so many who are not virtuous.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The fact that a believer is happier than a skeptic is no more to the point than the fact that a drunken man is happier than a sober one. The happiness of credulity is a cheap and dangerous quality.

author: John Jay Chapman
title: The fact that a man is to vote forces him to think. You may preach to a congregation by the year and not affect its thought because it is not called upon for definite action. But throw your subject into a campaign and it becomes a challenge.

author: Mark Twain
title: The fact that man knows right from wrong proves his intellectual superiority to the other creatures; but the fact that he can do wrong proves his moral inferiority to any creatures that cannot.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The family is the test of freedom; because the family is the only thing that the free man makes for himself and by himself.

author: Francis Picabia
title: The family spirit has rendered man carnivorous.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: The farmer is the only man in our economy who buys everything at retail, sells everything at wholesale, and pays the freight both ways.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The first duty of man is to conquer fear; he must get rid of it, he cannot act till then.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The first farmer was the first man. All historic nobility rests on the possession and use of land.

author: Mrs. Humphrey Ward
title: The first law of story-telling. Every man is bound to leave a story better than he found it.

author: Huey P. Newton
title: The first lesson a revolutionary must learn is that he is a doomed man.,

author: Andrew Carnegie
title:
The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.,
,

author: Salvador Dali
title: The first man to compare the cheeks of a young woman to a rose was obviously a poet; the first to repeat it was possibly an idiot.

author: John Ruskin
title: The first test of a truly great man is his humility. By humility I don't mean doubt of his powers or hesitation in speaking his opinion, but merely an understanding of the relationship of what he can say and what he can do.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: The first three men in the world were a gardener, a ploughman, and a grazier; and if any man object that the second of these was a murderer, I desire he would consider that as soon as he was so, he quitted our profession and turned builder.

author: Helen Rowland
title: The follies which a man regrets the most in his life are those which he didn't commit when he had the opportunity.

author: Anatole France
title: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself a fool.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The fool thinks himself to be wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: The fool wanders, a wise man travels.

author: Buddha
title: The foolish man conceives the idea of 'self.' The wise man sees there is no ground on which to build the idea of 'self;' thus, he has a right conception of the world and well concludes that all compounds amassed by sorrow will be dissolved again, but the truth will remain.

author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
title: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance; The wise grows it under his feet.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: The forgotten man at the bottom of the economic pyramid.

author: Leon Blum
title: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.

author: Barbara Deming
title: The free man must be born before freedom can be won, and the brotherly man must be born before full brotherhood can be won. It will come into being only if we build it out of our very muscle and bone - by trying to act it out.

author: Robert Benchley
title: The free-lance writer is a man who is paid per piece or per word or perhaps.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The generative energy, which, when we are loose, dissipates and makes us unclean, when we are continent invigorates and inspires us. Chastity is the flowering of man; and what are called Genius, Heroism, Holiness, and the like, are but various fruits which succeed it.

author: George Borrow
title: The Germans are the most philosophic people in the world, and the greatest smokers: now I trace their philosophy to their smoking. Smoking has a sedative effect upon the nerves, and enables a man to bear the sorrows of this life (of which every one has his share) not only decently, but dignifiedly.

author: Russell Baker
title: The goal of all inanimate objects is to resist man and ultimately defeat him.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: The good is, like nature, an immense landscape in which man advances through centuries of exploration.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The good lawyer is not the man who has an eye to every side and angle of contingency, and qualifies all his qualifications, but who throws himself on your part so heartily, that he can get you out of a scrape.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: The good man is the friend of all living things.

author: John Dewey
title: The good man is the man who, no matter how morally unworthy he has been, is moving to become better.

author: Woody Allen
title: The government is unresponsive to the needs of the little man. Under 5'7", it is impossible to get your congressman on the phone.

author: Benjamin Whichcote
title: The government of man should be the monarchy of reason: it is too often the democracy of passions or the anarchy of humors.

author: Thomas J. Watson
title: The great accomplishments of man have resulted from the transmission of ideas and enthusiasm.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: The great and glorious masterpiece of man is how to live with purpose.

author: Stendhal
title: The great majority of men, especially in France, both desire and possess a fashionable woman, much in the way one might own a fine horse - as a luxury befitting a young man.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The great man fights the elements in his time that hinder his own greatness, in other words his own freedom and sincerity.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: The great man has two hearts - one bleeds, the second one endures.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
title: The great renewal of the world will perhaps consist in this, that man and maid, freed of all false feelings and reluctances, will seek each other not as opposites, but as brother and sister, as neighbors, and will come together as human beings.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: The great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: The greater man, the greater courtesy.

author: Bjornstjerne Bjornson
title: The greater the burden a man takes upon his shoulders, the stronger he must be to carry it. No words are unmentionable, no action or horror beyond powers of description, if one is equal to them.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: The greatest act of faith is when a man understands he is not God.

author: Samuel Daniel
title: The greatest Enemy That Man can have, is his Prosperity.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The greatest man in history was the poorest.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The greatest mistake a man can make is to be afraid of making one.

author: Buffalo Bill
title: The greatest of all the Sioux in my time, or in any time for that matter, was that wonderful old fighting man, Sitting Bull, whose life will some day be written by a historian who can really give him his due.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The greatest part of a writer's time is spent in reading, in order to write; a man will turn over half a library to make one book.

author: Anatole France
title: The greatest virtue of man is perhaps curiosity.

author: Bob Marley
title: The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: The greatness of man is great in that he knows himself to be wretched. A tree does not know itself to be wretched.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title:
The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.,
,
,

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The happiness of a married man depends on the people he has not married.”

author: Agatha Christie
title: The happiness of one man and one woman is the greatest thing in all the world.

author: Jacques-Yves Cousteau
title: The happiness of the bee and the dolphin is to exist. For man it is to know that and to wonder at it.

author: Nelson Algren
title: The hard necessity of bringing the judge on the bench down into the dock has been the peculiar responsibility of the writer in all ages of man.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The hardest struggle of all is to be something different from what the average man is.

author: Helen Rowland
title: The hardest task in a girl's life is to prove to a man that his intentions are serious.

author: Helen Rowland
title: The hardest task of a girl's life, nowadays, is to prove to a man that his intentions are serious.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: The hardest tumble a man can make is to fall over his own bluff.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon
title: The haunting of history is ever present in Barcelona. I see cities as organisms, as living creatures. To me, Madrid is a man and Barcelona is a woman. And it's a woman who's extremely vain.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The healthy man does not torture others - generally it is the tortured who turn into torturers.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: The heart of a fool is in his mouth, but the mouth of a wise man is in his heart.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: The heart of every man lies open to the shafts of correction if the archer can take proper aim.

author: John Ruskin
title: The higher a man stands, the more the word ''vulgar'' becomes unintelligible to him.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The highest happiness of man is to have probed what is knowable and quietly to revere what is unknowable.

author: Leon Trotsky
title: The historic ascent of humanity, taken as a whole, may be summarized as a succession of victories of consciousness over blind forces - in nature, in society, in man himself.

author: Charles Péguy
title: The honest man must be a perpetual renegade, the life of an honest man a perpetual infidelity. For the man who wishes to remain faithful must take himself perpetually unfaithful to all the continual, successive, indefatigable, renascent errors.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The horse, the horse! The symbol of surging potency and power of movement, of action, in man.

author: Anais Nin
title: The human father has to be confronted and recognized as human, as man who created a child and then, by his absence, left the child fatherless and then Godless.

author: Paracelsus
title: The human spirit is so great a thing that no man can express it; could we rightly comprehend the mind of man nothing would be impossible to us upon the earth.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: The humorous man recognizes that absolute purity, absolute justice, absolute logic and perfection are beyond human achievement and that men have been able to live happily for thousands of years in a state of genial frailty.

author: Lyndon B. Johnson
title: The hungry world cannot be fed until and unless the growth of its resources and the growth of its population come into balance. Each man and woman-and each nation - must make decisions of conscience and policy in the face of this great problem.

author: John W. Gardner
title: The idea for which this nation stands will not survive if the highest goal free man can set themselves is an amiable mediocrity. Excellence implies striving for the highest standards in every phase of life.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The idea that leisure is of value in itself is only conditionally true. The average man simply spends his leisure as a dog spends it. His recreations are all puerile, and the time supposed to benefit him really only stupefies him.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The images of the unconscious place a great responsibility upon a man. Failure to understand them, or a shirking of ethical responsibility, deprives him of his wholeness and imposes a painful fragmentariness on his life.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: The imagination is literally the workshop wherein are fashioned all plans created by man.

author: John Keats
title: The imagination of a boy is healthy, and the mature imagination of a man is healthy; but there is a space of life between, in which the soul is in a ferment, the character undecided, the way of life uncertain, the ambition thick-sighted: thence proceeds mawkishness.

author: Nelson Algren
title: The Impossible Generalized Man today is the critic who believes in loving those unworthy of love as well as those worthy -yet believes this only insofar as no personal risk is entailed. Meaning he loves no one, worthy or no. This is what makes him impossible.

author: Arthur Middleton
title: The Incarnation is the medicine of the soul, undoing the Fall and bringing man to the Tree of Life, and the office of a priest is to administer this medicine in the sacraments.

author: Marcel Duchamp
title: The individual, man as a man, man as a brain, if you like, interests me more than what he makes, because I've noticed that most artists only repeat themselves.

author: Denis Diderot
title: The infant runs toward it with its eyes closed, the adult is stationary, the old man approaches it with his back turned.

author: Bruno Rossi
title: The initial motivation of the experiment which led to this discovery was a subconscious feeling for the inexhaustible wealth of nature, a wealth that goes far beyond the imagination of man.

author: William Blake
title: The inquiry in England is not whether a man has talents and genius, but whether he is passive and polite and a virtuous ass and obedient to noblemen's opinions in art and science. If he is, he is a good man. If not, he must be starved.

author: William B. Yeats
title: The intellect of man is forced to choose perfection of the life, or of the work, and if it take the second must refuse a heavenly mansion, raging in the dark.

author: George Orwell
title: The intellectual is different from the ordinary man, but only in certain sections of his personality, and even then not all the time.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: The intelligent man finds almost everything ridiculous, the sensible man hardly anything.

author: Ed Parker
title: The intelligent man is one who has successfully fulfilled many accomplishments, and is yet willing to learn more.

author: Anna Quindlen
title: The issue is privacy. Why is the decision by a woman to sleep with a man she has just met in a bar a private one, and the decision to sleep with the same man for $100 subject to criminal penalties?

author: B. F. Skinner
title: The juvenile delinquent does not feel his disturbed personality. The intelligent man does not feel his intelligence or the introvert his introversion.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The key to every man is his thought. Sturdy and defying though he look, he has a helm which he obeys, which is the idea after which all his facts are classified. He can only be reformed by showing him a new idea which commands his own.

author: Edward Coke
title: The King himself should be under no man, but under God and the Law.

author: Augustus William Hare
title: The king is the least independent man in his dominions; the beggar the most so.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The king is the man who can.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The laboring man has not leisure for a true integrity day by day.

author: Lord George Byron
title: The lapse of ages changes all things - time, language, the earth, the bounds of the sea, the stars of the sky, and every thing ''about, around, and underneath'' man, except man himself.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: The last I heard of the young man in question, he was trying to eke out a miserable existence as a book agent while he was looking about for a position somewhere with the Government as a janitor or for some other equally humble occupation.

author: James Thurber
title: The laughter of man is more terrible than his tears, and takes more forms - hollow, heartless, mirthless, maniacal.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: The Left masks its distaste for the Bible's condemnation of homosexuality in a straw man argument that Bible believers are violent bigots. They are not. Citing the Bible doesn't make you a bigot against human beings - it makes you a bigot against sin, which is a good thing.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The less a man thinks or knows about his virtues, the better we like him.

author: Abraham Cowley
title: The liberty of a people consists in being governed by laws which they have made themselves, under whatsoever form it be of government; the liberty of a private man, in being master of his own time and actions, as far as may consist with the laws of God and of his country.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: The life of man is a journey; a journey that must be traveled, however bad the roads or the accommodation.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: The life of man is a long march through the night, surrounded by invisible foes, tortured by weariness and pain, towards a goal that few can hope to reach, and where none may tarry long.

author: David Hume
title: The life of man is of no greater importance to the universe than that of an oyster.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The life of man is the true romance, which when it is valiantly conduced, will yield the imagination a higher joy than any fiction.

author: Milan Kundera
title: The light that radiates from the great novels time can never dim, for human existence is perpetually being forgotten by man and thus the novelists discoveries, however old they may be, will never cease to astonish.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The little man is still a man.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: The longer a man lives in this world the more he must be convinced that all domestic quarrels had better never be obtruded on the public; for, let the husband be right, or let him be wrong, there is always a sympathy existing for women which is certain to give the man the worst of it.

author: Will Durant
title: The love we have in our youth is superficial compared to the love that an old man has for his old wife.,

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
