title: The machine does not isolate man from the great problems of nature but plunges him more deeply into them.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The madman is not the man who has lost his reason. He is the man who has lost everything except his reason.

author: Jean Genet
title: The main object of a revolution is the liberation of man... not the interpretation and application of some transcendental ideology.

author: Thomas Hardy
title: The main object of religion is not to get a man into heaven, but to get heaven into him.

author: H. Rap Brown
title: The man does not beat your head because you got a Cadillac or because you got a Ford; he beats you because you're black!

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The man for who the law exists - the man of forms, the conservative - is a tame man.

author: Horace
title: The man is either mad, or he is making verses.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The man loves danger and sport. That is why he loves woman, the most dangerous of all sports.

author: Charles Lamb
title: The man must have a rare recipe for melancholy, who can be dull in Fleet Street.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The man never feels the want of what it never occurs to him to ask for.

author: Boris Sidis
title: The man of genius whether as artist or thinker requires a mass of accidental variations to select from and a rigidly selective process of attention.

author: Hermann Hesse
title: The man of power is ruined by power, the man of money by money, the submissive man by subservience, the pleasure seeker by pleasure.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The man of science is a poor philosopher.

author: Sir Arthur Helps
title: The man of the house can destroy the pleasure of the household, but he cannot make it. That rests with the woman, and it is her greatest privilege.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The man of understanding finds everything laughable.

author: A. W. Tozer
title: The man or woman who is wholly or joyously surrendered to Christ can't make a wrong choice-any choice will be the right one.

author: Edward Young
title: The man that blushes is not quite a brute.

author: William Cowper
title: The man that hails you Tom or Jack, and proves by thumps upon your back how he esteems your merit, is such a friend, that one had need be very much his friend indeed to pardon or to bear it.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The man that hath no music in himself; nor is not move with concord of sweet sounds; is fit for treasons stratagems, and spoils.

author: Edward Young
title: The man that makes a character, makes foes.

author: Andrew Carnegie
title: The man who acquires the ability to take full possession of his own mind may take possession of anything else to which he justly entitled.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: The man who builds a factory builds a temple, that the man who works there worships there, and to each is due, not scorn and blame, but reverence and praise.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The man who can dominate a London dinner-table can dominate the world.

author: Roger Bannister
title: The man who can drive himself further once the effort gets painful is the man who will win.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The man who can make hard things easy is the educator.

author: Cardinal de Retz
title: The man who can own up to his error is greater than he who merely knows how to avoid making it.

author: Roy L. Smith
title: The man who cannot believe in himself cannot believe in anything else. The basis of all integrity and character is whatever faith we have in our own integrity.

author: J. Paul Getty
title: The man who comes up with a means for doing or producing almost anything better, faster or more economically has his future and his fortune at his fingertips.

author: Lou Holtz
title: The man who complains about the way the ball bounces is likely the one who dropped it.

author: Aeschylus
title: The man who does ill must suffer ill.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: The man who does more than he is paid for will soon be paid for more than he does.

author: Mark Twain
title: The man who does not read books has no advantage over the man that can not read them.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The man who does not understand your silence will probably not understand your words.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The man who does not work for the love of work but only for money is not likely to make money nor find much fun in life.

author: Mark Twain
title: The man who doesn't read good books has no advantage over the man who can't read them.

author: F. Swinnnerton
title: The man who fails because he aims astray or because he does not aim at all is to be found everywhere.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: The man who fears no truth has nothing to fear from lies.

author: Ernest Hello
title: The man who gives up accomplishes nothing and is only a hindrance. The man who does not give up can move mountains.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare. The sure-thing boat never gets far from shore.

author: Francis H. Bradley
title: The man who has ceased to fear has ceased to care.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: The man who has done his best has done everything.

author: B. C. Forbes
title: The man who has done his level best, and who is conscious that he has done his best, is a success, even though the world may write him down as a failure.

author: Jawaharlal Nehru
title: The man who has gotten everything he wants is all in favor of peace and order.

author: Theodor Reik
title: The man who has never made a fool of himself in love will never be wise in love.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The man who has never made a mistake will never make anything else.

author: Muhammad Ali
title: The man who has no imagination has no wings.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The man who has no more problems to solve, is out of the game.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title:
The man who has no problems is out of the game.,
,

author: B. C. Forbes
title: The man who has won millions at the cost of his conscience is a failure.

author: Alexander Smith
title: The man who in this world can keep the whiteness of his soul is not likely to lose it in any other.

author: Mark Twain
title: The man who is a pessimist before 48 knows too much; if he is an optimist after it, he knows too little.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: The man who is admired for the ingenuity of his larceny is almost always rediscovering some earlier form of fraud. The basic forms are all known, have all been practiced. The manners of capitalism improve. The morals may not.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: The man who is always worrying whether or not his soul would be damned generally has a soul that isn't worth a damn.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: The man who is aware of himself is henceforward independent; and he is never bored, and life is only too short, and he is steeped through and through with a profound yet temperate happiness.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The man who is born with a talent which he was meant to use finds his greatest happiness in using it.

author: C. Northcote Parkinson
title: The man who is denied the opportunity of making decisions of importance begins to regard as important the decisions he is allowed to make.

author: C. Northcote Parkinson
title: The man who is denied the opportunity of taking decisions of importance begins to regard as important the decisions he is allowed to take.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The man who is dissatisfied with himself, what can he do?

author: Henry Miller
title: The man who is forever disturbed about the condition of humanity either has no problems of his own or has refused to face them.

author: B. C. Forbes
title: The man who is intent on making the most of his opportunities is too busy to bother about luck.

author: Mark Twain
title: The man who is ostentatious of his modesty is twin to the statue that wears a fig-leaf.

author: Bruce Lee
title: The man who is really serious, with the urge to find out what truth is, has no style at all. He lives only in what is.

author: Henry S. Naskins
title: The man who is too old to learn was probably always too old to learn.

author: Ayn Rand
title: The man who lets a leader prescribe his course is a wreck being towed to the scrap heap.

author: Samuel Butler
title: The man who lets himself be bored is even more contemptible than the bore.

author: Henry Miller
title: The man who looks for security, even in the mind, is like a man who would chop off his limbs in order to have artificial ones which will give him no pain or trouble.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: The man who makes no mistakes does not usually make anything

author: E.J. Phelps
title: The man who makes no mistakes does not usually make anything.

author: William Blake
title: The man who never alters his opinion is like standing water, and breeds reptiles of the mind.

author: James Lendall Basford
title: The man who never has money enough to pay his debts has too much of something else.

author: Aaron Hill
title: The man who pauses on the paths of treason, Halts on a quicksand, the first step engulfs him.

author: Lord Acton
title: The man who prefers his country before any other duty  shows the same spirit as the man who surrenders every right to the state. They both deny that right is superior to authority.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The man who promises everything is sure to fulfil nothing, and everyone who promises too much is in danger of using evil means in order to carry out his promises, and is already on the road to perdition.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: The man who reads nothing at all is better educated than the man who reads nothing, but newspapers.

author: William Faulkner
title: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The man who says he has exhausted life generally means that life has exhausted him.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: The man who says his evening prayer is a captain posting his sentinels. He can sleep.

author: Thomas B. Aldrich
title: The man who suspects his own tediousness is yet to be born.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The man who throws a bomb is an artist, because he prefers a great moment to everything.

author: Henry Ford
title: The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar, instead of how little he can give for a dollar, is bound to succeed.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and about all time.

author: Aeschylus
title: The man whose authority is recent is always stern.

author: C. Northcote Parkinson
title: The man whose life is devoted to paperwork has lost the initiative. He is dealing with things that are brought to his notice, having ceased to notice anything for himself.

author: Mark Twain
title: The man with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The man with a toothache thinks everyone happy whose teeth are sound. The poverty-stricken man makes the same mistake about the rich man.

author: Aaron Hill
title: The man with but one idea in his head is sure to exaggerate that to top-heaviness, and thus he loses his equilibrium.

author: Will Rogers
title: The man with the best job in the country is the vice-president. All he has to do is get up every morning and say, 'How is the president?',

author: Bert Williams
title: The man with the real sense of humor is the man who can put himself in the spectator's place and laugh at his own misfortunes.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The man without a purpose is like a ship without a rudder - waif, a nothing, a no man. Have a purpose in life, and, having it, throw such strength of mind and muscle into your work as God has given you.

author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning
title: The man, most man, works best for men: and, if most man indeed, he gets his manhood plainest from his soul.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The meanest, most contemptible kind of praise is that which first speaks well of a man, and then qualifies it with a ''But''.

author: Plutarch
title: The measure of a man is the way he bears up under misfortune.

author: Pittacus
title: The measure of a man is what he does with power.

author: Malcolm X
title: The mental flexibility of the wise man permits him to keep an open mind and enables him to readjust himself whenever it becomes necessary for a change.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: The mind of man is capable of anything - because everything is in it, all the past as well as all the future.

author: William Hazlitt
title: The mind of man is like a clock that is always running down, and requires to be constantly wound up.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The mind of the thoroughly well-informed man is a dreadful thing. It is like a bric-à-brac shop, all monsters and dust, with everything priced above its proper value.

author: William James
title: The minute a man ceases to grow, no matter what his years, that minute he begins to be old.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: The mistakes of the fool are known to the world, but not to himself. The mistakes of the wise man are known to himself, but not to the world.

author: Raymond Chandler
title: The moment a man begins to talk about technique that's proof that he is fresh out of ideas.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: The more a man can forget, the greater the number of metamorphoses which his life can undergo, the more he can remember the more divine his life becomes.

author: Charles Baudelaire
title: The more a man cultivates the arts the less he fornicates. A more and more apparent cleavage occurs between the spirit and the brute.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: The more a man knows about himself in relation to every kind of experience, the greater his chance of suddenly, one fine morning, realizing who in fact he is...

author: Marquis de Sade
title: The more defects a man may have, the older he is, the less lovable, the more resounding his success.

author: Josh Billings
title: The more humble a man is before God the more he will be exalted; the more humble he is before man, the more he will get rode roughshod.

author: Jane Austen
title: The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love.

author: Confucius
title: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The more things a man is ashamed of, the more respectable he is.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The more unintelligent a man is, the less mysterious existence seems to him.

author: Richard Nixon
title: The more you stay in this kind of job, the more you realize that a public figure, a major public figure, is a lonely man.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The most anxious man in a prison is the governor.

author: Ernest Bevin
title: The most conservative man in the world is the British Trade Unionist when you want to change him.

author: Clark Moustakas
title: The most dramatic conflicts are perhaps, those that take place not between men but between a man and himself - where the arena of conflict is a solitary mind.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The most evident difference springs from the important part which is played in man by a relatively strong power of imagination and by the capacity to think, aided as it is by language and other symbolically devices.

author: Barbara Corcoran
title: The most expensive hobby a rich man could have is a boat, and the second most expensive hobby he could have is a very old house.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The most happy man is he who knows how to bring into relation the end and beginning of his life.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: The most important of all sciences man can and must learn is the science of living so as to do the least evil and the greatest possible good.

author: Candace Bushnell
title: The most important thing to strive for in life is some kind of personal and professional achievement. Not as a man or a woman, but as a person.

author: Walter Bagehot
title: The most intellectual of men are moved quite as much by the circumstances which they are used to as by their own will. The active voluntary part of a man is very small, and if it were not economized by a sleepy kind of habit, its results would be null.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: The most perfect ape cannot draw an ape; only man can do that; but, likewise, only man regards the ability to do this as a sign of superiority.

author: Fjodor M. Dostojewski
title: The most pressing question on the problem of faith is whether a man as a civilized being… can believe in the divinity of the Son of God, Jesus Christ, for therein rests the whole of our faith.

author: Edward M. Forster
title: The most successful career must show a waste of strength that might have removed mountains, and the most unsuccessful is not that of the man who is taken unprepared, but of him who has prepared and is never taken. On a tragedy of that kind our national morality is duly silent.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: The most winning woman I ever knew was hanged for poisoning three little children for their insurance-money, and the most repellent man of my acquaintance is a philanthropist who has spent nearly a quarter of a million upon the London poor.

author: Bram Stoker
title: The mouth, so far as I could see it under the heavy moustache, was fixed and rather cruel-looking, with peculiarly sharp white teeth; these protruded over the lips, whose remarkable ruddiness showed astonishing vitality in a man of his years.

author: Bernard Mandeville
title: The multitude will hardly believe the excessive force of education, and in the difference of modesty between men and women, ascribe that to nature, which is altogether owing to early instruction: Miss is scarce three years old, but she's spoke to every day to hide her leg, and rebuked in good earnest if she shows it; whilst little Master at the same age is bid to take up his coats, and piss like a man.

author: Marshall Mcluhan
title: The name of a man is a numbing blow from which he never recovers.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: The name of an iron man goes round the world. , It takes a long time to forget an iron man.

author: Barbara Tuchman
title: The nastiness of women [in the 14th century] was generally perceived at the close of life when a man began to worry about hell, and his sexual desire in any case fading.

author: Sir William Osler
title: The natural man has only two primal passions, to get and to beget.

author: Matthew Arnold
title: The need of expansion is as genuine an instinct in man as the need in a plant for the light, or the need in man himself for going upright. The love of liberty is simply the instinct in man for expansion.

author: Martin Luther King
title: The Negro needs the white man to free him from his fears. The white man needs the Negro to free him from his guilt.

author: Baron William Henry Beveridge
title: The object of government in peace and in war is not the glory of rulers or of races, but the happiness of the common man.

author: E. M. Cioran
title: The obsession with suicide is characteristic of the man who can neither live nor die, and whose attention never swerves from this double impossibility.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: The ocean is a body of water occupying about two-thirds of a world made for man - who has no gills.

author: Silas Wright
title: The office should seek the man, not man the office.

author: Aeschylus
title: The one knowing what is profitable, and not the man knowing many things, is wise.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title:
The one permanent emotion of the inferior man is fear - fear of the unknown, the complex, the inexplicable. What he wants above everything else is safety.,
,

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The one person who has more illusions than the dreamer is the man of action.

author: Samuel Butler
title: The one serious conviction that a man should have is that nothing is to be taken too seriously.

author: Mrs. Jamieson
title: The only competition worthy a wise man is with himself.

author: George Eliot
title: The only failure a man ought to fear is failure in cleaving to the purpose he sees to be best.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The only man I know who behaves sensibly is my tailor; he takes my measurements anew each time he sees me. The rest go on with their old measurements and expect me to fit them.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The only man who makes money following the races is one who does it with a broom and shovel.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: The only man who never makes a mistake is the man who never does anything.,

author: Benjamin Watson
title: The only one who can change the heart of man is the Lord. And that will make us want to make things fair for other people.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: The only solid and lasting peace between a man and his wife is, doubtless, a separation.

author: Tupac Shakur
title: The only thing that comes to a sleeping man is dreams.,

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The only thing that ever consoles man for the stupid things he does is the praise he always gives himself for doing them.

author: Richard M. DeVos
title: The only thing that stands between a man and what he wants from life is often merely the will to try it and the faith to believe that it is possible.

author: Amy Hempel
title: The only time the word baby doesn't scare me is the time that it should, when it is what a man calls me.

author: Sir William Temple
title: The only way for a rich man to be healthy is by exercise and abstinence, to live as if he were poor.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The only way for a woman to provide for herself decently is for her to be good to some man that can afford to be good to her.

author: Betty Friedan
title: The only way for a woman, as for a man, to find herself, to know herself as a person, is by creative work of her own. There is no other way.

author: Al Goldstein
title: The only way marriage can work is if a man respects the woman and she is a thinking woman and he wants to work on the marriage.

author: Henry Lewis Stimson
title: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.

author: Charles F. Kettering
title: The opportunities of man are limited only by his imagination. But so few have imagination that there are ten thousand fiddlers to one composer.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The ordinary man is an anarchist. He wants to do as he likes. He may want his neighbour to be governed, but he himself doesn't want to be governed. He is mortally afraid of government officials and policemen.

author: Henry Miller
title: The ordinary man is involved in action, the hero acts. An immense difference.

author: Aleister Crowley
title: The ordinary man looking at a mountain is like an illiterate person confronted with a Greek manuscript.

author: Erich Fromm
title: The ordinary man with extraordinary power is the chief danger for mankind - not the fiend or the sadist.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The ordinary scientific man is strictly a sentimentalist. He is a sentimentalist in this essential sense, that he is soaked and swept away by mere associations.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: The origins of disputes between philosophers is, that one class of them have undertaken to raise man by displaying his greatness, and the other to debase him by showing his miseries.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The past is of no importance. The present is of no importance. It is with the future that we have to deal. For the past is what man should not have been. The present is what man ought not to be. The future is what artists are.

author: Bernard of Clairvaux
title: The peacemakers shall be called the sons of God, who came to make peace between God and man. What then shall the sowers of discord be called, but the children of the devil? And what must they look for but their father's portion?

author: Carl Sandburg
title: The people know the salt of the sea , and the strength of the winds , lashing the corners of the earth. , The people take the earth , as a tomb of rest and a cradle of hope. , Who else speaks for the Family of Man?

author: Benjamin Graham
title: The people of the United States will not tolerate another deep depression that arises not from any lack of natural resources, productive capacity or man and brain power, but solely from imperfections in the functioning of the system of finance capitalism.

author: Brooks Atkinson
title: The perfect bureaucrat everywhere is the man who manages to make no decisions and escape all responsibility.

author: Leigh Hunt
title: The person who can be only serious or only cheerful, is but half a man.

author: Stokely Carmichael
title: The philosophers Camus and Sartre raise the question whether or not a man can condemn himself.

author: George Santayana
title: The philosophy of the common man is an old wife that gives him no pleasure, yet he cannot live without her, and resents any aspersions that strangers may cast on her character.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: The poor man looks upon the law as an enemy, not as a friend. For him, the law is always taking something away.,

author: Plautus
title: The poor man who enters into a partnership with one who is rich makes a risky venture.

author: Albert J. Nock
title: The position of modern science, as far as an ignorant man of letters can understand it, seems not a step in advance of that held by Huxley and Romanes in the last century.

author: Winston Churchill
title: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.

author: Thomas Malthus
title: The power of population is so superior to the power in the earth to produce subsistence for man, that premature death must in some shape or other visit the human race.

author: James Baldwin
title: The power of the white world is threatened whenever a black man refuses to accept the white world's definitions.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The power which resides in man is new in nature, and none but he knows what that is which he can do, nor does he know until he has tried.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: The pre-human creature from which man evolved was unlike any other living thing in its malicious viciousness toward its own kind. Humanization was not a leap forward but a groping toward survival.

author: C. J. Mahaney
title: The presence of any humility in my life is purely and completely an evidence of God's grace. From my perspective, I am not a humble man. I am a proud man pursuing humility by the grace of God.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: The present generation, wearied by its chimerical efforts, relapses into complete indolence. Its condition is that of a man who has only fallen asleep towards morning: first of all come great dreams, then a feeling of laziness, and finally a witty or clever excuse for remaining in bed.

author: J. Clare
title: The present is the funeral of the past, and man the living sepulchre of life.

author: Seneca
title: The pressure of adversity does not affect the mind of the brave man. It is more powerful than external circumstances.

author: Adam Sedgwick
title: The pretended physical philosophy of modern days strips Man of all his moral attributes, or holds them of no account in the estimate of his origin and place in the created world.

author: Boris Sidis
title: The principle of recognition of evil under all its guises is at the basis of the true education of man.

author: Germaine Greer
title: The principle of the brotherhood of man is narcissistic... for the grounds for that love have always been the assumption that we ought to realize that we are the same the whole world over.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: The privilege of absurdity; to which no living creature is subject, but man only.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: The problem of meaning today is the problem of how the diverse and superficially self-contradictory experiences of men can be put into a consistent picture that will provide contemporary man with a convincing basis from which to live and to act.

author: C. Wright Mills
title: The professional celebrity, male and female, is the crowning result of the star system of a society that makes a fetish of competition. In America, this system is carried to the point where a man who can knock a small white ball into a series of holes in the ground with more efficiency than anyone else thereby gains social access to the President of the United States.

author: Ben Stein
title: The prosecutors say that Mr. Strauss-Kahn forced the complainant to have oral and other sex with him. How? Did he have a gun? Did he have a knife? He's a short fat old man.

author: Brendan Francis
title: The prospect of success in achieving our most cherished dream is not without its terrors. Who is more deprived and alone than the man who has achieved his dream?

author: F. L. Lucan
title: The prosperous man is never sure that he is loved for himself.

author: Fulton John Sheen
title: The proud man counts his newspaper clippings, the humble man his blessings.

author: Voltaire
title: The punishment of criminals should serve a purpose. When a man is hanged he is useless.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The purpose of man is in action not thought.

author: Henry Ford
title: The question ''Who ought to be boss?'' is like as ''Who ought to be the tenor in the quartet?'' Obviously, the man who can sing tenor.

author: John Paul II
title: The question confronting the Church today is not any longer whether the man in the street can grasp a religious message, but how to employ the communications media so as to let him have the full impact of the Gospel message.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: The question is this - Is man an ape or an angel? My Lord, I am on the side of the angels. I repudiate with indignation and abhorrence these new fanged theories.

author: Carl Van Doren
title: The race of man, while sheep in credulity, are wolves for conformity.

author: Joshua Reynolds
title: The real character of a man is found out by his amusements.

author: Allan Bloom
title: The real community of man is the community of those who seek the truth, of the potential knowers.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The real democratic American idea is, not that every man shall be on a level with every other man, but that every man shall have liberty to be what God made him, without hindrance.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The real difficulty, the difficulty which has baffled the sages of all times, is rather this: how can we make our teaching so potent in the motional life of man, that its influence should withstand the pressure of the elemental psychic forces in the individual?

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The real man is one who always finds excuses for others, but never excuses himself.

author: Thomas Paine
title: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.,

author: Adam Smith
title: The real price of everything, what everything really costs to the man who wants to acquire it, is the toil and trouble of acquiring it.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: The real question is not whether machines think but whether men do. The mystery which surrounds a thinking machine already surrounds a thinking man.

author: James Baldwin
title: The real victim of bigotry is the white man who hides his weakness under his myth of superiority.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable man persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.

author: Ching I
title: The responses of human beings vary greatly under dangerous circumstances. The strong man advances boldly to meet them head on. The weak man grows agitated. But the superior man stands up to fate, endures resolutely in his inner certainty If ignorant both

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: The rich man is always sold to the institution which makes him rich. Absolutely speaking, the more money, the less virtue.

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: The riches of the soul are stored up in its memory. this is the test of character, not whether a man follows the daily fashion, but whether the past is alive in his present.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The right man is the one that seizes the moment.

author: Gregory Nunn
title: The right man, in the right place, at the right time, can steal millions.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The savage bows down to idols of wood and stone: the civilized man to idols of flesh and blood.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: The sea has never been friendly to man. At most it has been the accomplice of human restlessness.

author: William Camden
title: The sea hath fish for every man.

author: Alfred Loisy
title: The search for truth is not a trade by which a man can support himself; for a priest it is a supreme peril .

author: Claiborne Pell
title: The secret is to always let the other man have your way.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: The secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: The secret thoughts of a man run over all things, holy, profane, clean, obscene, grave, and light, without shame or blame.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: The senses have been conditioned by attraction to the pleasant and aversion to the unpleasant: a man should not be ruled by them; they are obstacles in his path.

author: Walt Whitman
title: The shallow consider liberty a release from all law, from every constraint. The wise man sees in it, on the contrary, the potent Law of Laws.

author: Benjamin Tucker
title: The shortest way to change a radical into a conservative, a liberal into a tyrant, a man into a beast, is to give him power over his fellows.

author: Robert Lynd
title: The shy man usually finds that he has been shy without a cause, and that, in practice, no one takes the slightest notice of him.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: The significance of a man is not in what he attains, but rather what he longs to attain.

author: John Ruskin
title: The sky is the part of creation in which nature has done for the sake of pleasing man.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: The slave has but one master, the ambitious man has as many as there are persons whose aid may contribute to the advancement of his fortunes.

author: John Dryden
title: The sooner you treat your son as a man, the sooner he will be one.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The soul of this man is his clothes.

author: William Shakespeare
title: The soul of this man is in his clothes.

author: David Herbert Lawrence
title: The source of all life and knowledge is in man and woman, and the source of all living is in the interchange and the meeting and mingling of these two: man-life and woman-life, man-knowledge and woman-knowledge, man-being and woman-being.

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: The spirit of man is more important than mere physical strength, and the spiritual fiber of a nation than its wealth

author: George Santayana
title: The spirit's foe in man has not been simplicity, but sophistication.

author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
title: The splendid discontent of God With chaos made the world. And from the discontent of man The worlds best progress springs.

author: Abe Fortas
title: The story of man is the history, first, of the acceptance and imposition of restraints necessary to permit communal life; and second, of the emancipation of the individual within that system of necessary restraints.

author: Carlisle Floyd
title: The story of Willie Stark fascinated me because it was tackling the story of a man who outwardly has all the success one could possibly want and who is destroyed by his personal demons.

author: Bruce Springsteen
title: The street's on fire in a real death waltz , Between what's flesh and what's fantasy , Man, the poets down here don't write nothin' at all, , They just stand back and let it all be

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The strength of a man consists in finding out the way God is going, and going that way.

author: Henrik Ibsen
title: The strongest man in the world is he who stands alone.

author: Milan Kundera
title: The struggle of man against power is the struggle of memory against forgetting.

author: Mark Caine
title: The successful man doesn't use others, other people use the successful man, for above all the success is of service.

author: Charles E. Popplestone
title: The successful man is prosperous, because he has developed ninety-five percent of his ability. The failure is poor, because only five percent of his natural talents have been utilized.

author: Roy L. Smith
title: The successful man is the one who finds out what is the matter with his business before his competitors do.

author: Dale Carnegie
title: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.,

author: Thomas Paine
title: The summer soldier and the sunshine patriot will, in this crisis, shrink from the service of his country; but he that stands it NOW deserves the love and thanks of man and woman.

author: Confucius
title: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.

author: Don Shula
title: The superior man blames himself. The inferior man blames others.

author: Confucius
title: The superior man is firm in the right way, and not merely firm.

author: Confucius
title: The superior man is modest in his speech but exceeds in his actions.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
title: The superior man is the providence of the inferior. He is eyes for the blind, strength for the weak, and a shield for the defenseless.

author: Confucius
title: The superior man thinks always of virtue; the common man thinks of comfort.

author: Confucius
title: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.

author: Confucius
title: The superior man will watch over himself when he is alone. He examines his heart that there may be nothing wrong there, and that he may have no cause of dissatisfaction with himself.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: The supreme function of reason is to show man that some things are beyond reason.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: The surest plan to make a man is, think him so.

author: Robert Benchley
title: The surest way to make a monkey of a man is to quote him.

author: Napoleon
title: The surest way to remain poor is to be an honest man.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The surest way to ruin a man who doesn't know how to handle money is to give him some.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: The tendency of aggression is an innate, independent, instinctual disposition in man... it constitutes the most powerful obstacle to culture.

author: Bob Wells
title: The tendency of old age to the body, say the physiologists, is to form bone. It is as rare as it is pleasant to meet with an old man whose opinions are not ossified.

author: Arthur Young
title: The tendency of philosophers who know nothing of machinery is to talk of man as a mere mechanism, intending by this to imply that he is without purpose. This shows a lack of understanding of machines as well as of man.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The test of a man or woman's breeding is how they behave in a quarrel.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The test of Christian character should be that a man is a joy-bearing agent to the world.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: The test of every religious, political, or educational system is the man that it forms.

author: Marguerite Duras
title: The thing that's between us is fascination, and the fascination resides in our being alike. Whether you're a man or a woman, the fascination resides in finding out that we're alike.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: The things I want to know are in books; my best friend is the man who'll get me a book I ain't read.

author: Augusto Roa Bastos
title: The things that have come into being change continually. The man with a good memory remembers nothing because he forgets nothing.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: The thirst after happiness is never extinguished in the heart of man.

author: Samuel Butler
title: The three most important things a man has are, briefly, his private parts, his money, and his religious opinions.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: The time comes upon every public man when it is best for him to keep his lips closed.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: The timid man calls himself cautious, the sordid man thrifty.

author: Aneurin Bevan
title: The Tories, every election, must have a bogy man. If you haven't got a programme, a bogy man will do.

author: Bobby Jones
title: The toughest opponent of all is Old Man Par. He's a patient soul who never shoots a birdie and never incurs a bogey. And if you would travel the long road with him, you must be patient, too.

author: Max Lerner
title: The tourist who moves about to see and hear and open himself to all the influences of the places which condense centuries of human greatness is only a man in search of excellence.

author: Norman Cousins
title: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.

author: Heywood Broun
title: The tragedy of life is not that a man loses, but that he almost wins.

author: Heywood Brown
title: The tragedy of life is not that man loses, but that he almost wins.

author: Germaine Greer
title: The tragedy of machismo is that a man is never quite man enough.

author: William Blake
title: The tree which moves some to tears of joy is in the eyes of others only a green thing that stands in the way. Some see nature all ridicule and deformity... and some scarce see nature at all. But to the eyes of the man of imagination, nature is imagination itself.

author: Ben Kingsley
title: The trick is to try and justify every word on the page and make sure my character is the man who would say that.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
title: The true civilization is where every man gives to every other every right that he claims for himself.

author: Charles Sumner
title: The true grandeur of humanity is in moral elevation, sustained, enlightened and decorated by the intellect of man.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.

author: Ann Landers
title: The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: The true past departs not, no truth or goodness realized by man ever dies, or can die; but all is still here, and, recognized or not, lives and works through endless change.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The true perfection of man lies not in what man has, but in what man is.

author: Pierre Charron
title: The true science and study of man, is man himself.

author: Carine Roitfeld
title: The true test of a man's style is the haircut. There are some men who look good no matter how their hair is styled, whether it's trendy or not. A man can change his haircut many times, but to pull off any haircut, you have to be very chic. Like Brad Pitt.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: The true worth of a man is not to be found in man himself, but in the colours and textures that come alive in others.

author: Phillips Brooks
title: The truest help we can render an afflicted man is not to take his burden from him, but to call out his best energy, that he may be able to bear the burden.

author: William Hazlitt
title: The truly proud man knows neither superiors or inferiors. The first he does not admit of - the last he does not concern himself about.

author: Henry Louis Mencken

author: Algernon Sydney
title: The truth is, man is hereunto led by reason which is his nature.

author: Alfred Nobel
title: The truthful man is usually a liar.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: The two maxims of any great man at court are, always to keep his countenance and never to keep his work.

author: Epictetus
title: The two powers which in my opinion constitute a wise man are those of bearing and forbearing.

author: Emma Goldman
title: The ultimate end of all revolutionary social change is to establish the sanctity of human life, the dignity of man, the right of every human being to liberty and well-being.

author: Martin Luther King
title: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.

author: Gamaliel Bradford
title: The ultimate test of the laughing instinct is that a man should always be ready to laugh at himself.

author: Marquis de Sade
title: The ultimate triumph of philosophy would be to cast light upon the mysterious ways in which Providence moves to achieve the designs it has for man.

author: Carl Jung
title: The unconscious mind of man sees correctly even when conscious reason is blind and impotent.

author: St. Gregory the Great
title: The universe is not rich enough to buy the vote of an honest man.

author: V.A. Rosewarne
title: The universe is so vast and so ageless that the life of one man can only be justified by the measure of his sacrifice.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The value of a man should be seen in what he gives and not in what he is able to receive.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: The value of an idea has nothing whatever to do with the sincerity of the man who expresses it.

author: Gloria Steinem
title: The voting booth is the only place that a pauper equals a billionaire, and any woman equals any man.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: The vulgar man is always the most distinguished, for the very desire to be distinguished is vulgar.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The walking of Man is falling forwards.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: The way for a young man to rise is to improve himself in every way he can, never suspecting that anybody wishes to hinder him.

author: Nathanael Emmons
title: The weakest spot in every man is where he thinks himself to be the wisest.

author: Carroll Quigley
title: The West believes that man and the universe are both complex and that the apparently discordant parts of each can be put into a reasonably workable arrangement with a little good will, patience, and experimentation.

author: Muhammad Ali
title: The white man is destroying the world.,

author: Malcolm X
title: The white man is not inherently evil, but America's racist society influences him to act evilly. The society has produced and nourishes a psychology which brings out the lowest, most base part of human beings.

author: Chief Seattle
title: The white man's dead forget the country of their birth when they go to walk among the stars. Our dead never forget this beautiful earth, for it is the mother of the red man.

author: Remy de Gourmont
title: The whole effort of a sincere man is to erect his personal impressions into laws.

author: Charles Bukowski
title: The whole LSD, STP, marijuana, heroin, hashish, prescription cough medicine crowd suffers from the ''Watchtower'' itch: you gotta be with us, man, or you're out, you're dead. This pitch is a continual and seeming MUST with those who use the stuff. It's no wonder they keep getting busted.

author: Carl Jung
title: The whole nature of man presupposes woman, both physically and spiritually. His system is tuned into woman from the start, just as it is prepared for a quite definite world where there is water, light, air, salt, carbohydrates etc..

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: The will of man is his happiness.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: The wise man applauds he who he thinks most virtuous; the rest of the world applauds the wealthy.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: The wise man avoids evil by anticipating it.

author: John Pierpont Morgan
title: The wise man bridges the gap by laying out the path by means of which he can get from where he is to where he wants to go.

author: Jack Handey
title: The wise man can pick up a grain of sand and envision a whole universe. But the stupid man will just lay down on some seaweed and roll around in it until he's completely draped in it. Then he'll stand up and go hey, I'm Vine Man.

author: Baltasar Gracián
title: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.

author: Aristotle
title: The wise man does not expose himself needlessly to danger, since there are few things for which he cares sufficiently; but he is willing, in great crises, to give even his life - knowing that under certain conditions it is not worthwhile to live.

author: Charles Dudley Warner
title: The wise man does not permit himself to set up even in his own mind any comparisons of his friends. His friendship is capable of going to extremes with many people, evoked as it is by many qualities.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The wise man in the storm prays to God, not for safety from danger, but for deliverance from fear.

author: Wilferd Arlan Peterson
title: The wise man realistically accepts as part of life and builds a philosophy to meet them and make the most of them. He lives on the principle of ''nothing attempted, nothing gained'' and is resolved that if he fails he is going to fail while trying to succeed.

author: John B. S. Haldane
title: The wise man regulates his conduct by the theories both of religion and science. But he regards these theories not as statements of ultimate fact but as art-forms.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: The wise man sees in the misfortune of others what he should avoid.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: The wise man who is not heeded is counted a fool, and the fool who proclaims the general folly first and loudest passes for a prophet and Führer, and sometimes it is luckily the other way round as well, or else mankind would long since have perished of stupidity.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: The wise man... if he would live at peace with others, he will bear and forbear.

author: Nicholas Boileau
title: The wisest man is he who does not fancy that he is so at all.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: The wisest reason takes as her own principles those which the imagination of man has everywhere rashly introduced.

author: Marguerite Duras
title: The woman is the home. That's where she used to be, and that's where she still is. You might ask me, What if a man tries to be part of the home - will the woman let him? I answer yes. Because then he becomes one of the children.

author: Betty Grable
title: The woman's vision is deep reaching, the man's far reaching. With the man the world is his heart, with the woman the heart is her world.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: The word of man is the most durable of all material.

author: W. H. Auden
title: The words of a dead man are modified in the guts of the living.

author: Claude Lévi-Strauss
title: The world began without man, and it will complete itself without him.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: The world has the habit of making room for the man whose actions show that he knows where he is going.,

author: William M. Thackeray
title: The world is a looking glass and gives back to every man the reflection of his own face.

author: W. C. Fields
title: The world is getting to be such a dangerous place, a man is lucky to get out of it alive.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The world is moving so fast now-a-days that the man who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.

author: Baal Shem Tov
title: The world is new to us every morning - this is God's gift; and every man should believe he is reborn each day.

author: David Starr Jordan
title: The world turns aside to let any man pass who knows whither he is going.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: The worst cliques are those which consist of one man.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: The worst feeling in the world is the homesickness that comes over a man occasionally when he is at home.

author: Austin O'Malley
title: The worst misfortune that can happen to an ordinary man is to have an extraordinary father.

author: Charles Dickens
title: The worst of all listeners is the man who does nothing but listen.

author: Herodotus
title: The worst part a man can suffer is to have insight into much and power over nothing.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: The worthiest man to be known, and for a pattern to be presented to the world, he is the man of whom we have most certain knowledge. He hath been declared and enlightened by the most clear-seeing men that ever were; the testimonies we have of him are in faithfulness and sufficiency most admirable.

author: Paul De Man
title: The writer's language is to some degree the product of his own action; he is both the historian and the agent of his own language.

author: Democritus
title: The wrongdoer is more unfortunate than the man wronged.

author: Bob Goddard
title: The years forever fashion new dreams when old ones go. God pity a one-dream man.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.,

author: George Santayana
title: The young man who has not wept is a savage, and the old man who will not laugh is a fool.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Their learning is like bread in a besieged town: every man gets a little, but no man gets a full meal.

author: Carine Roitfeld
title: There are a lot of good men's magazines. In England, you have 'Arena Homme+' and 'Another Man;' and in France we have 'L'Officiel Hommes.' But all are looking similar.

author: William Makepeace Thackeray
title: There are a thousand thoughts lying within a man that he does not know till he takes up a pen to write.

author: Ann Oakley
title: There are always women who will take men on their own terms. If I were a man I wouldn't bother to change while there are women like that around.

author: Margot Asquith
title: There are big men, men of intellect, intellectual men, men of talent and men of action; but the great man is difficult to find, and it needs - apart from discernment - a certain greatness to find him.

author: Ezra Pound
title: There are few things more difficult than to appraise the work of a man suddenly dead in his youth; to disentangle ''promise'' from achievement; to save him from that sentimentalizing which confuses the tragedy of the interruption with the merit of the work actually performed.

author: James Baldwin
title: There are few things more dreadful than dealing with a man who knows he is going under, in his own eyes, and in the eyes of others. Nothing can help that man. What is left of that man flees from what is left of human attention.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: There are few ways in which a man can be more innocently employed than in getting money.

author: George M. Adams
title: There are high spots in all of our lives and most of them have come about through encouragement from someone else. I don't care how great, how famous or successful a man or woman may be, each hungers for applause.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: There are nine hundred and ninety-nine patrons of virtue to one virtuous man.

author: St. Francis de Sales
title: There are no galley-slaves in the royal vessel of divine love - every man works his oar voluntarily!

author: Bruce Lee
title: There are no limits. There are plateaus, but you must not stay there, you must go beyond them. If it kills you, it kills you. A man must constantly exceed his level.

author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
title: There are no signposts in the sky to show a man has passed that way before. There are no channels marked. The flier breaks each second into new uncharted seas.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: There are no such things as incurable s. There are only things for which man has not found a cure.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title:
There are practical little things in housekeeping which no man really understands.,
,

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: There are some experiences in life which should not be demanded twice from any man, and one of them is listening to the Brahms Requiem.

author: Archibald Macleish
title: There are those, I know, who will reply that the liberation of humanity, the freedom of man and mind, is nothing but a dream. They are right. It is. It is the American Dream.

author: Charles Kingsley
title: There are two freedoms - the false, where a man is free to do what he likes; the true, where he is free to do what he ought.

author: A. P. Gouthey
title: There are two great forces in this world - good and evil; and no man is worth his salt unless he has lost and won battle for a principle.

author: Camilo Jose Cela
title: There are two kinds of man: the ones who make history and the ones who endure it.

author: Booth Tarkington
title: There are two things that will be believed of any man whatsoever, and one of them is that he has taken to drink.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: There are two ways of being happy: We must either diminish our wants or augment our means - either may do - the result is the same and it is for each man to decide for himself and to do that which happens to be easier.

author: Ansel Adams
title: There are worlds of experience beyond the world of the aggressive man, beyond history, and beyond science. The moods and qualities of nature and the revelations of great art are equally difficult to define; we can grasp them only in the depths of our perceptive spirit.

author: Edward Hoagland
title: There aren't many irritations to match the condescension which a woman metes out to a man who she believes has loved her vainly for the past umpteen years.

author: Arnold Bennett
title: There can be no doubt that the average man blames much more than he praises. His instinct is to blame. If he is satisfied he says nothing; if he is not, he most illogically kicks up a row.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: There can be no two opinions as to what a highbrow is. He is the man or woman of thoroughbred intelligence who rides his mind at a gallop across country in pursuit of an idea.

author: Sir William Temple
title: There cannot live a more unhappy creature than an ill-natured old man, who is neither capable of receiving pleasures, nor sensible of conferring them on others.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: There has never yet been a man in our history who led a life of ease whose name is worth remembering.

author: Bennett Cerf
title: There have been too many [books] in which some young man is looking forward, backward or sideways in anger. Or in which some Southern youth is being chased through the magnolia bushes by his aunt. She catches him on page 28 with horrid results.

author: Francis Bacon
title: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: There is a God shaped vacuum in the heart of every man which cannot be filled by any created thing, but only by God, the Creator, made known through Jesus.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: There is a great man who makes every man feel small. But the real great man is the man who makes every man feel great.

author: Alfred Adler
title: There is a law that man should love his neighbor as himself. In a few hundred years it should be as natural to mankind as breathing or the upright gait; but if he does not learn it he must perish.

author: George Gordon
title: There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes. By the deep sea, and music in its roars; I love not man the less, but nature more.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: There is a time when a man distinguishes the idea of felicity from the idea of wealth; it is the beginning of wisdom.

author: Croesus
title: There is a wheel on the affairs of men revolve and its mechanism is such that it prevents any man from being always fortunate.

author: Jean Cocteau
title: There is always a period when a man with a beard shaves it off. This period does not last. He returns headlong to his beard.

author: Francis Bacon
title: There is as much difference between the counsel that a friend giveth, and that a man giveth himself, as there is between the counsel of a friend and of a flatterer. For there is no such flatterer as is a man's self.

author: John Adams
title: There is danger from all men. The only maxim of a free government ought to be to trust no man living with power to endanger the public liberty.

author: David Gemmell
title: There is evil in all of us, and it is the mark of a man how he defies the evil within.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: There is hardly a man clever enough to recognize the full extent of the evil he does.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: There is hardly a man on earth who will take advice unless he is certain that it is positively bad.

author: Sir Arthur Helps
title: There is hardly a more common error than that of taking the man who has one talent, for a genius.

author: Norman Douglas
title: There is in us a lyric germ or nucleus which deserves respect; it bids a man to ponder or create; and in this dim corner of himself he can take refuge and find consolations which the society of his fellow creatures does not provide.

author: Louis XIV
title: There is little that can withstand a man who can conquer himself.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: There is much difference between imitating a man and counterfeiting him.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: There is no action of man in this life which is not the beginning of so long a chain of consequences, as that no human providence is high enough to give us a prospect to the end.

author: Owen Felltham
title: There is no belittling worse than to over praise a man.

author: Thomas Alva Edison
title: There is no expedient to which a man will not resort to avoid the real labor of thinking.

author: George Crane
title: There is no future in any job. The future lies in the man who holds the job.

author: Ivan Illich
title: There is no greater distance than that between a man in prayer and God.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: There is no greater folly in the world than for a man to despair.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: There is no indispensable man.

author: Denis Diderot
title: There is no kind of harassment that a man may not inflict on a woman with impunity in civilized societies.

author: John Sterling
title: There is no lie that a man will not believe; and there is no man who does not believe many lies; and there is no man who believes only lies.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: There is no lonelier man in death, except the suicide, than that man who has lived many years with a good wife and then outlived her. If two people love each other there can be no happy end to it.

author: Henry Ford
title: There is no man living who isn't capable of doing more than he thinks he can do.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: There is no man so good, who, were he to submit all his thoughts and actions to the laws, would not deserve hanging ten times in his life.

author: Erich Fromm
title: There is no meaning to life except the meaning man gives his life by unfolding of his powers.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: There is no need to worry about mere size. We do not necessarily respect a fat man more than a thin man. Sir Isaac Newton was very much smaller than a hippopotamus, but we do not on that account value him less.

author: William Hazlitt
title: There is no one thoroughly despicable. We cannot descend much lower than an idiot; and an idiot has some advantages over a wise man.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: There is no prosperity, trade, art, city, or great material wealth of any kind, but if you trace it home, you will find it rooted in a thought of some individual man.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: There is no purifier like knowledge in this world: , time makes man find himself in his heart.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: There is no real wealth but the labor of man.

author: Anna Sewell
title: There is no religion without love, and people may talk as much as they like about their religion, but if it does not teach them to be good and kind to man and beast, it is all a sham.

author: Jean de la Bruyère
title: There is no road too long to the man who advances deliberately and without undue haste; there are no honors too distant to the man who prepares himself for them with patience.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: There is no satisfaction in hanging a man who does not object to it.

author: George Shinn
title: There is no such thing as a self-made man. You will reach your goals only with the help of others.

author: Groucho Marx
title: There is no sweeter sound than the crumbling of ones fellow man.

author: Miguel de Unamuno
title: There is no true love save in suffering, and in this world we have to choose either love, which is suffering, or happiness. Man is the more man - that is, the more divine - the greater his capacity for suffering, or rather, for anguish.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: There is not a more repulsive spectacle than on old man who will not forsake the world, which has already forsaken him.,

author: John Webster
title: There is not in nature, a thing that makes man so deformed, so beastly, as doth intemperate anger.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: There is not one single established religion that an intelligent, educated man can believe.

author: Henry Fielding
title: There is nothing a man of good sense dreads in a wife so much as her having more sense than himself.

author: Seneca
title: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.

author: Robert Lynd
title: There is nothing in which the birds differ more from man than the way in which they can build and yet leave a landscape as it was before.

author: Francis Bacon
title: There is nothing makes a man suspect much, more than to know little, and therefore men should remedy suspicion by procuring to know more, and not keep their suspicions in smother.

author: Seneca
title: There is nothing more despicable than an old man who has no other proof than his age to offer of his having lived long in the world.

author: William Hazlitt
title: There is nothing more likely to drive a man mad, than the being unable to get rid of the idea of the distinction between right and wrong, and an obstinate, constitutional preference of the true to the agreeable.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: There is nothing more mysterious than a TV set left on in an empty room. It is even stranger than a man talking to himself or a woman standing dreaming at her stove. It is as if another planet is communicating with you.

author: Homer
title: There is nothing nobler or more admirable than when two people who see eye to eye keep house as man and wife, confounding their enemies and delighting their friends.

author: Will Rogers
title: There is nothing so stupid as an educated man, if you get him off the thing he was educated in.

author: Henry Miller
title: There is nothing strange about fear: no matter in what guise it presents itself it is something with which we are all so familiar that when a man appears who is without it we are at once enslaved by him.

author: Mark Caine
title: There is nothing that puts a man more in your debt than that he owes you nothing.

author: George Eliot
title: There is nothing that will kill a man so soon as having nobody to find fault with but himself.

author: Samuel Butler
title: There is nothing which at once affects a man so much and so little as his own death.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: There is nothing which has yet been contrived by man, by which so much happiness is produced as by a good tavern.

author: Søren Kierkegaard
title: There is nothing with which every man is so afraid as getting to know how enormously much he is capable of doing and becoming.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: There is nothing, Sir, too little for so little a creature as man. It is by studying little things that we attain the great art of having as little misery and as much happiness as possible.

author: Herbert Spencer
title: There is one principle that can keep a man in everlasting ignorance.  That is contempt prior to investigation.

author: Groucho Marx
title: There is one way to find out if a man is honest; ask him! If he says yes you know he's crooked.

author: Ogden Nash
title: There is only one thing for a man to do who is married to a woman who enjoys spending money, and that is enjoy earning it.

author: Alan Paton
title: There is only one way in which one can endure man's inhumanity to man and that is to try, in one's own life, to exemplify man's humanity to man.

author: Douglas William Jerrold
title: There is peace more destructive of the manhood of living man than war is destructive of his material body.

author: Carl Jung
title: There is rarely a creative man who does not have to pay a high price for the divine spark of his great gifts... the human element is frequently bled for the benefit of the creative element.

author: John Frederick Boyes
title: There is scarcely a man who is not conscious of the benefits which his own mind has received from the performance of single acts of benevolence. How strange that so few of us try a course of the same medicine!

author: Abraham Cowley
title: There is some help for all the defects of fortune; for, if a man cannot attain to the length of his wishes, he may have his remedy by cutting of them shorter.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: There is something in the unselfish and self-sacrificing love of a brute, which goes directly to the heart of him who has had frequent occasion to test the paltry friendship and gossamer fidelity of mere Man.

author: Herman Melville
title: There is something wrong about the man who wants help. There is somewhere a deep defect, a want, in brief, a need, a crying need, somewhere about that man.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: There is such a thing as a man being too proud to fight.

author: Robert Frost
title: There is the fear that we shan't prove worthy in the eyes of someone who knows us at least as well as we know ourselves. That is the fear of God. And there is the fear of Man - fear that men won't understand us and we shall be cut of from them.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom, that he that thinks himself the happiest man, really is so; but he who thinks himself the wisest, is generally the greatest fool.

author: Carl Van Vechten
title: There is, indeed, no single quality of the cat that man could not emulate to his advantage.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: There isn't any symbolism. The sea is the sea. The old man is an old man. The boy is a boy and the fish is a fish. The shark are all sharks no better and no worse. All the symbolism that people say is shit. What goes beyond is what you see beyond when you know.

author: Arleigh Burke
title: There never is a convenient place to fight a war when the other man starts it.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: There never was a truly great man that was not at the same time truly virtuous.

author: Olive Schreiner
title: There was never a great man who had not a great mother.

author: St. Francis de Sales
title: There was never an angry man that thought his anger unjust.

author: Billy Bennett
title: There's a cockeyed yellow poodle to the north of Conga Pooch; , There's a little hot cross bun that's turning green; , There's a double-jointed woman doing tricks in Chu-Chin-Chow, , And you're a better man than I am, Gunga Din.

author: A. Lawrence Lowell
title: There's a Harvard man on the wrong side of every question.

author: C. Day Lewis
title: There's a kind of release , And a kind of torment in every goodbye for every man.

author: Bobby Bowden
title: There's a saying in my business that there are two kinds of coaches - those who have been fired and those who haven't been fired yet. That's kind of like prostate cancer. Every man will have it if he lives long enough.

author: Cassandra Clare
title: There's a stigma that guys hate romance and hate love, but that's not true. Look at 'Iron Man.' There's a whole through-line plot about his relationship with Pepper, and everybody loves it.

author: Samuel Beckett
title: There's man all over for you, blaming on his boots the fault of his feet.

author: Bill Cosby
title: There's no labor a man can do that's undignified - if he does it right.

author: Col. Harland Sanders
title: There's no reason to be the richest man in the cemetery. You can't do any business from there.

author: Kin Hubbard
title: There's no secret about success. Did you ever know a successful man who didn't tell you about it?

author: William Shakespeare
title: There's not one wise man among twenty will praise himself.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: There's nothing in the world like the devotion of a married woman. It's a thing no married man knows anything about.

author: Philip Roth
title: There's something every woman wants, and that's a man to blame.

author: Agatha Christie
title: There's too much tendency to attribute to God the evils that man does of his own free will.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Therefore if a man look sharply and attentively, he shall see Fortune; for though she be blind, yet she is not invisible.

author: Aristotle
title: Therefore, the good of man must be the end of the science of politics.

author: Alfred Hitchcock
title: These are bagpipes. I understand the inventor of the bagpipes was inspired when he saw a man carrying an indignant, asthmatic pig under his arm. Unfortunately, the man-made sound never equaled the purity of the sound achieved by the pig.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
title: These unhappy times call for the building of plans that build from the bottom up and not from the top down, that put their faith once more in the forgotten man at the bottom of the economic pyramid.

author: Charles Dickens
title: They are so filthy and bestial that no honest man would admit one into his house for a water-closet doormat.

author: John Morley
title: They are the guiding oracles which man has found out for himself in that great business of ours, of learning how to be, to do, to do without, and to depart.

author: Virgil
title: They attack the one man with their hate and their shower of weapons. But he is like some rock which stretches into the vast sea and which, exposed to the fury of the winds and beaten against by the waves, endures all the violence

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: They have given us into the hand of new unhappy lords. Lords without anger and honor, who dare not carry their swords. They fight by shuffling papers; they have bright dead alien eyes; They look at our labor and laughter as a tired man looks at flies.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: They said, ''You have a blue guitar, you do not play things as they are. The man replied, ''Things as they are changed upon a blue guitar.''

author: Joseph Conrad
title: They talk of a man betraying his country, his friends, his sweetheart. There must be a moral bond first. All a man can betray is his conscience.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: They who do not understand that a man may be brought to hope that which of all things is the most grievous to him, have not observed with sufficient closeness the perversity of the human mind.

author: Henri L. Bergson
title: Think like a man of action, and act like a man of thought.

author: William Butler Yeats
title: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.,

author: William B. Yeats
title: Think like a wise man but communicate in the language of the people.

author: William Shakespeare
title: This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: This is a court of law young man, not a court of justice.

author: Francis Bacon
title: This is certain, that a man that studieth revenge keeps his wounds green, which otherwise would heal and do well.

author: Karl Kraus
title: This is something that I cannot get over - that a whole line could be written by half a man, that a work could be built on the quicksand of a character.

author: Thomas Wolfe
title: This is the artist, then, life's hungry man, the glutton of eternity, beauty's miser, glory's slave.

author: Cat Stevens
title: This is the beauty of the Qur'an: it asks you to reflect and reason, and not to worship the sun or moon but the One who has created everything. The Qur'an asks man to reflect upon the sun and moon and God's creation in general.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: This is the very perfection of a man, to find out his own imperfections.

author: Carol Ann Duffy
title: This is the word tightrope. Now imagine , a man, inching across it in the space , between our thoughts. He holds our breath. There is no word net. You want him to fall, don't you? , I guessed as much; he teeters but succeeds. , The word applause is written all over him.

author: Aristophanes
title:
This is what extremely grieves us, that a man who never fought,
Should contrive our fees to pilfer, on who for his native land,
Never to this day had oar, or lance, or blister in his hand.

author: Adelbert von Chamisso
title: This man, although he appeared so humble and embarrassed in his air and manners, and passed so unheeded, had inspired me with such a feeling of horror by the unearthly paleness of his countenance, from which I could not avert my eyes, that I was unable longer to endure it.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
title: This type of man who is devoted to the study of wisdom is always most unlucky in everything, and particularly when it comes to procreating children; I imagine this is because Nature wants to ensure that the evils of wisdom shall not spread further throughout mankind.

author: Bill Hicks
title: Those guys were in hog heaven, man. They had a weapons catalog, What's G-12 do, Tommy? Says here it destroys everything but the fillings in their teeth, helps pay for the war effort. Well, shit, pull that one up! Pull up G-12, please. ] ...Cool. What's G-13 do?

author: Henry Thomas Buckle
title: Those minute critics who seem to think that when they detect the occasional errors of a great man, they in some degree reduce him to their own level.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Thou seest I have more flesh than another man, and therefore more frailty.

author: John Keats
title: Though a quarrel in the streets is a thing to be hated, the energies displayed in it are fine; the commonest man shows a grace in his quarrel.

author: Alexis de Tocqueville
title: Though it is very important for man as an individual that his religion should be true, that is not the case for society. Society has nothing to fear or hope from another life; what is most important for it is not that all citizens profess the true religion but that they should profess religion.

author: Eliza Cook
title: Though language forms the preacher, 'Tis ''good works'' make the man.

author: Edward Dahlberg
