title: Though man is the only beast that can write, he has small reason to be proud of it. When he utters something that is wise it is nothing that the river horse does not know, and most of his creations are the result of accident.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Thought is great and swift and free, the light of the world, the chief glory of man.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Thought is the organizing factor in man, intersected between the causal primary instincts and the resulting actions.

author: Amos Bronson Alcott
title: Thought means life, since those who do not think so do not live in any high or real sense. Thinking makes the man.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Thought once awakened does not again slumber; unfolds itself into a System of Thought; grows, in man after man, generation after generation, till its full stature is reached, and such System of Thought can grow no farther, but must give place to another.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Thought takes man out of servitude, into freedom.,

author: Woody Allen
title: Thought: Why does man kill? He kills for food. And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.

author: Paracelsus
title: Thoughts give birth to a creative force that is neither elemental nor sidereal. Thoughts create a new heaven, a new firmament, a new source of energy, from which new arts flow. When a man undertakes to create something, he establishes a new heaven.

author: Stanislaw J. Lec
title: Thoughts, like fleas, jump from man to man, but they don't bite everybody.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: Three hours a day will produce as much as a man ought to write.

author: Josh Billings
title: Threescore years and ten is enough; if a man can't suffer all the misery he wants in that time, he must be numb.

author: Comte de Lautréamont
title: Throughout the centuries, man has considered himself beautiful. I rather suppose that man only believes in his own beauty out of pride; that he is not really beautiful and he suspects this himself; for why does he look on the face of his fellow-man with such scorn?

author: Maxwell Maltz
title: Thus man of all creatures is more than a creature, he is also a creator. Man alone can direct his success mechanism by the use of imagination, or imaging ability.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: Thus so wretched is man that he would weary even without any cause for weariness... and so frivolous is he that, though full of a thousand reasons for weariness, the least thing, such as playing billiards or hitting a ball, is sufficient enough to amuse him.

author: John Locke
title: Till a man can judge whether they be truths or not, his understanding is but little improved, and thus men of much reading, though greatly learned, but may be little knowing.

author: Robert Frost
title: Time and tide wait for no man, but time always stands still for a woman of 30.

author: Geoffrey Chaucer
title: Time and tide wait for no man.

author: Herbert Spencer
title: Time is that which a man is always trying to kill, but which ends in killing him.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: Time ripens all things; no man is born wise.

author: Ralph Hodgson
title: Time, you old gypsy man, will you not stay, put up your caravan just for one day?

author: Gore Vidal
title: To a man, ornithologists are tall, slender, and bearded so that they can stand motionless for hours, imitating kindly trees, as they watch for birds.

author: Joseph Conrad
title: To a teacher of languages there comes a time when the world is but a place of many words and man appears a mere talking animal not much more wonderful than a parrot.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: To act coolly, intelligently and prudently in perilous circumstances is the test of a man - and also a nation.

author: George Eliot
title: To act with doubleness towards a man whose own conduct was double, was so near an approach to virtue that it deserved to be called by no meaner name than diplomacy.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts. Every man is tasked to make his life, even in its details, worthy of the contemplation of his most elevated and critical hour.

author: Albert Camus
title: To assert in any case that a man must be absolutely cut off from society because he is absolutely evil amounts to saying that society is absolutely good, and no-one in his right mind will believe this today.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: To be a man is to be responsible. It is to feel shame at the sight of what seems to be unmerited misery. It is to take pride in a victory won by one's comrades. It is to feel, when setting one's stone, that one is contributing to the building of the world.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery
title: To be a man is, precisely, to be responsible.

author: W. E. B. Du Bois
title: To be a poor man is hard, but to be a poor race in a land of dollars is the very bottom of hardships.

author: Marlene Dietrich
title: To be completely woman you need a master, and in him a compass for your life. You need a man you can look up to and respect. If you dethrone him it's no wonder that you are discontented, and discontented women are not loved for long.

author: Helen Rowland
title: To be happy with a man you must understand him a lot and love him a little. To be happy with a woman you must love her a lot and not try to understand her at all.

author: William Shakespeare
title: To be honest, as this world goes, is to be. One man picked out of ten thousand.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: To be idle and to be poor have always been reproaches, and therefore every man endeavors with his utmost care to hide his poverty from others, and his idleness from himself.

author: Golda Meir
title: To be successful, a woman has to be better at her job than a man.

author: Jane Harrison
title: To be womanly is one thing, and one only; it is to be sensitive to man, to be highly endowed with the sex instinct; to be manly is to be sensitive to woman.

author: Henry Drummond
title: To become Christ-like is the only thing in the whole world worth caring for, the thing before which every ambition of man is folly and all lower achievement vain.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: To believe what has not occurred in history will not occur at all, is to argue disbelief in the dignity of man.

author: Valerie Solanas
title: To call a man an animal is to flatter him; he's a machine, a walking dildo.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: To compel a man to furnish contributions of money for the propagation of opinions which he disbelieves and abhors is sinful and tyrannical.

author: Algernon Sydney
title: To depend upon the Will of a Man is Slavery.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: To depersonalize man is the dominant drift of our times.

author: Plutarch
title: To do an evil act is base. To do a good one without incurring danger, is common enough. But it is part of a good man to do great and noble deeds though he risks everything in doing them.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: To educate a man in mind and not in morals is to educate a menace to society.

author: Buddha
title: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.

author: Bruce Fairchild Barton
title: To every man of vision the clear Voice speaks; there is no great leadership where there is not a mystic. Nothing splendid has ever been achieved except by those who dared believe that something inside themselves was superior to circumstance. To choose the sure thing is treason to the soul.

author: John Oxenham
title: To every man there openeth A way, and ways, and a way. And the high soul climbs the high way, And the low soul gropes the low: And in between, on the misty flats, The rest drift to and fro. But to every man there openeth A high way and a low, And every man decideth. The way his soul shall go.

author: E. M. Cioran
title: To exist is equivalent to an act of faith, a protest against the truth, an interminable prayer. As soon as they consent to live, the unbeliever and the man of faith are fundamentally the same, since both have made the only decision that defines a being.

author: Benjamin Tucker
title: To force a man to pay for the violation of his own liberty is indeed an addition of insult to injury.

author: Robert A. Heinlein
title: To get anywhere, or even live a long time, a man has to guess, and guess right, over and over again, without enough data for a logical answer.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: To give a generous hope to a man of his own nature, is to enrich him immeasurably.

author: John Locke
title: To give a man full knowledge of morality, I would send him to no other book than the New Testament.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: To give aid to every poor man is far beyond the reach and power of every man. Care of the poor is incumbent on society as a whole.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: To give an accurate description of what has never occurred is not merely the proper occupation of the historian, but the inalienable privilege of any man of parts and culture.

author: Alan Paton
title: To give up the task of reforming society is to give up one's responsibility as a free man.

author: Horace
title: To have a great man for a friend seems pleasant to those who have never tried it; those who have, fear it.

author: Margaret Oliphant
title: To have a man who can flirt is next thing to indispensable to a leader of society.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: To have doubted one's own first principles is the mark of a civilized man.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: To have the reputation of possessing the most perfect social tact, talk to every woman as if you loved her, and to every man as if he bored you.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.,

author: Elvis Presley
title: To judge a man by his weakest link or deed is like judging the power of the ocean by one wave.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: To know a man, observe how he wins his object, rather than how he loses it; for when we fail, our pride supports; when we succeed; it betrays us.

author: Paul Auster
title: To leave the world a little better than you found it. That's the best a man can ever do.

author: Marguerite Duras
title: To love one child and to love all children, whether living or dead - somewhere these two loves come together. To love a no-good but humble punk and to love an honest man who believes himself to be an honest man - somewhere these, too, come together.

author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton
title: To make laws that man cannot, and will not obey, serves to bring all law into contempt.

author: Plutarch
title: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.

author: Adlai Stevenson
title: To me, there is something superbly symbolic in the fact that an astronaut, sent up as assistant to a series of computers, found that he worked more accurately and more intelligently than they. Inside the capsule, man is still in charge.

author: Malcolm Stevenson Forbes
title: To measure the man, measure his heart.

author: John Gray
title: To offer a man unsolicited advice is to presume that he doesn't know what to do or that he can't do it on his own.

author: Bruce Feirstein
title: To paraphrase Jane Austen, it is a truth universally acknowledged that a married man in possession of a vast fortune must be in want of a newer, younger wife.

author: John Selden
title: To preach long, loud, and Damnation, is the way to be cried up. We love a man that damns us, and we run after him again to save us.

author: Thomas Malthus
title: To prevent the recurrence of misery is, alas! beyond the power of man.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: To procrastinate seems inherent in man, for if you do to-day that you may enjoy to-morrow it is but deferring the enjoyment; so that to be idle or industrious, vicious or virtuous, is but with a view of procrastinating the one or the other.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: To reform a world, to reform a nation, no wise man will undertake; and all but foolish men know, that the only solid, though a far slower reformation, is what each begins and perfects on himself.

author: Demosthenes
title: To remind a man of the good turns you have done him is very much like a reproach.

author: Jean Rostand
title: To say of men that they are bad is to say they are worse than we think we are, or worse than the ideal man whose image we have built up on the basis of a certain few.

author: D'Amato Cus
title: To see a man beaten not by a better opponent but by himself is a tragedy.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: To sentence a man of true genius, to the drudgery of a school is to put a racehorse on a treadmill.

author: George Steiner
title: To shoot a man because one disagrees with his interpretation of Darwin or Hegel is a sinister tribute to the supremacy of ideas in human affairs - but a tribute nevertheless.

author: Ben Jonson
title: To speak and to speak well, are two things. A fool may talk, but a wise man speaks.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: To sum up: 1. The cosmos is a gigantic fly-wheel making 10, 000 revolutions a minute. 2. Man is a sick fly taking a dizzy ride on it. 3. Religion is the theory that the wheel was designed and set spinning to give him the ride.

author: Benjamin Jowett
title: To teach a man how he may learn to grow independently, and for himself, is perhaps the greatest service that one man can do another.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: To the excessively fearful the chief characteristic of power is its arbitrariness. Man had to gain enormously in confidence before he could conceive an all-powerful God who obeys his own laws.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: To the illumined man or woman, a clod of dirt, a stone, and gold are the same.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.

author: W. H. Auden
title: To the man-in-the-street, who, I'm sorry to say, is a keen observer of life. The word ''Intellectual'' suggests straight away. A man who's untrue to his wife.

author: Emily Post
title: To the old saying that man built the house but woman made of it a ''home'' might be added the modern supplement that woman accepted cooking as a chore but man has made of it a recreation.

author: Carl Jung
title: To the psychotherapist an old man who cannot bid farewell to life appears as feeble and sickly as a young man who is unable to embrace it.

author: Thomas Merton
title: To the truly humble man the ordinary ways and customs and habits of men are not a matter of conflict.

author: William Shakespeare
title: To thine own self be true; and it must follow, as the night the day: thou canst not then be false to any man.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: To those of my race who... underestimate the importance of cultivating friendly relations with the Southern white man, who is their next-door neighbor, I would say, 'Cast down your bucket where you are'â€”cast it down in making friends in every manly way of the people of all races by whom we are surrounded.

author: Calvin Harris
title: To throw a shoe at a man in Dundee is the equivalent of a kiss on the cheek and an embrace in London. Dundee is a very different place; they have their own rules.

author: Alexis Carrel
title: To what extent is any given man morally responsible for any given act? We do not know.

author: Aristotle
title: To write well, express yourself like common people, but think like a wise man. Or, think as wise men do, but speak as the common people do.

author: Alfred Rosenberg
title: Today a new faith is stirring: the myth of blood, the faith that along with blood we are defending the divine nature of man as a whole.

author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
title:
Tolerance is the virtue of the man without convictions.,
,

author: Bridget Moynahan
title: Tom Selleck brings in the babes of all ages, I have to tell you. You can be 60, 80, or 16 and still love that man.

author: Bernard Crick
title: Too often the revolutionary is the man who must create order in the chaos left by failed conservatives.

author: Winston Churchill
title: Too often the strong, silent man is silent only because he does not know what to say, and is reputed strong only because he has remained silent.

author: Henry Miller
title: Topographically the country is magnificent - and terrifying. Why terrifying? Because nowhere else in the world is the divorce between man and nature so complete. Nowhere have I encountered such a dull, monotonous fabric of life as here in America. Here boredom reaches its peak.

author: John Burroughs
title: Travel and society polish one, but a rolling stone gathers no moss, and a little moss is a good thing on a man.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: Travel makes a wise man better, and a fool worse

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Traveling makes a man wiser, but less happy.

author: Larry Mcmurtry
title: True maturity is only reached when a man realizes he has become a father figure to his girlfriends boyfriends - and he accepts it.

author: Francis H. Bradley
title: True penitence condemns to silence. What a man is ready to recall he would be willing to repeat.

author: Akhenaton
title: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.

author: René Daumal
title: Truth is one, but error proliferates. Man tracks it down and cuts it up into little pieces hoping to turn it into grains of truth. But the ultimate atom will always essentially be an error, a miscalculation.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: Twas glory once to be a Roman; She makes it glory, now, to be a man.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: Twenty-five hundred years ago it might have been said that man understood himself as well as any other part of the world. Today he is the thing he understands least.

author: Thomas Fuller
title: Two things a man should never be angry at: what he can help, and what he cannot help.

author: Frederick W. Robertson
title: Two thousand years ago there was One here on this earth who lived the grandest life that ever has been lived yet -a life that every thinking man, with deeper or shallower meaning, has agreed to call divine.

author: E. M. Cioran
title: Tyranny destroys or strengthens the individual; freedom enervates him, until he becomes no more than a puppet. Man has more chances of saving himself by hell than by paradise.

author: Norman Mailer
title: Ultimately a hero is a man who would argue with the gods, and so awakens devils to contest his vision. The more a man can achieve, the more he may be certain that the devil will inhabit a part of his creation.

author: Bobby Fischer
title: Ultimately the white man should leave the United States and the black people should go back to Africa.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: Ultimately, America's answer to the intolerant man is diversity, the very diversity which our heritage of religious freedom has inspired.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Uncontrolled, the hunger and thirst after God may become an obstacle, cutting off the soul from what it desires. If a man would travel far along the mystic road, he must learn to desire God intensely but in stillness, passively and yet with all his heart and mind and strength.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Under a government which imprisons any unjustly, the true place for a just man is also a prison.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: Under capitalism, man exploits man. Under communism, it’s just the opposite

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: Under the species of Syndicalism and Fascism there appears for the first time in Europe a type of man who does not want to give reasons or to be right, but simply shows himself resolved to impose his opinions.

author: William Ellery Channing
title: Undoubtedly a man is to labor to better his condition, but first to better himself.

author: Carlos Saavedra Lamas
title: Unemployment is a great tragedy. The man who goes about hopelessly seeking work in order to earn bread for his children is a living reproach to civilization.

author: Carl Jung
title: Unfortunately, there can be no doubt that man is, on the whole, less good than he imagines himself or wants to be. Everyone carries a shadow, and the less it is embodied in the individual's conscious life, the blacker and darker it is. If an inferiority is conscious, one always has a chance to correct it. Furthermore, it is constantly in contact with other interests, so that it is continually subjected to modifications. But if it is repressed and isolated from consciousness, it never gets co

author: Wallace Stevens
title: Union of the weakest develops strength not wisdom. Can all men, together, avenge one of the leaves that have fallen in autumn? But the wise man avenges by building his city in snow.

author: S. Daniel
title: Unless above himself he can erect himself, how poor a thing is a man.

author: Bernard Baruch
title: Unless each man produces more than he receives, increases his output, there will be less for him than all the others.

author: Adam Clayton
title: Unless man is committed to the belief that all mankind are his brothers, then he labors in vain and hypocritically in the vineyards of equality.

author: Adam Clayton Powell
title: Unless man is committed to the belief that all of mankind are his brothers, then he labors in vain and hypocritically in the vineyards of equality.

author: B. R. Ambedkar
title: Unlike a drop of water which loses its identity when it joins the ocean, man does not lose his being in the society in which he lives. Man's life is independent. He is born not for the development of the society alone, but for the development of his self.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Until he extends his circle of compassion to include all living things, man will not himself find peace.

author: Jean Anouilh
title: Until the day of his death, no man can be sure of his courage.

author: Brigitte Bardot
title: Vadim changed my mind about acting. Vadim was the only man who was certain I had something special to offer.

author: Bruce Willis
title: Violence - look, we live in a violent world, man. This country was founded on violence. Who's kidding who?

author: Aleksandr Solzjenitsyn
title: Violence can only be concealed by a lie, and the lie can only be maintained by violence. Any man who has once proclaimed violence as his method is inevitably forced to take the lie as his principle.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Virtue is like health: the harmony of the whole man.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Virtue is, like health, the harmony of the whole man.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Visit the Navy-Yard, and behold a marine, such a man as an American government can make, or such as it can make a man with its black arts - a mere shadow and reminiscence of humanity, a man laid out alive and standing, and already, as one may say, buried under arms with funeral accompaniments.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: Vote for the man who promises least; he'll be the least disappointing.

author: Richard Nixon
title: Voters quickly forget what a man says.

author: Anatole France
title: Wandering re-establishes the original harmony which once existed between man and the universe.

author: Machiavelli
title: War is a profession by which a man cannot live honorably; an employment by which the soldier, if he would reap any profit, is obliged to be false, rapacious, and cruel.

author: Alfred Adler
title: War is not the continuation of politics with different means, it is the greatest mass-crime perpetrated on the community of man.

author: Benito Mussolini
title: War is to man what maternity is to a woman. From a philosophical and doctrinal viewpoint, I do not believe in perpetual peace.

author: Benito Mussolini
title: War is to man what motherhood is to a woman. From a philosophical and doctrinal viewpoint, I do not believe in perpetual peace.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: Was putting a man on the moon actually easier than improving education in our public schools?

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Water is the only drink for a wise man.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: We all want progress, but if you're on the wrong road, progress means doing an about-turn and walking back to the right road; in that case, the man who turns back soonest is the most progressive.

author: A. B. Yehoshua
title: We always knew how to honor fallen soldiers. They were killed for our sake, they went out on our mission. But how are we to mourn a random man killed in a terrorist attack while sitting in a cafe? How do you mourn a housewife who got on a bus and never returned?

author: William James
title: We are all ready to be savage in some cause. The difference between a good man and a bad one is the choice of the cause.

author: Charles Horton Cooley
title: We are ashamed to seem evasive in the presence of a straightforward man, cowardly in the presence of a brave one, gross in the eyes of a refined one, and so on. We always imagine, and in imagining share, the judgments of the other mind.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: We are born believing. A man bears beliefs as a tree bears apples.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: We are born, so to speak, twice over; born into existence, and born into life; born a human being, and born a man.

author: Betty Dodson
title: We are constantly protecting the male ego, and it's a disservice to men. If a man has any sensitivity or intelligence, he wants to get the straight scoop from his girlfriend.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: We are more thoroughly an enlightened people, with respect to our political interests, than perhaps any other under heaven. Every man among us reads, and is so easy in his circumstances as to have leisure for conversations of improvement and for acquiring information.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: We are motivated by a keen desire for praise, and the better a man is the more he is inspired by glory. The very philosophers themselves, even in those books which they write in contempt of glory, inscribe their names.

author: Samuel Butler
title: We are not won by arguments that we can analyze, but by tone and temper; by the manner, which is the man himself.

author: Dr. Jerome Brunner
title: We are only now on the threshold of knowing the range of the educability of man-the perfectibility of man. We have never addressed ourselves to this problem before.

author: Jerome K. Jerome
title: We are so bound together that no man can labor for himself alone. Each blow he strikes in his own behalf helps to mold the universe.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: We call a man a bigot or a slave of dogma because he is a thinker who has thought thoroughly and to a definite end.

author: Joseph Roux
title: We call that person who has lost his father, an orphan; and a widower that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known the immense unhappiness of losing a friend, by what name do we call him? Here every language is silent and holds its peace in impotence.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: We can always redeem the man who aspires and strives.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely.

author: Bill Walton
title: We can never thank David Stern enough. His vision to use basketball to improve the quality of our lives to make this world a better and saner place, that guy, is the most important man in the history of basketball.

author: James Truslow Adams
title: We cannot advance without new experiments in living, but no wise man tries every day what he has proved wrong the day before.

author: Blaise Pascal
title: We conceal it from ourselves in vain - we must always love something. In those matters seemingly removed from love, the feeling is secretly to be found, and man cannot possibly live for a moment without it.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: We distinguish the excellent man from the common man by saying that the former is the one who makes great demands on himself, and the latter who makes no demands on himself.

author: William Hazlitt
title: We do not say that a man to be a critic must necessarily be a poet: but to be a good critic, he ought not to be a bad poet.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: We falsely attribute to men a determined character - putting together all their yesterdays - and averaging them - we presume we know them. Pity the man who has character to support - it is worse than a large family - he is the silent poor indeed.

author: B. F. Skinner
title: We have not yet seen what man can make of man.

author: John Ruskin
title: We have seen when the earth had to be prepared for the habitation of man, a veil, as it were, of intermediate being was spread between him and its darkness, in which were joined in a subdued measure, the stability and insensibility of the earth, and the passion and perishing of mankind.

author: Ronald Reagan
title: We have so many people who can't see a fat man standing beside a thin one without coming to the conclusion that the fat man got that way by taking advantage of the thin one!

author: Arthur C. Clarke
title: We have to abandon the idea that schooling is something restricted to youth. How can it be, in a world where half the things a man knows at 20 are no longer true at 40 - and half the things he knows at 40 hadn't been discovered when he was 20?

author: Auberon Herbert
title: We hold that what one man cannot morally do, a million men cannot morally do, and government, representing many millions of men, cannot do.

author: Bobby Keys
title: We just get up there and play rock-and-roll music, man. Everybody sweats and has a good time.

author: George Steiner
title: We know that a man can read Goethe or Rilke in the evening, that he can play Bach and Schubert, and go to his day's work at Auschwitz in the morning.

author: Chief Seattle
title: We know that the white man does not understand our ways. One portion of land is the same to him as the next, for he is a stranger who comes in the night and takes from the land whatever he needs. The earth is not his brother, but his enemy, and when he has conquered it, he moves on.

author: Mark Twain
title: We like a man to come right out and say what he thinks, if we agree with him.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: We live at a time when man believes himself fabulously capable of creation, but he does not know what to create.

author: Aaron Sorkin
title: We live in a world that has walls. And those walls have to be guarded by men with guns. Who's gonna do it? You?... You can't handle it. Because deep down, in places you don't talk about, you want me on that wall. You need me there. We use words like honor, code, loyalty. We use these words as a backbone to a life spent defending something. You use them as a punchline. I have neither the time nor the inclination to explain myself to a man who rises and sleeps under the blanket of the

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
title: We make way for the man who boldly pushes past us.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: We must be as courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light.

author: Harry S. Truman
title: We must build a new world, a far better world - one in which the eternal dignity of man is respected.

author: Robert F. Kennedy
title: We must continue to prove to the world that we can provide a rising standard of living for all men without loss of civil rights or human dignity to any man.,

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: We must hold a man amenable to reason for the choice of his daily craft or profession. It is not an excuse any longer for his deeds that they are the custom of his trade. What business has he with an evil trade?

author: Napoleon
title: We must laugh at man to avoid crying for him.

author: Amy Vanderbilt
title: We must learn which ceremonies may be breached occasionally at our convenience and which ones may never be if we are to live pleasantly with our fellow man.

author: Mark Twain
title: We need not worry so much about what man descends from; it's what he descends to that shames the human race.

author: Charles F. Kettering
title: We need to teach the highly educated man that it is not a disgrace to fail and that he must analyze every failure to find its cause. He must learn how to fail intelligently, for failing is one of the greatest arts in the world.

author: Aristotle
title: We praise a man who feels angry on the right grounds and against the right persons and also in the right manner at the right moment and for the right length of time.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: We say nothing essential about the cathedral when we speak of its stones. We say nothing essential about Man when we seek to define him by the qualities of men.

author: Bill Cosby
title: We see a successful, elegant man now, but as a child, an adolescent, his life was not a done deal. Sidney respected his mistakes. When failure came, he never said, This is too difficult, too hard, he had the resiliency to try again. His life is somewhere between astounding and unbelievable.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: We shall see but little way if we require to understand what we see. How few things can a man measure with the tape of his understanding! How many greater things might he be seeing in the meanwhile!

author: Karl Marx
title: We should not say that one man's hour is worth another man's hour, but rather that one man during an hour is worth just as much as another man during an hour. Time is everything, man is nothing: he is at the most time's carcass.

author: Armstrong Williams
title: We tend to admire the people in our society who have accumulated such wealth as to seem somehow great. But we shouldn't forget that it was the everyday working class man who made this country great.

author: Butch Trucks
title: We were either listening to jazz or Robert Johnson, the old blues man, but not to our peers.

author: Kin Hubbard
title: We'd all like to vote for the best man, but he's never a candidate.

author: Adam Savage
title: We're not leaving here without Buster, man. Leave no crash-test dummy behind!.

author: John Wicker
title: Wealth is not in making money, but in making the man while he is making money.

author: Sean O'Casey
title: Wealth often takes away chances from men as well as poverty. There is none to tell the rich to go on striving, for a rich man makes the law that hallows and hollows his own life.

author: Helen Rowland
title: Wedding: the point at which a man stops toasting a woman and begins roasting her.

author: Betty Buckley
title: Well, the teacher I studied with for nineteen and a half years was a man named Paul Gavert. He was a great lieder singer, so basically I'm a trained lieder singer because of that teacher. The teacher I currently study with - since 1995 - is Joan Lader, who also studied with Gavert.

author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset
title: Were art to redeem man, it could do so only by saving him from the seriousness of life and restoring him to an unexpected boyishness.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
title: Were I called on to define, very briefly, the term Art, I should call it ''the reproduction of what the Senses perceive in Nature through the veil of the soul.'' The mere imitation, however accurate, of what is in Nature, entitles no man to the sacred name of ''Artist.''

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Were it not for imagination a man would be as happy in arms of a chambermaid as of a duchess.

author: Socrates
title: What a lot of things there are a man can do without.

author: Helen Rowland
title: What a man calls his ''conscience'' is merely the mental action that follows a sentimental reaction after too much wine or love.

author: Abraham H. Maslow
title: What a man can be, he must be. This need we may call self-actualization.

author: H. P. Lovecraft
title: What a man does for pay is of little significance. What he is, as a sensitive instrument responsive to the world's beauty, is everything!,

author: Robin George Collingwood
title: What a man is ashamed of is always at bottom himself; and he is ashamed of himself at bottom always for being afraid.

author: Adlai E. Stevenson II
title: What a man knows at fifty that he did not know at twenty is for the most part incommunicable.

author: Joseph Wood Krutch
title: What a man knows is everywhere at war with what he wants.

author: Brendan Francis
title: What a man most enjoys about a woman's clothes are his fantasies of how she would look without them.

author: Meister Eckhart
title: What a man takes in by contemplation, that he pours out in love.

author: Lord George Byron
title: What a strange thing man is; and what a stranger thing woman.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: What are your historical Facts; still more your biographical? Wilt thou know a man by stringing-together beadrolls of what thou namest Facts?

author: Alan Paton
title: What broke in a man when he could bring himself to kill another?

author: Adam Smith
title: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?

author: Edmund Burke
title: What ever disunites man from God, also disunites man from man.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: What ever the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

author: William James
title: What every genuine philosopher (every genuine man, in fact) craves most is praise - although the philosophers generally call it ''recognition''!

author: Boris Pasternak
title: What for centuries raised man above the beast is not the cudgel but the irresistible power of unarmed truth.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: What gift has providence bestowed on man that is so dear to him as his children?

author: Archibald Macleish
title: What happened at Hiroshima was not only that a scientific breakthrough had occurred and that a great part of the population of a city had been burned to death, but that the problem of the relation of the triumphs of modern science to the human purposes of man had been explicitly defined.

author: Edward Dahlberg
title: What has a writer to be bombastic about? Whatever good a man may write is the consequence of accident, luck, or surprise, and nobody is more surprised than an honest writer when he makes a good phrase or says something truthful.

author: Jean Genet
title: What I did not yet know so intensely was the hatred of the white American for the black, a hatred so deep that I wonder if every white man in this country, when he plants a tree, doesn't see Negroes hanging from its branches.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: What is a man if he is not a thief who openly charges as much as he can for the goods he sells?

author: Albert Camus
title: What is a rebel? A man who says no.

author: Salvador Dali
title: What is a television apparatus to man, who has only to shut his eyes to see the most inaccessible regions of the seen and the never seen, who has only to imagine in order to pierce through walls and cause all the planetary Baghdad's of his dreams to rise from the dust.

author: Carl Jung
title: What is essential in a work of art is that it should rise far above the realm of personal life and speak to the spirit and heart of the poet as man to the spirit and heart of mankind.

author: Lucretius
title: What is food to one man is bitter poison to others.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: What is good? All that heightens the feeling of power, the will to power, power itself in man.

author: Chief Seattle
title: What is man without the beasts? If all the beasts were gone, man would die from a great loneliness of spirit. For whatever happens to the beasts, soon happens to man. All things are connected.

author: Lord Palmerston
title: What is merit? The opinion one man entertains of another.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: What is peculiar in the life of a man consists not in his obedience, but his opposition, to his instincts. In one direction or another he strives to live a supernatural life.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: What is said of a man is nothing. The point is, who says it.

author: Leonard Cohen
title: What is the appropriate behavior for a man or a woman in the midst of this world, where each person is clinging to his piece of debris? What's the proper salutation between people as they pass each other in this flood?

author: William Blake
title: What is the price of experience? Do men buy it for a song? Or wisdom for a dance in the street? No, it is bought with the price of all the man hath, his house, his wife, his children.

author: Arthur Erickson
title: What is the thread of western civilization that distinguished its course in history? It has to do with the preoccupation of western man with his outward command and his sense of superiority.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: What is the vanity of the vainest man compared with the vanity which the most modest possesses when, in the midst of nature and the world, he feels himself to be ''man''!

author: Evelyn Waugh
title: What is youth except a man or a woman before it is ready or fit to be seen.

author: Charles A. Lindbergh
title: What kind of man would live where there is no daring? I don't believe in taking foolish chances but nothing can be accomplished without taking any chance at all.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: What life half gives a man, posterity gives entirely.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
title: What light is to the eyes - what air is to the lungs - what love is to the heart, liberty is to the soul of man.

author: Seneca
title: What madness it is for a man to starve himself to enrich his heir, and so turn a friend into an enemy! For his joy at your death will be proportioned to what you leave him.

author: Angelina Grimke
title: What man or woman of common sense now doubts the intellectual capacity of colored people? Who does not know, that with all our efforts as a nation to crush and annihilate the mind of this portion of our race, we have never yet been able to do it.

author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
title: What one man can invent, another can discover.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: What really flatters a man is that you think him worth flattering.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step.

author: Lord George Byron
title: What should I have known or written had I been a quiet, mercantile politician or a lord in waiting? A man must travel, and turmoil, or there is no existence.

author: Alexander Graham Bell
title: What this power is I cannot say; all I know is that it exists and it becomes available only when a man is in that state of mind in which he knows exactly what he wants and is fully determined not to quit until he finds it.

author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr
title: What war has always been is a puberty ceremony. It's a very rough one, but you went away a boy and came back a man, maybe with an eye missing or whatever but godammit you were a man and people had to call you a man thereafter.

author: Robertson Davies
title: What we call luck is the inner man externalized. We make things happen to us.

author: E. M. Cioran
title: What we want is not freedom but its appearances. It is for these simulacra that man has always striven. And since freedom, as has been said, is no more than a sensation, what difference is there between being free and believing ourselves free?

author: Boris Pasternak
title: What you don't understand is that it is possible to be an atheist, it is possible not to know if God exists or why He should, and yet to believe that man does not live in a state of nature but in history, and that history as we know it now began with Christ, it was founded by Him on the Gospels.

author: Malcolm S. Forbes
title: What's an expert? I read somewhere, that the more a man knows, the more he knows, he doesn't know. So I suppose one definition of an expert would be someone who doesn't admit out loud that he knows enough about a subject to know he doesn't really know how much.

author: Bob Dylan
title: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.

author: Mark Twain
title: What, then, is the true Gospel of consistency? Change. Who is the really consistent man? The man who changes. Since change is the law of his being, he cannot be consistent if he stick in a rut.

author: Chief Seattle
title: Whatever befalls the earth befalls the son of the earth. Man did not weave the web of life; he is merely a strand of it. Whatever he does to the web, he does to himself.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: Whatever evil a man may think of women, there is no woman but thinks more.

author: Agnes Macphail
title: Whatever is dirty, it is women's job to clean up, or drive some man to clean up, and that goes for everything from cellar to senate.

author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi
title: Whatever man does he must do first in his mind.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time.

author: Benjamin Watson
title: Whatever you do, do it wholeheartedly for the Lord and not for man, because our true identity is in Him.

author: Phyllis Diller
title: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Whatever your life's work is, do it well. A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.

author: William B. Yeats
title: When a country produces a man of genius he never is what it wants or believes it wants; he is always unlike its idea of itself.

author: Euripides
title: When a good man is hurt all who would be called good must suffer with him.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: When a great man dies, for years the light he leaves behind him, lies on the paths of men.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: When a man and a woman have an overwhelming passion for each other, it seems to me, in spite of such obstacles dividing them as parents or husband, that they belong to each other in the name of Nature, and are lovers by Divine right, in spite of human convention or the laws.

author: Georges Clemenceau
title: When a man asks himself what is meant by action he proves that he isn't a man of action. Action is a lack of balance. In order to act you must be somewhat insane. A reasonably sensible man is satisfied with thinking.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: When a man assumes a public trust he should consider himself a public property.

author: Josh Billings
title: When a man comes to me for advice, I find out the kind of advice he wants, and I give it to him.

author: Marcelene Cox
title: When a man does a household job, he goes through three periods: contemplating how it will be done; contemplating when it will be done; and contemplating.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: When a man fell into his anecdotage it was a sign for him to retire from the world.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: When a man finds no peace within himself, it is useless to seek it elsewhere.

author: Jung Chang
title: When a man gets power, even his chickens and dogs rise to heaven.

author: Josh Billings
title: When a man gets talking about himself, he seldom fails to be eloquent and often reaches the sublime.

author: Oswald Chambers
title: When a man gets to despair he knows that all his thinking will never get him out. He will only get out by the sheer creative effort of God. Consequently he is in the right attitude to receive from God that which he cannot gain for himself.

author: Bette Davis
title: When a man gives his opinion, he's a man. When a woman gives her opinion, she's a bitch.

author: Enid Bagnold
title: When a man goes through six years training to be a doctor he will never be the same. He knows too much.

author: M. Rutherford
title: When a man grows old, wisdom will not keep him alive.

author: Russel H. Conwell
title: When a man has done all he can do, still there is a mighty, mysterious agency over which he needs influence to secure success. The one way he can reach it is by prayer.

author: Mack R. Douglas
title: When a man has done his best, has given his all, and in the process supplied the needs of his family and his society, that man has made a habit of succeeding.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: When a man has no reason to trust himself, he trusts in luck.

author: Thomas Scott
title: When a man has not a good reason for doing a thing, he has one good reason for letting it alone.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When a man has once loved a woman, he will do anything for her, except continue to love her.

author: Charles M. Schwab
title: When a man has put a limit on what he will do, he has put a limit on what he can do.

author: Anthony Trollope
title: When a man is ill nothing is so important to him as his own illness.

author: Benjamin Haydon
title: When a man is no longer anxious to do better than well, he is done for.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: When a man is out of sight, it is not too long before he is out of mind.

author: Samuel Johnson
title:
When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life; for there is in London all that life can afford.,
,

author: John Ruskin
title: When a man is wrapped up in himself he makes a pretty small package.

author: Thomas C. Haliburton
title: When a man is wrong and won't admit it, he always gets angry.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: When a man knows he is to be hanged in a fortnight, it concentrates his mind wonderfully.

author: Merlin
title: When a man lies, he murders some part of the world.

author: Prins Philip
title: When a man opens a car door for his wife, it's either a new car or a new wife.

author: Prince Philip
title: When a man opens the car door for his wife, it's either a new car or a new wife.

author: Ben Shahn
title: When a man returned from the field and we'd look at the work, we'd criticize each other very genuinely and never offensively. And we would avoid all tricks, angle shots were just horrible to us.

author: Otto von Bismarck
title: When a man says he approves of something in principle, it means he hasn't the slightest intention of putting it into practice.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: When a man says he had pleasure with a woman he does not mean conversation.,

author: Augustus William Hare
title: When a man says he sees nothing in a book, he very often means that he does not see himself in it: which, if it is not a comedy or a satire, is likely enough.

author: Edgar W. Howe
title: When a man says money can do anything, that settles it. He hasn't any.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When a man says money can do anything, that settles it: he hasn't got any.

author: Otto Von Bismarck
title: When a man says that he approves something in principal, it means he hasn't the slightest intention of putting it in practice.

author: Albert Einstein
title: When a man sits with a pretty girl for an hour, it seems like a minute. But let him sit on a hot stove for a minute - then it's longer than any hour. That's relativity!

author: Helen Rowland
title: When a man spends his time giving his wife criticism and advice instead of compliments, he forgets that it was not his good judgment, but his charming manners, that won her heart.

author: Sacha Guitry
title: When a man steals your wife, there is no better revenge than to let him keep her.

author: Robert Bolt
title: When a man takes an oath, Meg, he's holding his ownself in his own hands. Like water. And if he opens his fingers then- he needn't hope to find himself again.

author: Don Marquis
title: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him whose?

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport; when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: When a man wants your advice he generally wants your praise.

author: C. S. Forester
title: When a man who is drinking neat gin starts talking about his mother he is past all argument.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty.

author: Ben Jonson
title: When a virtuous man is raised, it brings gladness to his friends, grief to his enemies, and glory to his posterity.

author: Edith Evans
title: When a woman behaves like a man, why doesn't she behave like a nice man?

author: Minna Antrim
title: When a woman is very, very bad, she is awful, but when a man is correspondingly good, he is weird.

author: Alice Duer Miller
title:
When a woman like that whom I've seen so much, ,
All of a sudden drops out of touch; ,
Is always busy and never can, ,
Spare you a moment, it means a man.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: When a woman marries again it is because she detested her first husband. When a man marries again it is because he adored his first wife. Women try their luck; men risk theirs.

author: George D. Prentice
title: When a young man complains that a young lady has no heart, it's pretty certain that she has his.

author: Benjamin Harrison
title: When and under what conditions is the black man to have a free ballot? When is he in fact to have those full civil rights which have so long been his in law?

author: John Greenleaf Whittier
title: When faith is lost, when honor dies, the man is dead.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When God created man and woman, he did not take a patent. That's why any imbecile has been able to do so ever since.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: When he has no lust, no hatred, , A man walks safely among the things of lust and hatred

author: Marc Chagall
title: When I am finishing a picture I hold some God-made object up to it - a rock, a flower, the branch of a tree or my hand - as a kind of final test. If the painting stands up beside a thing man cannot make, the painting is authentic. If there's a clash between the two, it is bad art.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: When I am getting ready to reason with a man, I spend one-third of my time thinking about myself and what I am going to say and two-thirds about him and what he is going to say.

author: Ben Kingsley
title: When I choose a role it's either because I recognise the man, or that I'm very curious to know him. If I neither recognise nor know him, then it is better that I don't play him.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: When I give a man an office, I watch him carefully to see whether he is swelling or growing.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: When I hear a man preach, I like to see him act as if he were fighting bees.

author: Butch Trucks
title: When I listened to Elvin Jones, man, for the first time I heard a drummer that had all the technique plus emotion, passion, feel, and just - good God!

author: Winston Churchill
title: When I look back on all the worries I remember the story of the old man who said on his deathbed that he had a lot of trouble in his life, most of which never happened.

author: Betty Williams
title: When I received the news of the Nobel Peace Award, I could not believe it. I told my father, 'I think they have the wrong name, Dad. Please, can you talk to this man on the phone? I'm busy cooking!'

author: Bo Burnham
title: When I see someone filming me, I don't usually think, 'No, man, don't put this up online!' I'd think, 'Hey man, you don't get to go to shows very often, put down the camera and enjoy it!' I love going to theatre and to shows so much.

author: Bobby Keys
title: When I talk about rock n' roll, to me, that goes back to the beginning of the 1950s. Blue suede shoes and sideburns, man. Pink and black coloured clothes. Turn your collar up, comb your hair in ducktails. And the music was cool. It was a whole culture then - a different world.

author: Napoleon
title: When I want any, good head work done; I always choose a man, if possible with a long nose.

author: Josh Billings
title: When I was a boy of fourteen, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.

author: Mark Twain
title: When I was a boy of fourteen, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But, when I got to be twenty-one, I was astonished at how much he had learned in seven years.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: When I was a young man I observed that nine out of ten things I did were failures. I didn't want to be a failure, so I did ten times more work.

author: Billy Collins
title: When I was a young man, I understood that poetry was two things - it was difficult to understand, but you could understand that the poet was miserable. So for a while there, I wrote poems that were hard to understand, even by me, but gave off whiffs of misery.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: When I was coming of age, I remembered reading and studying the initial ideas within the feminist movement. There was this idea with my parents' generation that in order to find equality, a woman would need to behave like a man.

author: Bob Gibson
title: When I was playing I never wished I was doing anything else. I think being a professional athlete is the finest thing a man can do.

author: Brian K. Vaughan
title: When I wrote 'Runaways,' I was a naive kid who thought that all parents were evil. Now that I'm a wise old man with children of my own, I am certain that all parents are evil.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: When I'm getting ready to reason with a man, I spend one-third of my time thinking about myself and what I am going to say and two-thirds thinking about him and what he is going to say.

author: John Galsworthy
title: When Man evolved Pity, he did a queer thing - deprived himself of the power of living life as it is without wishing it to become something different.

author: Adam Weishaupt
title: When man lives under government, he is fallen, his worth is gone, and his nature tarnished.

author: Ryszard Kapuscinski
title: When man meets an obstacle he can't destroy, he destroys himself.

author: Junius
title: When once a man is determined to believe, the very absurdity of the doctrine confirms him in his faith.

author: John Donne
title: When one man dies, one chapter is not torn out of the book, but translated into a better language.

author: Mark Twain
title: When people do not respect us we are sharply offended; yet deep down in his private heart no man much respects himself.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: When power leads man towards arrogance, poetry reminds him of his limitations. When power narrows the area of man's concern, poetry reminds him of the richness and diversity of existence. When power corrupts, poetry cleanses.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: When the body sinks into death, the essence of man is revealed. Man is a knot, a web, a mesh into which relationships are tied. Only those relationships matter. The body is an old crock that nobody will miss. I have never known a man to think of himself when dying. Never.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: When the eyes say one thing, and the tongue another, a practiced man relies on the language of the first.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: When the intensity of emotional conviction subsides, a man who is in the habit of reasoning will search for logical grounds in favor of the belief which he finds in himself.

author: Anthony Holden
title: When the magistrate says 'That's not a good enough reason my man.' He said 'Excuse me, could I ask you? Have you taken an oath of allegiance to the Monarch?'.

author: Samuel Butler
title: When the righteous man truth away from his righteousness that he hath committed and doeth that which is neither quite lawful nor quite right, he will generally be found to have gained in amiability what he has lost in holiness.

author: George Macdonald
title: When tomorrow's burden is added to the burden of today than the weight is more than a man can bear.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: When we treat man as he is, we make him worse than he is; when we treat him as if he already were what he potentially could be, we make him what he should be.

author: Ernest Becker
title: When we understand that man is the only animal who must create meaning, who must open a wedge into neutral nature, we already understand the essence of love. Love is the problem of an animal who must find life, create a dialogue with nature in order to experience his own being.

author: Henry Fielding
title: When widows exclaim loudly against second marriages, I would always lay a wager than the man, If not the wedding day, is absolutely fixed on.

author: Barbara Taylor Bradford
title: When you are a strong woman, you will attract trouble. When a man feels threatened, there is always trouble.

author: Winston Churchill
title:
When you have to kill a man, it costs nothing to be polite.,
,

author: Russell Hoban
title: When you suffer an attack of nerves you're being attacked by the nervous system. What chance has a man got against a system?

author: C. P. Snow
title: When you think of the long and gloomy history of man, you will find that far more, and far more hideous, crimes have been committed in the name of obedience than have ever been committed in the name of rebellion.

author: Ann Coulter
title: When you try to figure out what the religious right is, it ultimately comes down either to one man, Pat Robertson, or anyone who believes in a higher being and wants their taxes cut.

author: Charles Dickens
title: When you're a married man, Samivel, you'll understand a good many things as you don't understand now; but whether it's worth while, going through so much, to learn so little, as the charity-boy said when he got to the end of the alphabet, is a matter o taste.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.

author: Harry S. Truman
title: Whenever a man does the best he can, then that is all he can do.

author: William M. Thackeray
title: Whenever he met a great man he groveled before him, and my-lorded him as only a free-born Briton can do.

author: Rita Rudner
title: Whenever I date a guy, I think, is this the man I want my children to spend their weekends with?

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Whenever there are in any country uncultivated lands and unemployed poor, it is clear that the laws of property have been so far extended as to violate natural right. The earth is given as a common stock for man to labor and live on. The small landowners are the most precious part of a state.

author: William James
title: Whenever two people meet there are really six people present. There is each man as he sees himself, each man as the other person sees him, and each man as he really is.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Whenever you hear a man speak of his love for his country, it is a sign that he expects to be paid for it.

author: Seneca
title: Whenever you hold a fellow creature in distress, remember that he is a man.

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: Where a man can live, he can also live well.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Where is the man who has the strength to be true, and to show himself as he is?

author: Dwight L. Moody
title: Where one man reads the Bible, a hundred read you and me.

author: Cardinal de Retz
title: Where princes are concerned, a man who is able to do good is as dangerous and almost as criminal as a man who intends to do evil.

author: Marshall Mcluhan
title: Where the whole man is involved there is no work. Work begins with the division of labor.

author: Dorothy Parker
title: Where's the man could ease a heart, like a satin gown?

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Wherever a man goes, men will pursue him and paw him with their dirty institutions, and, if they can, constrain him to belong to their desperate odd-fellow society.

author: Albert Schweitzer
title: Wherever a man turns he can find someone who needs him.

author: Jonathan Swift
title: Wherever I find a great deal of gratitude in a poor man, I take it for granted there would be as much generosity if he were a rich man.

author: Bunker Roy
title: Wherever I've been, and I've been to over 20, maybe 25, countries in Africa, I've noticed how their backbone is broken. They don't have any confidence in themselves. They always think a white man will solve their problems from outside for them.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: Wherever our life touches yours, we help or hinder... wherever your life touches ours, you make us stronger or weaker.... There is no escape - man drags man down, or man lifts man up.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Wherever the choice has had to be made between the man of reason and the madman, the world has unhesitatingly followed the madman.

author: Hannah Arendt
title: Wherever the relevance of speech is at stake, matters become political by definition, for speech is what makes man a political being.

author: John Jay Chapman
title: Wherever you see a man who gives someone else's corruption, someone else's prejudice as a reason for not taking action himself, you see a cog in The Machine that governs us.

author: Victoria Billings
title: Whether he admits it or not, a man has been brought up to look at money as a sign of his virility, a symbol of his power, a bigger phallic symbol than a Porsche.

author: James Tyler Kent
title: While Homeopathy itself is a perfect science, its truth is only partially known. The truth itself relates to the Divine, the knowledge relates to man.

author: St. Augustine of Hippo
title: Who can map out the various forces at play in one soul? Man is a great depth, O Lord. The hairs of his head are easier by far to count than his feeling, the movements of his heart.

author: Babe Ruth
title: Who is richer? The man who is seen, but cannot see? Or the man who is not being seen, but can see?

author: Oscar Wilde
title: Who is that man over there? I don't know him. What is he doing? Is he a conspirator? Have you searched him? Give him till tomorrow to confess, then hang him! - hang him!

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Who is the wisest man? He who neither knows or wishes for anything else than what happens.

author: John Milton
title: Who kills a man kills a reasonable creature, God's image, but thee who destroys a good book, kills reason itself.

author: Billie Holiday
title: Who love my man, I'm a liar if I say I don't , But I'll quit my man, I'm a liar if I say I wont.

author: George Meredith
title: Who rises from prayer a better man, his prayer is answered.

author: Horace
title: Who then is free? The wise man who can govern himself.

author: Andrew Johnson
title: Who, then, will govern? The answer must be, Man - for we have no angels in the shape of men, as yet, who are willing to take charge of our political affairs.

author: Luigi Pirandello
title: Whoever has the luck to be born a character can laugh even at death. Because a character will never die! A man will die, a writer, the instrument of creation: but what he has created will never die!

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: Why be a man when you can be a success?

author: Robert Browning
title: Why comes temptation, but for man to meet and master and crouch beneath his foot, and so be pedestaled in triumph?

author: Helen Rowland
title: Why does a man take it for granted that a girl who flirts with him wants him to kiss her - when, nine times out of ten, she only wants him to want to kiss her?

author: Woody Allen
title: Why does man kill? He kills for food. And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.

author: Carrie Snow
title: Why get married and make one man miserable when I can stay single and make thousands miserable?

author: Alexander Hamilton
title: Why has government been instituted at all? Because the passions of man will not conform to the dictates of reason and justice without constraint.

author: Alexander Pope
title: Why has not man a microscopic eye? For the plain reason man is not a fly.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Why, except as a means of livelihood, a man should desire to act on the stage when he has the whole world to act in, is not clear to me.

author: James A. Froude
title: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.

author: Buffalo Bill
title: Wild Bill was anything but a quarrelsome man yet I have personal knowledge of at least half a dozen men whom he had at various times killed.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Will power is to the mind like a strong blind man who carries on his shoulders a lame man who can see.

author: Bill Dedman
title: William Andrews Clark was caught in a bribery scandal during a campaign for the U.S. Senate - he was said to describe the Montana legislators this way: 'I never bought a man who wasn't for sale.'

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Wine gives a man nothing. It neither gives him knowledge nor wit; it only animates a man, and enables him to bring out what a dread of the company has repressed. It only puts in motion what had been locked up in frost.

author: Alcaeus
title: Wine is a peep-hole on a man.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Wine makes a man better pleased with himself. I do not say that it makes him more pleasing to others... This is one of the disadvantages of wine, it makes a man mistake words for thoughts.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Wine makes a man more pleased with himself; I do not say it makes him more pleasing to others.,

author: Edward Parsons Day
title: Wine makes a poor man rich in imagination, a rich man poor in reality.

author: Babur
title: Wine maketh a man act like an ass in a rich pasture.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Wisdom is like electricity. There is no permanently wise man, but men capable of wisdom, who, being put into certain company, or other favorable conditions, become wise for a short time, as glasses rubbed acquire electric power for a while.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: Wit is so shining a quality that everybody admires it; most people aim at it, all people fear it, and few love it unless in themselves. A man must have a good share of wit himself to endure a great share of it in another.

author: Clarence Darrow
title: With all their faults, trade unions have done more for humanity than any other organization of men that ever existed. They have done more for decency, for honesty, for education, for the betterment of the race, for the developing of character in man, than any other association of men.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: With children use force with men reason; such is the natural order of things. The wise man requires no law.

author: Buddha
title: With fools, there is no companionship. Rather than to live with men who are selfish, vain, quarrelsome, and obstinate, let a man walk alone.

author: Bruce Cameron
title: With my book 'How to Remodel a Man,' I was on Oprah, Fox News, the Early Show, and Good Morning America. Oprah was the best - an hour long segment. TV is so short; you answer a few questions, and then it's over. It feels like a hit-and-run with a camera.

author: Ezra Pound
title: With one day's reading a man may have the key in his hands.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: With prophecies the commentator is often a more important man than the prophet.

author: Louis-Ferdinand Celine
title: With two thousand years of Christianity behind him... a man can't see a regiment of soldiers march past without going off the deep end. It starts off far too many ideas in his head.

author: Harry S. Truman
title: Within the first few months I discovered that being president is like riding a tiger. A man has to keep riding or be swallowed.

author: Sir Edwin Arnold
title: Within yourself deliverance must be searched for, because each man makes his own prison.

author: Bram Stoker
title: Within, stood a tall old man, clean shaven save for a long white moustache, and clad in black from head to foot, without a single speck of colour about him anywhere.

author: Andre Maurois
title: Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold.

author: Andre Maurois
title: Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold.

author: Homer
title: Without a sign, his sword the brave man draws, and asks no omen, but his country's cause.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Without friends the world is but a wilderness. There is no man that imparteth his joys to his friends, but he joyeth the more; and no man that imparteth his grieves to his friend, but he grieveth the less.

author: George Gurdjieff
title: Without self knowledge, without understanding the working and functions of his machine, man cannot be free, he cannot govern himself and he will always remain a slave.

author: B. C. Forbes
title: Without self-respect there can be no genuine success. Success won at the cost of self-respect is not success – for what shall it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses his own self-respect.

author: John Dewey
title: Without some goals and some efforts to reach it, no man can live.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title:
Without tools is the man nothing, with tools he is all.,
,

author: Joseph Conrad
title: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: Woe to you, my Princess, when I come... you shall see who is the stronger, a gentle little girl who doesn't eat enough or a big wild man who has cocaine in his body.

author: Luigi Pirandello
title: Woman for example, look at her case! She turns tantalizing inviting glances on you. You seize her. No sooner does she feel herself in your grasp than she closes her eyes. It is a sign of her mission, the sign by which she says to man: ''Blind yourself, for I am blind.''

author: Charles Edward Jerningham
title: Woman often feigns love; man, oftener, passion.

author: Blind Lemon Jefferson
title: Woman rocks the cradle and I declare she rules her home Many man rocks some other man's baby and the fool thinks he's rocking his own.

author: Brad Meltzer
title: Women are not weaker. Read that again. Women are not weaker. They are just as strong, just as resolute, just as creative, and are filled with just as much potential as any man.

author: Mary Wollstonecraft
title: Women are told from their infancy, and taught by the example of their mothers, that a little knowledge of human weakness, justly termed cunning, softness of temper, outward obedience and a scrupulous attention to a puerile kind of propriety, will obtain for them the protection of man.

author: Virginia Woolf
title: Women have served all these centuries as looking-glasses possessing the magic and delicious power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size.

author: William Wycherley
title: Women serve but to keep a man from better company.

author: Sister Corita Kent
title: Women's liberation is the liberation of the feminine in the man and the masculine in the woman.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: Wondrous is the strength of cheerfulness, and its power of endurance - the cheerful man will do more in the same time, will do it ;better, will preserve it longer, than the sad or sullen.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Wood burns because it has the proper stuff in it; and a man becomes famous because he has the proper stuff in him.

author: C. Northcote Parkinson
title: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion. General recognition of this fact is shown in the proverbial phrase ''It is the busiest man who has time to spare.''

author: Pablo Picasso
title: Work is a necessity for man. Man invented the alarm clock.

author: Pablo Picasso
title: Work is necessary for man. Man invented the alarm clock.

author: Sir Theodore Martin
title: Work is the true elixir of life. The busiest man is the happiest man.

author: John F. Kennedy
title: World peace, like community peace, does not require that each man love his neighbor - it requires only that they live together with mutual tolerance, submitting their disputes to a just and peaceful settlement.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Would you live with ease, do what you should, and not what you please. Success has ruined many a man.

author: Billy Gardell
title: Yeah, I've done Jim Breuer's radio show a couple times, and I heard from Larry the Cable Guy when I got 'Mike & Molly,' wishing me congratulations. I'm always the last one to the party, man. But that's okay. I got there.

author: Babe Ruth
title: Yes, he's a prick, but he sure can hit. God Almighty, that man can hit!

author: Malcolm X
title: Yes, I'm an extremist. The Black race here in North America is in extremely bad condition. You show me a Black man who isn't an extremist and I'll show you one who needs psychiatric attention.

author: Oscar Wilde
title:
Yet each man kills the thing he loves,
By each let this be heard.,
Some do it with a bitter look,,
Some with a flattering word.,
The coward does it with a kiss,,
The brave man with a sword!

author: William Shakespeare
title: Yet who would have thought the old man to have had so much blood in him?

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: You accuse a woman of wavering affections, but don't blame her; she is just looking for a consistent man.

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: You are a man, not God; you are human, not an angel. How can you expect to remain always in a constant state of virtue, when this was not possible even for an angel of Heaven, nor for the first man in the Garden?

author: Mark Caine
title: You are beginning to see that any man to whom you can do favor is your friend, and that you can do a favor to almost anyone.

author: William Shakespeare
title: You are thought here to be the most senseless and fit man for the constable of the watch, therefore bear you the lantern.

author: Charles Bukowski
title: You begin saving the world by saving one man at a time; all else is grandiose romanticism or politics.

author: Norman Douglas
title: You can construct the character of a man and his age not only from what he does and says, but from what he fails to say and do.

author: Terence
title: You can take a chance with any man who pays his bills on time.

author: Seneca
title: You can tell the character of every man when you see how he receives praise.

author: Booker T. Washington
title: You can't hold a man down without staying down with him.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: You cannot become thorough Americans if you think of yourselves in groups. America does not consist of groups. A man who thinks of himself as belonging to a particular national group in America has not yet become an American.

author: William Boetcker
title: You cannot raise a man up by calling him down.

author: Galileo Galilei
title: You cannot teach a man anything; you can only help him find it within himself.

author: Malcolm X
title: You don't have to be a man to fight for freedom. All you have to do is to be an intelligent human being.,

author: Cab Calloway
