title: Wait for those unguarded moments. Relax the mood and, like the child dropping off to sleep, the subject often reveals his truest self.

author: Bjornstjerne Bjornson
title: Watch over your child, as it struggles for breath on the outermost verge of life, or see your wife follow the child to that outermost verge, beside herself for anxiety and sleeplessness, - then love will teach you that life comes first.

author: Candice S. Miller
title: We are learning more about the humanity of the unborn child. Science and truth support the prolife movement.

author: Marianne Williamson
title: We ask ourselves, Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous? Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world.

author: Bono
title: We can be the generation that no longer accepts that an accident of latitude determines whether a child lives or dies. But will we be that generation?

author: Plato
title: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.

author: Carl Jung
title: We can keep from a child all knowledge of earlier myths, but we cannot take from him the need for mythology.

author: Anne C. Weisberg
title: We felt often that we were perceived as mothers trying to be lawyers, while a male colleague of ours who had a young child was perceived as a lawyer who also happened to be a father.

author: Bob Filner
title: We have seen that, in another unfunded mandate, the so-called No Child Left Behind Act, which created tougher standards, and we all support that, but Congress did not provide the money to attract and hire the best teachers.

author: Carl Honore
title: We know that no algorithm can solve global poverty; no pill can cure a chronic illness; no box of chocolates can mend a broken relationship; no educational DVD can transform a child into a baby Einstein; no drone strike can end a terrorist conflict. Sadly, there is no such thing as 'One Tip to a Flat Stomach.'

author: Carol Bellamy
title: We must ensure that while eliminating child labor in the export industry, we are also eliminating their labour from the informal sector, which is more invisible to public scrutiny - and thus leaves the children more open to abuse and exploitation.

author: Bill Cosby
title: We see a successful, elegant man now, but as a child, an adolescent, his life was not a done deal. Sidney respected his mistakes. When failure came, he never said, This is too difficult, too hard, he had the resiliency to try again. His life is somewhere between astounding and unbelievable.

author: Ben Carson
title: Well, I say that the most important job you can possibly have is raising a child, and it needs to be treated that way. You have to show them, rather than just talk to them.

author: Pearl S. Buck
title: What is a neglected child? He is a child not planned for, not wanted. Neglect begins, therefore, before he is born.

author: Simone de Beauvoir
title: What is an adult? A child blown up by age.

author: Pablo Picasso
title: What might be taken for a precocious genius is the genius of childhood. When the child grows up, it disappears without a trace. It may happen that this boy will become a real painter some day, or even a great painter. But then he will have to begin everything again, from zero.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: What we want is to see the child in pursuit of knowledge, and not knowledge in pursuit of the child.

author: Horace Mann
title: When a child can be brought to tears, and not from fear of punishment, but from repentance he needs no chastisement. When the tears begin to flow from the grief of their conduct you can be sure there is an angel nestling in their heart.

author: C. Everett Koop
title: When a child shows up for school, and is not physically and mentally ready to learn, he or she never catches up.

author: Anna Pavlova
title: When a small child, I thought that success spelled happiness. I was wrong, happiness is like a butterfly which appears and delights us for one brief moment, but soon flits away.

author: Marguerite Duras
title: When a woman drinks it's as if an animal were drinking, or a child. Alcoholism is scandalous in a woman, and a female alcoholic is rare, a serious matter. It's a slur on the divine in our nature.

author: Leon Blum
title: When a woman is twenty, a child deforms her; when she is thirty, he preserves her; and when forty, he makes her young again.

author: W. Temple
title: When all is done, human life is, at the greatest and the best, but like a forward child, that must be play'd with and humoured a little to keep it quiet till it falls asleep, and then the care is over.

author: Sir William Temple
title: When all is done, human life is, at the greatest and the best, but like a froward child, that must be played with and humored a little to keep it quiet till it falls asleep, and then the care is over.

author: Caroll Spinney
title: When he first started - Jim Henson, who created Bid Bird and Oscar - he said Big Bird was just a big, goofy guy. And it was - a script came along and I said, 'I think Big Bird would be much more useful to the show if he were a child learning all the things we were teaching in the show.' And so he didn't know the alphabet, even, for instance.

author: C. S. Lewis
title: When I lay these questions before God I get no answer. But a rather special sort of 'No answer.' It is not the locked door. It is more like a silent, certainly not uncompassionate, gaze. As though He shook His head not in refusal but waiving the question. Like, 'Peace, child; you don't understand.

author: Alain de Botton
title: When I see someone like Richard Dawkins, I see my father. I grew up with that. I'm basically the child of Richard Dawkins.,

author: Boris Becker
title: When I was a child, I had posters of James Dean in my room. I was a big admirer of his work and was fascinated by him living on the edge. Looking back, my life was kind of the same.

author: Bertrand Piccard
title: When I was a child, I saw my father diving to the deepest point in the ocean with the U.S. Navy.

author: Bruce Forsyth
title: When I was a child, life felt so slow because all I wanted to do was get into show business. Each day seemed like a year, but when you get older, years pass like minutes. I wish there was a tape recorder where we could just slow our lives down.

author: Philip Roth
title: When I was a child... I was watching a snowstorm, and hopefully asked, 'Momma, do we believe in winter?'

author: Boman Irani
title: When I was child, I never spoke. Teacher used to write remarks on my note book. My mom sent me to a trainer. I started talking, and it gave me confidence.

author: Beyonce Knowles
title: When I was writing the Destiny's Child songs, it was a big thing to be that young and taking control. And the label at the time didn't know that we were going to be that successful, so they gave us all control. And I got used to it.

author: Bipasha Basu
title: When things have gone really wrong in my life, I've cried like a child. I have really, really cried. I cry it out. Two-three days I cry, and then I'm like, enough, time to deal with reality and figure a way out. This is the way I have dealt with everything.

author: Carolyn Wells
title: When Venus said, Spell no for me, N-O, Dan Cupid wrote with glee, And smiled at his success: Ah, child, said Venus, laughing low, We women do not spell it so, We spell it Y-E-S.

author: Austin O'Malley
title: When you are dealing with a child, keep all your wits about you, and sit on the floor.

author: Carol Ann Duffy
title: When you have a child, your previous life seems like someone else's. It's like living in a house and suddenly finding a room you didn't know was there, full of treasure and light.

author: Criss Angel
title: When you think like a child your imagination is free and anything is possible.

author: Alice Miller
title: Wherever I look, I see signs of the commandment to honor one's parents and nowhere of a commandment that calls for the respect of a child.

author: Blanche Lincoln
title: Whether it's making sure that families have access to quality health care and child care, or making sure that our children receive the best educational opportunities we can give them, we must remain committed to these needs because our children are our future.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: With rushing winds and gloomy skies The dark and stubborn Winter dies: Far-off, unseen, Spring faintly cries, Bidding her earliest child arise; March!

author: Barbara Mikulski
title: Women leading means that Congress is working to create jobs, make quality child care more affordable and strengthen the middle class because we understand that America grows the economy and opportunity from the middle out, not the top down.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: Words today are like the shells and rope of seaweed which a child brings home glistening from the beach and which in an hour have lost their luster.

author: Colin Powell
title: Wouldn't it be great if we could look forward to a whole world in which no child will be left behind?

author: Bill Cosby
title: Yes, having a child is surely the most beautifully irrational act that two people in love can commit.

author: Billie Holiday
title: Yes, the strong gets more , While the weak ones fade , Empty pockets don't ever make the grade , Mama may have, Papa may have , But God bless the child that's got his own , That's got his own.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Yes, there is a Nirvanah; it is leading your sheep to a green pasture, and in putting your child to sleep, and in writing the last line of your poem.

author: Bob Ney
title: Yet, when child sex offenders are brought to justice and serve time for their offenses, they are often released into unsuspecting communities and left free to resume their sexual attacks.

author: Michael Moore
title: You can't regulate child labor. You can't regulate slavery. Some things are just wrong.

author: Katherine Anne Porter
title: You can't write about people out of textbooks, and you can't use jargon. You have to speak clearly and simply and purely in a language that a six-year-old child can understand; and yet have the meanings and the overtones of language, and the implications, that appeal to the highest intelligence.

author: W. H. Auden
title: You have to see the sex act comically, as a child.

author: Bryan Batt
title: You know, I think I was always intrigued by theater since I was a small child.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: You meet your soulmate, and you're like, 'Well, this is it. This is the feeling of falling in love, and it's the most intense it can ever be.' Then you have a child, and it's like - it's huge!

author: Toni Morrison
title: You need a whole community to raise a child. I have raised two children, alone.,

author: Dogen
title: You should study not only that you become a mother when your child is born, but also that you become a child.

author: Ben Stiller
title: You're freaked out that you're going to be having a child, and once you're looking after your daughter, it's the most beautiful thing in the world.

author: James Baldwin
title: A child cannot be taught by anyone who despises him, and a child cannot afford to be fooled.

author: Elias Canetti
title: Adults find pleasure in deceiving a child. They consider it necessary, but they also enjoy it. The children very quickly figure it out and then practice deception themselves.

author: Jean Arp
title: Art is a fruit that grows in man, like a fruit on a plant, or a child in its mother's womb.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
title: One looks back with appreciation to the brilliant teachers, but with gratitude to those who touched our human feelings. The curriculum is so much necessary raw material, but warmth is the vital element for the growing plant and for the soul of the child.

author: author
title: title

author: John Wooden
title: Ability may get you to the top, but it takes character to keep you there.

author: Novalis
title: A character is a completely fashioned will.

author: Evan Esar
title: A signature always reveals a man's character - and sometimes even his name.

author: Faith Baldwin
title: Character builds slowly, but it can be torn down with incredible swiftness.

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: Action, looks, words, steps, form the alphabet by which you may spell character.

author: Henry Ford
title: Life is a series of experiences, each one of which makes us bigger, even though sometimes it is hard to realize this. For the world was built to develop character, and we must learn that the setbacks and grieves which we endure help us in our marching onward.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: A man's own character is the arbiter of his fortune.

author: John Howe
title: Character is power; it makes friends, draws patronage and support and opens the way to wealth, honor and happiness.

author: August Strindberg
title: A man with a so-called character is often a simple piece of mechanism; he has often only one point of view for the extremely complicated relationships of life.

author: Jean Baudrillard
title: Contact with men who wield power and authority still leaves an intangible sense of repulsion. It's very like being in close proximity to fecal matter, the fecal embodiment of something unmentionable, and you wonder what it is made of and when it acquired its historically sacred character.

author: Plutarch
title: Character is simply habit long continued.

author: Jean Paul
title: A man never discloses his own character so clearly as when he describes another s.

author: Hosea Ballou
title: A single bad habit will mar an otherwise faultless character, as an ink-drop soileth the pure white page.

author: Bernard M. Baruch
title: During my eighty-seven years, I have witnessed a whole succession of technological revolutions. But none of them has done away with the need for character in the individual or the ability to think.

author: André Maurois
title: If you create an act, you create a habit. If you create a habit, you create a character. If you create a character, you create a destiny.

author: André Maurois
title: If you create an act, you create a habit. If you create a habit, you create a character. If you create a character, you create a destiny.

author: Horace
title: Let your character be kept up the very end, just as it began, and so be consistent.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: ''To give style'' to one's character - a great and rare art! He exercises it who surveys all that his nature presents in strength and weakness and then moulds it to an artistic plan until everything appears as art and reason, and even the weaknesses delight the eye.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A low self-love in the parent desires that his child should repeat his character and fortune.

author: Lydia M. Child
title: Flowers have spoken to me more than I can tell in written words. They are the hieroglyphics of angels, loved by all men for the beauty of the character, though few can decipher even fragments of their meaning.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: Pity the man who has a character to support - it is worse than a large family - he is silent poor indeed.

author: Katharine Hepburn
title: To keep your character intact you cannot stoop to filthy acts. It makes it easier to stoop the next time.

author: Barbara Windsor
title: 'EastEnders' has been wonderful to me and it's no secret that it changed my life all of those years ago. I'll be so sad to leave Peggy behind; she's such a wonderful character to play. I have had the pleasure of working with a marvelous cast and crew and have made many lasting good friends.

author: Bailey Chase
title: 'Longmire' is more of a show about the characters, and you couldn't pay a bigger compliment than to want to know more about my character, or the characters on the show.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: 'The Butler' has virtually nothing in common with its source material, the life of White House butler Gene Allen, except for the fact that the main character of the film and Allen were both black butlers in the White House.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: A character is like an acrostic or Alexandrian stanza; read it forward, backward, or across, it still spells the same thing.

author: Bill Skarsgard
title: A character on screen that's the 'good guy' or the 'bad guy,' they're never interesting. There's got to be an internal struggle, the duality is important to find.

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: A good character is the best tombstone. Those who loved you, and were helped by you, will remember you when forget-me-nots are withered. Carve your name on hearts, and not on marble

author: Bobby Bowden
title: A guy's who has all the money he needs and never faced any hard times, he won't have any character. But when you've had it tough and you've had it rough and you thought you were at the end of the rope and you work your way out of it, that's the way you build character.

author: Billy Eichner
title: A lot of comics aren't their on-screen personas; Chris Rock isn't always ranting and raving. What I do is make myself this over-the-top character that people either find endearing or they think is a joke. Then I can do anything I want.

author: Bjork
title: A lot of the time I get obsessed by little nerdy things in my corner that no one else is interested in. I have that nerd factor in my character.

author: Heraclitus
title: A man's character is his guardian divinity.

author: William Somerset Maugham
title: A man's height gives him a different outlook on his environment and so changes his character.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: A man's own manner and character is what most becomes him.

author: Charlie Chaplin
title: A man's true character comes out when he's drunk.,

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: A person reveals his character by nothing so clearly as the joke he resents.

author: Charles Dickens

author: Bill Goldberg
title: My character is just an extension of me. The in-ring work, the things that will always be said about me: Big, overbearing, powerful, in-your-face, couldn't wrestle - I never needed to wrestle. Why did I need to learn how to wrestle? Did Hulk Hogan need to learn how to wrestle? Nope. Is Hulk Hogan a good athlete? Nope.

author: Bill Goldberg
title: My experience with video games is a far cry from 'WWE 2K17.' Did I ever aspire to be that character? Man, I just wanted to be a hero to kids. Whether it's a character in a video game, a movie or a TV series, it's an accolade that I'm greatly appreciative of.

author: Beau Bridges
title: My favorite roles usually have to do with the story, if it's a good story I usually enjoy doing the character.

author: Beth Ditto
title: My size has helped make me an amazing performer too. The cliche of the Funny Fat Friend: I absolutely was that character - I am that character... It's a complicated bag of tools I acquired, and I've put them all to work onstage.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: National character is only another name for the particular form which the littleness, perversity and baseness of mankind take in every country. Every nation mocks at other nations, and all are right.

author: David Seabury
title: Nature is at work.. Character and destiny are her handiwork. She gives us love and hate, jealousy and reverence. All that is ours is the power to choose which impulse we shall follow.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Nature magically suits a man to his fortunes, by making them the fruit of his character.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.

author: Lyman Beecher
title: Never chase a lie. Let it alone, and it will run itself to death. I can work out a good character much faster than anyone can lie me out of it

author: Charlotte Saunders Cushman
title: No artist work is so high, so noble, so grand, so enduring, so important for all time, as the making of character is a child.

author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
title: No author ever drew a character consistent to human nature, but he was forced to ascribe to it many inconsistencies.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.

author: Benjamin Robbins Curtis
title: No government can be strong and flourishing while the national character is weak and degraded. A government must flourish and decay with its subjects; and, when a prince makes a law or performs an action which has a tendency to injure the character or prosperity of the nation, he injures himself.

author: John S. Bonnell
title: No man or woman has achieved an effective personality who is not self-disciplined. Such discipline must not be an end in itself, but must be directed to the development of resolute Christian character.

author: William James
title: No matter how full a reservoir of maxims one may possess, and no matter how good one's sentiments may be, if one has not taken advantage of every concrete opportunity to act, one's character may remain entirely unaffected for the better.

author: Brad Stone
title: No matter how hard we strive for objectivity, writers are biased toward tension - those moments in which character is forged and revealed.

author: Robert Wilson
title: No one is more interesting to anybody than is that mysterious character we all call me, which is why self-liberation, self-actualization, self-transcendence, etc., are the most exciting games in town.

author: Hitopadesa
title: No one should form an acquaintance with one who has an evil character. A piece of coal, if it is hot burns, and if it's cold, blackens the hands.

author: Tacitus
title: Noble character is best appreciated in those ages in which it can most readily develop.

author: Andrew Coyle Bradley
title: Nor does the idea of a moral order asserting itself against attack or want of conformity answer in full to our feelings regarding the tragic character.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Nothing shows a man's character more than what he laughs at.''

author: Robert E. Lee
title: Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.,

author: Henry Clay
title: Of all the properties which belong to honorable men, not one is so highly prized as that of character.

author: Cameron Diaz
title: Oftentimes, in fact I think this is to my fault, I look at usually scripts as a whole. I should probably pay more attention to the character that I'm going to play and what they do.

author: Marie Henri Beyle
title: One can acquire everything in solitude - except character.

author: Brock Lesnar
title: One match that really sticks out for me, there's a bunch of matches with all the guys that I worked with. For me, when I got in the ring, I approached it as being real because I was a real character. I didn't have a gimmick name; I didn't have a gimmick finish.

author: Brit Marling
title: One of the great pleasures of acting is surrendering to someone else's point of view of the world - living inside a character and a story that never would have come out of your mind or heart.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: One of the many reasons for the bewildering and tragic character of human existence is the fact that social organization is at once necessary and fatal. Men are forever creating such organizations for their own convenience and forever finding themselves the victims of their home-made monsters.

author: C. L. R. James
title: One of the surest signs of the estimated changes in the consciousness of the American proletariat is to be found in the character of the demands now being put forward by the leadership.

author: Ben Bass
title: One of the ways that you reveal character is by getting a character into a situation and seeing what they do.

author: Albert Einstein
title: One strength of the communist system of the East is that it has some of the character of a religion and inspires the emotions of a religion.

author: Alexander Chase
title: One who understands much displays a greater simplicity of character than one who understands little.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: Only a man's character is the real criterion of worth.,

author: Billy Graham
title: Only God Himself fully appreciates the influence of a Christian mother in the molding of character in her children.

author: Zig Ziglar
title: Only men of character are trusted.,

author: Caroll Spinney
title: Oscar is the exact opposite of how I think you should behave. I just think of it as a negative view of the positive mind I have. Big Bird is sweet and nice and also sympathetic, as kids can identify with him even though he looks like such a bizarre character - great 8 feet 2 inches, a beak 18 inches long.

author: Stephen R. Covey
title: Our character is basically a composite of our habits. Because they are consistent, often unconcious patterns, they constantly, daily, express our character…

author: H. Jackson Brown Jr
title: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.

author: Thomas Paine
title: Our citizenship in the United States is our national character. Our citizenship in any particular state is only our local distinction. By the latter we are known at home, by the former to the world. Our great title is AMERICANS - our inferior one varies with the place.

author: Anne Frank
title: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

author: Baruch Spinoza
title: Peace is not the absence of war, but a virtue based on strength of character.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.

author: Bobby Bowden
title: People that are brilliant and successful, we think they've just always been that way. That's not the case. Most of them have had some tough adversity in their life. It's prepared them. I've never felt like you could develop character without adversity.

author: Bertie Carvel
title: People's character is their behaviour - we're all capable of good and evil.

author: Napoleon Hill
title: Persistence is to the character of man as carbon is to steel.

author: Beyonce Knowles
title: Playing Etta James in the movie 'Cadillac Records' really changed me. It was a darker character, and I realized that if anything is too comfortable, I want to run from it. It's no fun being safe.

author: Bernard Crick
title: Politics is too often regarded as a poor relation, inherently dependent and subsidiary; it is rarely praised as something with a life and character of its own.

author: Antiphanes
title: Poverty is the schoolmaster of character.

author: W. H. Auden
title: Precisely because we do not communicate by singing, a song can be out of place but not out of character; it is just as credible that a stupid person should sing beautifully as that a clever person should do so.

author: Angela Y. Davis
title: Progressive art can assist people to learn not only about the objective forces at work in the society in which they live, but also about the intensely social character of their interior lives. Ultimately, it can propel people toward social emancipation.

author: Solon
title: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.

author: Ben Shapiro
title: Putin himself is a character out of fiction, an uber-macho former Soviet thug running a massive, expansionist kleptocracy. The man stages photographs riding horses barechested and hunting tigers. His enemies find themselves on the wrong end of radioactive poisoning.

author: Ann Beattie
title: Quite often my narrator or protagonist may be a man, but I'm not sure he's the more interesting character, or if the more complex character isn't the woman.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
title: Rascals are always sociable - more's the pity! and the chief sign that a man has any nobility in his character is the little pleasure he takes in others company.

author: Thomas Paine
title: Reputation is what men and women think of us; character is what God and angels know of us.

author: Theodore Parker
title: Self-denial is indispensable to a strong character, and the highest kind comes from a religious stock.

author: Bryan Greenberg
title: Seriously, my music really does help my acting, and, like, getting in and out of a character from a different lifestyle and writing a song about it. Likewise, my acting inspires the music because I can write a theme that I wouldn't necessarily approach at all in life.

author: Cardinal de Retz
title: She knew how to trust people... a rare quality, revealing a character far above average.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: She who makes her husband and her children happy, who reclaims the one from vice, and trains up the other to virtue, is a much greater character than the ladies described in romance, whose whole occupation is to murder mankind with shafts from their quiver or their eyes.

author: Fawn M. Brodie
title: Show me a character whose life arouses my curiosity, and my flesh begins crawling with suspense.

author: Sir Henry Taylor
title: Shy and proud men are more liable than any others to fall into the hands of parasites and creatures of low character. For in the intimacies which are formed by shy men, they do not choose, but are chosen.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
title: Simplicity in character, in manners, in style; in all things the supreme excellence is simplicity.

author: James Russell Lowell
title: Sincerity is impossible, unless it pervade the whole being, and the pretence of it saps the very foundation of character.

author: Maria Weston Chapman
title: Slavery can only be abolished by raising the character of the people who compose the nation; and that can be done only by showing them a higher one.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: So far as regards their moral character, the Finns have as little cause for reproach as any other people.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Society is a masked ball, where every one hides his real character, and reveals it by hiding.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Some men are born to own, and can animate all their possessions. Others cannot: their owning is not graceful; seems to be a compromise of their character: they seem to steal their own dividends.

author: Brooke Shields
title: Someone said adversity builds character, but someone else said adversity reveals character. I'm pleasantly surprised with my resilience. I persevere, and not just blindly. I take the best, get rid of the rest, and move on, realizing that you can make a choice to take the good.

author: Christian Nevell Bovee
title: Something of a person's character may be observed by how they smile. Some never smile they only grin.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: Sometimes apparent resemblance of character will bring two men together and for a certain time unite them. But their mistake gradually becomes evident, and they are astonished to find themselves not only far apart, but even repelled, in some sort, at all their points of contact.

author: Calista Flockhart
title: Sometimes when you play a character, you can feel it in your body. And I felt like I had characteristics of my dog: the way Webster moves, the way he holds his head. I kind of adapted it into this part unconsciously.

author: Bonnie Wright
title: Sometimes you need to put your own characteristics into the actor, and you take different things from the character that you admire - sometimes you can't see the boundaries anymore.

author: Og Mandino
title: Sound character provides the power with which a person may ride the emergencies of life instead of being overwhelmed by them. Failure is... the highway to success.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Sow a thought and you reap an action; sow an act and you reap a habit; sow a habit and you reap a character; sow a character and you reap a destiny.

author: John Wooden
title: Sports do not build character. They reveal it.

author: Billie Jean King
title: Sports teaches you character, it teaches you to play by the rules, it teaches you to know what it feels like to win and lose-it teaches you about life.

author: John F. Boyes
title: Strict punctuality is perhaps the cheapest virtue which can give force to an otherwise utterly insignificant character.

author: Jean Paul
title: Strong character is brought out by change, weak ones by permanence.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Study carefully, the character of the one you recommend, lest their misconduct bring you shame.

author: Edward Gibbon
title: Style is the image of character.

author: Howard Whitman
title: Success is no exclusive club. It is open to each individual who has the courage to choose his own goal and go after it. It is from this forward motion that human growth springs, and out of it comes the human essence known as character.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Successfully (whatever that may mean) or unsuccessfully, we all overact the part of our favorite character in fiction.

author: Tony Robbins
title: Surmounting difficulty is the crucible that forms character.,

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Surmounting difficulty is the crucible that forms character.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Talent develops in quiet places, character in the full current of human life.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
title: Talent develops in tranquillity, character in the full current of human life.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Talents are best nurtured in solitude. Character is best formed in the stormy billows of the world.

author: John Burroughs
title: Temperament lies behind mood; behind will, lies the fate of character. Then behind both, the influence of family the tyranny of culture; and finally the power of climate and environment; and we are free, only to the extent we rise above these.

author: Alexander Pope
title: That character in conversation which commonly passes for agreeable, is made up of civility and falsehood.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: That which we call character is a reserved force which acts directly by presence, and without means. It is conceived of as a certain undemonstrable force, a familiar or genius, by whose impulses the man is guided, but whose counsels he cannot impart.

author: Brandon Routh
title: That's definitely a part of who Superman is and definitely who Clark on the farm is. It translates to how calm he is. I feel like I'm pretty calm most of the time and relaxed, which gives presence to the character.

author: Anne Tyler
title: The Amateur Marriage grew out of the reflection that of all the opportunities to show differences in character, surely an unhappy marriage must be the richest.

author: Mary McCarthy
title: The American character looks always as if it had just had a rather bad haircut, which gives it, in our eyes at any rate, a greater humanity than the European, which even among its beggars has an all too professional air.

author: Archibald Macleish
title: The American mood, perhaps even the American character, has changed. There are few manifestations any longer of the old American self-assurance which so irritated Dickens. Instead, there is a sense of frustration so perceptible that even our politicians have attempted to exploit it.

author: Bayard Rustin
title: The barometer for judging the character of people, in regard human rights, is now those who consider themselves gay, homosexual, lesbian. The judgment as to whether you can trust the future, the social advancement - depending on people - will be judged on where they come out on that question.

author: Abigail Van Buren
title: The best index to a person's character is (a) how he treats people who can't do him any good, and (b) how he treats people who can't fight back.

author: Bill Alexander
title: The character and fight against fascism moved centre stage when, in 1936, Franco attempted to overthrow by force the Popular Front Government of Republican Spain.

author: Stephen R. Covey
title: The character ethic, which I believe to be the foundation of success, teaches that there are basic principles of effective living, and that people can only experience true success and enduring happiness as they learn and integrate these principles into their basic character.

author: Agatha Christie
title: The character of the victim has always something to do with his or her murder.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: The conspicuously wealthy turn up urging the character building values of the privation of the poor.

author: Bridgit Mendler
title: The cool thing about doing a voice-over into a different language is that you get to bring the character of your own culture into it.

author: Leon Trotsky
title: The depth and strength of a human character are defined by its moral reserves. People reveal themselves completely only when they are thrown out of the customary conditions of their life, for only then do they have to fall back on their reserves.

author: Walter Benjamin
title: The destructive character lives from the feeling, not that life is worth living, but that suicide is not worth the trouble.

author: Peter de Vries
title: The difficulty with marriage is that we fall in love with a personality, but must live with a character.

author: John Locke
title:
The discipline of desire is the background of character.,
,

author: Bo Bennett
title: The discipline you learn and character you build from setting and achieving a goal can be more valuable than the achievement of the goal itself.

author: John Ruskin
title: The distinctive character of a child is to always live in the tangible present.

author: Byron Howard
title: The era of 'The Jungle Book' was when the animators were at the top of their game and their sense of character was great.

author: Isabelle Eberhardt
title: The farther behind I leave the past, the closer I am to forging my own character.

author: Anne Frank
title: The final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.

author: Silas Weir Mitchell
title: The first thing to be done by a biographer in estimating character is to examine the stubs of his victim's check-books.

author: George Washington
title: The foolish and wicked practice of profane cursing and swearing is a vice so mean and low that every person of sense and character detests and despises it.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The formation of one's character ought to be everyone's chief aim.

author: Zig Ziglar
title: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.

author: Edward Vernon Rickenbacker
title: The four cornerstones of character on which the structure of this nation was built are: initiative, imagination, individuality, and independence.

author: Martin Luther King
title: The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically. Intelligence plus character - that is the goal of true education.

author: Richard Dawkins
title: The God of the Old Testament is arguably the most unpleasant character in all fiction: jealous and proud of it; a petty, unjust, unforgiving control-freak; a vindictive, bloodthirsty ethnic cleanser; a misogynistic, homophobic, racist, infanticidal, genocidal, filicidal, pestilential, megalomaniacal, sadomasochistic, capriciously malevolent bully.

author: Billy Graham
title: The greatest legacy one can pass on to one's children and grandchildren is not money or other material things accumulated in one's life, but rather a legacy of character and faith.

author: Thomas C. Haliburton
title: The happiness of every country depends upon the character of its people, rather than the form of its government.

author: Emma Goldman
title: The higher mental development of woman, the less possible it is for her to meet a congenial male who will see in her, not only sex, but also the human being, the friend, the comrade and strong individuality, who cannot and ought not lose a single trait of her character.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: The history of mankind is his character.

author: Alfred de Vigny
title: The human mind, I believe, cares for the True only in the general character of an epoch.

author: John Keats
title: The imagination of a boy is healthy, and the mature imagination of a man is healthy; but there is a space of life between, in which the soul is in a ferment, the character undecided, the way of life uncertain, the ambition thick-sighted: thence proceeds mawkishness.

author: Bradley Whitford
title: The issue for my character, and the issue of the show is, how dirty do your feet have to get without suffocating yourself in the mud in order to get an inch of what you really want done?

author: Douglas Adams
title: The last time anybody made a list of the top hundred character attributes of New Yorkers, common sense snuck in at number 79.

author: James Allen
title: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.

author: Edward Young
title: The man that makes a character, makes foes.

author: Roy L. Smith
title: The man who cannot believe in himself cannot believe in anything else. The basis of all integrity and character is whatever faith we have in our own integrity.

author: Thomas B. Macaulay
title: The measure of a man's real character is what he would do if he knew he would never be found out.

author: Brandon Sanderson
title: The more limitations you put on a character, often times the better a character you'll make them, the more interesting the story becomes because the character can't simply wave a hand and make something happen. They have to work within the framework.

author: Miguel de Cervantes
title: The most difficult character in comedy is that of the fool, and he must be no simpleton that plays that part.

author: Antonio Tabucchi
title: The most important basis of any novel is wanting to be someone else, and this means creating a character.

author: Stephen Vizinczey
title: The only virtue a character needs to possess between hardcovers, even if he bears a real person's name, is vitality: if he comes to life in our imaginations, he passes the test.

author: Nicolas Chamfort
title: The person of intellect is lost unless they unite with energy of character. When we have the lantern of Diogenese we must also have his staff.

author: George Santayana
title: The philosophy of the common man is an old wife that gives him no pleasure, yet he cannot live without her, and resents any aspersions that strangers may cast on her character.

author: Augustus Hare
title: The power of faith will often shine forth the most when the character is naturally weak.

author: George Eliot
title: The presence of a noble nature, generous in its wishes, ardent in its charity, changes the lights for us: we begin to see things again in their larger, quieter masses, and to believe that we too can be seen and judged in the wholeness of our character.

author: Dean Inge
title: The proper time to influence the character of a child is about a hundred years before he is born.

author: Joshua Reynolds
title: The real character of a man is found out by his amusements.

author: George Orwell
title: The real test of character is how you treat someone who has no possibility of doing you any good.

author: Alice Miller
title: The reason why parents mistreat their children has less to do with character and temperament than with the fact that they were mistreated themselves and were not permitted to defend themselves.

author: Abraham J. Heschel
title: The riches of the soul are stored up in its memory. this is the test of character, not whether a man follows the daily fashion, but whether the past is alive in his present.

author: Milan Kundera
title: The serial number of a human specimen is the face, that accidental and unrepeatable combination of features. It reflects neither character nor soul, nor what we call the self. The face is only the serial number of a specimen.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The State must follow, and not lead, the character and progress of the citizen.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: The test of Christian character should be that a man is a joy-bearing agent to the world.

author: Alfred Jarry
title: The theater, bringing impersonal masks to life, is only for those who are virile enough to create new life: either as a conflict of passions subtler than those we already know, or as a complete new character.

author: Ben Whishaw
title: The thing I love about acting is that you can bring something very personal into the open and at the same time remain hidden because you're always playing a character in a story that someone else has imagined. You're always protected.

author: Buddha
title: The thought manifests as the word; The word manifests as the deed; The deed develops into habit; And habit hardens into character; So watch the thought and its ways with care, And let it spring from love Born out of concern for all beingsÂ… As the shadow follows the body, As we think, so we become.

author: Ben Kingsley
title: The trick is to try and justify every word on the page and make sure my character is the man who would say that.

author: Voltaire
title: The true character of liberty is independence, maintained by force.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: The true index of a man's character is the health of his wife.

author: John Holt
title: The true test of character is not how much we know how to do, but how we behave when we don't know what to do.

author: Bernard Crick
title: The unique character of political activity lies, quite literally, in its publicity.

author: Ben Bass
title: The way I navigate scenes is through what I perceive to be the emotional truth of the character: what he wants from moment to moment.

author: Sir Walter Scott
title: The willow which bends to the tempest, often escapes better than the oak which resists it; and so in great calamities, it sometimes happens that light and frivolous spirits recover their elasticity and presence of mind sooner than those of a loftier character.

author: Carson McCullers
title: The writer by nature of his profession is a dreamer and a conscious dreamer. He must imagine, and imagination takes humility, love and great courage. How can you create a character without live and the struggle that goes with love?

author: Johann Kaspar Lavater
title: There are many kinds of smiles, each having a distinct character. Some announce goodness and sweetness, others betray sarcasm, bitterness and pride; some soften the countenance by their languishing tenderness, others brighten by their spiritual vivacity.

author: Casey Wilson
title: There are sometimes concerns about being respectful with a gay character, and you either end up with a tiptoeing quality or an all-out cliche.

author: Brad Meltzer
title: There is no better place to plot the death of a character than when you're miserable and working out.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: There is no greater index of character so sure as the voice.

author: Thornton T. Munger
title: There is no road to success but through a clear strong purpose. Nothing can take its place. A purpose underlies character, culture, position, attainment of every part.

author: David Lloyd George
title: There is nothing so fatal to character as half finished tasks.

author: Sir Walter Scott
title: There never will exist anything permanently noble and excellent in the character which is a stranger to resolute self-denial.

author: Bruce Lipton
title: There's a theory that says that life is based on a competition and the struggle and the fight for survival, and it's interesting because when you look at the fractal character of evolution, it's totally different. It's based on cooperation among the elements in the geometry and not competition.

author: Billy Dee Williams
title: There's always been a lot of misunderstanding about Lando's character. I used to pick up my daughter from elementary school and get into arguments with little children who would accuse me of betraying Han Solo.

author: Bryce Dallas Howard
title: There's something really freeing about playing a character that isn't even, like, remotely likeable whatsoever.

author: Cate Blanchett
title: Things present themselves to you, and it's how you choose to deal with them that reveals who you are. We all say a lot of things, don't we, about who we are and how we think. But in the end it's your actions, how you respond to circumstance that reveals your character.

author: Adam Sandler
title: This character feels so much like my brother. He has two children. He has a wife. He works with me. He chooses to stay in New Hampshire because he wants his kids to grow up in the school they started with. He doesn't want them to lose friends. He is his family's hero.

author: Daniel Webster
title: This is a Senate of equals, of men of individual honor and personal character, and of absolute independence. We know no masters, we acknowledge no dictators. This is a hall for mutual consultation and discussion; not an arena for the exhibition of champions.

author: Karl Kraus
title: This is something that I cannot get over - that a whole line could be written by half a man, that a work could be built on the quicksand of a character.

author: Horace
title: Those who cross the sea change only the climate, not their character.

author: Carey Mulligan
title: Those with dementia are still people and they still have stories and they still have character and they're all individuals and they're all unique. And they just need to be interacted with on a human level.

author: Quentin Crisp
title: Though intelligence is powerless to modify character, it is a dab hand at finding euphemisms for its weaknesses.

author: Tryon Edwards
title: Thoughts lead on to purposes; purposes go forth in action; actions form habits; habits decide character; and character fixes our destiny.

author: Mark Twain
title: To arrive at a just estimate of a renowned man's character one must judge it by the standards of his time, not ours.

author: Caroline Lawrence
title: To create a character who really interests you, try combining aspects of your favourite fictional character with a real person.

author: Mary Caroline Richards
title: To have character is to be big enough to take life on.

author: Brent Sexton
title: To me, any character that is conflicted inside as well as outside of themselves is always a better role to play.

author: Willa Cather
title: To note an artist's limitations is but to define his talent. A reporter can write equally well about everything that is presented to his view, but a creative writer can do his best only with what lies within the range and character of his deepest sympathies.

author: Oscar Wilde
title: To speak frankly, I am not in favour of long engagements. They give people the opportunity of finding out each other's character before marriage, which I think is never advisable.

author: Emma Goldman
title: To the indefinite, uncertain mind of the American radical the most contradictory ideas and methods are possible. The result is a sad chaos in the radical movement, a sort of intellectual hash, which has neither taste nor character.

author: Oscar Levant
title: Underneath this flabby exterior is an enormous lack of character.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Unpretending mediocrity is good, and genius is glorious; but a weak flavor of genius in an essentially common person is detestable. It spoils the grand neutrality of a commonplace character, as the rinsings of an unwashed wine-glass spoil a draught of fair water.

author: Carrie P. Meek
title: Until we all start to take responsibility, until we do all we can to improve the character of our communities, we'll never break the cycle of violence and indifference.

author: George Bernard Shaw
title: Vivisection is a social evil because if it advances human knowledge, it does so at the expense of human character.

author: Burgess Owens
title: W. E. B Dubois used the NAACP platform for two decades to discredit the character, reputation, and fund-raising efforts of capitalist and Tuskegee University founder, Booker T. Washington.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: We are armed with language adequate to describe each leaf of the filed, but not to describe human character.

author: John Locke
title: We are like chameleons, we take our hue and the color of our moral character, from those who are around us.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: We falsely attribute to men a determined character - putting together all their yesterdays - and averaging them - we presume we know them. Pity the man who has character to support - it is worse than a large family - he is the silent poor indeed.

author: Jean Paul
title: We learn our virtues from our friends who love us; our faults from the enemy who hates us. We cannot easily discover our real character from a friend. He is a mirror, on which the warmth of our breath impedes the clearness of the reflection.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: We should come home from adventures, and perils, and discoveries every day with new experience and character.

author: Burgess Owens
title: We're dealing with whether we're going to accept the idea of socialism and Marxism and atheism. Or go back to the American way, Judeo-Christian values, which meritocracy is part of it. The idea that content and character and talent are colorblind.

author: Albert Einstein
title: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character .

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Weakness of character is the only defect which cannot be amended.

author: Bubba Smith
title: Well, everybody knew their character. I was the only one who didn't have a partner. I basically showed up when people got in trouble. Where I came from, I don't know. Nobody knows. But I would show up to help.

author: Augustus Hare
title: What a person praises is perhaps a surer standard, even than what he condemns, of his own character, information and abilities.

author: Anne Rice
title: What I did was take the Jesus of the Gospels, the Son of God, the Son of the Virgin Mary, and sought to make Him utterly believable, a vital breathing character.

author: Henry James
title: What is character but the determination of incident? What is incident but the illustration of character?

author: Barry Humphries
title: What is extraordinary about the character of Edna - and I speak as though I am completely outside this character and I am talking to you - I'm, as it were, in the wings, and she's on stage, and every now and then she says something extremely funny, and I stand there and think: 'I wish I'd thought of that.'

author: Aristotle
title: What the statesman is most anxious to produce is a certain moral character in his fellow citizens, namely a disposition to virtue and the performance of virtuous actions.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: What we need in appointive positions are men of knowledge and experience with sufficient character to resist temptations.

author: Alfred Hitchcock
title: When an actor comes to me and wants to discuss his character, I say, 'It's in the script.' If he says, 'But what's my motivation?, ' I say, 'Your salary.'

author: Bill Skarsgard
title: When I read a script and have my first interaction with this character, do I feel like there's something I'm gonna' learn here? If I feel like it's something I've done before, then what's the incentive for me to do it?

author: Ang Lee
title: When there is a strong woman character in a story - that always grabs me.

author: Confucius
title: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.

author: Billy Graham
title: When wealth is lost, nothing is lost; when health is lost, something is lost; when character is lost, all is lost.

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: When writing a novel a writer should create living people; people not characters. A character is a caricature.

author: Balthazar Getty
title: When you go in and do a cool, small character, it feels less like work and more like fun.

author: Bailee Madison
title: When you have a movie, you know who they start out as and where they go. But this is constantly changing, and you're growing with the character.

author: Bel Powley
title: When you're portraying someone that really existed, there has to be a time as an actress where you leave reality and move into the fantasy world so you can do your job of creating a character.

author: Candice Patton
title: When you're shooting a TV show, there's not a lot of time to build character.

author: Luigi Pirandello
title: Whoever has the luck to be born a character can laugh even at death. Because a character will never die! A man will die, a writer, the instrument of creation: but what he has created will never die!

author: Buffalo Bill
title: Wild Bill was a strange character. In person he was about six feet and one inch in height. He was a Plains-man in every sense of the word.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Wit makes its own welcome, and levels all distinctions. No dignity, no learning, no force of character, can make any stand against good wit.

author: Clarence Darrow
title: With all their faults, trade unions have done more for humanity than any other organization of men that ever existed. They have done more for decency, for honesty, for education, for the betterment of the race, for the developing of character in man, than any other association of men.

author: Susan Sontag
title: With the modern diseases (once TB, now cancer) the romantic idea that the disease expresses the character is invariably extended to assert that the character causes the disease - because it has not expressed itself. Passion moves inward, striking and blighting the deepest cellular recesses.

author: Norman Douglas
title: You can construct the character of a man and his age not only from what he does and says, but from what he fails to say and do.

author: Ronald Reagan
title: You can tell a lot about a fellow's character by his way of eating jelly beans.

author: Seneca
title: You can tell the character of every man when you see how he receives praise.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: You cannot build character and courage by taking away a man's initiative and independence.

author: James Froude
title: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself one.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: You gave him an opportunity of showing greatness of character and he did not seize it. He will never forgive you for that.

author: Bubba Smith
title: You know, he would go and look at different funny books because he wanted his character to be different and make different faces. I saw a funny book in his room and it looked like the same character he was playing. It was about a duck.

author: Lord Chesterfield
title: You must never seem to affect the character in which you have a mind to shine. Modesty is the only sure bait when you angle for praise.

author: Vauvenargues
title: You must rouse into people's consciousness their own prudence and strength, if you want to raise their character.

author: Richard Nixon
title: You've got to learn to survive a defeat. That's when you develop character.,

author: Sir John Lubbock
title: Your character will be what you yourself choose to make it.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
title: A man's character is the reality of himself; his reputation, the opinion others have formed about him; character resides in him, reputation in other people; that is the substance, this is the shadow.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: A pun does not commonly justify a blow in return. But if a blow were given for such cause, and death ensued, the jury would be judges both of the facts and of the pun, and might, if the latter were of an aggravated character, return a verdict of justifiable homicide.

author: David Hume
title: Character is the result of a system of stereotyped principals.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: Character is the result of two things: Mental attitude and the way we spend our time.

author: Dwight L. Moody
title: If I take care of my character, my reputation will take care of me.

author: author
title: title

author: Confucius
title: To be fond of learning is near to wisdom; to practice with vigor is near to benevolence; and to be conscious of shame is near to fortitude. He who knows these three things

author: Aristophanes
title: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.

author: Greg Anderson
title: Let us be about setting high standards for life, love, creativity, and wisdom. If our expectations in these areas are low, we are not likely to experience wellness. Setting high standards makes every day and every decade worth looking forward to.

author: Cato the Elder
title: Tis sometimes the height of wisdom to feign stupidity.

author: Josh Billings
title: Experience increases our wisdom but doesn't reduce our follies.

author: Francis Bacon
title: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.

author: James Allen
title: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.

author: Aeschylus
title: And even in our sleep pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart, and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom to us by the awful grace of God.

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.

author: William Faulkner
title: The end of wisdom is to dream high enough to lose the dream in the seeking of it.

author: Aeschylus
title: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.

author: William Arthur Ward
title: Committing a great truth to memory is admirable; committing it to life is wisdom.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: Action should culminate in wisdom.

author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
title: To know how to grow old is the master work of wisdom, and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.

author: Robert Frost
title: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.

author: Anatole France
title: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.

author: Calvin Coolidge
title: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of face within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.

author: Woody Allen
title: More than any time in history mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness, the other to total extinction. Let us pray that we have the wisdom to choose correctly.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: To be a philosopher is not merely to have subtle thoughts, nor even to found a school, but so to love wisdom as to live according to its dictates a life of simplicity, independence, magnanimity, and trust. It is to solve some of the problems of life, not only theoretically, but practically.

author: John Henry Newman
title: A great memory is never made synonymous with wisdom, any more than a dictionary would be called a treatise.

author: Ralph Waldo Trine
title: A miracle is nothing more or less than this. Anyone who has come into a knowledge of his true identity, of his oneness with the all-pervading wisdom and power, this makes it possible for laws higher than the ordinary mind knows of to be revealed to him.

author: J. Russel
title: A proverb is one man's wit and all men's wisdom.

author: Joseph Roux
title: Experience comprises illusions lost, rather than wisdom gained.

author: Anatole France
title: I prefer the errors of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.

author: Ansel Adams
title: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.

author: Josh Billings
title: Incredulity is the wisdom of the fool.

author: Frank Zappa
title: Information is not knowledge. Knowledge is not wisdom. Wisdom is not truth. Truth is not beauty. Beauty is not love. Love is not music. Music is the best.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: It is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.

author: Walter Lippmann
title: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.

author: Lao-Tzu
title: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.

author: Edmund Burke
title: Magnanimity in politics is not seldom the truest wisdom; and a great empire and little minds go ill together.

author: Plutarch
title: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.

author: Solomon Ibn Gabirol
title: The beginning of wisdom is to desire it.

author: Walter Bagehot
title: A cold, and cynical wisdom particularly disapproves of most men's best actions.

author: Mark Twain
title: A man never reaches that dizzy height of wisdom that he can no longer be lead by the nose.

author: Sophocles
title: A short saying often contains much wisdom.

author: Publilius Syrus
title: All delay is helpful, but it does produce wisdom.

author: James A. Garfield
title: All free governments are managed by the combined wisdom and folly of the people.

author: Lord George Byron
title: And having wisdom with each studious year, in meditation dwelt, with learning wrought, and shaped his weapon with an edge severe, sapping a solemn creed with solemn sneer.

author: Joseph Addison
title: Animals, in their generation, are wiser than the sons of men; but their wisdom is confined to a few particulars, and lies in a very narrow compass.

author: Dave Barry
title: Another possible source of guidance for teenagers is television, but television's message has always been that the need for truth, wisdom and world peace pales by comparison with the need for a toothpaste that offers whiter teeth *and* fresher breath.

author: Bennie Thompson
title: Any successful nominee should possess both the temperament to interpret the law and the wisdom to do so fairly. The next Supreme Court Justice should have a record of protecting individual rights and a strong willingness to put aside any political agenda.

author: William R. Alger
title: Apothegms are portable wisdom, the quintessential extracts of thought and feelings.

author: Bernhard Schlink
title: As a citizen and someone who was a judge on the constitutional law court for 18 years, I feel whenever I can raise my voice with the hope of being heard I need to do it, but I wouldn't assign a special wisdom and responsibility to writers.

author: Anne Bradstreet
title: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy ax without an edge, fitter to bruise than to polish.

author: Carl Sandburg
title: Back of every mistaken venture and defeat is the laughter of wisdom, if you listen.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Beauty is the index of a larger fact than wisdom.

author: Count Axel Gustafsson Oxenstierna
title: Behold, my son, with what little wisdom the world is ruled.

author: Bernie Siegel
title: Being a survivor doesn't mean being strong - it's telling people when you need a meal or a ride, company, whatever. It's paying attention to heart wisdom, feelings, not living a role, but having a unique, authentic life, having something to contribute, finding time to love and laugh. All these things are qualities of survivors.

author: Jeremy Collier
title: Books are but waste paper unless we spend in action the wisdom we get from thought - asleep. When we are weary of the living, we may repair to the dead, who have nothing of peevishness, pride, or design in their conversation.

author: Elizabeth Hardwick
title: Books give not wisdom where none was before. But where some is, there reading makes it more.

author: Sir John Denham
title: Books should to one of these fours ends conduce, for wisdom, piety, delight, or use.

author: Carl Sagan
title: Books tap the wisdom of our species - the greatest minds, the best teachers - from all over the world and from all our history. And they're patient.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.

author: Confucius
title: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: By Wisdom wealth is won; But riches purchased wisdom yet for none.

author: Paul Klee
title: Children also have artistic ability, and there is wisdom in there having it! The more helpless they are, the more instructive are the examples they furnish us; and they must be preserved free of corruption from an early age.

author: Euripides
title: Cleverness is not wisdom.

author: Archibald Macleish
title: Conventional wisdom notwithstanding, there is no reason either in football or in poetry why the two should not meet in a man's life if he has the weight and cares about the words.

author: Walter Benjamin
title: Counsel woven into the fabric of real life is wisdom.

author: Anthony Robbins
title: Create a vision and never let the environment, other people's beliefs, or the limits of what has been done in the past shape your decisions. Ignore conventional wisdom.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.,

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?

author: Bob Marley
title: Don't gain the world and lose your soul; wisdom is better than silver or gold.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Doubt is the vestibule through which all must pass before they can enter into the temple of wisdom.

author: Jean Giraudoux
title: Education makes us more stupid than the brutes. A thousand voices call to us on every hand, but our ears are stopped with wisdom.

author: Robert Orben
title: Every speaker has a mouth; An arrangement rather neat. Sometimes it's filled with wisdom. Sometimes it's filled with feet.

author: Aristotle
title: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.

author: Karl Kraus
title: Experiences are savings which a miser puts aside. Wisdom is an inheritance which a wastrel cannot exhaust.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Facts are ventriloquists dummies. Sitting on a wise man's knee they may be made to utter words of wisdom; elsewhere, they say nothing, or talk nonsense, or indulge in sheer diabolism.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: Few persons have sufficient wisdom to prefer censure, which is useful, to praise which deceives them.

author: Aristotle
title: First, have a definite, clear practical ideal; a goal, an objective. Second, have the necessary means to achieve your ends; wisdom, money, materials, and methods. Third, adjust all your means to that end.

author: Oprah Winfrey
title: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: For eighteen hundred years, though perchance I have no right to say it, the New Testament has been written; yet where is the legislator who has wisdom and practical talent enough to avail himself of the light which it sheds on the science of legislation?

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: Full of wisdom are the ordinations of fate.

author: Reinhold Niebuhr
title: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.

author: William Saroyan
title: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.

author: Philo
title: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.

author: Francis Quarles
title: Has fortune dealt you some bad cards. Then let wisdom make you a good gamester.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: He swallowed a lot of wisdom, but all of it seems to have gone down the wrong way.

author: Francis Bacon
title: He that will not apply new remedies, must expect new evils: for Time is the greatest innovator: and if Time, of course, alter things to the worse, and wisdom and counsel shall not alter them to the better, what shall be the end?.

author: Epictetus
title: He who exercises wisdom exercises the knowledge which is about God.

author: William Penn
title: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: Honesty is the first chapter of the book of wisdom.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: How earthy old people become, moldy as the grave! Their wisdom smacks of the earth. There is no foretaste of immortality in it. They remind me of earthworms and mole crickets.

author: Karl Wilhelm Von Humboldt
title: However great an evil immorality may be, we must not forget that it is not without its beneficial consequences. It is only through extremes that men can arrive at the middle path of wisdom and virtue.

author: Alex Grey
title: I acknowledge the privilege of being alive in a human body at this moment, endowed with senses, memories, emotions, thoughts, and the space of mind in its wisdom aspect.

author: Buddha
title: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.

author: John Barrymore
title: I am thinking of taking a fifth wife. Why not? Solomon had a thousand wives and he is a synonym for wisdom.

author: Umberto Eco
title: I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren't trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom.

author: Arthur Cohn
title: I chose Sony Classics, not just because of their practical experience, not just because of their wisdom in marketing, but mainly because of their integrity.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: I do not believe in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: I have been driven many times to my knees by the overwhelming conviction that I had nowhere to go. My own wisdom, and that of all about me, seemed insufficient for the day.

author: Igor Stravinsky
title: I have learned throughout my life as a composer chiefly through my mistakes and pursuits of false assumptions, not by my exposure to founts of wisdom and knowledge.

author: Thomas Jefferson
title: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.

author: Pietro Aretino
title: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure, because, of all the things granted us by wisdom, none is greater or better than friendship.

author: John Keats
title: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom - one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.

author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
title: If a person tells me he has been to the worst places I have no reason to judge him; but if he tells me it was his superior wisdom that enabled him to go there, then I know he is a fraud.

author: Lord George Byron
title: If I am fool, it is, at least, a doubting one; and I envy no one the certainty of his self-approved wisdom.

author: Leo Buscaglia
title: If I don't have wisdom, I can teach you only ignorance.

author: William Butler Yeats
title: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.,

author: Carl Sagan
title: If we continue to accumulate only power and not wisdom, we will surely destroy ourselves.

author: Bill Bradley
title: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'

author: Euripides
title: In goodness there are all kinds of wisdom.

author: Ben Carson
title: In my own personal life, God plays a great role in the risk, because I pray before I go into the operating room for every case, and I ask him to give me wisdom, to help me to know what to do - and not only for operating, but for everything.

author: Bruce Bueno de Mesquita
title: In order to predict effectively, we need to use science. And the reason that we need to use science is because then we can reproduce what we're doing; it's not just wisdom or guesswork. And if we can predict, then we can engineer the future.

author: Rabbi Ben Azai
title: In seeking wisdom thou art wise; in imagining that thou hast attained it, thou art a fool.

author: Thomas Carlyle
title: In the long-run every Government is the exact symbol of its People, with their wisdom and unwisdom; we have to say, Like People like Government.

author: George Eliot
title: In the vain laughter of folly wisdom hears half its applause.

author: William Blake
title: Innocence dwells with Wisdom, but never with Ignorance.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: It is almost everywhere the case that soon after it is begotten the greater part of human wisdom is laid to rest in repositories.

author: Margaret Fuller
title: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.

author: W. R. Inge
title: It is astonishing with how little wisdom mankind can be governed, when that little wisdom is its own.

author: Mark Twain
title: It is by the fortune of God that, in this country, we have three benefits: freedom of speech, freedom of thought, and the wisdom never to use either.

author: Henry David Thoreau
title: It is characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things.

author: Roger Ascham
title: It is costly wisdom that is bought by experience.

author: Roger Ascham
title: It is costly wisdom that is bought by experience.

author: St. John of the Cross
title: It is great wisdom to know how to be silent and to look at neither the remarks, nor the deeds, nor the lives of others.

author: William B. Yeats
title: It is most important that we should keep in this country a certain leisured class. I am of the opinion of the ancient Jewish book which says ''there is no wisdom without leisure.''

author: Thomas à Kempis
title: It is no little wisdom for a man to keep himself in silence and in good peace when evil words are spoken to him, and to turn his heart to God and not to be troubled with man's judgment.

author: Maurice Maeterlinck
title: It is not from reason that justice springs, but goodness is born of wisdom.

author: Thomas Hobbes
title: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.,

author: Adam Schiff
title: It is now conventional wisdom that Americans do not care why we went to war in Iraq, that it is enough that the world is better off without Saddam Hussein.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.

author: Aristotle
title: It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
