title: It is wisdom in prosperity, when all is as thou wouldn't have it, to fear and suspect the worst.

author: Roger L'Estrange
title: It may serve as a comfort to us, in all our calamities and afflictions, that he that loses anything and gets wisdom by it is a gainer by the loss.

author: Sigmund Freud
title: Just as a cautious businessman avoids investing all his capital in one concern, so wisdom would probably admonish us also not to anticipate all our happiness from one quarter alone.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: Just as a fire is covered by smoke and a mirror is obscured by dust, just as the embryo rests deep within the womb, wisdom is hidden by selfish desire.

author: Buddha
title: Just as treasures are uncovered from the earth, so virtue appears from good deeds, and wisdom appears from a pure and peaceful mind. To walk safely through the maze of human life, one needs the light of wisdom and the guidance of virtue.

author: Benjamin Cardozo
title: Justice is not to be taken by storm. She is to be wooed by slow advances. Substitute statute for decision, and you shift the center of authority, but add no quota of inspired wisdom.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh, and the greatness which does not bow before children.

author: Theodore I. Rubin
title: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.

author: Philip James Bailey
title: Kindness is wisdom.

author: James Redfield
title: Knowing our personal mission further enhances the flow of mysterious coincidences as we are guided toward our destinies. First we have a question, then dreams, daydreams, and intuitions lead us toward the answers, which usually are synchronistically provided by the wisdom of another human being.

author: Terry Pratchett
title: Knowing that you are going to die is, I suspect, the beginning of wisdom.,

author: Hermann Hesse
title: Knowledge can be communicated, but wisdom cannot. A man can find it, he can live it, he can be filled and sustained by it, but he cannot utter or teach it.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
title: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.

author: Martin Luther King
title: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Knowledge is an affair of symbols and is, all too often, a hindrance to wisdom, the uncovering of the self from moment to moment.

author: William Cowper
title: Knowledge is proud that he has learn'd so much; wisdom is humble that he knows no more.

author: William Cowper
title: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; Wisdom is humble that it knows no more.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: Knowledge shrinks as wisdom grows.

author: Jimi Hendrix
title: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Knowledge which is divorced from justice, may be called cunning rather than wisdom.

author: William Cowper
title: Knowledge, a rude unprofitable mass, the mere materials with which wisdom builds, till smoothed and squared and fitted to its place, does but encumber whom it seems to enrich. Knowledge is proud that he has learned so much; wisdom is humble that he knows no more.

author: Laurence Sterne
title: Lessons of wisdom have the most power over us when they capture the heart through the groundwork of a story, which engages the passions.

author: Queen Elizabeth II
title: Let us not take ourselves too seriously. None of us has a monopoly on wisdom.

author: Thornton T. Munger
title: Life is given for wisdom, and yet we are not wise; for goodness, and we are not good; for overcoming evil, and evil remains; for patience and sympathy and love, and yet we are fretful and hard and weak and selfish. We are keyed not to attainment, but to the struggle toward it.

author: Peter Conrad
title: Losing faith in your own singularity is the start of wisdom, I suppose; also the first announcement of death.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.

author: Umberto Eco
title: Love is wiser than wisdom.

author: Arianna Huffington
title: Mainstream media tend to just mouth the conventional wisdom, to see everything through the filter of right and left.

author: Bob Woodward
title: Many people have their reputations as reporters and analysts because they are on television, batting around conventional wisdom. A lot of these people have never reported a story.

author: Bell Hooks
title: Many spiritual teachers - in Buddhism, in Islam - have talked about first-hand experience of the world as an important part of the path to wisdom, to enlightenment.

author: John Morley
title: Maxims and aphorisms, let us remember that wisdom is the true salt of literature, and the books that are most nourishing are richly stored with it, and that is the main object to seek in reading books.

author: Buddha
title: Meditation brings wisdom; lack of mediation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what hold you back, and choose the path that leads to wisdom.

author: Martin Farquhar Tupper
title: Memory is not wisdom; idiots can by rote repeat volumes. Yet what is wisdom without memory?

author: Aeschylus
title: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.

author: Gilbert K. Chesterton
title: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers. In the perfect stranger we perceive man himself; the image of a God is not disguised by resemblances to an uncle or doubts of wisdom of a mustache.

author: Havelock Ellis
title: Men who know themselves are no longer fools. They stand on the threshold of the door of Wisdom.

author: Horace
title: Mingle some brief folly with your wisdom.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.

author: Graham Greene
title: Morality comes with the sad wisdom of age, when the sense of curiosity has withered.

author: George Eliot
title: More helpful than all wisdom is one draught of simple human pity that will not forsake us.

author: Woody Allen
title: More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: More wisdom is latent in things as they are than in all the words men use.

author: Tryon Edwards
title: Most of our censure of others is only oblique praise of self, uttered to show the wisdom and superiority of the speaker. It has all the invidiousness of self-praise, and all the ill-desert of falsehood.

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.

author: Charles Simmons
title: Much of the wisdom of one age, is the folly of the next.

author: Charlie Parker
title: Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn.

author: Juvenal
title: Nature never says one thing and wisdom another.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
title: Nine-tenths of wisdom consists in being wise in time.

author: George Meredith
title: Not till the fire is dying in the grate, Look we for any kinship with the stars. Oh, wisdom never comes when it is gold, And the great price we paid for it full worth: We have it only when we are half earth. Little avails that coinage to the old!

author: George Santayana
title: Nothing can be meaner than the anxiety to live on, to live on anyhow and in any shape; a spirit with any honor is not willing to live except in its own way, and a spirit with any wisdom is not over-eager to live at all.

author: John Updike
title: Now that I am sixty, I see why the idea of elder wisdom has passed from currency.

author: Epicurus
title: Of all things which wisdom provides to make life entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.

author: Franz Grillparzer
title: Oh that wisdom was half as zealous for converts as ridicule.

author: Buddha
title: On life's journey faith is nourishment, virtuous deeds are a shelter, wisdom is the light by day and right mindfulness is the protection by night. If a man lives a pure life, nothing can destroy him.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: One of the greatest pieces of economic wisdom is to know what you do not know.

author: L'Chiam
title: Our great men have written words of wisdom to be used when hardship must be faced. Life obliges us with hardship so the words of wisdom shouldn't go to waste.

author: Sophocles
title: Our happiness depends on wisdom all the way.

author: Henry Miller
title: Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack. We give it orders which make no sense.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: Out of compassion I destroy the darkness of their ignorance. From within them I light the lamp of wisdom and dispel all darkness from their lives.

author: John Patrick
title: Pain makes man think. Thought makes man wise. Wisdom makes life endurable.

author: Anna Quindlen
title: People always blame the girl; she should have said no. A monosyllable, but conventional wisdom has always been that boys can't manage it.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
title: Perhaps in His wisdom the Almighty is trying to show us that a leader may chart the way, may point out the road to lasting peace, but that many leaders and many peoples must do the building.

author: Mark Twain
title: Pessimism is only the name that men of weak nerve give to wisdom.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: Practical wisdom is only to be learned in the school of experience. Precepts and instruction are useful so far as they go, but, without the discipline of real life, they remain of the nature of theory only.

author: Barry Schwartz
title: Practical wisdom is what's called for in situations that have a moral dimension to them.

author: Karl Wilhelm Von Humboldt
title: Providence certainly does not favor just certain individuals, but the deep wisdom of its counsel, instruction and ennoblement extends to all.

author: Bill Cosby
title: Raising children is an incredibly hard and risky business in which no cumulative wisdom is gained: each generation repeats the mistakes the previous one made.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Raphael paints wisdom; Handel sings it, Phidias carves it, Shakespeare writes it, Wren builds it, Columbus sails it, Luther preaches it, Washington arms it, Watt mechanizes it.

author: Solon
title: Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.

author: Marcus Tullius Cicero
title: Rightly defined philosophy is simply the love of wisdom.

author: Will Durant
title: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom. ,

author: Aleister Crowley
title: Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.

author: Immanuel Kant
title: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.

author: Beau Bridges
title: Second, this epic tale allows the audience to actually listen to the Native Americans and receive their wisdom. Spielberg conveys the respect for Native Americans that is normally lacking in Western films.

author: Aldous Huxley
title: Silence is as full of potential wisdom and wit as the unshown marble of great sculpture.

author: Francis Bacon
title: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.

author: Euripides
title: Some wisdom you must learn from one who's wise.

author: Elizabeth Gaskell
title: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: Subtract from the great man all that he owes to opportunity, all that he owes to chance, and all that he gained by the wisdom of his friends and the folly of his enemies, and the giant will often be seen to be a pygmy.

author: Sam Walton
title:
Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.,
,

author: Sir Walter Scott
title: Teach you children poetry; it opens the mind, lends grace to wisdom and makes the heroic virtues hereditary.

author: John Stuart Mill
title: That which seems the height of absurdity in one generation often becomes the height of wisdom in the next.

author: Bertolt Brecht
title: The aim of science is not to open the door to infinite wisdom, but to set some limit on infinite error.

author: Walter Benjamin
title: The art of storytelling is reaching its end because the epic side of truth, wisdom, is dying out.

author: Albert Einstein
title: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.

author: Socrates
title: The beginning of wisdom is a definition of terms.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: The doors of wisdom are never shut.

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is the knowledge of our own ignorance.

author: John Kenneth Galbraith
title: The enemy of the conventional wisdom is not ideas but the march of events.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: The experience gathered from books, though often valuable, is but the nature of learning; whereas the experience gained from actual life is one of the nature of wisdom.

author: Jean Cocteau
title: The extreme limit of wisdom -that's what the public calls madness.

author: Hilaire Belloc
title: The future always comes as a surprise, but political wisdom consists in attempting at least some partial judgment of what that surprise may be. And for my part I cannot but believe that a main unexpected thing of the future is the return of Islam.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
title: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove one's self a fool; the truest heroism is to resist the doubt; and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.

author: Louise Erdrich
title: The greatest wisdom doesn't know itself. The richest plan is not to have one.

author: Konstantin Stanislavisky
title: The greatest wisdom is to realize one's lack of it

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: The growth of wisdom may be gauged exactly by the diminution of ill temper.

author: William Blake
title: The hours of folly are measured by the clock, but of wisdom no clock can measure.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: The live in wisdom who see themselves in all and all in them, who have renounced every selfish desire and sense craving tormenting the heart.

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: The mintage of wisdom is to know that rest is rust, and that real life is love, laughter, and work.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: The most foolish kind of a book is a kind of leaky boat on the sea of wisdom; some of the wisdom will get in anyhow.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: The most manifest sign of wisdom is a continual cheerfulness; her state is like that in the regions above the moon, always clear and serene.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.

author: Eugene O'Neill
title: The old, like children, talk to themselves, for they have reached that hopeless wisdom of experience which knows that though one were to cry it in the streets to multitudes, or whisper it in the kiss to one's beloved, the only ears that can ever hear one's secrets are one's own!

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: The older I get the more wisdom I find in the ancient rule of taking first things first. A process which often reduces the most complex human problem to a manageable proportion.

author: Henry Louis Mencken
title: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.

author: Leo Tolstoy
title: The only thing that we know is that we know nothing and that is the highest flight of human wisdom.

author: Socrates
title: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

author: Bayard Taylor
title: The Prophet's words were true; The mouth of Ali is the golden door Of Wisdom. When his friends to Ali bore These words, he smiled and said: And should they ask The same until my dying day, the task Were easy; for the stream from Wisdom's well, Which God supplies, is inexhaustible.

author: William Blake
title: The road to excess leads to the palace of wisdom.

author: Piet Hein
title: The road to wisdom? Well, it's plain and simple to express: Errand err again but less and less and less.

author: Benjamin Graham
title: The story of Joseph in Egypt and of the seven fat and the seven lean years has passed into the homely wisdom of the ages; but our economic thinking seems to have lost contact with so simple and basic approach to prudent management of a nations welfare.

author: Milan Kundera
title: The stupidity of people comes from having an answer for everything. The wisdom of the novel comes from having a question for everything.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.,

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: The teacher gives not of his wisdom, but rather of his faith and lovingness.

author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox
title: The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.

author: Hal Borland
title: The ultimate wisdom which deals with beginnings, remains locked in a seed. There it lies, the simplest fact of the universe and at the same time the one which calls faith rather than reason.

author: Aristotle
title: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.

author: John Locke
title: The visible mark of extraordinary wisdom and power appear so plainly in all the works of creation.

author: Andrew Jackson
title: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.

author: Eric Hoffer
title: The wisdom of others remains dull till it is writ over with our own blood. We are essentially apart from the world; it bursts into our consciousness only when it sinks its teeth and nails into us.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: The wisdom of the wise and the experience of the ages are perpetuated by quotations.

author: D'Israeli Isaac
title: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: The world is full of fools and faint hearts; and yet everyone has courage enough to bear the misfortunes, and wisdom enough to manage the affairs of his neighbor.

author: Plato
title: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.

author: Confucius
title: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.

author: Francis Bacon
title: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: There is a time when a man distinguishes the idea of felicity from the idea of wealth; it is the beginning of wisdom.

author: Charles Dickens
title: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.

author: Francis Bacon
title: There is no great concurrence between learning and wisdom.

author: Brigham Young
title: There is no knowledge, no light, no wisdom that you are in possession of, but what you have received it from some source.

author: Cyril Connolly
title: There is no pain equal to that which two lovers can inflict on one another. This should be made clear to all who contemplate such a union. The avoidance of this pain is the beginning of wisdom, for it is strong enough to contaminate the rest of our lives.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: There is no wisdom in useless and hopeless sorrow, but there is something in it so like virtue, that he who is wholly without it cannot be loved.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
title: There is no wisdom like frankness.

author: Martin Luther
title: There is no wisdom save in truth. Truth is everlasting, but our ideas about truth are changeable. Only a little of the first fruits of wisdom, only a few fragments of the boundless heights, breadths and depths of truth, have I been able to gather.

author: Charles Caleb Colton
title: There is this difference between happiness and wisdom, that he that thinks himself the happiest man, really is so; but he who thinks himself the wisest, is generally the greatest fool.

author: Confucius
title: They must change who would be constant in happiness and wisdom.

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: They would need to be already wise, in order to love wisdom.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: This is the highest wisdom that I own; freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.

author: Desiderius Erasmus
title: This type of man who is devoted to the study of wisdom is always most unlucky in everything, and particularly when it comes to procreating children; I imagine this is because Nature wants to ensure that the evils of wisdom shall not spread further throughout mankind.

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: Those who govern, having much business on their hands, do not generally like to take the trouble of considering and carrying into execution new projects. The best public measures are therefore seldom adopted from previous wisdom, but forced by the occasion.

author: Bo Bennett
title: Those who improve with age embrace the power of personal growth and personal achievement and begin to replace youth with wisdom, innocence with understanding, and lack of purpose with self-actualization.

author: Samuel Butler
title: Though wisdom cannot be gotten for gold, still less can be gotten without it.

author: Bruce Lipton
title: Through consciousness, our minds have the power to change our planet and ourselves. It is time we heed the wisdom of the ancient indigenous people and channel our consciousness and spirit to tend the garden and not destroy it.

author: Horace Walpole
title: To act with common sense, according to the moment, is the best wisdom I know; and the best philosophy, to do one's duties, take the world as it comes, submit respectfully to one's lot, bless the goodness that has given us so much happiness with it, whatever it is, and despise affectation.

author: Akhenaton
title: To be satisfied with a little, is the greatest wisdom; and he that increaseth his riches, increaseth his cares; but a contented mind is a hidden treasure, and trouble findeth it not.

author: Carly Fiorina
title: To build a great company, which is a CEO's job, sometimes you have to stand up against conventional wisdom.

author: Bertrand Russell
title: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.

author: Buddha
title: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.

author: William Penn
title: To hazard much to get much has more of avarice than wisdom.

author: Samuel Johnson
title: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.,

author: Albert Einstein
title: To know what is impenetrable to us really exists, manifesting itself as the highest wisdom and the most radiant beauty... this knowledge, this feeling is at the center of true religiousness.

author: Plutarch
title: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.

author: John Churton Collins
title: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.

author: Thomas Traherne
title: To think the world therefore a general Bedlam, or place of madmen, and oneself a physician, is the most necessary point of present wisdom: an important imagination, and the way to happiness.

author: Socrates
title: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.

author: Akhenaton
title: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.

author: Wallace Stevens
title: Union of the weakest develops strength not wisdom. Can all men, together, avenge one of the leaves that have fallen in autumn? But the wise man avenges by building his city in snow.

author: Carole King
title: Way over yonder is a place I have seen , In a garden of wisdom from some long ago dream.

author: Jack Herbert
title: We all admire the wisdom of people who come to us for advice.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: We can be knowledgeable with other men's knowledge, but we cannot be wise with other men's wisdom.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: We estimate the wisdom of nations by seeing what they did with their surplus capital.

author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld
title: We give advice, but we cannot give the wisdom to profit by it.

author: G. C. Lichtenberg
title: We have no words for speaking of wisdom to the stupid. He who understands the wise is wise already.

author: Mark Twain
title: We should be careful to get out of an experience only the wisdom that is in it - and stop there; lest we be like the cat that sits down on a hot stove-lid. She will never sit down on a hot stove-lid again - and that is well; but also she will never sit down on a cold one anymore.

author: Stephen Vincent Benét
title: We thought, because we had power, we had wisdom.

author: Bruce Eric Kaplan
title: What I like about graduation speeches is that they're an opportunity for someone to make sense of their life and to impart that wisdom to someone else. It's like a sanctioned self-help moment.

author: William Blake
title: What is the price of experience? Do men buy it for a song? Or wisdom for a dance in the street? No, it is bought with the price of all the man hath, his house, his wife, his children.

author: John Milton
title: What wisdom can there be to choose, what continence to forbear without the knowledge of evil? He that can apprehend and consider vice with all her baits and seeming pleasures, and yet abstain, and yet distinguish, and yet prefer that which is truly better, he is the true wayfaring Christian.

author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
title: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?

author: M. Rutherford
title: When a man grows old, wisdom will not keep him alive.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: When you are in deep meditation, you feel a great serenity, a joy that is unknown to you, a watchfulness that is a new guest. Soon this watchfulness will become the host. The day the watchfulness becomes the host, it remains twenty-four hours with you. And out of this watchfulness, whatever you do has a wisdom in it. Whatever you do shows a clarity, a purity, a spontaneity, a grace.

author: Bhagavad Gita
title: When you move amidst the world of sense, free from attachment and aversion alike, there comes the peace in which all sorrows end, and you life in the wisdom of the Self.

author: Saadi
title: Whenever you argue with another wiser than yourself in order that others may admire your wisdom, they will discover your ignorance.

author: T. S. Eliot
title: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?,

author: T. S. Eliot
title: Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information.

author: Madame Neckar
title: Where love and wisdom drink out of the same cup, in this everyday world, it is the exception.

author: St. Francis of Assisi
title: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance. Where there is patience and humility, there is neither anger nor vexation. Where there is poverty and joy, there is neither greed nor avarice. Where there is peace and meditation, there is neither anxiety nor doubt.

author: Alan Paton
title: Who knows what we live, and struggle, and die?... Wise men write many books, in words too hard to understand. But this, the purpose of our lives, the end of all our struggle, is beyond all human wisdom.

author: Plato
title: Wisdom alone is the science of others sciences.

author: Alfred N. Whitehead
title: Wisdom alone is true ambition's aim, wisdom the source of virtue, and of fame, obtained with labour, for mankind employed, and then, when most you share it, best enjoyed.

author: William Shakespeare
title: Wisdom and goodness to the vile seem vile; filths savour but themselves.

author: Abigail Adams
title: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.

author: Samuel Smiles
title: Wisdom and understanding can only become the possession of individual men by travelling the old road of observation, attention, perseverance, and industry.

author: Daniel Webster
title: Wisdom begins at the end.

author: Socrates
title: Wisdom begins in wonder.

author: George Santayana
title: Wisdom comes by disillusionment.

author: Norman Cousins
title: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.

author: Francis Hutcheson
title: Wisdom denotes the pursuing of the best Ends by the best Means.

author: Josh Billings
title: Wisdom deprives even poverty of half its power.

author: Seneca
title: Wisdom does not show itself so much in precept as in life - in firmness of mind and a mastery of appetite. It teaches us to do as well as to talk; and to make our words and actions all of a color.

author: Abigail Van Buren
title: Wisdom doesn't automatically come with old age. Nothing does - except wrinkles. It's true, some wines improve with age. But only if the grapes were good in the first place.

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: Wisdom doesn't necessarily come with age. Sometimes age just shows up all by itself.

author: Bhagwan Shree Rajneesh
title: Wisdom happens through meditation, and bliss also happens through meditation. Both the flowers bloom on the same branch.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.,

author: Josh Billings
title: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.

author: Michel Eyquem De Montaigne
title: Wisdom hath her excesses, and no less need of moderation than folly.

author: Plato
title: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Wisdom is found only in truth.

author: David Starr Jordan
title: Wisdom is knowing what to do next, skill is knowing how to do it, and virtue is doing it.

author: William James
title: Wisdom is learning what to overlook.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: Wisdom is like electricity. There is no permanently wise man, but men capable of wisdom, who, being put into certain company, or other favorable conditions, become wise for a short time, as glasses rubbed acquire electric power for a while.

author: Bergen Evans
title: Wisdom is meaningless until our own experience has given it meaning.

author: Plautus
title: Wisdom is not attained by years, but by ability.

author: Horace
title: Wisdom is not wisdom when it is derived from books alone.

author: Robert E. Lee
title: Wisdom is nothing more than healed pain.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes
title: Wisdom is the abstract of the past, but beauty is the promise of the future.,

author: Thomas J. Watson
title: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.

author: Doug Larson
title: Wisdom is the reward you get for a lifetime of listening when you'd have preferred to talk.

author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon
title: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.

author: Sophocles
title: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.

author: Stephen R. Covey
title: Wisdom is your perspective on life, your sense of balance, your understanding of how the various parts and principles apply and relate to each other. It embraces judgment, discernment, comprehension. It is a gestalt or oneness, and integrated wholeness.

author: Octavio Paz
title: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two.

author: Oliver Goldsmith
title: Wisdom makes a slow defense against trouble, though a sure one in the end.

author: Francis Quarles
title: Wisdom not only gets, but once got, retains.

author: Herbert Clark Hoover
title: Wisdom oft times consists of knowing what to do next.

author: Juvenal
title: Wisdom overcomes fortune.

author: Kahlil Gibran
title: Wisdom stands at the turn in the road and calls upon us publicly, but we consider it false and despise its adherents.

author: Felix Frankfurter
title: Wisdom too often never comes, and so one ought not to reject it merely because it comes late.

author: John Cheever
title: Wisdom we know is the knowledge of good and evil - not the strength to choose between the two.

author: Confucius
title: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.

author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe
title: Yes! To this thought I hold with firm persistence; The last result of wisdom stamps it true; He only earns his freedom and existence Who daily conquers them anew.

author: Ben Carson
title: You know, many people have said that I'm on the edge and I'm maverick for some of the big operations that I've done. I'm not at all. I pray; I ask God to give me wisdom, 'Should I do it?', guidance in terms of how to do it, who to consult with. All those kind of things are incredibly important.

author: Jim Rohn
title: You must learn to translate wisdom and strong feelings into labor.

author: A. Lawrence Lowell
title: Your aim will be knowledge and wisdom, not the reflected glamour of fame.

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: Experience. The wisdom that enables us to recognize in an undesirable old acquaintance the folly that we have already embraced.

author: Simone Weil
title: Misfortunes leave wounds which bleed drop by drop even in sleep; thus little by little they train man by force and dispose him to wisdom in spite of himself. Man must learn to think of himself as a limited and dependent being; and only suffering teaches
